abandon v.放弃；抛弃；放纵 n.放纵	(1) Those who abandon themselves to despair can not succeed. (2) The cruel man abandoned his wife and child. (3) They abandon themselves to drinking. (4) He signed cheques with careless abandon. (5) The cheerleader waved his arms with wild abandon.	(1) 那些自暴自弃的人无法成功。 (2) 那个狠心的男人抛弃了他的妻儿。 (3) 他们沉湎于饮酒。 (4) 他无所顾忌地乱开支票。 (5) 拉拉队队长疯狂地挥舞双臂。
ability n.能力；才能	(1) This is a task well within your ability. (2) She has the ability to keep calm in an emergency. (3) He is a man of great executive ability. (4) The boy shows remarkable ability at math. (5) He shows exceptional ability in solving problems.	(1) 这完全是你力所能及的工作。 (2) 她有处变不惊的本事。 (3) 他是个具有极高管理才能的人。 (4) 这男孩显示出非凡的数学才能。 (5) 他处理问题才干过人。
abnormal adj.反常的；不正常的；变态的 n.不正常的人	(1) We were very surprised at his abnormal behavior . (2) At one time, she is fine, but at another, she is abnormal. (3) He is mentally abnormal. (4) It's abnormal for the boy to eat so much. (5) It is important to make a study of abnormal psychology. (6) Prolonged exposure to lead peroxide can cause abnormal pain, nausea, and vomiting.	(1) 我们对他的反常行为感到非常吃惊。 (2) 有时候，她表现得很好，有时候又失常。 (3) 他精神不正常。 (4) 这个孩子吃这么多是不正常的。 (5) 研究变态心理学是重要的。 (6) 长期接触铅可引起不正常的过氧化疼痛，恶心和呕吐。
aboard adv.在船上；在火车上；在飞机上 prep.上船；上飞机；上车	(1) Little Tom and the sailors spent two months aboard. (2) All passengers aboard fell into the river. (3) A limited menu is available aboard the train, but a nice bottle of vin rouge and a simple picnic hamper will enhance your Orient-Express fantasy. (4) They were the last two to go aboard the ship. (5) We must not take combustible goods aboard. (6) Passengers may only take aboard the aircraft a minimum of luggage.	(1) 小汤姆和水手们在船上过了两个月。 (2) 船上所有乘客皆落入河中。 (3) 在火车上提供的食物很有限，自备一瓶上好法国红葡萄酒和一份简单的野餐食盒，将会提升你东方快车之旅的乐趣。 (4) 他们是最後两位上船的。 (5) 我们不可以带易燃物品上船。 (6) 乘客上飞机时，只可以带最少量的行李。
abolish vt.废除；革除；消灭	(1) Abraham Lincoln abolished slavery in the United States. (2) There are many bad customs and laws that ought to be abolished. (3) They petitioned the government to abolish hanging. (4) The legislature passed a law to abolish the surtax. (5) The weapons of war must be abolished before they abolish us.	(1) 亚伯拉罕·林肯在美国废除了奴隶制。 (2) 有许多不良的习俗和法规应予以废除。 (3) 他们向政府请愿，要求废除绞刑。 (4) 立法机关通过了一项废除附加税的法令。 (5) 在作战武器消灭我们以前，我们应先把它消灭。
abortion n.流产；堕胎；（计划等）失败	(1) Abortion is illegal in this country. (2) She decided not to go through with the abortion. (3) Abortion issues are political dynamite. (4) They are discussing the morality of abortion. (5) There has been much dispute over the question of legalized abortion.	(1) 人工流产在这个国家是不合法的。 (2) 她决定不做流产。 (3) 堕胎问题在政治上是个爆炸性问题。 (4) 他们正在讨论堕胎的道德性。 (5) 堕胎合法化问题引起了许多争论。
abrupt adj.突然的；唐突的；意外的；陡峭的	(1) The river takes an abrupt bend to the west. (2) His speech comes to an abrupt stop. (3) That young man has an abrupt manner. (4) His manner of speaking was quite abrupt. (5) Pug's abrupt proposal gave her a big surprise. (6) We walked down an abrupt slope.	(1) 这河突然向西转弯。 (2) 他的演讲突然停止了。 (3) 那个年轻人态度很无礼。 (4) 他的说话方式很唐突。 (5) 帕格的出乎意料的求婚给了她一个意外的惊喜。 (6) 我们沿着陡峭的斜坡走下来。
absence n.缺席；缺乏	(1) His long absence raised fears about his safety. (2) What was the real reason for your absence? (3) We are in the absence of experience. (4) The absence of color in that drawing make it dull.	(1) 他长期不在引起了大家对他的安全的担心。 (2) 你缺席的真正原因是什么？ (3) 我们缺乏经验。 (4) 那幅画因没有着色而显得晦暗。
absent adj.缺席的；不在的；缺乏的 vt.使缺席	(1) Professor Li is absent, I will take the lesson in the place of him. (2) Many students were absent, notably the monitor. (3) You should not be absent from class. (4) Before such experiments, humans thought language skills were absent from the animal kingdom. (5) Why did you absent yourself from school yesterday?	(1) 李教授不在，我替他上课。 (2) 许多学生缺席，特别是连班长也没来。 (3) 你不应当旷课。 (4) 在做这些实验前,人们认为动物王国缺乏语言技能。 (5) 昨天你为何不到校?
absolute adj.绝对的；确实的；专制的；完全的；独立的；无限制的 n.绝对的事物	(1) There is no absolute standard for beauty. (2) Motion is absolute, while stillness is relative. (3) There is no absolute freedom in the world. (4) The police have absolute proof of his guilt. (5) We don't like the absolute ruler who does just as he please. (6) We have an absolute mandate for these proposals. (7) This reply is equeal to an absolute denial. (8) Independent thinking is an absolute necessity. (9) I disagree that the property right is absolute.	(1) 美是没有绝对的标准的。 (2) 运动是绝对的，而静止是相对的。 (3) 世上没有绝对的自由。 (4) 警方有他犯罪的确凿证据。 (5) 我们不喜欢为所欲为的专制统治者。 (6) 我们完全有权提出这些建议。 (7) 这个答复就相当于完全否定。 (8) 独立思考是绝对必要的。 (9) 我不同意财产权是无限制的。
absorb vt.吸收；吸引 ... 的注意；吞并；承受	(1) Dry sand absorbs water. (2) Did you absorb everything the professor said? (3) His business absorbs him. (4) Large nations shouldn't absorb smaller ones. (5) She won't be able to absorb another heavy blow.	(1) 干沙吸收水份。 (2) 教授说的你全部理解了吗? (3) 他的业务使他全神贯注。 (4) 大国不应当吞并小国。 (5) 她无力承受再一次沉重的打击。
abstract adj.抽象的；理论的；抽象派的 n.摘要；抽象派艺术作品 v.(/æbˈstrækt/)把…抽象出；提取；抽取；转移(注意力等)；做…的摘要；<婉>偷	(1) We may talk of beautiful things, but beauty itself is abstract. (2) He has some abstract notion of wanting to change the world. (3) Abstract paintings did not appeal to him. (4) The whole text of the abstract shall contain not more than 300 Chinese characters. (5) They are trying to abstract iron from ore. (6) There is a plan to abstract 8 million gallons of water from the river. (7) She tried to abstract my attention from my work.	(1) 我们尽可谈论美的事物，然而美本身却是抽象的。 (2) 他有一种要改造世界的空想。 (3) 抽象派绘画引不起他的兴趣。 (4) 摘要文字部分不得超过300个字。 (5) 他们正试图从矿石中提取铁。 (6) 有一个从这条河中抽取800万加仑水的计划。 (7) 她企图转移我对工作的注意力。
absurd adj.荒唐的；可笑的；不合理的 n.荒唐	(1) He finally recovered from an absurd infatuation. (2) We have no intention of lying down under these absurd allegations. (3) It was absurd of you to suggest such a thing. (4) He looked absurd in that get-up. (5) It is absurd to argue from these premises. (6) The proposal borders on the absurd. (7) The pleading with Nora is beyond absurd.	(1) 他终于从荒唐的迷恋中醒悟过来。 (2) 对这些荒谬的指控我们是不甘受辱的。 (3) 你居然建议这样的事，太可笑了。 (4) 他穿著那套衣服看上去怪模怪样的。 (5) 凭这些前提议论是不合理的。 (6) 该提议近乎可笑。 (7) 向诺拉好言相求真是荒唐得无以复加。
abundant adj.丰富的；充裕的	(1) Indonesia is abundant in petroleum deposits. (2) The agricultural commodities are abundant this year. (3) Birds concentrate in places where food is abundant. (4) There is abundant firewood in the forest. (5) We have abundant oil seeds to sell.	(1) 印尼的石油蕴藏量丰富。 (2) 今年的农产品很丰富。 (3) 鸟聚集在食物丰盛的地方。 (4) 森林里有充裕的薪柴可用。 (5) 我们有充裕的油籽出售。
abuse n.滥用；恶习 vt.滥用；辱骂；虐待	(1) The government has set up a working party to look into the problem of drug abuse. (2) His political reputation was tainted by his abuse of the power. (3) He greeted me with a stream of abuse. (4) It's easy to abuse one's power. (5) I don't consider it good for a person to be afraid of being abused.	(1) 政府已成立工作组调查滥用毒品问题。 (2) 他因滥用职权而破坏了政治声誉。 (3) 他见到我就连声辱骂。 (4) 人容易滥用权力。 (5) 一个人怕挨骂,我看不好。
academic adj.学院的；学术的；理论的 n.大学教师，大学生；学者，学究	(1) Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema was an English painter in the academic tradition. (2) With my strong academic background, I am competent. (3) Applicant must possess good conduct and obtain satisfactory academic results.	(1) 阿尔玛·台德玛是学院派的英国画家。 (2) 依我良好的学术背景,我能胜任。 (3) 申请者必须拥有良好品性,并考获令人满意的成绩;
academy n.学院；学会；专科学校	(1) He is a student in an academy of music. (2) He was expelled from the Academy of Sciences. (3) The Royal Academy is regarded as the sanctuary by artists. (4) After graduating from Whittier Academy, my mother went on to Whittier College. (5) Sichuan Art Junior College is the precursor of Sichuan Fine Arts College and Sichuan Academy of Music.	(1) 他是一所音乐学院的学生。 (2) 他被科学院开除了。 (3) 英国皇家艺术学会被艺术家视为圣殿。 (4) 我母亲从惠蒂尔专科学校毕业后，进了惠蒂尔学院。 (5) 四川省艺术专科学校是四川美术学院和四川音乐学院的前身。
accelerate v.加速；提前；跳级	(1) Our present task is to accelerate economic growth. (2) The leader is losing ground as the rest of the runners accelerate. (3) We will accelerate the reform of the financial system under these circumstances. (4) The decline of her health seemed to suddenly accelerate.	(1) 加速经济发展是我们当前的任务。 (2) 领先者在其余赛跑者加速时就逐渐失去了优势。 (3) 在这一背景情况下,我们将加快金融体制改革。 (4) 她的健康状况好像突然提前衰退了。
accent n.重音；口音；强调 vt.重读；强调	(1) The accent falls on the third syllable. (2) She spoke with an Irish accent. (3) He flattered himself that he spoke French with a perfect accent. (4) The Government put the accent on light industry. (5) Please accent the first syllable. (6) The women accent their eyes with make-up.	(1) 重音落在第三个音节上。 (2) 她说话带有爱尔兰口音。 (3) 他自以为他说法语的腔调很完美。 (4) 政府注重轻工业。 (5) 请重读第一个音节。 (6) 女性用化妆品来突出眼部。
accept vt.接受；同意；承担(责任等) vi.接受	(1) We gave him a present,but he did not accept it. (2) she accepted the judge's decision. (3) They accepted responsibility for the accident. (4) She offered him a lift and he accepted.	(1) 我们给他一件礼物,但他不肯接受。 (2) 她同意了法官的判决。 (3) 他们承认了对这次事故所负的责任。 (4) 她请他坐她的车，他就领情了。
access n.入口；通道 n.接近(的机会)；使用之权 vt.进入；(电脑)存取	(1) This is the only means of access to the building. (2) The avalanche cut off the access to the mountain village. (3) The only access to that building is along the track. (4) Only high officials have access to the president. (5) People in that mountain area had no access to education. (6) I demanded access to a telephone. (7) An error occurred when we tried to access the inventory database. (8) We can't access the Internet. (9) She access three different files to find the correct information. (10) Branch officials can access the central data bank.	(1) 这是进入这栋楼的唯一入口。 (2) 雪崩切断了进入山村的通道。 (3) 到那座大楼的唯一通道就是沿这条小路走。 (4) 只有高级官员才可以接近总统。 (5) 那个山区的人们过去没有受教育的机会。 (6) 我要求有权使用电话。 (7) 当我们试图进入存货数据库时，屏幕上显示出现了错误。 (8) 我们连不上网。 (9) 她存取了三个文件以找寻所要的信息。 (10) 分行官员可以存取中央数据库。
accessible adj.可得到的；易接近的；可进入的；易受影响的；易理解的	(1) Such information is not really accessible. (2) A manager should be accessible to his staff. (3) This database is only accessible by the authorized manager. (4) He is not accessible to pity. (5) The information ought to be made more accessible.	(1) 这种信息不是很容易得到的。 (2) 一个管理人员应该让职员感到平易近人。 (3) 只有授权的管理员才可以访问此数据库。 (4) 他不大有同情心。 (5) 资料应该明白易懂。
accommodation n.膳宿；和解；住处；适应	(1) There travelling students found accommodation at moderate terms. (2) If labour and management don't reach an accommodation there will be a strike. (3) We can provide accommodation for six people at a push. (4) Hotel accommodation was scarce during the Olympic Games. (5) I will arrange the accommodation of my plans to yours. (6) Their spirits had learned accommodation to much more than cold.	(1) 旅游的学生们感到那儿的膳宿费是公道的。 (2) 如果劳资双方达不成妥协，就会发生罢工。 (3) 如情况需要，我们可以安排六个人的住处。 (4) 奥运会期间，旅馆房间很难找。 (5) 我将调整我的计划以便和你的计划相适应。 (6) 他们的心灵已经适应于比寒冷更坏得多的条件。
accompany vt.陪伴；伴随...发生；补充；给 ... 伴奏 vi.伴奏	(1) She asked me to accompany her to the airport. (2) Lightning usually accompanies thunder. (3) The text is accompanied by illustration. (4) In the singer's eyes,she accompanied magnificently.	(1) 她要求我陪她到机场去。 (2) 闪电通常伴有雷声。 (3) 正文附有插图。 (4) 在那名歌手的眼里,她伴奏得精彩极了。
accomplish vt.完成；实现	(1) I have accomplished a great deal in the last few months. (2) The prediction was literally accomplished. (3) The role of a judge is to accomplish fairness.	(1) 在过去几个月里，我完成了相当多的工作。 (2) 这个预言确实实现了。 (3) 法官的职责是实现公平。
according to prep.按照；根据；取决于	(1) In dictionaries, words are listed according to their orthography. (2) The books in the library were distributed according to subjects. (3) According to the old legend, Romulus was the founder of Rome. (4) According to facts in my possession he can not possibly be guilty. (5) We will go or we won't, according to circumstances. (6) He will be punished according to the seriousness of his crime.	(1) 按字母顺序。 (2) 图书馆里的藏书按科目分类。 (3) 按照古老的传说，罗穆卢斯是古罗马的建国者。 (4) 根据我所掌握的事实，他是不可能有罪的。 (5) 我们或去或不去,都将视情况而定。 (6) 他将据其罪行的轻重受到处罚。
account n.账户；帐目；赊账；老主顾；报告；描述；解释；说明；估计；理由；利益；好处；根据 v.解释；导致；报账；把 ... 视为；归咎(于)	(1) She squared her account at the store. (2) We have accounts with most of our suppliers. (3) The agency has lost several of its most important accounts. (4) This is a particular account of the accident. (5) She gave an accurate account of the case. (6) His account contradicted itself. (7) Lynne gave us a detailed account of her plan. (8) We must take full account of our difficulties. (9) On no account shall the Parties evade the responsibility for the loss of profits. (10) He turned his writing skills to good account. (11) On that account, it is best to do so. (12) He has been asked to account for his conduct. (13) A man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty.	(1) 她在商店里结清帐目。 (2) 我们与大多数供应商都是实行赊购制。 (3) 这家代理机构失去了几家最重要的老客户。 (4) 这是一份全面而详尽的事故报告。 (5) 她对事故做了准确的描述。 (6) 他的解释自相矛盾。 (7) 关于计划 (8) 我们对困难要有足够的估计。 (9) 协议双方均不得以任何理由逃避对方利益损失的责任。 (10) 他利用他的写作技巧来获利。 (11) 根据那一点,我们最好就这么做。 (12) 他被要求解释他的行为。 (13) 一个人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。
accountant n.会计人员；会计师	(1) The accountant described his work to the sales staff. (2) The company accountant queried my travel expenses. (3) The book is kept by a freelance accountant. (4) The boss dropped an accountant from the payroll.	(1) 那个会计向营业部的职员介绍了自己的工作情况。 (2) 公司的会计对我的旅行开支提出疑问。 (3) 由独立会计师进行计帐。 (4) 老板把一名会计师从在职人员名单中除了名。
accumulate v.积累；增加；聚集	(1) They set out to accumulate a huge mass of data. (2) Dust and dirt soon accumulates if a house is not cleaned regularly. (3) True poetry accumulates meaning every time it is read. (4) However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the zoo felt obliged to investigate. (5) Over the years, I had accumulated hundreds of books.	(1) 他们开始积累大量的资料。 (2) 房屋不经常打扫,尘土很快就越积越多。 (3) 真正好诗愈念涵义愈丰富。 (4) 然而，当证据日趋增多时，该动物园的专家们感到有必要进行调查。 (5) 多年来,我收集了几百本书。
accuracy n.准确(性)；精确度	(1) He's a man of accuracy and strict method. (2) Accuracy is more important than speed in his new job. (3) I can predict something with great accuracy. (4) It is impossible to say with any accuracy how many are affected. (5) The accuracy of the parallel increased.	(1) 他是个精细而严谨的人。 (2) 对他的新工作，准确比速度更重要。 (3) 我能很准确地预测某事。 (4) 无论如何也说不准受影响的有多少。 (5) 这种比拟变得愈来愈确切了。
accuse v.谴责；控告；指责	(1) How dare you accuse me of lying! (2) We resolve not to accuse them to avoid troubles. (3) I mustered up enough courage to accuse him. (4) He was accused of incompetence. (5) As long as you do what you can, no one will accuse you even if you fail it in the future.	(1) 你怎敢谴责我说谎! (2) 我们决定不起诉他们 (3) 我鼓起足够的勇气控告他。 (4) 他被指责为不称职。 (5) 只要你尽力而为,即使将来失败也没有人会指责你。
accustomed adj.习惯了的；通常的	(1) He was accustomed to command, not to entreat. (2) You will soon get accustomed to the climate here. (3) I might have been incredulous had I not been accustomed to such responses. (4) He is accustom to get up at six. (5) She sat in her accustomed place reading. (6) The stars will avert their gaze from these men and alter their accustomed course.	(1) 他习惯于发号施令，而不是恳求他人。 (2) 你会很快习惯这里的气候的。 (3) 若非我已经习惯了这样的回答，我可能不敢轻易相信。 (4) 他习惯于6点起床。 (5) 她坐在她惯常坐的地方读书。 (6) 恒星会从这些人当中转移它们的视野，改变了它们通常的路线。
ache n.痛；隐痛 vi.渴望；痛	(1) There was a little ache in her fancy of all he described. (2) You'll make your back ache if you carry those heavy buckets. (3) He felt a dull ache in his shoulder. (4) Even though women may ache for love, they carry around an inner evaluator who asks, Can I count on this man? (5) The universal stare made the eyes ache. (6) My tennis elbow began to ache again.	(1) 她想象着他所描绘的一切，心里不禁有些刺痛。 (2) 如果你背那些沉重的桶，你的背会痛的。 (3) 他感到肩膀隐隐作痛。 (4) 即使女人渴望爱情，她们也会在内心自问：“我能信赖这个男人吗? (5) 这种普遍的耀眼色彩令人眼睛发痛。 (6) 我打网球的手肘又开始痛了。
achieve v.完成；达到；实现	(1) I've achieved only half of what I'd hoped to do. (2) Work hard, and you will achieve your goal.	(1) 我希望做到的,我仅完成了一半。 (2) 好好干,你就会达到自己的目标。
achievement n.成就；成绩；完成；达到	(1) Effort and achievement are always in full accord. (2) You haven't realized the magnitude of her achievement. (3) I felt a great sense of achievement when I reached the top of the mountain. (4) Coming top in the exam was quite an achievement. (5) Flying across the Atlantic for the first time was a great achievement. (6) Most achievement rates were close to,or reached,100 per cent. (7) The achievement of this level of investment in a democratic nation is remarkable.	(1) 努力和成就总是相辅相承的。 (2) 你没有认识到她这一成就的重大意义。 (3) 当我到达山顶的时候，我有一种巨大的成就感。 (4) 考第一是很了不起的成绩。 (5) 首次飞跃大西洋是一项了不起的业绩。 (6) 就大部分的服务目标而言，该署几乎完全达到目标。 (7) 在一个民主国家中投资达到这种高水平，是十分突出的。
acid n.酸；酸性物质；<俚>迷幻药 adj.酸的；酸性的；尖酸的	(1) Acids react with bases to form salts. (2) The acid burnt a hole in the carpet. (3) The acid has burnt a hole in my jacket. (4) The acid in the rain slowly ate away at the stone wall. (5) Add more sugar if it tastes too acid. (6) These plants prefer an acid soil. (7) She uttered the phrase with acid sarcasm.	(1) 酸与碱反应生成盐。 (2) 酸把地毯烧了个洞。 (3) 这种酸把我的上衣烧了一个窟窿。 (4) 雨水中的酸性物质慢慢侵蚀着石墙。 (5) 如果尝着太酸的话就多放点糖。 (6) 这些植物喜酸性土壤。 (7) 她以辛辣的讽刺口吻说这个词。
acknowledge vt.承认；告知收到；公认；表示感谢；注意到	(1) We acknowledged the need for reform. (2) Please acknowledge this cheque as soon as you receive it. (3) We hope you can acknowledge your mistake in public. (4) We are sending you some money in acknowledgement of your valuable help.	(1) 我们承认改革的需要。 (2) 收到该支票后,请立即告知。 (3) 希望你当众认错。 (4) 我们送些酬劳，对您的大力协助聊表谢意。
acquaintance n.熟人；相识；了解	(1) He is not a friend of mine, only an acquaintance. (2) I made his acquaintance at a party. (3) Their acquaintance was of long standing. (4) He has only a limited acquaintance with the matter.	(1) 他不是朋友我的,只是个熟人。 (2) 我是在一次聚会上认识他的。 (3) 他们相识多年。 (4) 他对这件事的了解很有限。
acquire vt.获得；学到；取得	(1) We should try to acquire good habits. (2) He will acquire the right to permanent residency here. (3) We hope to acquire the knowledge in the happiness. (4) You must acquire great skills of perception. (5) We should acquire more firsthand information.	(1) 我们应该努力养成良好的习惯。 (2) 他将获得这里的永久居留权。 (3) 我们希望在快乐中获得知识。 (4) 你必须学会洞察事物的高超技巧。 (5) 我们应当取得更多的第一手资料。
acquisition n.获得；所获之物；采集	(1) Life is a process about the acquisition of knowledge, wealth and happiness. (2) My classmates were attracted by the library's most recent acquisitions.	(1) 生命就是一个获得知识、财富和幸福的过程。 (2) 同学们都被图书馆最近新添的书籍吸引了。
acre n.英亩	(1) The shepherd has penned up the sheep in the four acre field. (2) The house has half an acre of lawn. (3) We own 100 acres of farmland. (4) He ploughed an acre in six hours.	(1) 牧羊人把羊群围在那块四英亩的土地上。 (2) 这座房子有半英亩草坪。 (3) 我们拥有一百英亩农田。 (4) 他六小时犁一英亩地。
act n.行为；行动；法案；(戏剧、歌剧等的)一幕；假装 v.行动；举止；假装；表演；扮演；充当；有效果	(1) It is an act of kindness to help a blind man across the street. (2) This act had to get a strong support from them. (3) In 1601, Parliament passed an act, which aimed to provide the poor with more jobs. (4) Don't take her seriously--it's all an act. (5) Think well before you act. (6) John's been acting very strangely lately. (7) I decided to act dumb. (8) Act interested even if you're bored. (9) Now let's act out the model dialogue. (10) She plans to act Lady Macbeth in summer stock. (11) I volunteered to act as chauffeur. (12) Alcohol acts on the nervous system.	(1) 帮助盲人过街是慈善的行为。 (2) 这个行动必须得到他们的大力支持。 (3) 1601年,国会通过了一项旨在向贫困群体提供更多工作机会的法案。 (4) 别跟她认真--完全是装腔作势。 (5) 要三思而后行。 (6) 近来约翰的行为怪得很。 (7) 我决定装哑。 (8) 即使你觉得厌烦，也假装有兴趣。 (9) 现在让我们表演一下示范对话。 (10) 她计划在夏季剧团中扮演马克白夫人 (11) 我自愿充当汽车司机. (12) 酒精对神经系统有影响。
action n.行为；活动；措施；效用；交战；情节；事件；姿态；起诉；机能	(1) After the security incident, you should create an action report that includes three simple goals. (2) The government finally took some actions because the public had been pressing for inquiry into the question. (3) The medicine will not take action until two hours later. (4) The action lasted three hours and caused great casualties. (5) In Scene 1, the action takes place in an expensive restaurant. (6) The action took place in a seaside village. (7) She had a fine action while dancing ballet. (8) Finally she had to file an action for divorce. (9) The action of your heart is perfect.	(1) 这次安全事故后,你要撰写一个包括三个简单目标的活动报告。 (2) 由于公众一再坚持调查这一问题,政府终于采取了一些措施。 (3) 这药在两小时後才会起作用。 (4) 战斗持续了三个小时,造成了大量人员伤亡。 (5) 在第一个场景中,故事情节在一家昂贵的餐厅展开。 (6) 这个故事发生在海边的一个渔村里。 (7) 她跳芭蕾舞的时候姿态非常优美。 (8) 最后她只好提出离婚诉讼。 (9) 你心脏的机能非常好。
actor n.演员；行动者	(1) The young actor pretended to be Hamlet. (2) John promises well as an actor. (3) An actor have to learn to laugh off bad review. (4) The star of the film is a previously unknown actor. (5) Kierkegaard distinguished between the spectator and the acter, arguing that only the actor is involved in existence.	(1) 那个年轻演员扮演哈姆雷特。 (2) 约翰有希望成为演员。 (3) 演员需学会能对贬斥性评论一笑置之的本事。 (4) 这部电影里的明星以前是个默默无闻的演员。 (5) 克尔凯郭尔区分了旁观者和行动者，认为只有行动者才真正存在。
actress n.女演员	(1) The actress received numerous floral tributes. (2) Her success as an actress was now assured. (3) She has romantic notions about becoming a famous actress.	(1) 那位女演员接受了许多献花。 (2) 她当演员很成功，已毋庸置疑了。 (3) 她心里充满幻想，总希望有一天会成为著名演员。
actual adj.实际的；事实上的	(1) The actual cause of the quake itself is the rupturing or breaking of rocks at or below the earth's surface. (2) We call the baby Doc. His actual name is Daniel. (3) I need the actual figures, not an estimate. (4) My calculation is based on notional figures, since the actual figures are not yet available. (5) It calls for actual deeds and not flowery language.	(1) 地震本身的真正原因是地球表面的或地底下的岩石断裂或破裂。 (2) 我们把这个婴儿叫做多克,他的实际名字是丹尼尔。 (3) 我需要确实的数字，不要估计的。 (4) 因尚无实际数字，我是根据估计的数字计算的。 (5) 需要的是实际行动, 而不是漂亮的辞藻。
acute adj.严重的；敏锐的；急性的；剧烈的	(1) He suffers from acute depression. (2) This area has an acute shortage of water. (3) She has acute hearing. (4) The doctor said that you had acute appendicitis. (5) The patient is complaining of acute earache.	(1) 他患有严重的抑郁症。 (2) 这个地方缺水严重。 (3) 她有很敏锐的听力。 (4) 医生说您患的是急性阑尾炎。 (5) 病人说耳部剧痛。
AD abbr.广告 (=advertisement) abbr.公元(=Anno Domini)	(1) That's an interesting ad. (2) I got four replies to my ad about the bicycle for sale. (3) The ad was run in the paper for a week. (4) This tradition has been traced back to the sixth century AD. (5) It was first built in 326 AD and restored several times through the centuries.	(1) 那是有趣的广告。 (2) 已经收到了四份对我出售自行车广告的回信。 (3) 这则广告在报上连续刊登了一个星期。 (4) 这一传统已被追溯到公元16世纪。 (5) 它始建于公元326年。几个世纪以来，人们对它进行了几次重建。
adapt vt.改编；使适应 vi.适应；适合	(1) This novel has been adapted for radio from the Russian original. (2) She adapted herself quickly to the new climate. (3) You must adapt to the norms of the society you live in. (4) It's hard to adapt this novel for children. (5) There will be more than one person who can adapt to you.	(1) 这部小说已由俄文原著改编成无线电广播节目。 (2) 她很快就适应了这种新气候。 (3) 在社会中生活就要遵循社会行为准则。 (4) 要将这部小说改编为适合小孩的阅读水准很难。 (5) 世界上适合你的人不会只有一个。
adaptation n.改编；改编成的作品；适应；【心】（感官）适应，适应性变化	(1) This story lends itself to film adaptation. (2) Scotish adaptation was made about a century later. (3) I bought my son an adaptation for children of a play by Shakespeare. (4) He made a quick adaptation to the new environment. (5) Another idea is that art is a social adaptation.	(1) 这个故事适合改编拍电影。 (2) 大约一个世纪之后的出现了一个苏格兰的改编本。 (3) 我给我儿子买了为儿童改编的莎士比亚剧本。 (4) 他很快适应了新的环境。 (5) 另一个想法是，艺术是一种对社会的适应。
add v.加；增加；补充	(1) If you add 4 to 5, you get 9. (2) If the tea is too strong, add some hot water to it. (3) He added some wood to increase the fire. (4) He did nothing but add to our trouble. (5) I know, and I must add that we have a very pleasant relationship. (6) Would anyone like to add anything to what I've said?	(1) 四加五等于九。 (2) 如果茶太浓,加点开水。 (3) 他加了一些木柴，使火旺些。 (4) 他什么也没做,只是增加了我们的麻烦。 (5) 我知道,而且我还要补充一条: 我们的关系非常愉快。 (6) 有没有人要补充我刚才所说的?
addicted adj.沉溺于的；有毒瘾的	(1) He's finally off (ie is no longer addicted to) drugs. (2) He's hooked on (ie addicted to) speed. (3) Smokers who inhale are likely to become addicted to nicotine. (4) He is addicted to alcohol.	(1) 他终於戒了毒了。 (2) 他使用安非他明已成瘾。 (3) 吸烟的人容易对尼古丁上瘾。 (4) 他嗜好喝酒。
addition n.增加；加法；附加物	(1) In addition to a diet, she pursues various exercises on TV. (2) In addition to an album, I gave him a pen and a pencil. (3) They eat a great deal of fruit in addition. (4) Addition and division are forms of computation. (5) The little girl is not very clever at addition. (6) We exhibit several addition to our product line. (7) just had an addition to the family, ie another child. (8) Ann will be a very useful addition to our team.	(1) 节食以外她还随电视做体操。 (2) 除了一本照相簿外，我还给了他一支钢笔和一支铅笔。 (3) 他们还吃大量的水果。 (4) 加法和除法都是计算方法。 (5) 这个小女孩不太善于做加法。 (6) 我们正在展览生产线上增加的几种新产品。 (7) 他们家里刚刚又添了一口人（另一个孩子）。 (8) 安来到我们队给我们增加了一员干将。
adequate adj.足够的；适当的；能胜任的	(1) We had adequate food for a week's journey. (2) He sought for an adequate solution to the problem. (3) I hope he will be adequate to the job.	(1) 我们有足够的食物可以做一星期的旅行。 (2) 他寻求解决这个问题的适当办法。 (3) 我希望他将胜任这一工作。
adjust v.调整；校准；调节；使适应	(1) Could you teach me how to adjust the iris of the camera? (2) This kind of desk can be adjusted to the height you need. (3) He can't adjust himself to the whirl of modern life in this big city. (4) Over the years, we all learned to adjust, to become more comfortable with each other, and to adapt to our new family arrangement. (5) He adjusted himself very quickly to the heat of the country.	(1) 你能教我怎么调照相机的光圈吗？ (2) 这种书桌的高低可以按照你的需要调节。 (3) 他无法适应这个大都市的现代生活的忙碌。 (4) 年复一年，我们都学会了调整自己，学会了彼此宽容，学会了适应我们新的家庭规则。 (5) 他很快使自己适应了这个国家炎热的天气。
adjustment n.调整；调节	(1) I've made a few minor adjustments to the seating plan. (2) The company made an adjustment in my salary. (3) The adjustment of the interest rate will moderate. (4) They should make adjustment to the new environment. (5) Some adjustment of the lens may be necessary. (6) A small adjustment will equalize the temperature in the two rooms. (7) The volume adjustment knob on my TV is broken.	(1) 我对座次表作了小小的调整。 (2) 公司对我的薪金作了调整。 (3) 利率的调整将会放缓。 (4) 他们应进行调整以适应新环境。 (5) 可能有必要调节一下镜头。 (6) 稍作些调节就会使两间房内的温度相等。 (7) 我电视机上的音量调节开关坏了。
administration n.实施；管理；行政；行政部门；任期	(1) He is responsible for the administration of justice. (2) He works in hospital administration. (3) The company developed rapidly under his administration. (4) She has been looking after the, day-to-day administration. (5) I hate the prodigal administration. (6) A new Presidential administration will begin soon. (7) He tried to remedy this neglect during his own administration.	(1) 他负责赏罚。 (2) 他从事医院管理工作. (3) 在他的管理下，公司发展得很快。 (4) 她一直在照管日常的行政工作。 (5) 我痛恨铺张浪费的行政机关。 (6) 新一届总统任期马上就要开始了。 (7) 他努力在他的任期内弥补这个缺陷。
admirable adj.令人钦佩的；令人赞赏的	(1) His bravery is admirable. (2) She showed admirable self-control. (3) This essay is admirable in all respects. (4) It was reserved for him to make the admirable discovery.	(1) 他的勇气令人钦佩。 (2) 她表现出令人钦佩的自我控制。 (3) 这篇文章在各方面都很值得欣赏。 (4) 那项令人赞赏的发现注定由他完成。
admire vt.钦佩；赞美；羡慕；欣赏	(1) You may not like him, but you have got to admire his persistence. (2) We admire him for his righteousness. (3) Visitors admire Beijing for its beauty. (4) There is no man who does not admire him.	(1) 你可以不喜欢他，但你不得不佩服他那种坚韧不拔的精神。 (2) 我们钦佩他的正直。 (3) 观光者赞赏北京的美丽。 (4) 没有人不羡慕他的。
admission n.承认；入会费；许可	(1) He is a coward by his own admission. (2) He was, on his own admission, impulsive by nature. (3) Do they charge for admission? (4) The charge for admission is US$5. (5) Admission to British universities depends on examination results. (6) Admission (to the club) is restricted to members only. (7) How does one gain admission to the Buckingham Palace? (8) He gained admission into this university.	(1) 他自己承认是个胆小鬼。 (2) 他承认自己生性易于感情冲动。 (3) 入场要收费吗? (4) 入场费五美元。 (5) 英国大学入学以考试成绩为凭。 (6) 只准会员进入(俱乐部). (7) 怎样才能获准进入白金汉宫? (8) 他获准进入这所大学。
admit vt.承认；允许进入；给…进入的权利；容纳 vi.承认；允许进入；允许	(1) He made a terrible mistake, but he refused to admit it. (2) We have to admit that there is still room for improvement. (3) Each ticket admits two people to the party. (4) I reluctantly admitted to being nervous about the test. (5) He was admitted to the hospital suffering from burns. (6) This sentence admits of several interpretations.	(1) 他犯了一个严重的错误,可是他拒不承认。 (2) 我们不得不承认,在这方面有尚待改进的地方。 (3) 每张票可供两人入场参加聚会。 (4) 我勉强承认我对测试感到紧张。 (5) 他由于烧伤，被送入医院治疗。 (6) 这个句子可以有多种解释。
adolescence n.青春期（一般指13～16岁的发育期）	(1) Adolescence is no time to be lulled to sleep. (2) Can excessive masturbation affect adolescence long?	(1) 青春期不是让人哄着入睡的时候了。 (2) 青春期过度手淫会影响长个吗？
adolescent adj.青春期的；青少年的 n.青少年	(1) It is not unusual for grown adults to act in an adolescent way. (2) She says that risk-taking is normal adolescent behaviour. (3) I still remember my adolescent life. (4) The adolescent period is one's best time. (5) Overgrowth is common in adolescents. (6) Many adolescents suffer from/have acne.	(1) 成人表现出青春期的样子很正常。 (2) 她说冒险是青春期的正常表现。 (3) 我仍然记得我青少年时期的生活。 (4) 青少年时期是一个人最美好的一段时光。 (5) 青少年成长过快是普遍现象。 (6) 很多青少年患有痤疮[长粉刺]。
adopt v.采用；收养；接受	(1) They adopt new techniques in raising sheep. (2) The schools must adopt new methods of teaching foreign languages. (3) She was left an orphan and a poor peasant woman adopted her. (4) We should adopt the consumers' suggestion.	(1) 他们采用新的养羊技术。 (2) 学校应采用新的外语教学法。 (3) 她成了孤儿，一位贫农妇女收养了她。 (4) 我们应该接受用户的建议。
adore vt.爱慕；崇拜；很喜欢	(1) Men can only adore women who are adorable. (2) The kids adore their father and confide in him. (3) The boys adore their mothers. (4) All the girls in our school adore the handsome mathematics teacher who happens to be a bachelor.	(1) 男人们只爱慕那些让人爱慕的女人。 (2) 孩子们崇拜并信赖他们的父亲。 (3) 男孩们敬慕他们的母亲。 (4) 我们学校里所有女孩子都崇拜那个恰巧是单身汉的英俊数学老师。
adult n.成年人；成年动物 adj.成年的；理智的；适合成年人的；成熟的	(1) The bear was a fully grown adult. (2) He spent his adult life in Canada. (3) Can you try and be a little more adult about this? (4) Children are not admitted, for this is an adult film. (5) His behavior is not particularly adult.	(1) 那只熊已完全发育成熟. (2) 他在加拿大度过了他的成年时期。 (3) 你能不能试着更理智一点地看待这件事？ (4) 儿童不得入内观看,因为这是一部成人电影。 (5) 他的举止行为还不太成熟。
advance n.前进；进展；预付金 v.前进；预付；增长；推进 adj.预先的；提前的	(1) Advance in the jungle was very slow. (2) There have been great progresses in medicine in the past decade. (3) She asked for an advance on her salary. (4) The officer directed them to advance. (5) The enemy was afraid to advance into our base area. (6) Can you advance me two dollars on my salary? (7) Stock market prices continue to advance. (8) There was no advance warning before the earthquake hit. (9) It is a popular show, so advance booking is essential.	(1) 在丛林中行进很慢。 (2) 在过去十年里,医学取得了巨大的进步。 (3) 她请求预支薪水。 (4) 指挥官命令他们前进。 (5) 敌人不敢进入我们根据地。 (6) 你能从我的工资中预支给我两块钱吗? (7) 股票市场价格继续上涨。 (8) 地震之前没有任何预兆。 (9) 这是个很受欢迎的演出，所以一定要提前订票。
advantage n.优势；有利条件 vt.有利于	(1) For a goalkeeper,it's a great advantage to have big hands. (2) Rich has an advantage over you since he can speak German. (3) It is an advantage if you know how to type. (4) We should take advantage of all educational opportunities. (5) Voice training will be to your advantage if you plan to go into the theatre. (6) Such action will advantage our cause. (7) It would advantage him to go abroad.	(1) 对于守门员来说,有一双大手是很大的优势。 (2) 理奇比你占优势，因为他会讲德语。 (3) 如果你会打字,对你将有利。 (4) 我们应该利用一切教育的机会。 (5) 如果你想当演员,进行发音训练对你是有好处的。 (6) 这样的行动有益于我们的事业。 (7) 出国会对他有好处。

(7) It may be safer not to advertise your presence.	(1) 我们决定为我们的新产品做广告。 (2) 我们可以在网上登广告。 (3) 我得刊登广告聘请一位新秘书。 (4) 当时的当务之急是我们的事业可不是为我们的汽车进行广告宣传。 (5) 希望我们能想出最佳的宣传策略。 (6) 我告知他我的计划。 (7) 不把你出席的事声张出去也许更为安全。

alcoholic adj.酒精的；含酒精的；酗酒的 n.酗酒者	(1) Alcoholic drink can have a bad effect on your body. (2) Alcoholic drink can have a bad effect on your body. (3) Perhaps you have an alcoholic parallel life. (4) She made a decision to divorce her alcoholic husband. (5) He has degenerated into an alcoholic. (6) Have you ever been around an alcoholic?	(1) 含酒精的饮料会对你身体有很坏的影响。 (2) 含酒精的饮料会对你身体有很坏的影响。 (3) 或许你有一个酗酒的平行生命。 (4) 她决定和她酗酒的丈夫离婚。 (5) 他堕落成酗酒者。 (6) 你的身边曾经有过酗酒者吗？
algebra n.代数学	(1) The boy can't figure out the algebra problems. (2) It's easy to learn algebra. (3) We've learned algebra in middle school.	(1) 这个男孩做不出这道代数题。 (2) 学习代数很容易。 (3) 我在中学就学过代数学。
allergic adj.过敏的；反感的	(1) Ben is allergic to pollen. (2) I like cats but unfortunately I'm allergic to them. (3) Nuts can trigger off a violent allergic reaction. (4) He is allergic to having his picture taken. (5) You could see he was allergic to housework.	(1) 班对花粉过敏。 (2) 我很喜欢猫,但遗憾的是我对猫过敏。 (3) 坚果可以引起严重的过敏反应。 (4) 他讨厌别人给他照相。 (5) 你可以看出他很讨厌做家务。
alley n.胡同；巷；跑道；球道	(1) The thief slunk down the dark alley. (2) Davies' house is down a long narrow alley. (3) The alley was strewn with garbage. (4) He was badly beaten up in a back alley. (5) Kathy and Susan are about to book a lane in their local bowling alley.	(1) 那个贼偷偷钻进黑胡同里。 (2) 戴维斯的家在一条狭长的胡同里。 (3) 垃圾散布于巷道上。 (4) 他在后巷里被人毒打。 (5) 凯西和苏珊正在当地的一家保龄球馆准备预约球道。
allocate vt.分派；分配；分配额	(1) Allocate rations for a week - long campingtrip. (2) You must allocate the money carefully.	(1) 分配一星期外出野营的定额。 (2) 你们必须谨慎地分配钱。
allowance n.零用钱；津贴；限额，定量；允许；折扣；考虑	(1) I have to work to earn my allowance. (2) She receives a monthly allowance of $500. (3) Your baggage allowance is 75 pounds. (4) Please don't come in without my allowance. (5) The dealer gave us an allowance on our old car. (6) She failed one of the exam papers, but we ought to make allowance for the fact that she was ill.	(1) 我非得工作挣零用钱。 (2) 她每月收到500美元的津贴。 (3) 你行李的重量限额是七十五英镑。 (4) 没有我的允许,请不要进来。 (5) 车商给我们的旧车打了折扣 (6) 她有一门不及格，但我们必须考虑到她当时有病。
alongside adv.在旁边 prep.在 ... 旁边	(1) He is the master of the boat moored alongside. (2) The police car pulled up alongside. (3) The car drew up alongside the road. (4) The dog ran alongside his mistress. (5) We tied the boat up alongside the quay. (6) The rain ran in shallow runnels alongside the path.	(1) 他是那条靠着码头停泊的船的主人。 (2) 那辆警车在旁边停下。 (3) 小汽车在路边停下来。 (4) 狗在女主人的身边奔跑。 (5) 我们把船停泊在码头处。 (6) 雨水流进路边的小河沟里。
aloud adv.出声地；大声地	(1) She sobbed aloud, not caring to restrain her grief. (2) He groaned aloud as he started to drag himself to his feet.	(1) 她大声地啜泣，不打算遏止悲哀。 (2) 他一面拖着身体站起来，一面大声地哼哼。
alphabet n.字母表；基本原理(元素)；符号系统	(1) C comes after B in the alphabet. (2) There are 26 letters in the English alphabet. (3) The first letter in the English Alphabet is A. (4) he said the space is the most important character in the alphabet.	(1) 在字母表中C接在B后面。 (2) 英语字母表中有26个字母。 (3) 英语字母表中的第一个字母是A。 (4) 他说空格是系统符号里最重要的字符。
alternative adj.两者择一的；供选择的；非主流的 n.二者择一；供替代的选择	(1) We have the alternative plans of having a picnic or taking a boat trip. (2) They are provided with the choice of two alternative flights. (3) I had no alternative but to accept the offer.	(1) 我们在去野餐或者去乘船旅游两个计划中只能选一。 (2) 有两个航班可供他们选择。 (3) 我除了接受该项提议之外，别无选择。
altitude n.高度；海拔；高地	(1) We are flying at an altitude of 20000 feet. (2) Air pressure decreases with altitude. (3) At this altitude there is no screening from the sun's rays. (4) At this altitude you often get strong winds. (5) Some people develop altitude sickness when climbing high mountains.	(1) 我们的飞行高度是20000英尺。 (2) 气压随海拔高度的增加而下降。 (3) 在这种海拔高度，没有遮阳处。 (4) 在这一纬度地区，经常有大风。 (5) 有些人在爬高山时会发生高山反应。
altogether adv.总共；完全；总的来说	(1) He bought altogether 500 hectares of land. (2) There are ten people altogether. (3) I am altogether on your side in this matter. (4) I dissent altogether from such an unwise idea.	(1) 他总共买了五百公顷土地。 (2) 这里总共有十个人。 (3) 在这个问题上我完全支持你。 (4) 我完全不同意这样愚昧的见解。
aluminium n.铝 =aluminum（美）	(1) I hardly ever know that aluminium alloy could be as strong as steel. (2) Aluminium was slowly wedging its way in the metal market. (3) By mixing aluminium with other metals, scientists have been able to produce a variety of alloys, some of which have the strength of steel but weigh only one third as much. (4) Wrapping aluminium foil round a joint allows the meat to cook in its own juice/juices.	(1) 我几乎从来不知道铝合金竟会和钢强度一样大。 (2) 当时铝正在慢慢地挤入金属市场。 (3) 把铝和其他金属混合，科学家们能够制造出各种合金，其中一些具有钢一样的强度，但其重量只是钢的三分之一。 (4) 用铝箔把肉包住使之在原汁中烹制。
amateur n.外行；业余爱好者 adj.业余（爱好者）的	(1) An amateur shouldn't play roulette for high stakes. (2) You're a professional, but I am an amateur. (3) Don't let yourself be beaten by an amateur. (4) He is an amateur photographer. (5) He is an amateur painter. (6) Amateur actors often overact.	(1) 外行不该下大赌注赌轮盘赌。 (2) 你是专业的,而我是业余的。 (3) 不要让自己给一个业余运动员打败了。 (4) 他是个业余摄影爱好者。 (5) 他是一个业余画家。 (6) 业余演员往往表演过火。
amaze vt.使吃惊；使惊异 vi.惊讶 n.吃惊；好奇	(1) He amazed me by his audacity. (2) I was amazed to find her there. (3) We were amazed at the change in his appearance. (4) Modern technology never ceases to amaze me. (5) In reality, this was their first and the incredible amount of loose rock and gravel continued to amaze them. (6) He stood in amaze at the sight .	(1) 他的无理让我惊骇。 (2) 发现她在那，我感到很吃惊。 (3) 他的样子变得使我们大为惊讶。 (4) 现代科技总是令我惊讶不已。 (5) 事实上，这是他们第一次的攀登，那些难以置信的松散的岩石和砂砾更是一直让他们惊讶。 (6) 他看到那种景象,惊愕得呆呆地站在那里。
ambassador n.大使；代表	(1) He was appointed ambassador to the United States. (2) He never failed to send the ambassador a report each week. (3) The ambassador expects that his next posting will be (to) Paris. (4) He is seen by the black nation at the U.N. as an ambassador for blackness.	(1) 他被任命为驻美国大使。 (2) 他每个礼拜必送报告给大使。 (3) 那位大使预期他下次派驻巴黎。 (4) 他被参加联合国的黑人国家看作黑人民族自豪感的代表。

(4) Why are you always so ambiguous about this problem?	(1) 他给了我们一个模棱两可的答复。 (2) 实际上,你说的那些模棱两可的话等于是拒绝。 (3) 她的陈述故意含混不清。 (4) 为什么你总是对这个问题含糊不清？

(4) There are no bounds to his ambition. (5) His wild ambition was thoroughly exposed. (6) She had no ambition to go dancing. (7) I never ambitioned it. (8) He was frustrated in his ambition. (9) That political statesman is full of ambition.	(1) 你应该坚持你的雄心大志。 (2) 为国增光是他的雄心。 (3) 那个政治家野心很大。 (4) 他的野心是无止境的。 (5) 他的狼子野心暴露无遗。 (6) 她没有精力去跳舞了。 (7) 我从来不妄想得到它。 (8) 他的野心受挫。 (9) 那个政治家野心很大。
ambulance n.救护车	(1) An ambulance dashed to the scene of the accident. (2) An ambulance was racing along with its sirens wailing. (3) The injured man was fairly far gone by the time the ambulance arrived. (4) The light was red but the ambulance drove straight through. (5) If he gets any worse, we must phone for an ambulance. (6) By the time the ambulance had arrived, a crowd of onlookers had gathered.	(1) 救护车风驰电掣赶往事故现场。 (2) 救护车响着警报急驰而过。 (3) 救护车到时那伤者已生命垂危。 (4) 红灯亮着,但救护车闯了过去。 (5) 要是他情况恶化，我们就得打电话叫救护车了。 (6) 救护车赶到时，围观的人已经很多了。

(3) It doesn't matter if you are Asian or American or European, we are all the same. (4) He spoke with an American accent. (5) Bill Gates is an American citizen. (6) American civilization differs from ours. (7) An American conglomerate holds a major share in the company. (8) The American eagle stands on a perch. (4) The total cost of repairs amounted to 100 dollars. (5) The number of the injured amounted to over one hundred. (6) Her answer amounted to a complete refusal. (7) This amounts to doing the whole thing over again.	(1) 汽油表指示出汽车里所剩的汽油数量。 (2) 他每天有大量的信件要回复。 (3) 记得告诉客人帐单的总额。 (4) 修理费用总计一百美元。 (5) 受伤人数总计一百多。 (6) 她的答复等于是完全拒绝。 (7) 这就等于要把整个事情重做一遍。

(3) The house has an ample parlor. (4) Our sitting room is ample and bright. (5) Ample underground parking lot available for parking needs. (6) We have ample time. (7) She favoured his cause with ample funds. (8) We have an ample supply of water.	(1) 他有丰富的舞台经验，不会怵场的。 (2) 这个地区由于有丰富的矿藏,所以发展得很快。 (3) 这座房子有宽敞的客厅。 (4) 我们的居室宽敞明亮。 (5) 大厦内有宽敞的地下停车场。 (6) 我们有充足的时间。 (7) 她以充足的资金支持他的事业。 (8) 我们的水供应很充足。
amuse v.娱乐；消遣；使 ... 发笑	(1) I amuse myself by reading on weekends. (2) It is not always easy to amuse oneself on holiday. (3) The boys amuse themselves by drawing caricatures of their teacher. (4) Her parents offered a lot of money as reward for anyone who could amuse her.	(1) 周末我读书消遣。 (2) 让自己在假期里自娱并不总是容易的。 (3) 男孩子们以画老师的漫画取乐。 (4) 她父母悬赏很多钱，请人逗他们女儿发笑。
amusement n.乐趣，娱乐；消遣	(1) I find amusement in collecting stamps. (2) His chief amusement is reading novels. (3) I would never choose to watch cricket as an amusement.	(1) 我发现了集邮的乐趣。 (2) 他的主要消遣是看小说。 (3) 我决不会把看板球当作消遣。
analyze vt.分析；解析；研究	(1) Can you analyze the structure of the sentence for me? (2) Let's analyze the problem and see what went wrong. (3) You should analyze the essence of the problem. (4) They will take the problem apart and analyze it. (5) We must try to analyse the causes of the strike.	(1) 你能给我分析一下这个句子的结构吗？ (2) 让我们分析一下这道题，看什么地方出错了。 (3) 你应该剖析问题的实质。 (4) 他们会深入剖析这个问题。 (5) 我们得研究一下罢工的原因。
analysis n.分析；解析	(1) His analysis of the problem showed great perception. (2) We agreed with his acute analysis of the political situation. (3) Close analysis of sales figures showed clear regional variations. (4) In the final analysis I think our sympathy lies with the heroine of the play. (5) He had espoused the joint use of analysis and pure geometry. (6) Aircraft actuator system failure can be detected by analytic redundancy analysis.	(1) 他对该问题的分析显示出敏锐的洞察力。 (2) 我们都同意他对政治形势的深刻分析。 (3) 对销售额的仔细分析显示出明显的地区差别。 (4) 总之，我们认为我们都同情剧中的女主人公。 (5) 他赞成联合运用解析几何与纯粹几何。 (6) 飞机舵机系统的机械故障可用解析余度法检测。
ancestor n.祖宗；祖先；原种	(1) During the festival the investor investigated his ancestor. (2) They said their ancestor was a famous hunter and a crack hunter. (3) People who share an ancestor are called relatives. (4) One of my ancestors was a great scholar. (5) The abacus is the ancestor of the modern computer. (6) The three species evolved from a single ancestor.	(1) 节日期间投资者调查了他的祖宗。 (2) 他们说他们的祖宗是个有名的猎人，也是个神枪手。 (3) 有同一个祖先的叫做亲戚。 (4) 我的祖先当中有一位是伟大的学者。 (5) 算盘是现代电脑的原型。 (6) 这三种生物从同一原种进化而来。
ancient adj.古老的；古代的 n.古人	(1) This is an ancient parable. (2) It's an ancient tale which appears in various guises in several languages. (3) Soldiers in ancient time used escutcheon to fight. (4) This stone axe is a relic of ancient times. (5) We will all have a course in ancient history this term. (6) The ancients believed that the sun and moon were planets.	(1) 这是一个古老的寓言。 (2) 那是一个以几种语言叙述的古老的故事。 (3) 古代的士兵用饰有花纹的盾作战。 (4) 这把石斧是古代的遗物。 (5) 这个学期我们都有一门古代史课程。 (6) 古人相信太阳和月亮都是星球。
anecdote n.轶事；奇闻	(1) He departs from the text to tell an anecdote. (2) He preceded his lecture with a humorous anecdote. (3) He told me some anecdotes about our English teacher. (4) It had never been more than a family anecdote.	(1) 他没讲课文而讲了一段轶事。 (2) 他以一个幽默的轶事开始他的演说 (3) 他告诉我几个关于英语老师的掌故。 (4) 那不过是个家庭趣谈罢了。
anger n.愤怒；怒火 vt.激怒 vi.发火	(1) His charges were met with cries of anger. (2) His face was inflamed with anger. (3) He was inflamed with anger. (4) She felt anger rise in her heart. (5) The eagle is eager to anger the tiger in danger. (6) We don't want to anger the people who don't approve of nationalization. (7) He was roused to anger by the insult.	(1) 他的指控遭到一阵愤怒的反对声。 (2) 他的脸因愤怒而涨得通红。 (3) 他满腔怒火。 (4) 她感到心中冒起怒火。 (5) 鹰渴望激怒处在危险中的老虎。 (6) 我们不要激怒那些不赞成国有化的人。 (7) 他因受辱而生气。
angle n.角度；角；观点 v.形成或转变角度；歪曲 v.钓鱼；谋取 Angle. n.盎格鲁人	(1) The rising sun is especially beautiful to look at from this angle. (2) Try looking at the affair from a different angle. (3) The two roads lie at an angle of about 45 degrees. (4) We would like to hear your angle in this dispute. (5) Viewed from any angle, drinking heavily on an empty stomach is very dangerous to the liver. (6) Angle the mirror so that you can see behind you. (7) He is keen on angling. (8) He used to angle for prestige.	(1) 旭日从这个角度看起来特别美。 (2) 试从不同的角度来看这件事。 (3) 这两条路交叉成45度角。 (4) 我们想听听你在这场争论中的观点。 (5) 从任何观点看来，空腹大量饮酒对肝绝对是危险的。 (6) 调整镜子的角度,你可以看见你的后面。 (7) 他喜欢钓鱼。 (8) 他过去一贯沽名钓誉。
ankle n.踝；踝关节	(1) The doctor has taped up my swollen ankle. (2) She stepped on a loose stone and twisted her ankle. (3) He gave a wrench to his ankle when he jumped down. (4) She broke her ankle weeks ago and it's still in plaster.	(1) 医生用绷带把我肿起的脚踝包扎起来。 (2) 她踩到一块松动的石头上，扭伤了脚踝。 (3) 他跳下去的时候扭伤了足踝。 (4) 她的踝关节数周前骨折，至今仍打著石膏。
anniversary n.周年纪念；周年纪念日	(1) He gave me a necklace as an anniversary gift. (2) They held a dinner to celebrate his anniversary. (3) How did you celebrate your wedding anniversary? (4) She reproached her husband for having forgotten their wedding anniversary.	(1) 他给我一条项链作为周年纪念礼物。 (2) 为了庆祝他的周年纪念他们举办了一个宴会。 (3) 你是怎样庆祝结婚周年纪念日的？ (4) 她责怪丈夫忘了他们的结婚周年纪念日。
announce vt.宣布；宣告；预示；播报 vi.作播音员；宣布竞选	(1) I hope to announce the winner shortly. (2) The president will announce a momentous decision. (3) We can go out to people and announce Good News. (4) I will always announce my goals to the world. (5) Footsteps announced his return. (6) The news was announced by Radio Beijing. (7) Cindy announces four programs a week.	(1) 我希望马上宣布胜利者的名字。 (2) 主席将宣布重要决定。 (3) 我们能够走向人们，宣告天国的好消息。 (4) 我要常常向世人宣告我的目标。 (5) 听到脚步声，就知道他回来了。 (6) 这条消息是由北京广播电台播发的。 (7) 辛迪一星期担任四个节目的播音员。
announcement n.通告；宣布；声明	(1) The government's announcement is seen as a move towards settling the strike. (2) An announcement of further cuts in government expenditure is imminent. (3) An announcement will be made next week. (4) I've got an important announcement to make. (5) Our cook's sudden announcement that she was leaving took us quite by surprise. (6) He made the announcement in a speech on television.	(1) 政府的通告已被视为迈向解决罢工问题的一步。 (2) 最近将发布进一步削减政府开支的公告。 (3) 下周将有一个通告发布。 (4) 我有件重要事情要宣布。 (5) 我们的厨师突然说要离去，这使我们非常惊奇。 (6) 他在一次电视讲话中发表了这一声明。
annoy v.使恼怒；使烦恼；骚扰	(1) We can annoy the enemy by raids. (2) Some peoples' daily mission is to annoy you!	(1) 我们可用袭击骚扰敌人。 (2) 一些人的日常使命就是骚扰你！
annual adj.每年的；年度的；一年生的 n.年刊；一年生植物	(1) The firm has an annual turnover of $75 million. (2) Now, again, his annual trip to Paris begins. (3) The kind of plant is a hardy annual. (4) Annual or perennial herbs, or tall woody bamboos. (5) Many garden plants are annuals.	(1) 这家公司的年营业额为7500万美元。 (2) 现在,他一年一度的巴黎之行又开始了。 (3) 这种植物是耐寒的一年生植物。 (4) 一年生或多年生草本，或高的木质的竹子。 (5) 许多观赏植物都是一年生的。
ant n.蚂蚁	(1) Afterwards I allowed an ant to visit them. (2) A dove heard the ant and flew over to help. (3) An ant will sacrifice himself for his friends. (4) Ant is the most popular animal in the world.	(1) 我于是让一只蚂蚁去接近它们。 (2) 一只鸽子听到蚂蚁的呼救声就飞过去救它。 (3) 每只蚂蚁都愿意为了朋友牺牲自己. (4) 蚂蚁是世界上分布最广、数量最多的生物之一。
Antarctic adj.南极的 n.(the A-)南极洲；南极圈	(1) Oh, I have got another cable to send to Antarctic. (2) Antarctic exploration begins with Ptolemy. (3) Antarctic Peninsula has the most moderate climate. (4) He always dreams of adventuring in Antarctic. (5) The Antarctic Circle is the boundary of this region of lightness. (6) Are you asocial or do you just enjoy living in the Antarctic?	(1) 哦，我还要发一份去南极的电报。 (2) 南极的探险是由普特利姆首先进行的。 (3) 南极洲半岛气候最温和。 (4) 他总梦想在南极洲进行冒险尝试。 (5) 南极圈就是这一明亮地带的边界。 (6) 你是不合群的还是仅仅喜欢住在南极圈？
