Antarctica n.南极洲	(1) He warmed to the idea of a trip to Antarctica. (2) No minerals have yet been exploited in Antarctica.	(1) 他对到南极洲旅游的计划很热心。 (2) 南极洲的矿藏还未开采。
antique adj.古代的；古老的；过时的 n.古董；古物	(1) The antique table went to the lady in the pink hat. (2) In the museum we saw many antique plates. (3) The antique furniture was made in 1700. (4) She wore an antique gown to the costume party. (5) The value of that antique is inestimable. (6) This jade dragon is a genuine antique. (7) I struck upon that antique in a little shop in London.	(1) 这张古董桌子卖给那位戴粉红色帽子的女士了。 (2) 我们在博物馆看到了很多古时候的盘子. (3) 这件古老的家具是1700年制造的。 (4) 她穿着一件过时的长袍参加化妆舞会。 (5) 那件古董的价值无法估计。 (6) 这件玉龙是真正的古玩。 (7) 我在伦敦一家小店里偶然发现那件古物。
anxiety n.焦虑；担心；渴望	(1) It proved difficult to disguise his anxiety. (2) They show great anxiety concerning their retirement allowance. (3) This has caused us much anxiety. (4) Some anxiety still lurked in her mind. (5) His anxiety for knowledge is to be praised.	(1) 他的焦虑难以掩饰。 (2) 他们对自己的养老金问题显得十分焦虑。 (3) 这事使我们极为担心。 (4) 她心里还暗暗地有点不放心。 (5) 他对知识的渴求应该受到称赞。
anxious adj.渴望的；忧虑的	(1) The whole country was anxious for peace. (2) I am anxious to compare my fancy with reality. (3) Small businesses are anxious to experiment with computers. (4) She was anxious to enlighten me about the events that led up to the dispute. (5) I'm very anxious about the speech contest. (6) The moderates have plenty to be anxious about. (7) I was anxious about the children when they didn't come back home from school.	(1) 全国上下都渴望和平。 (2) 我焦切地把我的想象同现实作一番比较。 (3) 小型企业都急于试用计算机。 (4) 她急着要使我明白引起这场争执的那些事情。 (5) 我对此次演讲比赛十分忧虑。 (6) 温和派有许多问题要担忧。 (7) 孩子们放学后没有回家，我非常担心。
anyhow adv.无论如何；不管怎样	(1) Anyhow,Spring will return to us. (2) Anyhow, don't worry yourself now about it. (3) But anyhow they are engaged to be married.	(1) 春，无论如何也会回到人间。 (2) 不管怎样，现在不要为这事烦恼了。 (3) 但是不管怎样他们订婚了。
anyway adv.不管怎样；无论如何	(1) Anyway she said what was in her mind. (2) He reflected that the quality of the instruments was good anyway. (3) I don't think they need help, but I think I should offer anyway. (4) Anyway, he must have eaten a lot because now he is fat. (5) The house was locked and I cannot get in anyway. (6) I am coming anyway, no matter what you say.	(1) 不管怎样，她说了心里话。。 (2) 他寻思，不管怎样，这些乐器的质量还是不错的。 (3) 我认为他们无须帮助，不过我想我应有所表示。 (4) 无论如何，他一定吃了很多东西，因为现在他胖了。 (5) 屋子锁着，我无论如何也进不去。 (6) 不管你怎么说,我无论如何都要来。
apart adv.相距；分开地；分别地 adj.分开的；分离的	(1) The two villages are three miles apart. (2) He took the watch apart to repair it. (3) She lives apart from her family. (4) I can't tell the twins apart. (5) At that time we were never apart.	(1) 这两个村子相距三英里。 (2) 他把手表拆开来修理。 (3) 她跟家人分开住。 (4) 我辨认不出这对双胞胎。 (5) 那时我们从不分开。
apartment n.一套公寓房间	(1) I have an apartment in downtown Manhattan. (2) We are fascinated by the delicate interior design of the apartment.	(1) 我在曼哈顿中心区有一套住房。 (2) 我们被这所公寓的精致的室内装潢设计吸引。
apologize vi.道歉；赔罪	(1) He apologizes to her for not going to her party. (2) I apologize if I hurt your feelings. (3) You must apologize to him for your fault.	(1) 他因未出席她的派对向她表示歉意。 (2) 如果我伤害了你的感情,那我道歉。 (3) 你必须为你的过失向他赔罪。
apology n.道歉；辩解；<口>勉强的代用品	(1) I demand an apology. (2) Please accept my apology. (3) He made a contrite apology. (4) In my judgement, we should accept their apology. (5) Her open letter was really an apology for her way of life.	(1) 我要求道歉。 (2) 请接受我的道歉。 (3) 他深表懊悔地致歉。 (4) 依我看，我们应该接受他们的道歉。 (5) 她的公开信实际上是对她生活方式的辩护。
apparent adj.明显的；表面上的	(1) It was apparent to all that he was guilty. (2) Japan's apparent lack of capitalist endeavour also has much to do with the lack of a mature financing market. (3) She had many good qualities despite her apparent rudeness. (4) If she had inner doubts, it was not apparent to anyone else. (5) She heard the news of his death with apparent unconcern.	(1) 众所周知，他是有罪的。 (2) 显而易见,日本缺少资本家的创业精神,而这与日本没有一个成熟的融资市场也有很大关系。 (3) 她粗鲁是粗鲁，但还有许多优秀品质。 (4) 她若心中生疑亦不形之于色。 (5) 她听到他的死讯无动于衷。
appeal n.恳求；呼吁；上诉；吸引力 n.(体育比赛中)诉请裁决 v.呼吁；有吸引力；求助；诉请	(1) Their appeal for help went unheeded. (2) He made one last appeal to his father to forgive him. (3) His appeal to a higher court was set aside. (4) The judge rejected the appeal made by the prisoner for a new trial. (5) Jazz hasn't much appeal to me. (6) Films of that sort have lost their appeal for children. (7) The police appealed to the crowd not to panic. (8) The community is appealing to everyone to save water. (9) Her sense of humour appealed to him enormously. (10) The sinking ship appealed to the rescue team for help. (11) We will appeal to a great variety of source of information. (12) The captain appealed against the light.	(1) 他们求助的呼吁未受到注意。 (2) 他最後一次恳求父亲宽恕他。 (3) 他的上诉被驳回。 (4) 法官驳回了犯人提出重新审理的上诉。 (5) 爵士乐对我没有什么吸引力。 (6) 那种电影对孩子们已经没有吸引力了。 (7) 警方向群众呼吁不要惊慌。 (8) 社区呼吁每个人节约用水。 (9) 她的幽默感把他强烈地吸引住了。 (10) 沉船向抢救队求助。 (11) 我们将求助于各种资料信息来源。 (12) 队长对光线提出异议。
appearance n.出现；露面；外貌；外表；出场	(1) The journal makes its appearance once two months. (2) The appearance of Internet marked the beginning of the age of information. (3) I don't want to go to the party but I'd better put in an appearance, I suppose. (4) We should not judge a person by his appearance. (5) She is most pleasing in manner and appearance. (6) Something in his appearance riveted our attention. (7) You should not be misled by a person's appearance. (8) At the sight of his appearance on the stage, the hall rang with thunderous applause. (9) The first appearance of Jielun Chou impresses us with showing off coldness and unruliness!	(1) 这本刊物两个月出版一次。 (2) 因特网的出现标志着信息时代的开始。 (3) 我不想参加那个聚会，可是我最好还是要露一下面。 (4) 我们不应该以貌取人。 (5) 她的外貌和举止都非常讨人喜欢。 (6) 他外表的某些特徵吸引了我们的注意力。 (7) 你不应该被人的外表所欺骗。 (8) 他一出场，礼堂里就掌声雷动。 (9) 周杰伦一出场给人一种爱耍酷，桀骜不驯的感觉，不喜欢对媒体亲近。
appendix n.附录；附属物；阑尾	(1) There is an appendix at the back of the book. (2) This is the appendix to the investigation report. (3) The details are clearly set out in an appendix. (4) He had his appendix taken out. (5) The doctor said the appendix is not important for us.	(1) 该书末尾处有一附录。 (2) 这是调查报告的附件。 (3) 详细情况在一个附录里清楚列出。 (4) 他的阑尾割去了。 (5) 那个大夫说阑尾对我们来说并不重要。
appetite n.食欲；嗜好；欲望	(1) She is suffering from lack of appetite. (2) The long walk has given me a good appetite. (3) Mary has no appetite for hard work. (4) I have to make an effort to work up an appetite for reading. (5) His power appetite was hindered by his bad health.	(1) 她食欲不振。 (2) 走了长路使我食欲大振。 (3) 玛丽不想干艰苦的工作。 (4) 我得努力使自己产生天天想读书的愿望。 (5) 不良的健康状况抑制了他的权力欲。
applaud vi.拍手喝彩 vt.称赞；赞成；鼓掌	(1) He leaped to his feet and began to applaud. (2) Please don't applaud until everyone has performed. (3) Should I applaud my husband or chastise him? (4) Before I begin to flame anything, I would like to applaud a few folks. (5) I applaud your decision. (6) We all applaud you for your decision. (7) He was loudly applauded.	(1) 他跳起来开始鼓掌。 (2) 请在每个人表演完毕后再鼓掌。 (3) 我是该称赞还是责罚我的丈夫呢？ (4) 在我开始对任何事激动之前,我想称赞一些人。 (5) 我赞成你的决定。 (6) 我们一致赞成你的决定。 (7) 他受到热烈的掌声欢迎。
applicant n.申请人	(1) He gave every new applicant the once-over. (2) As the wage of the job was low, there were few applicants for it. (3) The enterprise is an applicant of this credit.	(1) 他匆匆地看一下每一个新来的申请人。 (2) 因为工资低,没有什么人申请这份工作。 (3) 这家企业是信用证的申请者。
application n.应用；申请；专心；应用程序	(1) The application of new scientific discoveries to industrial production methods usually increases efficiency. (2) I didn't receive an acknowledgement of my application. (3) The manager received twenty applications for the post. (4) You can run several applications at the same time.	(1) 把新的科学发现运用到工业生产上,通常可以提高效率。 (2) 对我的申请,我还没有收到复信告知收悉。 (3) 经理收到了二十份求职申请书。 (4) 你可以同时运行好几个应用程序。
apply vt.应用；涂；使专心从事 vi.申请；有关联	(1) We should not only know the theory but also how to apply it to practice. (2) I am applying for a fellowship. (3) Above terms shall apply unless otherwise mention.	(1) 我们不仅要知道理论，还要知道怎样把理论应用于实践。 (2) 我在申请研究生奖学金。 (3) 除非另有说明书,上述条件一概适用。
appoint v.任命；委派；指定；约定	(1) The company decided to appoint a new treasurer. (2) They appointed him chairman. (3) As a top manager, he should appoint none but people on their merit. (4) We must appoint a new teacher soon. (5) He wasn't there at the appointed time.	(1) 公司决定任命一位新司库。 (2) 他们任命他为主席。 (3) 作为一位总经理，他应该任人为贤。 (4) 我们必须尽快委派一个新教师。 (5) 他没有在指定的时间在那里。
appointment n.约会；任命；设备；职位	(1) I've made an appointment for a facial next week. (2) His promotion to manager was a popular appointment. (3) The appointments in this hotel are very good. (4) I believe he will get a good appointment.	(1) 我已经预约了下周去美容。 (2) 他升任经理是众望所归的。 (3) 这旅馆的设备很好。 (4) 我相信他会获得一个好职位的。
appreciate vt.欣赏；赏识；感激；领会；意识到 vi.增值	(1) I really appreciate his complete absorption in his work. (2) I've decided to learn photography in order that I may better appreciate the beauty of nature. (3) Very few people really appreciate his works. (4) His talents are not fully appreciated in that company. (5) I deeply appreciate your concern. (6) I would greatly appreciate it if you would send me the application forms as soon as possible. (7) It is at time like this that one really appreciates the kindness of a friend. (8) Land will continue to appreciate. (9) Our house has appreciated by 50% in the last two years.	(1) 我很欣赏他对工作的极端专注。 (2) 我决定学摄影以便能更好地欣赏自然的美。 (3) 没人赏识他的作品。 (4) 他的才干在那家公司未受到充分赏识。 (5) 我非常感激你的关心。 (6) 若能尽快寄来申请表格,我将不胜感激。 (7) 只有在这样的时刻,一个人才会真正领会到朋友的深情厚意。 (8) 土地将继续增值。 (9) 在过去的两年中,我们的房子增值了50%25。
appreciation n.欣赏；感激；鉴识；评价；增值	(1) She shows little appreciation of good music. (2) An appreciation of art will enrich your life. (3) She grinned her appreciation of my help. (4) Please accept this as a token of my appreciation. (5) There is an appreciation of the poet's work in the book. (6) These shares show an appreciation of 10%.	(1) 她对于好音乐几乎没有欣赏能力。 (2) 艺术欣赏将会丰富你的生活 (3) 她露齿一笑表示感激我的帮助。 (4) 请接受这份表示感激的礼物。 (5) 那本书中有对诗人作品的评论。 (6) 这些股票增值10%25。
approach v.靠近；接近；接洽；要求；达到；动手处理 n.途径；方法；接近；接洽；要求；路径；进场着陆；相似的事物	(1) Such people as are friendly are easy to approach. (2) She approached the bank for a loan. (3) There is no one who even approaches his talents. (4) Workers, above all, will know how to approach the problem correctly . (5) Narration should become a basic approach to preschool education. (6) I like her approach to the problem. (7) High walls forbid all approach. (8) The company makes an approach to the supermarket chain. (9) They walked together slowly along the solitary and broken approach. (10) The airplane made a faulty landing approach. (11) That's the nearest approach to an apology you'll get from him.	(1) 亲切之人容易接近。 (2) 她向银行要求贷款。 (3) 目前还没有谁的能力能与他媲美。 (4) 工人们最懂得怎样正确地处理这个问题。 (5) 叙事应是幼儿教育的基本途径。 (6) 我喜欢她解决这个问题的方法。 (7) 高墙遮断，难以接近。 (8) 该公司已与超级市场的联营店接洽。 (9) 他们正在顺着这条冷落的、支离破碎的路径往前走。 (10) 飞机着陆出错。 (11) 那是他所能作出的最似歉意的表示。
appropriate adj.适当的；相称的 vt.占用；拨出(款项)	(1) You will be informed of the details at the appropriate time. (2) It is not easy to choose clothes which are appropriate to your beautiful figure. (3) The government has appropriated some funds for education.	(1) 在适当的时候将把详情告诉你。 (2) 选择与你漂亮的体型相称的服装是不容易的。 (3) 政府拨出了一些款项用作教育基金。
approve v.批准；赞成；同意；称许	(1) The city council approved the building plan. (2) I presume you will approve of the plan. (3) You can join the class if your parents approve. (4) I approve of your trying to earn some money, but please don't neglect your studies. (5) No teacher can approve of cheating in exams.	(1) 市议会批准了这项建筑计划。 (2) 我相信你会赞成这个计划。 (3) 如果你父母同意，你可以参加这个班。 (4) 我同意你去挣一些钱，可是请不要误了功课。 (5) 任何教师都不能允许考试作弊。
approximately adv.大约；近似地	(1) The plane will be taking off in approximately five minutes. (2) Approximately it has 400 pages when this book is completed. (3) There were approximately fifty people there.	(1) 飞机大约五分钟后就起飞。 (2) 当这本书完成时大约有四百页。 (3) 那儿大约有五十个人。
apron n.围裙；停机坪；台口；遮挡板	(1) My apron is so dirty that I have to wash it. (2) She tied an apron around her waist. (3) She made up the remaining cloth into an apron. (4) A fighter plane is revving up on the hanger apron. (5) She walked out onto the apron and began to sing in front of the full theatre.	(1) 我的围裙太脏了，我不得不洗它。 (2) 她将围裙系在腰间。 (3) 她把余下来的布缝成一条围裙。 (4) 飞机库前面停机坪上，一架战斗机正在起动。 (5) 她走上台口，开始对着整个剧场放声高歌。
arbitrary adj.任意的；专制的；武断的；霸道的	(1) I'm not used to your arbitrary standards. (2) Dictators are arbitrary rulers. (3) This is an arbitrary decision.	(1) 我不习惯你们那些随心所欲的标准。 (2) 独裁者即独断专横的统治者。 (3) 这是个武断的决定。
arch n.拱；拱门；拱状物 v.成拱形；拱起 adj.主要的；调皮的	(1) Dip your head under the low arch. (2) A pointed arch drawn from two centers within the span. (3) Have you been to the Triumphal Arch? (4) The bridge has three arches. (5) Marble Arch is a famous London landmark. (6) The cat arched its back when it saw the dog. (7) "(actors, singers, etc.) perform for outside salary income without approval by the unit they belong to" (8) They considered him their arch opponent. (9) Pepsi and Coke have been arch rivals for a long time. (10) Yuan Shikai was an arch usurper of state power.	(1) 在低矮的门拱下要低头。 (2) 在跨度内有两个中心点，连接两个中心点的是弧度突出的拱。 (3) 你去过凯旋门吗？ (4) 这座桥有三座拱洞。 (5) 大理石拱门是著名的伦敦标志。 (6) 那猫看见狗时就拱起了背。 (7) 走穴 (8) 他们将他看成是主要对手。 (9) 百事和可口可乐长期以来都是主要的对手。 (10) 袁世凯是一个窃国大盗。
architect n.建筑师 n.【喻】缔造者；创造者	(1) He is known as a successful architect. (2) The author of the guidebook is an architect by profession. (3) The architect was given/presented with a blank cheque to design a new city centre. (4) He was one of the architects of the republic.	(1) 他以成功的建筑师闻名。 (2) 该旅行指南的作者任职建筑师。 (3) 设计师被授予全权设计一个新的城市中心区。 (4) 他是这个共和国的缔造者之一。
architecture n.建筑学；结构；一座建筑物；总称建筑物；建筑风格；【计算机】计算机构造，架构，体系结构，结构格式	(1) He obtained a diploma in architecture. (2) The architecture of this house is very substantial. (3) The new house he bought was colonial architecture. (4) The Forbidden City is one of the world's greatest works of architecture. (5) This church is a fine example of Norman architecture.	(1) 他获得了建筑学的学位证书。 (2) 这座房子的结构很牢固。 (3) 他新买的房子是美国初期的建筑。 (4) 紫禁城是世界上最伟大的建筑之一。 (5) 这座教堂是典型的诺曼式建筑。
Arab n.阿拉伯人；阿拉伯马 adj.阿拉伯人的；阿拉伯的	(1) Tanner yanked the gun free of the Arab. (2) Tanner yanked the gun free of the Arab. (3) The new defense minister is a Sunni Arab. (4) The Bush era had produced a dramatic decline in America's global image, with anti-Americanism taking root around the world, from European capitals to the Arab street.	(1) 坦纳把枪从阿拉伯人手中扯过来。 (2) 坦纳把枪从阿拉伯人手中扯过来。 (3) 新的防卫长官是阿拉伯的伊斯兰教的人。 (4) 布什的年代已经使美国的全球形象跌入谷底，从欧洲的首都城市到阿拉伯的街巷，反美情绪已经在全球扎根。
Arabic n.阿拉伯语 adj.阿拉伯语的；阿拉伯人的；阿拉伯式的	(1) He speaks Arabic and English with equal ease. (2) Arabic greeting cards for many occasions. (3) If you can read any Arabic, you can tell what it says.	(1) 他说阿拉伯语和英语都一样自如。 (2) 阿拉伯语贺卡许多场合。 (3) 如果你会阿拉伯语的话，你就能明白上边说些什么。
Arctic adj.北极的；极寒的 n.北极圈；北极	(1) The polar bear's habitat is the icy waters of the Arctic. (2) I guess there are much less people in the Arctic regions than here. (3) We can't stand this arctic weather. (4) Wilderness forests give way to arctic tundra in the Far North. (5) It is very cold in the Arctic Circle all the year. (6) Your journey to the Arctic is a brave venture.	(1) 北极熊的栖息地是冰冷的北极海域。 (2) 我想北极地区的人要比这里的少得多。 (3) 我们受不了这种严寒的天气。 (4) 原生森林一直延伸到极远的北方始由极地草原取代。 (5) 北极圈内终年寒冷。 (6) 你去北极旅行是一个大胆的行动。
the Arctic n.北极区	(1) The area surrounding the North Pole is called the Arctic region. (2) Lemmings, small rodents of the arctic and subarctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere, have long been a byword for mass mindlessness and mass suicide.	(1) 北极周围的地区称为北极区。 (2) 旅鼠是一种生活在北半球北极区和亚北极区的小型啮齿类动物，一直以来人们流传着很多关于他们愚笨和自杀的笑话。
the Arctic Ocean 北冰洋	(1) The Arctic is considered to be a part of the Atlantic.	(1) 北冰洋被认为是大西洋的一部分。
area n.面积；地区，地段；区域；领域	(1) The farm has an area of 100 square kilometers. (2) This area has not been covered by the communication net. (3) We are going to build a school in this area. (4) His special interest lies in the area of literature.	(1) 这个农场占地100平方公里。 (2) 这个地区还不在通讯网的覆盖之内。 (3) 我们准备在这个区域内建一所学校。 (4) 他对文学领域特别感兴趣。
argue v.说服；争论；辩论	(1) We argued her into joining us. (2) The United States should, he argues, attempt to remain aloof. (3) As we've seen, the experts argue about which diet is best. (4) They argued the case for hours.	(1) 我们说服她参加了宴会。 (2) 他认为，美国应保持超然态度。 (3) 正如我们所看见,而专家们争论,是最好的饮食。 (4) 他们就这个案子辩论了几个小时。
argument n.辩论；论点；论据；争论；理由；(函数)自变量	(1) She handled a difficult argument skilfully. (2) This argument, however, does not hold water. (3) This point is vital to my argument. (4) We accepted the agreement without argument. (5) The argument among the two parties was blown up by the press. (6) It is not a logically compelling argument. (7) The argument of the function was misrepresented. (8) Consider a method that takes a String as its argument.	(1) 她巧妙地应付了一场艰难的辩论。 (2) 但是,这种观点是站不住脚的。 (3) 这一点对我的论据极为重要。 (4) 我们毫无异议地接受了这一协议。 (5) 双方的争论被新闻界夸大了。 (6) 它在逻辑上并不是令人信服的理由。 (7) 这个函数的自变量出现表达错误。 (8) 下面让我们考虑将一个字串作为自变量使用的方法。
arise vi.出现；升起；上升；发生；起来	(1) An opportunity has arisen. (2) Tell our comrades to keep calm when problems arise. (3) Notice what emotions arise within you. (4) Whatever it is, let it arise and look at it mindfully. (5) The times of cleansing shall be due to many diseases that will arise as the temperature of Earth continues to rise due to her global ascension. (6) Accidents often arise from carelessness. (7) Various new problems may arise in future. (8) The problem may not arise, but there's no harm in keeping our powder dry. (9) Arise, LORD, come to your resting place, you and your majestic ark.	(1) 机会来了。 (2) 告诉同志们遇事要沉着。 (3) 注意到在你内心升起的情绪。 (4) 无论是什么，让它升起，觉知的观察它。 (5) 净化时代将是由于许多疾病的缘故，这些疾病将由于是地球气温因全球提升而上升的情况而出现。 (6) 事故往往起因于粗心。 (7) 将来可能会出现种种新问题。 (8) 问题不一定会发生，但有备无患并无害处。 (9) 上主，请你和你威严的约柜，起来驾临到你安息的地宅。
arithmetic n.算术；计算 adj.算术的	(1) I'm good at history but not so hot at arithmetic. (2) He got the answer by mental arithmetic. (3) My job is to instruct you in arithmetic. (4) I am not sure my arithmetic is correct, but I think the total is 75. (5) I saw him puzzle over an arithmetic problem. (6) Who can solve this simple arithmetic problem?	(1) 我的历史成绩不错，但算术不太好。 (2) 他用心算得出了答案。 (3) 我的工作就是指导你学算术。 (4) 我不确定我的计算是不是正确,但是我认为总数是75。 (5) 我看见他正在苦心思索一道算术题。 (6) 谁会做这道简单的算术题?
armchair n.扶手椅；单人沙发；安乐椅 adj.不切实际的	(1) This armchair is made of bamboo. (2) He ensconced himself in a armchair. (3) He got up slowly from the armchair. (4) She installed herself in an armchair.	(1) 这个扶手椅是用竹子做成的。 (2) 他安坐在扶手椅上。 (3) 他慢慢从单人沙发上站起身来。 (4) 她在安乐椅上坐下来。
army n.军队；陆军；一大批	(1) The battlefield is full of the army. (2) He joined the army a year ago. (3) The head of state was deposed by the army. (4) The town was pillaged by the invading army. (5) The army, navy and airforce are all controlled by the Ministry of Defense. (6) What I have said about the army also applies, mutatis mutandis, to the navy.	(1) 军队布满了战场。 (2) 一年以前，他参军了。 (3) 国家元首被军队废黜了。 (4) 入侵的军队将该城镇掠夺一空。 (5) 陆海空军皆由国防部控制。 (6) 我谈到的陆军方面,如作适当变动,也适用于海军。
arrange vt.整理；安排；计划；改编(乐曲) vi.协商；计划	(1) You must arrange these books in alphabetical order. (2) I have arranged one of my staff to meet you at the airport. (3) I have arranged with the neighbours about taking care of the cat. (4) Her parents are busy arranging for her wedding ceremony.	(1) 你要把这些书按字母顺序排好。 (2) 我已经安排好一个职员到飞机场接你。 (3) 我已和邻居们商量好照顾猫咪的事情。 (4) 她的父母正忙着为她的婚礼做准备。
arrangement n.布置；安排；约定；商议；改编曲	(1) He introduced to us the symmetrical arrangement of the garden. (2) He knew the room arrangement well. (3) This arrangement is agreeable to both sides. (4) We have made all the arrangements for the conference. (5) Our arrangement of yesterday no longer stands. (6) He can play a piano arrangement of an old folk song.	(1) 他为我们介绍了花园中对称的布局。 (2) 他对房间的布局是很清楚的。 (3) 这样安排对双方都合适。 (4) 我们已做好会议的全部筹备工作。 (5) 我们昨天商议的不再有效。 (6) 他会弹奏由古老民谣改编的钢琴曲。
arrest vt.逮捕；拘留 n.逮捕；拘留	(1) The police arrested the thief. (2) You shouldn't arrest him without warrant. (3) The constable stop the car and arrest the driver. (4) The riot led to the arrest of three young men. (5) They put the susper under arrest after finding him with incriminating cvidence. (6) Some baby bear tried to arrest me for speeding, but I conned him out of it.	(1) 警察逮捕了小偷。 (2) 你不能毫无根据地逮捕他。 (3) 警官使车停住并将司机扣留。 (4) 暴乱导致3 个年轻人被捕。 (5) 他们发现嫌疑犯有犯罪证据后将他拘留。 (6) 有个刚上任的公路巡警要以超速驾车拘留我，但我找了些理由把他哄骗过去了。
arrival n.到达；达到；到达者；新生儿	(1) I am impatient for his arrival. (2) The secretary informed me of his arrival. (3) Since her arrival at the company, she has re-organized several departments. (4) The new arrival was a large healthy baby.	(1) 我渴盼着他的到来。 (2) 秘书通知我他来了。 (3) 自从她到这个公司,她已经重组了几个部门了。 (4) 新生的婴儿又大又健康。
arrow n.箭；箭头	(1) The arrow just split the apple in half. (2) The arrow flew straight and true to its mark. (3) The bow twanged and the arrow whistled through the air. (4) The arrow indicates where we are. (5) The arrow is pointing the wrong way.	(1) 箭把苹果分成两半。 (2) 那箭不偏不斜地直朝目标飞去。 (3) 那张弓发出“崩”的一声,箭随之呼啸而去。 (4) 箭头表示我们现在所在之处。 (5) 这个箭头指错了方向。
article n.文章；物品；条款；[语]冠词 vt.订契约	(1) She asked him to contribute a biweekly article on European affairs. (2) If you don't return the article to the shop within a week, you forfeit your chance of getting your money back. (3) Article 180 states that one third of the members must be women. (4) The test wasn't difficult at all, I had to choose the right article for each of the 30 sentences. (5) I am articled to a firm of lawyers.	(1) 她让他每两周写一篇有关欧洲情况的文章。 (2) 如果你不把物品归还商店，你就丧失了取回钱的机会。 (3) 第180条规定,三分之一的成员必须为女性。 (4) 考试并不难，我得给三十个句子找出正确的冠词。 (5) 我受雇在一家律师公司做见习生。
artificial adj.人造的；虚伪的；武断的	(1) This orange drink contains no artificial flavourings. (2) This dress is made of artificial fibers. (3) She welcomed us with an artificial smile on her face. (4) Her artificial manner made me sick.	(1) 这种橙汁饮品不含人工调味料。 (2) 这件衣服是人造纤维的。 (3) 她脸上挂着虚委的笑容来迎接我们。 (4) 她那装腔作势的样子令我恶心。
ash n.灰；灰烬 n.白蜡树；白蜡木 (复)ashes：骨灰；废墟；苍白.	(1) Wood ash should be forked or dug into the soil. (2) I wish he would refrain from scattering his ash all over the carpet. (3) The fire reduced the house to a mass of ash. (4) There was an ash tree in the forest which was thought to be a monster.	(1) 木灰应被耙入或插进土壤里。 (2) 我希望他不要将烟灰往地毯上乱弹。 (3) 大火把房子烧成了灰烬。 (4) 森林中有一株被认为是妖怪的白蜡树。
ashamed adj.感到惭愧的；感到害臊的	(1) He is ashamed for his former dishonorable action. (2) He was ashamed that he had lied. (3) As for you, you should feel ashamed. (4) He jumped up,looking a little ashamed of himself. (5) She seemed ashamed, and turned away as we went by. (6) You ought to feel ashamed of yourself for having descended to such falsehood.	(1) 他对他以前不光彩的行为感到羞愧。 (2) 他很惭愧他说了谎。 (3) 至于你，你应该感到惭愧。 (4) 他跳了起来，显得有点惭愧。 (5) 她似乎很害臊，所以在我们走过的时候，她把头扭过去了。 (6) 你竟然堕落到这样说谎的地步，自己应该感到害臊。
Asia n.亚洲；亚细亚	(1) He kept a journal of his wanderings across Asia. (2) The company has begun to scale down its operations in Asia. (3) China is a developing country in Asia. (4) It is a programme beamed at Asia. (5) Much of Central Asia was appropriated by the tsars only in the nineteenth century.	(1) 他记自己漫游亚洲的日记。 (2) 这家公司已开始减少在亚洲的业务。 (3) 中国是亚洲的发展中国家。 (4) 这是一个对亚洲地区广播的节目。 (5) 中亚细亚的大部分地区只是到了十九世纪才被沙皇所吞并。
Asian adj.亚洲的；亚洲人的 n.亚洲人	(1) How many Asian countries have taken part in the sport meeting? (2) Before entering a house in some Asian countries, it is good manners to take off your shoes. (3) I've been invited to an Asian wedding. What happens on such occasions? (4) That Asian stopped me and asked if I was Chinese.	(1) 有多少亚洲国家参加这次运动会？ (2) 在某些亚洲的国家，进屋子之前脱下鞋子才是有礼貌的。 (3) 我应邀参加亚洲人的婚礼。这种婚礼是如何举行的? (4) 那个亚洲人拦住我，问我是不是中国人。
aside n.旁白；顺便说的话 adv.在一边；另外；离开	(1) This is surely an author's aside. (2) He spoke in an aside of his family. (3) She has cast her old friends aside. (4) We turned aside from the main road. (5) I shall have to go aside for a few moments.	(1) 这当然是作者的旁白。 (2) 他离开本题谈起他的家庭。 (3) 她把老朋友都撇在一边。 (4) 我们离开大道。 (5) 我必须离开一会儿。
aspect n.方面；方位；外观；外貌	(1) This is only one aspect of the problem. (2) He has made progress in every aspect. (3) The open spaces differ according to aspect. (4) His brother is a man with a serious aspect. (5) The fierce aspect of the salesman frightened the customer off.	(1) 这只是问题的一个方面。 (2) 他在各方面都有起色。 (3) 开敞空地随方位而不同。 (4) 他的兄弟是一个外貌严肃的人。 (5) 那个店员的凶相把顾客吓走了。
assess v.评定；评估；估算	(1) He can quickly assess a person's character. (2) How do you assess your students? (3) We will assess the damages caused by the flood.	(1) 他能很快地评定出某人的品质。 (2) 你如何评估学生们？ (3) 我们将对洪灾造成的损失进行评估。
assessment n.评价；评估；评定	(1) His assessment of the situation was spot-on. (2) Your assessment is substantially correct. (3) It was a shrewd assessment and probably pretty close to the truth. (4) Continuous assessment is made of all students' work.	(1) 他对形势判断得很正确。 (2) 你的估计基本正确。 (3) 这个评估很有道理，可能相当正确。 (4) 对全体学生的功课作出连贯性的评定。
assist vt.帮助；协助 vi.帮助；出席 n.帮助；协助；助攻；协助的器械	(1) A team of nurses assisted the doctor in performing the operation. (2) I saw the angels standing near us, waiting to assist us, rejoicing in our accomplishments and joys. (3) Sixty years ago, George Marshall came to this commencement and announced a plan to assist the nations of post-war Europe. (4) I have too much work and no one to assist me (5) I assisted in doing his homework. (6) All her friends assist at the wedding ceremony. (7) The victims of earthquake need assist asap. (8) Lin scored 27 points and dished out 11 assists as the Knicks have now won six games in a row.	(1) 一组护士协助医生施行手术。 (2) 我看见天使站在我们旁边,等着帮助我们,为我们的成就及喜悦而欢呼。 (3) 六十年前，乔治·马歇尔也是在这个地方的毕业典礼上，宣布了一个计划，帮助那些欧洲国家的战后建设。 (4) 我工作太多,又没人协助我 (5) 我帮助他做功课。 (6) 她的朋友们都参加了婚礼。 (7) 那些地震灾民需要立即援助。 (8) 林获得27分，发动11次助攻，尼克斯取得六连胜。
assistance n.援助；帮助	(1) We are ready to render them economic assistance. (2) He gave the assistance to me when I was in trouble. (3) You can not rely on his assistance. (4) I really appreciate your assistance.	(1) 我们愿意向他们提供经济援助。 (2) 我有麻烦时,他向我伸出援助之手。 (3) 你不能指望他能帮助你。 (4) 衷心感谢您的帮助。
associate vt.联想；联合 n.伙伴；同事；同伴 adj.副的；共事的；有联系的 n.准学士学位获得者 vi.交往	(1) We should associate ourselves with this large firm. (2) Mr. Miller is a business associate of our company. (3) I got a new job and a new group of work associates. (4) He conformed his manners to those of his associates. (5) He is an associate editor of the newspaper. (6) Mr. Lee is the associate producer of this film. (7) At the conference I met many friends from associate organizations. (8) You are wooing troubles if you associate with him.	(1) 我们应该和这家大公司联合。 (2) 米勒先生是我们公司的生意伙伴。 (3) 我有了新工作和一班新同事。 (4) 他使自己举止和同伴一致。 (5) 他是报纸的副主编。 (6) 李先生是这部影片的联合制片人。 (7) 在那次会议上,我遇到兄弟单位的许多朋友。 (8) 你和他交往会招来麻烦。
association n.协会；社团；交往；联想；联合；结合	(1) Have you joined the teachers' association? (2) About 20 people have registered in the association. (3) Horwath refers to Horwath International Association, a Swiss verein. (4) I benefited much from my association with him. (5) What association do you have with the color green? (6) United Services Auto- mobile Association. (7) It was formed, in fact, by the Article of Association in 1774. (8) Such a complex association between creatures of four species has the hallmark of an ecologic happy family. (9) The vapor association of acetic acid and propionic acid due to dimerization and trimerization has been considered as well.	(1) 你加入教师协会了吗? (2) 大约有20人已登记加入这一协会。 (3) 浩华是指浩华国际协会，为一个根据瑞士法律所组成的社团组织。 (4) 我从跟他的交往中获益匪浅。 (5) 绿色会使你产生什么联想? (6) 联合服务汽车协会。 (7) 事实上它是由一七七四年的联合条款所组成。 (8) 四种动物之间这种复杂的结合是生态学幸福家庭的标志。 (9) 考虑乙酸与丙酸于气相因结合作用在气相形成二聚体及三聚体。
assume vt.假定；设想；承担；(想当然的)认为；假装	(1) Let's assume it to be true. (2) We assume his guilt. (3) They assumed their operational positions. (4) I am not afraid to assume the responsibility. (5) She was in arrogance to assume she would win every time.	(1) 让我们假定这是真的。 (2) 我们假定他是有罪的。 (3) 他们设想了自己在实施中的作用。 (4) 我不怕承担责任. (5) 她认为每次都能赢，未免太自大了。
assumption n.假定；设想；担任(职责等)；假装	(1) The project was predicated on the assumption that the economy was expanding. (2) The theory is based on a series of wrong assumptions. (3) His assumption of power was welcomed by everyone. (4) He talked with an assumption of ease.	(1) 这一计划是以经济发展的设想为依据的。 (2) 这一理论是以一系列错误的设想为依据的。 (3) 他的当权为大家所欢迎。 (4) 他装出从容的样子说话。
astonish vt.使惊讶；使吃惊	(1) I was astonished at the news of his escape. (2) She astonished me with her beautiful handwriting. (3) A matter of repeated occurrence like this will not astonish people.	(1) 听到他逃之夭夭的消息，我感到惊讶。 (2) 她以其秀丽的书法而使我惊异。 (3) 重复出现的事物不会使人吃惊。
astronaut n.宇航员	(1) The astronaut can send out a robot which will work on the unknown planet, collecting rocks and minerals, putting up a permanent observation station or traveling far and wide. (2) My son's dream is to be an astronaut. (3) A rocket manned by trained astronauts will launch soon. (4) The rocket boosts the astronaut into space. (5) He'll be an astronaut by the time he is thirty.	(1) 宇航员可以派出机器人在这颗陌生的行星上工作，收集岩石和矿物; 建立永久性观察站，或向四面八方走动。 (2) 我儿子的理想是当宇航员。 (3) 载有受过训练的宇航员的火箭马上就要发射了。 (4) 这火箭能把宇航员送入太空。 (5) 在他三十岁的时候他将成为一名宇航员。
astronomer n.天文学家	(1) He wished to be an astronomer when he was a child. (2) But one astronomer has just done precisely that.	(1) 他还是孩子的时候就梦想成为天文学家。 (2) 但是一位天文学家却恰恰做到了这一点。
astronomy n.天文学	(1) Physics and astronomy are cognate sciences. (2) Astronomy, as distinct from astrology, is an exact science. (3) Astronomy is the scientific study of the sun, moon, and stars and other heaven bodies. (4) We're at cross-purposes: I'm talking about astronomy, you're talking about astrology.	(1) 物理学和天文学是相关联的科学。 (2) 天文学是一门严谨的科学，与占星术完全不同。 (3) 天文学是研究太阳、月亮、星星和其他天体的科学。 (4) 我们彼此误解了: 我谈的是天文学，你谈的是占星术。
athlete n.运动员	(1) The athlete is suffering from muscular strain. (2) She will make a very good athlete. (3) The athlete has an electrifying burst of speed.	(1) 这名运动员正受肌肉劳损之苦。 (2) 她将来会成为一名很好的运动员。 (3) 这名运动员具有惊人的爆发速度。
athletic adj.运动的；活跃的；健壮的	(1) Athletic sports are good to the health. (2) Paul is a bright and athletic student . (3) John is an athletic boy and he is good at running.	(1) 体育运动有益健康。 (2) 保罗是个伶俐活跃的学生。 (3) 约翰体魄健壮,他擅长跑步。
athletics n.体育运动；田径	(1) She showed us the athletics awards she had won. (2) Athletics include all kinds of sports. (3) I like all the athletics events. (4) Runners in an athletics stadium run in individual lanes.	(1) 她给我们看她赢得的体育运动奖。 (2) 体育运动包括各种竞技。 (3) 我喜欢所有的田径项目。 (4) 在田径运动场上赛跑的人有各自的跑道。
Atlantic adj.大西洋的 n.大西洋	(1) It took them several days to cross the Atlantic Ocean. (2) A strong gale swept down on the atlantic coast. (3) He was the first airpilot to cross the Atlantic. (4) They underlaid the Atlantic with a cable.	(1) 他们花了好几天的时间穿越大西洋。 (2) 狂风突然猛袭大西洋海岸。 (3) 他是飞越大西洋的第一个飞行员。 (4) 他们在大西洋海底铺设了一条电缆。
the Atlantic Ocean 大西洋	(1) A legendary island in the Atlantic Ocean west of Gibraltar, said by Plato to have sunk beneath the sea during an earthquake. (2) It took them several days to cross the Atlantic Ocean. (3) Who first navigated the Atlantic Ocean? (4) This river flowed southwest to the Atlantic Ocean.	(1) 亚特兰蒂斯大西洋中一传说岛屿，位于直布罗陀西部，柏拉图声称在一场地震中沉入海底 (2) 他们花了好几天的时间穿越大西洋。 (3) 是谁首先横渡大西洋? (4) 这条河流向西南，汇入大西洋。
atmosphere n.大气；空气；气氛；气压	(1) The burning of fossil fuels results in the pollution of the atmosphere. (2) The atmosphere of the city is very much polluted. (3) The atmosphere changed as soon as she walked in. (4) The atmosphere over dinner was warm and friendly. (5) The atmosphere pressure gradient is an inverse measure of the spacing of the isobars on a weather map. (6) The water droplets ejected by the gun expand in the atmosphere because it is at lower pressure than the air used to make the droplets.	(1) 矿物燃料的燃烧导致了大气污染。 (2) 那个城市的空气受到严重污染。 (3) 她一进来气氛就变了。 (4) 用餐时洋溢著热情友好的气氛。 (5) 气压梯度与天气图上等压线的间隔大小成反比。 (6) 由于大气气压比造雪炮中气压低，雪炮中的水滴被喷射到空气中。
atom n.原子；微粒	(1) Scientists have unlocked the secret of the atom. (2) A molecule of water consists of two atoms of hydrogen and one atom of oxygen. (3) The atom bomb is the offspring of the 20th century physics. (4) That cannot get up an atom of sympathy for them. (5) There isn't an atom of truth in the rumour.	(1) 科学家已经揭开了原子的秘密。 (2) 水分子含有两个氢原子和一个氧原子。 (3) 原子弹是20世纪物理学的产物。 (4) 那并不能激发起人们对他们的丝毫同情。 (5) 谣言中没有丝毫的真实性。
attach v.附上；系上；贴上；使依附；使附属；使附着	(1) I attach a copy of my notes for your information. (2) In confirmation hereof we attach a bank statement. (3) Please attach these labels to your hand luggages. (4) Please attach your business card below or fill up the information. (5) China will not attach itself to any big power. (6) This middle school is attached to a normal college. (7) Tendons are the thick fibrous cords that attach muscle to bone.	(1) 我附上笔记一份供你参考。 (2) 为作这方面的确认我们附上银行结单。 (3) 请把这些标签系在您的手提行李上。 (4) 推荐人请在下面框中贴上您的名片,如不贴名片,则请详细填写框中各项。 (5) 中国不依附任何大国。 (6) 这所中学附属于一所师范院校。 (7) 肌腱是附着肌肉和骨上的厚纤维带。
attain v.实现；获得；达到	(1) We can attain whatever goal we set in our mind. (2) We should be able to attain that goal. (3) They're sure to attain emancipation in the end. (4) I'm determined to attain my purpose at any cost. (5) She pulls every string to attain the end.	(1) 我们设定了什么目标，就能实现什么目标。 (2) 我们应该能够实现这个目标。 (3) 他们最后一定能获得解放。 (4) 我决心不惜任何代价达到目的。 (5) 她想尽一切办法来达到目的。
attempt v.企图；尝试 n.企图；试图	(1) He attempted to smother up the scandal about his family. (2) I would be the last to attempt to answer the question. (3) He studied hard in an attempt to pass the exam.	(1) 他企图掩饰有关他家庭的丑闻。 (2) 我是最不可能去尝试回答这个问题。 (3) 他努力学习试图通过考试。
attend v.出席；参加；照料；注意；专心于	(1) I shall be attending the meeting. (2) During summer vacations some teachers attend seminars at college. (3) You're going out? But who will attend to the baby? (4) Attend to what your teacher says. (5) Attend to your work and stop talking.	(1) 我会参加会议。 (2) 暑假里,一些教师在学院里参加研究班。 (3) 你要出去?那谁来照料这婴儿。 (4) 注意听老师的话。 (5) 专心工作，不要说话。
attention n.注意；注意力；照料；留心；关怀；(口令)立正	(1) She soon becomes the centre of attention. (2) You should focus your attention on your work. (3) She gave her aging parents much attention. (4) He didn't pay much attention to his surroundings. (5) My mother always lavishes us with attention. (6) Spring to attention when the captain enters.	(1) 她很快成为大家注意的人物。 (2) 你应该把注意力放到工作上。 (3) 她悉心照料年迈的双亲。 (4) 他没有留心他周围的环境。 (5) 妈妈对我们关怀得无微不至。 (6) 上尉一进来，就要迅速立正站好。
attentively adv.注意地；留意地	(1) Ask her what happened and listen sympathetically and attentively. (2) If there is a chat among us, she is always the one who says little but listens attentively.	(1) 问受害者所发生的事，并同情地及注意地听。 (2) 如果有在我们之中的闲谈，她总是少说但是注意地听的人。
attitude n.态度；看法；姿势	(1) We must maintain a firm attitude. (2) She shows a very positive attitude to her work. (3) He has a mellow attitude to life. (4) As you get older, your attitude towards death changes. (5) They sat around in easy attitude.	(1) 我们必须采取坚定的态度。 (2) 她工作态度非常积极。 (3) 他对生活有种成熟的看法。 (4) 人随著年龄的增长,对死亡的看法也会有所改变。 (5) 他们以舒适的姿势围坐在一起。
attraction n.吸引；吸引力；有吸引力的人或事物	(1) She felt an immediate attraction to him. (2) The attraction of the moon for the earth causes the tides. (3) She felt a strong attraction to him. (4) The main attraction of the place is the nightlife. (5) City life holds few attractions for me.	(1) 她对他一见锺情。 (2) 月球对地球的吸引力造成潮汐。 (3) 她感到他对她有强烈的吸引力。 (4) 这个地方最具吸引力的是夜生活。 (5) 城市生活中没有什么吸引我的东西。
attractive adj.有吸引力的；有魅力的	(1) Ice-cream is attractive to children. (2) It's an attractive idea. (3) I think she is a very attractive girl. (4) The photo made him quite attractive.	(1) 冰淇淋对孩子们非常有吸引力。 (2) 这是个使人感兴趣的想法。 (3) 我认为她是很有魅力的女孩。 (4) 照片把他拍得相当英俊。
authentic adj.真正的；真实的；可信的；可靠的	(1) He found out the most authentic restaurants. (2) The details of the costume were totally authentic. (3) He's got an authentic letter by Shakespeare. (4) The screen saver is accompanied by authentic Didgeridoo music. (5) Next, patients in the first group received authentic acupuncture with needles placed in established "acupoints. (6) They demanded to be shown the authentic documents.	(1) 他找到了最正宗的餐馆。 (2) 这件古装的每个小地方都完全真实。 (3) 他弄到了一封莎士比亚的亲笔信。 (4) 屏幕保护程序被伴随着可信的澳大利亚土著居民的管乐器音乐。 (5) 然后，第一组患者接受了可信的针灸疗法，将针放置在确定的针灸穴位。 (6) 他们要求出示真实可靠的文件。
author n.作家；作者 vt.编写；创作 Author. n.上帝	(1) This book shows that he is an ingenious author. (2) The book was translated without the sanction of the author. (3) Through them you can vicariously enter into the experience of the author, gaining a fresh, new perspective on the vastness of God's creation and the depths of the human spirit. (4) The book is authored by six leading historians. (5) He authored two best-sellers.	(1) 这本书表明他是一个有创造力的作家。 (2) 这本书未经作者许可就给翻译了。 (3) 透过书本，你会进入作者的心灵世界，对上帝广大的创造，和人类精神的层次有新的体认。 (4) 这本书由六名权威的历史学家编写而成。 (5) 他写过两部畅销书。
authority n.权力；官方；当局；职权；权威	(1) The government is the highest authority in the country. (2) Authorities say the fires do look suspicious. (3) Both the authorities and the media wondered whether insider dealing had been going on. (4) The authorities did not interfere with us. (5) The new building must be financed by the local authority. (6) These documents ensure to you the authority you need . (7) We see him as an authority on the subject.	(1) 政府是国家的最高权力机构。 (2) 官方表示，火灾看起来确实很奇怪。 (3) 官方跟媒体都在怀疑这里面是不是存在内幕交易。 (4) 当局不干涉我们。 (5) 新大楼的建筑资金必须由地方当局提供。 (6) 这些文件使你获得你需要的职权。 (7) 我们把他看作为这方面的权威。
automatic adj.自动的；无意识的；必然的 n.自动装置；半自动武器	(1) This heating system has an automatic temperature control. (2) We get an automatic increase in pay every year. (3) For most of us breathing is automatic. (4) A fine for this offence is automatic. (5) We now consider it to be the primordial automatic device because it held the first breath of lifelikeness in a machine. (6) Cranking-motor controls have varied from a simple foot-operated pedal to automatic devices that close the cranking-motor circuit when the accelerator pedal is depressed.	(1) 这个暖气系统有自动化的温度调节系统。 (2) 我们的薪金每年会自动增长。 (3) 我们大多数人的呼吸都是无意识的。 (4) 对于这种过失,罚款是必然的。 (5) 而我们现在之所以把它看成是自动装置的鼻祖，是因为它在一个机器装置中成功地把握到了生命之为生命的第一次呼吸。 (6) 控制起动电机的方式已从一个简单的脚踏板改为压下加速踏板即可自动接通起动电机电路的自动装置。
autonomous adj.自治的	(1) Each of the U.S. states has an autonomous government. (2) The former Soviet Union is formed of several autonomous republic.	(1) 美国的每个州都有一个自治政府。 (2) 前苏联是由数个自治共和国组成的。
available adj.可利用的；可得到的；有空的；有效的；<贬>【政】有资格的，适合的	(1) Do you have a room available? (2) The swimming pool is available only in summer. (3) All sorts of lamps are available in that shop. (4) The Prime Minister was not available for comment. (5) When will the plumber be available? (6) This film ticket is no longer available. (7) The round trip ticket is available for two months.	(1) 你们有空房间吗？ (2) 这个游泳池只在夏天开放。 (3) 在那家商店可买到各式各样的灯具。 (4) 首相无暇作出评论。 (5) 管道工什么时候有空? (6) 这张电影票不再有效。 (7) 返程票两个月有效。
avenue n.林荫道；大街；途径手段	(1) He stands on the corner of a wide avenue. (2) I meet him by chance on Fifth Avenue. (3) The avenue was crowded with people. (4) Hard work is a sure avenue to success. (5) They exploded every avenue but could not find a solution.	(1) 他站在宽阔的林荫道的角落里。 (2) 我偶然在第大街上遇到他。 (3) 大街上挤满了人。 (4) 勤奋是可靠的成功之道。 (5) 他们探索过各种途径，但是没有找到解决的办法。
average n.平均数；平均水平 adj.平均的；一般的；通常的 v.取平均值；达到平均水平	(1) The average of 4,6 and 8 is 6. (2) Temperatures are below average for the time of year. (3) The average age of the boys in this class is fifteen. (4) Tom's work at school is above the average. (5) He is an average man, there's nothing special about him. (6) If you average 4, 6 and 11,you get 7 . (7) Meals average out at 5 per head.	(1) 4,6, 8的平均数是6。 (2) 温度低于此时的年平均温度。 (3) 本班男生的平均年龄是十五岁。 (4) 汤姆的功课是中上等水平。 (5) 他是个普通人, 并没有什么异乎常人的地方。 (6) 如果你将4，6和11平均，你即得7。 (7) 膳食平均每人5英镑。
avoid vt.避免；逃避；[律]使无效；撤销	(1) You should avoid unnecessary repetition. (2) He'll grab at any excuse to avoid doing the dishes. (3) No one can avoid his own responsibility.	(1) 你应避免不必要的重复。 (2) 他会随便找个借口来逃避洗碗。 (3) 没有人能够逃避自己的责任。
award n.奖品；奖 v.授予；给予；判给	(1) It is impossible to honor her with the award. (2) The child smiled at his teacher as he received the award. (3) It is the highest award a producer can receive. (4) Bill accepted the championship award on behalf of the team. (5) The university awarded him an honorary degree. (6) She has been awarded first prize four years in succession. (7) The judge awarded costs to the defendant. (8) Custody of the children was awarded to the mother.	(1) 奖品授给她是不可能的。 (2) 孩子接过奖品时朝老师微笑着。 (3) 这是一个制作人所能获得的最高奖项。 (4) 比尔代表他的队接受了冠军奖。 (5) 这所大学授给他名誉学位。 (6) 她已连续四年获得一等奖。 (7) 法官判由原告向被告支付诉讼费。 (8) 儿童的监护权已判给母亲。
aware adj.知道的；意识到的	(1) If you were aware of all that, you would change your mind. (2) Then he became aware that they were regarding him with interest.	(1) 如果你知道了那一切,你会改变主意的。 (2) 这时,他意识到他们都在饶有兴趣地看着他。
awesome adj.可怕的；表示敬畏的；了不起的；精彩的，绝妙的	(1) An awesome thunderstorm struck the city yesterday. (2) The archaeologist stood in awesome silence before the ancient ruins.	(1) 昨天,一场可怕的暴风雨侵袭了这个城市。 (2) 那名考古学家在古代遗址前充满敬畏地默立着。
awful adj.糟糕的；可怕的；充满敬畏的；难受的 adv.极其	(1) It would be awful if he found out the truth. (2) I left Harvard with no real awareness of the awful inequities in the world. (3) I feel awful about not inviting her. (4) She said she had a sore throat and was feeling awful. (5) These weeks is an awful long time to wait.	(1) 如果他发现了真相，那就糟了。 (2) 当我离开哈佛时,我并没真正有意识到这个世界存在着可怕的不平等现象。 (3) 没有邀请她,我感到很内疚。 (4) 她说她嗓子疼,而且感觉很难受。 (5) 这几个星期真的是一段极其漫长的等待时间啊。
awkward adj.尴尬的；笨拙的；（设计）别扭的	(1) It's a little awkward, because he's my friend but I'm still his boss. (2) He felt awkward and uncomfortable. (3) He seemed as awkward and rough as ever. (4) The handle of this teapot has an awkward shape. (5) The heavy ax was awkward to use.	(1) 他是我朋友,而我又是他老板,这真有点尴尬。 (2) 他感到尴尬和不舒服。 (3) 他跟从前一样拙笨和粗鲁。 (4) 这茶壶把儿的形状真别扭。 (5) 这把重斧头不好用。
Baby n.婴儿；宝贝儿；孩子气的人 adj.婴儿的；小型的 vt.溺爱	(1) She gave birth to a fine healthy baby. (2) The mother rocked the baby to sleep in its cradle. (3) We've turned the smallest bedroom into a nursery for our new baby. (4) Baby, come on, let's go home, I'm tired. (5) Don't be such a baby. (6) Since 2001, organic baby food sales have jumped 63%. (7) Don't baby the boy.	(1) 她生了一个健康漂亮的婴儿。 (2) 母亲摇动摇篮使婴儿入睡。 (3) 我们已将最小的那间卧室改成新生婴儿的幼儿室。 (4) 宝贝儿，快点儿，我们回家吧，我累了。 (5) 别那么孩子气。 (6) 从2001年以来,有机婴儿食品销售额已上升63%25。 (7) 别惯这孩子。
bachelor n.单身汉；学士	(1) You have the alternative of marrying or remaining a bachelor. (2) He remained a bachelor all his life. (3) Are you a Bachelor of Arts? (4) Bush graduated from Yale with a bachelor's degree in history in 1968,	(1) 你可以结婚也可以仍做单身汉，任你选择。 (2) 他终生未娶。 (3) 你是文学学士吗？ (4) 布什1968年从耶鲁大学毕业，获历史学学士学位，
backache n.背痛；腰痛	(1) Poor posture will give you backache. (2) The only way to cure backache is to rest.	(1) 坐姿不好会使人腰背酸痛。 (2) 治疗背痛的唯一办法是休息。
background n.背景；经历；幕后；后景 vt.提供背景	(1) He has a strong political background. (2) It is wrong to differentiate between people according to their family background. (3) With my working-class background I feel like a fish out of water among these high-society people. (4) Her marketing background made her a natural choice for the job. (5) He stayed in the background to escape from the public attention. (6) He took a picture of me with the pavilion in the background.	(1) 他有强大的政治背景。 (2) 根据出身不同而区别待人是不对的。 (3) 我出身于工人阶级,在上流社会中感到很不自在。 (4) 她的经销经历使她成为这一职位的必然人选。 (5) 他呆在幕后为了避开公众的注意。 (6) 他以那个亭子为背景给我照了一张相片。
backward adj.向后的；落后的 adv.向后	(1) He took a backward step and ran away. (2) This part of the country is still backward. (3) Although he is clever, he is backward in giving his views. (4) He looked backward over his shoulder. (5) He stepped backward and fell over the cliff.	(1) 他向后退了一步,跑了。 (2) 这个国家的这个地区仍很落后。 (3) 他虽然很聪明，却不善发表他的意见。 (4) 他回头向后看。 (5) 他向后退了一步就从悬崖上掉下去了。
bacon n.培根；咸肉；熏肉	(1) I'll plump for bacon and eggs rather than breakfast cereal. (2) The bacon is all frizzled up! (3) I'll rustle up some eggs and bacon for you.	(1) 我宁愿吃咸肉和鸡蛋，而不愿吃谷类制作的早餐食品。 (2) 腌肉都煎糊了！ (3) 我给你弄些鸡蛋和腌猪肉。
bacterium n.细菌	(1) Most of disease is caused from bacterium. (2) A bacterium was identified as the cause for his duodenal ulcer.	(1) 大多数疾病都是由细菌引起的。 (2) 一种细菌被断定为造成他十二指肠溃疡的根源。
badminton n.羽毛球	(1) I like to play badminton in my spare time. (2) He went to the badminton club at times during his school days. (3) He's in his element when playing badminton. (4) He plays tennis better than badminton. (5) I played badminton with my friends. (6) We go to play badminton in the nearest gym every Sunday.	(1) 我喜欢在闲暇时打羽毛球。 (2) 他上学时有时到羽毛球俱乐部去。 (3) 他打起羽毛球来真是得心应手。 (4) 他网球比羽毛球打得好。 (5) 我和朋友打了羽毛球。 (6) 每个星期天我们都去最近的体育馆打羽毛球。
baggage n.行李	(1) Let me put your baggage in the trunk. (2) Our baggage has cleared customs.	(1) 我来把你的行李放在汽车后部的行李箱内。 (2) 我们的行李已通过海关检查。
bake v.烤；烘焙；烘干；<非正式>灼热	(1) The bread is baking in the oven. (2) I will bake Tracy several buns now. (3) We bake bread and cake in an oven. (4) In some places, bricks are still baked in the sun.	(1) 烤箱里正在烤面包。 (2) 我现在要为特蕾西烤几个小面包。 (3) 我们用烤箱烘面包与糕点。 (4) 有些地方仍使用在太阳下晒干砖块的方法。
bakery n.面包店；面包厂	(1) The bakery serves us with fresh bread daily. (2) We were in luck, for the bakery was still open.	(1) 面包店每天都给我们提供新鲜面包。 (2) 我们总算走运，面包店还开着。
balance n.平衡；天平；平静；结余；差额；调和；制衡 vt.权衡；使平衡；抵消；称重量 vi.均衡；建立平衡	(1) The girl lost her balance and fell off the balance beam. (2) Great care must be taken in the use of the balance. (3) He used a very sensitive torsion balance. (4) Sunday is a great time to balance out whatever area of your life has felt disordered as of late. (5) We need to maintain some semblance of balance and some sense that we are steering the ship of our life. (6) Kindly remit us the balance without delay . (7) In other words, the balance of trade may deteriorate rather than improve. (8) The balance of the shade and the sun on the tree-trunks and on the ground is beautiful beyond words. (9) EBN is balance in Yin and Yang, sweet and mild, making it a surprisingly pleasant medicinal food. (10) The balance of terror has replaced the balance of power. (11) Locke's ideas on the power balance are still inspiring in modem societies. (12) You have to balance the advantages of living in a big city against the disadvantages. (13) The company will lay off workers to balance the budget. (14) This year's profits will balance our previous losses. (15) The dancer could balance on one toe. (16) The aviator warped a wing tip to regain balance.	(1) 小女孩失去了平衡，从平衡木上摔了下来。 (2) 这种天平使用时必须十分当心。 (3) 他利用了一架非常灵敏的扭力天平。 (4) 星期天是你最近动荡不安的生活得到平静的大好时机。 (5) 我们需要保持平静的外表，和一种我们掌握了我们的生活之舟的意识。 (6) 请立即把余额汇给我们。 (7) 换句话说,国际贸易差额不但不会改善,反而可能会恶化。 (8) 射在树干与地面上的阳光和树荫，其色彩之调和，真是美得难以形容。 (9) 燕窝的特质是阴阳调和，带甜温和，使到其成为人们喜欢享用的保健品。 (10) 恐惧的制衡已经取代了强权的制衡。 (11) 洛克权力制衡思想对现代社会仍然具有启发意义。 (12) 你必须权衡住在大城市的利与弊。 (13) 这家公司会裁员,以平衡预算。 (14) 本年度的盈利将与上一年度的亏损相抵。 (15) 舞蹈演员可以用一个脚趾平衡。 (16) 飞行员使一机翼的端部翘起,以恢复平衡。
balcony n.阳台；楼座；包厢	(1) The prospect from the balcony was breathtaking. (2) He planted some flowers on the balcony that projects over the street. (3) He was watching a performance from the balcony. (4) I'm sorry, all the balcony seats are sold out.	(1) 从阳台上看去景色美极了。 (2) 他在那个伸出到街上的阳台上种了些花。 (3) 他正在从楼厅上看电影。 (4) 抱歉,包厢的票都卖完了。
ballet n.芭蕾舞	(1) He did a sketch of the ballet dancers. (2) She invited us to see the ballet.	(1) 他为这些芭蕾舞者画了一张素描。 (2) 她邀请我们去看芭蕾舞。
balloon n.气球；球状物 vt.使膨胀 vi.乘气球飞行；激增；如气球般膨胀 adj.气球状的	(1) A balloon floated across the sky. (2) He balloons his cheeks when he is hesitant. (3) He tried to balloon around the earth but storms forced him to land in China. (4) Our expenses had ballooned. (5) Her skirt ballooned in the wind.	(1) 有个气球从空中飘过。 (2) 他迟疑不决时会鼓起双颊。 (3) 他试图乘气球做环球旅行，但风暴迫使他降落在中国。 (4) 我们的开销大大增加了。 (5) 她的裙子让风吹得鼓起来了。
ballpoint n.圆珠笔(=ballpoint pen)	(1) Do you sell this kind of ballpoint? (2) You can buy the ballpoint pen anywhere. (3) The boys were bickering over some ballpoints.	(1) 你们卖这种圆珠笔吗？ (2) 你到哪儿都能够买到这种圆珠笔。 (3) 那些男孩子为几支圆珠笔争吵起来了。

bandage n.绷带 vt.用绷带包扎	(1) The nurse eased away the bandage from the wound. (2) I twisted the bandage round her knee. (3) The waitress put a bandage round his hand. (4) The surgeon bandaged up his injured head. (5) Do you know how to bandage an injured arm?	(1) 护士小心翼翼地解开伤口处的绷带。 (2) 我用带缠住了她的膝盖。 (3) 女服务员用绷带将他的手包扎起来。 (4) 外科医生把他受伤的头部包扎起来。 (5) 你知道如何包扎受伤的胳膊吗?

bar n.酒吧；条；横木；栅 vt.禁止；阻挠；闩上；在 ... 设栅栏	(1) There are several bars in the hotel. (2) A bar of chocolate is enough to stop his crying. (3) There's a strong bar on the door. (4) There is a burning man hovering in the air over a grille in the Smoldering Corpse Bar. (5) After the bombing, the whole area was barred to the public. (6) The members voted to bar women from the club. (7) I will bar no honest man to my house.	(1) 这家旅馆里有好几个酒吧。 (2) 一条巧克力就可以让他不哭了。 (3) 门上有一个很坚固的闩。 (4) 有一个焚烧中的人，飘浮在冒烟尸体酒吧的铁栅上方。 (5) 轰炸后，整个地区禁止公众通行。 (6) 会员表决不让妇女加入该俱乐部。 (7) 我不会阻止任何诚实的人到我家里来。
barbecue n.烤肉；烧烤；烤架 v.烤炙	(1) The sunshine bodes well for our barbecue. (2) The rain loused up the barbecue. (3) If you're not busy Sunday, we'd love to have you both over for a barbecue. (4) We can't calculate on having good weather for the barbecue. (5) I put another steak on the barbecue. (6) Now and then we like to barbecue chicken in the back yard.	(1) 明媚的阳光对我们的烤肉野餐是个吉兆。 (2) 下雨弄砸了烤肉野餐。 (3) 如果你周日有空，我们想请你们俩来吃烧烤。 (4) 我们不能指望着有好天气才去烧烤。 (5) 我在烤架上又放了一块肉排。 (6) 我们偶而会在后院子里烤鸡吃。

(3) The barber bought one of his brooms, and, when he had shaved him, asked for the price of it. (4) They sat in twos and threes on the trim barbered lawn.	(1) 理发师把我浓密的头发削薄了一些。 (2) 他父亲送他去当理发师的徒弟。 (3) 当理发师给他修完面后，问了一下扫帚的价钱。 (4) 他们三三两两地坐在修剪平整的草坪上。

(4) A bare word would be enough for me. (5) He bared his head. (6) The dog bared its teeth. (7) He bared his heart to the girl.	(1) 灼热的阳光炙烤着光秃秃的大地。 (2) 这男孩喜欢赤脚在沙滩上走。 (3) 这个小房间几乎没有什么家俱。 (4) 对我来说一句话就够了。 (5) 他脱掉了帽子。 (6) 狗露出了牙齿。 (7) 他向这个女孩吐露自己的真情。
bargain n.交易；便宜货；契约 v.讨价还价；议价；(谈价钱后)卖	(1) He made a satisfactory bargain with them. (2) If you promote our goods, we will give you a good discount as our part of the bargain. (3) She knows a bargain when she sees one. (4) There never was a better bargain driver. (5) They sealed their bargain by shaking hands. (6) The salesman refused to bargain over the price. (7) Bargain like a gypsy,but pay like a gentleman. (8) The leaders bargained away the freedom of their people.	(1) 他和他们做了一笔满意的交易。 (2) 若你方经销我们的货物，我方愿给予你相当大的优惠作为回报。 (3) 她有辨别便宜货的能力。 (4) 再没有比这更美好的契约。 (5) 他们握手表示确认交易契约。 (6) 推销员拒绝讨价还价。 (7) 议价时斤斤计较，付帐时爽快利落。 (8) 领导人拿人民的自由来做交易。
bark v.(狗)吠；咆哮 v.剥皮；擦伤 n.狗吠；咆哮 n.树皮	(1) The dog barked when the stranger came near. (2) An old dog does not bark for nothing. (3) When you speak to people, don't bark at them. (4) Some officers bark out their orders. (5) He barked his elbow on the wall. (6) Those trees have very beautiful white bark. (7) The bark of plane trees peels off regularly. (8) We found that birch bark could serve as paper.	(1) 当陌生人走近时，狗叫了起来。 (2) 老狗不会无事而吠。 (3) 当你和人说话时不要咆哮。 (4) 有些军官以粗暴的声音发布命令。 (5) 他碰到墙上，肘部擦破了皮。 (6) 那些树长着非常漂亮的白色树皮。 (7) 悬铃木的树皮到时候就脱落。 (8) 我们发现桦树皮可以作纸用。
barrier n.栅栏；障碍物；屏障	(1) The ice skater rammed into the barrier. (2) Heavy duties on imports and exports are a barrier to international trade. (3) The Sahara Desert is a natural barrier between north and central Africa.	(1) 溜冰者撞到护栏上了。 (2) 进出口的高关税是国际贸易的障碍。 (3) 撒哈拉沙漠是北非与中非之间的天然屏障。
basement n.根基；地下室	(1) Dam Monitoring Dam monitoring at a mountain water reservoir during the basement stablization. (2) The dampness in the basement damaged his books.	(1) 大坝监测水库大坝监测在根基稳定期间。 (2) 地下室的潮湿将他的书损坏了。
basic adj.基本的；基础的；初级的；含硅少的 n.基础；根本；[计]BASIC语言	(1) The family is the basic unit of society. (2) The right to work is a basic right of the citizens. (3) Food, clothing and shelter are all basic necessities of life. (4) Basic research is of great importance in all scientific fields. (5) We should give priority to the development of the basic industries. (6) All the people can be accessible to basic health care services in the future. (7) His research formed the basic of his new book. (8) BASIC is the language most programmers learn first.	(1) 家庭是社会的基本单位。 (2) 劳动权是公民的一项基本权利。 (3) 衣、 食、 住所是生活的基本必需品。 (4) 在各个科学领域里,基础研究是非常重要的。 (5) 我们要优先发展基础工业。 (6) 在将来能实现人人享有初级卫生保健服务。 (7) 他的研究成果构成了这本新书的基础。 (8) BASIC是大多数程序编制者首先学习的语言。
basin n.脸盆；盆地；流域；水池	(1) This basin is made of iron. (2) He washed his hands in a basin. (3) He first poured some water in the basin. (4) Wenshui lies in the west of Taiyuan Basin. (5) The whole river basin is covered with tropical forest. (6) If Iris is right, I just need to dip the necklace in the basin.	(1) 这个盆子是铁做的。 (2) 他在盆里洗了手。 (3) 他先在脸盆里倒了一些水。 (4) 文水位于太原盆地以西。 (5) 热带森林覆盖了整个河流流域。 (6) 假如伊莉丝是对的，我需要将项链浸在水池里。
basis n.基础；根据；基底	(1) His research formed the basis of his new book. (2) We drew this conclusion on the basis of experiments. (3) What basis do you have for saying that? (4) Rates of work are calculated on a weekly basis. (5) This country's heavy industry rests on a broad and firm base.	(1) 他的研究成果是他这本新书的基础。 (2) 我们是在试验的基础上得出这个结论的。 (3) 你那样说有什么根据啊? (4) 工资是以周为计算基准的. (5) 这个国家的重工业有广泛坚实的底子。

(5) Bats fly at night and feed on insects. (6) Green batted for two hours on the playground. (7) The cat batted the balloon with its paws. (8) He was trying to bat the flies away with his newspaper. (9) I'll be a big farmer before you can bat an eye! (10) He heard the bad news without batting an eyelid.	(1) 他只是用球棒擦击来球。 (2) 其他的男孩都想得到他的新球棒。 (3) 我想要买一个新网球拍。 (4) 球拍和球全被偷了。 (5) 蝙蝠在夜间飞行，以昆虫为食。 (6) 格林在赛场上执棒两小时。 (7) 猫用爪子击打气球。 (8) 他想用报纸把苍蝇打跑。 (9) 他说你只要眨眨眼，我就马上变成一个富裕的庄稼人！ (10) 他听到这个坏的消息丝毫没动声色(没贬眼睛)。
bath n.洗澡；浴室；沐浴；浴盆 v.洗澡 Bath. n.巴斯(英国城市)	(1) He takes a cold bath every day. (2) The idea came to him in his bath. (3) I want a double room with a bath. (4) After the bath, he took a walk in the yard. (5) The children like to have bubbles in their bath. (6) He was decorated with the Order of the Bath. (7) That sick personhas got a bath chair. (8) He will bath only after we fill the tub with toys.	(1) 他每天洗一个冷水澡。 (2) 他洗澡时想出了这个主意。 (3) 我要一间有浴室的双人房。 (4) 沐浴后，他在院子里散步。 (5) 孩子们喜欢浴盆里有肥皂泡。 (6) 他被授以巴斯勋章。 (7) 那个病人有一部巴斯轮椅。 (8) 他只有在我们在浴盆中装满玩具后才洗澡。

(4) Every room in the hotel has a private bathroom. (5) We'll have one room with a bathroom and one room without. (4) A captain commands a company or battery. (5) An enemy battery zeroed in on the crossroad. (6) He was guilty of assault and battery. (7) A battery is any act done intentionally. (4) Progress is slow but we keep battling on.	(1) 他在那场战斗中的英勇事迹为他赢得了永恒的荣誉。 (2) 他已在这场争斗中证明了自己的睿智。 (3) 他们与风浪搏斗。 (4) 进展虽慢
battleground n.战场；战地	(1) Sex, typically, was one battleground. (2) In the battleground,there is no place for hope.	(1) 两性问题是一个典型的战场。 (2) 在战场上，没有所谓希望的地方。
bay n.海湾；月桂树；隔间；犬吠；【计】机架，底板 vi.嗥叫；哀号 adj.红棕色	(1) Sunlight shimmers on the waters of the bay. (2) We can see a magical view over the calm water of the bay from our window. (3) In the milk was a bay leaf, a few slices of onion. (4) In the library, the books on history are all kept in one bay. (5) There is a storage bay in the house. (6) We heard the distant bay of the hounds. (7) He is baying at the moon. (8) I heard the baying cry of a wolf. (9) It takes us a great deal of money to bay this new house.	(1) 阳光在海湾的水面上闪烁。 (2) 从我们的窗户里可以看到海湾里平静海水的迷人景色。 (3) 牛奶中也有一片月桂树叶和几片洋葱。 (4) 在图书馆里，历史方面的书都放在同一隔间里。 (5) 屋内有一个隔开的储藏间。 (6) 我们听到远处一群猎犬的吠声。 (7) 他朝着月亮吠叫。 (8) 我听过狼的哀嚎。 (9) 买这套新房子花掉我们很多钱。
beam vi.微笑；发光 vt.播送；发射；用梁支撑 n.桁条；光线；(光线的)束；(横)梁	(1) She beamed at me. (2) His face(He) is beaming with delight. (3) From a sky of untarnished blue the sun beamed down upon Beijing. (4) Television began beaming the national nominating conventions into the homes of Americans. (5) This is a programme beamed at Japan. (6) I beamed my flashlight into the corner and saw a mouse. (7) The transmitter will be beamed at Africa. (8) A rotary table helps to optimize the beam incidence angle. (9) A through beam illuminated the dark road ahead. (10) A ns pulse beam device is installed at pulse beam current piping. (11) He struck the beam with his head. (12) If you hit your head on that beam,you'll know it.	(1) 她对我微笑。 (2) 他高兴得笑容满面。 (3) 阳光透过万里碧空照耀着北京城。 (4) 电视开始向美国家庭播放总统候选人全国提名大会的情况。 (5) 这是对日本广播的节目。 (6) 我把手电照向墙角,看见一只老鼠。 (7) 这台发射机将用于对非洲广播。 (8) 一张旋转的桌子有助于将光线影响之方式角最佳化。 (9) 一束透射光照亮了前方黑暗的道路。 (10) 在脉冲束流管道上安装有强流毫微秒脉冲化聚束装置。 (11) 他的头撞到梁上了。 (12) 头要是撞到梁上去了，就有你的好受。
bean n.豆；豆科植物	(1) Cocoa bean is used to make some kinds of drink. (2) A bean grows rapidly. (3) The bean plant is cultivated for animal fodder.	(1) 可可豆用于制作一些饮料。 (2) 豆类植物生长很快。 (3) 种植豆科植物可以用来当动物饲料。
beancurd n.豆腐	(1) I would also suggest Beancurd with pepper and chili sauce. (2) I think Mapo beancurd and shredded meat in chilli sauce are quite special.	(1) 我还建议您点个麻婆豆腐。 (2) 我觉得麻婆豆腐和鱼香肉丝味道不错。
beard n.胡须 vt.公开反对；抓住胡须	(1) Why don't you shave your beard off? (2) To my great amusement his false beard fell off. (3) He thought I was not brave enough to beard him, but he was wrong because I did it. (4) He bearded his boss and demanded an explanation.	(1) 你怎麽不把胡子刮掉? (2) 使我感到极其好笑的是他的假胡子掉下来了。 (3) 他以为我没有那么大勇气向他挑战，但是他错了，我就这么做了。 (4) 他公然蔑视上司，并要求他作出解释。
beast n.兽；畜牲	(1) The lion is called the king of beasts. (2) The hunters blocked up the hole of the beast. (3) He put the beast out and headed home.	(1) 狮子号称百兽之王。 (2) 猎人堵住了兽穴。 (3) 他把这只畜牲丢下，掉头就回家。
beauty n.美人；美丽；美的东西	(1) Beauty's tears are lovelier than her smile. (2) His wife is an unmatched beauty. (3) Words cannot describe the beauty of the scene. (4) The beauty of the scene filled us with enchantment. (5) This bird cannot be paralled for beauty. (6) The beauty of living in California is that the weather is so good. (7) You have no feeling for the beauty of nature.	(1) 美人的泪水比微笑更可爱。 (2) 他妻子是一个倾国倾城的美人。 (3) 语言难以描述那景色之美丽。 (4) 我们被美丽的景色迷住了。 (5) 这鸟的美丽是无与伦比的。 (6) 在加利福尼亚居住的好处就在于气候宜人。 (7) 你对大自然的美缺乏欣赏力。
bedclothes n.铺盖；床单被褥类	(1) The child burrowed under the bedclothes. (2) She crept in beside him under the bedclothes. (3) The bedclothes were tumbled as though the bed had been slept in.	(1) 那孩子在被窝里钻来钻去。 (2) 她钻进被窝，躺在他身旁。 (3) 床上的被褥都弄乱了，好像有人睡过觉。
beddings 垫料	(1) The brook warbled over its rocky bed. (2) She rushed off to work leaving her bed unmade. (3) A mosquito netting completely surrounds our bed. (4) It was hard work getting the children off to bed. (5) I threw off my clothes and tumbled into bed. (6) I usually go to bed at half past ten.	(1) 小溪潺潺流过多石的河床。 (2) 她匆忙去上班连床都没铺好。 (3) 一顶蚊帐把我们的床完全围住了。 (4) 哄孩子们去睡可不是容易的事。 (5) 我脱掉衣服倒在床上便睡了。 (6) 我通常十点半睡觉。
bee n.蜜蜂 n.集会	(1) A bee pricks the skin with its sting. (2) He can hear the hum of the bee in the garden.	(1) 蜜蜂用螫针刺皮肤。 (2) 他听得见花园里蜜蜂的嗡嗡声。
beehive n.蜂箱	(1) We're just about to kick a beehive. (2) Tokyo is a human beehive of a city. (3) The dog stared at the beehive, barked, and wanted to climb up the tree.	(1) 我们就要捅马蜂窝了。 (2) 东京是个像蜂窝般人囗集中而热闹的都市。 (3) 这只狗一直望着那个蜂箱，狂吠着，想爬上树去。
behalf n.代表；利益；方面	(1) The agent spoke on behalf of his principal. (2) On behalf of my colleagues and myself I thank you. (3) He agreed to testify on behalf of the accused man. (4) I put up the proposal on your behalf. (5) I made all these troubles in your behalf. (6) I intervened on her behalf to try to get the decision changed. (7) Jim gave the vote of thanks on behalf of the fellowship. (8) They threatened to become distressed sellers of large volumes of debt securities where they had been the biggest investors or had held assets on behalf of others.	(1) 代理人代表他的委托人说话。 (2) 我代表我的同事和我本人向你表示感谢。 (3) 他同意为被告作证。 (4) 我是为你的利益才提出这个建议的。 (5) 我是为了你才找这么多麻烦的。 (6) 我为她力争，以求改变决定。 (7) 在团体的利益方面，吉姆鼓掌表示感谢。 (8) 它们威胁称，有可能被迫抛售大量债券，它们要么是这些债券的最大投资者，要么代表其它方面持有这些资产。
behave v.表现；行为；举止	(1) How is your new car behaving? (2) I'll trust you to behave responsibly while I'm out. (3) If you behave like that, you'll get yourself disliked. (4) It's hard to train children to behave well at the table. (5) I do not think it's proper for you to behave so.	(1) 你的新车性能如何？ (2) 我相信你在我外出期间会认真办事的。 (3) 如果你的行为那样，你会让人厌恶的。 (4) 培养儿童用餐时举止得体是很困难的。 (5) 我认为您这样的举止不合体统。
behaviour n.行为；举止；品行 =behavior<美>	(1) Such behaviour is beneath contempt. (2) What comments have you about my son's behaviour? (3) I could not endure the insolence of his behaviour. (4) His friendly behaviour was a cloak for his evil intentions. (5) We are surprised by his scandalous behaviour. (6) All of us like her for her beneficent behaviour.	(1) 这种行为令人不齿。 (2) 你对我儿子的行为有什么意见？ (3) 我不能再忍受他那傲慢无礼的行为了。 (4) 他的友好行为不过是他险恶用心的伪装。 (5) 我们很震惊他那令人反感的举止。 (6) 因为她友善的品行，我们每个人都喜欢她。
being n.存在；人；生物；本质	(1) I don't like being pent up in the house all the time. (2) It is fun eating by stealth without being found. (3) Earthenware has an advantage over wood in being more easily kept clean. (4) I have a feeling that we are being followed. (5) The ship was in imminent peril of being wrecked. (6) I detest violence with my whole being. (7) When did the world come into being? (8) What is the purpose of our being?	(1) 我不喜欢整天给关在屋子里。 (2) 偷吃而不被人发现很有趣。 (3) 陶器的优点在于比木器更容易保持清洁。 (4) 我有种感觉我们正被人跟踪。 (5) 那条船马上就有失事的危险。 (6) 我毕生谴责暴力行为。 (7) 世界是什么时候形成的？ (8) 我们生存的目的是什么？
Belgium n.比利时[欧洲]	(1) The site of the battle of Waterloo is in Belgium. (2) Belgium has been called the cockpit of Europe. (3) We travelled through France and Belgium. (4) Belgium is not so large as France.	(1) 滑铁卢战役的遗址在比利时。 (2) 比利时被称作欧洲战场。 (3) 我们走遍了法国和比利时。 (4) 比利时没有法国那么大。
belief n.信念；信仰；相信	(1) It bolstered my belief. (2) He acted in accordance with his beliefs. (3) His belief of communism is immovable. (4) His firmness on his belief supported him in difficulties. (5) There was a happy chime of belief and practice in everything she said. (6) He has lost his belief in God. (7) The story of his miseries is beyond my belief.	(1) 这增强了我的信念。 (2) 他按照自己的信念行事。 (3) 他坚定不移地信仰共产主义。 (4) 困境中，他坚定的信仰支撑着他。 (5) 她所说的每一件事都体现了信仰和行动的完美和谐。 (6) 他已不相信上帝了。 (7) 他的悲惨身世令人难以置信。
bell n.钟；铃；门铃；钟声；钟状物 vt.敲钟；使象钟状地张开 vi.使呈钟状；张开	(1) The church bell tolled the hour. (2) I was roused by the sound of the bell this morning. (3) I was too preoccupied to hear the bell. (4) The church bell calls up my wedding day. (5) The young monk clangs the bell every morning. (6) Lots of bell ringers were killed by lightning. (7) The thief got flurried,thinking that it was too bad to have produced the crashiing sound which would himself on the bell,trying to muffle the crashing sound with his arms.	(1) 教堂的鸣钟报时。 (2) 今天早晨，我被铃声唤醒。 (3) 当时我出神地想着心事，没有听见门铃响。 (4) 教堂的钟声使我想起了我结婚的那天。 (5) 年幼的和尚每天早晨当当地敲钟。 (6) 许多敲钟人被闪电击毙。 (7) 他心里一急，身子一下子扑到了钟上，张开双臂想捂住钟声，可钟声又怎么捂得住呢！
belly n.腹部 v.膨胀	(1) My belly is empty. (2) A hungry belly has no ears. (3) The robber stabbed the young man in the belly. (4) The boat carried with much cargo in its belly. (5) The belly of the animal is covered in long piercing spikes. (6) The sails bellied in the wind.	(1) 我肚子饿了。 (2) 人肚子饿了就听不进道理。 (3) 强盗刺伤了这名年轻人的腹部。 (4) 该船的舱里载了很多的货物。 (5) 这种动物的腹部长满了锋利的长刺。 (6) 帆在风中鼓得满满的。
belong vi.应归入；属于	(1) The daffodil belongs to the genus Narcissus. (2) Those documents belong with the sale report. (3) These boots belong in the closet. (4) What party do you belong to? (5) That dictionary belongs to me. (6) You and I belong to different political camps. (7) All these houses belong to the people's commune.	(1) 黄水仙是水仙属植物。 (2) 那些文件归入销售报告。 (3) 这些靴子应搁在壁橱里。 (4) 你属于哪一党派？ (5) 那本字典是属于我的。 (6) 你和我属于不同的政治阵营。 (7) 这些房子都是属于人民公社的。
belt n.腰带；带状物；地带；皮带 vt.用皮带抽打；用带系上；用带标示 vi.疾驰；大声歌唱	(1) He has a brown belt in karate. (2) A belt of trees grew between the two fields. (3) As Indonesia lies in the volcanic belt, earthquakes can occur. (4) My trousers only stay up if I wear a belt. (5) He strapped the driver with a leather belt. (6) The air hostess asked everyone to belt himself in. (7) They went belting along the road.	(1) 他有一条空手道的棕腰带。（他是空手道茶带） (2) 两块田之间有一条树木带。 (3) 由于印尼位于火山地带,因此有发生地震的可能。 (4) 我这条裤子要是不系皮带就往下掉。 (5) 他用皮带抽打司机。 (6) 空中小姐要求大家扣好安全带。 (7) 他们沿着马路疾驰而去。
bench n.长凳；工作台；法官	(1) This bench is made of elm. (2) An old man sat on the park bench and fed the pigeon. (3) A young woman, of sullen aspect, was sitting alone on the bench. (4) I'm glad the new trainee is keen but I wish he'd stop hanging around my bench and getting in my hair. (5) The bench read the sentence to the criminal. (6) She has recently been appointed to the bench.	(1) 这条长凳是榆木制的。 (2) 一位老人坐在公园的长凳上喂鸽子。 (3) 一个面色忧郁的年轻女人独自坐在长凳上。 (4) 新来的受训者很敏捷，我很满意，不过我希望他别再我工作台周围闲荡，使我觉得烦恼。 (5) 法官向罪犯宣读了判决。 (6) 她最近当上了法官。
bend v.弯曲；使弯曲；屈服；屈从；集中于 n.弯曲；弯道	(1) The branches bent in the wind. (2) The branch bent but didn't break when the boy climbed along it. (3) They refused to bend to the hijackers' demands. (4) She can't bend him to her will. (5) He could not bend his mind to his studies . (6) The stream takes a sudden bend to the east. (7) There is a sharp bend in the road here.	(1) 树枝被风吹弯了。 (2) 那男孩爬上树枝时，树枝弯曲了，但是没有折断。 (3) 他们拒绝屈从于劫机者的要求。 (4) 她无法使他服从自己的意志。 (5) 他不能专心于他的功课。 (6) 小溪突然转向东流。 (7) 这段路上有一处急转弯。
beneath prep.在 ... 之下；被...覆盖；低于...；不值得 adv.在下方；在底下	(1) They found the body buried beneath a pile of leaves. (2) The earth lay beneath a blanket of snow. (3) He is beneath his brother intellectually. (4) Such behaviour is beneath contempt. (5) He shrugged off my criticism as though it was beneath his notice. (6) Her careful make-up hid the signs of age beneath. (7) We looked down from the plane at the fields spread out beneath.	(1) 他们在一堆树叶下面发现了那具尸体。 (2) 大地被厚厚的白雪覆盖。 (3) 他在智力方面不如他兄弟。 (4) 这种行为令人不齿。 (5) 他不理睬我的批评,好像我的批评不值得他一顾似的。 (6) 她的精心化妆掩饰了脂粉下面岁月刻下的痕迹。 (7) 我们从飞机上俯瞰下面一片片的土地。
beneficial adj.有利的；有益的	(1) It's a beneficial result to us. (2) Word of mouth advertising is the most beneficial. (3) Calcium is beneficial to our bones. (4) Fresh air is beneficial to our health.	(1) 对我们来说那是有利的结果。 (2) 口碑广告是最有利的。 (3) 钙对我们的骨骼有益。 (4) 新鲜空气有益于健康。
benefit n.利益；津贴；义演；保险金；借助 vt.有益于；得益	(1) It was for the benefit of your company that we did that. (2) Applications for unemployment benefits dropped last month. (3) A benefit performance will be held tonight. (4) The unemployed are entitled to receive other unemployment insurance benefits during the period of receiving unemployment insurance compensation. (5) It was achieved with the benefit of modern technology. (6) The new hospital will benefit the entire community. (7) A large number of students will benefit from the new teaching method.	(1) 我们这样做都是为了你们公司的利益。 (2) 上个月申请失业津贴的人数下降了。 (3) 今晚有义演。 (4) 失业人员在领取失业保险金期间,按照规定同时享受其他失业保险待遇。 (5) 借助现代技术,这个目标已经达到。 (6) 新医院将有益于整个社区。 (7) 多数学生将从这个新的教学方法中得益。
bent bend的过去式和过去分词. adj.下定决心的；弯曲的 n.嗜好	(1) He's bent on completing his essay. (2) She is bent on becoming a film star when she grows up. (3) Just as the twig is bent, the tree is inclined. (4) The bent strip can straighten up by itself. (5) He has a bent for art.	(1) 他决心要写完他的随笔。 (2) 她一心想长大后当一名影星。 (3) 弯曲的树苗长成弯曲的树。 (4) 这弯曲的金属片能自己变直。 (5) 他生性爱好艺术。
besides prep.除 ... 之外 adv.此外；也	(1) No one writes to me besides you. (2) There will be five of us for dinner, besides John. (3) He has been to Mexico but nowhere besides. (4) He gave me a book,a pen and some money besides. (5) I haven't time to see the film besides, it had dreadful reviews.	(1) 除你以外，没有人给我写信。 (2) 除约翰外，还有我们五个人要一起吃饭。 (3) 他曾去过墨西哥但没去过别的地方。 (4) 他给我一本书，一支钢笔，此外还给一些钱。 (5) 我没有时间去看这部影片--再说，影评也诸多贬斥。
betray vt.背叛；出卖；泄露；显露	(1) He betrayed his country. (2) He promised never to betray the organization. (3) He was seduced to betray his friend. (4) As long as you don't betray me, I'll do whatever you ask me to. (5) A friend does not betray confidences. (6) His accent betrayed the fact that he was foreign. (7) The smoke from cooking betrayed the presence of the enemy.	(1) 他背叛了他的国家。 (2) 他发誓永不背叛组织。 (3) 他受唆使而出卖朋友。 (4) 只要你不出卖我,要我做什么我都愿意。 (5) 朋友是不会泄露秘密的 (6) 他的口音显露出他是外国人。 (7) 炊烟暴露了敌人的存在。
beyond prep.超出；远于；除 ... 之外；超出…之外 adv.在更远处；另外 n.远处；来世	(1) The level of inflation has gone beyond 8%. (2) Such philosophical subtleties are beyond my reach. (3) The scenery there was beautiful beyond expression. (4) He's got nothing beyond his state pension. (5) I don't notice anything beyond his rather strange accent. (6) They crossed the mountains and travelled to the valleys beyond. (7) The immediate future is clear, but it's hard to tell what lies beyond. (8) Another unidentified source, seen below the galactic plane, is likely beyond the boundaries of the Milky Way. (9) The localisation extends beyond a Swedish language poker client, with Party Poker additionally offering full Swedish-speaking support. (10) In future, men can travel to the moon and beyond. (11) What can we know of the beyond?	(1) 通货膨胀率已经超过了8%。 (2) 这种深奥的哲理我可无法理解。 (3) 那儿的风景美丽得无法形容。 (4) 除了国家发的养老金，他一无所有。 (5) 除了他那颇为古怪的口音以外,我没注意到别的。 (6) 他们越过群山，到了那边的山谷。 (7) 近期内的情况很清楚,但很难说以后如何。 (8) 另外一个处在银河盘面下方的未被命名的伽马源，大概在银河系的边界之外。 (9) 本地化延伸超越瑞典语扑克客户端，与党扑克另外提供充分讲瑞典语的支持。 (10) 未来人们能到月球或更远处去旅行。 (11) 我们对来世能知道些什么呢？
bicycle n.自行车 vi.骑自行车	(1) Can you ride a bicycle? (2) He beguiled me into lending him my bicycle. (3) Every day he rode his old bicycle to his office. (4) You can coast downhill on a bicycle. (5) I saw him make by the gate on his bicycle.	(1) 你会骑自行车吗？ (2) 他骗我把自行车借给了他。 (3) 每天他骑着他那辆旧自行车去上班。 (4) 你可以骑自行车滑下坡。 (5) 我看见他骑自行车从大门旁边过去了。
bid v.（买方）出价；投标；吩咐；叫牌 n.出价；努力；叫牌	(1) She bid 500 for the painting. (2) Several firms have bid for the contract to build the new concert hall. (3) Several companies are bidding for the contract to build the bridge. (4) Do as you are bidden. (5) I bid two hearts. (6) He made a bid of 50 for a painting. (7) A bid higher than another bid. (8) He failed in his bid to reach the summit. (9) It's your bid next.	(1) 她喊价500买这幅画。 (2) 有几家公司投标，争取建造新音乐厅的合同。 (3) 有几家公司在投标争取承包建桥工程。 (4) 按照吩咐你的去做。 (5) 我叫两红心。 (6) 他为一幅画出价50英镑。 (7) 过高的出价比其它的价高的出价 (8) 他攀登顶峰未能成功. (9) 轮到你叫牌了。

(4) Her voice took on a sudden bitter note. (5) His story brought back our bitter past . (6) The bitter quarrel ended their friendship. (7) He is bitter in his condemnation of terrorism. (8) It has stopped snowing, but there's a bitter cold wind. (9) Green tea, unlike black tea, has not been oxidized and can easily turn bitter if not made properly. (10) The star is called Wormwood, and a third of the waters was turned into wormwood and many people died because of the water which had turned bitter. (11) He has tasted the sweets and bitters of life. (12) I like the coffee to taste a little bitter. (13) In the past, however, most medicines were very bitter tasting.	(1) 这药有苦味。 (2) 那次失败是一次难以吞咽的苦果。 (3) 她为失去了她的情人而流下痛苦的眼泪。 (4) 她的声音带着一股出意料的辛酸语气。 (5) 他的事使我们想起辛酸的往事。 (6) 那场激烈的争吵结束了他的友谊。 (7) 他言辞激烈地谴责恐怖主义。 (8) 已经停止下雪啦,不过,还刮着刺骨的寒风。 (9) 绿茶与红茶不同，没有经过发酵氧化，如果处理不当很容易发涩变苦。 (10) 于是水的三分之一变成苦的，许多人因水变苦了而死去。 (11) 他已尝遍了人生的甜酸苦辣。 (12) 我喜欢喝起来有点苦的咖啡。 (13) 然而，在过去，大部分的药都是非常苦的。

boom n.繁荣；兴旺；激增；低沉声 n.帆杠；吊杆；支臂；尾桁；水栅 vi.急速增长；发出低沉声 vt.使兴旺；促进	(1) He made his pile during the property boom. (2) The oil market is enjoying a boom. (3) City growth far outran the general population boom. (4) We heard the sonic boom of a jet overhead. (5) The boom swung over the deck. (6) Please swing the boom overside. (7) The long boom of the crane functions like our arms. (8) The boom of the airplane was damaged. (9) Business is booming. (10) The tower clock boomed out twelve. (11) Foreign investments boomed the city. (12) This boom in adult education, in turn, helps to raise the intellectual standard of the whole country. (13) The entente, which has brought better communications with Spain, has helped to fuel the boom.	(1) 在房地产生意兴隆期间他发了大财。 (2) 石油市场欣欣向荣。 (3) 城市的发展大大超过总的人口激增。 (4) 我们听见头顶上飞机发出轰鸣声。 (5) 帆杠在甲板上转动。 (6) 请把吊杆甩到外档。 (7) 起重机的长臂与我们的手臂功能相同。 (8) 飞机的尾桁受到损害。 (9) 商业正日趋繁荣。 (10) 塔楼上的大钟沉重地敲了十二下。 (11) 国外投资使这个城市迅速繁荣起来。 (12) 而成人教育热反过来又促进了整个国家文化水平的提高。 (13) 那项协议使得与西班牙的联系得到加强，这有助于促进当地的经济繁荣。
booth n.货摊；电话亭；小间	(1) Would you please watch over my booth? (2) I'll give him a call from the phone booth on the corner. (3) It happened that there was a telephone booth nearby. (4) They sat in a corner booth, away from other diners.	(1) 请您照料一下我的摊位好吗? (2) 我到街角的电话亭给他打个电话。 (3) 碰巧在附近有个公用电话亭。 (4) 他们坐在餐厅角落的小隔间里，与别的就餐者分开。
telephone booth 电话亭	(1) The car dashed against a telephone booth. (2) He banged into a telephone booth and hurt his leg. (3) It happened that there was a telephone booth nearby. (4) There is a telephone booth near the cinema.	(1) 那车子猛地撞在一间电话亭上。 (2) 他撞在了一个电话亭上，伤了腿。 (3) 碰巧在附近有个公用电话亭。 (4) 电影院附近有一个电话亭。
border n.边界；边境；边缘 vt.与 ... 接壤；加边于 vi.近似；毗邻	(1) We have a herbaceous border round our garden. (2) A series of provocations led up to the border war. (3) Enemy troops raided our border areas. (4) I lost a white handkerchief with a blue border. (5) France borders Germany along parts of the Rhine. (6) Some of his statements are so incorrect that they border on fraudulence. (7) Our garden is bordered on one side by a stream.	(1) 我们的花园四周种有草本植物。 (2) 一系列的挑衅事件导致了边境战争的发生。 (3) 敌军对我边境地区进行袭击。 (4) 我丢了一块带蓝色花边的白手绢。 (5) 法国沿莱茵河部分河段与德国接壤。 (6) 他的某些说法非常不正确以致近乎欺诈。 (7) 我们的花园有一边以小河为界。
bored adj.无聊的；厌烦的；郁闷的	(1) Some people use their teisure for such activities because they are lonely or bored. (2) He is a bored student.	(1) 有些人因为寂寞或无聊,才利用闲暇时间从事这些活动。 (2) 他是一位感到厌烦的学生。
boss n.老板；上司；首脑 v.管理；指挥	(1) My boss is a football fan. (2) He was fired by his boss. (3) He is my sometime boss. (4) Bob liked to boss the young man about. (5) Don't boss me around! What do you take me for?	(1) 我的上司是一位足球迷。 (2) 他被他的老板解雇了。 (3) 他是我从前的上司。 (4) 鲍伯喜爱对那位年轻人发号施令。 (5) 别把我使唤来使唤去的!你当我是什么?
botanical adj.植物学的；植物的 n.植物制剂	(1) My botanical interest is largely confined to the reproductive processes in vascular plants. (2) De Bary abandoned a career in medicine in Frankfurt to devote the rest of his life to his botanical studies, becoming professor of botany at a number of German universities. (3) My botanical interest is largely confined to the reproductive processes in vascular plants.	(1) 我对植物学的兴趣主要限于维管植物的生殖过程。 (2) 它放弃了在法兰克福医学的研究转向植物学的研究，后来成为好几所德国大学的植物学教授。 (3) 我对植物学的兴趣主要限于维管植物的生殖过程。
botany n.植物学；植物	(1) To what degree are you interested in botany? (2) In learning botany, I understand much about nature. (3) Botany deals with the study of plants. (4) He taught Irene botany and natural history.	(1) 你对植物学的兴趣达到什么程度？ (2) 学习植物学使我对大自然了解了许多。 (3) 植物学论述植物的研究。 (4) 他教绮瑞娜认识植物和学习自然史。
bottom n.底部；底端 adj.底部的 v.触底；打(基础)	(1) There are tea leaves in the bottom of my cup. (2) They sent the enemy ship to the bottom of the sea. (3) He was always bottom of the class in maths. (4) Put your books on the bottom shelf. (5) There is no sign that the recession has bottomed out yet. (6) We wanted to bottom our plan on a solid basis.	(1) 我的杯底有茶叶。 (2) 他们把敌舰击沉。 (3) 他的数学成绩在班上总是垫底。 (4) 把你的书放在最下层的架子上. (5) 没有迹象表明萧条已经到了极点。 (6) 我们想把我们的计划建立在牢固的基础上。
bounce vi.弹起；重新恢复；退票 vt.使弹起；解雇；驱逐 n.弹跳；弹力；活力	(1) The ball hit the wall and bounced off it. (2) She's had many misfortunes in her life but she always bounces back. (3) He is young enough to bounce back from this disappointment. (4) I hope this cheque doesn't bounce. (5) I bounced the baby on my knee. (6) After starting a fight, he was bounced from the pub. (7) The volleyball gave a high bounce. (8) There's not much bounce left in these balls. (9) She came back full of confidence and bounce.	(1) 球打在墙上又反弹回来。 (2) 她一生中经历过许多挫折，然而总是能重新振作起来。 (3) 他很年轻，能够从这次挫折中恢复过来。 (4) 我希望这张支票别遭退票 (5) 我把婴儿放在膝上上下颠着。 (6) 在打架闹事後,他被酒廊逐出来。 (7) 排球高高地弹起来。 (8) 这些球已没有多少弹性了。 (9) 她回来了,充满了自信和活力。
bound adj.必定的；有义务的；受约束的；装订的 vi.跳；跳跃前进；猛涨 n.跳跃；范围；界限 动词bind的过去式和过去分词形式	(1) It's bound to rain soon. (2) You are not legally bound to answer these questions. (3) He bought a bound volume of the magazine. (4) The dog bounded down the hill. (5) Polly came bounding into the room holding a letter. (6) He predicted that the stock market would be sure to bound ahead. (7) With one bound, he was over the wall. (8) He reached popularity at a bound, while still a youth. (9) I will try my best within the bound of my abilities. (10) There are no bounds to his ambition.	(1) 过一会儿肯定会下雨。 (2) 在法律上，你没有义务非回答这些问题不可。 (3) 他买了一本该杂志的合订本。 (4) 狗跳跃着朝山下跑去。 (5) 波利手上拿着一封信,蹦蹦跳跳地跑进了房间。 (6) 他预测股市肯定会一路猛涨。 (7) 他纵身一跃就跳过了墙。 (8) 当他还很年轻的时候,就一举成名了。 (9) 我将在我的能力范围内竭尽全力。 (10) 他的野心是无止境的。
boundary n.边界；分界线	(1) We crossed the state boundary at midnight. (2) They marked the boundaries of the football fields. (3) Scientists continue to push back the boundaries of knowledge. (4) The lane is the boundary of our land from theirs. (5) The fence marks the boundary between my land and hers.	(1) 我们在午夜穿过了州界。 (2) 他们画出了足球场地的边界。 (3) 科学家不断地把知识领域的边缘向外扩展。 (4) 那条小路就是我们这片地与他们那片地的分界线。 (5) 这道栅栏是我的地和她的地的分界线。
bow n.弓；鞠躬礼；蝴蝶结；船头 v.鞠躬；致敬；压弯	(1) At that time, people hunt with bows and arrows. (2) He moved aside for her with a polite bow. (3) She has a dress decorated with bows. (4) The yacht hit a rock and damaged her bows. (5) The cast bowed as the audience applauded. (6) Every one bowed as the Queen walked into the room. (7) Those branches were bowed down by the snow on them.	(1) 在那时,人们以弓﹑ 箭行猎。 (2) 他礼貌地鞠躬，退避一旁让她过去。 (3) 她有一条饰有蝴蝶结的连衣裙。 (4) 游艇碰上了礁石，撞坏了船头。 (5) 演员们向鼓掌的观众鞠躬。 (6) 女王走进房间时，每个人都鞠躬致敬。 (7) 那些树枝被覆盖着的积雪压弯了.

(4) We are determined to boycott them. (5) The union called on its members to boycott the meeting.	(1) 他呼吁所有民众联手抵制韩国货。 (2) 我们抵制用动物做产品实验。 (3) 我们抵制某国货，因为他伤了我们的面子。 (4) 我们决定拒绝跟他们来往。 (5) 工会号召其会员拒绝参加会议。

(4) She has a good brain. (5) You need brains to become a university professor. (6) He is one of the leading brains in the country. (7) Brain is the master control center of the body. (8) The medulla oblongata is the most vital part of the brain because it contains centers controlling breathing and heart functioning. (9) I'll brain you if you don't keep quiet.	(1) 这种药可能会引起永久性的脑部伤害。 (2) 他的大脑看起来功能正常。 (3) 他的脑子里充满空想和梦幻。 (4) 她很有头脑。 (5) 当大学教授要有才智。 (6) 他是国家的知识分子精英。 (7) 脑是身体的主要控制中心。 (8) 延髓是大脑最重要的部分，因为它包含着呼吸和心脏功能的控制中心。 (9) 如果你不保持安静的话，我就敲你的脑袋。

(4) The car in front of me stopped suddenly and I had to brake. (5) The driver braked his car suddenly.	(1) 制动器太松了，需要调紧。 (2) 刹车不灵了。 (3) 很多的维修费用都花在了更换煞车方面。 (4) 我前面那辆小汽车突然停住，我只好刹车。 (5) 司机突然煞车。

(7) Follow the main road until it branches, and then turn to the right. (8) She's leaving the company to branch out on her own. (2) You may personalize the design to match your company's existing brand identity and design specifications. (3) The advertising manager may set as a goal for advertising an increase of 15 percent in consumer brand awareness in the next six months. (4) She's gone over to a milder brand of cigarettes. (5) He has his own brand of humor. (6) The ceiling is pasted with labels of liquor brand . (7) Those who have triumphantly withstood such strains may brand his name. (8) It's unfair to brand all football fans as troublemakers. (9) Cowboys round up their cattle in the spring time to brand the new calves.	(1) 作为新旧两个时代交替期的作家,塞万提斯身上不可避免地带有两个时代的烙印。 (2) 您也可以进行个性化设计,使其符合公司的现有商标与设计规范。 (3) 广告经理确定的目标为:在今后的6个月里，通过广告，提高消费者商标知晓率的15%25。 (4) 她已改吸另一牌子味道较淡的香烟。 (5) 他有他独特的幽默感。 (6) 天花板上贴了许多酒类商标。 (7) 那些成功地经受了严峻考验的人们或许会污辱他的名声。 (8) 把所有的球迷都当成闹事者是不公平的。 (9) 牛仔们在春天时把牛赶拢在一起，给新生下来的看犊打上印记。

(4) They visited all the braveries of the city. (5) She came to the party in all the bravery of her new dress. (4) The medical breakthrough proves that guzzling ale is not the only reason why men develop saggy stomachs. (4) They had chicken breast for supper. (5) His head sank forward on his breast. (6) Who is the first to breast the tape? breath n.呼吸；气息	(1) He caught his breath in surprise. (2) His chest heaves with every breath. (3) It took us a few minutes to get our breath back after the race. (4) His breath smelt suspiciously of drink. (5) The delicious breath of rain was in the air.	(1) 他惊奇得屏住了呼吸。 (2) 他的胸部随着呼吸而起伏。 (3) 赛跑后我们用了好几分钟才恢复了正常呼吸。 (4) 他嘴里呼出的气息好象有酒味。 (5) 空中弥漫着清新的雨的气息。
breathless adj.喘不过气来的	(1) Bob was breathless with excitement. (2) I was completely breathless when I got to the top of the mountain. (3) The children are breathless as they watch the tightrope act.	(1) Bob激动得喘不过气来. (2) 当我到达山顶上时，我已经上气不接下气了。 (3) 孩子们在看走绳索表演时呼吸都屏住了。

(4) He bought a brick of cheese and a bottle of wine. (5) All the windows were bricked up.	(1) 他的新房子是他自己一块砖一块砖砌起来的。 (2) 她丈夫是个砌砖匠。 (3) 那次集会时，他的头部被一块砖头击中。 (4) 他买了一块乳酪和一瓶葡萄酒。 (5) 所有的窗户都用砖堵住了。
bride n.新娘	(1) The bride wore a beautiful white dress. (2) We must drink to the health of the bride. (3) The bride brought many dowries to her husband. (4) The bride was given away by her father. (5) I suppose we shall be having some sort of celebration for the bride.	(1) 新娘穿了一身美丽的白色礼服。 (2) 我们要为新娘的健康干杯。 (3) 新娘带着很多嫁妆给她丈夫。 (4) 由父亲把新娘交与新郎。 (5) 我想我们还是来为新娘庆贺一番吧。
