brief adj.短暂的；短期的；简短的；扼要的 n.摘要；案件陈述 vt.作…的概述；（向…）简单介绍	(1) There was a brief pause in the conversation. (2) We have a tight schedule for your brief visit. I hope you don't mind. (3) In the beginning, the teacher gave us a brief introduction about the subject. (4) I don't want to keep you long, so let me be brief. (5) He drew up a brief for his speech. (6) The lawyers declared on a court brief that they will argue Mr. Brown's innocence by reason of insanity. (7) The chairman will brief the Board on the most recent developments.	(1) 对话中有短暂的停顿。 (2) 对您短暂的访问,我们为您安排的日程很紧,希望您不介意。 (3) 开始时,老师给我们做了关于这门课程的简短介绍。 (4) 我不想浪费大家的时间,就简明扼要地讲几句吧。 (5) 他起草了一份讲话的摘要。 (6) 律师们在呈交法庭的辩护状上声明,他们将以神经错乱为由为布朗先生作无罪辩护。 (7) 主席将向董事会概述最近的发展。
brilliant adj.卓越的；灿烂的；美妙的；杰出的；才华横溢的 n.宝石	(1) He has got brilliant achievements in the field of physics. (2) The brilliant sun lit up their rooms. (3) The novel is considered a brilliant performance. (4) She's brilliant but self-effacing.	(1) 他在物理学方面已经取得了卓越的成就。 (2) 灿烂的阳光照亮了他们的屋子。 (3) 这部小说被认为是出色的佳作。 (4) 她才华横溢而不露锋芒。
the British 英国人(总称)	(1) I have consulted a number of law books in the British Museums. (2) The Americans look at life differently from the British. (3) The British Empire once covered large parts of the world. (4) The British character is often said to be phlegmatic. (5) The British are said to have an unusual sense of humour. (6) Irish patriot who fought for the rights of Irish Catholics and was executed for his part in a bungled uprising against the British. (7) One of the glories of the British heritage is the right to a fair trial. (8) The Americans spell some words differently from the British.	(1) 我查阅了大英博物馆里许多法律书籍。 (2) 美国人对生活的看法，与英国人不同。 (3) 大英帝国曾经占有过世界上的大片地方。 (4) 英国人的性格常说成是冷漠的。 (5) 据说英国人有一种特殊的幽默感。 (6) 埃米特，罗伯特1778－1803爱尔兰爱国主义者，他为爱尔兰天主教的权利而战，在反对英国的事件中，因失败而被处决 (7) 英国人引以自豪的传统之一是有获得公正审判的权利。 (8) 美国人拼写某些单词不同于英国人。
broad adj.宽广的；清楚无误的；明显的；胸怀开阔的；粗俗的 n.<俚>女子	(1) The broad steps in front of the mansion made it look very dignified. (2) The Minister gave a broad hint that she intends to raise taxes. (3) The kidnapping occurred in broad daylight. (4) He is broad-minded.	(1) 宽阔的台阶使大厦的正面显得很气派。 (2) 首相明白地暗示她打算提高税额. (3) 在光天化日之下竟发生绑架事件。 (4) 他是一个心胸宽阔的人。

(7) The broadcast was recorded, not live. (8) Here is a political party broadcast before an election. (6) The rain bucketed down. (7) The girl was bucketing water from the well.	(1) 去替我装满一桶水来。 (2) 他提著一桶水下山来了。 (3) 我打翻了水桶，水流了一地。 (4) 他们买了很多票,并且再卖掉以获取利润。 (5) 那辆旧车以30公里左右的时速行驶。 (6) 大雨倾盆。 (7) 那姑娘在用桶从井里打水。

(8) It seems that matter is lost when fuels burn. (9) Coal of this quality doesn't burn very easily.	(1) 蜡烛已烧去一半。 (2) 与其慢慢凋谢,不如灿烂燃烧! (3) 如果人造卫星返回地球太快,它在归途中就会烧毁了。 (4) 他要剥掉我的头皮或是在火刑柱上烧我。 (5) 她急于要告诉你这消息。 (6) 告诉他,在烧伤处敷凉水。 (7) 他因在火灾中受烧伤而死。 (8) 似乎燃料燃烧时物质就消失了。 (9) 这种品质的煤不容易燃烧。

(6) We cannot calculate on his help.	(1) 你能计算出试管的容量吗? (2) 科学家已推算出世界人口在本世纪末将要增加一倍。 (3) 我想做那件事简直是在浪费时间。 (4) 那位经济学家推测,物价或许会再次上涨。 (5) 这个广告是针对儿童设计的。 (6) 我们不能指望他的帮助。
calm adj.平静的；冷静的 v.(使)平静；(使)镇静 n.镇定；平静；平稳	(1) The calm sea gave no hint of the storm that was coming. (2) She always remains cool, calm and collected in a crisis. (3) You should keep calm even in face of danger. (4) Moved by what she said, he could hardly calm down. (5) Before the performance everybody held a deep breath to calm down themselves. (6) In mental institutions, doctors often let the patients listen to soft music to calm their emotions. (7) Under his apparent calm lay real anxiety. (8) The sea had continued calm until a hurricane rose. (9) The hall was very quiet, but it was the calm before the storm. (10) Instantly the baby girl responds.The pulse rate becomes calm and steady. (11) You can be called into action with the knowledge that can bring calm to a changing planet.	(1) 平静的海上没有一点迹象显示暴风雨即将来临。 (2) 她在危难中总能保持冷静、 平静和镇静。 (3) 即使面临危险，你也应当保持镇静。 (4) 由于被她那些话所感动,他很难平静下来。 (5) 上台表演前,每个人都,让自己平静下来。 (6) 在精神病院里,医生也常常让病患听一些很柔和的音乐,使他们的情绪稳定下来。 (7) 他表面镇静,内心焦虑。 (8) 飓风来临之前,海面一直平静。 (9) 大厅里一片安静,但这是暴风雨前的平静。 (10) 小女孩立刻有了反应，她的脉搏开始变地平稳。 (11) 你能够以知识发动进入行动那将能带著平稳去一个改变中的行星。

cattle n.牛；家畜；畜牲	(1) There is much forage for the cattle. (2) There are many herds of cattle in the meadow. (3) Clover can be grown as food for cattle. (4) He lives on a farm, so he knows a lot about cattle. (5) We wintered our cattle in the warm valley. (6) Those poor soldiers died like cattle, without a struggle.	(1) 那儿有很多喂牛的饲料。 (2) 牧场上有许多牛群。 (3) 苜蓿可以用作牛饲料。 (4) 他住在农场，所以对家畜知之甚多。 (5) 冬天我们在温暖的山谷中饲养家畜。 (6) 那些可怜的士兵未经抵抗，就象畜生一般死了。
caution n.警告；慎重；戒备；吸引人眼球的人或物 vt.警告；劝告	(1) The teacher gave Tom a caution and told him never to do it again. (2) He told us to proceed with caution. (3) Always he sought someone to whom he could talk without caution. (4) I must caution you against the danger. (5) I would caution you against undue optimism .	(1) 老师给了汤姆一次警告,叫他不许再那样做。 (2) 他要我们谨慎行事。 (3) 他一直在找一个能够随便谈谈的人。 (4) 我必须告诫你应谨防危险。 (5) 我奉劝你不要过于乐观.
cautious adj.谨慎的；十分小心的	(1) She is cautious of telling secrets. (2) He is cautious in his choice of words. (3) The old lady is very cautious with money. (4) I should be cautious not to give offence.	(1) 她很谨慎，不会泄露秘密。 (2) 他措辞很谨慎。 (3) 那位老太太用钱很谨慎。 (4) 我应该小心不要得罪人。
cave n.洞穴；山洞 v.挖空；塌落；屈服	(1) This cave was used by smugglersin the eighteenth century. (2) The cliffs are riddled with caves. (3) We kindled a firebrand in the cave. (4) The boys huddled together in the cave to keep warm. (5) The roof of the old house caved in. (6) The enemy had to cave in and surrender. (7) They refused to cave in to the terrorists'demands.	(1) 这个洞穴是十八世纪走私的人使用的。 (2) 岩壁上布满洞穴。 (3) 我们在山洞里点燃火把。 (4) 男孩子们在山洞里挤成一团取暖。 (5) 那栋旧房子的屋顶塌下了。 (6) 敌人只好屈服投降。 (7) 他们拒绝向恐怖分子的要求屈服。

ceiling n.天花板；上限	(1) He cracked his nut on the ceiling. (2) The low ceiling of the room gave me a feeling of oppression. (3) It took more or less a whole day to paint the ceiling. (4) This ceiling has a carved panel. (5) My bedroom is a large room with a high ceiling. (6) We need to set a ceiling on the price of corn. (7) The management had set a ceiling for the rate of payrises that year. (8) The government has set a wages and prices ceiling of 10%.	(1) 他的头让天花板碰破了。 (2) 低矮的屋顶给我一种压抑的感觉。 (3) 粉刷天花板用了将近一整天的时间。 (4) 这块天花板带有刻花镶板。 (5) 我的卧室是一个天花板很高的大房间。 (6) 我们得给玉米价格设个上限。 (7) 那一年，管理层对工资的增长率设定了一个上限。 (8) 政府规定工资和物价提高的最高限度为10%25.
celebrate v.庆祝；庆贺；颂扬	(1) Let's celebrate! (2) People in the city held a great party to celebrate their victory. (3) They had a family feast to celebrate it. (4) He read us a sonnet that celebrates love. (5) Odysseus's heroic exploits are celebrated in The Odyssey'.	(1) 让我们好好庆祝一下吧！ (2) 本市的市民举行了盛大的晚会庆祝他们的胜利。 (3) 他们举办家宴以示庆贺。 (4) 他给我们读了一首歌颂爱情的十四行诗。 (5) 《奥德赛》史诗中歌颂了奥德修斯的丰功伟绩。
celebration n.典礼；宗教仪式；庆祝，祝贺	(1) The hotel had a grand celebration for its opening. (2) "(actors, singers, etc.) perform for outside salary income without approval by the unit they belong to" (3) The celebration will run from next Monday. (4) Preparations for a big celebration were under way. (5) The date of celebration is in the air.	(1) 该饭店办了一个盛大的开幕典礼。 (2) 走穴 (3) 庆祝活动从下周一开始。 (4) 盛大庆祝的准备工作正在进行中。 (5) 庆祝的日期还没有决定。
cell n.单人牢房；小房间；细胞；蜂房的巢室；电池；政治小组；(计算机电子表格的)单元格；<美口>手机	(1) The prisoner was locked in a cell. (2) She was found prostrate on the floor of the cell. (3) The cancer cell may invade other parts of the body. (4) There is a queen bee in the cell. (5) I have to buy a new dry cell. (6) An al-qaeda sleeper cell may have used Arizona as its base. (7) The cell is running out of juice.	(1) 那囚犯被关在单人牢房内。 (2) 有人发现她趴在小屋的地板上。 (3) 癌细胞可能侵袭身体的其他部分。 (4) 蜂房里有一只蜂王。 (5) 我必须买一节新的干电池了。 (6) 基地组织的一个潜伏小组可能将亚利桑那州作为其基地。 (7) 手机要没电了。
cellar n.地窖；地下室 vt.把 ... 藏入地窑	(1) This wine cellar stays at an even temperature all year round. (2) The cellar floods whenever it rains heavily. (3) The cheese molded in the damp cellar. (4) They were ensconced in the cellar. (5) The plumber went down to the cellar to fix the leaky pipe. (6) The wine has been cellared for ten years.	(1) 这个酒窖常年保持恒温。 (2) 一下大雨地窖里就灌满了水。 (3) 乳酪在潮湿的地下室中长了霉。 (4) 他们躲在地下室里。 (5) 管道工到地下室去修漏水的管子。 (6) 酒在地窖里存了十年。
centigrade adj.摄氏的；百分度的	(1) This thermometer is calibrated by centigrade. (2) It is therefore usually expressed in percentage terms rather than in engineering units such as degrees centigrade.	(1) 这种温度计是用摄氏百分度标定的。 (2) 因此它往往用一个百分比来表示而不是机械单位如百分度表示。
centimetre n.厘米 =centimeter（美）	(1) Round each measurement to the nearest whole inch or centimetre.	(1) 将每个测量数目四舍五入到最近的英寸或厘米整数。
central adj.中心的；中央的；主要的；起支配作用的；有控制力的；[语]中央元音的 n.中心枢纽；中央办公室；电话交换机	(1) My house is very central. (2) What's the central thought of this article? (3) She stays in a small hotel near central park. (4) She has been a central figure in the campaign. (5) The organization has a central office in York.	(1) 我的家非常靠近市中心。 (2) 这篇文章的中心思想是什么？ (3) 她住在中央公园附近的一家小旅馆。 (4) 她一直是这场运动的主要人物。 (5) 该组织在约克设有总部。
ceremony n.仪式；礼节；典礼	(1) The marriage ceremony took place in the church. (2) They hold a mystic religious ceremony. (3) There's no need for ceremony between friends. (4) What the old headmaster said at the graduation ceremony dwells in my mind. (5) The ceremony went off without a hitch.	(1) 婚礼在教堂举行。 (2) 他们举行了一个神秘的宗教仪式。 (3) 朋友之间不必拘礼. (4) 老校长在毕业典礼上讲的话一直留在我的脑海里。 (5) 典礼进行得很顺利。
certain adj.确定的；肯定的；某事；某人；某种；（与人名连用；表示不认识此人）一位叫...；特定的；轻微的；微小的 pron.某些；某几个	(1) It's certain that every effect must have a cause. (2) I can tell you for certain that I am always honest. (3) Certain things are still open to discussion. (4) For certain reasons I will be unable to attend the meeting. (5) A certain Mr Brown telephoned while you were out. (6) To a certain extent, I'm in favor of your project. (7) There was a certain coldness in her attitude towards me. (8) Certain of those present had had too much to drink.	(1) 无疑，每个结果必定有其原因。 (2) 我可以肯定地告诉你, 我一向是老实的。 (3) 有些事还需要商量。 (4) 因为某种原因，我不能出席这次会议。 (5) 你出去的时候 (6) 从某种程度上说,我赞成你的方案。 (7) 她对我的态度有点儿冷淡。 (8) 有些出席的人喝得太多了。
certificate n.执照；证(明)书 vt.认可；批准；发证书给 ...	(1) The driver's certificate was suspended by the police. (2) He was afforded a certificate upon completion of his course of study. (3) This is an accredited course and participants will receive 4.5 college credits and a world recognized Certificate of Nutrition upon completion. (4) Bocog originally promised to issue a certificate of recognition to the participant in its global campaign whose slogan was adopted. (5) After approval, a certificate of approval shall be issued by MOFTEC. (6) If you are successful, the official will confirm the record and you will get a certificate from the Guinness Book of World Records stating that you are a world record holder!	(1) 这个司机的驾驶执照被警察吊销了。 (2) 他结业时被授予证书。 (3) 本课程设学分制，完成课程的直销商可获国际认可大学学分，结业时将获颁发盖有美国大溪谷州立大学盖印的营养证书。 (4) 北京奥组委最初承诺，在全球征集活动中，一旦某一口号获选，将向口号的提出者颁发认可证书。 (5) 批准后，由对外贸易经济合作部发给批准证书。 (6) 假如你成功了，官员就会批准你的记录，你就会得到一个吉尼斯世界纪录的证书，表明你是世界纪录的保持者。
chain n.束缚；链条；链；(一)连串；连锁店（常用复数） vt.束缚；用铁链锁住	(1) Though you seek in garments the freedom of privacy you may find in them a harness and a chain. (2) She wore a silver chain around her neck. (3) He detached a link from a chain. (4) The Government fear the strike may produce a chain reaction in other industries.	(1) 你们想借着衣服得到隐私的自由,反而却因此为之羁绊和束缚。 (2) 她脖子上戴着一条银项链。 (3) 他从链子上拆下一个链环。 (4) 政府害怕罢工可能在其他行业产生连锁反应。
chain store 连锁商店	(1) One advantage of most chain stores is that goods bought in one of the shops can usually be returned to one of the others if there is any problem. (2) As you know, we are a well-established firm in the line of textiles, and we enjoy good relations with all the wholesalers, chain stores and distributors in Canada. (3) I bought this loaf of bread in the chain store opposite the street.	(1) 大多数连锁商店的一个优点是：在其中一间商店中购买的货物，如果有什么问题的话，通常可以在其他任何一间店退货。 (2) 你知道，我公司在纺织业有良好的信誉，跟加拿大所有的批发商、连锁商店和分销商都保持很好的关系。 (3) 我在街道对面的连锁商店里买了这只面包。

chairwoman n.女主席；女董事长	(1) The new chairwoman was very well-spoken. (2) The chairwoman started her working life on the shop floor.	(1) 新上任的女主席很会说话。 (2) 这位女董事长的职业生涯是从车间基层干起的。
chalk n.粉笔；白垩 v.用粉笔写；记录；使变白；归咎	(1) The teacher wrote on the blackboard with a piece of chalk. (2) The teacher's chalk grated on the blackboard. (3) My father said cement couldn't be made from chalk. (4) The boys chalked out goalposts on the playground wall. (5) He chalked out a simple plan of the new building. (6) Our team has chalked up a record score for the season. (7) The team has chalked up its fifth win in a row. (8) You shouldn't chalk that up to experience.	(1) 老师用一支粉笔在黑板上写字。 (2) 老师的粉笔在黑板上发出刺耳的摩擦声。 (3) 我父亲说水泥不能用白垩来制作。 (4) 男孩子们在运动场的墙上用粉笔画上了球门柱。 (5) 他用粉笔勾画了新大楼的简图。 (6) 我们队已取得该季度最佳得分记录。 (7) 这队一连五次取得胜利。 (8) 你不应将此归咎为经验问题。

champion n.拥护者；冠军；优胜者；勇士 vt.拥护；保卫；为 ... 而斗争	(1) He is a champion of women's rights. (2) He is the undisputed champion. (3) He is a champion at writing familiar essays. (4) Every absurdity have a champion to defend it. (5) He is forced to champion unpopular causes. (6) He has always championed the cause of gay rights.	(1) 他是妇女权利的卫士. (2) 他是无可争辩的冠军。 (3) 他是写小品文的好手。 (4) 任何谬论都拥有拥护它的斗士。 (5) 他被迫去支持一些不得人心的事业。 (6) 他一直在为争取同性恋者的权利而斗争。
changeable adj.易变的；可改变的	(1) In the subjects having known the risk factors, more than half of patients still did not adopt any actions on the changeable life styles.	(1) 在了解危险因素的同时仍有半数以上患者在可改变的生活方式上未采取行为。
channel n.频道；海峡；方法；通道；（消息）渠道 vt.引导；形成河道；集中（精力）	(1) This channel comes on the air every morning at 7 am. (2) The ship went through the English Channel fast. (3) She was seeking a channel for her creative energies. (4) We can reach these markets through our existing distribution channels. (5) It is important to maintain clear channels of communication. (6) All information on the classes is channeled through the principal's office. (7) She channeled all her energies into her career.	(1) 这个频道每天早晨7点钟开始播放。 (2) 那条船很快的通过了英吉利海峡。 (3) 她正在为她创造性的能量寻找方法。 (4) 我们可以通过我们现有的分散渠道到达这些市场。 (5) 保持清晰的消息渠道很重要。 (6) 课上的所有信息都被传到校长办公室了 (7) 她集中精力于她的事业。
chant n.圣歌；赞美诗；旋律；喊叫 v.吟唱；诵扬；叫喊	(1) What we call Gregorian chant today first appears distinctly in the Roman repertory of the fifth and sixth centuries. (2) The chant of the crowd was "Work for all". (3) The angels chant the chorus all day long. (4) They decide to chant beethoven's symphony no.9 on the mayor's birthday. (5) The subject of his poem is to chant the praises of labour heroes. (6) Worldly people chant the name of God, but there is no zeal behind it.	(1) 我们现在说的格立高圣歌最早清楚的出现在5和6世纪的罗马剧目中。 (2) 群众反复有节奏地呼喊的是"给大家工作"。 (3) 天使们整天唱着圣歌， (4) 他们决定在市长生日那天咏唱贝多芬的第九交响曲。 (5) 他的诗的主题是歌颂劳动英雄。 (6) 世人唱着神的圣名，却没有了热诚。
chaos n.混乱；无秩序；混沌	(1) The wintry weather has caused chaos on the roads. (2) Without rules, people would live in a state of chaos. (3) Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit. (4) The Chaos gods demand their souls.	(1) 因风雪交加,道路上混乱不堪。 (2) 若无规则,人们将在混乱状态中生活。 (3) 混沌常常孕育着生命，而秩序会产生习惯。 (4) 混沌邪神需要他们的灵魂。
character n.个性；品质；字符；人物；名誉；地位 adj.[剧](角色)代表某一特性的	(1) The boy has a strong character. (2) He is remembered for the nobility of his character. (3) We need only keep track of the last marked character. (4) I never saw a character so thoroughly hit off . (5) His character is without a blemish. (6) She is responsible for the character part of the hero's devoted mother.	(1) 这孩子个性很强。 (2) 他因品质高尚而被人怀念。 (3) 我们只要记住最后标记的字符。 (4) 我从没看见过一个人物被描写得如此淋漓尽致。 (5) 他在名誉上毫无瑕疵。 (6) 她负责这个主人公的忠诚的母亲的角色部分。
characteristic n.特点；特性；特色 adj.典型的；特有的	(1) Ambition is a characteristic of all successful businessmen. (2) A characteristic of the camel is its ability to live for a long time without water. (3) They have been affected by trends in Italy too much to keep their own characteristics. (4) It is the characteristic attitude of people towards life in those post-war years. (5) Sympathy is the feeling characteristic of mankind.	(1) 雄心勃勃是所有成功生意人的共同特点。 (2) 骆驼的特点是不喝水也能活很长时间。 (3) 他们受意大利潮流的影响太大了,以致无法保持自己的特色。 (4) 这是战后人们典型的处世态度。 (5) 同情心是人类特有的感情。
charge n.责任；电荷；指控；费用；照顾 vi.要价；充电；向前冲，冲锋；记在账上 vt.控诉；赊帐；给…充电；委以重任；归罪于；装填（炸药等）	(1) As group leader, you should take charge. (2) He was arrested on a charge of armed robbery. (3) Rub the leather and the rubber will produce the charge. (4) He was arrested on a charge of armed robbery. (5) The extra charge is for the water bed. (6) How much do you charge per unit? (7) The suspect was charged with murdering his wife. (8) Please charge these bills to my account. (9) He forgot to charge the battery. (10) She was charged with an important mission.	(1) 你身为组长, 应当负起责任来。 (2) 他被指控犯武装抢劫罪而遭逮捕。 (3) 摩擦皮毛和橡胶会产生电荷。 (4) 他被指控犯武装抢劫罪而遭逮捕。 (5) 超额费用是因为有水床。 (6) 你们每件要价多少呢？ (7) 嫌疑犯被控诉为谋杀他的妻子。 (8) 请把这些帐单记在我的账上。 (9) 他忘记给电池充电了。 (10) 她被委以重任。
chapter n.章；回；篇	(1) One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in chapter 6. (2) He has got prepared to write a new chapter. (3) Let us revert to the earlier part of the chapter. (4) Chapter IV is about anaphora of third person pronouns. (5) He could recite the prose chapter and verse.	(1) 书中最有趣的情节是在第6章。 (2) 他已经准备动手写新的一章。 (3) 让我们回到本章的前面部分。 (4) 第四章，第三人称代词回指研究。 (5) 他能一字不漏地背诵那篇散文。
chat vi.闲谈；谈天 n.闲谈；聊天	(1) He came round last week and we chatted for a while. (2) He likes to chat with his e-pals on the Internet. (3) It is pleasant to chat with friends, and with no chat is it more pleasant than with close friends.	(1) 上星期他顺道来访,我们闲谈了一会。 (2) 他喜欢上网与网友聊天。 (3) 和朋友聊天是愉快的，而这种情形没有比和知己的朋友聊天更为愉快。
cheat vt.欺骗；骗取 vi.作弊；行骗 n.骗子；欺骗	(1) We were on our honor not to cheat the customers. (2) It is contemptible to cheat friends. (3) They cheat the old woman of her house and money. (4) I would rather fail than cheat in the examination. (5) He never cheats to pass examination. (6) It is just not credible that she would cheat. (7) He is a shameless cheat. (8) Your cheat will sooner or later find you out.	(1) 我们以名誉担保不欺骗顾客。 (2) 欺骗朋友是卑劣的。 (3) 他们骗取了老妇人的房屋和钱财。 (4) 我宁愿考不及格，也不愿意考试作弊。 (5) 他考试从不作弊。 (6) 她会行骗简直难以置信。 (7) 他是个无耻的骗子。 (8) 你的欺骗行为迟早会暴露的。
cheek n.面颊；脸蛋	(1) A bullet grazed his cheek. (2) She has a tiny mole on her cheek. (3) Philip stroked the baby's little cheek.	(1) 子弹擦伤了他的面颊。 (2) 她面颊上有一颗小痣。 (3) 菲利浦摸着那婴儿的小脸蛋。
cheer n.欢呼；激励；愉快 vt.鼓舞；加油；快活起来 vi.欢呼；使振奋	(1) The audience greet his speech with loud cheer. (2) The audience gave a great cheer when he scored. (3) Your words of cheer disposed me for the task. (4) He's always full of cheer in summer. (5) The crowd cheered the runners on as they started the last lap. (6) They beat drums to cheer up the players. (7) I will be there to cheer for you. (8) His high spirits flood her and cheer her. (9) The crowd cheered loudly as the Queen appeared.	(1) 听众对他的演讲报以高声欢呼。 (2) 当他得分的时候，观众们爆发出热烈的欢呼。 (3) 你的一番鼓励的话使我乐意接受这项任务了。 (4) 夏天他总是高高兴兴的。 (5) 赛跑进入最後一圈时，观众为运动员加油鼓劲。 (6) 他们擂鼓给运动员加油。 (7) 我会在赛场边为你加油的。 (8) 他兴高采烈的神情感染了她，使她也快活起来。 (9) 女王出现时群众高声欢呼。
Cheer up v.高兴起来；振作起来；使高兴；使振奋	(1) Try and cheer up a bit; life isn't that bad! (2) Cheer up! I'm sure you'll feel better tomorrow. (3) Cheer up! Things are not so bad as they seem. (4) He took her to the ballet to cheer her up. (5) Our teachers often cheer us up in class every day.	(1) 想办法高兴点儿,生活并不是那么糟！ (2) 振作起来！我肯定你明天会好些的。 (3) 振作起来！情况并不象看上去那样糟。 (4) 他为了使她高兴起来,便带她去看芭蕾舞。 (5) 老师常常使我们每天在课堂上都很振奋。
cheerful adj.高兴的；快乐的	(1) His cheerful manner belied his real feelings. (2) There is hardly any cheerful news in the papers. (3) A cheerful wife is the joy of life. (4) Her cheerful spirits and bubble laughter infect the whole class. (5) These detail represented cheerful woman savour.	(1) 他那快活的样子掩饰了他真实的感情。 (2) 报上没有什么叫人高兴的消息。 (3) 快乐的妻子是生活的乐事。 (4) 她那快乐的情绪和爽朗的笑声感染了全班。 (5) 这些细节都代表了快乐女人的品味。
cheers int.干杯；再见；谢谢	(1) Let's drink a toast to our hostess. Cheers! (2) To our friendship and health. Cheers! (3) Cheers! See you tomorrow night.	(1) 为我们的女主人举杯。干杯！ (2) 让我们为友谊和健康，干杯！ (3) 再见！明晚见。
chef n.厨师；主厨	(1) The chef is not interested in Greek food. (2) The chef sprinkle poppy seed on the cake. (3) I commended the chef on the excellent meal. I later wrote to commend him to his employer, the restaurant owner. (4) Dinner is in the hands of the chef. (5) This is a delicious dinner, my compliments to the chef.	(1) 厨师对希腊饭不感兴趣。 (2) 厨师往蛋糕上撒罂粟籽。 (3) 我称赞厨师做的菜味道好。随后我给雇用他的餐馆老板写了封信表扬他。 (4) 晚餐由主厨负责。 (5) 晚饭真不错，请向主厨转达我的赞誉。
chemical adj.化学的 n.药品；化学物	(1) The government has banned the use of chemical weapons. (2) A reactor is a container for chemical reaction. (3) We are doing a chemical experiment. (4) The industry produces agricultural chemicals. (5) The fine chemicals become more and more important. (6) The chemical can behave as an acid. (4) The woman went to the chemist's shop and showed the docter's note to the chemist.	(1) 你想向化学家要些什么吗？ (2) 那个著名的化学家赢得了诺贝尔奖。 (3) 药剂师正在配药。 (4) 这女人去了药师房，把医生写的那张纸条递给药剂师看。
cheque n.支票 =check(美).	(1) Don't forget to date your cheque. (2) I hope this cheque doesn't bounce. (3) He drew a cheque to her. (4) Payments by cheque easily outnumbered cash transactions. (5) Will you lend me some money to tide me over until I get my pay cheque?	(1) 不要忘记在支票上写上日期。 (2) 我希望这张支票别遭退票 (3) 他开了张支票给她。 (4) 用支票付款在数量上大大超过现金交易。 (5) 你能否借给我点儿钱，帮我维持到发薪时?
chest n.胸部；胸腔；箱子；金库	(1) The soldier received a serious wound on the chest. (2) The bullet hit him in the chest. (3) Chest pains may be symptomatic of heart disease. (4) The diaphragm is between the chest and the abdomen. (5) He dragged the heavy case across the floor. (6) He put some food into the ice chest.	(1) 这名士兵胸部受了重伤。 (2) 子弹击中了他的胸膛。 (3) 胸痛可能是心脏病的症状。 (4) 横隔膜位于胸腔与腹部之间。 (5) 他在地板上拖着那个沉重的箱子。 (6) 他把一些食物放进冰箱里。
chew vt.咀嚼；嚼碎；深思 vi.咀嚼 n.咀嚼；咀嚼物	(1) Many people like to chew mint gum in the summer. (2) You must chew your food well before you swallow it. (3) Chew your food well before swallow. (4) Chew your food properly before swallowing it. (5) I'll chew the problem over for a few days. (6) I'll give you till tomorrow to chew over. (7) Saliva helps one chew and digest food. (8) He can't chew without his false teeth. (9) I'll think about it while I have a chew.	(1) 许多人喜欢在夏天嚼薄荷口香糖。 (2) 食物吞下去之前先要细细咀嚼。 (3) 吞下食物以前必须要好好咀嚼。 (4) 食物嚼碎後再咽下。 (5) 这个问题我会仔细思考几天。 (6) 我给你一天的时间来考虑。 (7) 唾液能帮助咀嚼和消化食物。 (8) 他没有假牙就嚼不动。 (9) 我吃饭时会想想看。
chick n.小鸡；少妇 adj.胆小的；懦弱的	(1) I breed some chicks for pets. (2) The chick will soon feather out. (3) Oh really ? What about chick I took out in August ? She was hot!	(1) 我养了一些小鸡当宠物。 (2) 这只小鸡很快就要长羽毛了。 (3) 哦，真的吗?我八月份带出去的那个少妇如何?她很性感！

(4) The chief interchanged the diamond with some pieces of glass. (5) The chief of the police department demanded severe punishments for criminals.	(1) 在美国,纽约是主要的商业中心。 (2) 你们国家有哪些主要的出口物品？ (3) 海运最大的缺点是速度慢。 (4) 那首领拿一些玻璃块替换了那些钻石。 (5) 警察局长要求严惩罪犯。
childhood n.童年；幼年	(1) I have only misty memories of my early childhood. (2) He had a lively remembrance of his childhood. (3) Childhood is a period of rapid growth. (4) I had known him from his childhood.	(1) 我对自己的童年只剩一些模糊的记忆。 (2) 他对他的童年生活记忆犹新。 (3) 幼年是生长迅速的时期。 (4) 我从他幼年起就认识他。
choice n.选择；挑选；抉择 adj.上等的；精选的	(1) I believe that he can make a judicious choice. (2) The choice rests entirely with you. (3) We have no choice except to trust ourselves. (4) The shop has a wide choice of hats. (5) The choice lies between death and dishonor. (6) We select only the choicest apples for our pies. (7) She summed up the situation in a few choice phrases. choir n.唱诗班；合唱队；唱诗班的席位	(1) The choir sang the 23rd Psalm. (2) The choir sang the amens beautifully. (3) The choir sang sweetly, and none more so than the Welsh boy. (4) The choir was singing distinctly out of tune in places. (5) The choir gave a ragged performance.	(1) 唱诗班唱《旧约·诗篇》之第23篇。 (2) 唱诗班唱的阿门非常优美。 (3) 唱诗班唱得很悦耳，尤其是没人比得上那个威尔士男孩儿。 (4) 合唱团有些地方明显唱走调了。 (5) 合唱队演唱得很不和谐。
choke vi.窒息；阻塞；说不出话 vt.使窒息；阻塞；抑制；使说不出话 n.窒息；阻塞；阻风门	(1) She found it hard to choke down her anger. (2) She choked with emotion. (3) Very small toys can choke a baby. (4) You have to choke the engine when it is cold. (5) The plant will soon choke ponds and waterways if left unchecked. (6) She kept talking and nobody could choke her off. (7) Anger choked his words. (8) Very small toys can choke a baby. (9) Horse's narrow esophagus stenosis results in repeated choke. (10) The automatic choke includes a thermostatic spring and a vacuum piston.	(1) 她感到难以压下心中的怒火。 (2) 她激动得说不出话来。 (3) 很小的玩具可使婴儿窒息。 (4) 当发动机冷却的时候，你要阻塞住它的气门。 (5) 如不控制这种植物的生长，池塘和水道很快就要被阻塞。 (6) 她说个不停,没人能阻止她。 (7) 他气得说不出话来。 (8) 很小的玩具可使婴儿窒息。 (9) 马的食道狭窄，常常引起食道阻塞。 (10) 自动阻风门包括一个恒温控制弹簧和一个真空活塞。
chorus n.合唱队；歌舞队；齐声说道；副歌部分 vt.合唱	(1) The audience chimed in on the chorus. (2) The chorus is dressed as fairies. (3) When I asked questions, they answered up in chorus. (4) The papers all chorused the praises of the President.	(1) 听众开始跟合唱队一起唱起来。 (2) 歌舞队的人都装扮成仙子。 (3) 我提问题时,他们迅速齐声回答。 (4) 各报都异口同声地对总统表示赞扬。
Christian n.基督徒 adj.基督教的；基督徒的	(1) He is a pious Christian. (2) My husband is a Christian and I’m going to turn. (3) The man was excommunicated from the Christian Church. (4) Christian and Muslim doctrines are very different. (5) Christmas and Easter are Christian festivals. (6) Jesus was the founder of the Christian religion.	(1) 他是一名虔诚的基督教徒。 (2) 我丈夫是基督徒，我也准备皈依基督教。 (3) 那人被驱逐出基督教会。 (4) 基督教教义和穆斯林教义极为不同。 (5) 圣诞节和复活节是基督教的节日。 (6) 耶稣是基督教的创始人。
Christmas card n.耶诞卡；圣诞贺卡	(1) At the foot of her bed, there was a locker with one Christmas card.	(1) 在她的床脚边有一个床脚柜，柜子上有一张圣诞贺卡。
Christmas tree 圣诞树	(1) The children soon denuded the Christmas tree of its parcels. (2) The Christmas tree caught fire, and the family was burned out. (3) Someone pressed a switch and all the lights on the Christmas tree flashed on together. (4) We bought some ornaments for the Christmas tree.	(1) 孩子们很快就把挂在圣诞树上的一包包礼物拿得精光。 (2) 圣诞树着了火，全家都被迫逃了出来。 (3) 有人按了一下开关，圣诞树上全部的灯一起亮了起来。 (4) 我们买了一些装饰品来点缀圣诞树。
Christmas Eve n.圣诞节前夕(12月24日)	(1) I always go to my parents'house on Christmas Eve. (2) Toy sale peaked just before christmas and is now decreasing.	(1) 我总是到我父母家里度过圣诞节前夕。 (2) 玩具销售额在圣诞节前夕达到最高峰，现已逐渐下降。
cigar n.雪茄烟	(1) He exhaled a billow of cigar smoke. (2) Your cigar tinctures the room with an awful smell.	(1) 他吐出一股雪茄烟。 (2) 你吸雪茄烟弄得满屋子都是臭味。
cigarette n.香烟，卷烟，烟卷	(1) He asked me if I had a cigarette lighter with me. (2) A cigarette set the dry grass alight. (3) Don't drop cigarette ash on the carpet. (4) He lit a cigarette in order to calm his mind. (5) A good cigarette will smoke at least ten minutes. (6) A cigarette thrown into the woods in dry weather may start a fire. (7) In our city, the shops were not allowed to sell cigarettes to students.	(1) 他问我身上是否带着打火机。 (2) 香烟把乾草点著了。 (3) 别把烟灰落在地毯上。 (4) 他点燃一支香烟，镇定一下情绪。 (5) 一支好烟至少可以抽10分钟。 (6) 在天气干燥时把点燃的香烟扔进树林可能会引起火灾。 (7) 在我市，商店不准把香烟卖给学生。
circuit n.巡回；线路；环形；电路；回路 v.巡回；绕 ... 环形	(1) The commanding officer made a circuit of the camp. (2) Complete minor repairs to circuit wiring. (3) The circuit is a conventional ring counter. (4) The circuit of the city walls is three miles. (5) The rocket did one circuit of the earth and returned to base. (6) There are two breakers in this circuit. (7) The switches close the contacts and complete the circuit. (8) I hit the lunch-and-lecture circuit again. (9) Smith was subpoenaed as a witness to appear in the circuit court. (10) The circuit is a conventional ring counter.	(1) 指挥官在营地巡视一周。 (2) 完成线路小修。 (3) 此线路是一个普通的环形计数器。 (4) 环绕本市城墙的周长是三英里。 (5) 火箭绕地球运行一周后返回基地。 (6) 这个电路里面使用了两个断路器。 (7) 这些开关可使接触器接通电流形成回路。 (8) 我又去参加那些巡回午餐演讲了。 (9) 史密斯被传唤作为证人在巡回法院出庭。 (10) 此线路是一个普通的环形计数器。
circulate vi.流通；循环；传播 vt.使流通，使环流	(1) Please open a window to allow the air to circulate. (2) Foreign money is not allowed to circulate in China. (3) Money shall circulate freely within the common market. (4) Blood circulates through the body. (5) The news of her death circulated quickly.	(1) 打开窗子让空气流通。 (2) 外币不允许在中国流通。 (3) 货币应在共同市场内自由流通。 (4) 血液在体内循环。 (5) 她死去的消息迅速传开。
circumstance n.环境；详情；事件；(复数)境况	(1) He was forced by the circumstances to do this. (2) The choice of technique is, therefore, a matter of preference, and in some cases circumstance. (3) I cannot recollect the exact circumstance. (4) Your arrival was a fortunate circumstance. (5) Due to circumstances beyond our control the lecture was cancelled.	(1) 他做此事是为环境所迫。 (2) 因此,技术的选择是偏好的问题,在某些情况下也与环境有关。 (3) 我总是想不起确实的情况。 (4) 你的到来是命中注定的。 (5) 由于无法控制的情况，讲座取消了。
circus n.马戏团；马戏表演；竞技场；广场	(1) He performs riding stunts in the circus. (2) The circus placarded the city with advertisements. (3) The fascinations of the circus are endless. (4) The Roman circus was used for chariot and horse races. (5) Am I on the right road to Piccadilly Circus?	(1) 他在马戏团表演骑马绝技。 (2) 马戏团满城张贴广告。 (3) 马戏表演非常吸引人。 (4) 罗马竞技场是用来举行敞篷双轮马车竞赛和赛马比赛的。 (5) 我走这条路去皮卡迪利广场对吗?
citizen n.公民；市民	(1) He is a Dane inasmuch as he was born in Denmark, but he became a British citizen at the age of 30. (2) She is a lawful citizen. (3) This accusation of bribery is a vile smear on an honorable citizen. (4) A citizen of London is called a Londoner. (5) The citizen of the city can access any libraries gratis.	(1) 他按其出生在丹麦来说是丹麦人，但他在30岁时成了英国公民。 (2) 她是个守法的公民。 (3) 这项有关贿赂的指控是对一个正直公民的无耻诽谤。 (4) 伦敦的市民被叫做伦敦人。 (5) 这个城市的市民可以免费进入任何图书馆。
civil adj.公民的；文明的；国内的；民用的；民事的；【建】土木的	(1) The law shall strictly protect civil rights. (2) The presence of the army should act as a check on civil unrest. (3) The boy was so cold and even didn't return a civil greeting. (4) The America Civil War broke out during the presidency of Lincoln. (5) It was a civil case so there was no question of him being sent to prison.	(1) 法律应严格保护公民的权利。 (2) 军队的存在应能制止民间的动乱。 (3) 那个男孩是那么的冷淡,他甚至都没有回敬一个礼貌的问候。 (4) 在林肯就职其间,美国爆发了内战。 (5) 这是一桩民事案件，因此他没有被送进监狱的可能。
civilian adj.平民的 n.罗马法专家；平民	(1) He resigned his commission to take up a civilian job. (2) People are indignant by their shooting of innocent civilians. (3) A civilian was killed by a stray bullet.	(1) 他辞去军职而从事平民工作。 (2) 对于他们枪杀无辜平民，人们感到义愤填膺。 (3) 一个平民被流弹打死。
civilization n.文明；开化；教养	(1) Chinese civilization is one of the oldest in the world. (2) The civilization of mankind has taken thousands of years. (3) In some ways, civilization does not seem to have progressed much in the last century. (4) The civilization of these tribes will take a long time. (5) These letters revealed her wit and civilization. (6) He is remembered for his generosity and civilization.	(1) 中国文化是世界上最古老的文化之一。 (2) 人类经数千年才文明开化。 (3) 在某些方面，上个世纪文明似乎进展不大。 (4) 这些部落的开化将需很长时间。 (5) 这些信流露出她的教养和才华。 (6) 他因慷慨和良好的教养而被人们怀念。
clap v.拍手；轻拍；鼓掌；啪地关上 n.霹雳声；轻拍；拍手声	(1) She clapped her hands in delight. (2) The gray-beard swept out an arm to clap Shemsen on the shoulder. (3) Sometimes people will clap wildly after you dance. (4) There was a clap of thunder in the distance. (5) I gave him a gentle clap on the shoulder. (6) The audience gave him a loud clap.	(1) 她高兴地拍手。 (2) 灰胡子腾出一只手，拍了拍舍姆森的肩。 (3) 有时候，你跳完舞后人们会疯狂地鼓掌。 (4) 远处有雷鸣。 (5) 我在他肩膀上斯文的轻拍了一下。 (6) 听众给他一个大声的鼓掌。
clarify vt.澄清；阐明；净化	(1) These brief remarks may serve to clarify the fact. (2) The teacher's explanation clarified the puzzling problem. (3) Would you please clarify your question? (4) She asked him to clarify what he meant.	(1) 这些简要的评论可以澄清事实。 (2) 老师的说明澄清了困扰的问题。 (3) 请你把你的问题说清楚好吗？ (4) 她要他说清楚他是什么意思。
classic n.杰作；古典作品；第一流艺术家 adj.最优秀的；传统的；古典的	(1) "War and Peace" is a literary classic. (2) The idea of a classic is historically bound up with the view. (3) This is a really classic French champagne. (4) The novel is regarded as one of the classic works. (5) The old gentleman had on a classic suit. (6) The temple has been considered an example of classic design. (7) This church is a classic example of medieval architecture.	(1) 《战争与和平》是一部经典文学著作。 (2) 从历史上来看，古典的想法和这个观点有着密切的联系。 (3) 这确实是上等的法国香槟酒。 (4) 这篇小说被公认为是最优秀的作品之一。 (5) 那位老年绅士穿著一套古朴的传统服装。 (6) 人们认为这座神庙是古典式设计的范例。 (7) 这座教堂是中世纪建筑风格的典型实例。
classical adj.古典的；权威的；传统的；正统的	(1) Beethoven is regarded as one of the immortals of classical music. (2) Some young people like pop music, while still others like classical music. (3) He is regarded as one of the classical composers in this century. (4) The classical approach could be realized in at least two forms. (5) Classical scientific ideas about light were changed by Einstein. (6) In this classical surreal film, a sailor meets a student who has just murdered his tutor.	(1) 贝多芬被认为是不朽的古典音乐大师。 (2) 一些年青人喜欢流行音乐，但仍有其它人喜欢古典音乐。 (3) 他被认为是本世纪第一流的作曲家之一。 (4) 传统的道路被认为至少有两种形式。 (5) 爱因斯坦改变了科学上关于光的传统观念。 (6) 在这部正统的超现实电影中，一个水手碰到了一个刚刚杀害了自己的家庭教师的学生。
classify vt.分类；归类	(1) The books in the library are classified by subject. (2) We can classify these subjects under three headings. (3) Would you classify her novels as serious literature or other? (4) It is entirly proper to classify Kant as a transcendental idealist.	(1) 图书馆的书是按科目分类的。 (2) 我们可以将这些题目加以分类成三个主题。 (3) 你认为她的小说属于文学类，还是其它类? (4) 把康德化归类为先验的唯心主义者是完全正确的。
claw n.爪；钳；螯；爪状物 v.抓；撕	(1) Cats have sharp claws. (2) A hen's claw has three toes. (3) The editor got his claws into the opposition in a vicious editorial. (4) His face was badly clawed. (5) Their favorite cat clawed a hole in my stocking. (6) Anxiety clawed him.	(1) 猫有锋利的爪子。 (2) 母鸡的脚爪有三个脚趾。 (3) 那个编辑在一篇社论中恶毒地攻击了反对派。 (4) 他的脸给抓坏了。 (5) 他们家宠爱的猫在我的袜子上抓破了个洞。 (6) 忧虑撕裂他的心。

(4) It was said that the first man was moulded from clay by some kind of god. (5) Wet the clay a bit more before you start to mould it.	(1) 黏土是可塑物质。 (2) 黏土能保持水分。 (3) 砖和盘子由各种粘土制成。 (4) 据传，第一个人是某个神用泥土造出来的。 (5) 把泥再弄湿点再动手塑造。

(6) The clone was a copy of its ancestor. (7) You wonder why they can clone sheep but you can't dupe the cows. (3) It saddens me to recall that I assured him that I had no expectations of a long-term commitment. (5) They are looking for someone with a real sense of commitment to the job.
