common adj.常见的；共同的；普通的；平常的；平凡的；粗俗的 n.公地；平民；普通；公园	(1) Windmills are a common sight in Holland. (2) We have common topics to talk about. (3) Common interests bind us together. (4) Smith is a common surname. (5) Excellence is to do a common thing in an uncommon way. (6) She thought he was very common and uneducated. (7) We went for a walk on the common. (8) His parents were of the commons. (9) Extra shares of common will be sold publicly. (10) They campaign nationally for the protection of commons, village greens and footpaths.	(1) 风车是荷兰常见的景色。 (2) 我们有共同的话题可谈。 (3) 共同的利益使我们结合在一起。 (4) 史密斯是个很普通的姓。 (5) 所谓优秀就是用不平凡的方法做平凡的事. (6) 她认为他很粗俗且无教养。 (7) 我们在公地上散步。 (8) 他的父母是平民。 (9) 额外的普通股份将公开出售。 (10) 他们在全国搞运动宣传保护城市公园、乡村绿地和人行小径。
communicate v.传达；沟通；交流	(1) He has communicated his wishes to me. (2) I like to communicate with my family. (3) The door communicates with my room. (4) Good manners are not only about the way we talk, but also about all other things we do when we communicate with other people.	(1) 他已经把他的愿望告诉了我。 (2) 我喜欢和我的家人沟通。 (3) 这门和我的房间相通。 (4) 好的礼节不仅仅是指我们谈话的方式,还包括我们在与别人交流时进行各种活动的处理办法与态度。
communication n.交流；通讯；传达；通信；沟通	(1) Being able to hold a conversation does not necessarily mean having effective communication. (2) This area has not been covered by the communication net. (3) The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication. (4) Gestures comprise a major form of nonverbal communication. (5) Radio and television are important means of communication. (6) Students should come with better preparation and better communication skills.	(1) 能够对话并不意味着在进行有效的交流。 (2) 这个地区还不在通讯网的覆盖之内。 (3) 海滨救生员通常用旗号传达讯息。 (4) 手势是非语言传达中很重要的一环。 (5) 无线电和电视是重要的通信手段。 (6) 学生应做好更充分的准备,具备更好的沟通能力。
communism n.共产主义	(1) Communism is based on Marxism. (2) Our ultimate aim is to realize communism. (3) Marx is the progenitor of Communism.	(1) 共产主义是以马克思主义为基础。 (2) 我们的最终目的是实现共产主义。 (3) 马克思是共产主义的创始人。
communist adj.共产主义的 n.共产主义者	(1) The Communist form of government had not mellowed. (2) She's a member of the Communist Party. (3) Every true Communist must fight to root out this evil.	(1) 共产主义的政府形式还没有成熟。 (2) 她是共产党员。 (3) 每一个忠诚的共产主义者，必须为消灭这种恶劣的现象而斗争。
companion n.同伴；志趣相投的人；成对物品之一；参考书 v.陪伴	(1) He is a good companion on the journey. (2) He had always considered her an ideal companion for his son. (3) The dog has been her constant companion these past ten years. (4) His brother is not much of a companion for him. (5) She takes a traveller's companion with her for this journey. (6) I worked as a companion to an old princess. (7) When I grew up, my mother told me it was unseemly for young girls to go about alone at night or travel without an older companion.	(1) 他是个好旅伴。 (2) 他一直以为她是他儿子的理想伴侣。 (3) 过去十年来,这只狗一直与她形影不离。 (4) 他兄弟与他情趣不甚相投。 (5) 她为这次旅行带了一本旅行指南。 (6) 我当过一位老公爵夫人的陪伴人。 (7) 当我长大后，我母亲告诉我，年轻女孩儿独自在晚上出门或是远行而没有年长人的陪伴，这都是不体面的。
compare v.比较；对比；比喻 n.比较；对照	(1) I compared the copy with the original, but there was not much difference. (2) The police compared the suspect's fingerprints with those found at the crime scene. (3) Life is poetically compared to the morning dew. (4) She is lovely beyond compare. (5) Compare respirations and breath sounds with previous findings.	(1) 我比较了复印件和原件，但是差别不是很大。 (2) 警察将嫌疑犯的指纹和犯罪现场的指纹进行了对比。 (3) 在诗歌中，人生被比喻为朝露。 (4) 她真是可爱得无与伦比。 (5) 将本次呼吸与呼吸音与前次检查结果相对照。
compass n.圆规；指南针；范围 vt.达到；围绕；图谋	(1) Now we begin to draw a circle with compasses. (2) I need a compass to draw a circle. (3) A compass needle points to the north. (4) The compass was invented by the Chinese, as is well known. (5) Finance is not within the compass of our department. (6) Her action go beyond the compass of proper social behavior. (7) In order to compass our object we must work hard. (8) He tried his best to compass his purpose. (9) Suddenly we compassed the enemies on all sides.	(1) 现在我们开始用圆规画一个圆。 (2) 我需要一支圆规画圆。 (3) 罗盘的指针永远指向北方。 (4) 众所周知,指南针是中国人发明的。 (5) 财政不在我们这个部门的管辖范围之内。 (6) 她的举动越出了正当的社交行为的范围。 (7) 为了达到我们的目标，我们必须努力工作。 (8) 他尽力去实现他的目标。 (9) 我们突然从四面八方将敌人包围了。
compensate v.补偿；赔偿；付报酬	(1) Nothing can compensate for the loss of one's health. (2) She was compensated by the insurance company for her injuries. (3) You will have to compensate us for the loss.	(1) 什么都不能补偿健康受损。 (2) 她受伤后获得保险公司的赔偿。 (3) 你必须赔偿我们的损失。
compete v.竞争；比赛；对抗	(1) Companies must be able to compete in the marketplace. (2) Several companies are competing for the contract. (3) We can compete with the best teams. (4) He's hoping to compete in the London marathon.	(1) 公司一定要在市场中有竞争力。 (2) 几家公司正为争取一项合同而互相竞争。 (3) 我们能与最好的队竞争。 (4) 他期盼着参加伦敦马拉松比赛。
competence n.能力；胜任；管辖权	(1) Competence is prerequisite to promotion. (2) I doubt his competence to do the work. (3) No one doubts her competence as a teacher. (4) It has beyond the competence of the court. (5) It does not lie the competence of this committee.	(1) 能力是升职的先决条件。 (2) 我怀疑他是否有能力做那件工作。 (3) 谁也不怀疑她能胜任教师工作。 (4) 它已经超出法院的权限。 (5) 这不属于该委员会的权限范围。
competitor n.竞争者；对手	(1) The Japanese can outsell any competitor in the market. (2) He girded up his loin to face his competitor. (3) That company constitutes our lone competitor in the field. (4) That company is a strong competitor of us. (5) The firm has better products than its competitors. (6) Customers were flocking to the competitor.	(1) 日本人比谁都会搞市场推销。 (2) 他做好准备来迎战他的对手。 (3) 那家公司成了我们在这个领域唯一的竞争对手。 (4) 那个公司是我们强有力的竞争对手。 (5) 这家公司的产品比其对手的好。 (6) 客户纷纷拥向竞争对手。
complete adj.完整的；完成的；彻底的 vt.完成；使完美；使圆满；填（表格等）	(1) We'll certainly set up a complete modern industrial system. (2) When the experiment is complete, include your findings in a report. (3) This is a complete failure. (4) Can you complete your task on time? (5) By their joint efforts they managed to complete the project on time. (6) A second child would complete their family. (7) I only need one volume to complete my set of Dickens's novels. (8) Complete your application in ink.	(1) 我们一定要建立一个完整的现代化工业体系。 (2) 试验完成後,请把结果写入报告。 (3) 这是一个彻底的失败。 (4) 你们能按时完成工作吗? (5) 他们通过共同努力总算按时完成了计划。 (6) 第二个孩子使他们的家更加完美了 (7) 我那套狄更斯小说只差一卷就能配齐了. (8) 用钢笔填申请表。
complex adj.复杂的；合成的；复合的 n.综合体；复合体；[医]综合症状；[心]情结	(1) It was a complex problem. (2) This enhances the complex flavors and bouquet of the wine. (3) Complex briary fruit with smoldering oak. (4) They also provide composable functionality required to support complex, large-scale systems. (5) Libraries are great complexes of tiny items. (6) The synaptonemal complex is protein in nature. (7) An inferiority complex is very harmful to you and is the greatest obstacle .	(1) 这是一个复杂的问题。 (2) 这加强了酒的合成的味道。 (3) 有复合的水果香和烟熏橡木香。 (4) 并提供可复合的功能以支持复杂的大规模系统。 (5) 图书馆是细小类目的大综合体。 (6) 联合复合体实质上是蛋白质。 (7) 自卑心是最伤害自己的，是最大的障碍。
component n.零部件；元件；组成部分；成分 adj.组成的；构成的	(1) Each of the components is useful in its degree. (2) The militia is a component of the state's armed forces. (3) A chemist can seperate a medicine into its components. (4) Can you resolve it into its component elements? (5) The processing and assembling business is a component part of our foreign trade.	(1) 每一个元件都各有程度不同的用处。 (2) 民兵是国家武装力量的组成部分。 (3) 化学家能把一种药物的各种成分分解出来。 (4) 你能把它分解为组成它的元素吗? (5) 加工装配贸易是我们对外贸易的一个组成部分。
comprehension n.理解；理解力；领悟能力	(1) It is above comprehension. (2) This event was a tragedy that strained all comprehension. (3) It's quite past my comprehension. (4) Learning Chinese, you must have good comprehension. (5) Students have differing levels of comprehension.	(1) 那是难于理解的。 (2) 这一事件是人们怎么也不能理解的一个悲剧。 (3) 这件事已远超出我的理解力了。 (4) 学习汉语,必须要有很强的理解力 (5) 学生有不同层次的领悟。
compromise n.妥协；折衷；折衷案；和解 vt.妥协处理；危害 vi.妥协，和解；让步	(1) He did it without compromise of his dignity. (2) The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out. (3) After some discussion we arrive at a compromise. (4) Or are we ready to compromise our faith? (5) Build the disorder that does not have the market to compromise project quality forthrightly. (6) They found it wiser to compromise with her. (7) The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out. (8) The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out. (9) I think we'd better reach a compromise.	(1) 他做这事而不损及他的尊严。 (2) 这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。 (3) 经过一番讨论之后，我们达成一项折衷方案。 (4) 或者，我们准备好了在信仰上折衷吗？ (5) 建没市场的混乱直接地危害工程质量。 (6) 他们觉得与她妥协更明智。 (7) 这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。 (8) 这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。 (9) 我认为我们最好相互让步。
compulsory adj.强制的；势在必行的；义务的	(1) Attendance at evening prayers is not compulsory. (2) I think it is compulsory. (3) The car insurance is compulsory. (4) I think it is compulsory to look over the house. (5) Building model stars is a compulsory task. (6) Is English a compulsory subject? (7) Is military service compulsory in your country?	(1) 参加晚祷并非硬性规定。 (2) 我认为这是非做不可的。 (3) 这项汽车保险是强制性的。 (4) 我认为检查这栋房子势在必行。 (5) 建立恒星模型是一项势在必行的任务。 (6) 英语是必修科目吗？ (7) 你们国家实行义务兵役制吗？
computer game 电脑游戏	(1) How people design computer games is beyond me. (2) I found a computer game to divert the children.	(1) 我不明白电脑游戏是怎麽设计的。 (2) 我发现了一种供孩子娱乐的电脑游戏。
comrade n.同志	(1) He puts me in mind of a comrade in my army unit. (2) Comrade Lei Feng left an undying example behind.	(1) 他使我想起了我们部队的一位同志。 (2) 雷锋同志留下了一个不朽的榜样。
concentrate v.专心；集中；浓缩 n.浓缩物	(1) I can't concentrate on my work when I'm tired. (2) The confusing matters make him unable to concentrate on his study. (3) The crowds concentrated round the palace. (4) We can concentrate sugar solution into syrup. (5) It is an orange concentrate which you dilute with water.	(1) 我累了就无法集中精力工作。 (2) 那么多烦心事使他无法专心学习。 (3) 人群汇集在宫殿的四周。 (4) 我们可以将糖的溶液浓缩为糖浆。 (5) 这是一种兑水饮用的浓缩橙汁.
concept n.观念；概念；想法	(1) I can not understand such an abstract concept. (2) He presented a new concept of the origins of the universe.	(1) 我无法理解如此抽象的观念。 (2) 他提出了一种宇宙起源的新概念。
concern n.关心；关心的事；忧虑，担心 vt.涉及；影响；关心；（使）担心 n.公司；企业	(1) Hardly a whisper of concern has been voiced. (2) Provision of shelter was their main concern for the disaster victims. (3) I am not insensible of your concern. (4) Rarely would a single concern have the entire facilities required for a complete testing program. (5) TCL is a large concern in our country. (6) The theory of relativity is concerned with two seemingly opposite ideas. (7) Local industry should concern itself with local needs .	(1) 没有人表示过一点点的关心。 (2) 为灾民提供避难处是他们最关切的事。 (3) 我不是没察觉到你的忧虑。 (4) 很少有一个公司能拥有为完成整个试验大纲所需要的全部设备。 (5) 是我们国家的一个大企业。 (6) 相对论涉及两个似乎对应的概念。 (7) 地方工业应关心本地的需要。
conclude vt.推断出；缔结；使结束 vi.结束；总结；作决定；作协议	(1) From his appearance we may safely conclude that he is a chain smoker. (2) He conclude the negotiation with dispatch. (3) The concert concluded with the National Anthem. (4) I want to conclude on a positive note.	(1) 从他的外表，我们可以有把握地断定他烟抽得很凶。 (2) 他迅速结束谈判。 (3) 音乐会最后以演奏国歌结束。 (4) 让我从乐观的角度作个总结。
conclusion n.结尾；结论；结束	(1) I found the conclusion of her story very exciting. (2) Some found the conclusion of the film Titanic very disappointing. (3) Your information is inaccurate and your conclusion is therefore wrong. (4) So far no correct conclusion has arrived at.	(1) 我觉得她那故事的结尾很激动人心。 (2) 有些人觉得电影《泰坦尼克号》的结尾是令人失望的. (3) 你的信息不准确，所以你的结论是错误的。 (4) 到目前为止,还没有得出任何正确的结论。
concrete adj.具体的；实质性的；混凝土的 n.水泥；混凝土；具体物 v.凝结；结合	(1) I can't tell you anything concrete. (2) He had nothing concrete to fasten it upon. (3) The statue rests on a bed of concrete. (4) Between these are fixed precast concrete external cladding panels. (5) Tom tumbled over and hit his head on the concrete. (6) They have had the tunnel shored up with concrete. (7) The house is made of stone, not concrete. (8) The road was paved with concrete. (9) Beauty is not concrete but a door is. (10) The government concreted the road over. (11) Slabs are concreted complete with ducts and openings framed with metal aprons welded to slab reinforcement and intended to accommodate columns. (12) It is easier to think in concrete terms rather than in the abstract.	(1) 这具体的我也说不上来。 (2) 他抓不到什么具体的证据。 (3) 这座雕像立在混凝土的基座上。 (4) 在它们之间填上预制混凝土的外层空心板。 (5) 汤姆摔倒，头撞到水泥地。 (6) 他们已经叫人用水泥把坑道加固。 (7) 那房子是石造的，不是混凝土造的。 (8) 路面由混凝土铺成。 (9) 美丽不是具体物，但门是。 (10) 政府用混凝土铺路。 (11) 楼板用混凝土浇注成整体，其上留有用金属挡板围成的孔道和提升环，它们和楼板配筋焊接在一起，以备将柱子套入其中。 (12) 结合具体的事物来思考要比抽象思考容易些。
condition n.条件；情况 v.训练；决定；以 ... 为条件；护理（头发）	(1) Conditions in poor quarters were horrible. (2) I had halfway decided to accept their conditions at that time. (3) The terrorists will only release their hostage on certain condition. (4) Jimmie had but a vague idea of world conditions now. (5) His thinking is incommensurate to the changed conditions. (6) I conditioned the dog to bark at strangers. (7) Most people have been conditioned to accept what they see on television. (8) The amount of money I spend is conditioned by the amount I earn. (9) Age and health do not always condition each other. (10) The gift to the boy was conditioned on his good behavior. (11) I condition my hair every two weeks.	(1) 城里穷人居住区条件十分糟糕。 (2) 当时我已差不多决定要接受他们的条件了。 (3) 恐怖分子只有在某些条件下才释放人质。 (4) 杰米对当今世界情况只有一点模糊的了解。 (5) 他的思想和已经变化了的情况不相适应。 (6) 我训练这只狗对陌生人吠叫。 (7) 大多数人已被训练得会接受电视里看到的东西。 (8) 我花多少钱是由我挣多少钱决定的。 (9) 年龄与健康并不总是互为条件的。 (10) 给孩子的礼物是以他的表现好坏为条件的。 (11) 我每两周做一次头发。
condemn vt.谴责；判刑	(1) We must not condemn her on pure supposition. (2) We condemn all sorts of slanders. (3) Most people are willing to condemn violence. (4) The criminal was condemned to death.	(1) 我们不能单凭猜测就谴责她。 (2) 我们谴责一切诽谤中伤的言论。 (3) 大部分的人极力谴责暴力。 (4) 这个罪犯被判死刑。
conduct n.行为；举动；品行 v.引导；指挥；管理 vt.导电；传热	(1) Your conduct is not consistent with what you say. (2) His behavior transgressed the unwritten rules of social conduct. (3) His conduct roused the suspicion of the police. (4) He has good conduct. (5) A man of irreproachable conduct commands the respect of others. (6) The guide conducted us around the ruins of the ancient city. (7) The visitors were conducted over the factory. (8) Who is conducting the orchestra tonight? (9) They hired agents to conduct their company. (10) As to softwares for management, they can aid people to conduct scientific management. (11) Most metals can conduct electricity. (12) Most plastics do not readily conduct heat or electricity. (13) Metal conducts heat better than wood. (14) Copper is a good medium for conducting heat.	(1) 你的言行不一致。 (2) 他的行为违反了不成文的社交规范。 (3) 他的举动引起了警察的怀疑。 (4) 他品行端正。 (5) 品行端正的人,受人尊敬。 (6) 导游引导我们游览了古城废墟。 (7) 参观者被引导到工厂的各处去参观。 (8) 谁指挥今晚的管弦乐队呢? (9) 他们雇请代理人来管理他们的公司。 (10) 管理软件可以帮助人们进行科学的管理。 (11) 大多数金属能导电。 (12) 大多数塑料不易导电导热。 (13) 金属传热性能比木头好。 (14) 铜是传热的良导体。
confidential adj.秘密的；机密的；表示信任的；获信赖的	(1) He has been on confidential missions to Berlin. (2) He told me the confidential information. (3) He was an author whose works were so little known as to be almost confidential. (4) Don't be too confidential with strangers. (5) She is a confidential secretary of Mr. Smith.	(1) 他前往柏林执行秘密任务。 (2) 他向我透露了这个秘密的信息。 (3) 他这位作家的著作是如此不为人所知，以致几乎等于机密文件。 (4) 不要过份相信陌生人。 (5) 她是史密斯先生的一个机要秘书。
conference n.会议；讨论会；协商会；会谈	(1) An international conference will be held in Beijing next month. (2) There will be a banquet following the conference. (3) We are all fully confident that the conference will be a great success. (4) Peace was the dominant theme of the conference.	(1) 一个国际性的会议下月将在北京举行。 (2) 会议过后将有一个宴会。 (3) 我们都有充分的信心,这次会议将会非常成功。 (4) 和平是大会的首要议题。
confirm v.证实；批准；确定	(1) His letter confirmed everything. (2) The treaty was confirmed by the president. (3) Could you confirm the dispatch date?	(1) 他的信证实了一切。 (2) 条约已被总统批准。 (3) 您可以确定发货日期吗?
conflict n.冲突；战斗；矛盾；斗争 vi.冲突；抵触；争执	(1) Both sides suffered heavy casualties in the border armed conflict. (2) This is an irreconcilable conflict. (3) He's got involved in a political conflict he can't extricate himself from. (4) Your interests conflict with mine. (5) The hours of those two exams conflict. (6) John often comes into conflict with his boss. (7) A careless move may well trigger an all new debate and conflict.	(1) 在这次边界武装冲突中双方都遭到了重大伤亡。 (2) 这是一个不可调和的矛盾。 (3) 他陷在一场政治斗争中不能脱身。 (4) 你的利益和我的冲突。 (5) 那两门测验的钟点互有抵触。 (6) 约翰经常和他的老板发生争执。 (7) 一不小心，还可能引发全新的争执和冲突。
confuse vt.使困惑；使混乱；混淆	(1) They asked so many questions that they confused me. (2) Your explanation does not so much enlighten us as confuse us. (3) Her unexpected arrival confused all our plans. (4) Please don't confuse Australia with Austria. (5) I often confuse you and your brother.	(1) 他们问了许许多多问题，把我弄糊涂了。 (2) 你的解释没有起到启发作用,反而把我们弄糊涂了。 (3) 她突然来到把我们所有的计划全打乱了. (4) 别把澳大利亚和奥地利混淆了。 (5) 我常把你和你哥哥弄错了。
congratulate vt.祝贺；庆祝	(1) Let me congratulate you. (2) May I congratulate you? (3) I congratulate you on your great discovery. (4) I congratulated myself on my narrow escape. (5) We congratulated him on his birthday.	(1) 请允许我向您表示祝贺。 (2) 请允许我向您表示祝贺。 (3) 我祝贺你的伟大发现。 (4) 我庆祝自己死里逃生。 (5) 我们向他庆祝生日。
connection n.联系；关系；连接；亲戚	(1) What is the connection between the two ideas? (2) There is no connection between them. (3) Your connection with the press served out turn. (4) I have no immediate connection with him. (5) How long will the connection of the telephone take? (6) He is a distant connection of my wife's.	(1) 这两个概念之间有何联系？ (2) 他们之间没有什么关系。 (3) 你与新闻界的关系正适应了我们的需要。 (4) 我和他没有直接关系。 (5) 接通电话需要多长时间呢? (6) 他是我妻子的一个远亲。
conscience n.良心；是非之心；顾忌	(1) She was afflicted with conscience. (2) The thief's conscience smote him. (3) She gave him back the money she'd stolen for the sake of her conscience. (4) This is a document that serves as the nation's conscience.	(1) 她受良心责备。 (2) 那个贼突然良心发现。 (3) 为了不受良心的谴责，她把从他那偷来的钱还给他了。 (4) 这是一份表明民族道德准则的文件。
consensus n.一致；同意；共识	(1) The two parties have reached a consensus. (2) It would be a good idea to predict which proposal is most likely to achieve consensus.	(1) 这两个政党达成了一致意见。 (2) 不妨研究一下哪项提案最有可能获得一致同意。
consequence n.结果；后果；重要性；影响	(1) It terrified me to contemplate the consequence of your action. (2) He studied hard, and in consequence he passed the exam. (3) Happiness is not a reward it is a consequence. (4) In consequence of his bad conduct he was dismissed. (5) He is a man of great consequence. (6) Both sides think of the point as of no consequence. (7) The difference is not of consequence.	(1) 一想到你行动的后果,我就感到害怕。 (2) 他努力学习，因此通过了考试。 (3) 幸福不是报偿，而是结果。 (4) 由于行为不良，他被开除了。 (5) 他是一个很重要的人物。 (6) 双方都认为这一点不重要。 (7) 此差别是无关紧要的。
conservation n.保存；保护；守恒；节约	(1) If I may refer back to the problem we discussed, I think we shall stress on the conservation of our natural resource. (2) Conservation methods will also help meet their energy needs. (3) Most people have come to accept the need for conservation of natural resources. (4) Our community is a leader in the conservation of wildlife. (5) Who discovered the conservation of energy?	(1) 请允许我重提我们刚才讨论过的问题，我想我们应该强调保存我们的自然资源。 (2) 能量保存方法也会有利于满足其能源需求。 (3) 现在大多数人已认识到保护自然资源的必要。 (4) 我们社区在野生动物保护方面走在前头。 (5) 谁发现了能量守恒？
conservative adj.保守的；守旧的 n.保守派(党)；保守的人	(1) He was very conservative in the estimate. (2) Old people are usually more conservative than young people. (3) The man turned from Radical to Conservative. (4) He listed himself as a conservative.	(1) 他的这一估计很保守。 (2) 老年人通常比年轻人保守。 (3) 这人从激进派变成了保守派。 (4) 他自称是一个保守主义者。
consider v.考虑；思考；认为；体谅；注视	(1) Please take time to consider the problem. (2) They did not consider whether they could afford the time or not. (3) When you read, don't just consider what the author thinks, consider what you think. (4) We consider that the driver is not to blame. (5) I consider it a great honor to be invited to dinner. (6) You should consider other people before you act. (7) He stood there, considering the painting.	(1) 请仔细考虑一下这个问题。 (2) 他们没有考虑是否抽得出时间。 (3) 当你在阅读的时候,不要只是思考作者在想什么,而是要思考你在想什么。 (4) 我们认为这不是司机的过错。 (5) 我认为能被邀请参加晚宴是很大的荣幸。 (6) 你在行动之前应当考虑到别人。 (7) 他站在那里，凝视着那幅画。
considerate adj.考虑周到的；体谅的；体贴的	(1) It was considerate of you to bring me my raincoat. (2) It is considerate of you to call on your relatives from time to time. (3) He is no more considerate of others than his brother is. (4) She's a very considerate and caring person.	(1) 你为我带来雨衣,真是想得周到。 (2) 你时时拜望亲戚很周到啊。 (3) 他不体谅别人，就跟他弟弟一样。 (4) 她是一个很懂得体贴和关心的人。
consideration n.考虑；体贴；考虑因素；敬重；意见	(1) Please give the matter your careful consideration. (2) He showed no consideration for his wife. (3) Thank you for all your consideration and help. (4) Time is an important consideration in this case. (5) Several considerations have influenced my decision.	(1) 此事请你仔细考虑。 (2) 他不体贴他的妻子。 (3) 谢谢您的关心和帮助。 (4) 在这种情况下，时间是一个要考虑的重要因素。 (5) 有好几个因素影响了我的决定。
consist vi.由 ... 组成；构成；在于；符合	(1) The United Kingdom consists of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. (2) How many players does a baseball team consist of? (3) Matters consist of molecules, and molecules of atoms. (4) The islands consist of oyster reefs covered with a thin veneer of black mud. (5) The beauty of the plan consists in its simplicity. (6) The beauty of Venice consists largely in the style of its ancient buildings. (7) Health does not cossint with intemperance. (8) The report does not consist with the fact.	(1) 联合王国由大不列颠和北爱尔兰组成。 (2) 棒球队由几名队员组成? (3) 物质由分子构成，而分子由原子构成。 (4) 由牡蛎礁构成的小岛上覆盖着一层薄薄的黑色软泥。 (5) 该计划的妙处在于简洁明了。 (6) 威尼斯的美很大程度上在于它那古代建筑的风格。 (7) 健康和酗酒不能相容。 (8) 那报导与事实不合。
consistent adj.始终如一的；持续的；一致的	(1) She is a consistent girl in her feeling. (2) Our aim is to ensure a consistent growth. (3) Your conduct is not consistent with what you say.	(1) 在感情方面她是个始终如一的女孩。 (2) 我们的目标是确保持续的增长。 (3) 你的言行不一致。
constant adj.不变的；经常的 n.常数；恒量	(1) In our world nothing seems constant. (2) The birth rate in this city is almost constant. (3) The machinery requires constant maintenance. (4) The constant friction between the young couple finally caused divorce. (5) The speed of light is an important constant. (6) The size can be set only as a constant. (7) This quantity is called the universal gas constant.	(1) 在我们这个世界上似乎没有东西是永恒不变的。 (2) 这城市的出生率几乎是不变的。 (3) 这些机器需要经常保养维修。 (4) 小夫妻俩之间经常的冲突终于导致了离婚。 (5) 光速是一个重要的常数。 (6) 大小只能被设置为常数。 (7) 这个量叫做普适气体恒量。
constitution n.宪法；组织；体质；构成，组成，构造	(1) The President swore to uphold the constitution. (2) The country's constitution embodies the ideals of freedom and equality. (3) The constitution of a primitive society is not necessarily simple. (4) Hunger and disease had weakened his constitution. (5) He has a good constitution.	(1) 总统宣誓维护宪法。 (2) 这个国家的宪法体现了自由和平等的理想。 (3) 原始社会的结构并不一定就是简单的。 (4) 他饥饿与疾病交加，体质已削弱。 (5) 他体质很好。
construct vt.建造；构筑；造(句) n.构想	(1) This factory was constructed by our company. (2) They are planning to construct a new supermarket. (3) You must learn how to construct a logical argument. (4) He taught us how to construct sentences. (5) There is a contrast between lived reality and the construct held in the mind.	(1) 这家工厂是由我们公司建设的。 (2) 他们正在计划建造一个新的超级市场。 (3) 你必须学会怎样确立合乎逻辑的论点。 (4) 他教我们怎样造句。 (5) 现实生活与头脑所持概念之间有明显差别。
construction n.建设；结构；建筑物；建造；构造；解释	(1) China is striding ahead in her economic construction. (2) It is an object of simple construction. (3) The cathedral is a fantastic modern construction. (4) The building was of bizarre construction. (5) This page is still under construction. (6) I was inclined to put a favorable construction on his reply.	(1) 中国正在经济建设方面大步前进。 (2) 它是一个简单结构的物体。 (3) 那个教堂是奇特的现代建筑。 (4) 这建筑构造奇异。 (5) 此页还在构造之中。 (6) 我总是对他的回答作出很好的解释。
consult v.查阅；请教；商讨；就诊	(1) I will have to consult the plane time table first. (2) He paused to consult his notes, and then proceeded with his questions. (3) If you wish good advice, consult an old man. (4) I need to consult with my colleagues on the proposals. (5) I consulted with a friend on a matter. (6) He went to town to consult his doctor.	(1) 我得先查阅飞机时刻表。 (2) 他停下来看了看笔记，然后继续提问。 (3) 若要主意好，老人须请教。 (4) 我需要和我的同事商讨这些建议。 (5) 我和朋友商量一件事。 (6) 他进城去看医生。
consultant n.顾问；咨询者；<英>会诊医生	(1) Of all the consultants, only Mr. Wang gave us some proposals in point. (2) The spy's cover was that she was a consultant engineer. (3) The consultant was a woman who had many unanswered questions.	(1) 所有的顾问当中，只有王先生提了一些中肯的建议。 (2) 那女间谍伪装成顾问工程师。 (3) 这个女性咨询者有许多有待解决的问题。
consume v.消耗；吃喝；毁灭	(1) His old car consumed much gasoline. (2) Each year Americans consume a high percentage of the world's energy. (3) I saw the flames consuming the whole building.	(1) 他的旧汽车耗油很多。 (2) 每年美国人都消耗掉世界能源的很大比例 (3) 我看见火焰吞噬了整栋建筑物。
contain vt.容纳；包含；抑制；克制 vi.自制	(1) The atlas contains forty maps. (2) Does each cup contain the same amount of milk? (3) This book contains all the information you need. (4) I could hardly contain my curiosity. (5) Try to contain your anger! (6) She couldn't contain herself for joy.	(1) 这个地图集有四十幅地图。 (2) 每个杯子里的牛奶都一样多吗? (3) 这本书包含你所需的一切资料。 (4) 我简直无法克制我的好奇心 (5) 设法抑制你的怒火！ (6) 她高兴地难以自制。
container n.容器；集装箱	(1) A reactor is a container for chemical reaction. (2) The volume of this container is 2 cubic meters. (3) The goods are packed in airtight container. (4) You need to empty the container.	(1) 反应器是进行化学反应的容器。 (2) 这个容器的容量是两立方米。 (3) 货物被装在密封的集装箱内。 (4) 你必须腾空这个集装箱。
contemporary adj.同时代的；当代的 n.同时代的人；同龄人	(1) Marlowe was contemporary with Shakespeare. (2) He had devoted his whole life to the study of contemporary art. (3) Thackeray is a contemporary of Dickens. (4) She and I were contemporaries at college. (5) He is a contemporary of mine, but our experiences are completely different.	(1) 马洛与莎士比亚是同时代的。 (2) 他把他的一生都献给了当代艺术研究。 (3) 萨克莱跟狄更斯是同时期的人。 (4) 她和我在学院里是同学。 (5) 他和我是同龄人，但我们的经历截然不同。
content n. 内容； 目录； 含量 adj. 满足的； 满意的 vt. 使 ... 满足； 使 ... 安心	(1) Teaching content should be concise. (2) The book is rich in content and succinct in style. (3) Define content sections of status reports. (4) Using file shares that provide only a hierarchical directory structure as a means of organizing content. (5) Tests of the manure showed a high ammonia content. (6) The calorie content in this ice cream is very high. (7) We're also in the content business. (8) Disport oneself to one's heart's content. (9) Feel quite content with my present situation.	(1) 教学内容要少而精。 (2) 这本书内容丰富，文字简练。 (3) 定义状态报告的目录部分。 (4) 将只提供一个层次目录结构的文件共享作为内容组织方式使用。 (5) 这种肥料经过化验表明氨的含量很高。 (6) 这种冰激凌的卡路里含量很高。 (7) 我们是也在满足的生意方面。 (8) 玩个痛快什么也不会使他满足。 (9) 我对我的现状感到很满足。
continent n.大陆；洲；(the Continent)欧洲大陆	(1) The discovery of the new continent is usually referred to Columbus. (2) There are seven continents in the world. (3) Asia is the largest continent on Earth. (4) Many people embark at Dover for the Continent.	(1) 人们通常认为新大陆是哥伦布发现的。 (2) 世界上有七大洲。 (3) 亚洲是地球上最大的洲。 (4) 许多前往欧洲大陆的人都在多佛搭船。
continue v.继续；连续；维持；持续	(1) They continued down until they came to some pockets of natural gas. (2) She continued as mayor for a second term. (3) We will continue with the payments for another year. (4) Wet weather may continue for a few more days. (5) The fighting around the airport continued for a week before the enemy was defeated.	(1) 他们继续往下钻，终於找到了一些天然气的气阱。 (2) 她连任了一期市长 (3) 我们这样的报酬还要再维持一年。 (4) 多雨的天气可能还要持续好几天。 (5) 机场附近的战斗持续了一个星期，敌军才被击溃。
contradict vt.反驳；与 ... 矛盾	(1) He did not contradict his attorney's comment. (2) She doesn't like to contradict her husband in public. (3) Don't contradict your father. (4) The report contradicts what we heard yesterday. (5) The two statements contradict each other.	(1) 他没有反驳律师的意见。 (2) 她不愿在众人面前反驳她丈夫。 (3) 别和你父亲犟嘴。 (4) 这个报道与我们昨天听到的有矛盾。 (5) 两种说法相互抵触。
contradictory adj.矛盾的 n.矛盾	(1) I was bewildered by the contradictory statements. (2) People found this sort of contradictory reality hard to accept. (3) His remark was contradictory to the truth. (4) We had to face up to a number of seemingly contradictory concerns.	(1) 我被互相矛盾的陈述搞得莫衷一是。 (2) 人们都觉得这矛盾的现实难以接受。 (3) 他的叙述与事实矛盾。 (4) 我们不得不正视若干看起来相互矛盾的问题。
contrary adj.相反的；截然不同的；执拗的 n.反面；相反	(1) Hot and cold are contrary terms. (2) My sister's taste in dresses is contrary to my own. (3) Mrs. Smith is too contrary to make friends easily. (4) Cruelty is the contrary of kindness. (5) On the contrary,I have tons of things to do.	(1) 热与冷是相反的词语。 (2) 在服装方面，我妹妹的爱好和我完全不同。 (3) 史密斯太太过于固执而不易交朋友。 (4) 残忍是仁慈的反面。 (5) 正相反,我有一大堆事要做。
contribute vt.捐助；投稿 vi.投稿；贡献；是原因之一	(1) It was generous of her to contribute such a large sum. (2) She asked him to contribute a biweekly article on European affairs. (3) Don't contribute after the closing date. (4) It is an honour to be invited to contribute to your magazine. (5) Honesty and hard work contribute to success and happiness. (6) Henry, whose goal in life was to contribute towards the happiness of others, died a hero.	(1) 她很大方，捐助了这么大笔钱。 (2) 她让他每两周写一篇有关欧洲情况的文章。 (3) 请在截止日期前投稿。 (4) 应邀向贵杂志投稿是一个荣誉。 (5) 诚实加苦干有助于成功和幸福。 (6) Henry英勇献身，他的生活目标是为他人的幸福作贡献。
control n.掌控；控制；管制；克制；操作装置 v.控制；支配；掌管；抑制；克制	(1) Don't worry, we have everything under control. (2) Inflation has got out of control. (3) The government has imposed strict controls over the import of luxury goods. (4) He has little control over his emotions. (5) The pilot is at the controls. (6) The firemen were unable to control the blaze. (7) He tries to control me as if I were his slave. (8) Who will control the affairs of the entity? (9) He couldn't control the indignation that swelled in his heart. (10) He was unable to control his addiction to drugs.	(1) 别担心,一切都在我们掌控之中。 (2) 通货膨胀失去了控制。 (3) 政府对奢侈品的进口采取了严格的管制。 (4) 他控制不住自己的感情。 (5) 飞行员在掌握操纵仪。 (6) 消防队员无法控制这场大火。 (7) 他要支配我,好象我是他的奴隶似的。 (8) 谁来掌管公司事务? (9) 他无法抑制胸中涌起的义愤。 (10) 他无法克制他的毒瘾。
controversial adj.有争议的；引起争论的	(1) We tried to stay away from controversial topics at the dinner party.	(1) 晚宴上我们尽力避免一些有争议的话题。
convenience n.便利；舒适；适宜；便利设施；方便的时间	(1) It's a great convenience to live in town. (2) I stock upon grocery at the convenience store. (3) The hotel combines comfort with convenience. (4) Analyzed experiment data, the best one is ultrasonic in the light of convenience, quick, especially avoid sample color disturbing and hydrargyrum pollution. (5) We find our folding table a great convenience. (6) Please come at your convenience.	(1) 住在城市里有很大的方便。 (2) 我到便利商店买食品备用。 (3) 这家旅馆既舒适又方便。 (4) 通过实验得出数据，进行分析，确定了超声法为最适宜样品前处理方法。 (5) 我们发现可折叠的桌子使用非常方便。 (6) 请在你方便的时候前来。
convenient adj.便利的；方便的	(1) Internet makes it convenient for us to get in touch with each other. (2) Please come whenever it is convenient to you.	(1) 互联网使得我们相互联系便利了。 (2) 方便的时候,请随时来。
conventional adj.传统的；惯例的；常规的	(1) Her book is a hilarious send-up of a conventional spy story. (2) According to conventional wisdom, voters usually make their choice on the basis of domestic issues. (3) After a conventional opening remarks, he made a brilliant speech. (4) I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.	(1) 她写的书用的是取笑传统侦探小说的笔法，令人捧腹。 (2) 按一般人在这些问题上的看法，选民常常着眼于国内问题来选择候选人。 (3) 在一个常规的开场白后,他做了个很精彩的演讲。 (4) 我用寻常套路可永远也得不到这样的女孩。
convey vt.表达；传达；运输；转移	(1) I find it hard to convey my feelings in word. (2) Word will suffice to convey his grief. (3) A vibrating membrane in the ear helps to convey sounds to the brain. (4) They asked me to convey their sincere apology to you and promised to replace these rollers by new ones.	(1) 我觉得难以用言语表达我的感情。 (2) 他的悲伤足以用言辞表达。 (3) 耳膜的振动帮助声音传送到大脑。 (4) 他们请我向你们转移他们真诚的歉意，他们还保证用新滚筒替换这些滚筒。
convince vt.使确信；使信服；说服	(1) I try to convince him of the reality of the danger. (2) It took many hours to convince me of his guilt. (3) He convinced me of his sincerity. (4) There was not an atom of evidence to convince him. (5) Your argument is too weak to convince me.	(1) 我试图使他相信危险的确存在。 (2) 研究了许多个小时我才相信他有罪。 (3) 他使我确信他的真诚。 (4) 没有一点能使他信服的证据。 (5) 你的论点太薄弱了，说服不了我。
cooker n.炉具；烹饪用的水果	(1) The cooker has several temperature settings. (2) Clean the area round the cooker. (3) These apples are good cookers.	(1) 这个炉具有几个温度定位挡。 (2) 把炊具周围弄干净。 (3) 这些苹果宜於烹饪.
cordless adj.无线的	(1) I like to use cordless telephone. (2) Three audio channels prevent interference with other cordless devices. (3) There is a laser printer and a cordless telephone on the desk.	(1) 我喜欢使用无线的电话。 (2) 三个音频通道避免其他无线设备干扰。 (3) 桌子上有一台激光打印机和一部无绳电话。
corporation n.公司；法人	(1) He works for a large American corporation. (2) Several new members have come into this corporation. (3) West Coast Corps is a large corporation. (4) A corporation is treated by the law as an entity. (5) And also, the corporation of the MRT construction shall be responsible for the paying back of the investment.	(1) 他为美国一家大型公司工作。 (2) 这个公司又有新人员加入。 (3) 西海岸公司是个大型公司。 (4) 法人在法律上被视为一个实体。 (5) 同时，实行项目法人负责制，进行综合开发，实现城市轨道交通建设投资的回报。
correction n.订正；改正；惩罚；(市价)回落	(1) I'm speaking under correction. (2) The correction of all my mistakes took nearly an hour. (3) I believe these figures are the most recent available but I am open to correction. (4) The prisoner was sent to a labor camp for correction. (5) Market runups are invariably followed by a correction.	(1) 我说的不一定正确。 (2) 我用了近一个小时才改完我的全部错误。 (3) 我认为这些数据是最近才得到的，但我乐于接受改正。 (4) 囚犯被判往劳工营改过自新。 (5) 股票市场上涨之后总是再回落下来。
correspond v.符合；对应；通信	(1) Your account and hers correspond. (2) Your account of events corresponds with hers. (3) The American Congress corresponds to the British Parliament. (4) I correspond with him regularly. (5) The two sisters correspond every week.	(1) 你的说法跟她的说法一致。 (2) 你说的情况跟她说的相符。 (3) 美国的国会相当于英国的议会。 (4) 我经常和他通信。 (5) 这两姐妹每周通信。
corrupt adj.腐败的；堕落的；讹误的 vt.贿赂；使恶化；使腐烂 vi.腐败；腐烂	(1) She wrote a book declaiming against our corrupt society. (2) The corrupt judge dismissed the case without a hearing. (3) The official led a corrupt life. (4) The manuscript is so corrupt that parts of it make no sense at all. (5) He was sent to prison for trying to corrupt a policeman with money. (6) Bad habit corrupt good manners. (7) Bad company may corrupt a good boy. (8) Complete power corrupts completely.	(1) 她写了一本书抨击我们这腐败的社会。 (2) 腐败的法官没有听审就驳回了这个案子。 (3) 这个官员过着堕落的生活。 (4) 这稿子由于讹误太多，以致有的部分意义不明。 (5) 他因为试图用钱贿赂一名警察而被送入监狱。 (6) 坏习惯败坏好风俗。 (7) 跟坏人在一起会使好孩子变坏。 (8) 绝对的权力造成绝对的腐败。
cosy adj.舒适温暖的；亲切友好的；相互勾结的 n.保温套 v.讨好 =cozy（美）.	(1) He lives in a cosy little room. (2) He has been accused of cosying up to the new US president.	(1) 他住在一个舒适的小屋里。 (2) 他被指责讨好新任美国总统。
cottage n.小屋；村舍	(1) The cottage could accommodate up to five people. (2) The cottage was a casualty of the forest fire. (3) His cottage is on the gentle slope of the hill. (4) He has a house in London and a cottage near the sea. (5) From the cottage window a few lamps were glimmering in the distance. (6) Please accept the use of our cottage as a quid pro quo for lending us your car. (7) They own a cottage in Scotland and a house in London as well as a pied-a-terre in Paris.	(1) 这间小屋最多能容纳5个人。 (2) 那小屋被森林大火烧毁。 (3) 他的小屋在山的缓坡上。 (4) 他在伦敦有一所房子，在海边还有一个小屋。 (5) 远处的农舍窗户闪烁着几盏微弱的灯。 (6) 请尽管使用我们的村舍，以酬谢借给我们汽车之事。 (7) 他们在苏格兰有一村舍，在伦敦有一所房子，在巴黎还有一套备用公寓。
counter n.柜台；筹码；计数器；反驳 adj.相反的 adv.与…相反地 v.反对；反击	(1) He placed the money on the counter. (2) Shoppers got into a scrum round the bargain counter. (3) The circuit is a conventional ring counter. (4) They had always had the counter effect of making him beastly. (5) He acted counter to his promise. (6) The result ran counter to our expectation. (7) I counter their plan with my own. (8) He hit me but I did not counter.	(1) 他把钱放在柜台上。 (2) 顾客在廉价品柜台周围你争我夺。 (3) 此线路是一个普通的环形计数器。 (4) 女人总产生相反的效果，使他更像野兽。 (5) 他的行动与他的诺言相反。 (6) 结果与我们的期望相反。 (7) 我用自己的方案去反对他们的计划。 (8) 他打了我,但我没有还手。
couple n.对；夫妇；数个 v.连结；交配	(1) They are a nice couple. (2) The couple seemed to be on cloud nine. (3) Next door to us there's a couple from the USA. (4) My tourist visa lets me stay for a couple of weeks. (5) They coupled the carriages of the train together.	(1) 他们是很美满的一对。 (2) 那对夫妇看上去极其幸福。 (3) 我们隔壁住著来自美国的一对夫妇。 (4) 我的观光签证可让我停留数周。 (5) 他们把火车的车厢连接好。
courage n.勇气；胆量	(1) He showed remarkable courage when he faced the danger. (2) I don't think I have the courage to tell him the bad news. (3) Do you have the courage to go bungee jumping?	(1) 他在面对危险的时候表现出非凡的勇气。 (2) 我觉得我没有勇气告诉他这个坏消息。 (3) 你有胆量玩蹦极跳吗?
course n.课程；讲座；过程；路线；一道(菜) v.跑过，穿过；追赶；快跑	(1) She took a course in philosophy. (2) She is taking a secretarial course. (3) Television has arranged an English teaching course lately. (4) Events took their natural course. (5) We shall now describe the course of this change. (6) They came to dispute in the course of conversation. (7) Our course was straight to the north. (8) Fish was the last course that day.	(1) 她选读了一门哲学课程。 (2) 她正在上文秘课程。 (3) 电视台最近开设了英语讲座。 (4) 事态依自然进程发展。 (5) 现在我们就来说明这种变化的过程。 (6) 他们在谈话过程中争论起来。 (7) 我们是朝正北方向航行。 (8) 那天, 鱼是最后一道菜。
court n.法院；庭院；宫廷；球场；奉承 v.献殷勤；追求；招致；设法获得	(1) Sherman recommended that Clarke be disciplined, but higher-ups rejected the idea. (2) My court is deserted but I do not care. (3) The court of King Solomon was noted for its splendor. (4) The court moves to the country in the summer. (5) The two players entered the court hand in hand. (6) He has been courting the director, hoping to get the leading role in the play. (7) The young man courted the young lady by bring her flowers every day. (8) He courted disaster by getting mixed up with criminal types. (9) He courted the audience's affection.	(1) 谢尔曼建议对克拉克进行纪律惩戒，但高层拒绝了这个意见。 (2) 我的庭院一片荒芜但是我无心照看。 (3) 所罗门国王的宫廷以其华丽著称。 (4) 夏天王室上下都移居到乡下去。 (5) 两位运动员手拉手地进入球场。 (6) 他一直在讨好导演，想在剧中扮演主角。 (7) 那青年通过每天给那女子送花而向她求爱。 (8) 他因与犯罪分子鬼混而招致灾祸。 (9) 他博取观众的喜爱。
courtyard n.庭院；院子	(1) The courtyard was shaded by high trees. (2) Rise at dawn and sweep the courtyard. (3) The hotel is built round a courtyard, with fountain and palm tree. (4) These bricks are to pave the courtyard. (5) The children always racket about in the courtyard. (6) This gate leads into the courtyard.	(1) 庭院荫庇在大树下。 (2) 黎明即起，洒扫庭除。 (3) 这家饭店围绕一庭院而建，辅以泉水和棕榈树。 (4) 这些砖要用来铺院子。 (5) 孩子们总是在院子里吵吵闹闹。 (6) 这门通向院子。
cowboy n.牛仔	(1) The cowboy lives an idle life. (2) One evening the school put on a cowboy film.	(1) 牛仔过着悠闲的生活。 (2) 有天晚上学校放映了一部牛仔片。
crayon n.蜡笔；蜡笔画 v.以蜡笔作画	(1) The baby daubed up the wall with his crayon. (2) The boy wants to draw in crayon.	(1) 小孩用蜡笔把墙上画得斑斑点点。 (2) 这个男孩想用蜡笔画画。
crazy adj.疯狂的；荒唐的；着迷的 n.荒唐的人 adv.疯狂地	(1) It drives me crazy. (2) The mother of the kidnapped child was crazy with worry. (3) What started him off on this crazy idea? (4) I'm crazy about English. (5) The kids went crazy when the film star appeared.	(1) 它使我快要发疯了。 (2) 那个被绑架的孩子的母亲担心得几乎发狂了。 (3) 他这个荒唐的主意是哪儿来的? (4) 我非常喜欢英语。 (5) 那位影星一出场，孩子们欣喜若狂。
create v.创造；造成 adj.<古>创造的	(1) Some people believe that God created the world. (2) An artist should create beautiful things. (3) This is the kind of atmosphere we want to create. (4) That can create a vicious circle.	(1) 有些人相信上帝创造了世界。 (2) 一个艺术家应该创造美丽的东西。 (3) 我们就想造成这种氛围。 (4) 这会造成恶性循环。
creature n.生物；动物；人	(1) This creature lives in the depth of the ocean. (2) We can't see microscopic creature with naked eyes. (3) Pandas are precious creatures. (4) The old lady is such a dear creature. (5) He is a creature of habit. (6) The poor creature has had a hard life.	(1) 这种生物生活在海洋深处。 (2) 我们不能用肉眼看到微生物。 (3) 熊猫是珍贵的动物。 (4) 这位老太太是位非常可爱的人。 (5) 他是个墨守成规的人。 (6) 这可怜的人一直过着艰苦的生活。
crime n.犯罪；恶行	(1) He was acquitted of the crime. (2) His addiction to drugs propelled him towards a life of crime. (3) The government is alarmed by the dramatic increase in violent crime. (4) It's a crime the way he bullies his children. (5) It's a crime to neglect such a lovely garden. (6) Murder is a vile and loathsome crime. (7) Religion is often made the covert of crime.	(1) 他被宣告无罪。 (2) 他吸毒成瘾使他走上了犯罪的道路。 (3) 政府对暴力犯罪案件的急剧增加感到担心。 (4) 像他那样欺负自己的孩子真缺德。 (5) 让这么可爱的花园荒废是极不应该的。 (6) 谋杀是邪恶而令人发指的罪行。 (7) 宗教常成为罪恶的护庇所。
criminal n.罪犯 adj.犯罪的；刑事的；违法的	(1) The criminal was sentenced to prison for theft. (2) Murder and stealing are criminal acts. (3) They were reinvestigating a criminal case. (4) We are placing your son in criminal detention. (5) The government has adopted practical measures for handling these kinds of criminal offenses according to law.	(1) 那个犯人因偷窃被判入狱。 (2) 谋杀和偷盗都是犯罪行为。 (3) 他们正在复查一桩刑事案件。 (4) 我们对你儿子实行刑事拘留。 (5) 中国采取了切实措施并依法严格查处这类违法犯罪案件。
crew n.全体船员；全体乘务员；(一组)工作人员；划艇队员 v.当船员；当机务人员	(1) The ship set sail after all the crew came on board. (2) The crew abandoned the sinking ship. (3) The plane crashed, killing all its passengers and crew. (4) The captain piped the crew down after work. (5) We are a happy crew in our office. (6) They were a motley crew. (7) The crew were rowed out at the end of the race . (8) The winning crew rapidly forged ahead.	(1) 全体船员上船后，船就开了。 (2) 全体船员离开了正在下沉的船。 (3) 飞机失事了，所有乘客和机组人员都遇难了。 (4) 船长吹哨让全体船员下班。 (5) 我们办公室的一伙人相处得很愉快。 (6) 这帮人成份混杂。 (7) 比赛终了时，划船队全体队员都划累了。 (8) 领先的赛艇队员拼命往前划。
criterion n.标准；准则	(1) Practice is the sole criterion for testing truth. (2) He thinks that the criterion of success is the ability to work joyfully. (3) We have a clear-cut criterion to go by. (4) The table shows the scoring for each criterion and criterion group. (5) The optimal systems differ according to the criterion chosen.	(1) 实践是检验真理的唯一标准。 (2) 他认为成功的检验标准是看能否愉快地生活。 (3) 我们有个可供遵循的明确标准。 (4) 上表显示每一准则和准则组别的评分。 (5) 按照所用准则之不同，最佳化系统便不同。
crossroads n.交叉路口；十字路	(1) The horse swayed left at the crossroads. (2) An accident happened at a crossroads a few metres away from bank. (3) The accident took place at the crossroads. (4) If you take the next turning to the right, you'll be able to head them off at the big crossroads.	(1) 在交叉路口，那匹马往左偏转。 (2) 在离一家银行几米处的一个交叉路口发生了车祸。 (3) 事故就发生在十字路口。 (4) 如果你在下一个拐弯处向右拐，你就能在大十字路口处拦住他们。
crowd n.人群；群众；大群；朋友 v.拥挤；挤满；涌入；贴近；逼迫	(1) We had to push our way through the crowd. (2) From across the fields came cheers of the crowd. (3) A large crowd was waiting at the bus stop. (4) A crowd gathered at the scene of the fire. (5) That's just what you get from hanging out with the wrong crowd. (6) Everyone in the restaurant crowded around them and started singing. (7) The room was crowded with guests. (8) Hundreds of people crowded the street. (9) Images of the accident kept crowding my mind. (10) A bevy of reporters crowded toward the candidate. (11) He crowded the debtor for payment.	(1) 我们得从人群中挤过去。 (2) 从田野的那一边传来群众的欢呼声。 (3) 一大群人在公共汽车站等候。 (4) 许多人聚集在火灾现场。 (5) 交错了朋友就是这样的下场。 (6) 餐厅里的所有人都挤在他们周围,开始放声高歌。 (7) 房间里挤满了客人。 (8) 大街上挤满了几百个人。 (9) 那场事故的情景不断在我脑海里涌现。 (10) 一群记者涌向候选人。 (11) 他催逼负债人还债。
crowded adj.拥挤的	(1) Guests were crowded into the few remaining rooms. (2) The robbery occurred in broad daylight, in a crowded street. (3) He tried to squeeze himself onto the crowded bus.	(1) 把客人都挤在剩余的几个房间里了。 (2) 在拥挤的街道上，光天化日之下竟发生了抢劫。 (3) 他设法挤上了那辆拥挤的公共汽车。
cruel adj.残酷的；残忍的；引起痛苦的	(1) The feudal barons were cruel to the people. (2) That emperor was a cruel despot. (3) The death of their daughter was a cruel blow. (4) He is a cruel assassin. (5) We shouldn't be cruel to animals. (6) In fairy stories, the ogre is cruel and eats people. (7) His cruel remarks cut me deeply.	(1) 封建贵族对人民很残酷。 (2) 那个皇帝是个残酷的专制君主。 (3) 女儿的死对他们是一个残酷的打击。 (4) 他是个残忍的杀手。 (5) 我们不应该对动物残忍。 (6) 在神话故事中，魔鬼很残忍而且吃人。 (7) 他那无情的话太伤我的心了。
cube n.立方体；立方 vt.求 ... 的立方 adj.立方的	(1) A cube is a three-dimensional object. (2) Three cubed is twenty-seven. (3) If you cube 1 0 , the result is 1 0 0 0 . (4) The National Aquatic Center is also called "water cube ".	(1) 立方体是三维物体。 (2) 三的立方是二十七。 (3) 如果你求10的立方，得出的结果是1000。 (4) 国家游泳中心又被称为“水立方”。
cubic adj.立方体的；立方的	(1) This box is a cubic object. (2) The volume of this container is 20 cubic meters. (3) What's the cubic capacity of this engine?	(1) 这个盒子是个立方体。 (2) 这个集装箱的体积是20立方米。 (3) 这台发动机的立体容积是多少？
cuisine n.烹饪；佳肴	(1) Chinese cuisine is very different from European. (2) I studied Greek cuisine for one year. (3) After that, they might end their day dining in a restaurant that serves Chinese cuisine. (4) The hotel restaurant is noted for its excellent cuisine. (5) The tourists decided to go native and sample the local cuisine.	(1) 中国烹饪与欧洲烹饪有很大区别。 (2) 我学了一年的希腊菜烹饪法。 (3) 然后他俩可能会去一家中国餐馆吃晚饭，以此来结束一天的活动。 (4) 这家旅馆的餐厅以美味佳肴闻名遐迩。 (5) 观光客们决定过一下土人生活并品尝当地佳肴。
culture n.栽培；文化；教养 vt.培养，栽培	(1) He has to learn the culture of bees. (2) She has studied the cultures of Oriental countries. (3) The culture of the mind is vital.	(1) 他得学养蜂。 (2) 她研究过东方各国的文化。 (3) 修心养性是极其重要的。
cure n.治疗；治愈；疗法；对策 v.治愈；治疗；纠正	(1) There is no effective cure for colds except rest. (2) There is still no cure for the common cold. (3) The cure for stress lies in learning to relax. (4) I tried every cure you can think of. (5) When I left the hpsoital I was completely cured. (6) The only way to cure backache is to rest. (7) He tried to cure his child of the habit.	(1) 除了多休息,没有有效的方法可以治疗感冒。 (2) 目前仍没有治愈感冒的良药。 (3) 消除紧张的方法在于学会放松。 (4) 我试过了一切能想到的解脱办法。 (5) 出院时，我已经完全痊愈了。 (6) 治疗背痛的唯一办法是休息。 (7) 他试着去矫正他孩子的那种习惯。
curious adj.好奇的；奇特的	(1) I am curious how she will receive the news. (2) The boy was curious about everything he saw. (3) I caught a curious sound in the neighboring room. (4) It's curious that he didn't tell you.	(1) 我很想知道她如何接受那消息。 (2) 那男孩对所见的一切都感到好奇。 (3) 我听到隔壁房间里有奇怪的响声。 (4) 他没有告诉你，实在反常。
currency n.货币；流通	(1) The president proclaimed that a new currency would be issued. (2) Our currency will not be depreciated. (3) There are currency restrictions on the sums allowed for foreign travel. (4) The word has attained general currency.	(1) 总统宣布将发行新货币。 (2) 我们的货币不会贬值。 (3) 到国外旅行允许携带的款额有所限制。 (4) 这个词已经通用起来了。
curriculum n.全部课程；课程	(1) Our curriculum comprises Politics, Chinese, English and History. (2) Our mathematics curriculum is much more complicated now.	(1) 我们的课程共有四门：政治、汉语、英语、历史。 (2) 我们的数学课现在复杂得多了。
curtain n.窗帘；门帘；幕(布) vt.(用帘)装饰；(以帘)遮蔽	(1) The curtain was suddenly drawn and a bright light shone in. (2) She came upon a low curtain she had not noticed before. (3) She kept peering through the side curtain. (4) The curtain rose to disclose a stunning set. (5) I bought enough material to curtain the house. (6) Night could not curtain his guilt. (7) We can curtain off each bed in the hospital.	(1) 突然窗帘拉了开来，一道强光照了进来。 (2) 她发现刚才没有注意到的一个低垂的门帘。 (3) 她不时地从旁边的幕帐向外窥视。 (4) 布帘被揭开暴露出极好的布。 (5) 我买了不少布料，足够做房子的窗帘用。 (6) 黑夜无法掩藏他的罪行。 (7) 我们可以用布帘将医院内的病床每张隔开。
cushion n.垫子；橡皮软垫；缓冲 vt.加垫褥；放在垫子上；保护；减缓；为 ... 装垫子	(1) He covered the cushion with new material. (2) She embroidered the cushion with flowers. (3) A hovercraft rides on a cushion of air. (4) The bush acted as a cushion to my fall. (5) We are going to cushion the rocking chair so that it is more comfortable. (6) The kid poked holes in the cushion. (7) Amy reposed her head on a cushion. (8) We try to cushion our children from the hard realities of life. (9) His hat helped to cushion the blow. (10) Nothing can cushion the shock of the tragedy.	(1) 他给靠垫蒙上了新的料子。 (2) 她把垫子绣上了花。 (3) 气垫船悬浮在气垫上行驶. (4) 这灌木在我摔下时起了缓冲作用。 (5) 我们要在摇椅上铺软垫，那么就会更舒适了。 (6) 孩子们在垫子上扎了几个洞。 (7) 艾咪把头靠在垫子上。 (8) 我们试图保护我们的孩子们免受严酷的现实生活的煎熬。 (9) 他的帽子减轻了这下打击。 (10) 没有什麽能减轻那个悲剧的冲击。
custom n.习惯；风俗；惯例 （复）Customs: 海关；关税 adj.定做的；定制的	(1) The custom has now become a rule. (2) It is my custom to go for a walk before breakfast. (3) Custom rules the law. (4) The custom prevails over the whole area. (5) Please enter a name for the custom controller.	(1) 那种习惯现已变为成规。 (2) 早餐前出去散散步是我的习惯。 (3) [谚]风俗左右法律。 (4) 这风俗存在于这整个地区。 (5) 请输入自定义控制器的名称。
customer n.顾客；主顾；<口>家伙	(1) My father asked me to see the customer to the door. (2) The new store across the road has taken away most of my customers.	(1) 我父亲要我送顾客到门口。 (2) 路那边的那家新店抢走了我的许多主顾。
customs n.海关	(1) His father is a customs officer. (2) The customs asked me if I had anything to declare. (3) How long does it take to get through customs?	(1) 他父亲是一位海关官员。 (2) 海关人员问我是否有要报税的东西。 (3) 海关检查要用多少时间?
cycle n.循环；周期；自行车；摩托车 v.骑自行车；(使)轮转；(使)循环	(1) The seasons of the year make a cycle. (2) The business cycle experienced a sudden down. (3) A cycle of the sun takes a year. (4) I go to school by cycle every day. (5) There are thousands of cycle paths in Holland. (6) Her latest stunt is riding a motor cycle through a ring of flames. (7) I usually cycle home through the park. (8) It's easier to cycle with the wind behind you. (9) This machine automatically cycles. (10) You can press TAB to cycle through the windows.	(1) 一年四季构成一个循环。 (2) 商业周期经历了突然的萧条。 (3) 太阳循环周期需要一年。 (4) 我每天骑自行车上学。 (5) 荷兰有数千条自行车道。 (6) 她的最新特技表演是骑摩托车钻火圈。 (7) 我通常骑自行车穿过公园回家。 (8) 顺风骑车省力。 (9) 这台机器能够自动轮转。 (10) 你可以按Tab键循环切换窗口。
cyclist n.骑自行车的人	(1) The cyclist was run down by a lorry.	(1) 卡车把骑自行车的人撞倒了。
daddy n.<口>爸爸	(1) I've lost my daddy, ' the little boy cried/sobbed/wept/whimpered/wailed. (2) Because of the age difference, Rosemary's older companion had the reputation of being a sugar daddy. (3) `Give me a ride on your shoulders, Daddy.' (4) Daddy did all he could to fill my needs and desires. (5) The girl over there about six years old called him daddy.	(1) ｀我找不到爸爸了，＇小孩哭著[抽抽搭搭地/哭哭啼啼地/呜呜咽咽地/痛哭流涕地]说。 (2) 因为年龄的差异，罗斯玛丽的老男友有在少女身上滥花钱的老色迷之名声。 (3) ｀爸爸，让我在你肩膀上骑一会儿吧. (4) 爸爸尽一切可能来满足我的需求和欲望。 (5) 那边那个大约六岁的女孩叫他爸爸。
daily adj.每日的；日常的 adv.每日；天天 n.日报 (复)dailies：工作样片.	(1) He writes for the daily newspaper. (2) As a result, daily output has doubled. (3) Daily practice is the trick in learning a foreign language. (4) I need a holiday as a relief from the daily grind. (5) The bakery serves us with fresh bread daily. (6) The stores are open daily except on Sundays. (7) I like to read China Daily on my way home.	(1) 他为那家日报撰稿。 (2) 结果日产量翻了一番。 (3) 每天练习是学会一门外语的诀窍。 (4) 我需要休假以摆脱单调的日常工作。 (5) 面包店每天都给我们提供新鲜面包。 (6) 除了星期天以外,那些商店天天都营业。 (7) 我喜欢在回家的途中阅读《中国日报》。
dam n.水坝；堤；障碍物 v.筑坝；抑制(情感等）	(1) The dam was not strong enough to hold back the flood waters. (2) The village was swept away when the dam burst. (3) The water deepened after the dam was built. (4) The river keeps rising and the dam is threatened. (5) A dam is a barrier holding water back. (6) They are going to dam up the river to set up a hydropower station. (7) It's hard to dam up one's feelings.	(1) 水坝不太坚固，挡不住洪水。 (2) 村庄在水坝决堤时被冲走了。 (3) 堤坝建成后水已加深。 (4) 河水不断上涨，大堤出现险情。 (5) 水坝是防堵水的障碍物。 (6) 他们准备拦江筑坝建水电站。 (7) 一个人要抑制自己的感情是不容易的。
damage n.损害；损失；毁坏 vt.损害；毁坏	(1) The damage to the painting is the work of vandals. (2) Knowing all this, they made me pay for the damage. (3) The flood did a lot of damage to the crops. (4) Drinking and smoking can damage your health. (5) Be careful not to damage the priceless vase.	(1) 毁坏这幅画的事是恣意破坏公物的人干的。 (2) 他们尽管了解这一切,还是让我赔偿损失。 (3) 洪水毁坏了大量农作物。 (4) 饮酒和吸烟会损害你的健康。 (5) 当心别把那个贵重的花瓶打碎了。
damp adj.潮湿的；有湿气的；沮丧的 n.湿气；潮湿 vt.使潮湿；使扫兴 vi.变潮湿	(1) Damp wood doesn't burn well. (2) The building was cold and damp. (3) The cheese molded in the damp cellar. (4) The party was a bit of a damp squib. (5) The air of this room is impregnated with damp. (6) The damp has started the timbers. (7) Damp the cloth before you clean the windows. (8) The setback did not damp his zest.	(1) 潮湿的木头不好烧。 (2) 这房子又冷又湿。 (3) 乳酪在潮湿的地下室中长了霉。 (4) 这次聚会有些扫兴。 (5) 这房间充满着湿气。 (6) 潮湿已使梁木弯翘了。 (7) 在擦玻璃窗之前,把揩布弄湿。 (8) 挫折没有使他降低热情。
dare vt.敢；挑战；冒...的风险 vi.勇于；胆敢 aux.胆敢 n.胆量；挑战	(1) The gymnast dared a breathtakingly difficult move. (2) He dared me to jump over the river. (3) He dared his grandfather's displeasure when he left the family business. (4) I would do it if I dared. (5) I dare say you are right. (6) I dare not touch the flower for its tenderness. (7) If he dare say such a thing again, I shall knock him down. (8) Don't worry! I am just trying my dare. (9) He only entered the competition for a dare.	(1) 这位体操选手敢于做惊险的高难度动作 (2) 他激我跳过河。 (3) 他不顾祖父的不悦，放下了家族的生意。 (4) 如果我有勇气我就做。 (5) 我认为你是对的。 (6) 这花太娇嫩了，我不敢碰它。 (7) 如果他胆敢再说这种话,我一定把他打倒在地。 (8) 不用担心！我只不过在试试自己的胆量而已。 (9) 他只是因为受人激将才参加竞赛。
darkness n.黑暗	(1) She strained her eyes in the darkness.	(1) 她在黑暗中睁大眼睛看。
dash v.猛冲；猛掷；泼溅；匆忙完成 n.破折号；短跑；猛冲；冲	(1) He dashed across the street and ran towards me. (2) He dash the glass bowl to bit on a rock. (3) Don't dash the paint on the wall like that. (4) She dashed off a letter to her mother. (5) The dash is used in writing to show a pause. (6) Everything you need to convert your stock analog dash to a digital instrument panel is included. (7) They made a headlong dash for the door. (8) They made a headlong dash for the door. (9) I must just dash upstairs and run a comb through my hair.	(1) 他冲过马路，向我跑过来。 (2) 他对著石块把玻璃碗砸得粉碎。 (3) 别那样在墙上乱涂漆。 (4) 她给母亲匆匆写了一封信。 (5) 在写作上破折号用来表示停顿。 (6) 你所需要的一切转换您的股票模拟破折号的数字仪表板包含。 (7) 他们迅猛地向门口冲去。 (8) 他们迅猛地向门口冲去。 (9) 我得冲上楼赶紧把头发梳理一下。

dawn n.黎明；曙光；开端；破晓 vi.开始出现；破晓；逐渐明白	(1) We set sail at dawn and headed for New York. (2) Diana aroused them just before dawn. (3) I can see the dawn of the better day for humanity. (4) The sky was pink with the first glimmer of the dawn. (5) We look forward to the dawn of better days. (6) The marchers jumped off at the crack of dawn. (7) Dawn was breaking when we came back to the camp. (8) Break of dawn, there's no sun up in the sky. (9) A new era is dawning. (10) It began to dawn after the long night. (11) The truth began to dawn upon him. (12) It didn't dawn on me that I was getting the bum's rush.	(1) 我们在黎明起程，直驶纽约。 (2) 戴安娜在黎明前唤醒了他们。 (3) 我已经看到了人类美好日子的曙光。 (4) 天空因第一丝曙光而呈淡红色。 (5) 我们期待较好的日子的来临。 (6) 行军队伍在破晓时出发了。 (7) 当我们返回营地时，天刚破晓。 (8) 破晓时分,天空还没有太阳。 (9) 一个新的时代开始出现了。 (10) 漫漫长夜之后天开始亮起来。 (11) 他开始明白那道理。 (12) 我不明白，我竟要被赶走。
daylight n.日光；白昼；黎明	(1) One of their big weaknesses is daylight. (2) Daylight robberies were of frequent occurrence. (3) A diurnal animal hunts its food during daylight. (4) They saw gleams of daylight through the cracks. (5) During the holy month of Ramadan, devout Muslims abstain from food, drink and smoking during daylight hours as an act of sacrifice.	(1) 他们其中一个大弱点是日光！ (2) 白昼行窃已司空见惯了。 (3) 白天活动的动物在白昼时猎食。 (4) 他们从缝隙中看到了黎明的曙光。 (5) 在回教神圣的斋戒月间，虔诚的回教徒为求牺牲，黎明到日落间禁止吃喝和吸烟。
deadline n.最后期限；(鉴于边上的)警戒线；截止时间	(1) I hope we can finish this before the deadline. (2) She was working in haste to meet the deadline. (3) We pulled out all the stops to meet the deadline.	(1) 我希望我们能在最后期限之前完成这项工作。 (2) 她匆忙工作是为了赶上最后期限。 (3) 我们竭尽全力在截止日期前完成了工作。
debate n.辩论；讨论 vt.争论；思考 vi.辩论	(1) After a long debate, the house of commons approved the bill. (2) We had a long debate as to whether we should spend so much money on space technology. (3) Her resignation caused much public debate. (4) There has been heated debate about whether the film should be allowed. (5) He debated buying a new car, but didn't in the end. (6) This is a question that they have often debated.	(1) 经过长时间的辩论，下议院通过了议案。 (2) 至于我们要否花那么多钱在太空技术上,我们辩论了很久。 (3) 她辞职一事引起群众议论纷纷。 (4) 关于这场电影是否该通过,人们展开了热烈的讨论。 (5) 他思量很久是否买辆新汽车,但最后还是没买。 (6) 这是个他们常讨论的问题。
debt n.债务；恩情；负债状态；义务；罪	(1) He promised to pay his debt within a month. (2) If I pay all my debts I'll have no money. (3) We owe you a debt of gratitude for you help. (4) The company is deep in debt. (5) We'll run into debt if you spend more than our income. (6) You have an obligation to pay your debt to society. (7) Liabilities are the obligatio or debt that a busine must pay in money or services at some time in the future. (8) He's in debt to the extent of200. (9) They said that they would drop the charges if we paid off the debt.	(1) 他保证在1个月内偿还债务。 (2) 我若还请所有欠债就分文不剩了。 (3) 承蒙帮助，感恩不尽。 (4) 这家公司正负债累累。 (5) 要是你花的比我们挣的还多，我们就要欠债了。 (6) 你有义务偿还对社会的债务。 (7) 负债是指将来需用货币或服务偿还的债务或履行的义务。 (8) 请求为他犯的偷窃罪从轻量刑。 (9) 他们说还清欠款就可以顶罪了。
decade n.十年	(1) Prices have risen steadily during the past decade. (2) Several decades have elapsed since I graduated from the college. (3) I believed that this struggle is going to go on and it might well be decided in the next decade.	(1) 在过去十年里，物价一直在上涨。 (2) 我大学毕业已数十年了。 (3) 我相信这一对抗还将会持续下去，并可能在下一个十年中得出结果。
declare v.宣布（声明）；申报；声明	(1) I now declare this meeting open. (2) Britain declared war on Germany in 1914. (3) The customs asked me if I had anything to declare. (4) Do you have anything to declare, jewelry or cash? (5) He declared that he was innocent.	(1) 我现在宣布会议开幕。 (2) 英国在1914年向德国宣战。 (3) 海关人员问我是否有要报税的东西。 (4) 你有没有什么东西要申报?珠宝或现金? (5) 他声称自己是无罪的。
decline v.下降；减少；变弱；拒绝；倾斜 n.衰微；跌落；晚年	(1) I wish prices would decline. (2) The price of 14 inches TV set declined from 400 to 320 yuan each. (3) He spent his declining years in the country. (4) I must regretfully decline your kind invitation. (5) The wall declined slightly on account of the earthquake. (6) This decline in vigour with the passing of time is called ageing. (7) There is a sharp decline in unemployment. (8) The decline of sales embarrassed the company.	(1) 但愿物价下降。 (2) 14英寸的电视机每台从400元降到320元。 (3) 他在乡间度过晚年。 (4) 我很抱歉必须拒绝你的盛情邀请。 (5) 墙壁因地震而倾斜。 (6) 这种随着时间流逝的活力衰退就叫做衰老。 (7) 失业率急剧下跌。 (8) 销路下降使公司陷于财政困难。
decoration n.装饰；装饰品	(1) Such decoration was a typical feature of the baroque period. (2) A lot of money has been allotted to the decoration. (3) She put some decorations on the Christmas tree. (4) She'd put these whatnots in her hair as decoration.	(1) 这种装饰是巴罗克时期的特征。 (2) 装饰花了很多钱。 (3) 她在圣诞树上放了一些装饰品。 (4) 她把那些也不知道是什么的东西弄到头发上当饰物。
decrease v.减少；减小；降低 n.减少；降低	(1) They are making further efforts to decrease military spending. (2) His interest in this subject gradually decreases. (3) The government projected a tax decrease. (4) They tried to decrease the costs. (5) The new treatment led to a huge decrease in the number of deaths. (6) There has been a steady decrease in population in this city.	(1) 他们正在做进一步的努力来减少军费开支。 (2) 他对这门学科的兴趣逐渐减退。 (3) 政府计划降低税收。 (4) 他们设法降低成本。 (5) 新的疗法使死亡率急剧减少。 (6) 这个城市的人口在持续下降。
deed n.行为；事迹；[法]契约 vt.立契转让	(1) His deed claims our respect. (2) His deed revealed him to be a kind man. (3) We must take the consequences of our own deed. (4) This is the deed to John's plantation. (5) He affixed his seal to the deed. (6) The widow decided to deed the house over to her nephew before she died. (7) He decided to deed the ownreship of houses over to his youngest son.	(1) 他的行为值得我们尊敬。 (2) 他的行为显示他是个好心的人。 (3) 我们必须承担自己行为的后果。 (4) 这是约翰农场的契约。 (5) 他在契约上盖了章。 (6) 那寡妇决定在去世前把房子立契转让给她侄子。 (7) 他决定立契把房子所有权转让给最小的儿子。
deeply adv.深深地；强烈地；（颜色）浓浓地；（声音）低沉地	(1) He was deeply involved with the anti-drugs crusade. (2) I know that her condition hurt her deeply. (3) Now after a month had passed in quiet, undisturbed conditions, she felt more and more deeply the loss of her father, which was connected in her heart with the downfall of Russia.	(1) 他深深地涉入了反毒品运动。 (2) 我知道这深深地刺痛着她。 (3) 丧亲之悲痛与俄国危亡的印象，在事过一月之后的今天，在平静的生活中，在她内心愈来愈强烈地感觉到了。
defeat n.挫败；败北 vt.战胜；击败；使...不能实现	(1) He was depressed by his defeat. (2) This defeat was a powerful blow to the enemy. (3) The news of army's defeat cast a gloom over the town. (4) They are still wailing over their defeat. (5) It was a sound strategy to defeat the enemy. (6) I believe nothing can defeat you. (7) The test completely defeated me.	(1) 失败让他沮丧。 (2) 这次失败是对敌人的有力的打击。 (3) 军队败北的消息给小城蒙上了一层忧郁。 (4) 他们仍在为比赛失利而悲叹。 (5) 那是战胜敌人的良策。 (6) 我相信什么都打不垮你的。 (7) 这个测试完全难倒了我。
defence n.防御；答辩；防务	(1) They planned the defence of the town. (2) They took up arms in defence of their country. (3) The defence argues that the evidence is weak. (4) The defence must be filed and served in seven days. (5) She spoke up in defence of her beliefs. (6) The government has reduced its expense on defence. (7) Senior defence officials held private talks.	(1) 他们订出了该城的防御计划。 (2) 他们拿起武器保卫祖国。 (3) 辩护律师提出理由认为证据不充分。 (4) 答辩必须在7日内呈交和送达。 (5) 她大胆地为自己的信仰辩护。 (6) 政府减少了国防开支。 (7) 高级防务官员举行了秘密会谈。
defend v.防守；防护；辩护	(1) Some players are better at defending. (2) The union said that they would take action to defend their member's jobs. (3) He was afraid of being attacked by Liu Bei and Sun Quan, so he sent a troop to defend Jingzhou. (4) She demonstrated how best to defend oneself. (5) He undertook to defend this attitude.	(1) 有些运动员较擅长打防卫。 (2) 工会说他们将采取行动维护会员的工作权益。 (3) 他害怕刘备和孙权继续向他进攻,派人在荆州防守。 (4) 她示范最有效的自卫方法。 (5) 他开始为这一态度辩护。
degree n.学位；程度；度数	(1) He went down without taking a degree. (2) To do this job, you must have a degree in English. (3) She has also been affected, but to a lesser degree. (4) They cannot be trusted in the slightest degree. (5) Water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius. (6) A graph is regular if every vertex has the same degree.	(1) 他没获得学位就离开了大学。 (2) 从事这个工作你必须具有英语专业的大学学位。 (3) 她也受到波及，但程度较轻。 (4) 对他们一点也不能相信。 (5) 水在摄氏零度结冰。 (6) 如果一个图的每个顶点都具有相同的度数，则称它是正则图。
delay v.耽搁；推迟；延误 n.耽搁；延期；推迟	(1) It was impossible to delay her at such a crisis. (2) We decided to delay our wedding until next year. (3) Our plane was delayed by fog. (4) The weather is responsible for the delay. (5) Delay is not permissible, even for a single day. (6) There was a delay of two hours before the plane took off.	(1) 在这样一个紧要关头来耽搁她是不可能的。 (2) 我们决定把婚礼推迟到明年。 (3) 我们的飞机因大雾而误点了。 (4) 由于天气关系才耽搁了。 (5) 不得延误，即使一日亦不可。 (6) 飞机起飞推迟了两个小时。
delete vt.删除	(1) The attack is to wipe out data, to delete flies, or to format the hard disk. (2) Please delete my name from your list. (3) You cannot delete your standard resource.	(1) 常见的攻击方式是消除数据、删除文件或者格式化硬盘。 (2) 请把我的名字从你的名单上删除。 (3) 您不能删除您的标准资源。
deliberately adv.故意地；不慌不忙地	(1) You have deliberately acted against my wishes. (2) He's being deliberately obtuse. (3) She had deliberately shifted our relations. (4) She continued deliberately to toss the books severally upon the floor.	(1) 你故意和我的想法对著干。 (2) 他装糊涂。 (3) 她故意地改变了我们的关系。 (4) 她继续不紧不慢把书一本一本地往地上扔。
delicate adj.微妙的；精美的；纤细的；脆弱的；敏锐的；美味的	(1) The international situation is very delicate at present. (2) He persecuted me with various delicate questions. (3) She wears a dress with delicate lace. (4) The scientist needs some delicate instruments. (5) He has a delicate sense of smell. (6) They are the most delicate morsels.	(1) 目前的国际形势极其微妙。 (2) 他用种种微妙的问题把我难倒了。 (3) 她穿了一件带有精致花边的裙子。 (4) 这位科学家需要一些精密的仪器。 (5) 他嗅觉灵敏。 (6) 这些确是最好吃的部分。
delight n.高兴；快乐 v.(使)高兴；(使)欣喜	(1) She clapped her hands in delight. (2) The children were prancing about with delight. (3) He takes great delight in painting. (4) We delight in going for long walks in the country. (5) He delighted the audience with his performance.	(1) 她高兴地拍手。 (2) 孩子们高兴得蹦蹦跳跳。 (3) 他爱好绘画。 (4) 我们乐于去乡间远足。 (5) 他用他的表演使观众喜悦。
delighted adj.高兴的；快乐的 v.快乐；喜悦	(1) I'd be most delighted if you will. (2) Lennie's face broke into a delighted smile. (3) I am delighted to see all so happy. (4) The bear was delighted and began to dance happily. (5) He delighted the audience with his performance. (6) I am much delighted to be here today to officiate at the Opening Ceremony of the Tai Po Campus of the Hong Kong Institute of Education.	(1) 如果您愿意，我会非常高兴的。 (2) 伦尼的脸辗然露出高兴的笑容。 (3) 看见大家这么快乐我很高兴。 (4) 那只熊听了很高兴，就开始快乐地跳舞。 (5) 他用他的表演使观众喜悦。 (6) 今天我以喜悦和兴奋的心情，为香港教育学院大埔校园主持启用典礼。
deliver v.递送；发表（演讲）；交付；解救；生（孩子）；接生；履行；投掷	(1) The mailman delivers letters and parcels every morning. (2) He delivered a long prose. (3) We deliver the goods in batches. (4) Education delivered him from ignorance. (5) She delivered twins in the evening. (6) The obstetrician delivered the child. (7) I am certain that he will deliver on his promise.	(1) 邮差每天早晨递送信件和包裹。 (2) 他发表了一篇冗长乏味的演讲。 (3) 我们分批交付货物。 (4) 教育把他从无知中解救出来。 (5) 晚上她生了一对双胞胎。 (6) 产科医生替这个孩子接生。 (7) 我确信他会履行诺言。
demand n.要求；需求 v.要求；查问；需要	(1) Their demand is entirely justified. (2) The demand for coal begins to slacken off in the spring. (3) He had the impertinence to demand a raise. (4) The policeman demanded their names. (5) All these questions demand careful and detailed study.	(1) 他们的要求是完全正当的。 (2) 煤的需求在春天开始减少。 (3) 他竟冒失地要求增加工资。 (4) 那个警察查问了他们的名字。 (5) 这些都需要认真具体的研究。
dentist n.牙科医生	(1) The dentist told the boy not to eat too many sweets. (2) I have an appointment with my dentist this afternoon. (3) The dentist took out his bad tooth yesterday.	(1) 牙医告诫这男孩不要吃太多糖果。 (2) 我已约好今天下午去看牙医。 (3) 昨天医生拔掉了他的一颗坏牙。
department n.部门；系；科；处；局 n.知识范围	(1) He worked in community welfare department. (2) He works in the drapery department of the store. (3) He was elected the dean of our department. (4) The students of our department numbered in the hundreds. (5) The Immigration Department is tasked to exercise these functions. (6) Don't ask me about our finances: that's my wife's department.	(1) 他在社会福利部工作。 (2) 他在商店的纺织品部工作。 (3) 他被选为我们系的系主任。 (4) 我们系的学生总共有几百人。 (5) 入境事务处负责执行上述职务。 (6) 我们家的经济情况你别问我,那是我妻子的事。
departure n.出发；离开；分歧；新的尝试	(1) We made our departure in the early morning. (2) All the arrangements should have been completed prior to our departure. (3) Her arrival coincided with our departure. (4) Her sudden departure has disarranged my plans. (5) His way of doing things is a departure from the the standard procedure. (6) Working on a farm is a new departure for him.	(1) 我们一大早就起程了。 (2) 全部安排都应该在我们出发之前完成。 (3) 她来到时我们正好离开。 (4) 她突然离去打乱了我的计划。 (5) 他做事的方式与标准程序存在分歧。 (6) 对他来说，在农场工作是一种新的尝试。
depend vi.依赖；依靠；取决于	(1) Children depend on their parents for food and clothing. (2) He is a man whom you can depend on. (3) The country depends heavily on its tourist trade. (4) I have no one but you to depend on. (5) Everything depends on whether you pass the examination.	(1) 小孩依赖他们的父母供给衣食。 (2) 他是个你可以信赖的人。 (3) 这个国家的经济在很大程度上依靠其旅游业。 (4) 除了你，我没有可依靠的人。 (5) 一手取决于你能否通过考试。
deposit v.放置；(使)沉淀；存储；付(订金等)；寄存 n.存款；定金；堆积物；矿床	(1) Coarse crumb rubber is apt to deposit in asphalt. (2) The Nile floods the fields and deposits mud on them. (3) He deposits a sum of money in the bank each month. (4) I had to deposit 10% of the price of the house. (5) He deposited the case in the left luggage office. (6) Ten yuan is the minimum initial deposit. (7) You must pay a deposit if you want to reserve the room. (8) There is some deposit in the bottom of the cup. (9) We have found a promising iron deposit.	(1) 粗的橡胶颗粒容易在沥青中沉淀。 (2) 尼罗河泛滥，在田野上淤积一层泥。 (3) 他每月在银行存一笔钱。 (4) 我必须先付房价的10%25作定钱。 (5) 他把箱子放在行李寄存处。 (6) 最低的开户存款金额是十元。 (7) 你要预订房间,就得先付定金。 (8) 这只烧杯的底部有些沉淀物。 (9) 我们已经发现了一个有开采价值的铁矿床。
depth n.深度；深刻；深奥；深；厚度	(1) The young man dived to a depth of 40 feet. (2) Her latest poem has remarkable depth. (3) The child is being taught subjects that are beyond his depth. (4) Nobody knew the depth of her love for the child. (5) A tread depth of less than 1/16 inch is unsafe.	(1) 那个青年人潜到四十尺的深度。 (2) 她最近的那首诗极有深度。 (3) 现在教给孩子的学科都过于深奥。 (4) 谁也不知道她对这孩子的爱有多深。 (5) 台胎纹厚度低于1/16英寸则不安全。
design n.设计；图样；图案；目的 v.设计；计划	(1) This dress is of the latest design. (2) He chalked out a design on the blackboard. (3) The bedcover was quilted in a flower design. (4) His evil designs were frustrated. (5) He designed us a beautiful house. (6) How do you design your college campus life?	(1) 这件衣服是最新设计。 (2) 他用粉笔在黑板上勾划出一个图样。 (3) 床罩被缝成花卉图案。 (4) 他的罪恶企图未能得逞。 (5) 他为我们设计了一所很美的房子。 (6) 如何规划大学四年的学习生活?
desire n.渴望；愿望；欲望 v.渴望；向往；要求	(1) I am filled with the desire to go back home. (2) Young people have no desire to work for the government. (3) She desires for a breakthrough in her research. (4) Everyone desires to live in a world free of worries and pains. (5) We desire you to complete the work within one month.	(1) 我心中充满了回家的渴望。 (2) 年轻人没有在政府部门工作的意愿。 (3) 她渴望自己的研究能够出现突破。 (4) 每个人都向往生活在一个无忧无虑的世界里。 (5) 我们要求你在一个月内完成这项工作。
desperate adj.绝望的；不顾一切的；极其想要的	(1) I had no money left and was desperate. (2) They made a desperate plea for help. (3) His failure made him desperate. (4) The man lost in the desert was desperate for water. (5) He is desperate to get a job.	(1) 我一点钱都没有了,简直绝望了。 (2) 他们不顾一切地恳求帮助。 (3) 他因失败而铤而走险。 (4) 在沙漠中迷失方向的人极度渴望得到水。 (5) 他非常渴求得一职。
dessert n.甜食，餐后甜点	(1) I like to have ice cream for dessert. (2) Can I have some fruit instead of the dessert?	(1) 我喜欢在正餐后吃冰淇淋当甜点。 (2) 可不可以不要甜点改要水果？
destination n.目的地；终点	(1) We eventually arrived at our destination. (2) The parcel was sent to the wrong destination. (3) The coach followed a rather devious course to its destination. (4) The destination of bus No. 8 is the State University.	(1) 我们终于到达了目的地。 (2) 包裹送错了地方。 (3) 长途汽车要绕很多弯路才到达目的地。 (4) 8路车的终点是州立大学。
destroy v.破坏；杀死；消灭；摧毁	(1) If the tree falls that way, it will destroy the house. (2) We want to nurture the new project, not destroy it. (3) The new law operates to destroy our advantages. (4) He had to destroy the injured animal. (5) We must first of all destroy the enemy effectives. (6) Before they fled the country, the enemy vainly attempted to destroy all the factories. (7) An atom bomb would destroy a city.	(1) 这棵树向那边倒下就会把那所房子压坏。 (2) 我们要支持这个新工程，不要破坏它。 (3) 这项新法律损害我们的利益。 (4) 他只好杀死那个受伤的动物。 (5) 我们首先必须消灭敌人的有生力量。 (6) 敌人在逃往国外前，妄图把所有工厂都毁掉。 (7) 一颗原子弹能摧毁一座城市。
determination n.决心；测定；规定；(正式)决定；定位	(1) He was utterly ruthless in his determination to succeed. (2) The determination of the amount of iron in ore is very important. (3) The determination will aversely affect the outcome of the game. (4) In the event that an affirmative determination of dumping and injury is made, the undertaking shall continue consistent with its terms and the provisions of this Agreement. (5) The choice of a foster home was left to the determination of the court. (6) The determination of a name for the club took a very long time. (7) Conclusion Diagnosis is depended on qualitative determination of the pericardial effusion and level diagnosis by radionuclide lymphography. (8) The application of genechip based on bioinfomatics became a stronger tool for environmental microbial ecological study and gene determination of function enzyme.	(1) 他下定决心争取成功。 (2) 矿石中铁含量的测定是很主要的。 (3) 这个规定将逆转比赛结果。 (4) 如做出关于倾销和损害的肯定裁定，则承诺应按其条件和本协定的规定继续有效。 (5) 选择怎样的家庭抚养孤儿,将由法庭决定。 (6) 决定俱乐部的名称费了很长的时间。 (7) 乳糜性心包积液严重者可发生慢性心包填塞，诊断依赖穿刺积液的定性诊断和淋巴显像的定位诊断。 (8) 基因芯片技术的运用，成为环境微生物生态研究和功能酶基因定位的有力工具。
determine v.决定；决心；确定；测定	(1) Chance will determine the outcome. (2) I must now determine whether to meet him or not. (3) I am determined to find out the rights and wrongs of this matter. (4) An inquest was held to determine the cause of his death. (5) They used geology to determine likely sites for new oil wells.	(1) 机缘将决定结果 (2) 我现在必须决定是否要见他。 (3) 我决心查明这件事的真相。 (4) 为确定他的死因进行了审问。 (5) 他们运用地质学来测定新油井的可能位置。
development n.发展；开发；生长；进展；[摄]显影；新开发区	(1) The economic sanctions could not prevent the development of that country. (2) The main impediment to development is the country's large population. (3) The firm pumped money into the development of the new product. (4) The department has produced a feasibility report on the development project. (5) Inadequate food can stunt a child's development. (6) These vegetables are good for the healthy development of chilidren. (7) We have got the latest developments in foreign trade. (8) The development of the project was seriously impeded by a reduction in funds. (9) Can you have this roll of film develop and printed? (10) They are living in a commercial development.	(1) 经济制裁不能阻碍那个国家的发展。 (2) 发展的主要障碍是这个国家人口太多。 (3) 这家企业投入大量资金以开发这种新产品。 (4) 这个部门已经拿出了一份开发项目的可行性报告。 (5) 食物不足能影响儿童的发育。 (6) 这些蔬菜有益于儿童的健康成长。 (7) 我们已经得到了对外贸易方面的新进展。 (8) 由于基金削减工程进度严重受阻。 (9) 请你给这卷胶卷冲印一下可以吗？ (10) 他们居住在一个新开发区。
devote vt.致力于；奉献给；把...专用于	(1) You must devote your attention to your work. (2) After he graduated, he continued to devote himself to the research. (3) He devoted himself entirely to music. (4) He started to study ecology and decided to devote his whole life to the science. (5) He devoted a great sum of money to books.
