devotion n.虔诚；献身；奉献；热爱	(1) Through great effort perhaps he is just cultivating a little devotion. (2) We were deeply moved by their devotion. (3) His devotion to science is well known. (4) His devotion led him to the priesthood. (5) A career needs our devotion all our lives. (6) His devotion to music is plain to see.	(1) 尽管经过了很大的努力，他也许只是培养出少许的虔诚。 (2) 我们为他们的献身精神所感动。 (3) 他对科学的献身精神为人熟知。 (4) 他的信仰使他成为祭司。 (5) 一项事业需要我们毕生的奉献。 (6) 他对音乐的挚爱是显而易见的。
dial n.拨号盘；刻度盘；日晷；钟面 v.拨号；打电话	(1) The phone number is on the dial. (2) Please clean the telephone set including the dial. (3) The dial records very slight variations in pressure. (4) Can you read the number on the dial? (5) What is the good of a sun dial in the shade? (6) The clock dial is illuminated at night. (7) There was a dial that showed when the bus left. (8) Put in the money before dialing. (9) What number shall I dial to get long - distance ? (10) Is there any discount if I dial in the evening?	(1) 号码就在拨号盘上。 (2) 请将电话机清理一下,包括拨号盘。 (3) 刻度盘显示出压力有微小变化。 (4) 你能读出刻度盘上的读数吗？ (5) 日晷在暗中，如何起作用? (6) 那只钟面是夜光的。 (7) 那里有个钟面，指明开车的时间。 (8) 拨电话前先把钱放进去。 (9) 要打长途怎么拨号? (10) 晚上打电话优惠吗?
dialog n.对话；对白 =dialogue<英>	(1) At last there can be a reasonable dialog between our two governments. (2) The writer is not very good at writing dialogs.	(1) 我们两国最后终于能理智地进行对话了。 (2) 这个作家不太擅长写对白。
diamond n.钻石；菱形；棒球内场；纸牌的方块 vt.用钻石装饰	(1) She wore a diamond clip on her new dress. (2) The diamond ring on her finger glittered in the light. (3) Her bedroom curtains have a diamond pattern. (4) Mr Smith laid off a baseball diamond on the vacant lot. (5) You must play a diamond if you have one.	(1) 她在新衣服上戴了一枚钻石别针。 (2) 她手指上的钻石戒指在灯光下闪闪发光。 (3) 她卧室的窗帘有菱形的图案。 (4) 史密斯先生在空地上划出棒球内场的界线。 (5) 如果你有方块就必须出。
dictation n.听写；口述；命令	(1) The teacher gave the pupils dictation. (2) We have a dictation every English class. (3) I hated it if I ever had to take dictation from him. (4) The pupils wrote at their teacher's dictation. (5) She was tired of her husband's dictation.	(1) 教师让学生听写。 (2) 每次上英语课我们都进行听写测验。 (3) 如果我总是不得不作他的口授记录员，我会感到讨厌的。 (4) 学生按照老师的口述写下来。 (5) 她对丈夫的发号施令感到厌烦。
diet n.日常食物；规定饮食；节食 n.（日本等国的）国会 v.节食；照规定饮食；喂食	(1) Too rich a diet (ie Too much rich food) is not good for you. (2) You should eat more high-protein diet. (3) Her diet restricts her to 1500 calories a day. (4) The doctor says I've got to go on a diet. (5) He is on a diet to reduce some weight. (6) The Diet will have a long session. (7) The Japanese prime minister responded to the Congressmen at the diet. (8) You ought to diet and take more exercise. (9) We must diet and take more exercise. (10) She got so fat that she had to diet . (11) The diet of youngstock is a contentious issue as overfeeding or an incorrect diet can lead to problems in later life. (12) Longo and colleagues said animals fed a low-calorie diet live longer, in part because their cells can resist stress better.	(1) 吃太多油腻的食物对你身体不好。 (2) 你应该多吃些高蛋白食物。 (3) 她的规定饮食限制她每天摄入1500卡的热量。 (4) 医生说我得节食。 (5) 他正在节食以减轻体重。 (6) 国会将有长会期。 (7) 日本首相在国会对众议院进行了回应。 (8) 你应该节食并多做运动。 (9) 我们必须节食并多锻炼。 (10) 她太胖了,需要节食。 (11) 小马驹的饮食是一项有争议的问题因为过度喂食或饮食不正确会导致今后生活中出现问题。 (12) 隆哥和他的同事们说，喂食低热量食物的动物寿命较长，部分原因是它们的细胞可以更好地抗拒压力。
differ vi.不同；有区别	(1) They differ widely in their opinions. (2) Our ideologies differ. (3) They differ in size but not in kind. (4) Although our looks differ, we are both attractive. (5) We differ about moral standards.	(1) 他们的意见分歧很大。 (2) 我们的思想不同。 (3) 这些东西的区别只是大小不同而实质一样。 (4) 尽管我俩相貌不同，但都讨人喜欢。 (5) 我们对道德标准看法不一致。
difficulty n.困难；争议；麻烦	(1) He experienced great difficulty in getting a visa to leave the country. (2) He faced the difficulty with courage. (3) Have you any concrete thoughts on how to deal with this difficulty? (4) A difficulty has cropped up at work. (5) We accepted this arrangement without difficulty. (6) Why do you come to me with every little difficulty? (7) But now she was in another difficulty. (8) He will get into some trouble or difficulty, otherwise.	(1) 他申请出国签证经历了很大的困难。 (2) 他勇敢地面对困难。 (3) 处理这种困难你有什么具体的想法？ (4) 工作中突然出现困难。 (5) 我们毫无争议地接受了这个安排。 (6) 你为什么有一点小麻烦便来找我? (7) 但现在,她又遇到麻烦。 (8) 不然的话,他会招麻烦的。
digest n.摘要 vt.消化；理解 vi.消化	(1) The baby is too small to digest meat. (2) Saliva helps one chew and digest food. (3) It took me some time to digest what I had heard. (4) I have digested most of the important points in the book. (5) This rich food doesn't digest easily. (6) Fish is easy to digest when you're ill.	(1) 婴儿太小,吃肉不消化。 (2) 唾液能帮助咀嚼和消化食物。 (3) 我花了一些时间才把听到的东西弄明白。 (4) 我领悟了书中大部分要点。 (5) 这种油腻的食物不易消化。 (6) 生病时吃鱼容易消化。
department store 百货商店；百货公司	(1) In the department store you can buy all manner of things. (2) I got this cheap at a department store sale. (3) He works in a department store. (4) There are four emergency exits in the department store.	(1) 在这家百货商店你可以买到各式各样的东西。 (2) 我在百货公司特价廉售时买到了这件便宜货。 (3) 他在一家百货商店工作。 (4) 这家百货公司有四个紧急出口。
commercial adj.商业的 n.商业广告	(1) Do you fancy having a go at doing a commercial feature film? (2) The downtown area is zoned for commercial use. (3) They were much more realistic about its long term commercial prospects. (4) The Dole commercial is the first time Pfizer has promoted Viagra through television. (5) A good commercial puts across the attractive features of a product.	(1) 对制作商业的影片有没有兴趣? (2) 市中心被划出供商业用。 (3) 他们对它的长远商业前景更为现实。 (4) 多尔的广告是辉瑞首次通过电视推销伟哥。 (5) 好广告能突显产品吸引人的特徵。
dignity n.尊严；高贵；端庄	(1) He would do nothing beneath his dignity. (2) The real dignity of a man lies in what he is, not in what he has. (3) A man's dignity depends not upon his wealth but upon his character. (4) She bears herself with dignity. (5) There was something impressive about Julia's quiet dignity.	(1) 他决不愿意干任何有损自身尊严的事。 (2) 一个人的真正尊严在于他的品格，而非他的财富。 (3) 人高尚与否不取决於他的财富,而取决於他的品格。 (4) 她举止庄重大方。 (5) 朱丽亚的宁静端庄给人印象很深。
dilemma n.困境；进退两难	(1) The bad weather put us in a dilemma——shall we move on or go back?	(1) 糟糕的天气使我们进退两难——是继续前进呢,还是打道回府？
dimension n. 尺寸； 次元； 容积； 维度； 范围； 方面 vt. 标尺寸； 形成 ... 尺寸	(1) Height is an external dimension. (2) When a dimension's origin is in doubt use the datums specified. (3) The fifth dimension creates everything that is on earth. (4) The crystal extractors from that dimension cross through all dimensions. (5) The long dimension of the barrel vaults that form the building is parallel to the allees and contours, continuing the layered structure of the outdoor space. (6) The data in a dimension is generally read-only. (7) Parameter has more than one dimension. (8) The ensuing firefight was a new dimension of combat. (9) Certain researchers have conceptualized these motivations as being poles of a single dimension. (10) There is another dimension you haven't mentioned. (11) Except for the Export-Import Bank, it lacked an economic dimension. (12) We were told to dimension off the plots. (13) Dimension the shelves so that they fit securely into the cabinet.	(1) 高是外部尺寸。 (2) 当不能确定尺寸原点时，使用规定的基准。 (3) 第五次元创造了地球上所有的东西。 (4) 从那个次元的水晶提取器穿越所有的次元。 (5) 构成建物的长容积桶状圆拱平行于树列及等高线，且接连了外部空间的地层构造。 (6) 维度中的数据通常为只读数据。 (7) 参数具有一个以上的维度。 (8) 交火在一种全新的战斗范围内进行。 (9) 无疑的研究已经将这些动机概念化，并各自成为单独的范围。 (10) 这个问题还有一个方面你没提到。 (11) 除了进出口银行，它缺乏经济方面的内容。 (12) 吩咐我们在图表上标出尺寸。 (13) 把搁板刨成需要的尺寸以便它们可牢固地镶入贮藏橱中。
dine v.用正餐；进餐	(1) She told me she would have to dine with Helen that night. (2) Every weekend, we dine at a nice little restaurant in the neighbourhood.	(1) 她告诉我那夜她必须与海伦一起进餐。 (2) 每个周末，我们在附近一家别致的小餐馆进餐。
dining-room n.餐厅；食堂	(1) The ship's passengers are in the dining saloon. (2) Their dining room is very spacious.	(1) 船上的旅客在餐厅就餐。 (2) 他们的餐厅很宽敞。
dioxide n.二氧化物	(1) The carbon14 atoms oxidize to carbon dioxide which gets blown about and mixed up with lower atmosphere. (2) Soft drinks contain carbon dioxide. (3) Plants can absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen. (4) Acid rain is caused by sculptures dioxide spewed from factories and power plants.	(1) 碳14原子氧化生成二氧化碳，向四周散去并与低空的大气混合。 (2) 软饮料中含有二氧化碳。 (3) 植物可以吸收二氧化碳释放氧气。 (4) 酸雨的形成是从工厂和发电厂被排放的二氧化物引起。
dip v.浸；蘸；下沉；倾斜；掏取；浏览 n.浸泡；浸；蘸；倾斜；下降	(1) The boat dipped into the waves. (2) He dipped his pen in the ink. (3) The children like to dip their bread into the milk. (4) The sun dipped below the horizon. (5) The land dips gently to the south. (6) I've only had time to dip into the report. (7) On a hot day a dip in the sea is sheer paradise. (8) Would you like to take a dip in the pool? (9) The children like to dip their bread into the milk. (10) When you shoot an arrow of truth, dip its point in honey. (11) The road takes a dip round the corner. (12) Share prices have taken a slight dip.	(1) 小船沉没在波涛之中。 (2) 他拿钢笔蘸墨水。 (3) 孩子们喜欢把面包蘸牛奶吃。 (4) 太阳落到地平线下。 (5) 地面缓缓向南倾斜。 (6) 这份报告我只来得及浏览了一遍。 (7) 热天洗个海水澡是十分令人惬意的事。 (8) 你想在游泳池里小游一会儿吗? (9) 孩子们喜欢把面包蘸牛奶吃。 (10) 射出真理的箭，先在蜜里蘸。 (11) 那条路在转角处往下倾斜。 (12) 股票价格稍微有所下降。
diploma n.文凭	(1) He obtained a diploma in architecture. (2) The youth won his diploma after only three years.	(1) 他获得了建筑学的学位证书。 (2) 那青年仅用了3 年时间就取得毕业文凭。
direct adj.直接的；笔直的；坦白的 v.对准；指挥；指示；命令	(1) I' m in direct contact with the hijackers. (2) He is very direct, so you always know what his real views are. (3) The guide directed our attention to the other picture. (4) He directed the building of the new bridge. (5) I asked a little girl to direct me to the bus stop. (6) The general directed that the prisoners should be set free.	(1) 我与劫机者保持着直接的联系. (2) 他为人很直率, 所以你总能知道他的真实想法。 (3) 讲解员要我们注意另一幅画. (4) 他指挥修建这座桥。 (5) 我请一个小姑娘告诉我怎么去汽车站。 (6) 将军下令释放犯人。
direction n.方向；指导；用法说明；趋势；目标；管理	(1) Which direction does your room face? (2) The investigation was carried out under the direction of a senior police officer. (3) Simple directions for assembling the model are printed on the box. (4) Your life seems to lack direction. (5) The factory is under the direction of the government.	(1) 你的房间面向哪个方向？ (2) 调查是在一位高级警官的指导下进行的。 (3) 盒上印有装配模型的简要说明。 (4) 你的人生似乎缺少目标。 (5) 该工厂受政府的管理。
director n.董事；经理；导演；主管，总监；指挥者	(1) The board nominated him as the new director. (2) Her career culminated in her appointment as director. (3) I wouldn't advise you to go against the director. (4) He has a lot of pull with the managing director. (5) The director told the actress to have a rest. (6) The band director cued the drums to begin.	(1) 董事会指定他为新董事。 (2) 她一生事业的顶峰是当上董事。 (3) 我反对你和经理对着干。 (4) 他对总经理有很大的影响力。 (5) 导演叫这名女演员休息一下。 (6) 乐队指挥暗示鼓手们敲起来。
directory n.目录；工商名录；指南 adj.给予指导的	(1) He thumbed through the directory to look for her number. (2) He found their address in the telephone directory. (3) And here is our service directory.	(1) 他翻阅电话号码簿找寻她的号码。 (2) 他在电话薄里找到了他们的住址。 (3) 这是服务指南。
dirt n.污垢；泥土；灰尘	(1) He scoured off the dirt from the floor. (2) Wash the dirt off your hands. (3) The dirt was deeply ground into the floor. (4) The road petered out into a dirt track. (5) The windows were encrusted with dirt. (6) That piece of dirt is out of your eye now.	(1) 他擦去地板上的污垢。 (2) 把你手上的泥污洗掉。 (3) 污垢被深深地压到地板里面去了。 (4) 大道延伸到一条泥土小径。 (5) 窗户上覆盖了一层灰尘。 (6) 那粒灰尘已从你眼中取出来了。
disability n.无力；无能；残疾；不利条件	(1) His disability caused this thing to fail. (2) The accident caused a temporary disability. (3) The only disability in life is a bad attitude. (4) As a matter of fact, many people have a disability. (5) Her lack of experience is a severe disability . (6) Not speaking French in Paris is a real disability.	(1) 他的无能导致了这件事失败。 (2) 事故造成了短暂的机体无能。 (3) 生命中仅有的残疾是残疾的生活态度。 (4) 事实上，许多人身体都有某种缺陷。 (5) 她缺乏经验 (6) 在巴黎不会说法语真是个缺陷。
disabled adj.残废的；有缺陷的	(1) He was disabled from walking by the accident. (2) Now that he was disabled, his house had become a prison to him. (3) She is also intellectually disabled. (4) The disabled ship coasted the island, looking for a harbor.	(1) 由于车祸，他不能走路了。 (2) 因为他残废了，他的房子就成了他的牢笼。 (3) 她有智力障碍。 (4) 那艘损坏的船只在海岛沿岸航行以寻找港口。
disadvantage n.不利；不利条件；损害；损失	(1) The situation put us at a serious disadvantage. (2) If you don't speak good English, you'll be at a big disadvantage when you try to get a job. (3) The system puts the firm at a disadvantage because of its overmuch manpower. (4) My lack of practical experience was a disadvantage. (5) The other candidate's main disadvantage is her age. (6) A transaction between two parties ought not to operate to the disadvantage of a third.	(1) 形势使我们处于非常不利的地位。 (2) 你要是英语讲得不好，找工作时就会处于非常不利的地位。 (3) 由于过剩的人力，这一体制使公司处境不利。 (4) 我缺少实际经验是个不利条件。 (5) 另一候选人的主要不利条件是她的年龄问题. (6) 这句不对，应该是双方进行的交易不得损害第三方利益。
disagree v.不同意；不一致；有分歧；不适应；不适宜	(1) I disagree with you on this point. (2) Initially, I disagreed with his proposal, but later I changed my mind. (3) In some countries, people who disagree with the government are classed as criminals. (4) These two reports of the accident disagree with each other. (5) I disagree with her on that point. (6) The climate disagrees with me. (7) Some kinds of vegetables disagree with me.	(1) 我不同意你的意见。 (2) 起初我不同意他的提议,不过后来我改了主意。 (3) 在某些国家，凡是同政府持有不同意见的人都被视为罪犯。 (4) 这两篇关于事故的报道不太一致。 (5) 在那一点上我跟她有分歧。 (6) 我不适应这里的气候。 (7) 有几种蔬菜对我不适宜。
disagreement n.不合；争论；不一致	(1) We are not blind to the reality of disagreement. (2) The recent disagreement points up the differences between the two sides. (3) He had a loud disagreement with his boss. (4) Andrew was the arbiter of the disagreement. (5) There was apparent disagreement between their stories. (6) There's a lot of disagreement among politicians on this issue.	(1) 我们不会忽视意见不合的事实。 (2) 最近的争执清楚显示双方有分歧。 (3) 他和老板大吵了一场。 (4) 安德鲁是那场纠纷的仲裁人。 (5) 他们的说法明显不一致。 (6) 对这一问题，政治家们有很大分歧。
disappoint v.使失望；使破灭	(1) The result disappointed him. (2) Her decision to cancel the concert is bound to disappoint her fans. (3) I am sorry to disappoint your expectations . (4) I'm sorry to disappoint your plans.	(1) 结果使他失望。 (2) 她决定取消这场音乐会，肯定会使她的歌迷失望。 (3) 我很抱歉使你的希望落空。 (4) 我很抱歉妨碍了你的计划。
disappointment n.失望；令人失望的人或事	(1) She concealed her disappointment from her mother. (2) He tried to mask his disappointment with a smile.	(1) 她对母亲隐瞒了自己的失望。 (2) 他试图以微笑来掩饰他的失望。
disaster n.灾难	(1) They had led the country into economic disaster. (2) The disaster caused him to waver in his faith. (3) He spoke darkly of possible future disaster. (4) We are all pervaded with a sense of disaster. (5) Nothing but disaster would come from such a plan.	(1) 他们把国家带入了经济灾难中。 (2) 这件灾难使他对信仰发生了动摇。 (3) 他悲观地说将来可能大难临头。 (4) 我们普遍有大祸降临的感觉。 (5) 此一计划除了导致失败而外将一无所获。
discount n.折扣；贴现率 vt.打折扣；贴现；不全信；不重视 vi.贴现；减息贷款	(1) These goods will be sold at a discount. (2) We give 10 percent discount for cash. (3) The discount rate is set by the Fed. (4) The preferred project in this case depends on the discount rate, not the IRR. (5) That store does not discount at all. (6) But you must discount only the dividends paid on existing shares. (7) You must discount much of what he says. (8) We shouldn't discount the effect of AIDS. (9) But you must discount only the dividends paid on existing shares.	(1) 这些货物将减价出售。 (2) 现金付款，我们九折优惠。 (3) 贴现率是由联储决定的。 (4) 该例中，我们倾向选择哪个项目取决于贴现率，而不是内部收益率。 (5) 那家商店出售商品一概不打折。 (6) 不过你必须仅贴现支付给现有股东的股利。 (7) 他说的好些话,你必须打个折扣听。 (8) 我们不应低估艾滋病的影响。 (9) 不过你必须仅贴现支付给现有股东的股利。
discourage vt.阻碍；使气馁	(1) Inflation discourages saving. (2) A new law has been brought in to discourage racial prejudice. (3) Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates. (4) I was never discouraged against learning English. (5) He is easily discouraged by difficulties and obstacles.	(1) 通货膨胀阻碍储蓄的积累。 (2) 一项反对种族歧视的新法律已被提出。 (3) 不要让属下对你这样不拘礼仪。 (4) 我从未对学习英语失去信心。 (5) 他遇到困难和阻碍就容易泄气。
discovery n.发现；发现物	(1) The new discovery caused a great sensation. (2) New scientific discoveries are being made everyday. (3) A collector of rare insects will show us some of his latest discoveries. (4) Like many discoveries, atomic power can be used for good or evil.	(1) 这项新发现很轰动。 (2) 每天都有新的科学发现。 (3) 一位稀有昆虫采集家将给我们看一些他的最新发现。 (4) 正如人类发现的许多事物一样，原子能既可用来为善，也可用以作恶。
discrimination n.歧视；鉴赏力；辨别	(1) Discrimination against Blacks is still common. (2) We should not have racial discrimination. (3) You should rely on your own discrimination. (4) The furnishings in their house showed taste and discrimination. (5) He has the discrimination in making friends.	(1) 歧视黑人仍是普遍现象。 (2) 我们不该有种族歧视。 (3) 你应该相信自己的眼力。 (4) 他们家的室内陈设显示了主人的审美力和鉴赏力。 (5) 在交友方面他有辨别力。
disgusting adj.令人厌恶的	(1) That's disgusting. (2) His speech was long, tedious and disgusting. (3) His deceit is disgusting; he took everybody in! (4) His disgusting jokes gave everybody the pip. (5) His servile expression of praise for his employer was disgusting to me.	(1) 真讨厌。 (2) 他的讲话冗长，叫人反感。 (3) 他的欺诈手段令人憎恶，弄得人人上当！ (4) 他那些令人作呕的笑话弄得大家都不痛快。 (5) 他奉承雇主的那副卑屈的嘴脸令我恶心。
dislike v.不喜欢；厌恶 n.不喜爱；厌恶；反感	(1) We dislike to have anyone patronize us. (2) What do you dislike most about this movie? (3) I saw everything I began to dislike, in retrospect. (4) I saw everything I began to dislike, in retrospect. (5) I do dislike having her extremist ideas rammed down my throat. (6) He did not try to hide his dislike of his boss.	(1) 我们不喜欢任何人对我们以恩人自居。 (2) 这部电影你最不喜欢什么？ (3) 我看见的一切都让我开始厌恶了，回想起来。 (4) 我看见的一切都让我开始厌恶了，回想起来。 (5) 我十分厌恶她强加于我的那些偏激观念。 (6) 他没有掩饰自己对上司的反感。
dismiss vt.开除；解散；屏除；（法律）驳回	(1) If you are late again, you will be dismissed. (2) Let us dismiss and return in an hour. (3) We should dismiss all thought of revenge. (4) The justice dismissed his evidence out of hand.	(1) 如果你再迟到，你将被解雇。 (2) 让我们先解散,一个钟头后再回来。 (3) 我们应该屏除一切报复的念头。 (4) 法官当即驳回了他的证据。
disobey v.违反；不服从	(1) Many drivers disobey traffic rules. (2) Those who disobey must be punished by law. (3) She promised never to disobey him again. (4) He disobeyed his mother and went to the party.	(1) 很多司机不遵守交通规则。 (2) 违法分子必须受到法律的惩罚。 (3) 她答应不会再忤逆他了。 (4) 他不听母亲的劝告，参加了那次聚会。
distance n.距离；路程；远方 vt.与 ... 保持距离；把(对手)甩在后面	(1) He judged the distance to a nicety. (2) My house is four miles distance from the sea. (3) We can see a windmill in the distance. (4) A more appropriate stance would be for the leader to distance itself from the com-petitors. (5) Interestingly, there are several reasons why it is so important to distance oneself from the rest.	(1) 他判断距离很正确。 (2) 我家离海四英里。 (3) 我们可以望见远处有架风车。 (4) 作为领导者，一个较正确的姿态是在自己和对手之间，拉开距离 。 (5) 有趣的是,一定要拉开和其他人的距离,背后有很多原因。
distant adj.疏远的；遥远的；远房的；陌生的；远行的	(1) His stepson is still very distant towards him. (2) Her manner was cold and distant. (3) It snows all the year round in that distant little village. (4) This palmer came from a very distant place. (5) She is a distant cousin of mine. (6) They sat down to meat with a distant cousin of the house.	(1) 他的继子对他仍然很疏远。 (2) 她的态度冷漠而疏远。 (3) 在那个遥远的小村落里整年下雪。 (4) 这个朝圣者来自非常远的地方。 (5) 她是我的远房表妹。 (6) 他们便坐下来，同一个远房表亲一起用饭。
distinction n.荣誉；差别；优秀；对比；区分	(1) Keller received many awards of great distinction. (2) He had the distinction of being the first man to walk on the moon. (3) There is a fine distinction between the two words. (4) He passed the examination with distinction. (5) She had the distinction of being the first woman to swim the Channel. (6) This is a refrigerator of distinction. (7) There is a distinction between what he says and what he does. (8) I don't understand your distinction: surely all painting is art?	(1) 凯勒被授予很多殊荣奖。 (2) 他以月球上第一个行走而闻名于世。 (3) 这两个字之间有细微区别。 (4) 他以优异成绩通过考试。 (5) 她卓尔不群,因为她是第一个横渡英吉利海峡的女子。 (6) 这是一台优质电冰箱。 (7) 他言行不一。 (8) 我不明白你为什麽要有所区分,所有的绘画不都是艺术吗?
distinguish vt.区别；辨认；使显著	(1) Speeches distinguish human beings from animals. (2) It's important to distinguish fact from fiction. (3) The twins were so much alike that it was impossible to distinguish one from the other. (4) We should distinguish between right and wrong. (5) She distinguished herself by her coolness and bravery.	(1) 人类和动物的区别在于人会说话。 (2) 把现实与虚构区分开来是很重要的。 (3) 这对孪生子像得使人无法分辨。 (4) 我们应辨别是非。 (5) 她因头脑冷静、敢作敢为而为人称道。
distribute v.分配；散发；分布	(1) Please distribute books among the students. (2) We distribute handbills on the street every weekend. (3) Some types of plants are widely distributed. (4) The population is distributed in a very uneven pattern.	(1) 把书发给学生。 (2) 我们每周都要在街上散发传单。 (3) 有些植物分布得很广。 (4) 人口分布很不平衡。
district n.地区；行政区 vt.把 ... 划分成区	(1) This district used to grow cotton on a large scale. (2) We wish to be your agent in our district if the commission rate is favorable. (3) He was elected the district attorney. (4) The expressway rounded about the urban district. (5) The officials related have districted the city into three electoral districts.	(1) 这个地区过去大量种棉花。 (2) 如佣金率优惠,我们愿意做你方在我们地区的代理。 (3) 他被选为地方检察官。 (4) 高速公路环绕着市区。 (5) 相关官员把该市划分成三个选区。
disturbing adj.烦扰的；担心的；令人不安的	(1) We do not tell each other what is disturbing us. (2) He had a novel and disturbing experience last year. (3) Magritte's art persistently questioned, with a kind of disturbing humor, the conventions of painting.	(1) 我们不告诉彼此什么是烦扰的我们。 (2) 去年他有一次新奇而又令人不安的经历。 (3) 马格里特的艺术总是用一种令人不安的幽默对绘画的常规提出挑战。
diverse adj.不同的；多种多样的	(1) They are the people from diverse cultures. (2) Since then，she has played a diverse range of roles. (3) Their way of life is rich, diverse and rooted. (4) The program deals with subjects as diverse as pop music and Beijing Opera.	(1) 他们是些有着不同文化背景的人。 (2) 从那时起,她出演了各种不同的角色。 (3) 他们的生活方式丰富多彩,多种多样,扎根传统。 (4) 节目涉及从流行音乐到京剧这样形形色色的题材。
divide vt.划分；隔开；分割；[数]除 vi.分裂；分开 n.分水岭；分歧；分	(1) White lines divide the playing area into sections. (2) I hope this disagreement will not divide us. (3) Divide the cake into equal parts. (4) Six divided by two is three. (5) Class differences can divide a nation. (6) The cancer cells divide much more rapidly than the normal cells. (7) The train divides at York. (8) This led to a divide between the upper class and the common man that persists to a degree down to the present generation. (9) There is a deep divide between the two factions. (10) The racial divide between the city and its suburbs is deepening.	(1) 这些白线把赛区分成各个部分。 (2) 我希望我们不会因这分歧而对立起来。 (3) 把蛋糕分成等份。 (4) 六除以二得三。 (5) 阶级差异会造成国家的分裂。 (6) 癌细胞的分裂比正常细胞快得多。 (7) 这列火车在约克市调动车厢分途行驶. (8) 这导致上层社会和平民大众之间的隔阂，在某种程度上，这个隔阂持续到当代。 (9) 这两派之间有很深的分歧。 (10) 城区与周边地区的差异正在加深。
division n.划分；除法；部门；分开；师（军队）	(1) The divisions between the various classes of society are not so sharply marked as they used to be. (2) The boy has learnt to do division. (3) He works in the foreign division of the company. (4) There was a division of opinion on the matter. (5) They wiped out an enemy division.	(1) 现在社会上各阶级的划分不象过去那样明显了。 (2) 这个小男孩已学会做除法。 (3) 他在公司的外事部工作。 (4) 对于那件事意见分歧。 (5) 他们消灭了敌人一个师。
divorce n.分离；离婚 vt.使分离；与 ... 离婚 vi.离婚	(1) They demanded the divorce of the subsidiary from the parent firm. (2) Boredom is not a ground for divorce. (3) She has filed a petition for divorce. (4) Divorce has become an everyday occurrence. (5) He is unable to divorce fantasy from reality. (6) They proposed to divorce church and state . (7) Did he divorce his wife or did she divorce him? (8) Do not push me too far, or I will divorce you. (9) My information is they're going to divorce.	(1) 他们要求子公司与母公司分离。 (2) 日久生厌不能成为离婚的理由。 (3) 她已向法院申请离婚。 (4) 离婚已成为每天都有的事了。 (5) 他不能将幻想与现实分开。 (6) 他们提议将教会和国家分开。 (7) 是他要和他妻子离婚，还是他妻子要和他离婚? (8) 别逼人太甚，否则我要与你离婚。 (9) 我所得到的信息是他们打算离婚。
dizzy adj.晕眩的；(速度)极快的；困惑的 vt.使晕眩；使困惑	(1) The airplane climbed to a dizzy height. (2) Riding on merry-go-round makes me feel dizzy. (3) He likes to drive at a dizzy speed. (4) Those math problems made me dizzy. (5) The old woman was dizzied by the strong wind.	(1) 飞机爬到令人头晕目眩的高度。 (2) 骑木马让我觉得眩晕。 (3) 他喜欢开快车。 (4) 那些数学题弄得我晕头转向。 (5) 那位老太太被风吹得头昏眼花。
dormitory n.集体宿舍 n.【美】学生宿舍楼	(1) He hangs out in the school dormitory. (2) Every girl must sign in when she comes back to the dormitory. (3) He soon gets accustomed to dormitory life and make two or three friend. (4) Every dormitory houses 200 students. (5) There is a garden in front of the dormitory. (6) Over there stands the dormitory for you to live in.	(1) 他留在学校的宿舍里。 (2) 每个女生回到宿舍的时候都必须签到。 (3) 他不久就逐渐习惯了宿舍的生活并交了两三个朋友。 (4) 每一栋宿舍能容纳200个学生。 (5) 宿舍前面是花园。 (6) 那边就是给你们住的宿舍。
dot n.少量；小圆点；小东西 v.点缀；作小点记号 [计算机] 点.	(1) We are all fellow passengers on a dot of earth. (2) The ship became a mere dot on the horizon. (3) On the map towns were marked by a red dot. (4) The lake was dotted with little boats. (5) Colorful flowers dot the lush pastureland. (6) Small coastal towns dot the landscape. (7) You must cross your t's and dot your I's.	(1) 我们都是一小块土地上的过客。 (2) 船在远处的水平线上成了一个小点。 (3) 在地图上，城镇是用小红点标出的。 (4) 湖面上布满了小船。 (5) 五颜六色的花朵点缀在茂盛的牧草间。 (6) 沿海的小镇点缀着这一带的山水美景。 (7) 你得在字母t那写横线，而在i那点一个点。
doubt n.怀疑；疑惑；悬而未定 vt.怀疑；不信任 vi.不确定	(1) There is no doubt that we will be successful. (2) Although a very religious man, he is still troubled by occasional doubts. (3) The outcome of this discussion is still in doubt. (4) She was very angry with you, because you seemed to doubt what she had said. (5) She said that I was getting into the habit of doubting.	(1) 毫无疑问我们会成功的。 (2) 他虽然笃信宗教，但有时仍感到迷惘。 (3) 这次讨论的结果还未定。 (4) 她对你很生气,因为你似乎不相信她说的话,因为你似乎不相信她说的。 (5) 她说我渐渐地好像对什么都不确定。
downtown n.市中心区；市中心 adj.市中心的	(1) Most of the old buildings in the downtown were plucked down, and new ones erected. (2) A new skyscraper has been put up downtown. (3) The family lived far away from downtown. (4) Most of the old buildings in the downtown were plucked down, and new ones erected. (5) I have an apartment in downtown Manhattan. (6) She went so far as to rent downtown office space.	(1) 市中心的大部分建筑物都拆掉了，建起了新的房子。 (2) 市中心又建起了一座摩天大厦。 (3) 那家人住在离市中心很远的地方。 (4) 市中心的大部分建筑物都拆掉了，建起了新的房子。 (5) 我在曼哈顿中心区有一套住房。 (6) 她甚至还在市中心租用了办公地方。
downward adv.向下 adj.向下的；下降的	(1) She laid the picture face downward on the table. (2) The custom has continued from the 16th century downward. (3) He is on the downward path. (4) Share prices continued their downward trend.	(1) 她把那幅画正面朝下放在桌上。 (2) 这种风俗自十六世纪沿袭下来。 (3) 他正在走下坡路。 (4) 股票价格继续保持着下行趋势。
dozen n.(一)打；十二个 adj.一打的；十二个的	(1) How much are those apples a dozen? (2) He gave me a dozen of roses for my birthday. (3) I had bred a dozen of chickens. (4) There were about a dozen of them. (5) The turkey is large enough to feed a dozen. (6) My mother bought a dozen eggs. (7) They began by baking two dozen loaves. (8) The group leader supervises a dozen workers.	(1) 那些苹果一打多少钱？ (2) 他在我生日那天送我了一打玫瑰。 (3) 我饲养了12只小鸡。 (4) 大约有十二人。 (5) 那只火鸡大得足够十二个人吃 (6) 我妈妈买了一打鸡蛋。 (7) 他们通过烘烤两打的面包开始。 (8) 组长管十二个工人。
Doctor n.博士；医生 v.篡改，伪造；阉割	(1) He is a Doctor of Philosophy. (2) His illness was more serious than the doctor first thought. (3) How else can the doctor save him?	(1) 他是一位哲学博士。 (2) 他的病较医生原来以为的更严重。 (3) 医院还有别的方法可以救他吗？
draft n.草稿；草图；汇票；征兵 vt.起草；征兵；选秀 adj.酝酿中的	(1) He drew a draft of the car. (2) He has drawn up the design draft. (3) He drew a draft on a pad then began his formal work. (4) I propose issuing a time draft for US $ 100,000. (5) Use of the draft as a form of punishment has struck a sour note in some quarters. (6) Who will draft the indictment? (7) John was drafted into the Army last year. (8) There are very few players in the draft with his size, athleticism and skill set. (9) Also, teams do not receive any compensatory draft picks for players not offered arbitration. (10) The Authority may suggest any other proposal it thinks fit for inclusion into the draft corporate plan.	(1) 他画了一张汽车的草图。 (2) 他拟订了设计草图。 (3) 他在便笺簿上画了草图，然后就开始正式工作了。 (4) 我建议开具价值10万美元的远期汇票。 (5) 将征兵作为一种惩罚手段的做法在一些地区引起了反感。 (6) 谁将起草起诉状？ (7) 约翰去年被应征入伍。 (8) 选秀迟中像他这样尺寸的并拥有运动能力和技术的家伙可真不多。 (9) 还有就是，若原球队未提出薪资仲裁，则不会获得选秀时的补偿。 (10) 市建局可提议其认为适合包括在事务计划草案内的任何其他提案。
drag v.拖；拉；迫使；缓慢行进；进行过久；扯进；打捞 n.拖；拉；累赘；阻力 n.男子穿的女子服装	(1) He jumped into the river and dragged her to safety. (2) She dragged herself out of bed, still half asleep. (3) She always drags behind us. (4) The first hour of the movie really dragged. (5) I don't want to drag out this argument any further. (6) She dragged up that incident just to embarrass me. (7) They dragged the canal for the missing child. (8) The cat is really excited by the drag of the basket on the floor. (9) The drag of the his son up to top of the mountain exhausted him. (10) Walking is a drag--let's take the car. (11) High interest rates are a drag on the housing market.	(1) 他跳进河里,把她拉到安全地带。 (2) 她挣扎着起了床,还是睡眼惺忪。 (3) 她总是在我们后面吃力地跟着。 (4) 那部电影的前一个小时真的是过得很慢。 (5) 我不想再就这场争论进一步拖长下去。 (6) 她又扯起那件事故意想使我难堪。 (7) 他们用拖网沿运河打捞失踪孩子的尸体。 (8) 在地板上来来回回拖着篮子可着实让那只猫兴奋了一回。 (9) 把他的儿子拉上山顶可真累坏了他。 (10) 走路太费事了——我们坐汽车吧。 (11) 高利率是住房市场上的一个阻力。
drawback n.缺点；退税；退款；不利条件；弊	(1) The great drawback to living near a main road is noise. (2) Everything has its drawbacks. (3) Many people are talking about the impact of export drawback system reform on the economy in China these days. (4) The bad weather is a major drawback. (5) The only drawback to the plan is its expense.	(1) 住在大街旁最大的缺点是噪音。 (2) 凡事都有不足之处。 (3) 这些天来许多人都在讨论出口退税制度改革对我国经济的影响。 (4) 恶劣天气是一个主要的障碍。 (5) 该计划实施的唯一障碍是经费问题。
drawer n.抽屉；出票人；制图员；拖曳者 （复）drawers：内裤.	(1) He found the money secreted in a drawer. (2) There is a pair of scissors in the bottom drawer. (3) The drawer will write the check. (4) I'm not a very good drawer.	(1) 他找到了藏在抽屉里的钱。 (2) 最底下的抽屉里有把剪刀。 (3) 出票人将填写支票。 (4) 我不擅长绘图。
drawing n.图画；素描；绘图；拉伸 n.抽签 动词draw的现在分词形式.	(1) Join the dots up to complete the drawing. (2) You jogged my elbow and spoiled what I was drawing. (3) She studies one drawing of a nude girl. (4) This drawing shows what the front elevation of the house will look like when it is built. (5) The drawing may shift and the page may zoom out. (6) If the scores are still equal, ranking will be decided by lots drawing. (7) Barcelona ace Ronaldinho insists they're unconcerned after drawing Chelsea in their Champions League group last night.	(1) 顺点连线把图画好。 (2) 你撞到了我的手肘，弄坏了我正在画的图画。 (3) 她认真看着一个裸体少女的素描。 (4) 这张图显示这幢房子建成后正面的外观。 (5) 可以移动绘图并缩小页面。 (6) 如仍然相同，则以抽签决定名次。 (7) 昨夜在冠军杯的抽签中与切尔西分到一组，巴萨的王牌小罗称他们对这个形势没有什么想法。
dryer n.吹风机；干衣机；干燥剂 =drier.	(1) He bought an electric hair-dryer for Mary. (2) The clothes tumbled in the dryer. (3) I finally got my rebate for my washer and dryer. (4) She put her clothes in the dryer, so she could wear them this afternoon. (5) Proof the materials against shrinking in the dryer.	(1) 他给玛丽买了一个电吹风。 (2) 衣服在干衣机中翻滚。 (3) 我终于拿回我的洗衣机和烘干机的折扣金了。 (4) 她把衣服放在干衣机里，这样她下午就能穿这些衣服了。 (5) 根据干燥剂的缩水情况检查这些材料。
drill n.钻孔机；钻子；反复操练；播种机 v.练习；钻孔；(军事)训练	(1) The dentist's drill made a lot of noise. (2) Jack used a drill to bore a hole in the wall above the fireplace. (3) Today's art lesson came to an abrupt end when the gongs sounded for a fire drill. (4) You'd better set a goal before you start the drill. (5) There'll be a fire-drill this morning. (6) You should finish your English grammar drills in the class. (7) A plow equipped with a double moldboard that turns up the soil on each side of the furrow,often having an attached drill for seed planting. (8) Listen to the first paragraph, then let them drill in teams. (9) The workman is drilling in the wall. (10) We had to drill down 200 feet to find water. (11) The soldiers drill every morning.	(1) 牙钻发出很大的噪音。 (2) 杰克用钻子在壁炉上方的墙上钻孔。 (3) 今天的美术课因火灾演习的铃声大作而突然结束。 (4) 练习开始前，你最好设定一个目标。 (5) 今天上午有消防演习。 (6) 你应该在课堂上完成语法练习。 (7) 双壁开沟犁，犁头后部有两块曲面铁板的犁，可翻开犁沟两边的泥土，常附有播种机。 (8) 听第一段,然后分组练习。 (9) 工人正在墙上打孔。 (10) 我们只好往地下钻两百英尺找水。 (11) 士兵每天早上操练。
drown vi.淹死 vt.淹死；淹没	(1) The little girl drowned in the river. (2) If you can keep your head above water, you won't drown. (3) It is cruel to drown the cat in the river. (4) The band drowned our conversation.	(1) 小女孩在河里淹死了。 (2) 如果能让头露出水面，你就不会被淹死。 (3) 把猫淹死在河里是件残忍的事。 (4) 乐队的演奏声把我们谈话的声音淹没了。
drug n.毒品；药 vt.使服麻醉药；使服毒品；掺麻醉药（或毒药）于	(1) They were arrested for drug offences. (2) The man formed a habit of taking harmful drugs. (3) We are testing the efficacy of a new drug. (4) His medicine is a drug that can be injected or taken by mouth. (5) They drug the watchman and rob the bank. (6) The nurse will drug the patient before and during the surgery procedure.	(1) 他们因贩卖毒品罪而被逮捕。 (2) 这人养成了服用有害麻醉品的习惯。 (3) 我们正在测试新药的功效。 (4) 他的药可以注射或口服。 (5) 他们用药麻醉看守人，然后抢劫银行。 (6) 护士在手术之前和手术之中给该病人服药。
drum n.鼓；鼓状物；鼓声 vi.击鼓；连续敲击；引起兴趣 vt.灌输；击鼓；逐出	(1) The beats of the drum were steady and slow. (2) The oil flowed over the rim of the drum. (3) People in the village drummed for my being enrolled by Peking University. (4) He drummed on the table with his fingers. (5) He is going round firms drumming up interest in the project. (6) She drummed it into the children that they can't cross the road alone. (7) We drummed the captain off the ship. (8) Bob was drummed out of the army for his neglect of duty.	(1) 鼓声平稳而缓慢。 (2) 油从汽油桶的边缘流出。 (3) 村子里的人为我顺利地考取北京大学而击鼓欢庆。 (4) 他用手指咚咚地敲打着桌子。 (5) 他到各公司游说以引起大家对该项目的兴趣。 (6) 她反复地给孩子们说,他们不可以独自横过马路。 (7) 我们鸣鼓送舰长离舰。 (8) 鲍勃因玩忽职守而被逐出军队。
drunk adj.醉酒的；陶醉的 n.醉鬼；醉酒 动词drink的过去分词形式.	(1) He was obviously drunk. (2) The drunk man lost his pouch in the bar. (3) Men were drunk now with a kind of fury of contest. (4) Several drunks lay on the floor. (5) She also throws up to me the time I get drunk. (6) The drunk humiliates the gentleman.	(1) 他显然是醉了。 (2) 那个喝醉了的人在酒吧里丢失了钱袋。 (3) 现在人们在一种斗争的狂热中陶醉了。 (4) 好几个醉汉躺在地板上。 (5) 她还反复向我提我那次喝醉酒的事情。 (6) 醉酒使得这位绅士丢人现眼。
due adj.应有的；到期的；预定的；应付的 n.应得物；会费	(1) When it comes to giving due respect to the old people, she feels a bit uneasy. (2) If you're going to the library, would you mind returning this book for me? It's due today. (3) The English version of the novel is due for publication next year. (4) The Customer obligations to pay any due amount shall include all commissions, charges and other costs determined by the Company. (5) He received a large reward, which was no more than his due. (6) Paul haven't paid my dues yet.	(1) 说到给老人应有的尊敬,她有些不自在。 (2) 如果你要去图书馆的话,是否介意替我还一下这本书呢?它今天到期。 (3) 这部小说的英文译本预定明年出版发行。 (4) 客户有支付任何应付的金额的义务应包括公司规定的所有的佣金，收费及其他费用。 (5) 他得到了一大笔奖金,这只是他应得的。 (6) 保罗还没交会费。
dull adj.呆滞的；钝的；迟钝的；无趣的；暗的 v.变钝；迟钝	(1) Jack had all work but no play, making him a dull boy. (2) It's impossible to cut a pineapple with such a dull knife. (3) The mind becomes dull if the body doesn't get on exercise. (4) This book is rather dull. (5) The dying fire was throwing out a dull red light. (6) The heating was turned up high to dull his audience's senses. (7) She gave me some medicine to dull the pain. (8) The sensory nerves of this old man seem to dull.	(1) 杰克只学不玩,这使得他成为一个呆笨的孩子。 (2) 用一把这么钝的刀子切菠萝是不可能的。 (3) 要是身体得不到锻炼,头脑也会迟钝的。 (4) 这本书很枯燥。 (5) 将要熄灭的火发出暗红色的光。 (6) 暖气温度被调到很高，以至于听众的意识变得迟钝。 (7) 她给了我一些可减轻疼痛的药。 (8) 这位老人的感觉神经似乎不太敏锐了。
dusk n.黄昏；薄暮；幽暗	(1) The lights go on at dusk. (2) He usually goes out for a walk at dusk. (3) He works from dawn till dusk. (4) We made a landfall at dusk after three weeks at sea. (5) Dusk was brooding over the lake. (6) She was invisible in the dusk of the room.	(1) 一到黄昏灯就亮了。 (2) 他通常在黄昏时出去散步。 (3) 他从天亮工作到天黑。 (4) 在海上航行三周后的一个黄昏,我们看到了陆地。 (5) 薄暮正笼罩着湖水。 (6) 她在昏暗的房间里别人看不到她。
dust n.灰尘；尘土；粉尘 vt.去掉 ... 的灰尘；撒粉末于 vi.除尘	(1) The mirror is covered with a film of dust. (2) A thick layer of dust lay on the furniture. (3) She knocks the dust out of her coat. (4) The amount of the industrial dust is rather large. (5) I used a piece of rag to dust the wooden furniture. (6) Mum dusted the pan with flour. (7) It's dusty so we have to dust every day. dusty adj.满是灰尘的	(1) Sunlight filtered in through the dusty window.	(1) 阳光从满是灰尘的窗子透进去。

(2) The different varieties of the language are in a dynamic relationship with each other. (3) We are looking for dynamic persons to be salesmen. (4) A dynamic government is necessary to meet the demands of a changing society. (5) Dynamics is a discipline that cannot be mastered without extensive practice.	(1) 这一章是关于热能转化成动力的。 (2) 这种语言的不同变体间存在着动态的联系。 (3) 我们正在寻找充满活力的销售人员。 (4) 一个有活力的政府必须适应社会的改变。 (5) 动力学是一门不做大量习题就不能掌握的学科。

(4) This will have a negligible effect on the temperature. (5) The general effect of the painting is overwhelming. (6) It's the music to heighten the dramatic effect. electricity n.电；电学；电流；热情	(1) The electricity failure paralyzed the water supply. (2) The interruption of electricity made us unable to do anything. (3) While I was cooking supper the electricity went off. (4) Both students have made quite a few experiments on electricity.	(1) 停电使水供应陷于瘫痪。 (2) 电力的中断让我们什么也不能做。 (3) 我正在做晚饭时停电了。 (4) 这两个学生都做了不少电学实验。
elegant adj.优雅的；雅致的	(1) He strolled about, looking very debonair in his elegant new suit. (2) He proudly promenaded his elegant companion in the park. (3) The lady wears an elegant dark suit. (4) I like my clothes to be simple but elegant.	(1) 他穿了一身讲究的新衣服逛来逛去，显得颇为惬意。 (2) 他得意地领著他那标致的伴侣遛公园。 (3) 那位女士穿着雅致的深色套装。 (4) 我喜欢朴素但漂亮雅致的衣服。

(4) You didn't embarrass me in the slightest. (5) Eye contact may convey sincerity and attentiveness in Western cultures but too much eye contact may embarrass people in some Oriental cultures. (6) True, job interviews are rife with opportunities for you to embarrass yourself, but hiring managers are more forgiving than you might think.	(1) 她又扯起那件事故意想使我难堪。 (2) 他被很多债务弄得焦灼不安。 (3) 她的粗野行为可能会让你尴尬。 (4) 你一点也没让我为难。 (5) 在西方文化，目光接触能传递真诚和关注，但太多的目光接触在某些东方文化中则令人窘迫。 (6) 不错，面试中充溢了令人窘迫的陷阱，不过招聘经理可比你想象的要宽容。
embassy n.大使馆；大使全体人员	(1) The terrorists have occupied the Embassy. (2) A crowd had already collected outside the embassy gates. (3) Two attaches at the embassy were expelled from the country. (4) The consulate was upgraded to embassy status. (5) He works at the American Embassy in Moscow.	(1) 恐怖分子占领了大使馆。 (2) 使馆大门外已经聚集了一群人。 (3) 大使馆的两名随员已驱逐出境。 (4) 该领事馆已升格为大使馆。 (5) 他在莫斯科的美国驻俄大使馆工作。
emergency n.突发事件；紧急状态 adj.应急的；紧急的；备用的	(1) She has the ability to keep calm in an emergency. (2) We took the emergency in our stride. (3) Ring the bell in an emergency. (4) The rioting grew worse and the government declared a state of emergency. (5) He has made every arrangement to meet any emergency. (6) With these incidents, Tang Ying consulted experts from various vocations for measures in emergency. (7) There are four emergency exits in the department store.	(1) 她有处变不惊的本事。 (2) 我们泰然地处理了紧急情况。 (3) 情况紧急时请按铃。 (4) 骚乱恶化，政府只得宣布进入紧急状态。 (5) 他已作好了应急的一切准备。 (6) 通过这些案例，唐颖向各行各业的专家请教了很多自我防范和应急的方法。 (7) 这家百货公司有四个紧急出口。
emperor n.皇帝	(1) The emperor was actually a political eunuch. (2) The emperor conferred a title on the brave soldier. (3) He knelt in front of the emperor with a look of entreaty. (4) The general overthrew the last emperor of that country and established a public. (5) Napoleon called himself Emperor of the French.	(1) 那个皇帝实际上没有政治实权。 (2) 皇上授予这勇敢的士兵一头衔。 (3) 他面带恳求的神态跪在皇帝面前。 (4) 将军推翻了那个国家的最后一个皇帝，建立了共和国。 (5) 拿破仑自称为法国皇帝。
empire n.帝国；大企业；帝权	(1) He is the builder of the great empire. (2) The Roman Empire existed for several centuries. (3) Empire Qin is found in B.C. 221. (4) His business empire was truly vast. (5) He started off with one small factory, and now he's the head of an oil empire.	(1) 他是大帝国的创立者。 (2) 罗马帝国存在了几百年。 (3) 秦帝国建于公元前221年。 (4) 他的企业规模极大. (5) 他开始只经营一家小工厂，如今已成为一个石油大企业的头儿。
employ v.雇佣；使用	(1) They employ casual labor to pick the fruit (2) You must employ someone to oversee the project. (3) Why do you think we should employ you? (4) Different artists employ different painting techniques. (5) We employ different security techniques to protect the database.	(1) 他们雇佣临时工摘水果。 (2) 你得雇个人监督这一工程。 (3) 你认为我们为何要雇佣你? (4) 不同的画家会使用不同的绘画技巧。 (5) 我们使用不同的保护措施来保护数据库。
encouragement n.鼓励；激励	(1) Her encouragement gave me a great sense of uplift. (2) The teacher's words were a great encouragement to him. (3) They attribute their success to their teacher's encouragement. (4) You will never know how much your encouragement meant to me. (5) Your encouragement made me more confident of my future. (6) He gave us great encouragement to carry out the plan.	(1) 她鼓励我激发了我的上进心。 (2) 教师的话对他是极大的鼓舞。 (3) 他们把成功归因于老师的鼓励。 (4) 你决不会知道你的鼓励对我多么有意义。 (5) 你的鼓励使我对我的未来更加有信心。 (6) 他激励我们去实行该计划。
ending n.结尾；结局	(1) The story is flawed by a weak ending. (2) Write your own ending dear reader. (3) The writer contrived a happy ending. (4) She got revved up by the tragic ending of the film.	(1) 这个故事因结尾写得马虎而显得逊色了。 (2) 亲爱的读者，您自己来作一个结尾吧。 (3) 作者安排了一个大团圆的结局。 (4) 她为这部电影的悲惨结局激动不已。
endless adj.无止境的；没完没了的	(1) Endless desires eventually led him astray. (2) I can't endure your endless complaints anymore. (3) I am too busy to listen to her endless grievance. (4) We feel boring about his endless querimony.	(1) 无止境的欲望最终将他引入了歧途。 (2) 我再也不能忍受你无止境的抱怨了。 (3) 我太忙了，没空听她那没完没了的牢骚。 (4) 我们对他没完没了的埋怨感到厌烦。
enemy n.敌人；敌军；有害物	(1) The city is held by the enemy. (2) The enemy was forced to retreat. (3) This defeat was a powerful blow to the enemy. (4) In a frenzy of hate he killed his enemy. (5) The shield protected him from the blows of his enemy. (6) After several reverses the enemy was forced to retreat. (7) The enemy kept up their bombardment day and night.	(1) 这座城市已被敌人占领。 (2) 敌人被迫撤退。 (3) 这次失败是对敌人的有力的打击。 (4) 在一阵痛恨的狂乱中，他杀死了敌人。 (5) 这盾牌保护他免受敌人的打击。 (6) 几经失败之后，敌军被迫后撤。 (7) 敌军一直日夜不停地狂轰滥炸。
energetic adj.精力旺盛的；有力的；能量的	(1) His son is an energetic child. (2) He seems an energetic person. (3) Her wiry athletic body seems energetic. (4) We should give energetic support to agriculture. (5) I like to take some energetic exercise at weekend.	(1) 他的儿子是个精力旺盛的孩子。 (2) 他似乎是一个精力充沛的人。 (3) 她瘦长结实的身体看上去精力充沛。 (4) 我们要大力支援农业。 (5) 我喜欢在周末做些剧烈运动。
engine n.发动机；引擎；机车；火车头 vt.给 ... 装引擎	(1) What's the cubic capacity of this engine? (2) There must be something wrong with the engine of my car. (3) There was a puff of steam from the engine before it stopped. (4) Smoke rises from the engine as the train climbs a hill.	(1) 这台发动机的立体容积是多少？ (2) 我汽车的引擎一定是出故障了。 (3) 机车喷出一股蒸气后就停了下来。 (4) 火车向山上爬着,浓浓的烟雾从火车头升起。
enlarge v.扩大；增大；详述	(1) I have to enlarge my vocabulary. (2) I planned to enlarge this photograph. (3) We must enlarge our views by reading. (4) I needn't enlarge upon this matter; you all know my views.	(1) 我必须扩大自己的词汇量。 (2) 我计划放大这张照片。 (3) 我们必须以读书来增长见识。 (4) 我不需要详述此事; 你们都知道我的意见。
enquiry n.(=inquiry) 询问	(1) He's quite within his rights to demand an enquiry. (2) Various malpractices by police officers were brought to light by the enquiry. (3) I am sorry, I am not able to help you with your enquiry. (4) He makes an enquiry for the product. (5) They referred me to the Enquiry Office.	(1) 他完全有权要求进行调查。 (2) 警察的各种不法行为经调查已揭露出来。 (3) 对不起，我无法帮助回答您的询问。 (4) 他对产品进行了询问。 (5) 他们让我到问事处去问。
enterprise n.企业；事业；进取心；谋划	(1) This enterprise is now on a firm footing and should soon get profits. (2) They are involved in an exciting scientific enterprise. (3) We need a spirit of enterprise if we are to overcome our difficulties.	(1) 现在这家企业基础稳固，很快就会赢利。 (2) 他们投身于一项激动人心的科学事业。 (3) 如果我们要克服困难，我们就要有进取精神。
entertainment n.娱乐	(1) There are few entertainments in that town. (2) Television provides universal entertainment. (3) Wrestling is in a twilight zone between sport and entertainment. (4) This hotel is famous for its entertainment.	(1) 那个镇上几乎没有娱乐设施。 (2) 电视提供大众化的娱乐。 (3) 摔跤是介於运动和娱乐两者之间的活动。 (4) 这家旅馆以殷勤待客著称。
enthusiastic adj.热心的；热情的；热烈的	(1) He is enthusiastic about helping others. (2) He doesn't know much about this subject, but he's very enthusiastic. (3) The audience were enthusiastic on the opening night of the play. (4) His idea received an enthusiastic response.	(1) 他热心助人。 (2) 他对这事所知不多,但他非常热心。 (3) 那出戏首次公演之夜观众非常热情。 (4) 他的想法获得热烈的响应。
entire adj.全部的；完整的；全面的	(1) I am in entire agreement with you. (2) The entire population was wiped out by the terrible disease. (3) He wrote the entire play in only two weeks. (4) The foul odor penetrated the entire house. (5) This reservoir supplies the entire city with water.	(1) 我完全同意你。 (2) 所有的居民都被可怕的疾病夺去了生命。 (3) 整个剧本只花了他两个星期时间。 (4) 难闻的臭气弥漫于整个房间。 (5) 这个水库为全城供水。
entry n.进入；进入权；入口；条目	(1) He pretended not to observe our entry. (2) The people without a ticket are denied entry. (3) He has applied for an entry visa. (4) You can leave your umbrella in the entry. (5) This dictionary has over 30000 entries.	(1) 他装作没有看见我们进来。 (2) 没有票的人不许入内。 (3) 他已申请入境签证。 (4) 雨伞可放在入口处。 (5) 这本字典有3 万多词条。
envelope n.信封；壳层；封袋	(1) There are several enclosures in the envelope. (2) I use a prepaid envelope. (3) He glued a stamp onto the envelope. (4) The surface of the sun is a glowing gas envelope. (5) The papers are enveloped by plastic bag.	(1) 信封内装有几份附件。 (2) 我用了一个邮资已付的信封。 (3) 他把邮票贴在信封上。 (4) 太阳的表面是一层炽热的气体层。 (5) 论文用塑料纸包封好了。
envy v.羡慕；妒忌 n.羡慕；(妒忌的)对象	(1) They envy him his good fortune. (2) I envy her ability to dance in front of a crowd. (3) Don't envy anyone who lives better than you. (4) He was filled with envy at my success. (5) His new house was the envy of all his friends.	(1) 他们羡慕他的好运气。 (2) 她在众人面前所展现的的舞技令我羡慕不已。 (3) 不要妒忌比你日子过得好的任何人。 (4) 他对我的成功满怀羡慕。 (5) 他的新居成了所有朋友羡慕的对象。
equal adj.相等的；平等的 vt.比得上；等于 n.同辈；平等；(同等的)人或事物	(1) Women demand equal pay for equal work. (2) All countries, big and small, should be equal. (3) Nobody can equal him in intelligence. (4) They are my equals in age. (5) They refused to treat with us on equal terms. (6) We are campaigning for equal rights for women. (7) I am not your equal in strength.	(1) 妇女要求同工同酬。 (2) 国家不论大小, 一律平等。 (3) 没有人在智力方面能比得上他。 (4) 我和他们是同龄人。 (5) 他们拒绝在平等的基础上与我们谈判。 (6) 我们正在开展妇女拥有平等权利的运动。 (7) 在体力上我比不上你。
equality n.同等；平等；[数]等式	(1) In some countries black people do not have equality with white people. (2) Genuine racial equality still seems light-years away. (3) The country's constitution embodies the ideals of freedom and equality. (4) Martin Luther King made many adversaries in his nonviolent quest for equality. (5) In this paper, we give a algorithm for multiobjective programming only with linear equality constraint.	(1) 在某些国家黑人没有和白人同等的权利。 (2) 真正的种族平等似乎仍遥遥无期。 (3) 这个国家的宪法体现了自由和平等的理想。 (4) 马丁·路德·金在以非暴力手段寻求平等的过程中树立了许多敌人。 (5) 摘要给出了求解仅含有线性等式约束的多目标规划的一个算法。
equip vt.装备；具备；准备；穿 abbr.装备（=equipment）	(1) They can't afford to equip their army. (2) We must equip the army for the modern war. (3) He is equipped with much experience in teaching. (4) Could you help me equip the caravan? (5) Please equip yourself with a sharp pencil and a rubber for the exam. (6) Did she equip her daughter with the correct boots?	(1) 他们无力装备自己的军队。 (2) 我们必须装备军队打现代化战争。 (3) 他具有丰富的教学经验。 (4) 你能帮我准备好这辆旅行车上的装备吗? (5) 请准备一枝尖的铅笔和一块橡皮参加考试。 (6) 她给女儿买的靴子合脚吗?
equipment n.设备；装备；器材	(1) The government has an interest in importing scientific equipment. (2) We should make a better use of the existing equipment. (3) The equipment must be bought from a supplier approved by the company. (4) The Army is auctioning off a lot of old equipment. (5) I tried to fix the equipment but I failed.	(1) 政府对引进科学设备非常感兴趣。 (2) 我们应该更好地利用现有设备。 (3) 设备必须从公司认可的供应商那里购买。 (4) 军队正在把大量旧装备拍卖掉。 (5) 我想把机器修理好，但是失败了。
error n.错误；过失；误差；谬误	(1) He overlooked a spelling error on the first page. (2) An alert listener will have noticed the error. (3) Every man is liable to error. (4) The accident was caused by human error. (5) Human error invoked the disaster. (6) Error analysis of the measurement system is given. (7) After several repetitions there still remains an error. (8) Divination is made up of a little error and superstition, plus a lot of fraud.	(1) 他没有看出第一页中有个拼写错误。 (2) 耳朵尖的人能听出这个错。 (3) 人人都可能犯错误。 (4) 这宗事故是人为过失造成的。 (5) 人的过失带来灾难。 (6) 给出了次测量系统的误差分析。 (7) 重复数次之后仍然存在误差。 (8) 占卜是由一些谬误和迷信构成，再加上大量的欺骗。
erupt v.爆发；喷发；发疹	(1) Violence has erupted on the streets. (2) The demonstration erupted into violence. (3) An active volcano may erupt at any time. (4) It's many years since Mount Vesuvius last erupted. (5) A rash has erupted all over my back.	(1) 大街上突然发生了暴乱。 (2) 示威游行中突然出现了武斗。 (3) 活火山随时可能喷发。 (4) 维苏威火山上一次喷发至今已有很多年了。 (5) 我的背上出满了疹子。
essay n.论文；短评；散文；试图 vt.尝试	(1) This essay is admirable in all respects. (2) This essay represents a considerable improvement on your recent work. (3) The teacher geve an essay on his composition. (4) His essay was carried in the June number. (5) In my opinion, essay is more readable than poem. (6) She made her first essays at cooking. (7) He essayed to speak but was told to be quiet.	(1) 这篇文章在各方面都很值得欣赏。 (2) 这篇论文说明你最近的工作取得了相当大的改进。 (3) 老师给他的作文做了一个短评。 (4) 他的散文登载在六月号上。 (5) 在我看来，散文比诗歌更具可读性。 (6) 她初次尝试做菜。 (7) 他试图发言,但主席让他不要讲话。
Europe n.欧洲；欧盟	(1) Africa is exporting beef to Europe. (2) Greece is located in the south of Europe. (3) Ceding sovereignty to Europe is a political hot potato in Britain.	(1) 非洲向欧洲出口牛肉。 (2) 希腊位于欧洲南部。 (3) 对英国政坛来说，放弃欧盟主权可谓是一块烫手的热山芋。
European adj.欧洲的；欧洲人的 n.欧洲人	(1) Germany is a European country. (2) The French Revolution was a volcanic upheaval in European history. (3) The meeting once again underlined European reserve. (4) The Japanese have taken over many European ways of life. (5) She is the only European in the class.	(1) 德国是一个欧洲国家。 (2) 法国大革命是欧洲历史上的一次剧变。 (3) 这次会晤又一次突出表明了欧洲人的守口如瓶。 (4) 日本人已袭用了不少欧洲人的生活方式。 (5) 她是班上唯一的欧洲人。
evaluate vt.评价；评估	(1) Let's evaluate the evidence. (2) The school has only been open for six months, so it's too early to evaluate its success. (3) At the conclusion of the test run, evaluate the test results. (4) If you want to change the order of the questions in your survey, you should first evaluate any impact on the branching.	(1) 让我们评定一下此证据的价值。 (2) 这所学校开办还不过六个月，所以要对它的成绩作出评价为时尚早。 (3) 在测试完成之后,对测试的结果进行评估; (4) 如果您想更改您的调查中的问题的顺序,则应先评估对分支的任何影响。
eventually adv.最后；终于	(1) It was a long journey, but we eventually arrived. (2) He struggled with his assailants and eventually drove them off. (3) She eventually got back the book she had lent him. (4) Eventually the fire was under control.	(1) 旅程很长，但我们最后还是到达了。 (2) 他同攻击他的人进行搏斗，最后把他们赶走了。 (3) 她终于收回了借给他的书。 (4) 火势终于被控制住了。
everyday adj.日常的；平常的	(1) Slowly insidiously the fog of the everyday has returned to enshroud me. (2) In a bizarre profession anything which belongs to an everyday routine gains great values. (3) He is in his everyday clothes.	(1) 慢慢地，不知不觉地，日常的迷雾又回来笼罩了我。 (2) 从事不寻常职业的人，日常生活中任何一件极平常的事物对他都具有不平凡的价值。 (3) 他穿着平常的衣服。
evidence n.证据；证词；根据；迹象 v.证明；证实	(1) There wasn't enough evidence to prove his guilt. (2) Evidence weighted against the defendant. (3) It is a statement in conflict with other evidence. (4) Have you any evidence to support this statement? (5) Experiment shows no evidence of the production of explosive forces. (6) When the ship reached port, it bore abundant evidence of the severity of the storm. (7) His answer evidenced a guilty conscience. (8) The volcano is still active, as evidenced by the recent eruption.	(1) 没有充分的证据能证明他有罪。 (2) 证词很不利于被告。 (3) 这一陈述与其他证词不一致。 (4) 你这种说法有根据吗? (5) 实验表明,丝毫没有产生爆炸力的迹象。 (6) 船抵港时，船上满是受到暴风雨肆虐的痕迹。 (7) 他的回答证明他良心有愧。 (8) 正如最近的喷发所证明，火山仍很活跃。
evident adj.明白的；明显的	(1) Now it became evident that he spoke two languages at once. (2) Inertia is evident in our every day experiences. (3) The purpose may not be immediately evident. (4) The rationale for the present study is evident. (5) He looks at twelve children with evident pride.	(1) 现在我才明白，原来他心里一套表面一套。 (2) 惯性在我们日常生活中是很常见的。 (3) 这种目的不一定显而易见。 (4) 该研究的理论基础是明显的。 (5) 他带着明显的得意看着12个儿女。
evolution n.进化；发展；演变	(1) Charles Darwin and Alfred Russell Wallace discovered evolution independently. (2) Within 30 years,humans could be debating whether to take charge of their own evolution. (3) Our watchword is: ‘Evolution, not revolution’. (4) In politics Britain has preferred evolution to revolution. (5) Do you know about the evolution of a seed into a plant?	(1) 查尔斯·达尔文和阿尔弗雷德· 罗素·华莱士各自独立地发现了进化论。 (2) 不出30年，人类将讨论是否要掌控自身的进化。 (3) 我们的口号是: ‘要循序渐进,不要剧烈变革’。 (4) 在政治上，英国喜欢渐进而不喜欢革命。 (5) 你知道从种子发展成为植物的过程吗？
exact adj.精密严谨的；确切的	(1) She's a very exact person. (2) We need exact instruments. (3) What is the exact size of the room? (4) It was difficult to tell her exact age.	(1) 她是个一丝不苟的人。 (2) 我们需要精密仪器。 (3) 这个房间的确切面积是多少？ (4) 很难说出她的确切年龄。
examine vt.检查；调查；考试；仔细观察 vi.检查；调查	(1) The doctor examined her carefully. (2) Examine the account well before you pay it. (3) He was unable to examine the issue with detachment. (4) The teacher will examine the students in English. (5) He went to the Congo to examine a new volcano. (6) Examine the falsework of a house. (7) Right mouse button Examine game objects. (8) The OFT will also examine customer satisfaction. (9) It is necessary to examine how the proposals can be carried out.	(1) 医生仔细检查了她的身体。 (2) 在付款以前仔细核对一下帐目。 (3) 他不能客观公正地调查这一问题。 (4) 老师要考学生的英语了。 (5) 他曾去刚果察看一座新火山。 (6) 检查一座房屋的临时鹰架。 (7) 右键鼠标检查物品。 (8) 公平交易办公室也会调查顾客的满意度。 (9) 有必要调查一下怎样才能实施这些方案。
exchange v.交换；兑换 n.交换；交易所；兑换；交战	(1) May I exchange seats with you? (2) You can exchange your car at our nearest office. (3) We exchanged our opinions about the event at the meeting. (4) I'd like to exchange some pounds for dollars. (5) He gave me an apple in exchange of an orange. (6) It seems the exchange rate fluctuates almost daily. (7) A soldier was wounded in the exchange.	(1) 我和你调一个座位好吗? (2) 你可以到我们附近的公司换车。 (3) 在会上，我们就此事交换了意见。 (4) 我想把一些英镑兑换成美金。 (5) 他给我一个苹果，交换一个橙子。 (6) 外汇兑换率似乎每天都在上下波动。 (7) 一名士兵在交火中受伤。
excite vt.使兴奋；使激动；刺激；激起	(1) The good news excited everybody. (2) Nothing seemed to surprise or excite him. (3) Strong coffee excites your nerves. (4) The rumors excite her curiosity. (5) Your remark excited him to jealousy. (6) Some people are sexually excited by pornographic magazines.	(1) 这个好消息使每一个人都很兴奋。 (2) 好像他对什么事情都不惊讶或兴奋似的。 (3) 浓咖啡刺激神经。 (4) 谣言引起了她的好奇心。 (5) 你的话引起了他的嫉妒。 (6) 有的人看到色情杂志能激发起性欲。
exhibition n.展览；展示	(1) There will be an exhibition of the development of automobile industry in our country next week. (2) They came from afar to see the exhibition. (3) Such an exhibition of rudeness is absolutely unacceptable.	(1) 下星期将举办一个关于我国汽车工业发展的展览。 (2) 他们从远处赶来参观这个展览会。 (3) 这样无礼的表现是绝对不能接受的。
exist v.存在；生存；活着	(1) Most scientists believe that water doesn't exist on the surface of the moon. (2) That department has ceased to exist. (3) The old lady exists only on rice coffee and bread.	(1) 多数科学家认为,月球表面不存在水。 (2) 那部门已不复存在。 (3) 老太太仅靠咖啡面包生活。
existence n.存在；生存	(1) The newspaper ceased to appear after an existence of three months. (2) According to some philosopher, everything in existence is reasonable. (3) The family lived a precarious existence. (4) Pollution poses a threat to the continued existence of this species.	(1) 该报发行3 个月后停刊了。 (2) 某位哲学家认为，存在的事物都是合理的。 (3) 这家人过着朝不保夕的生活。 (4) 污染对这一物种的继续生存造成了威胁。
exit n.出口；退场 v.离去；退出	(1) At the roundabout, take the third exit. (2) I was eventually granted an exit visa. (3) He made a quick exit to avoid meeting her. (4) When he stands to exit, he turns and sees Michael for the first time. (5) At the end of the third scene the actress exits. (6) If I fail, I will exit the company.	(1) 在环状交叉路口，从第三条出路驶出。 (2) 我终于获得了出境签证。 (3) 他迅速离去以避免见到她。 (4) 当传教结束后，林肯起身离去时，他第一眼就看见了迈克尔。 (5) 该女演员于第三场结束时退场。 (6) 如果失败，我将退出该公司。
expand v.使 ... 膨胀；详述；扩张；增加；张开	(1) Metals expand when they are heated. (2) Would you expand upon the matter a little further? (3) They conferred on the best way to expand business. (4) Our foreign trade has expanded during recent years. (5) The petals of many flowers expand in the sunshine.	(1) 金属遇热则膨胀。 (2) 请你再进一步谈谈这件事好吗? (3) 他们商议扩展业务的最好方法。 (4) 近年来我们的对外贸易有所增加。 (5) 许多花的花瓣在阳光中绽放。
expectation n.预料；期望	(1) It is really out of my expectation. (2) His parents have great expectations for his future. (3) She had high expectations of what university had to offer.	(1) 这真是出乎我的意料。 (2) 他父母对他的前途深寄厚望。 (3) 她对大学所能给她提供的一切期望很高.
expense n.费用；花费；代价	(1) It's too much of an expense for me to own a car. (2) Societies should try to save every plant and animal species, regardless of the expense to humans in effort, time, and financial well-being. (3) Don't involve yourself in unnecessary expense. (4) He finished the job at the expenses of his health. (5) That's why a reduction in price can never be made at the expense of quality.	(1) 对我来说，拥有一辆汽车的花费太大。 (2) 社会应尽力挽救每一动植物物种,不管花费多少人力、时间和财力。 (3) 勿做不必要的花费。 (4) 他以牺牲健康完成了这项工作。 (5) 正因为如此,降低价格的同时,并不能以牺牲质量为代价。
experiment n.试验；实验；尝试 vi.尝试；做实验	(1) The researchers are repeating the experiment on rats. (2) The students will have an experiment in the laboratory tomorrow. (3) Fortunately, these folks love to experiment. (4) With Multiple Level Undo you can safely experiment with various what-if scenarios. (5) Small businesses are anxious to experiment with computers. (6) Is he any good at gardening? We might experiment with him. (7) Some scientists experiment on animals. (8) Don't experiment with such dangerous drugs.	(1) 研究人员用老鼠反覆做该试验。 (2) 学生们明天要在实验室里做实验。 (3) 幸运的是，你们喜欢尝试。 (4) 使用多级撤消可以安全地尝试各种假设分析方案。 (5) 小型企业都急于试用计算机。 (6) 他擅长园艺吗? 我们可以试试他。 (7) 有些科学家用动物做试验。 (8) 不要用这种危险的药物做实验。
explain v.说明；解释	(1) She explained her conduct to her boss. (2) He explained his plan in some detail. (3) The lawyer explained the new law to us.	(1) 她向老板说明了自己那种表现的原因。 (2) 他仔细地说明了自己的计划。 (3) 律师向我们解释了新法律。
explanation n.解释；说明	(1) I made a full and frank explanation to the court. (2) What did he say in explanation of his stupid behavior? (3) There could be some psychological explanation for his bad health. (4) That's not an adequate explanation.	(1) 我对堂上直话直说,从头到尾解释了一番。 (2) 他说了什么来解释他那愚蠢的行为？ (3) 他的健康不佳可能有心理上的原因。 (4) 这并不足以说明问题。
explicit adj.明确的；清晰的；清楚的；露骨的	(1) They gave explicit reasons for leaving. (2) He has an explicit understanding of this. (3) He gave me explicit directions on how to get there. (4) This film will never pass the censors, because it is too sexually explicit	(1) 他们明确地说出了离开的原因。 (2) 他对这个了解得很清晰。 (3) 他清清楚楚地告诉我怎样到达那里。 (4) 这部电影一定不能通过审查这一关,因色情过于露骨。
explode vi.爆炸；激增；爆发 vt.使爆炸；驳倒	(1) The bomb was timed to explode during the rush-hour. (2) When the boiler exploded many people were injured. (3) The firework exploded in his hand. (4) Investment in technology stocks exploded in the 1990s. (5) An active volcano may explode at any time (6) The children exploded three firecrackers. (7) Several scientific myths were exploded by Galileo's observations.	(1) 炸弹选在人最多时爆炸。 (2) 因锅炉爆炸，许多人受了伤。 (3) 那个爆竹在他手里响了。 (4) 二十世纪九十年代的,对科技股票的投资迅速增加。 (5) 活火山随时都有可能爆发。 (6) 孩子们燃放了三个爆竹 (7) 科学上的几种荒诞说法因伽利略的观测而被推翻。
exploit vt.剥削；利用；开发；开拓 n.功绩；英勇行为	(1) The capitalists exploit the workers in order to maximize profits. (2) You must exploit all your spare time to learn English. (3) People should read the related regulations before they exploit natural resources. (4) We should look for blank parts in the market and exploit new market continuously. (5) Great men are remembered for their notable exploits. (6) The daring exploits of the soldiers were much admired.	(1) 资本家剥削工人是为了使利润最大化。 (2) 你必须利用一切空闲时间来学习英语。 (3) 在开发自然资源前，人们应该先了解相关的规定。 (4) 我们应找准市场空白,不断开拓新市场。 (5) 伟人们因其丰功伟绩而被世人铭记。 (6) 战士们的英勇行为令人赞叹不已。
export n.输出；出口；输出品；输出存储器的信息 v.输出；出口；带走，运走；从存储器输出信息	(1) Prohibition was laid on the export of coal. (2) The company's gearing up for the big export drive. (3) Consultancy, insurance and tourism are also parts of the export trade. (4) Export had suffered during the last six months. (5) Oil has supplanted coffee as our main export. (6) The blood can also export waste products from the tissues. (7) Africa is exporting beef to Europe. (8) They sell to the home market,but they don't export.	(1) 禁止煤炭输出。 (2) 公司正为大规模输出作好准备。 (3) 咨询,保险及旅游也是出口贸易的一部分。 (4) 前6个月内，出口已蒙受损失。 (5) 原油已经取代咖啡成为我们的主要出口货物。 (6) 血液还能从身体组织里输出废物。 (7) 非洲向欧洲出口牛肉。 (8) 他们向国内市场销售,但不出口。
expose vt.揭露；使曝光；使面临；使暴露	(1) The reporter was killed because he tried to expose a plot. (2) I hate the paparazzi.They always expose the people's privacy. (3) We should not expose our children to horrors. (4) Keep indoors and don't expose your skin to the sun. (5) You shouldn't expose the soldiers to unnecessary risks.	(1) 这名记者因为试图揭露一个阴谋而被杀害。 (2) 我讨厌狗仔队,他们老曝光别人的隐私。 (3) 我们不应该让孩子看恐怖片。 (4) 待在室内,不要把皮肤暴露在阳光下。 (5) 你不应该让士兵们冒不必要的危险。
express n.快车；快递；专使 adj.明确的；急速的；直接的 adv.用快递 vt.表达；表示；挤压出；快递	(1) The express is as swift as an arrow. (2) We have to change here for an express. (3) I sent the letter by express. (4) Important documents will be sent by express. (5) Is there an express checkout service? (6) It is the most direct way to approach the transcendental state and the most subtle way to express spiritual energy in audible form. (7) The parcel was sent express. (8) Many theologies express the same ideas. (9) I wish to take this opportunity to express my heartfelt gratitude to you again. (10) The writer expresses his love for his motherland in his novels. (11) As soon as I receive payment I will express the book to you.	(1) 快车似箭一般地飞驶。 (2) 我们必须在这里换乘快车。 (3) 我这封信寄的是快递。 (4) 重要文件会以快递寄出。 (5) 有没有快速退房手续的服务 (6) 这是接近超自然状态最直接的方式，也是用声音来表达灵性能量最精微的方法。 (7) 这包裹是用快邮寄的. (8) 许多宗教理论表达同一种思想。 (9) 我借此机会再一次地向大家表示衷心的感谢。 (10) 作者在小说中表达出他对祖国的爱。 (11) 我一收到付款就会将书快递给你。
expression n.表情；表示；表达；词句；措辞；表现；挤压	(1) He always shows a doleful expression. (2) She gave expression to her sadness. (3) The scenery was beautiful beyond expression. (4) I haven't heard that expression before. (5) The colloquial word is a word or expression often used in informal speech. (6) Art has different forms of expression.	(1) 他总是露出忧郁的表情。 (2) 她流露出了悲伤之情。 (3) 那风景美丽得无法形容。 (4) 我以前从未听到过这个词语。 (5) 俗语是在非正式讲话时常用的字或措辞。 (6) 艺术有多种不同的表现形式。
extension n.延长；伸展；延期；扩充；观念发展；增强 n.电话分机；特别课程 n.[计]文件名	(1) This cord is not long enough! do you have an extension? (2) His leg was now capable of full extension. (3) He asked for an extension of his visa. (4) We built an extension to our house. (5) He sees local history as an extension of family history. (6) There are telephone extensions in every office. (7) Method will only return one unique file name per file name extension. (8) You can optionally filter the list by extension and keyword contained inthe file name, and also choose to include sub-directories.	(1) 这条绳子不够长！你有长一点的吗？ (2) 他的腿现在能够伸展自如了。 (3) 他申请延长签证有效期。 (4) 我们扩建了我家的房屋。 (5) 他认为当地的历史是每个人家庭历史的发展。 (6) 每间办公室都有电话分机。 (7) 方法对每个文件名扩展名只返回一个唯一文件名。 (8) 你可以按照包含在文件名当中的扩展名和关键字有选择地过滤列表，并且还可以选择包括子目录。
extra adj.额外的 n.额外之物；临时演员 adv.特别地	(1) There were so many people that the company put on extra buses. (2) Guests at this hotel can use the gym at no extra cost. (3) Her school fees are 440 a term; music and dancing are extras. (4) We need hundreds of extras for the battle scenes. (5) We'll give you an extra special discount for buying this merchandise.	(1) 人数太多，公司加开了公共汽车。 (2) 这家饭店的客人们可以使用健身房,不再额外收费。 (3) 她的学费是每学期440英镑，音乐和舞蹈课另外收费。 (4) 我们拍战斗场面需要上百的临时演员。 (5) 要是您购买这些商品,我们会给您非常特别的折扣。
extraordinary adj.非凡的；特别的；特派的	(1) He has an extraordinary memory. (2) His extraordinary skill was praised by all. (3) He is full of extraordinary ideas. (4) He is an a minister extraordinary.	(1) 他有非凡的记忆力。 (2) 他超凡的技艺博得了广泛的赞誉。 (3) 他满脑子都是离奇的想法。 (4) 他是一位特派部长。
extreme adj.极度的；极端的 n.极端；极限	(1) Extreme cold can wake a hibernating animal. (2) The extreme heat sapped his strength and health. (3) Extreme poverty had reduced them to a state of apathy. (4) The capital is in the extreme south of the country. (5) His political views are rather extreme. (6) Love and hate are extremes. (7) Starvation is at one extreme of the spectrum of food intake; obesity is at the other. (8) Extreme sports are a drug for him. (9) Another extreme sport is snowboarding.	(1) 极度的寒冷能使正在冬眠的动物苏醒。 (2) 极度的暑热逐渐损耗他的体力兴健康。 (3) 极端的贫困使他们万念俱灰。 (4) 首都在这个国家的最南端。 (5) 他的政治观点相当极端。 (6) 爱和恨是两个极端。 (7) 饥饿是食物摄入量的一个极端,肥胖则是另一个极端。 (8) 他酷爱极限运动。 (9) 另外一个极限运动的例子则是滑雪。
extremely adv.非常；极其	(1) I'm extremely sorry. (2) He knows the area extremely well. (3) He is an extremely frank person. (4) It pains me extremely to have to leave you. (5) This task is extremely difficult.	(1) 我非常非常抱歉。 (2) 他对这个领域了解的非常透彻。 (3) 他是个极其老实的人。 (4) 不得不离开你，这使我极感痛苦。 (5) 这项任务极其困难。
eyesight n.视力	(1) Is your eyesight failing recently? (2) The eye drops will help to improve your eyesight.	(1) 你近来视力有所变差吗？ (2) 这种眼药水能改善你的视力。
eyewitness n.目击者；见证人	(1) He was the only eyewitness of the robbery. (2) One eyewitness is better than ten earwitnesses.	(1) 他是那起抢劫案的唯一目击者。 (2) 一人目击，胜过十人听到。
f n.字母F	(1) That word is spelt with a PH, not an F.	(1) 那个字里的f音拼作PH而不是F。
facial adj.脸部的；面部的 n.美容	(1) She is having a facial massage. (2) The cream dissolves facial hair. (3) She wiped off the sweat from her face with a piece of facial tissue. (4) The scientists are studying facial proportions. (5) Each warrior has different facial expression and manner. (6) She had a facial at the beauty parlor. (7) I've made an appointment for a facial next week.	(1) 她正做脸部按摩。 (2) 这种化妆品能清除脸上的汗毛。 (3) 她用一张面巾纸擦掉脸上的汗水。 (4) 科学家们正在研究面部比例。 (5) 每个战士的面部表情和神态都不一样。 (6) 她在美容院做了一次美容。 (7) 我已经预约了下周去美容。
fade v.逐渐消失；褪色；凋谢 n.淡入；淡出	(1) Hopes of a peaceful settlement are now fading. (2) The closing music fades out when the hero rides off into the sunset. (3) As evening came the coastline faded into darkness. (4) Flowers soon faded when they have been cut. (5) They'll fade in to an outdoor scene. (6) The exterior beauty will fade as time goes by, but the interior temperament will never die.	(1) 和平解决的希望正在消失。 (2) 当男主角策马向夕阳驰去时，尾声音乐逐渐消失。 (3) 夜晚来临，海岸线融入茫茫夜色中。 (4) 花剪下后很快就会枯萎。 (5) 他们将淡入至户外的一个场景。 (6) 外表美将随着时间的推移淡出，但内部的气质，将永远不死。
failure n.失败；失败者；不及格；疏忽；失灵；未能；悲惨的事	(1) I shall have another chance in the event of failure. (2) The play was a dead failure. (3) I was a failure in my own eyes. (4) In a word, his failure in the final exam did not surprise me. (5) His failure stems from his carelessness. (6) We must try to cope with our own failure. (7) Policy failure is common in market economy. (8) He gloated over his brother's failure to win the prize. (9) His car was taken back because of failure to meet payments.	(1) 如果失败，我还有另一个机会。 (2) 这场戏完全失败了。 (3) 在我眼里,我是个失败者。 (4) 总而言之,他考试不及格并没使我吃惊。 (5) 他的失败是由于疏忽。 (6) 我们必须设法应付我们自己的疏忽。 (7) 在市场经济体制下,经常会出现政策失灵。 (8) 他弟弟未能获奖，他却幸灾乐祸。 (9) 由于未能按期付款，他的汽车被收回去了。
fair adj.公平的；晴朗的；美丽的; 相当的；（皮肤、毛发等）浅色的；白皙的 n.展览会；市集 adv.公平地，直接地	(1) He won the game fair and square. (2) The rainbow promises fair weather. (3) A foul morning may turn to a fair day. (4) The visitors spied the exhibits at the fair. (5) Do you want to pre-register the following Fair? (6) There is a fair in the town square. (7) I laughed at her at the fair, and this happened to me!	(1) 他赢得这次比赛是公平的。 (2) 虹预示晴朗的天气。 (3) 天气不好的早晨能变成晴朗的白天。 (4) 参观者细细察看展览会上的陈列品。 (5) 请问阁下是否有兴趣优先登记以下展览会？ (6) 市中心广场有个市集。 (7) 我在市集嘲笑了她，然后事情就发生了！
fairly adv.公正地；相当地	(1) This company deals fairly with every client. (2) I think I was quite fairly treated by the police. (3) It's fairly hot today. (4) His general state of health is fairly satisfactory. (5) We're not rich but we're fairly comfortable.	(1) 这家公司公正地对待每位客户。 (2) 我认为警察对我非常公正。 (3) 今天相当热。 (4) 他总的健康状况相当令人满意。 (5) 我们并不富有,但生活还较宽裕。
fairness n.公平；公正	(1) Ideas of fairness in taxation are usually nebulous. (2) Law was an order of peace founded on fairness. (3) The judge was a man of eminent fairness. (4) If children live with fairness, they learn justice.	(1) 公平这一概念在税收领域一向是模糊不清的。 (2) 法律乃是建立在公平基础上的一种治安秩序。 (3) 这位法官是非常公正的人。 (4) 公正中长大的孩子，极富正义。
faith n.信仰；信念；信任	(1) Christians profess their faith when they say the Creed. (2) Missionaries went far afield to propagate their faith. (3) The disaster caused him to waver in his faith. (4) He has great talent, but he has lost his faith. (5) Love asks faith and faith asks firmness. (6) I still have faith in John despite his shortcomings. FALSE adj.假的；人造的；不真实的；错误的；虚伪的 adv.欺骗地	(1) The impostor traveled on a false passport. (2) Lucy had a pair of false eyelashes today. (3) They lulled me into a false sense of security. (4) After several false starts, she became a successful journalist. (5) There is no time for false modesty.	(1) 那个伪装者用一本假护照旅行。 (2) 露西今天戴了一副假睫毛。 (3) 他们哄骗我，让我产生了一种虚假的安全感。 (4) 她开始时遇到几次挫折,后来成为能干的记者 (5) 没时间虚情假意地故作谦虚了。

(4) He looks so familiar but I can't remember his name. (5) She looked around for a familiar face. (6) The man was busy helloing familiar faces, shaking hands.	(1) 实际上我对当地的法律并不熟。 (2) 我对这首摇篮曲很熟悉。 (3) 这帮小学生对老师过于随便。 (4) 他看上去非常面熟，但我想不起他的名字来了。 (5) 她环顾四周想寻找一个熟人。 (6) 那个男人正忙著一边和熟人打招呼，一边握手。

(3) A fancy hairstyle will be great for a party. (4) He sells poor goods and charges fancy prices. (5) The store sells fancy fresh fruits. (6) The painting took his fancy, so he bought it. (7) I have taken a fancy to that new bicycle. (8) You have to discriminate between fact and fancy. (9) In the spring, a young man's fancy lightly turns to thoughts of love. (10) I fancy they're getting on well with each other. (11) I fancy that my friend will be all right. (12) He is not at all the kind of man I fancy.	(1) 我想买一个手提包不要花俏,而要耐用。 (2) 所有的眼神都注视那部新奇的车。 (3) 参加晚会梳个时尚发型很不错。 (4) 他出售的商品很糟,要价却非常昂贵。 (5) 这商店出售优质的鲜果。 (6) 这幅画被他看中了,所以他就把它买了下来。 (7) 我非常喜欢那辆新自行车。 (8) 你得分清事实与幻想。 (9) 春天,年轻人的想像力很容易转移到关于爱情的遐想上去了。 (10) 我猜想他们相处得不错。 (11) 我希望我的朋友平安无事。 (12) 他根本不是我所喜欢的人。

(4) They are bidding for our favour. (5) He stood down in favour of the other candidate. (6) We have to apply the same rules to everyone, showing no favour. (7) Of the two possible plans I favour the first. (8) I shall favour neither side in this election . (9) She always favours her youngest child. (10) A teacher should not favour any of his pupils . (11) The wind favoured their sailing at dawn. (12) China will support capital market that favour of hi-tech development. (13) Wouldn't you say he favors his mother?	(1) 本，你能帮助我吗? (2) 请你帮帮忙好吗? (3) 一般舆论都支持改革。 (4) 他们在寻求我们的支持。 (5) 他退出竞选，以支持另一位候选人。 (6) 我们不得不对每一个人都施于同样的准则，不带任何偏爱。 (7) 在这两种可行方案中我赞成前者。 (8) 此次选举中，我将不支持任何一方。 (9) 她总是偏爱她最小的孩子。 (10) 教师不要偏爱任何学生。 (11) 这风便于他们在黎明时航行。 (12) 中国将扶持有利于高新技术发展的资本市场. (13) 你难道不认为他长得像他母亲吗？

(3) He had no movement or feeling below his navel. (4) I've lost all feeling in the left arm. (5) There is a weird feeling about the place. (6) You have no feeling for the beauty of nature. (7) His speech caused a lot of feeling. (8) His rapid promotion caused much bad feeling among his colleagues. (9) He is not a mere lump of clay but a feeling creature.	(1) 我有种感觉我们正被人跟踪。 (2) 这种感觉一年一年地加深了。 (3) 肚脐以下没有知觉，也不能活动。 (4) 我左臂完全失去了知觉。 (5) 这地方有一种神秘的气氛。 (6) 你对大自然的美缺乏欣赏力。 (7) 他的讲演引起了很多反感。 (8) 他获迅速提升在同事中引起很大的不满。 (9) 他不仅具有血肉之躯而且是一个有感情的人。

fever n.狂热；发烧；发热 v.（使）发烧；（使）狂热	(1) Football fever gripped the town when the local team reached the cup final. (2) War fever was rising all over the Middle East. (3) Her fever lasted five days without intermission. (4) My fever is gone, but I still have a cough. (5) Flu is an infectious disease characterized by fever, aches and pains and exhaustion. (6) Pneumonitis is usually associated with fever. (7) I feel as if I'm running a fever. (8) He went to see a doctor at the onset of a fever. (9) Fever is one manifestation of a cold. (10) War fever was rising all over the Middle East. (11) Soon he succumbed to silver mining fever.	(1) 在当地的足球队打进了优胜杯的决赛圈后，全市掀起一阵足球热。 (2) 战争狂热正在整个中东地区升温。 (3) 她连续五天一直发烧。 (4) 我不发烧了，但还是有点咳嗽。 (5) 流感是一种传染病，其特征是发热、全身疼痛和疲乏无力。 (6) 间质肺炎常伴有发热。 (7) 我好像有点儿发热。 (8) 他开始发烧时便去看医生了。 (9) 发烧是受凉的一种表现。 (10) 战争狂热正在整个中东地区升温。 (11) 没过多久他就被开采银矿的狂热所感染。

(5) Her cup was a fiction, but this is reality. (6) As operating devices, perpetual-motion machines are the province of crackpot science and science fiction. (4) He has a very fierce look on his face. (5) The fierce sun parched the bare earth.	(1) 他的话语遭到激烈反对。 (2) 因为失业严重，求职的竞争十分激烈。 (3) 那个邮递员被一只恶狗咬了。 (4) 他脸上一副凶相。 (5) 灼热的阳光炙烤着光秃秃的大地。
fight n.战斗；打架；斗志 vt.打架；对抗 vi.奋斗；斗争；争吵	(1) After spiritual purification, he meets the demon in a thrilling fight. (2) Armed with raincoat and flashlight, he joined in the fight against the flood. (3) Did you hear that there was a fight down in the local on Wednesday? (4) All the fight seemed to go out of him. (5) The news of defeat took all the fight out of us. (6) The boxer has fought many opponents. (7) We must band together to fight the common enemy. (8) Melinda Gates says there is work now to bring a new drug to India and Bangladesh to fight what is known as black fever. (9) She fought like a tiger to get what she wanted. (10) Let us unite to fight poverty and disease. (11) He tried to fight down his anxiety. (12) He was always fighting with his neighbors about the noise.	(1) 在精神净化后,他遇见邪魔并展开激烈的战斗。 (2) 他穿上雨衣,带上手电,加入了抗洪的战斗。 (3) 你听说了吗?上星期三在附近的酒馆里有人打架。 (4) 他似乎再无斗志。 (5) 失败的消息夺走了我们所有的斗志。 (6) 该拳手已与许多对手交锋。 (7) 我们必须联合起来, 对抗我们共同的敌人。 (8) 梅林达盖茨说,目前的工作是把一种新的药物带到印度和孟加拉国称以对抗黑热。 (9) 她竭力争取自己想要的东西。 (10) 让我们齐心协力来克服贫困和疾病。 (11) 他努力克制他的焦虑。 (12) 他常常为了噪音和邻居们争吵。

(4) The fighter plane was completely destroyed.	(1) 他是一个为种族平等而奋斗的坚强战士。 (2) 她被认为是优秀的共产主义战士。 (3) 我们的战斗机已做好战斗的准备。 (4) 这架战斗机彻底毁坏了。
figure n.图形；数字；外形；体型；形状；人物；塑像；图表；（冰上表演动作的）花样 v.是重要部分；认为；演算；领会到	(1) Our textbook has many figures to help explain the lessons. (2) The figure is expressed as a percentage. (3) He has a more angular figure than his father. (4) I like the color of the hat instead of its figure. (5) Mahatma Gandhi was both a political and a religious figure in Indian history. (6) The mass of clay was worked up into a reclining figure. (7) The format of the figure is very tasteful. (8) The figure skater glided gracefully over the ice. (9) They figured it was better to stay where they were. (10) The boy can't figure out the algebra problems. (11) How do you figure that? (5) There is a steady flow of traffic in the morning. (6) This river flowed southwest to the Atlantic Ocean. (7) She lost control and the tears began to flow. (8) Her hair flowed over her shoulders.
