flu n.流行性感冒	(1) I got flu and was out of commission for a week. (2) The school was closed because of the flu. (3) I caught a flu and had to lie in the bed. (4) His flu infected his wife. (5) I've been laid up with flu for a week. (6) She's still recovering from a bout of flu.	(1) 我得了流感，一星期没工作。 (2) 因为流行性感冒全校停止上课。 (3) 我得了流感，不得不卧床休息。 (4) 他把流行性感冒传染给妻子。 (5) 我患流感已在家休息一个星期了。 (6) 她这次患流行性感冒还没有完全恢复。
fluency n.流利；流畅	(1) He speaks English and French with equal fluency. (2) Fluency in spoken English is a major requirement. (3) He speaks English with great fluency. (4) This will improve the pupils fluency of reading.	(1) 他说英语和法语同样流利。 (2) 主要条件为英语口语流利。 (3) 他的英语说得非常流畅。 (4) 这可以使学生朗读得更流畅。
fluent adj.流利的；流畅的	(1) She speaks fluent and idiomatic French. (2) She likes him all the better for his fluent spoken English. (3) His work is rather fluent and felicitous. (4) Her fluent movements surprised us.	(1) 她说得一口又流利又地道的法语。 (2) 正因为他操一口流利的英语，她更爱他。 (3) 他的作品十分流畅，措辞巧妙。 (4) 她那协调优美的动作让我们惊奇。
focus n.焦点；焦距；中心 v.（使）集中；聚集	(1) He always wants to be the focus of attention. (2) He took out the binoculars and adjusted the focus. (3) The main focus of this manual is the management of fresh ground water resources. (4) The noise made it hard for me to focus on work. (5) He focused the sun's rays on the paper with a burning glass.	(1) 他总想成为注意力的焦点。 (2) 他取出双筒望远镜并调整了焦距。 (3) 本指南的主要中心是地下淡水资源的管理。 (4) 噪音让我无法集中注意力工作。 (5) 他用取火镜使太阳光聚集在纸上。
fold vt.包；折叠；交叉；拥抱 vi.翻倍；屈服；倒闭 n.折层；折痕	(1) I folded the handkerchief and put it in my pocket. (2) The paper should be folded in half. (3) The border guard folded his arms across his chest and glared the front. (4) if a business folds, it closes because it is not able to make enough money.	(1) 我折好手绢，放进口袋里。 (2) 这张纸应该对折。 (3) 边防战士双手交叉于胸前紧紧瞪着前方。 (4) 如果有公司倒闭关门,那是因为它没办法赚取足够的钱。
folk n.人们；（某类或来自某个地方的）人；双亲；<口>大伙儿；民间音乐 adj.民间的	(1) A lot of folks are upset at the changes. (2) This is no place for young folk. (3) The town folk know him as Mr. Dickey. (4) I'd like you to meet my folks. (5) He is a very popular folk singer. (6) Chicken soup is a popular folk remedy for the common cold.	(1) 许多人对这些变化感到不安。 (2) 这可不是年轻人该去的地方。 (3) 镇上的人们都知道他是迪基先生。 (4) 我想要你见见我的父母。 (5) 他是一位很受欢迎的民歌手。 (6) 鸡汤是一种广为流传的治疗普通感冒的民间药方。
following adj.接着的；下列的 prep.在 ... 以后 n.追随者；下列各项 动词follow的现在分词	(1) The following item is a piano solo by Jackson. (2) It rained on the day we arrived, but the following day was sunny. (3) Please choose from the following three selections. (4) Following this session,we shall formulate a series of laws. (5) Her books aren't bestsellers, but they have a certain cult following. (6) The following is of the greatest importance.	(1) 下一个节目是杰克逊表演的钢琴独奏。 (2) 我们到达的那天正下雨，但次日天气晴朗。 (3) 请从下列的三个选择中选择。 (4) 这次会议以后，要接着制定一系列的法律。 (5) 她的书算不上畅销书，但有一定的崇拜者。 (6) 下面一点最为重要。
fond adj.溺爱的；喜欢的；愚蠢的；渴望的	(1) A fond mother may spoil her child. (2) The fond father smiled with pleasure. (3) I am not fond of solitude. (4) He was fond of drawing when he was a child. (5) He is fond of high-sounding phrases. (6) She has many shortcomings, but we're all very fond of her. (7) My little son is fond of playing practical jokes on me. (8) He has a fond belief in his own cleverness. (9) Her father is extremely rich; many fond hopes are pinned on rich uncles. (10) He had fond dreams of living on Saturn.	(1) 溺爱的母亲可能会宠坏她的孩子。 (2) 溺爱孩子的父亲高兴地微笑了。 (3) 我不喜欢孤独。 (4) 他还是个孩子时就喜欢画画。 (5) 他爱用夸大的词句。 (6) 虽然她有许多缺点，但我们都很喜欢她。 (7) 我的小儿子喜欢对我玩恶作剧。 (8) 他盲目相信自己的聪明。 (9) 他父亲非常有钱；将许多渴望寄托在有钱叔叔的身上。 (10) 他做着在火星上生活的黄粱美梦。
fool n.傻瓜；小丑；奶油果蓉 v.愚弄；欺骗；开玩笑；干蠢事；玩弄；鬼混	(1) What a fool I was to believe he is a good man. (2) I am a fool to have refused the job. (3) He played the fool to entertain the king in that opera. (4) He is trying to fool you,don't listen to him. (5) He has fooled a lot of people into believing he is a rich man. (6) She fooled the old man out of all his money. (7) I was only fooling when I said I'd lost your keys. (8) Don't be angry. We are just fooling. (9) Stop fooling about with that knife or someone will get hurt. (10) Stop fooling with her affections. (11) That silly child never does anything; he just fools about all day long. (12) I was meant to be working on Sunday, but I just fooled around all day.	(1) 我竟然相信他是个好人，我真是个傻瓜。 (2) 我真傻,拒绝了那项工作。 (3) 在那部歌剧中他扮演小丑来逗国王开心。 (4) 他想愚弄你，别听他的。 (5) 他骗了许多人，让人相信他是个富翁。 (6) 她骗走了老人所有的钱。 (7) 我说把你的钥匙丢了，只是逗你玩的。 (8) 别生气,我们只是闹著玩的。 (9) 不要摆弄那把刀，会伤人的。 (10) 不要再玩弄她的感情了。 (11) 那个傻孩子从来不做事，只是整天游手好闲。 (12) 星期日我本应工作的，但却闲混了一整天。
foolish adj.愚蠢的；荒谬的；可笑的	(1) They all jeer at the foolish speaker. (2) It's foolish to idle away one's precious time. (3) He could not account for his foolish mistake. (4) If fifty million people say a foolish thing, it is still a foolish thing.	(1) 他们都嘲笑那个愚蠢的演说者。 (2) 把大好时光浪费掉是愚蠢的。 (3) 他无法解释他所犯的荒谬的错误。 (4) 假使五千万人讲出一件荒谬的事，那仍然是荒谬的事。
forbid vt.禁止；阻止；不许	(1) Smoking is forbidden in this office. (2) I forbid you to call me late at night. (3) Lack of time forbids any further discussion at the point. (4) Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed. (5) My parents forbid me to stay out at night. (6) He is forbidden from leaving the country.	(1) 这间办公室禁止吸烟。 (2) 我禁止你在深夜给我打电话。 (3) 由于时间不够，现在不能深入讨论这个问题。 (4) 篇幅所限,不能一一列出所有贡献者的名字。 (5) 我的父母不许我在外面过夜。 (6) 他不许离开国家。
force n.武力；暴力；力量；影响力；力量大的人或（事物）；权力；（为某目的组织起来的）一群人；军队；部队；武装力量；警察部门；力；风力 v.迫使；强迫；强制；使发生；强装（欢笑）；人工催长	(1) When persuasion failed they used force. (2) We'll settle the problem by force if necessary. (3) If you do not open the door, I am authorized to enter by use of force. (4) It is vain to attempt to root out heresy by force. (5) The force of his fall was broken by the straw mats. (6) The force of the explosion broke all the windows in the building. (7) The law should remain in force. (8) She is a force to be reckoned with. (9) These guidelines do not have the force of law. (10) Air force units have been ordered to intensify their patrols. (11) The armed forces usually consist of the army, the navy and the air force. (12) He joined the force twenty years ago. (13) The moon exerts a force on the earth. (14) Trees break the force of the wind. (15) Circumstances force us to adopt this policy. (16) No power on earth could force me to do it . (17) This will force a system shutdown, whether a user is logged in or not. (18) Building a new road here will force house prices down. (19) She managed to force a smile. (20) It is unwise to force a child's talent.	(1) 劝说无效时,他们就使用武力了。 (2) 如果有必要的话,我们会用武力解决这个问题。 (3) 如果你不开门,我有权使用暴力闯入。 (4) 试图用暴力消除异端邪说是徒劳的。 (5) 草垫的缓冲作用减弱了他下跌的力量。 (6) 爆炸的力量震碎了这座建筑上的所有窗户。 (7) 法律应当有效力。 (8) 她是一个需要认真对待的有影响力的人物。 (9) 这些指导原则不具有法律效力。 (10) 空军部队奉命加强巡逻。 (11) 武装力量通常有陆、海、空军组成。 (12) 他二十年前加入了警队。 (13) 月球对地球有引力。 (14) 树使风力减弱。 (15) 形势迫使我们采取这项政策。 (16) 世上没人能强迫我做这事。 (17) 这将强制关闭一个系统。无论使用者是否已经登陆。 (18) 在这里修建一条新道路将使房价下跌。 (19) 她勉强笑笑。 (20) 对儿童的才能拔苗助长是不明智的。
forecast n.预测；预报 v.预测	(1) Share prices plunged as a result of the gloomy economic forecast. (2) The Treasury's forecast assumes that inflation will remain below 3%. (3) The weather forecast says it will be sunny tomorrow. (4) Despite the good weather forecast, the next morning was as wet as ever. (5) They tried to forecast the result of the football match.	(1) 关于经济前景暗淡的预测导致股票价格大跌。 (2) 财政部的预测称,通货膨胀率将保持在3%25以下。 (3) 天气预报说明天是晴天。 (4) 尽管预报称天气很好，但次日上午仍阴雨绵绵。 (5) 他们试图预测这场足球比赛的结果。
forehead n.前额；前部	(1) She lightly touched his forehead. (2) The horse has a splash of white on its forehead. (3) The forehead is small and narrow, assumes the triangle slightly, the top of the head front part is smooth, on behind skin scale fine grain shape.	(1) 她轻轻地摸了摸他的前额。 (2) 这匹马的前额上有一块白斑。 (3) 头部窄小，略呈三角形，头顶前部平滑，头后部皮肤上秤细粒颗状。
foresee v.预见；预知	(1) Can you foresee what will happen in the future? (2) Nobody could foresee his running away. (3) Few analysts foresaw that oil prices would rise so steeply. (4) Those who can foresee difficulties on their way to success may keep calm when they really appear. (5) He foresaw that his journey would be delayed by bad weather.	(1) 你能预见将来会发生什么吗? (2) 没人预见到他的逃跑。 (3) 几乎没有分析师能预见的到石油价格会上升得这么快。 (4) 在走向成功的路途中能够预见到困难的人在困难真正出现的时候常常能保持冷静的态度。 (5) 他预知自己的旅程会被恶劣天气耽搁。
forget v.忘记；忽略	(1) I'm sorry; I've forgotten your name. (2) I almost forget to pay the phone bill. (3) We must not forget about the grass roots. (4) That was a moment that I shall never forget. (5) Forget yourself and think of someone else for a change. (6) I'm afraid I forgot myself and kissed him wildly. (7) Don't forget your friends when you become rich.	(1) 对不起，我忘了你的名字。 (2) 我几乎忘记电话费用。 (3) 我们绝不能忘记民众。 (4) 那个时刻我永远不会忘记。 (5) 别光想著你自己，你也为别人想一次。 (6) 当时我有些忘乎所以，疯狂地吻著他。 (7) 致富后不要忘了老朋友。
forgetful adj.健忘的；疏忽的	(1) Grandfather is forgetful and often repeats himself when he tells a story. (2) My old uncle has become rather forgetful. (3) She is forgetful of her object.	(1) 爷爷记忆不好，他讲故事的时候老爱重复。 (2) 我的老叔父已经有点健忘了。 (3) 她忘却了自己的目标。
forgive v.原谅；宽恕；饶恕	(1) Forgive me. (2) If he is really repentant, we should forgive him. (3) He is not a man who forgives easily. (4) They forgive the people who trespass against them.	(1) 请原谅我。 (2) 如果他真心悔过，我们就应该原谅他。 (3) 他不是一个肯轻易宽恕人的人。 (4) 他们总是宽恕冒犯他们的人。
format n.版式；设计 vt.使格式化；安排	(1) The book has been styled in a modern format. (2) It's the same book,but a new format. (3) The format of the meeting was such that every one could ask a question. (4) The disk is too large to format for the specified file system.	(1) 该书已按照现代版式制作。 (2) 还是那本书 (3) 会议安排好可让每个人都能提一个问题。 (4) 磁盘过大,无法为指定文件系统进行格式化。
former adj.前者的；前任的；以前的 n.创造者；<英>学校某一年级的学生	(1) Of these two men, the former is dead but the latter is still alive. (2) Mr. Heath is the former Prime Minister of Britain. (3) I paid a visit to my former English teacher. (4) a former of ideas (5) He is a fifth former.	(1) 这两个人中，前者已死，而后者仍然活着。 (2) 希思先生是英国前任首相。 (3) 我拜访了我以前的英语老师。 (4) 想出主意者 (5) 他是五年级生。
fortnight n.两星期；十四天	(1) It's a fortnight to National Day. (2) The patient lived out another fortnight. (3) I'd get a sickening sense of dread for the fortnight leading up to them, knowing that I would become a sleep-deprived grumpy, spotty hermit. (4) A fortnight has fourteen days.	(1) 离国庆节还有两星期。 (2) 病人又活了两星期。 (3) 十四天的夜班后我发现感到胆战心惊的害怕，我很清楚的知道自己会变成一个睡眠不足的，性情乖戾情绪不稳的隐士。 (4) 两周有十四天。
fortunate adj.幸运的；侥幸的；带来幸运的	(1) It's fortunate you didn't forget. (2) The girl was fortunate enough to have her mother as a bosom friend. (3) The couple forfeited their independence in order to help those less fortunate. (4) So it was fortunate that we didn't have to carry him. (5) He came at a very fortunate time.	(1) 幸好你没忘。 (2) 这个女孩非常幸运，她的妈妈是她的知心朋友。 (3) 这对夫妇把富裕出的钱都拿出来帮助那些受难的人。 (4) 侥幸的是，我们还不必抬它走。 (5) 他来得恰是时候。
fortune n.命运；财产；运气	(1) Everyone is the architect of his own fortune. (2) An ill marriage is a spring of ill fortune. (3) He dreamed of making a fortune. (4) I rate his fortune at$10,000. (5) These two brothers decided to go to America to try their fortunes.	(1) 每个人都是自己命运的创造者。 (2) 不良的婚姻是恶运的来源。 (3) 他梦想发大财。 (4) 我估计他有1万美元的财产。 (5) 这兄弟俩决定去美国碰碰运气。
forty num.四十 adj.四十 pron.四十(个；只 ... )	(1) They managed to squash forty people into the bus. (2) He reigned over the country for forty years.	(1) 那辆公共汽车好不容易塞进了四十个人。 (2) 他统治了这个国家四十年。
forward adj.向前的；前部的；未来的；将来的；莽撞的；热心的；早熟的 adv.向前地 v.促进；转交；发送 n.[体]前锋	(1) He is forward in his English. (2) We can see the forward part of the ship. (3) A little forward planning at the outset can save you a lot of expense. (4) I hope you'll apologize that was a very forward thing to do. (5) He is always forward to help others. (6) She stepped forward in order to see clearly. (7) Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward. (8) He's hoping to forward his career by this move. (9) Please forward my mail to my new address. (10) We have today forwarded you our new catalogue. (11) The forward made a foul in the penalty area.	(1) 他的英语有进步。 (2) 我们可以看见船的前部。 (3) 一开始就为未来作点打算能节约很多开支。 (4) 我希望你能道歉－－那事你做得太莽撞了。 (5) 他一贯热心帮助别人。 (6) 她向前走了一步以便能看得更清楚 (7) 警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。 (8) 他正希望通过这一举动来促进他的事业。 (9) 请把我的信件转到我的新地址。 (10) 我们今天已经把我们的新目录寄给你了。 (11) 前锋在禁区内犯规了。
founding n.建立；成立 动词found的现在分词.	(1) We commemorate the founding of our nation with a public holiday.	(1) 我们放假一日以庆祝国庆。
fountain n.喷泉；源泉；储水容器；泉水 v.使像喷泉一样流	(1) She dabbled her fingers in the fountain. (2) The parks of this city are famous for their ornate fountains. (3) Social life is the fountain of wisdom of writers. (4) The brain is the ultimate fountain of ideas. (5) OK. You go out and get a drink of water at the fountain. (6) The fountain babbled its familiar music. (7) The fountain is clear at its source .	(1) 她用手指在喷泉中玩水。 (2) 这个城市的公园以其华丽的喷泉而著名。 (3) 社会生活是作家们智慧的源泉。 (4) 大脑是思想的根本源泉。 (5) 好。你出去在饮水机那儿喝点水吧。 (6) 泉水发出惯常的潺潺声。 (7) 泉水源头清。
fourth n.第四；四分之一；第四音阶；第四档	(1) Time is sometimes called the fourth dimension. (2) Her fourth husband was a middle-aged playboy. (3) About one fourth of the earth is dry land. (4) She aided me in piecing myself together from a tragedy that I experienced in the fourth dimension following my ascension. (5) One may utilize the fourth octave by imagining it bathing every cell that is diseased with the vibrations necessary to bring such cells to harmony.	(1) 时间有时被称为第四度空间。 (2) 她的第四任丈夫是一个中年的花花公子。 (3) 地球约四分之一是陆地。 (4) 如果你并没有合并光明和黑暗成为一个单一音阶的音调的话，你将从一个非常明亮的极点移到另一个非常黑暗的极点。 (5) 你能通过想象它正沐浴着每个患病的细胞来利用此音阶，所需的振动被带进这些细胞内协调它们。
franc n.法郎	(1) I need to change my dollars into francs. (2) He give me two 10 franc coin in my change. (3) The ticket fare of the train for pairs is 77 Franc.	(1) 我需要把美金换成法郎。 (2) 他找给我两个10法郎的硬币。 (3) 去巴黎的火车票售价是77法郎。
fragile adj.易碎的；脆的；精细的；虚弱的	(1) Glasses are fragile and must be handled with great care. (2) This glass plate is very fragile. (3) The fragile boxes arrived intact. (4) Happiness is made of glass, it shines the brightest where it is most fragile. (5) He's feeling a bit fragile after last night's party.	(1) 玻璃制品易碎，必须小心轻放。 (2) 这个玻璃盘子很容易碎。 (3) 这些易碎的箱子完整无损地运到了。 (4) 幸福是玻璃做成的,它最脆弱的地方最闪亮! (5) 他参加了昨晚的聚会之后，现在觉得有些虚弱。
fragrant adj.芬香的；馥郁的	(1) The aspic is one kind of strongly fragrant purple blue color floret. (2) Fragrant fruit juice is the best drink to entertain guests in the four seasons.	(1) 薰衣草是一种馥郁的紫蓝色的小花。 (2) 香气馥郁的果露饮料是四季酬宾美物。
framework n.框架；体系；结构	(1) Government is the one who establishes national policy framework. (2) It's a bridge of steel framework. (3) All the cases can be considered within the framework of the existing rules.	(1) 国家政策体系的是由政府建立的。 (2) 那是座钢铁结构的桥梁。 (3) 一切情况都可依据现行章程的结构加以考虑。
freedom n.自由；直率；特许，特权	(1) Democracy is a bulwark of freedom. (2) They bought peace with their freedom. (3) By persistence many countries won freedom. (4) Slavery is the antithesis of freedom.	(1) 民主是自由的保障。 (2) 他们牺牲自由换取和平。 (3) 通过坚持不懈的努力, 许多国家赢得了自由。 (4) 奴役与自由对立是的。
freeway n.高速公路；快车道	(1) Heavy traffic clogged the freeways. (2) The new freeway will pass over the lake. (3) The accident turned the freeway into a bottleneck. (4) His new car certainly did ball the jack on the freeway.	(1) 拥挤的交通堵塞了高速公路 (2) 新的高速公路将越过湖面。 (3) 那起事故使快车道一下子变成了一个拥挤的狭口。 (4) 他的新车在快车道上确实开得快极了。
freezing adj.冰冻的；严寒的；冷冻用的 n.冰冻 动词freeze的现在分词.	(1) Freezing weather will break up the soil. (2) Leave a basin of water outside in freezing weather. (3) Freezing winter is harmful to orange trees. (4) Freezing weather will break up the soil.	(1) 冰冻的天气使土地龟裂。 (2) 在冰冻的天气里，放一盆水在室外。 (3) 冰冻天气对桔子树是有害的。 (4) 冰冻的天气使土地龟裂。
frequent adj.频繁的；经常的 vt.常到；常去	(1) My girlfriend writes frequent letters to me. (2) Traffic accidents are alarmingly frequent of late. (3) He is a frequent visitor to our house. (4) He suffers from frequent bouts of depression. (5) His frequent hesitations annoyed the audience. (6) He used to frequent the town's bars and night-clubs. (7) The police visited all the bars that the suspect frequented. (8) These woods are frequented by all kinds of birds.	(1) 我的女朋友频繁地给我写信。 (2) 近来交通事故频繁得吓人。 (3) 他是我们家的常客。 (4) 他患多发性抑郁症。 (5) 他三番五次欲言又止，听众已感到厌烦。 (6) 他从前常去镇上的酒吧和夜总会。 (7) 警察调查了嫌疑犯时常出没的所有酒吧。 (8) 这些树林里经常栖息着各种鸟类。
fresh adj.新鲜的；清新的；新近的；无经验的 adv.最近地	(1) Some tribes migrate with their cattle in search of fresh grass. (2) Open the window and let in some fresh air. (3) When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry. (4) I feel really fresh after my holiday. (5) There was no sense in courting fate with a new, able, and psychologically fresh group.	(1) 有些部落为了寻找新鲜的牧草而带着他们的牲畜迁移。 (2) 打开窗户，让新鲜的空气进来。 (3) 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。 (4) 我度假之後真觉得又精神饱满了。 (5) 把命运同一批能干的、但心理上无经验的新人拴在一起是没有什么意思的。
friction n.摩擦；摩擦力；分歧	(1) Constant friction wore out the heels of my shoes. (2) Matches are lighted by friction. (3) Friction lowers the efficiency of a machine. (4) Friction causes a rolling ball to stop finally. (5) Without friction, the brake would not work. (6) I oiled the machine to reduce friction. (7) My daughter and son always have frictions. (8) There is some friction among the family members.	(1) 不断的摩擦磨损了我的鞋跟。 (2) 火柴由摩擦而生火。 (3) 摩擦减低机器的效率。 (4) 摩擦力使滚动的球最终停了下来。 (5) 如果没有摩擦力,制动器就不能制动。 (6) 我把机器上油,以减少摩擦力。 (7) 我女儿和儿子总发生矛盾。 (8) 家庭成员间有些摩擦。
refrigerator n.冰箱	(1) Milk will keep for several days in a refrigerator. (2) Perishable food should be stored in a refrigerator.	(1) 牛奶在冰箱里可以保存几天。 (2) 易腐的食物应储存在冰箱里。
fried adj.炸过的 弗里德(Alfred Hermann,1864-1921，奥地利著述家、记者，曾获1911年诺贝尔和平奖）	(1) This dish sounds delicious, fried pork on a bed of roasted vegetables.	(1) 这道菜听起来就觉得好吃，它是把炸过的猪肉放在烤蔬菜下面。
fright n.惊骇；惊恐；<口>怪人	(1) Hearing the news, we turned pale with fright. (2) Tom's fright weakened every muscle in his body. (3) He cried out in fright as the dark figure approached. (4) He gave me a fright by bursting into a sudden laughter.	(1) 听到这消息后，我们惊骇失色。 (2) 汤姆所受的惊骇使他全身的肌肉都没有劲了。 (3) 那个黑影向他逼近，他吓得叫了出来。 (4) 他突然大笑起来，吓了我一跳。
frog n.蛙；嗓音沙哑；马的蹄叉；刀剑的挂环	(1) The witch changed the prince into a frog. (2) He sang with a frog in his throat.	(1) 巫婆把王子变成了青蛙。 (2) 他用略带沙哑的嗓音唱歌。
frontier n.边界；边境；尖端；边缘	(1) We were turned back at the frontier. (2) The frontier ranges from the northern hills to the southern coast. (3) Everything is quiet on the frontier. (4) The minority of us are confronted with difficulty in the frontier of the major. (5) The frontiers of medical knowledge are being pushed forwards as time goes on. (6) He came from the remote frontier.	(1) 我们在边界那儿被赶了回来。 (2) 边界从北部山地一直延伸到南部海岸。 (3) 边境上一切安静。 (4) 我们少数人在该专业尖端领域面临困难。 (5) 医学知识的新领域正随着时间向前推进。 (6) 他来自遥远的边疆。
frost n.霜；霜冻；严寒 v.结霜；冻死；用糖衣装饰	(1) The windscreen was covered with frost. (2) Sweet potatoes decayed after the frost. (3) The crops were blasted by frost. (4) Frost caused the split in the rock. (5) The apple trees were blighted by frost. (6) The cold has frosted the windows. (7) Young plants are often killed by frost. (8) I wanted to frost the cake with icing.	(1) 挡风玻璃上结了霜。 (2) 霜下了之后,地瓜烂掉了。 (3) 农作物被霜冻毁了。 (4) 霜冻使岩石裂了一条缝。 (5) 苹果树因严寒而枯萎。 (6) 寒冷的天气使窗子上结满了霜。 (7) 植物的幼苗常因严寒而冻死。 (8) 我想给蛋糕上撒一层糖霜。
fruit juice n.果汁	(1) Fruit juices ferment if they are kept a long time. (2) Children enjoy drinking juice through a straw.	(1) 果汁若是放置很久，就会发酵。 (2) 孩子喜欢用吸管喝果汁。
fry v.油煎；油炸 n.<美>法式炸薯条	(1) The eggs are frying in the pan. (2) We cut it into thin slices and fry it. (3) Shall I fry the fish for dinner? (4) I will fry an onion to make onion rings.	(1) 鸡蛋正在平底锅里煎着。 (2) 我们把它切成薄片并用油煎。 (3) 晚饭要不要我炸鱼？ (4) 我将炒一头洋葱，做炸葱圈。
fuel n.燃料；刺激因素 vt.供以燃料 vi.加燃料	(1) Coal is used as fuel. (2) We aim for a 10% saving in fuel. (3) His indifference was a fuel to her hatred. (4) Higher salaries helped to fuel inflation. (5) All aircraft must fuel before flight. (6) The ship put in at Shanghai to fuel.	(1) 煤用作燃料。 (2) 我们的目标是节省10%的燃料。 (3) 他无动于衷使她心中的怨恨火上加油。 (4) 工资提高刺激通货膨胀。 (5) 所有飞机飞行前都必须加油。 (6) 船驶入上海港加燃料。
function n.职务；功能；函数；重大聚会；应变量，有相关关系者；取决于 vi.运行；起作用	(1) What is his function on the committee? (2) The teacher did not explain its grammatical function. (3) The function of the ear is to listen. (4) Periodic change imposed on a controlled variable or a function by a controller. (5) Heads of state attend numerous functions every year. (6) Price is a function of supply and demand. (7) However, many system features and tasks will not function correctly. (8) A new tax and financial system was functioning effectively. (9) During the reorganization,we should pay careful attention to selecting the key leaders of these sections so that the latter can function properly. (10) During this mission, the command post is functioning prominently.	(1) 他在委员会里担任什么职务? (2) 老师没有解释它的文法功能。 (3) 耳的功能是听。 (4) 通过控制器控制某一变量或函数进行周期性变化。 (5) 国家首脑每年要出席很多重大宴会。 (6) 价格取决于供求关系的变化。 (7) 但是,许多系统功能和任务将无法正常运行。 (8) 新的财税体制有效运行。 (9) 调整时，还要注意选配好这些部门的领导骨干，发挥职能机构的作用。 (10) 此次任务中，指挥部的作用尤为突出。
fundamental adj.基本的；根本的；重要的 n.基础；基本原理	(1) For something fundamental has changed in Venezuela. (2) Trial by the jury is a fundamental right. (3) From the outset, it had two fundamental flaws. (4) The fundamental ones are embodied in the Party Constitution. (5) China quite naturally plays a fundamental role. (6) They wished to emphasize more fundamental issues. (7) Primary is about fundamental play. (8) In all cases the same fundamental principles apply. (9) A known fundamental is a usele fundamental.	(1) 因为在委内瑞拉，有一些基本的东西已经改变了。 (2) 有陪审团陪同审判是一项基本的权利。 (3) 从一开始，这一合作就有两个根本的缺陷。 (4) 党章是最根本的党规党法。 (5) 中国自然发挥着十分重要的作用。 (6) 他们希望强调更重要的问题。 (7) 原始与基础游戏有关。 (8) 但在任何情况下基本原理是相同的。 (9) 人人皆知的基本原理是毫无用处的基本原理。
funeral adj.葬礼(的) n.葬礼	(1) Funeral customs vary with different religions. (2) He asked for no funeral oration. (3) Their cars headed the funeral procession. (4) A funeral is a somber occasion. (5) We must obey the decencies and attend the funeral. (6) They held a state funeral in honour of the statesman. (7) He stood with bowed head at the funeral.	(1) 葬仪的习俗因宗教不同而不同。 (2) 他不要人在葬礼上宣读悼词。 (3) 他们的车队在葬礼队伍的最前面。 (4) 葬礼是个忧郁的场合。 (5) 我们要遵照礼仪参加葬礼。 (6) 他们为这位政治家举行了国葬。 (7) 在葬礼上他低下头站着。
fur n.毛皮；软毛；毛皮制品；皮衣 v.使生苔；使生垢	(1) He put on a coat with a fur lining. (2) She was wearing a silver fox fur across her shoulders. (3) The dog's fur was matted with blood. (4) The dog's fur bristled as it sensed danger. (5) She brought a coat with reddish fur. (6) He gave her an expensive fur for her birthday. (7) We stock all types of fur coats. (8) The muggers jumped the woman in the fur coat. (9) The kettle was furred up. (10) The water here is so hard that all the pans fur up after a single use.	(1) 他穿上一件有毛皮衬里的外衣。 (2) 她肩上披了一件银狐皮披肩。 (3) 那只狗的毛皮上沾有血迹。 (4) 那狗觉察到危险时，毛都竖立起来了。 (5) 她买了一件略带红色皮毛的衣服。 (6) 他送给她一件昂贵的毛皮衣服作为生日礼物。 (7) 我们有各种皮衣供应。 (8) 抢劫犯突然对这个身着皮衣的妇女进行袭击。 (9) 壶里长了水锈。 (10) 这里的水质很硬，所有的锅用了一次以后都生了水垢。
furnished adj.装配好家具的，带家具的 动词furnish的过去式和过去分词.	(1) The room was cheaply furnished. (2) The room was furnished in warm reds and browns. (3) The room was furnished in austere style. (4) They are renting a furnished flat.	(1) 屋里配置了便宜的家具。 (2) 这个房间是用红色和棕色装饰的暖色调。 (3) 这间屋子陈设得简单朴素。 (4) 他们租用了一套带有家具的公寓房子。
furniture n.家具；设备，装置；床罩；必要的附属品；【会计】家俬	(1) We will buy some furniture for our new house. (2) This old table is a valuable piece of furniture. (3) The antique furniture was made in 1700. (4) Children's furniture must withstand kicks and blows. (5) Cretonne can be used for furniture covers and curtains.	(1) 我们得给我们的新房子买些家具。 (2) 这张旧桌子是一件很珍贵的家具。 (3) 这件古老的家具是1700年制造的。 (4) 孩子用的家具必须经得起拳打脚踢。 (5) 印花棉布能被用来做家具套和窗帘。
gain n.获得；收益；增益 v.获得；到达；增加；获利；(钟、表等)走得快	(1) No pain, no gain. (2) He has no aspiration for fame or gain. (3) It is not for the love of gain that he does so. (4) It's the first time we've ever had the power to gain knowledge at our fingertips. (5) After swimming for an hour, he finally gained the shore. (6) Did you gain weight after you stopped exercising. (7) I did not gain very much by my inspection. (8) They gain in security what they lose in liberty. (9) The clock on my computer gains a minute every day.	(1) 不劳则无获。 (2) 他不图名利。 (3) 他这样做并非为了得什么好处。 (4) 人们第一次有了这样的能力,可以在指尖轻松的获得知识。 (5) 他游了一小时后,终于到达岸边。 (6) 在你停止锻炼之后,你的体重增加了吗? (7) 我这样细看一番收获并不太大。 (8) 他们从安全中得到了他们在自由中所失去的东西。 (9) 我电脑上的时间每天快一分钟。
gale n.狂风；一阵（喧闹；笑声等）	(1) The gale blew down the flagstaff.	(1) 狂风把旗杆吹倒了。
gallery n.美术馆；画廊；顶层楼座；走廊	(1) The gallery has a show of French oil painting. (2) She is a frequent visitor to the gallery. (3) The gallery is a treasure trove of medieval art. (4) There's a new picture show at the gallery tomorrow. (5) Our seats are in the gallery tonight. (6) He had been stamping impatiently about the gallery. gallon n.加仑(容量单位)	(1) There are eight pints in a gallon. (2) This type of car can run 25 miles a gallon.	(1) 一加仑有八品脱。 (2) 这种汽车每加仑油料能行驶二十五英里。
garage n.汽车修理厂；车库 vt.把 ... 放入车库	(1) He sent his car to the garage for repair. (2) My car broke down and had to be towed to a garage. (3) There is a garage built onto the side of the house. (4) We can't afford a car, not to mention the fact that we have no garage.	(1) 他把汽车送到修车厂修理。 (2) 我的汽车出故障了，得拉到修理厂去。 (3) 这所房子的一侧建有一个车库。 (4) 我们买不起汽车，没有车库的事就更不必说了。
garbage n.垃圾；废物；食物残渣	(1) Please put the garbage in the dustbin. (2) She threw the leftovers in the garbage. (3) The smell of the garbage overpowered me. (4) You are a garbage! (5) Please throw the garbage away. (6) In her home, garbage was fed to the pigs.	(1) 请把垃圾放在桶里。 (2) 她把剩饭倒进垃圾桶。 (3) 垃圾的臭味使我无法忍受。 (4) 你真是个废物！ (5) 请把这些废物扔掉。 (6) 在她家,剩菜用来喂猪。
gardening n.园艺(学) v.从事园艺活动；种植花木（动词garden的现在分词）	(1) Gardening is a very rewarding pastime. (2) I received a set of gardening tools on my birthday. (3) I got in an hour's gardening between the showers. (4) He's always laying down the law about gardening but he really doesn't know much about it. (5) I was so tired after all that gardening that I was out for the count for ten whole hours last night. (6) Dendrology for gardening is more suitable for students from specialties relating to gardening.	(1) 园艺劳动是非常有益的消遣。 (2) 生日那天，我收到一套园艺工具。 (3) 阵雨间歇时我抽了一小时的时间来整理花园。 (4) 他总是对园艺工作发号施令，其实他只是一知半解。 (5) 把花园里所有的活干完后，我实在太累了，昨晚沉睡了足足有10个小时。 (6) 园林树木学则主要适用于园林相关专业的学生。
garlic n.大蒜	(1) His breath smelt of garlic. (2) This dish needs a touch more garlic. (3) Can you taste the garlic in this stew? (4) She put several cloves of garlic in the dish.	(1) 他呼出的气中有蒜味。 (2) 这菜里要再加点儿蒜。 (3) 你尝得出炖肉里有大蒜味儿吗? (4) 她在菜里放了几瓣大蒜。
garment n.衣服 vt.给 ... 披上衣服；覆上 ...	(1) This garment should be washed carefully. (2) The garment fits her perfectly. (3) In spring nature wears a new garment.	(1) 这件衣服应该小心地洗涤。 (2) 这件衣服她穿上很合适。 (3) 春天
gas n.煤气；气体；汽油；空话 vt.使吸入毒气；毒(死)；给 ... 加汽油 vi.空谈；加汽油	(1) Gas is now widely used for cooking and heating. (2) She lit the gas and gave the coffee another warm. (3) Hydrogen and oxygen are gases. (4) Air is a mixture of gases. (5) I'll refill my cigarette lighter with gas. (6) He ran out of gas a mile from home. (7) His long speech was nothing but gas and hot air. (8) He was badly gassed in the war. (9) She couldn't face the future, and gassed herself. (10) The girls were still gassing when I left.	(1) 现在普遍用煤气烧饭和取暖。 (2) 她点燃煤气，把咖啡重新热了一下。 (3) 氢和氧是气体。 (4) 空气是气体的混合物。 (5) 我将给打火机再灌满汽油。 (6) 他在离家还有一英里的地方把汽油用完了。 (7) 他的长篇大论只是吹牛和空话。 (8) 他在战争中深受毒气伤害。 (9) 她对未来感到绝望,用煤气自杀了。 (10) 我走的时候，那些女孩子们还在胡扯。
gather v.聚集；集合；收集；推测 n.聚集；褶子	(1) People began to gather outside the palace. (2) We'll gather at the school gate at eight tomorrow. (3) He took the trouble to gather the materials for me. (4) I gather everyone has passed the exam.	(1) 人们开始聚集在宫殿前。 (2) 我们明天八点在校门口集合。 (3) 他不辞辛劳地为我收集资料。 (4) 我推测人人都通过考试了。
gay n.同性恋(多指男同性恋） adj.快乐的；鲜艳的；放荡的；同性恋的	(1) They object to the movie's depiction of gay people. (2) She gave a gay laugh. (3) The package was tied with gay ribbons. (4) They painted the room in gay colours. (5) I suppose she'd got tired of a gay life and wanted to settle down. (6) He has always championed the cause of gay rights.	(1) 他们反对这部影片对同性恋者的刻画。 (2) 她发出了快活的笑声。 (3) 包裹用色彩鲜艳的丝带捆扎好。 (4) 他们用鲜艳的颜色粉刷房间。 (5) 我想她一定是厌倦了放荡的生活，想要安定下来。 (6) 他一直在为争取同性恋者的权利而斗争。
general adj.普遍的；全面的；一般性的；大致的；笼统的；常规的；总的；首席的 n.将军；一般	(1) Her predictions are so general that they could apply to anybody. (2) As a general rule, prices follow demands. (3) They gave a general description of the man. (4) They just asked some general questions. (5) The general practice in such cases is to apply for a court order. (6) The general manager presided at the meeting. (7) The attorney general will prosecute in trial for serious crime. (8) The general is a respectable man. (9) In general, no one would like a man who speaks ill of others behind their back.	(1) 她的预测很全面,放之四海而皆准。 (2) 一般而言,物价随需求而变化。 (3) 他们对这个男人作了大致的描述。 (4) 他们只问了一些挺笼统的问题。 (5) 处理这类案件的常规做法是请求法院发出指令。 (6) 总经理主持了会议。 (7) 首席检查官将在严重犯罪案的审判中作公诉人。 (8) 那位将军是个令人肃然起敬的人物。 (9) 一般说来,没有人会喜欢一个背后说人坏话的家伙。
generation n.代；（产品类型的）代；产生；繁殖	(1) There is a generation gap between my parents and I. (2) One generation blows bubbles, and the next breaks them. (3) Their visionary ideas are often misunderstood by their own generation. (4) Each generation has its own standards of judgement. (5) The second generation of machines utilized improved miniature electronic tubes, and later solid-sate circuits. (6) How to prevent the generation of leukaemia? (7) The biology class studied the generation of fruit flies.	(1) 我父母和我之间有代沟。 (2) 前一代人制造出来的空洞理论，下一代人把它们打破。 (3) 他们有远见的理想往往招致同时代人的误解。 (4) 每一代都有它自己的判断标准。 (5) 第二代机器使用改良的微电子管和后固体电路。 (6) 如何防止白血病的产生？ (7) 生物班的学生研究了果蝇的繁殖。
generous adj.慷慨的；宽宏大量的；丰厚的；丰盛的；味浓的	(1) She was always very generous in her charity. (2) Such generous actions stamp him as a man of honour. (3) I am doubly indebted to you-- for the party and for your generous gift! (4) Tom's mother treated me with a generous meal. (5) I prefer beer to generous wine.	(1) 她行善时总是很慷慨。 (2) 他的这些慷慨行为表明他是个君子。 (3) 你为我操办欢送会并赠送厚礼,这样的深情厚谊我铭记在心。 (4) 汤姆的妈妈招待了我丰盛的一餐。 (5) 我喜欢喝啤酒,不喜欢味浓的酒。

(5) The dog is so gentle that I am not afraid of it. (6) She is gentle like a lamb. (7) My new teacher is a very gentle person. (8) He is a man gentle in manner but firm in action.	(1) 我们从来没有遇到这样温和的人。 (2) 我的母亲是一位心地善良、性情温和的妇女。 (3) 轻柔的音乐能使他放松。 (4) 微风吹动了树叶。 (5) 这只狗如此温顺,因此我不感到害怕。 (6) 她像只小羊羔一样温顺。 (7) 我的新老师是一个温文尔雅的人。 (8) 他是一个举止文雅但行动坚决的人。

(4) A true gentleman is above envy, jealousy or vindictiveness. (5) A gentleman will never hurt a woman under any circumstances. (3) Leon didn't finish his geometry homework because his mind kept jumping the track to think about the new girl in class. (4) The boy puzzled his way through geometry. (4) He raised his hands in a gesture of despair. (5) The doctor gestured me to take off my coat. (6) She gestured her disappointment by laying her hand on her forehead. giraffe n.长颈鹿	(1) The giraffe is much taller than the deer. (2) The giraffe eats tender leaf from the tree highly. (3) The giraffe must get up at six in the morning if it wants to have its breakfast in its stomach by nine.	(1) 长颈鹿比鹿高多了。 (2) 长颈鹿从高高的树上吃掉嫩树叶子。 (3) 长颈鹿得要在早上六点起来，如果它想早饭在九点钟之前到达胃里的话。

(9) She returned his smile with a frigid glance. (10) His glance swept from right to left. (3) The glare of the oncoming headlights temporarily blinded me. (4) Eyelashes defend the eye by shading it from glare. (5) Number denoting the degree to which discomfort glare is controlled.	(1) 我喜欢将来自房子的色度的一个角落变成开着空间的完整晒焦的闪耀光。 (2) 这些太阳镜是为减少刺眼的强光而设计的。 (3) 迎面车灯刺眼的光照得我瞬间什么也看不见。 (4) 眼睫毛通过遮掩眼睛而使眼睛避免受眩光刺激。 (5) 代表对不舒适眩光进行控制的等级号码。

govern v.统治；支配；管理；规定；控制	(1) Education makes a people easy to lead, but difficult to drive: easy to govern but impossible to slave. (2) You must not be governed by the opinions of others. (3) Such laws also govern the chances of commodity production and exchange. (4) They demand the right to govern themselves. (5) A man, who can govern a woman can govern a nation. (6) In Latin, several verbs govern the dative. (7) Please try to govern your passions. (8) Govern yourself and you'll be able to govern the world.	(1) 教育让一个民族容易被领导，却很难被驱使；容易被统治，却很难被奴役。 (2) 你决不要受别人意见的支配。 (3) 这种规律也支配着商品生产和商品交换的偶然性： (4) 他们要求自治权。 (5) 能够管理好女人的男人能够管理好一个国家。 (6) 在拉丁语中，有些动词要求与格的宾语。 (7) 请尽量控制你的感情。 (8) 能控制自己,就能控制世界。
government n.政府；政体；统治	(1) The government will garrison the coastal towns. (2) The government would not even consider his claim for money. (3) He is a man of some influence in the government circles. (4) Five hundred jobs were axed as a result of government spending cuts. (5) The two systems of government are polar opposites. (6) They imposed their government by force on the resistant population.	(1) 政府将派军驻守沿海的城镇。 (2) 政府甚至不考虑他的赔款要求。 (3) 他是个在政府内有一定势力的人。 (4) 由于政府缩减经费的缘故，有五百人被突然解雇了。 (5) 这两种政体正好相反。 (6) 他们以武力把自己的统治强加在持反抗态度的人民头上。
gown n.长袍；长外衣	(1) She is in a purplish mantle, pink gown. (2) She wore a black silk evening gown. (3) She put on her silken gown before going to bed. (4) She wore an antique gown to the costume party. (5) The gown a surgeon wears during an operation is usually green. gradually adv.逐渐地	(1) Controls in the city have gradually tightened. (2) Gradually the surrounding farmland turned residential. (3) The sea is gradually encroaching on the land. (4) His interest in this subject gradually decreases. (5) Her long illness gradually sapped her strength. (6) The colors graded gradually from orange to yellow.	(1) 对这个城市的控制逐渐加强。 (2) 周围的农田渐渐变成了住宅区。 (3) 海水渐渐地侵蚀了陆地。 (4) 他对这门学科的兴趣逐渐减退。 (5) 长期的患病使她的体力渐渐衰竭。 (6) 这些颜色逐渐地从橙色变成黄色。
graduation n.毕业；毕业典礼；分度；刻度线；分级	(1) I saw little or nothing of him after graduation. (2) After graduation, he lives on his own. (3) He worked as a magistrate after graduation. (4) John was asked to deliver a speech on the graduation. (5) The graduation is marked on the side of the flask. (6) Grades the indoor hypogene water fast to distribute whether to have the material effect evenly to the graduation effect.	(1) 毕业后我几乎没有看见过他。 (2) 毕业后他就独立生活了。 (3) 他毕业后任地方行政长官。 (4) 约翰被邀请在毕业典礼上发表演讲。 (5) 烧瓶侧面有刻度标志。 (6) 分级室内上升水速分布是否均匀对分级效果有重要影响。
grain n.谷物；谷类；微量；颗粒；纹理；格令 v.形成(颗粒)；(用谷物)喂养	(1) We ship grain to Africa. (2) There are a few grains of rice in a bowl. (3) There isn't a grain of truth in it. (4) It's easiest to cut meat in the direction of the grain. (5) Our new process locks up pounds of energy in every grain of the breakfast food. (6) Physical isolation goes against the corporate grain, the hierarchy being organized around the office. (7) And those tears slowly took the form of the grain when they first covered it, and later they began to form a small sphere. (8) In China, many farmers grain the pigs.	(1) 我们把谷物运往非洲。 (2) 碗中有几颗米粒。 (3) 那事无丝毫真实性。 (4) 切肉时顺着纹理切最容易。 (5) 我们新的生产方法能使每一格令的早餐食品中包含多磅能量。 (6) 身体上的隔绝违反合作意愿，使办公室周围形成特定阶层。 (7) 最开始，裹住沙粒的泪水都成了沙的形状，后来就形成了一个小小的球形。 (8) 在中国,好多农民都是用谷物喂猪。
gram n.克 abbr.语法（=grammar） suf.写出或画出的东西	(1) A dust particle weighs only a thousandth of a gram. (2) Sorry,but we sell the roast Beijing duck by the gram.	(1) 一粒尘埃的重量仅有千分之一克。 (2) 对不起，我们是按克出售北京烤鸭的。
grammar n.语法；文法	(1) That is not, properly speaking, a dictionary but a grammar book. (2) I know nothing about Latin grammar. (3) Why care for grammar as long as we are good? (4) Grammar is not that hard to reach.	(1) 严格地说，那不是一本字典，而是一本语法书。 (2) 我一点都不懂拉丁语法。 (3) 只要我们没有错，为什么要关心文法? (4) 文法也不是那么难以亲近.
grandchild n.孙儿；孙女	(1) His grandchild is a naughty boy. (2) He loves his grandchild very much. (3) Have you no consideration for my grandchild's future?	(1) 他的孙子是个淘气的男孩。 (2) 他非常喜欢他的孙儿。 (3) 你就不为我孙女的终身大事想想吗?
granddaughter n.孙女；外孙女	(1) His granddaughter is very pretty. (2) The couple has one daughter and one granddaughter.	(1) 他的孙女很漂亮。 (2) 这对夫妇有一个女儿和一个外孙女。
grandparents n.外祖父母；祖父母	(1) My grandparents on my mother's side were both Italians. (2) Do your parents,grandparents or sibling ever had any of the following? (3) Are your grandparents still alive? (4) Both his grandparents were buried here.	(1) 我外祖父母都是义大利人。 (2) 你的父母，祖父母，外祖父母，兄弟姐妹是否有下列病？ (3) 你的祖父母还在世吗？ (4) 他的祖父母都葬在这里。
grandson n.孙子；外孙	(1) The old lady placed great trust in her grandson. (2) The old man goes to see his grandson twice a week. (3) The old woman led her grandson by the arm.	(1) 那位老太太对她孙子非常信任。 (2) 这位老人每星期去看他的孙子两次。 (3) 那老婆婆牵着外孙的手。
granny n. <口>奶奶	(1) I can't believe, sometimes, that granny is dead. If I close my eyes I can just see her knitting away in that armchair as large as life, with her specs half-way down her nose. (2) My granny has always been good to me.	(1) 有时我真不相信祖母经去世。只要我闭上眼睛，就会看她活生生地坐在一把扶椅上，眼镜挂在鼻梁上，手里织着毛线衣。 (2) 我外婆总是对我很好。
graph n.图表；示意图 vt.(以图表)表示	(1) The graph shows a bulge in the price of meat. (2) Our research results are displayed in the form of a graph. (3) This is a simple graph of legislative process. (4) Since they are equations we can graph them.	(1) 图表显示肉类价格上涨。 (2) 我们的研究结果已用图表列出. (3) 这是立法过程的简易示意图。 (4) 由于它们是方程,所以我们能以图来描绘。
grasp n.把握；领会；抓紧 vt.领会；抓住；紧握	(1) She has a good grasp of the English language. (2) She has a comprehensive grasp of the subject. (3) I kept her hands in my grasp. (4) I grasped the main point of the speech. (5) Few, if any, Americans grasp the significance of what have been accomplished (6) You must grasp this opportunity. (7) If you grasp this rope, I will pull you up. (8) Jean Valjean remained inert beneath Javert's grasp, like a lion submitting to the claws of a lynx.	(1) 她精通英语。 (2) 她已全面掌握了这一学科。 (3) 我紧握着她的手。 (4) 我领会了这篇演讲的要点。 (5) 很少(如果有的话)有美国人去领会已完成的工作的意义 (6) 你必须抓住机会。 (7) 如果你抓住这根绳子，我可把你拉起来。 (8) 冉阿让在沙威的紧握下毫不动弹，好象狮子在忍受短尾山猫的爪子。
gravity n.重力；庄重；严重；严肃	(1) He discoursed impressively on Newton's theory of gravity. (2) The stone rolled down the hill by gravity. (3) The force of gravity pulls things towards the earth's centre. (4) The lunar gravity is about one-sixth that on earth. (5) Each graduate behaved with gravity at it. (6) He doesn't seem to understand the gravity of the situation. (7) She does not know the gravity of her illness. (8) This is a matter of the utmost gravity. (9) He could hardly keep his gravity.	(1) 他讲述了牛顿的引力定律，给人以深刻的印象。 (2) 石头在重力作用下向山下滚去。 (3) 地心吸力把物体吸向地心。 (4) 月亮的引力大约为地球的六分之一。 (5) 每个毕业生都举止庄重。 (6) 他似乎没有意识到形势的严重性。 (7) 她不知道自己病情严重。 (8) 这件事情十万火急。 (9) 他忍不住要笑出来。
Greece n.希腊	(1) The ship carried the national flag of Greece. (2) Ancient Greece was an advanced civilization.	(1) 那条船悬著希腊国旗。 (2) 古希腊是个先进的文明国家。

(3) Now,"Psyche"is the old Greek word for soul and also for butterfly. (4) The Greek checked his cheeks on the weekend. (5) My friend speaks French and Greek. (4) He spent the summer bussing tables in a downtown grill. (5) Had he asked any friends to grill him in a mock interview? (6) Grill the sausages for ten minutes. (7) I sometimes grill food outdoors on coals .	(1) 在生火前我们必须把烤架清理干净。 (2) 把汉堡牛排放到烤架上。 (3) 客房服务部不卖烧烤的食品。 (4) 整个夏季，他都在城里一个烧烤店帮助清理餐桌。 (5) 他可曾请朋友向他提问，对他进行模拟面试? (6) 把香肠烤十分钟。 (7) 有时我在户外用火炭烧烤食物。

(9) The abandoned garden was left to a wanton growth of weeds.	(1) 其增长速度是相当缓慢,但持续。 (2) 我们正在进入人类快速增长的时期。 (3) 市场需求低就要拖慢我们的经济增长速度。 (4) 寒冷的天气妨碍了庄稼生长。 (5) 镁是植物生长的营养要素。 (6) 治疗抑制了病情的发展。 (7) 为长期发展而牺牲短期利润是公司的方针。 (8) 尝尝我们自己种的苹果吧。 (9) 荒园里杂草丛生。

(4) If the guarantee goes to Beijing to petition again, then the four guarantors will lose their jobs. (5) Article 7 Guarantors should not provide guarantee for money-losingoverseas enterprises. (6) I can offer my land as a guarantee. (7) The guard guards the guarantee in the garden regardless of the hazard. (8) A diploma is no guarantee of efficiency. (9) We paid large fees to the Loan Guarantee Board. (10) We guarantee the fastness of these dyes.	(1) 持有文凭不能保证工作效率一定高。 (2) 我保证此类事情不会再发生。 (3) 我们担保这些染料不褪色。 (4) 如果被担保的人再次去北京上访，这四个担保人将丢失他们的工作。 (5) 第七条担保人不得为经营亏损企业提供对外担保。 (6) 我可拿出我的地产作抵押品。 (7) 卫兵不顾危险看守着花园里的抵押品。 (8) 持有文凭不能保证工作效率一定高。 (9) 我们付给了贷款保证委员会大笔的费用。 (10) 我们担保这些染料不褪色。

(4) We should not do anything under the guidance of instincts. (5) The airplane has a sophisticated electronic guidance system. guilty adj.有罪的；内疚的	(1) The court found him guilty. (2) The man was proved guilty of murder. (3) A man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty. (4) His answer evidenced a guilty conscience. (5) He had no sense of shame and never felt guilty.	(1) 法官判他有罪。 (2) 这个男子被证实犯了杀人罪。 (3) 一个人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。 (4) 他的回答证明他良心有愧。 (5) 他毫无羞耻之心，而且从不觉得内疚。
guitar n.吉他	(1) He plays the guitar and sings too. (2) I write my own songs and I play the guitar as well. (3) It is fun to play the guitar. (4) He sat there strumming a guitar. (5) Doubtless he'll be bringing his guitar, as usual.	(1) 他会弹吉他，也会唱歌。 (2) 我唱自己谱曲的歌，也弹吉他。 (3) 弹吉他是好玩的。 (4) 他坐在那儿漫不经心地弹吉他。 (5) 他很可能跟平常一样会带吉他来。
gun n.枪；炮；节流阀 vt.枪击；打开节流阀 vi.用枪打猎	(1) The gun has a carry of 400 yards. (2) He was clubbed to death with a butt of a gun. (3) It's illegal to carry guns in our country. (4) The soldier saw a gun jutting out from a bush. (5) The gun has an elevation of 45 degrees. (6) Two soldiers dismounted the gun from the base. (7) I saw them gun down innocent women and children.	(1) 这枪的射程为四百码。 (2) 他是被人用枪托殴打致死的。 (3) 在我们国家，携带枪支是违法的。 (4) 那士兵看见一支枪从矮树丛伸出来。 (5) 这门炮的仰角为45度。 (6) 两个战士把炮从底座上卸下来。 (7) 我看到他们枪杀无辜的妇女和儿童。
gym n.体育馆；健身房；体育课	(1) The basketball players are working out at the gym. (2) We go to play badminton in the nearest gym every Sunday. (3) He often went to the gym to harden his muscles. (4) I did a two-hour workout in the gym. (5) You are supposed to wear sneakers in gym class.	(1) 篮球运动员们正在体育馆进行训练。 (2) 每个星期天我们都去最近的体育馆打羽毛球。 (3) 他过去常到健身房锻炼肌肉。 (4) 我在健身房锻炼了两个小时。 (5) 体育课上你应该穿运动鞋。
gymnastics n.体操	(1) When she was young she practiced gymnastics. (2) The sport of gymnastics is popular in our country.	(1) 她年轻时练过体操。 (2) 体操运动在我国很流行。
ha int.哈！(表示惊异；愉快；怀疑；胜利等) n.[化]元素hahnium的符号	(1) The boy is very active, ha never flays up. (2) Her sincerity has never been questioned. (3) He has a downright pleasant manner. (4) "Then he's ill." "Ill? Ha! If ever I saw a gentleman in the pink?"	(1) 这个男孩很活跃，但从来不惹麻烦。 (2) 她的诚意从未受到怀疑。 (3) 他有一种令人愉快的率直态度。 (4) "那么他就是病了。""病了？哈！那我怎么看见一位绅士红光满面呢？"
habit n.习惯；习性	(1) He is in the habit of rising early. (2) I have to bear with his bad habit. (3) My colleague has broken off the habit of smoking. (4) He has a habit of sunbathe for two hours a day. (5) The honeysuckle has a twining habit.	(1) 他有早起的习惯。 (2) 我不得不忍受他的坏习惯。 (3) 我的同事已经戒掉了吸烟的习惯。 (4) 他习惯每天做两小时日光浴。 (5) 忍冬有盘绕的习性。
haircut n.理发；发式	(1) Where do you go to get a haircut? (2) She teased him into getting a haircut. (3) He sprang a new haircut on his wife.	(1) 你去哪儿理发？ (2) 她喋喋不休地哄他去理发。 (3) 他为妻子创作了一个新的发式。
ham n.火腿；（动物）后腿 v.表演过火；演技夸张	(1) This ham has too much fat on it. (2) He tucked into the ham hungrily. (3) He made a ham sandwich. (4) The actor is really ham it up to amuse the audience. (5) She is the person who likes to ham it up most I have ever seen. (6) Your story is very funny, but there is no need to ham it up.	(1) 这火腿肥肉太多。 (2) 他狼吞虎咽地大吃火腿。 (3) 他做了一个火腿三明治。 (4) 这些演员为博观众一笑,表演得实在太过火了。 (5) 她是我见过的最喜欢做作的人。 (6) 你的故事很能引人发笑，不过不必过分渲染。
hammer n.锤；榔头 vi.锤击；反复敲打 vt.锤打；严厉批评	(1) He hit the nail into the wall with a hammer. (2) He smashed a hole in the window with a hammer. (3) He took a hammer and recessed a hole into the wall. (4) The teacher has been trying to hammer in the facts. (5) The police hammered the door. (6) Her latest movie was hammered by the critics.	(1) 他用一把锤子把钉子打进墙里去。 (2) 他用锤子在玻璃上打了个洞。 (3) 他拿起一个榔头，在墙上敲出一个洞。 (4) 教师一直设法把这些事实灌输给学生。 (5) 警察不停地敲门。 (6) 她最近的一部电影遭到评论家的批评。
handbag n.手提包	(1) She was carrying a buffalo hide handbag. (2) Do you mind if I open your handbag and check?	(1) 她拎著一个牛皮手提包。 (2) 我打开你的手提包检查一下行吗？
handful n.一把；少数；<非>难控制的人；棘手之事	(1) He dipped into the bag and brought out a handful of sample wheat. (2) All the trouble is being caused by a handful of malcontents. (3) We invited twenty people, but only a handful of them came.	(1) 他把手伸进袋里，取出一把小麦样品。 (2) 这些是非都是由一小撮不满分子搬弄的。 (3) 我们邀请了20 个人，但只来了寥寥数人。
handkerchief n.手帕；方巾；围巾	(1) She was playing with her handkerchief all the while during the speech. (2) I polished my buttons with a handkerchief. (3) She embroidered her initials on the handkerchief. (4) I folded the handkerchief and put it in my pocket. (5) She fluttered her handkerchief from the train window as a good-bye. handle v.处理；对待；操作；触；买卖 n.把手；柄	(1) I was impressed by her handling of the affair. (2) The speaker was roughly handled by the mob. (3) He's not a very good teacher---he doesn't know how to handle children. (4) He knows how to handle the machine. (5) Customers are asked not to handle the goods in the shop. (6) We don't handle that sort of book. (7) I turned the handle and opened the door. (8) The handle of the hammer came away easily. (9) She burnt herself on a red-hot pan handle.	(1) 我觉得她对此事的处理很了不起。 (2) 演说者受到暴民的粗暴对待。 (3) 他不是一个好的老师---他不懂得如何对待孩子。 (4) 他会操作这台机器。 (5) 请顾客不要触摸商店里的货物。 (6) 我们不经销那一类书。 (7) 我转了转拉手,把门打开。 (8) 这锤柄很容易脱落。 (9) 她被炽热的锅柄烫伤了。
handsome adj.可观的；英俊的；慷慨大方的；灵巧的	(1) The waitress received a handsome tip. (2) He is a reporter on the news,and draws a handsome screw. (3) Her bridegroom is a handsome young man. (4) Her husband is a very handsome young man. (5) She was thrilled when the handsome filmstar kissed her. (6) It's handsome of him to give me a present. (7) I got a handsome present on my birthday. (8) The little girl is pretty handsome.	(1) 女侍者收到了数量可观的小费。 (2) 他是新闻记者，领取可观的薪水。 (3) 她的新郎是一个英俊的年轻人。 (4) 她丈夫是一个非常英俊的年轻人。 (5) 当那位英俊的电影明星吻她的时候，她欣喜若狂。 (6) 他慷慨大方地给了我一份送礼物。 (7) 在我生日那天我收到一份出手大方的礼物。 (8) 这个小女孩长得很灵巧。
handtruck n.手推运货车	(1) He crashed the handtruck through the doors. (2) A lady comes round the office with a tea handtruck in the afternoon. (3) A worker drove a small handtruck so carelessly that it hit the back of Mr King's legs. (4) At that time it was also the equivalent of four gallons of gas, two months’ supply of stamps, or an hour of my hard labor moving office furniture with little more than a handtruck, after tax.	(1) 他推着手推车乒乒乓乓地过了几道门。 (2) 下午一位女士用手推车给办公室里的人送茶水。 (3) 一个工人驾驶一辆推车时，太粗心大意了，车子竟撞着了金先生的腿肚子。 (4) 当然，任何一个制度下都不能缺了他们，否则没有谏言，但是如果把他们尊为学者大师，纳入决策圈的智库，恐怕国家大业要在无止境的争吵中葬送。
handwriting n.笔迹；书法	(1) The handwriting on both cheques is identical. (2) It's always a problem deciphering his handwriting. (3) My handwriting cannot compete with his. (4) There is need for improvement in your handwriting.	(1) 两张支票上的笔迹完全相同。 (2) 辨认他的笔迹有困难。 (3) 我的书法不及他。 (4) 你的书法需要改进。
handy adj.方便的；手边的；灵巧的；近便的；现成的	(1) An electric kettle is very handy. (2) The sailors clung to anything handy. (3) He is very handy at repairing clocks. (4) It is quite a handy little sailing boat. (5) Our flat is very handy for the schools. (6) The house is very handy for the shops. (7) When ideas fail, words come in very handy.	(1) 电水壶使用非常方便。 (2) 水手们紧紧抓住手边任何东西。 (3) 他修钟表很灵巧。 (4) 这是一个相当灵巧的小帆船。 (5) 我们的住所离学校很近，非常方便。 (6) 这房子离商店很近便。 (7) 想法失败的时候，词语就在手边。
happiness n.幸福；快乐；适当	(1) Human happiness is so fragile. (2) I desire happiness. (3) Money can't buy happiness. (4) His marriage is full of happiness. (5) Her happiness at seeing him submerged her former worries. (6) Money doesn't always bring happiness. (7) He has known both grief and happiness.	(1) 人生幸福易逝。 (2) 我渴望幸福。 (3) 金钱买不来幸福。 (4) 他的婚姻生活很幸福。 (5) 她看到他非常高兴，顿时完全忘记了先前的烦恼。 (6) 金钱并不一定带来快乐。 (7) 忧患和快乐他都经历过。
harbour n.港口；避难所 vt.庇护；心怀；窝藏 vi.进入避祸所；躲藏 =harbor.	(1) This harbour is a natural harbour. (2) We lay at anchor outside the harbour. (3) Harbour lights were blinking on the horizon. (4) He harbours a secret grudge against his father. (5) Harbouring criminals is an offence in law. (6) Crabs harbour in holes.	(1) 这个港口是天然港。 (2) 我们在港外抛锚停泊。 (3) 海港的灯火在水平线上闪烁着。 (4) 他对父亲暗怀不满。 (5) 窝藏罪犯是犯法的。 (6) 蟹躲藏在洞里。
hardship n.艰难；困苦	(1) We are ready to face any hardship. (2) He will not shrink from any hardship. (3) A strong man will bear hardship without complaining. (4) His health broke after years of hardship.	(1) 我们准备好了面对任何艰难。 (2) 他不会因任何艰难而畏缩。 (3) 一个坚强的人会忍受困苦而不抱怨。 (4) 多年的困苦生活使他的身体垮了。
hardworking adj.努力工作的；勤奋的	(1) China is full of hardworking people. (2) Hardworking students may see a quick improvement in their English level after a few weeks of study at our school.	(1) 中国到处都是勤奋的人。 (2) 勤奋的学生在我们的学校学习几个星期以后他们的英语水平就会有很明显的进步。
harmful adj.有害的	(1) The instrument sheds harmful radiations. (2) Freezing winter is harmful to orange trees.	(1) 这仪器散发有害的辐射物。 (2) 冰冻天气对桔子树是有害的。
harmless adj.无害的；无恶意的	(1) She developed a few harmless eccentricities. (2) No cigarette is completely harmless. (3) I made a harmless remark to some guy at the bar and he swung at me. (4) The bomb blast killed several harmless passers-by.	(1) 她逐渐养成一些无害的癖性。 (2) 没有香烟是完全无害的。 (3) 在酒吧里我向某个家伙说了句无恶意的话，他就向我打了一拳。 (4) 炸弹爆炸使几个无辜行人受伤。
harmony n.和谐；协调；调和；和声	(1) An enterprise should be full of fairness and harmony. (2) Their life is a natural harmony. (3) There was not much harmony in international affairs during those years. (4) Almost unconsciously she dressed in harmony with this note of simplicity. (5) Its harmony is grave and gentle, sad tender.	(1) 一个企业内部应该充满公平与和谐。 (2) 他们的生活是一种自然的和谐。 (3) 那些年国际事态不很协调。 (4) 她简直不自觉的打扮得跟这朴素的调子很调和。 (5) 它的和声显得既严峻又柔和，既忧伤又委婉。
hatch n.孵化；舱口，舱口盖 v.孵；孵出；策划	(1) The hatch date for tit eggs appears to be determined about a month earlier, when the eggs are laid. (2) Both men quickly disappeared down the hatch. (3) An incubator is used to hatch chicken. (4) The male leaves the female to hatch her eggs and looks for food. (5) Chicks are hatching from the eggs. (6) Hen's eggs take21 days to hatch out. (7) What mischief are those children hatching?	(1) 白颊山雀孵化的时间，似乎在孵化前一个月，也就是下蛋时便已决定。 (2) 两个人很快从舱口下去不见了。 (3) 孵卵器用来孵小鸡。 (4) 雄性离开雌性去孵蛋和寻找食物。 (5) 小鸡正从蛋壳里孵出来。 (6) 鸡蛋需要21天才孵化。 (7) 那些孩子在琢磨什么鬼花样?
hawk n.鹰；鹰派人物、主战分子；贪婪的人；清嗓 v.沿街叫卖；散布；鹰扑；放鹰行猎；清嗓	(1) The hawk is hovering overhead. (2) The hawk pounced on its prey and carried it off. (3) He is neither a dove nor a hawk, but betwixt and between. (4) In a free market, retailers hawk their wares. (5) He's always hawking gossip about. (6) The tribes like to hawk in the desert.	(1) 鹰在头顶上盘旋。 (2) 那只鹰向那小动物猛扑过去把它叼走了。 (3) 他既不是鸽派，也不是鹰派，而是中间派。 (4) 自由市场里商贩们不停地叫卖着。 (5) 他老是散播流言。 (6) 这些部落喜欢在沙漠中带鹰打猎。
hay n.干草；<俚>一小笔钱；床	(1) The children snuggled down on the hay. (2) Make hay while the sun shines. (3) The men hit the hay early, in order to be out hunting at dawn.	(1) 孩子们舒适地蜷伏在干草上。 (2) [谚]把握时机；趁热打铁。 (3) 为了第二天破晓出去打猎，这些人很早就上床睡觉了。
headline n.大字标题；新闻提要；头条新闻 v.加标题于；宣扬；作主角	(1) A newspaper headline caught his attention. (2) A headline on the front page draws attention to the fuller story inside. (3) A bold black headline screamed out from the front page. (4) The news headlines are broadcast on the half hour. (5) The medical breakthrough hit the headlines around the world. (6) The newspapers headlined the story of the astronauts' trip to the moon.	(1) 报纸的大标题引起他的注意。 (2) 扉页上的大字标题为的是吸引你注意里面的详细内容。 (3) 在头版上出现了一条令人触目惊心的粗黑体大字标题。 (4) 新闻提要每到半小时正时作一次广播。 (5) 那项医学上的重要突破登上全世界的头条。 (6) 报纸大力报导太空人的月球之行。
headmistress n.女校长	(1) Well,I was moved by the dedication of the selfless headmistress. (2) The charming headmistress is giving a lecture to the students.	(1) 我对那无私女校长的奉献十分感动。 (2) 那位很有魅力的女校长正在给学生上课。
headteacher n.中小学的校长	(1) The headteacher was wrathful with the children's unruly behavior.	(1) 校长被那些不守规矩的小学生惹得发怒。
heap n.堆；许多；<口>破车 vt.使成堆；装满；大量给予	(1) The books lay in a heap on the floor. (2) There is a disorderly heap of clothes in his room. (3) He fell down the stairs, landing in a heap at the bottom. (4) We have a heap of work to do. (5) Thanks a heap! (6) The best interest she likes is to heap up dollars. (7) He heaped the plate with food. (8) You have no right to heap insults on anybody.	(1) 书堆放在地板上。 (2) 他屋里有一堆乱七八糟的衣服。 (3) 他从楼梯上摔下来，直跌到楼梯底部滚成一团。 (4) 我们有许多工作要做。 (5) 多谢！ (6) 她的最大嗜好就是攒钱。 (7) 他在盘子里堆了满食物。 (8) 他没有权力侮辱任何一个人。
hearing n.听力；听觉；说话或申辩的机会；审讯；听证会 动词hear的现在分词.	(1) He has a good faculty of hearing. (2) His hearing was impaired after the explosion. (3) Loud noise would impair your hearing. (4) Vision and hearing are exteroceptive senses. (5) You knew the hearing was set down for today. (6) We received unfair treatment during our hearing. (7) The financial committee had a hearing yesterday. (8) We are all ready for the court hearing.	(1) 他的听力生来就好。 (2) 爆炸后他的听力受到了损害。 (3) 大的噪音会损害你的听觉。 (4) 视觉与听觉都是感受外界刺激的官能。 (5) 你当时知道，审讯定于今天举行。 (6) 审讯期间，我们受到了不公平的对待。 (7) 昨天经济委员会召开了一个听证会。 (8) 法院听证会我们都已经准备好了。
heat n.热度；热；热烈；激烈；发烧 v.(使)变热；(使)激动	(1) Turn the heat down or your cake will burn. (2) I can't walk about in this heat. (3) Water is changed into steam by heat and into ice by cold. (4) So desert should take heat with cereus. (5) In the heat of the argument, Mr. Rogers lost his self-control. (6) This will relieve the heat of the fever. (7) When a fever starts and your body tries to elevate its temperature, you feel chilly and may shiver to generate heat. (8) We'll heat some water to wash clothes. (9) Just heat up the food in the microwave. (10) That were remarks made in the heat of the moment. (11) I spoke with a little heat, thinking of the bloody dirk he had hidden in his pocket, and designed, in his ill thoughts, to end me with.	(1) 把热度调低吧,要不蛋糕就要糊了。 (2) 我不能在这种酷热下走路。 (3) 水加热则成为蒸汽，冷却则成为冰。 (4) 所以沙漠应该为仙人掌而热烈。 (5) 在这激烈的争论中,罗杰斯先生失去了自制力。 (6) 这会减轻发烧的热度。 (7) 当发烧开始的时候，身体试着提高温度，你就会感到寒冷并且通过发抖来产生热量。 (8) 我们会热点儿水洗衣服。 (9) 把食物放在微波炉里热热就行了。 (10) 那是一时激动之下所说的话。 (11) 想到他的怀里藏着一把沾着血迹的短剑，想到他心里装着邪念，要结果我的生命，我说话时不禁有些激动。
heaven n.天空；天堂 Heaven. n.上帝	(1) Twinkling stars are garnishry of heaven. (2) If there's a heaven on earth, this is it! (3) Christians believe that Jesus ascended into Heaven. (4) It was the will of Heaven.	(1) 闪烁的星星是天空的装饰品。 (2) 人间若有天堂，非此莫属！ (3) 基督徒认为耶稣升天了。 (4) 这是天意。
heel n.脚后跟 v.倾侧	(1) His heel is raw because his shoe does not fit well. (2) I have a blister on my heel because my shoes are too tight. (3) The boat heeled the strong wind.	(1) 因鞋子不合适，他的脚后跟擦破皮了。 (2) 鞋子太紧了，我脚后跟起了个泡。 (3) 船在大风吹袭下倾到了一边。
helicopter n.直升飞机 vt.用直升飞机载送 vi.乘直升机	(1) The criminal escaped by a helicopter. (2) The shipwrecked sailors were rescued by helicopter. (3) We shuttled the passengers to the city center by helicopter. (4) The officials were helicoptered aboard the ship. (5) You can helicopter to the island.	(1) 罪犯乘直升机逃走了。 (2) 遭遇海难的水手已经被直升机救起。 (3) 我们来来回回地用直升机把旅客运送到市中心。 (4) 官员们被用直升机送到船上。 (5) 你可以乘坐直升机去那个岛。
helmet n.头盔；安全帽	(1) The sword bit the knight's helmet. (2) A miner's lamp is fixed onto his helmet. (3) The safety helmet is held on by an elastic strap. (4) All visitors to the site must wear safety helmet.	(1) 剑刺穿了武士的头盔。 (2) 矿灯固定在矿工的头盔上。 (3) 安全帽用一根松紧带系住。 (4) 到工地的所有参观者必须带上安全帽。
hen n.母鸡；雌禽	(1) The hen sits for most of the day. (2) The hen tucked her head under her wing. (3) The hen clucked when calling her chickens. (4) This hen lays beautiful brown eggs. (5) The hen has hatched all her chickens. (6) The cock has brighter coloured feathers than the hen.	(1) 这只母鸡整天大部分时间都在抱窝。 (2) 那母鸡把头缩在翅膀下。 (3) 母鸡唤小鸡时，发出咯咯的叫声。 (4) 这只母鸡下很漂亮的棕色蛋。 (5) 那只母鸡已经孵出了全部小鸡。 (6) 雄鸟的羽毛比雌鸟的艳丽。
herb n.药草；香草	(1) He alighted on a rare medical herb. (2) I had to take the herb tea although it's bitter. (3) The essence drawn out from this medicinal herb is good for high blood pressure. (4) This herb can act as an antidote against snakebite. (5) Caraway has a nutty smell and is also an herb useful to digestion. (6) Parsley is an herb if you use just the greens. (7) The chicken was sauced in a fresh herb dressing. (8) A herb loaf goes well with melon salad.	(1) 他偶然找到了一种稀有的草药。 (2) 虽然汤药很苦，我还是不得不喝了。 (3) 从这种药草提炼出来的精华对治疗高血压有效。 (4) 这种药草可以用作被蛇咬后的解毒药。 (5) 香菜有一种坚果气味，也是一种对消化有益的药草。 (6) 假如只食用其绿叶部分，荷兰芹是一种香草。 (7) 鸡肉采用新鲜的香草佐料进行调味。 (8) 香草面包和甜瓜色拉是很好的搭配。
hero n.英雄 n.男主角；男主人公	(1) The hero smote the giant with his sword. (2) He is the hero of an old legend. (3) They say the hero is played by Tom Cruise. (4) Who is going to play to the hero of the play? (5) The hero of a story usually is a fine person.	(1) 英雄用剑猛劈巨人。 (2) 他是一个古老传说中的英雄。 (3) 据说男主角是汤姆·克鲁斯。 (4) 谁来演与男主角相配的女主角? (5) 故事中的男主人公往往都是品质好的人。
heroine n.女英雄；女主角	(1) This story featured a plucky heroine. (2) I cannot believe she is the heroine of the movie. (3) The heroine made her exit to great applause.	(1) 这个故事描述了一个勇敢的女英雄。 (2) 我难以相信她是这部电影的女主角。 (3) 女主角在热烈的掌声中退场。
hibernate vi.冬眠；蛰伏；过冬	(1) Bears wake for spring, summer, and fall and hibernate for the winter. (2) In the cold weather some of them hibernate. They go to sleep in all kinds of place. (3) You should hibernate before I contact with you. (4) His family often hibernates to the South.	(1) 熊在春天、夏天和秋天保持清醒,在冬季冬眠。 (2) 它们有的在寒冷的天气里冬眠了。它们在各种各样的地方睡觉。 (3) 在我与你联系之前，你得潜伏不动。 (4) 他们家每到冬天都到南方去过冬。
hibernation n.冬眠	(1) Hibernation has long intrigued biologists. (2) Some animals can overwinter without the hibernation.	(1) 冬眠长期以来一直引起生物学家的兴趣。 (2) 有些动物不需要冬眠也能过冬。
hide and seek 捉迷藏	(1) The boys gave us little trouble because they spent the whole afternoon together playing hide and seek. (2) The children spent the whole afternoon together playing hide and seek.	(1) 这些男孩并不怎么麻烦我们，因为整个下午他们都在一起捉迷藏。 (2) 整个下午孩子们都在一起玩捉迷藏游戏。
highway n.公路；(水陆空)直接航线或路线	(1) A four-lane highway connects the two cities. (2) This narrow highway should be broadened.	(1) 一条四车道的公路连接这两个城市。 (2) 这条狭窄的公路应该加宽。
hillside n.山腰；山坡	(1) The old man laboured up the hillside. (2) The path steepens as you climb the hillside. (3) The torrent scoured a gully down the hillside. (4) We walked down the woody hillside singing loudly. (5) The hillside is covered by grass and flowers in summer.	(1) 老人吃力地登上山腰。 (2) 顺着山腰往上爬,小径愈发陡峭。 (3) 那激流顺山坡而下冲出一条水沟。 (4) 我们大声唱着歌走下树木丛生的山坡。 (5) 夏天时，山坡上长满了花草。
hilly adj.多小山的；丘陵的	(1) The harvest in this hilly area is very bad. (2) The hilly areas make good sheep pasture, and sheep will batten on the lush grass. (3) There is a large hilly area in the northwest.	(1) 这种多山的地区收成很不好。 (2) 这一带山区是很好的牧羊场，羊吃了茂盛的青草会长得肥肥的。 (3) 西北部有一大片丘陵地带。
hire v.雇用；出租 n.租金；雇用；租用	(1) We don't want to hire inexperienced worker. (2) We hired an advertising company for help to sell our product. (3) Lawyers are men who hire out their words and anger. (4) They hire out boats by the hour. (5) The price includes the hire of the hall. (6) He signed up for a week's car hire.	(1) 我们不想聘用没有经验的工人。 (2) 我们雇用了一家广告公司来推销我们的产品。 (3) 律师,是把自己的言辞与愤怒出租于人的人。 (4) 他们按小时出租小船。 (5) 费用包括礼堂租金。 (6) 他签订了一星期的汽车租用协议。
hive n.蜂房；蜂箱；蜂群；喧闹繁忙的场所 vi.蜂进入蜂箱；聚居；把一部分分离出来 vt.使蜂入箱；储备	(1) A hive cannot exist without a queen. (2) There were so many bees in the hive that I felt great fear. (3) Tapping on the hive excited the bees. (4) He built a special hive,containing only one honeycomb. (5) There is only one queen in a hive of honey bees. (6) The whole hive flew after the queen bee. (7) Tom has hived off again. (8) The director decide to hive off some part of the work and start new firm.	(1) 蜂房不可无蜂王。 (2) 蜂房里有那么多蜜蜂我感到很害怕。 (3) 轻拍蜂箱触动了蜜蜂。 (4) 他特制了一个只有一个蜂窝的蜂箱。 (5) 一个蜜蜂的蜂群中只有一只蜂后。 (6) 整个蜂群跟著蜂王飞舞。 (7) 汤姆又不辞而别了。 (8) 董事们决定分出部分业务，另成立新公司。
holy adj.神圣的；圣洁的；令人敬仰的	(1) To the children, their father's study was the holy of holies. (2) Jerusalem was regarded as the holy place by the Christians. (3) They led a holy life. (4) The poem sings the praises of holy love. (5) The pursuit of peace is our holiest quest.	(1) 在这些孩子的眼里，父亲的书房是最神圣的地方。 (2) 耶路撒冷被基督徒们认为是圣地。 (3) 他们过着圣洁的生活。 (4) 这首诗歌颂圣洁的爱。 (5) 对和平的追求是最值得敬仰的。
homeland n.祖国	(1) They yearned to go back to their homeland. (2) The overseas are very glad to set foot on their homeland. (3) He came to miss his homeland when he settled down abroad.	(1) 他们念念不忘要回到祖国。 (2) 华侨们非常高兴地踏上祖国的土地。 (3) 当他在国外安定下来时，他开始想念祖国了。
honest adj.诚实的；正直的；坦率的	(1) Her action declared her to be an honest woman. (2) It was commonly believed that he was an honest man. (3) The article is an attempt to defame an honest man. (4) It's an honest book but it hasn't been polished.	(1) 她的行为足以说明她是一个诚实的女人。 (2) 一般都认为他是一个诚实的人。 (3) 这篇文章旨在诋毁一个正直的人。 (4) 这本书写得真诚坦率，但还未经润色。
honey n.蜂蜜；甜蜜；宝贝 v.说甜言蜜语；（加蜜）使甜 adj.甜蜜的；亲爱的	(1) This jar of pure honey weighs 350 grams net. (2) We can use honey as a substitute of sugar. (3) Love is a mixture of honey and bitterness. (4) Clear all these toys away before bedtime, honey. (5) Hi honey, are you okay? You look a little pale. (6) He always honeyed his boss. (7) Thanks for washing my pj's honey.	(1) 这瓶纯蜂蜜净重三百五十克。 (2) 我们可以蜂蜜作为糖的代替品。 (3) 爱情混杂着甜蜜和苦涩。 (4) 宝贝儿，睡觉前把这些玩具都放回去。 (5) 嗨,宝贝儿,你没事吧？你看起来有点苍白。 (6) 他总是恭维他的老板。 (7) 亲爱的，谢谢你帮我洗睡衣。
honor n.荣誉；荣幸；尊敬；信用；正直；贞洁 vt.尊敬；使荣幸；对...表示敬意；兑现	(1) He stained the family honor. (2) I consider it a great honor to be invited to dinner. (3) He won honor for his courage. (4) I see no need to honor a pact with an evil beast, Mikhail. (5) Credit rating agencies downgraded AIG A.I.G. because of concerns it could not honor its contracts. (6) He is a man of honor. (7) November 11th is Veterans Day, when Americans honor those who served in the military. (8) Would you honor me by dining with me tonight? (9) Mrs. Dodd wanted a special day to honor her father, William Smart. (10) Please honor our arrangement by exchanging the damaged goods.	(1) 他玷污了家族的荣誉。 (2) 我认为能被邀请参加晚宴是很大的荣幸。 (3) 他以勇气赢得大家的尊敬。 (4) 我认为没有必要跟一个邪恶怪兽讲信用，米克黑尔。 (5) 由于担心美国国际集团无法承兑这些合同，信用评级机构降低了其信用度的评估。 (6) 他是一个正直的人。 (7) 11月11日是美国老兵纪年日，是美国人表达其对军人尊敬的日子。 (8) 今晚你能赏光与我共进晚餐吗？ (9) 多德夫人希望能用一个特殊的日子向她父亲-威廉·斯玛特先生表示敬意。 (10) 请遵守我们的协议，给我们调换损坏的货物。
hook n.钩；钩状物；勾拳 v.钩住；弯成(钩状)；当妓女	(1) Please hang your coat on the hook. (2) They took the phone off the hook so no calls would disturb them. (3) Please hook the rope over the nail. (4) She had managed to hook a wealthy husband. (5) He tends to hook his finger when he is thinking.	(1) 请把你的外衣挂在钩上。 (2) 他们摘下电话听筒，以免电话打扰他们。 (3) 请把绳子挂在那根钉子上。 (4) 她成功地嫁到了一位有钱的丈夫。 (5) 他在思考时经常弯曲手指.

hopeful adj.有希望的	(1) I'm hopeful that they'll fulfil the task on time. (2) I am very hopeful that we will be able to reach an agreement.	(1) 他们会按时完成任务，对这一点，我是抱有希望的。 (2) 大家都作一点让步，那么达成协议很有希望的。

(4) It functions as a sort of mid-life purgatory for hopeless souls on Earth. (5) Mido was hopeless and will surely be on his way. (4) Dense fog is always horrible to the driver. (5) Will you stop making that horrible noise!	(1) 他一想到那种可怕的情景就感到恶心。 (2) 一切都陷入可怕的混乱。 (3) 战场的情景令人毛骨悚然。 (4) 对于路上的司机浓雾总是很讨厌的。 (5) 你别再弄出那种讨厌的响声来行不行。

(4) They listened to the howl of the wind through the trees. (5) The dog howled over its master's body. (6) The baby howled all night. (7) It's not polite to howl down a speaker. (4) He'll never change, and will hug his cherished beliefs. (5) During the fog, we had to hug the side of the road. (6) The road hugs the river. (7) He greeted her with a loving hug. (8) She gave her mother an affectionate hug.	(1) 在美国,见面拥抱是件很平常的事。 (2) 他匆匆忙忙走下跳板,张开双臂去拥抱等候着他的妻子。 (3) 那孩子紧抱着她的洋娃娃。 (4) 他不会改变的，他将永守他所抱的信仰。 (5) 雾出现的时候，我们不得不沿着路边走。 (6) 道路紧靠河边。 (7) 他以一个深情的拥抱来迎接她。 (8) 她紧紧拥抱著她的母亲。

(4) It tells a romantic and humorous love.	(1) 我有许多幽默的故事。 (2) 他的确有一副严肃的脸孔，但内心却是很富幽默感。 (3) 她在心情不好的时候写诙谐的歌曲。 (4) 它讲述了一个浪漫而诙谐的爱情故事。

(8) It's always best to humour him when he's in one of his bad moods.	(1) 她很幽默，谈起话来妙趣横生。 (2) 他十分缺乏幽默。 (3) 她的幽默感把他强烈地吸引住了。 (4) 要理解她的作品就必须具有幽默感。 (5) 各人有各人的脾气。 (6) 好多天来，他的情绪一直很不好。 (7) 纵容一个小孩是不明智的。 (8) 他心境不好的时候，最好还是迁就他。

hunter n.猎人；猎犬；猎马；搜寻者 Hunter. n.亨特（姓氏）	(1) The hunter steadied his rifle and fired. (2) The fox ran away before the hunter shot it. (3) The hunter agreed to take us to go hunting tomorrow. (4) The hunter used a dog to put up a hare. (5) When the hunter realized that the quarry had gone to earth and the dogs had lost scent, he called off the hunt. (6) The job hunter dawdled all morning but achieved nothing. (7) Hunter expects that she will come. (8) Harper made an abstract of Prof. Hunter's lecture.
