identity n.一致；身份；特征	(1) Identity of interests is the bond that unites them. (2) The police asked him to show his identity card. (3) The journalist did not want to reveal the identity of his informant. (4) He had to make his identity public. (5) The countries have kept their own distinct political and cultural identities.	(1) 利害的一致是把他们联合起来的纽带。 (2) 警察让他出示身份证。 (3) 那个新闻工作者不想透露消息提供人的身分。 (4) 他不得不公开自己的身份。 (5) 这些国家保持了自己独特的政治和文化特征。（《麦克米兰英语词典》）
identification n.确认；鉴定；识别；身份的证明	(1) A line of people is formed for identification. (2) He gave a positive identification of the killer. (3) Jewellery identification is a hard job. (4) Fingerprint identification is widely used. (5) Here is my passport for identification. (6) Do you have any identification cards?	(1) 人们排成一行等待确认身份。 (2) 他明确的认出了凶手。 (3) 珠宝鉴定不是一件容易的工作。 (4) 指纹鉴定被广泛运用。 (5) 这是我证明身份的护照。 (6) 你们有身份证吗？
idiom n.成语；惯用语；方言；风格；特色	(1) This idiom cannot be translated literally. (2) "Let the cat out of the bag" is an idiom meaning to tell a secret by mistake. (3) He spoke in the idiom of the New England countryside. (4) I like the idiom of modern popular music. (5) It was an old building in the local idiom.	(1) 这个成语无法照字面翻译。 (2) “让猫从袋子里跑出来”是惯用语，意思是无意中泄露秘密。 (3) 他讲新英格兰乡下的方言。 (4) 我喜欢现代流行音乐的风格。 (5) 这是一座具有当地特色的古建筑。
ignore vt.忽视；不理；不顾	(1) If you ignore your diet, trouble will follow. (2) I agree in principle, but we can't ignore the differences. (3) The wisest course would be to ignore it. (4) We could ignore him and go direct to the chairman, but we'd be skating on very thin ice. (5) We cannot afford to ignore their advice.	(1) 如果你忽视自己的饮食，必然会遇到麻烦 (2) 我原则上同意,但我们不能忽视这些差异。 (3) 上上策是不予理睬。 (4) 我们可以不理会他而直接去找主席，但那样做我们就如履薄冰了。 (5) 我们不能不考虑他们的劝告。
illegal adj.非法的；不合法的 n.非法移民	(1) The jewellery firm is just a front for their illegal trade in diamonds. (2) All protests are brutally repressed by the government as illegal. (3) Their speculative buying of grain is illegal. (4) Abortion is illegal in this country. (5) It's illegal to read people's private letters without permission. (6) The illegals couldn't be admitted by the authority.	(1) 该珠宝公司不过是进行非法的钻石交易的幌子。 (2) 所有的抗议活动都遭到当局的野蛮镇压，并被宣布为非法。 (3) 他们投机购买谷物是不合法的。 (4) 人工流产在这个国家是不合法的。 (5) 未经允许看别人的私人信件是不合法的。 (6) 非法移民是不被政府认可的。
illness n.病；疾病	(1) His illness diminished his health. (2) Worry and illness had made him prematurely old. (3) A mysterious illness is affecting all the animals. (4) More than three million people suffer from severe mental illness.	(1) 疾病侵蚀了他的健康。 (2) 他心事重重、 疾病缠身，落得个未老先衰。 (3) 一种奇怪的疾病正在侵袭所有的动物。 (4) 有超过三百万的人患有严重的精神疾病。
immediate adj.直接的；最接近的；立即的；目前的	(1) The immediate cause of death is unknown. (2) He seldom expected to receive any immediate profit. (3) The evidence has no immediate bearing on the case. (4) His immediate successors fell into the same trap. (5) I have no immediate connection with him. (6) His immediate reaction was one of revulsion. (7) My immediate family consists of my son and my wife. (8) There's no post office in the immediate neighbourhood. (9) What are your plans for the immediate future? (10) This work demands your immediate attention. (11) Her arrest produced an immediate reaction from the press. (12) He insisted on immediate payment. (13) The victims need our immediate help. (14) One hundred dollars will meet my immediate needs. (15) Today's immediate problem is one of distribution of both food and income.	(1) 造成死亡的直接原因不明。 (2) 他倒不一定是想从中捞到什么直接的好处。 (3) 该证据与本案无直接关系。 (4) 他的直接继承者也堕入了这一陷阱。 (5) 我和他没有直接关系。 (6) 他的直接反映是厌恶。 (7) 我的最亲近的家人包括儿子和妻子。 (8) 附近没有邮局。 (9) 你最近有什麽计画? (10) 这件工作急需你立即处理。 (11) 她被捕的事立刻在新闻界引起反应。 (12) 他坚持要求对方立即付款。 (13) 受害者需要我们立即的援助。 (14) 一百美元可以应付我目前的需要。 (15) 目前面临的紧迫问题是食物分配和收入分配问题。
immediately adv.立即；直接地 conj.一 ... (就)	(1) He began to look for another position immediately. (2) All those who are immediately involved will be informed of the decision. (3) I came immediately I heard the news.	(1) 他马上开始寻找另一个职位。 (2) 这个决定将被通知给所有直接有关的人。 (3) 我一听到这个消息,马上就来了。
immigration n.移居；移民	(1) He is talking about immigration. (2) There are strict controls on immigration into this country. (3) The increased immigration strengthened the colony.	(1) 他正在谈论移居国外的事. (2) 移民到这个国家有严格的限制。 (3) 移民的增加巩固了这个殖民地。
import n.进口；意义；进口商品 v.进口；输入	(1) The government has imposed strict controls over the import of luxury goods. (2) You should grasp the import of your mother's remarks. (3) The miscellaneous expenses of import are so much! (4) It is profitable to import food. (5) Please select file to import and click OK.	(1) 政府对奢侈品的进口采取了严格的管制。 (2) 你应该领会到你妈妈说话的含义。 (3) 进口货物的杂费太多了！ (4) 进口食品可赚钱。 (5) 请选择文件输入并点击完成。
importance n.重要；重要性	(1) Character is of sovereign importance. (2) What was said was of prime importance. (3) This matter is of vital importance to us. (4) He emphasized the importance of careful driving. (5) We cannot emphasize too much the importance of learning English.	(1) 人品最为重要。 (2) 说过的那件事是很重要的。 (3) 这件事对我们来说至关重要。 (4) 他强调小心驾驶的重要性。 (5) 我们再怎样强调学英文的重要性也不为过。
impress n.印记；印象；特征 v.使 ... 有印象；影响；印刻；传送	(1) Their honesty and hospitality leave an indelible impress on her life. (2) I had a chance to impress her with my efficiency and I muffed it up. (3) She impressed me as a scholar. (4) What impress you most when you go to IKEA? (5) How these mergers impress Chinese beer industry is the point of this paper. (6) If you are unable to sign, please impress your left thumbprint. (7) You must impress your seal on this official letter.	(1) 他们的诚实与好客给她一生留下了难以磨灭的印象。 (2) 我本来有机会使她对我的办事效率有印象,但是我错过了这个机会。 (3) 她给我留下了学者的印象。 (4) 您去宜家时以下哪一项对您影响最深刻？ (5) 这些并购对啤酒业绩效的影响是本文讨论的中心问题。 (6) 如不能签署,请印下左拇指指模。 (7) 你必须在这份公函上盖上你的。
impression n.印象；感觉；模仿 n.印迹；印刷	(1) Her gentleness has given me a deep impression. (2) I am surprised you've got an unfavorable impression of him. (3) I had the impression that your boy hates school. (4) The students did some marvellous impressions of the teachers at the end-of-term party. (5) The first edition of this dictionary has an impression of 10,000 copies and the total price is 1,000,000 yuan.	(1) 她的亲切给我留下了很深的印象。 (2) 我很惊讶你对他印象不佳。 (3) 我感觉你的孩子不喜欢去上学。 (4) 在期末联欢会上,学生惟妙惟肖地模仿起了教师。 (5) 这部词典第一版印刷一万册，码洋为一百万元。
improve vt.改善；改进；提高 vi.变得更好；改进	(1) Your work will get by, but try to improve it. (2) I want to improve my English. (3) Wine improves with age. (4) I hope the weather will improve before Friday. (5) His manners will improve with age. (6) This game is our baby so we want to constantly improve on it.	(1) 你的工作勉强通过了,但要设法改善它。 (2) 我想提高我的英语水平。 (3) 酒存放得越久越醇。 (4) 我希望星期五之前天气会好转。 (5) 随着年龄的增长 (6) 这个游戏是我们的孩子,我们当然想持续改进它。
inch n.英寸；少量 v.慢慢移动 （复）inches: 身高.	(1) She shortened the shirt by an inch. (2) The candle grew down until only an inch was left. (3) There was an inch of snow on the ground. (4) They climbed the steep mountain inch by inch. (5) The car missed me by inches. (6) Our troops inched their way along the mine-filled road. (7) Negotiations between residents and developers continued to inch along.	(1) 她把衬衫截短了一英寸。 (2) 蜡烛越来越短,最后只剩下一英寸了。 (3) 地上积着一英寸厚的白雪。 (4) 他们一点一点地攀上那座陡峭的山。 (5) 那辆汽车差一点儿撞著我。 (6) 我们的部队在沿着布满地雷的路上一步一步地向前挪动。 (7) 居民与开发商之间的谈判正在缓慢取得进展。
incident n.事变；事件；插曲 adj.难免的；附带的	(1) The serious incident along the border increased our fears of the war. (2) She couldn't erase the incident from her memory. (3) The police are connecting this incident with last week's terrorist bombing. (4) The incident put a dampener on his birthday party. (5) These diseases are incident to childhood. (6) There are many evils incident to human society.	(1) 边境上的紧张局势加重了我们对战争的忧虑。 (2) 她难以忘记那次事件。 (3) 警方认为这次事件和上周的恐怖分子爆炸事件有关。 (4) 这件事使得他的生日晚会很扫兴。 (5) 儿童易患这类疾病。 (6) 人类社会有很多罪恶。
include vt.包括；包含；列入	(1) His writings include poetry and prose. (2) The graphic arts include calligraphy and lithography. (3) Is service included in the blil? (4) Please include me in the list. (5) My job doesn't include making coffee for the boss!	(1) 他的作品包括诗和散文。 (2) 平面造型艺术包括书法和平版印刷术。 (3) 帐单中包含服务费吗？ (4) 请把我列入名单中。 (5) 为老板煮咖啡不是我份内的事！
income n.收入；所得；收益	(1) His income is well below the average. (2) My monthly income was just over 200 pounds. (3) He needs a high income to support such a large family. (4) The money I got was a useful supplement to my ordinary income. (5) The senate was censured for income tax evasion. (6) The Inland Revenue is responsible for collecting income tax. (7) The shopkeeper feels happy at the increasing income.	(1) 他的收入大大低于平均水平。 (2) 我每月的收入是200多磅。 (3) 他需要有高收入才能供养得起这样一个大家庭。 (4) 我得到的那笔钱是很管用的外快。 (5) 这名参议员因逃避缴纳所得税而受到指责。 (6) 税务局负责征收所得税。 (7) 对于日益增多的收益,店老板乐开了花。
incorrect adj.不正确的；错误的	(1) Which of the following collocations is incorrect? (2) The statement was proven incorrect. (3) Your pronunciation is incorrect. (4) It turned out that our calculations were incorrect.	(1) 下列选项中哪一种搭配是不正确的？ (2) 这种说法证明是不正确的。 (3) 你的发音是错误的。 (4) 结果证明我们的计算是错误的。
indeed adv.真正地；的确，确实；事实上；甚至	(1) I was very glad indeed to hear the news. (2) Indeed he has a solemn face, but he is very humorous at heart. (3) I don't mind. Indeed, I am delighted to help. (4) Indeed he was a patron of culture religion.	(1) 我听到这消息的确非常高兴。 (2) 他的确有一副严肃的脸孔，但内心却是很富幽默感。 (3) 我不在乎。其实,我很乐意帮忙。 (4) 事实上他是文化和宗教的庇护者。
independence n.独立；自立	(1) The country attained its independence in 1972. (2) The government adopted an uncompromising posture on the issue of independence. (3) I tried to preserve my independence. (4) This money gives me independence from my family. (5) Americans value independence， even when they're getting older. (6) I will never engage myself to one who has no manly independence. (7) A good education is only way to success and independence.	(1) 这个国家在1972年获得了独立。 (2) 政府在独立的问题上采取了毫不妥协的态度。 (3) 我试图保持自己的独立性。 (4) 这笔钱使我能离家自立了。 (5) 美国人很看重自立，甚至当他们年迈已老也一样。 (6) 我永远不会爱上一个没有男子气概，不能自立的人。 (7) 良好的教育是通往成功与自立的唯一道路。
independent adj.独立的；自主的；独自的；无偏见的 n.无党派者；独立派人士	(1) The former colonial possessions are now independent states. (2) You should learn to be independent of your parents. (3) Two independent investigators have reached virtually the same conclusions. (4) He is an independent observer.	(1) 以前的许多殖民地现已成为独立的国家。 (2) 你应该学习不要依赖父母。 (3) 两个调查人员各自做出的结论简直完全一致。 (4) 他是位无偏见的观察者。
Indicate v.指示；象征；显示；暗示，预示 v.表明；指明	(1) This is used to indicate the temperature of the enclosure. (2) Sword indicates the bearer to a just and generous pursuit of honor and virtue in warlike deeds. (3) My car's gas gauge indicated that there was little gas left. (4) His hesitation indicates unwillingness. (5) A signpost indicated the right road for us .	(1) 这个用来指示壳体的温度。 (2) 长剑象征剑的佩有者在格斗中具备公正、宽恕的美德。 (3) 我车上的汽油表显示剩下的油不多了。 (4) 他的犹豫表明不愿意。 (5) 一个路标为我们指明了正确的路。
industry n.工业；产业；行业；勤勉；勤劳	(1) Since the advent of atomic power, there have been great changes in industry. (2) The tourist trade has become a real industry. (3) The information industry is an infant industry in our country. (4) He wants to widen his knowledge of the industry. (5) Success comes with industry. (6) Industry sometimes compensates for lack of ability. (7) His success was due to his industry.	(1) 自从原子动力问世以后，工业发生了巨大的变化。 (2) 旅游业已经成为真正的产业。 (3) 信息产业在我国是新兴产业。 (4) 他想扩充自己在这一行业的知识。 (5) 成功来自勤奋。 (6) 勤勉有时可以弥补能力之不足。 (7) 他由于勤劳而获得成功。
influence v.影响；感染；<美俚>在(饮料)中加烈酒 n.影响力；影响；权势；势力；有影响的人(或事物)	(1) Don't let me ilfnuence your decision. (2) The labour enthusiasm of the workers strongly influenced us. (3) He makes a nice drink for women by influencing orange juice. (4) His influence is on the ebb. (5) This event had a pernicious influence on society. (6) His parents no longer have any real influence over him. (7) Mr. Smith is a man of influence in this town. (8) He has extended his sphere of influence to the world of banking. (9) He is an influence for good.	(1) 不要让我影响你的决定。 (2) 工人们的劳动热情极大地感染了我们。 (3) 他在橘子汁里加了少量烈性酒即制成了适于女性的爽口饮料。 (4) 他的影响力逐渐在衰退。 (5) 这件事情对社会造成了有害的影响。 (6) 他的父母对他不再有任何真正的约束力了。 (7) 史密斯先生是这个镇上有权势的人物。 (8) 他已把自己的势力范围扩展到金融界。 (9) 他是一个发挥良好作用的人。
inform v.通知；告诉；使熟悉；告发；赋特征于	(1) If you see something suspicious, inform the police at once. (2) I wasn't informed of the decision until it was too late. (3) The UN Associations work to inform the public about the role the UN plays in global affairs. (4) His poetry is deeply informed by the experience of poverty.	(1) 你要是看到什么可疑的东西就马上通知警察。 (2) 等到我得知这项决定时,已经太迟了。 (3) 联合国协会致力于使公众了解联合国在全球事务中发挥的作用。 (4) 他的诗歌里带有过去贫困经历的烙印。
information desk 服务台； 问讯处	(1) The table used to do duty for a hotel desk. (2) You can ask at the information desk over there. (3) They often come up to the information desk and ask some questions. (4) The information office is located in the city center.	(1) 这张桌子以前曾充当旅馆服务台。 (2) 你可以去那边的服务台打听。 (3) 他们经常走到问讯处问一些问题。 (4) 问讯处位于市中心。
initial n.(词)首字母 adj.开始的；最初的；字首的 vt.签姓名的首字母于	(1) This is a letter paper personalized with his initials. (2) After the initial cheers,the noise of the crowd began to die away as the group started playing. (3) We are through the initial testing period. (4) The word “hour” is pronounced without an initial aspirate. (5) She initialed a handkerchief and gave it to that young man.	(1) 这是一张有他姓名首字母的信纸。 (2) 开始的欢呼声结束以后，乐队开始演奏，人们的喧闹声也随之逐渐消失。 (3) 我们通过了最初的考试阶段 (4) hour一词的首字母h不发送气音。 (5) 她在手帕上绣上姓名的首字母，把它送给了那个年轻人。
injure vt.伤害；损害；损伤	(1) Don't injure yourself with that tool. (2) He that spare the bad injure the good. (3) It would naturally injure him in her estimation. (4) This rough life threatened to injure his health,but he didn't mind. (5) She was injured badly in the accident. (6) He injured his left hand in a fire.	(1) 不要让那工具伤害到你。 (2) 饶恕了恶人，伤害了好人。 (3) 那自然也会损害到她对他的评价。 (4) 这种艰苦生活看来要损害他的健康，但他并不介意。 (5) 她在这次意外中受到重伤。 (6) 他在火灾中伤了左手。
injury n.伤害；损害	(1) She still suffers considerable discomfort from her injury. (2) He had a spinal injury in that accident. (3) The injury to their key player could be a decisive factor in the game. (4) Motorcyclists must wear helmets to shield them from injury. (5) It's a severe injury to my reputation.	(1) 她因那次受伤至今仍感不适。 (2) 他在那次事故中脊柱受了伤。 (3) 他们主力队员受伤可能是这场比赛胜负的决定性因素。 (4) 摩托车手必须戴头盔保护自己免受伤害。 (5) 这对我的名誉是个严重的损害。
ink n.墨水；墨汁	(1) There's an ink stain on your shirt. (2) He has run out of red ink. (3) He swore at the boy who dropped ink on the book. (4) If the ink sinks in it'll be hard to remove it. (5) These ink stains won't wash out. (6) Thick black ink like that doesn't usually wash out. (7) The boy tried to paint a picture in Indian ink.	(1) 你的衬衫上有一个墨水斑。 (2) 他的红墨水用完了。 (3) 他对那把墨水倒翻在书上的孩子臭骂了一顿。 (4) 如果墨水渗入，要除去就很困难。 (5) 这些墨迹洗不掉。 (6) 那么浓黑的墨汁一般是洗不掉的。 (7) 那个男孩尝试着用墨汁作一幅画。
inland adj.内陆的；国内的 adv.内陆地 n.内陆	(1) Chongqing in his plan is to be an inland Shanghai. (2) Sea winds that blow inland from the west are warmed by a current of warm water that flows through the Pacific Ocean. (3) We spent a week by the coast before going inland. (4) Stockell didn't get very far inland that morning.	(1) 在他的计划里，重庆要成为内陆的上海。 (2) 从太平洋来的温暖的洋流使得从西吹过内陆的海风变得温暖。 (3) 在去内陆前，我们在海边住了一个星期。 (4) 那天早晨，斯托克并未深入内陆多远。
inn n.客栈；小旅店	(1) There was an air of romance about the old inn. (2) I intend to strike my staff at that small inn. (3) The traveller decided to lie at an inn that night. (4) My girl friend enjoys traveling through the country hailing up at the nearest inn.	(1) 这家老客栈颇有些浪漫气氛。 (2) 我打算在那家客栈暂住下来。 (3) 旅行者决定那天晚上在一个小旅店过夜。 (4) 我的女朋友喜欢乡间旅行，夜宿就近的小旅店。
innocent adj.清白的；无害的；无辜的；无知的；天真纯洁的	(1) A man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty. (2) He was charged with murder but found innocent later. (3) It was an innocent deception, meant as a joke. (4) He declared that he was innocent. (5) Don't be so innocent as to believe everything the politicians tell you.	(1) 一个人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。 (2) 他被控杀人，但后来发现他是无罪的。 (3) 那是个无伤大雅的骗术，开个玩笑而已。 (4) 他声称自己是无罪的。 (5) 别那么幼稚,以为政客说的一切都是可信的。
insect n.昆虫；虫子；卑微的人	(1) The insect bit him and drew blood from his arm. (2) A cocoon is a kind of silk covering made by an insect. (3) She stamped on the insect and killed it. (4) A locust is a kind of destructive insect. (5) He is just an insect in the company and deserves no mention.	(1) 那只昆虫叮在他的手臂上吸血。 (2) 蚕茧是由昆虫制造的一种由丝组成的外包层。 (3) 她踩死了一只虫子。 (4) 蝗虫是一种害虫。 (5) 他只是个无足轻重的人，不值一提。
insert v.插入；嵌入 n.插入物	(1) She inserted the key into the lock. (2) You can insert additional pages into that book. (3) The next procedure is to insert the battery. (4) He tried to insert an advertisement in a newspaper. (5) In the pause he managed to insert a question. (6) She found an insert in the book.	(1) 她把钥匙插入锁中。 (2) 你可以把附加的散页插入那本书里。 (3) 接下来的步骤是装进电池。 (4) 他设法将广告刊登在报纸上。 (5) 他趁谈话停顿时提出了一个问题。 (6) 她在那本书中找到了一个插入物。
insist vt.坚持；坚决主张 vi.坚持；强调	(1) He insisted that he had done right. (2) They insist that I stay there for supper. (3) Since you insist, I must amend the letter of credit. (4) He insisted on paying for the meal. (5) I must insist on more regular hours.	(1) 他坚决认为自己做对了。 (2) 他们坚决要求让我留下吃晚饭。 (3) 既然你坚持，我就只好修改信用证。 (4) 他坚持要付饭钱。 (5) 我必须强调起居定时。
inspect v.检查；视察	(1) Police were called out to keep at the airport, and inspect the arriving planes. (2) It was strange that nobody inspected my ticket before I got on the train. (3) Customs officers inspect our baggage. (4) The government sent him to inspect our school. (5) The stewards will inspect the course to see if racing is possible.	(1) 警察们被紧急召集起来去守卫机场，并对到达的飞机进行检查。 (2) 很奇怪，我上火车前，竟然没有人查看我的车票。 (3) 海关人员检查我们的行李。 (4) 政府派他来视察我们学校。 (5) 那些干事将检视赛马场看是否适宜比赛。
inspire vt.鼓舞；激发；产生；赋予...灵感 vi.吸入	(1) We're trying to inspire him with confidence. (2) The sight inspired him with nostalgia. (3) The failure inspired him to greater efforts. (4) You inspire me with admiration. (5) The Muse does not inspire all poets equally. (6) His best music was inspired by the memory of his mother.	(1) 我们在努力鼓舞他的自信心。 (2) 这景象激起了他的怀旧之情。 (3) 失败激发他作更大的努力。 (4) 你使我产生爱慕之心。 (5) 诗神并不一视同仁地赐予所有诗人以灵感。 (6) 他最好的乐曲创作灵感来自怀念他的母亲。
instant n.瞬间；立即 adj.立即的；即时的；速成的	(1) I shall be back in an instant. (2) Just for an instant I thought he was going to refuse. (3) I recognized her the instant I saw her. (4) Come here this instant! (5) I took an instant dislike to him. (6) The computer can generate instant multimedia messages. (7) I don't like to drink instant coffee.	(1) 我马上就回来。 (2) 我脑中有一闪念，以为他要拒绝了。 (3) 我一眼就认出是她。 (4) 请马上到这里来！ (5) 我一见他就不喜欢。 (6) 电脑亦可产生即时的多媒体讯息。 (7) 我不喜欢喝速溶咖啡。
institute n.学院；学会；协会 vt.开始；制定；创立	(1) New methods of teaching foreign languages are adopted in this institute. (2) Integrity and professionalism are the two main corporate values of the Institute. (3) The UK's Securities & Investment Institute provides education and qualifications for many of these staff. (4) The police instituted an inquiry into the cause of the accident. (5) The company will institute a new payment policy. (6) Chinese Institute of Science plans to institute a new agency in the new year. (7) He is currently the head of the Ethiopian Economic Policy Research Institute, a non-profit organization that he established less than a year ago.	(1) 该学院采用新的外语教学法。 (2) 诚信和专业精神是学会的两个主要机构价值观。 (3) 英国证券与投资协会为许多这样的员工提供培训和资格证书。 (4) 警方开始调查事故的原因。 (5) 公司将实施新的薪酬政策。 (6) 中国科学研究所计划在新的一年里创立一个新的机构。 (7) 目前他担任衣索比亚经济政策研究学院的领导，这是他不到一年前亲自创立的非营利组织。
institution n.制定；制度；机构；名流	(1) The institution of school rules is necessary. (2) Marriage is an institution in most societies. (3) Marriage is love. Love is blind. Therefore marriage is an institution for the blind.	(1) 制定学校规则的是很有必要的。 (2) 婚姻是大多数社会早已确立的制度。 (3) 婚姻就是爱情,爱情是盲目的,所以婚姻是一所收容盲人的机构。
instruct v.教；命令；指导；[计] 指示	(1) His uncle instructed him in French. (2) Don't instruct your secretary to say you are out when you are in. (3) It does not pertain to the young to instruct their elders. (4) Please instruct me how to do my work. (5) The customer can instruct the computer to perform financial services.	(1) 他的叔叔教他法语。 (2) 不要教你的秘书在你在的时候说不在。 (3) 年轻人不应该对老年人发号施令。 (4) 请指导一下我如何工作。 (5) 顾客可指示计算机进行金融服务。

(4) The hospital imported some surgical instruments.	(1) 这台仪器监听病人的心跳。 (2) 他几乎能演奏每一件乐器。 (3) 犁是用于耕作的工具。 (4) 医院进口了一些外科器械。
insurance n.保险；保险费；安全保障	(1) I am an insurance broker. (2) He works in an insurance company. (3) I have paid my car insurance. (4) He's applying for two other jobs as an insurance against not passing the interview for this one.	(1) 我是一名保险经纪人。 (2) 他在一家保险公司上班。 (3) 我已经交了汽车保险费。 (4) 他还申请了另外两份工作，以防这份工作面试不合格。

(5) His talent and dedication will insure his success. (6) You'll insure with the People's Insurance Company of China. I presume?	(1) 我要为自己的住宅保险。 (2) 我想要这包东西保险50美元。 (3) 我给自己保了综合险。 (4) 我的房子保了火险。 (5) 他的才气和执着将确保他成功。 (6) 我想你们是在中国人民保险公司投保的吧。
intelligence n.智力；理解力 n.情报；情报工作；情报机关	(1) She's the equal of her brother as far as intelligence is concerned. (2) His intelligence is rather limited. (3) She's not lacking in intelligence. (4) Our intelligence shows that the enemy is advancing. (5) Clearly, there was an intelligence failure. (6) The Bernauds knew that he was an officer of the Intelligence Service stationed in the Dieppe sector.	(1) 论智力，她和她哥哥不相上下。 (2) 他的智力相当有限。 (3) 她并不缺乏学识。 (4) 我们的情报显示敌人正在向前推进。 (5) 显然,情报工作出了差错。 (6) 伯纳德一家都知道，他是驻扎在迪埃普一带德军情报机关的军官。

(2) My husband trusts me and I don't intend to break that trust (3) I've chosen the main actors and we intend to put it on next January. (4) How long do you intend to stop with the firm? (5) The chair was intended for you, but she took it away. (6) I intended to catch the early train, but I didn't get up in time. (7) That remark was intended as a joke.	(1) 我还没有看展览会,我也不想去。 (2) 我的丈夫信任我,所以我不想失去这种信任 (3) 我已经选好了主要演员,打算明年一月上演这出戏。 (4) 你打算还为公司工作多久？ (5) 那把椅子原本是为你准备的，但是被她拿走了。 (6) 我本来打算赶早班的火车，但是我起晚了。 (7) 那句话本来只是个玩笑。
intention n.意图；目的；意向；打算	(1) What do you think was the author's intention in this passage? (2) Acquaint him with your intention. (3) Have you heard of her intention to resign? (4) They have no intention of getting married at present.	(1) 你认为作者写这一段的用意是什麽? (2) 让他知道你的意向。 (3) 你听到她打算辞职的传闻了吗？ (4) 他们目前没有结婚的打算。

(7) An Englishman would interrupt a war to have his afternoon tea. (3) The performance runs 2 hours 30 minutes including an interval. (4) These equations are interval linear equations. (5) This paper considers the nonlinear programming problem of interval parameters.	(1) 他每隔一段时间就回来看看我们。 (2) 车辆之间应保持适当的间距。 (3) 整个演出2小时30分,包括中间休息。 (4) 该控制方程是线性区间方程组。 (5) 摘要讨论了区间参数非线性规划问题。

(7) In the prosecution of his duties, he had to interview people of all classes. (8) They interview people from all walks of life. (9) All the applicants were interviewed one by one. (10) I'm interviewing all this afternoon. (11) The interview overran by fifteen minutes. (12) He had a television interview with a journalist.	(1) 你跟密歇根大学的人面谈得如何? (2) 他在我们会谈时提到了那个问题。 (3) 我觉得我这次面试考得不错。 (4) 在我们开始面试之前，我先说几句话可以吗？ (5) 我十分感谢您这次接见。 (6) 他简短地说接见结束了。 (7) 在履行职责的时候，他得会见各个阶级的人。 (8) 他们采访各行各业的人。 (9) 所有的申请者一个接着一个参加面试。 (10) 今天整个下午我都要进行面试。 (11) 那次采访超过规定时间十五分钟。 (12) 他接受了一个记者的电视采访。

(3) His native language was Brythonic, which was still somewhat similar to Archaic Irish, so Patrick soon spoke Irish as well. (4) These days, Irish history lessons are more sophisticated. (5) Now, Irish superstitions are noted around the world.	(1) 爱尔兰人过去用马铃薯作为主食。 (2) 宪法规定爱尔兰语是该国第一官方语言。 (3) 不利吞人语是他的母语，这种语言与古老的爱尔兰语言有一点相似，因袭，帕特里克很快就可以流利的说爱尔兰语了。 (4) 这些天，爱尔兰的历史课就更加复杂了。 (5) 如今爱尔兰的迷信已闻名全世界。

(4) How can I remove the rust from the iron door?	(1) 熨斗压在湿布上时发出嘶嘶声。 (2) 他们分析了矿砂,从中发现了铁。 (3) 汤姆昨天没有熨衬衣。 (4) 我怎样才能把铁门上的锈除掉呢？
irrigate vi.进行灌溉 vt.灌溉；[医]冲洗	(1) They are irrigating with water. (2) We have irrigated the desert area to make it fertile. (3) They have built canals to irrigate the desert. (4) They irrigate their crops with water from this river.	(1) 他们正用水灌溉土地。 (2) 我们已经灌溉了荒芜地区使它肥沃。 (3) 他们建造成水渠以灌溉沙漠。 (4) 他们引这条河里的水灌溉庄稼。
irrigation n.灌溉；[医]冲洗	(1) Water is channelled through a series of irrigation canals. (2) We used the money to set up an irrigation project. (3) Irrigation is needed to make crops grow in dry regions. (4) If not well managed, irrigation can be harmful. (5) Irrigation is important for farming. (6) Never try irrigation if the eardrum is broken.	(1) 把水引入一系列灌溉渠中。 (2) 我们把钱用在兴建灌溉工程上了。 (3) 干旱地区需要灌溉才能使作物生长。 (4) 如果管理不善，灌溉还可能有害处。 (5) 灌溉对农业是非常重要的。 (6) 如果耳膜破了，千万不要尝试这种冲洗法。
its pron.（it的所有格)它的	(1) The word here is used in its figurative sense. (2) He felt the cloth to see its quality.	(1) 此词在这儿取的是它的比喻意义。 (2) 他摸摸布看它的品质。
itself pron.它自己	(1) The cat is washing itself. (2) The government made itself unpopular. (3) The house itself is not particularly to my mind, but I like its environment.	(1) 猫正在给自己洗脸。 (2) 这届政府使得自己失去人心。 (3) 这房子本身并不特别合我的心意，但我喜欢它周围的环境。
jam n.果酱 n.堵塞；拥挤；困境 v.塞满；挤；卡住；夹伤；干扰；猛压	(1) He spread some apple jam on the bread. (2) I reached across the table for the jam. (3) Traffic jams in the town happen everyday. (4) We were delayed in a traffic jam. (5) They detoured around the traffic jam by heading south. (6) How am I going to get out of this jam? (7) The holiday traffic is jamming the roads. (8) The key turned halfway and then jammed. (9) He got his finger jammed in the door. (10) The government tried to jam the guerrillas' telecommunication. (11) I had to jam an the brakes sharply to avoid hitting two children	(1) 他在面包上涂上苹果酱。 (2) 我伸手到桌子那端去拿果酱。 (3) 城里的交通天天堵塞。 (4) 我们因交通拥挤而迟到了。 (5) 他们朝南绕过交通拥挤的人群。 (6) 我怎样才能摆脱困境呢？ (7) 假日的车辆堵塞了交通。 (8) 钥匙转了一半就卡住了。 (9) 他的手指被门夹伤了。 (10) 政府设法干扰游击队的无线电通讯。 (11) 我必须猛地踩刹车，以免撞上两上孩子。
jar n.广口瓶；坛子；刺耳声；震动 vi.发刺耳声；不协调；震荡；冲突 vt.扰乱；震动	(1) I can't get the lid off this jar. (2) The jar contains ten glasses of water. (3) I need a jar to make the krauts. (4) He fashioned the clay into a jar. (5) The jar of the alarm woke me up. (6) The side of the boat hit the reef with a grinding jar. (7) The jar of the explosion was felt for miles around. (8) The iron gate jarred when he opened it. (9) His harsh criticism jarred with the friendly tone of the meeting. (10) The orange curtains jar with the red furniture. (11) The noise is beginning to jar on my nerves. (12) Their opinion jarred with ours. (13) The children's screams jar my nerves. (14) The decision will jar the country.	(1) 我打不开这广口瓶的盖子。 (2) 这只大口瓶能装十杯水。 (3) 我需要一个坛子做泡菜。 (4) 他用粘土做成一个陶土罐子。 (5) 闹钟的刺耳铃声把我吵醒了。 (6) 船撞到礁石发出刺耳的声音。 (7) 那次爆炸引起的震荡周围好几英里都能感觉到。 (8) 他开门时，铁门发出刺耳的嘎嘎声。 (9) 他批评得十分尖刻,与会议中的友好气氛很不协调。 (10) 这橙色窗帘与红色的家具不协调。 (11) 那部收音机,吵得我心神不安。 (12) 他们的意见与我们不一致。 (13) 孩子们的尖叫声使我神经不安。 (14) 这项决定将震动这个国家。
jaw n.颚；颌；下巴；钳口；说教 v.喋喋不休；教训	(1) A strong square jaw is a sign of firm character. (2) He fell from a ladder, and broke his jaw bone. (3) Give him a sock on the jaw! (4) On hearing the news, his jaw dropped. (5) Broken pipes adopt a hacksaw or a saw without teeth.The size of pipe needing to cut should be exact.Put pipes on the center of pressure jaw, and keep fractures even. (6) Whenever my wife and her mother get together they jaw away for hours. (7) She jawed him all day about that.	(1) 强健的方颚是性格坚定的象征。 (2) 他从梯子上掉了下来，摔伤了颌骨。 (3) 给他下巴上来一拳！ (4) 听到这个消息，他惊讶得张口结舌。 (5) 断管采用钢锯或无齿锯，需断切的管子尺寸准确，将管子置于压力钳口中心卡紧，断口平齐。 (6) 每当我妻子和她母亲相聚时，她们总要聊上数小时。 (7) 她为那事数说了他一整天。
jazz n.爵士乐；<俚>空话；各种杂物 vt.使有生气；以爵士风格演奏 vi.跳爵士舞；奏爵士乐；游荡	(1) She's potty about jazz. (2) I don't dig modern jazz. (3) Does jazz hold any appeal for you? (4) Jazz has never really turned me on. (5) She brought the food and all the jazz to go with it. (6) We need to jazz this room up a bit. (7) Do you want to jazz up your old products? (8) I don't like to jazz up the classics.	(1) 她迷上了爵士音乐。 (2) 我不喜欢现代爵士乐。 (3) 你对爵士乐有兴趣吗？ (4) 我从未对爵士乐真正产生过兴趣。 (5) 她把食物和所有的杂物都拿来。 (6) 我们需要把这间屋子装饰一下使之更有生气。 (7) 你想给你们的老产品添点生气吗? (8) 我不喜欢用爵士乐的形式来演奏古典乐曲。
jeans n.牛仔裤	(1) Every other girl except me is wearing jeans. (2) He wears an oily old pair of jeans. (3) Both my sister and I like to wear jeans. (4) The jeans will shrink in the wash. (5) Will denim jeans ever go out of date?	(1) 除了我以外，其他姑娘都穿著牛仔裤。 (2) 他穿着一条沾满油污的旧牛仔裤。 (3) 我姐姐和我都喜欢穿牛仔裤。 (4) 那些牛仔裤洗过以后会缩水。 (5) 粗布牛仔裤会过时吗?
jet n.喷气式飞机；喷口；喷射；喷气式发动机 v.喷射；喷出；搭乘喷射式飞机	(1) Developing the supersonic jet was quite an accomplishment. (2) The accident happened as the jet was about to take off. (3) He left on the jet plane. (4) Clean the gas jets on the cooker. (5) The pipe burst and jet of water shoot across the kitchen. (6) This new jet engine is superbly engineered. (7) An English engineer invented the jet engine. (8) The water jetted out. (9) Oil suddenly jetted out of rig number four. (10) The flame-thrower jetted out flames. (11) We will jet to Las Vegas for the weekend. (3) The doctor finished the operation, but his success depended on the backroom boys who had invented the new laser scalpel. (4) A laser reflection will occur at each laminate substrate.	(1) 现在激光可以用来做手术。 (2) 他独占了这台激光打印机。 (3) 医生做完了手术，但他的成功有赖于那些发明了新型激光手术刀的研究人员。 (4) 每一片玻璃都会产生一个镭射反射。
lately adv.最近	(1) I haven't had enough sleep lately. (2) I've not been feeling very well lately. (3) I haven't heard any news from my son lately. (4) Frank has taken up with Lucy lately. (5) That kind of bird has become more numerous around here lately.	(1) 最近我睡眠不足。 (2) 我最近一直感觉不太好。 (3) 我最近没听到我儿子的任何音讯。 (4) 弗兰克最近经常与露西往来。 (5) 近来在附近一带那种鸟越来越多了。
latest adj.最近的；最新的；最后的 n.最迟的时间；最新的潮流；最新消息 形容词late的最高级形式.	(1) This latest incident may be the lever needed to change government policy. (2) The news is all about the latest summit meeting. (3) The latest developments have just been released to the media. (4) Have you read her latest work? (5) But in his latest adventure, he will drive a bulldozer. (6) You shall be back by six at the latest. (7) She is wearing the latest in hats. (8) Have you heard the latest?	(1) 最近的事件或许可以作为迫使政府改变政策所需的手段。 (2) 这条消息是关於最近的首脑级会议的。 (3) 最新的进展情况已向大众传播媒介发表。 (4) 你读过她最新的作品吗？ (5) 但是在他最后的一次历险中,他将驾驶一辆推土机。 (6) 你应该最迟不超过7点钟回来。 (7) 她戴着最新款式的帽子。 (8) 你听到最新消息了吗?
latter adj.后者的；后面的	(1) I prefer the former design to the latter. (2) One can travel there by ship or plane. Most people choose the latter. (3) The latter point is the most important. (4) In the latter years of his life he lived alone and never welcomed visitors.	(1) 比起后者的设计方案,我更喜欢前者的。 (2) 乘船或乘飞机都可以到那,人们多选择后者。 (3) 后面提及的那一点是最重要的。 (4) 他晚年独居，从不欢迎来访者。
laughter n.【U】笑；笑声	(1) We couldn't withhold our laughter. (2) He gave me a fright by bursting into a sudden laughter. (3) Her funny costume caused much mirthful laughter among the guests. (4) The room echoed with their happy laughter. (5) There was a burst of laughter in the next room.	(1) 我们忍不住大笑起来。 (2) 他突然大笑起来，吓了我一跳。 (3) 她那滑稽的服装引得客人哄堂大笑。 (4) 房间里回荡着他们的欢笑声。 (5) 隔壁房间里突然爆发出一阵笑声。
laundry n.洗衣店；洗衣；要洗的衣服	(1) Send these clothed over to the laundry. (2) This laundry makes deliveries on Thursday. (3) I'd like to have laundry service. (4) Why don't you help your mother do the laundry? (5) There is a small problem with your laundry.	(1) 把这些衣服送到洗衣店去洗。 (2) 这个洗衣店星期四送衣服。 (3) 我需要洗衣服务。 (4) 你为什么不帮你妈妈洗衣服? (5) 你们要洗的衣服有一点儿问题。
lavatory n.盥洗室；厕所	(1) I am sorry to bother you,but the lavatory drain be block. (2) The use of the lavatory has been suspended during take-off. (3) The lavatory windows are made of translucent glass. (4) There is a gentleman's lavatory on the ground floor.	(1) 对不起打扰您，但是盥洗室的排水管堵塞了。 (2) 在飞机起飞期间，盥洗室暂停使用。 (3) 厕所窗户是用半透明玻璃做的。 (4) 一层有男厕所。
law n.法律；法规；准则；起诉 v.起诉；打官司	(1) The law forbids stealing. (2) Those who break the law are subjected to justice. (3) The new law has received the royal assent. (4) The least possible sin is the law of man. (5) We go to law to try to regain our property.	(1) 法律禁止盗窃。 (2) 违法者要受到法制律裁。 (3) 新的法规已得到国王的批准。 (4) 尽量少犯错误，这是人的准则； (5) 我们起诉极力收回我们的财产。
lawyer n.律师	(1) His lawyer decided to take an appeal to a higher court. (2) Nothing can weaken his resolve to become a lawyer. (3) A good lawyer can always find a loophole. (4) The lawyer explained the new law to us. (5) She is easily the best lawyer in the city. (6) He is dreaming of becoming a lawyer.	(1) 他的律师决定向高一级法上院诉。 (2) 什么也动摇不了他要当律师的决心。 (3) 精明的律师总能找到漏洞。 (4) 律师向我们解释了新法律。 (5) 她无疑是本市最好的律师。 (6) 他梦想着成为律师。
lead v.引导；领先；带领；过 ... (的生活)；导致 n.领头位置；主角；榜样；引言；铅	(1) She led the way downstairs for us. (2) Our football team leads them by two goals. (3) It's up to you to lead us through the difficulties. (4) They lead a busy and colourful life on the campus. (5) She always takes the lead when we plan to do something. (6) He's playing the lead in the new play. (7) All the children followed his lead. (8) He told an amusing story as a lead-in to the serious part of his speech. (9) Lead fuses at a low temperature.	(1) 她引着我们下楼。 (2) 我们的足球队比他们领先两分。 (3) 就靠你来带领我们度过难关了。 (4) 他们在大学里过着忙碌而又丰富多彩的生活。 (5) 我们不管打算做什么事的时候总由她来领头。 (6) 他在新戏中担任主角。 (7) 所有的孩子都学习他的榜样。 (8) 他讲了一个有趣的故事作他演说中重要内容的引子。 (9) 铅在低温下就熔化。
leader n.领袖；领导者；指挥者；领先的人	(1) We are disciples of the artistic leader. (2) People came to the memorial to revere the memory of the great leader. (3) He's a follower, not a leader. (4) He was elected the leader of the union. (5) They handed in their war booty to their leader. (6) Which football team is the leader in the football championship? (7) He managed to overhaul the leader on the final lap.	(1) 我们是那位艺术领袖的追随者。 (2) 人们来到纪念馆崇敬地纪念这位伟大的领袖。 (3) 他是追随者，不是领导者。 (4) 他被选为工会的领导人。 (5) 他们把战利品上缴给了上级。 (6) 现在哪个队在足球锦标赛中领先？ (7) 他在最后一圈努力超过了领先的人。
leading adj.领导的；指导的；主要的；在前的	(1) He is a leading cadre. (2) She tried to beat up some support for the campaign she was leading. (3) This old man is a leading authority on wheat diseases. (4) The director cast her in a leading part when she was a young unknown of 16. (5) Sarah is very keen on athletics and can trot out the names of all the leading runners and their record times. (6) Have you read the leading story in the newspaper? (7) She was dressed by a leading New York designer.	(1) 他是个领导干部。 (2) 她力求赢得人们对她所领导的运动的支持。 (3) 这位老人是小麦病虫害方面的权威。 (4) 当她还是一个十六岁的无名少女时，导演选中她演主角。 (5) 萨拉非常爱好体育运动，能说出所有最主要的赛跑者的姓名和他们的最佳成绩。 (6) 你看了报纸的头条新闻了吗？ (7) 她穿着纽约杰出设计师设计的服装。
league n.种类；社团；联盟；同盟；里格（长度单位，约为3英里或3海里） v.（使）结盟	(1) They are not in the same league. (2) Our club is a member of the Football League. (3) Most of us in our class are League members. (4) He is a member of the Ivy League. (5) Several nations formed a defense league. (6) Thus the first worker's league came into being. (7) I enrolled my son in a junior sports league for the summer. (8) The League was led by Communists. (9) We should unite and form a league against imperialism.	(1) 他们的水平有高低。 (2) 我们的俱乐部是足球联合会的一员。 (3) 我们班上大多数是团员。 (4) 他是长春藤联合会的一员。 (5) 几个国家结成了防御联盟。 (6) 第一个工人联盟就这样产生了。 (7) 我把儿子招入夏季初中体育联盟。 (8) 这一同盟是由共产党领导的。 (9) 我们要团结起来组成一个反帝同盟。
leak v.渗；漏；泄露 n.漏洞；泄露	(1) Water had started to leak into the cellar. (2) The kitchen roof is apt to leak when it rains. (3) The details were supposed to be secret but somehow leaked out. (4) There is a leak in the roof. (5) Water poured in through a leak in the ship's hull.	(1) 水已开始渗入地下室。 (2) 厨房的屋顶下雨时容易漏雨。 (3) 这些细节原属秘密，可是不知怎么给泄露出去了。 (4) 屋顶有一个漏洞。 (5) 水从船体上的漏洞中涌进来。
learned adj.有学问的；博学的 动词learn的过去式和过去分词.	(1) I think he is a most learned man. (2) Most learned men are modest. (3) Learned men are not necessarily wise. (4) He is a learned doctor. (5) He was learned in the ways of the world.	(1) 我认为他是个很有学问的人。 (2) 大部分有学问的人都很谦虚。 (3) 博学者未必都是聪明的。 (4) 他是一个医术高明的医生。 (5) 他精通人情世故。
lecture n.讲课；演讲；训话 v.训斥；讲课；教导	(1) She ran over her notes before giving the lecture. (2) His lecture covered various aspects of language. (3) They could not follow the lecture. (4) He wrote down the outline of his lecture. (5) I don't need any lecture from you about being late! (6) It was a shame for me to be lectured in front of the whole class. (7) He lectured to his students on modern writers. (8) Your talk at home will lecture on your children.	(1) 她讲课前把讲稿匆匆看了一遍。 (2) 他的讲课涉及到语言诸方面的问题。 (3) 他们听不懂这次演讲。 (4) 他写下演讲的提纲。 (5) 我迟到也不需要你来训斥。 (6) 当着整个班级的面被训斥了一顿，真让我感到羞辱。 (7) 他给学生们讲了关于现代作家的一课。 (8) 你在家里的谈话会引导孩子。
left-handed adj.惯用左手的；用左手的；笨拙的	(1) It should be the third street on you left. (2) Your left thumb suffers a comminuted fracture.	(1) 在你左手的第三条街。 (2) 你左手的拇指是粉碎性骨折。
leftover n.剩饭；残留物 adj.残余的	(1) She threw the leftovers in the garbage. (2) Give the leftovers to the dog. (3) The leftover food began to smell bad. (4) Do you want to eat this leftover pizza for dinner?	(1) 她把剩饭倒进垃圾桶。 (2) 把剩饭给狗吃。 (3) 剩饭开始发臭了。 (4) 你要吃剩下的披萨当晚餐吗?
left-wing adj.左翼的	(1) He has always been a supporter of the left wing. (2) Kempt, on the left wing, demanded reinforcements.	(1) 他一直是左翼的支持者。 (2) 左翼的兰伯特请援。
legal adj.法定的；法律的；合法的	(1) When his father died, his uncle became his legal custodian. (2) She started out on her legal career in 1963. (3) We will introduce legal safeguards against fraud. (4) When you are 18, you are a legal voter.	(1) 他父亲死后,他叔叔成了他的法定监护人。 (2) 她于1963年干起了法律这一行。 (3) 我们要采取法律保护措施，制止诈骗活动。 (4) 当你满18岁的时候，你就是一个合法的投票者。
lemon n.柠檬；柠檬色；<俚>次品；令人讨厌的人	(1) The fish was garnished with slices of lemon. (2) The Clumber is primarily a white dog with lemon color or orange color markings. (3) He just stood there looking like a real lemon.	(1) 那盆鱼上配了几片柠檬作为装饰。 (2) 克伦伯猎鹬犬主要颜色是白色，带有柠檬色或橘色斑纹。 (3) 他只是站在那里，看上去像个地地道道的笨蛋。
lemonade n.柠檬水	(1) The waitress brought us a pitcher of lemonade. (2) She filled my glass with lemonade.	(1) 服务小姐给我们送来一壶柠檬水。 (2) 她给我倒了一杯柠檬水。
length n.长度；时间长短；距离；一段；距离的测量单位	(1) The room is 15 feet in length and 10 feet in breadth. (2) The length of your talk must be at least 10 minutes. (3) The pier was lit up along its entire length. (4) I need a length of wire or string to tie it with. (5) The horse won the race by two lengths.	(1) 这房间长15英尺，宽10英尺。 (2) 你的演讲时间至少要保持在10分钟。 (3) 整个桥墩从头到尾都沐浴在灯火之中。 (4) 我需要一根铁丝或绳子来捆它。 (5) 那马以两个自首至尾的距离领先赢得该场比赛。
letter-box 信箱； 邮箱,=mailbox(英)	(1) I dropped the letter into the mail-box. (2) The box was crammed into letters. (3) I put the letter in the mailbox. (4) He checks his mail box several times a day.	(1) 我将信投入信箱。 (2) 信箱里塞满了信。 (3) 我把信投入邮箱。 (4) 每天她都要检查几次邮箱。
level n.数量；等级；水平；水平线 adj.平的；等高的 v.弄平；夷平；对准 adv.<废>水平地	(1) Levels of unemployment vary from region to region. (2) We must increase production levels. (3) The top of this mountain is three kilometers above the sea level. (4) A football field should be level. (5) The two picture is not quite level that one is higher than the other. (6) We need a mechanical digger to level the ground. (7) The bombing raid practically leveled the town. (8) The hostage had a rifle levelled at his head.	(1) 失业情形各地不同. (2) 我们必须提高生产水平。 (3) 这座山的山顶海拔三千米高。 (4) 足球场地应该平坦。 (5) 这两幅画挂得不一般高, 这幅比那幅高。 (6) 我们需要一台挖掘机来平整土地。 (7) 空袭几乎把这座城镇夷为平地。 (8) 一枝步枪瞄准着人质的头。
liberty n.自由；自由权；冒失	(1) Those prisoners are dreaming of liberty. (2) Everybody is at liberty to air his views. (3) Women used to have little liberty. (4) I am afraid that I am not at liberty to discuss this matter. (5) Liberties are enjoyed by all citizens. (6) I took the liberty of borrowing your lawn-mower while you were away. (7) I took the liberty of reading the letter, even though it was addressed to you.	(1) 这些囚犯们梦想着获得自由。 (2) 每个人都有发表意见的自由。 (3) 过去妇女没有多少自由。 (4) 对不起，我无权讨论这个问题。 (5) 公民皆享有自由权。 (6) 你不在的时候我擅自借用了你的刈草机。 (7) 尽管这封信是写给你的，但是我冒昧地看过了。
liberate v.解放；使获得自由；释出；放出	(1) The country was liberated in 1966. (2) Our army had liberated many occupied areas. (3) They can liberate us from the limitations of our thoughts and feelings. (4) This will liberate him from economic worry. (5) There are some methylmercuric compounds which do not liberate methylmercury for extraction by the action of strong halide acids alone. (6) The free alkali metals react immediately with water to liberate hydrogen.	(1) 这个国家是在1966年解放的。 (2) 我们的军队解放了许多地区。 (3) 他们可以使我们从思想与感受解放。 (4) 这将解除他经济上的忧虑。 (5) 有一些甲基汞化合物，它们在强含卤酸的单独作用下不能释出供萃取的甲基汞。 (6) 游离的碱金属直接和水中作用，放出氢气。
liberation n.解放；解放运动（为获得平等权利和地位的行为）	(1) We came off relief grain shortly after liberation. (2) Only after liberation is he able to go to school. (3) The national liberation movement was gathering. (4) Third part, Climax of the women's liberation movement in Shanghai.	(1) 解放后不久，我们就不吃救济粮了。 (2) 只是在解放后，他才能去上学。 (3) 民族解放运动正日益高涨。 (4) 第三部分，上海妇女解放运动的高潮。
license n.许可证；执照；特许 vt.发许可证给；特许	(1) His license was suspended for six months. (2) The designers were allowed a lot of creative license. (3) Are you licensed to drive? (4) The shop was licensed to sell tobacco.	(1) 他的执照被吊销6个月。 (2) 那些设计者们获得了很多创意许可。 (3) 你得到驾车的执照了吗？ (4) 那家商店获许经销烟草。
lid n.盖子；眼睑 vt.给 ... 装盖子	(1) He slammed the lid down. (2) She gave the lid a few gentle taps to loosen it. (3) The lid of this jam pot won't unscrew. (4) She lifted the lid of the pot to add some salt. (5) He had not lost the eye, but the upper lid was neatly sliced. (6) They forgot to lid the garbage can.	(1) 他砰的一声盖上了盖子。 (2) 她把盖子轻拍了几下使它松动。 (3) 这果酱罐的盖子拧不开。 (4) 她掀起锅盖加点盐。 (5) 他保住了眼睛，但上眼睑几乎被切掉了。 (6) 他们忘了盖垃圾桶了。
lightning n.闪电；意外的幸运 adj.闪电般的；快速的	(1) The little girl is afraid of thunder and lightning. (2) The tree was struck by lightning and splintered. (3) He drove the car with lightning speed. (4) He would shoot his water-pot into the tank with a lightning movement so as to get his supply from an uncontaminated depth. (5) With his unrestrained use of personal pronouns Gao creates lightning shifts of perspective and compels the reader to question all confidences.	(1) 这小女孩害怕雷声和闪电。 (2) 那棵树被闪电劈裂了。 (3) 他以闪电般的速度开车。 (4) 他用闪电般的速度把水桶戳进水池里，以便能从没被污染的深处取水。 (5) 通过灵活运用的人称代词，作者达到了快速的视角变化，迫使读者疑窦丛生。
likely adj.可能的；可信的 adv.很可能	(1) I'm likely to be very busy tomorrow. (2) They'll very likely ask for an increase in the budget. (3) I've heard whispers that the firm is likely to go bankrupt. (4) A rather different fate seems more likely. (5) Most likely it were in the lining of my coat. (6) I shall very likely be here again next month. (7) You'll most likely see these animals at twilight.	(1) 明天我可能很忙。 (2) 他们很可能会要求增加预算。 (3) 我听到传闻说公司很可能要破产。 (4) 另一种大不相同的命运似乎更可信。 (5) 那东西很可能在我上衣的衬层里。 (6) 下个月我很可能再来这儿。 (7) 黄昏时分你很可能会看到这些动物。
limit n.限度；限制；界限 vt.限制；限定	(1) Her ambition knows no limit. (2) I'll help as much as I can, but there is a limit to what I can do. (3) His speech ran over the time limit. (4) That fence is the limit of the schoolyard. (5) We must limit our spending. (6) I shall limit myself to three aspects of the subject. (7) We must limit the amount of money we spend.	(1) 她的野心没有限度。 (2) 我会尽力帮忙，但我所能做的也是有限度的。 (3) 他的讲话超过了规定的时间限制。 (4) 那堵围墙是校园的界限。 (5) 我们必须限制我们的开支。 (6) 我仅探讨这一问题的三个方面。 (7) 我们必须限定花钱的数量。
link v.联系；连接 n.环；联系；节	(1) Television stations around the world are linked by satellite. (2) The road links all the new towns. (3) He detached a link from a chain. (4) Is there a link between smoking and lung disease? (5) We must question the value of our link with the university. (6) We must take firm hold the key link of our work.	(1) 全世界的电视台通过卫星联系一起。 (2) 这条路把所有的新城镇都连接起来了。 (3) 他从链子上拆下一个链环。 (4) 吸烟与肺部疾病之间有关系吗？ (5) 我们要斟酌一下与这所大学联系有何价值。 (6) 我们要牢牢抓住工作的主要环节。
lip n.嘴唇；唇状物 v.接吻；说话；拍打	(1) He kissed her on the lips. (2) She bit her lip to keep from crying. (3) After a moment's hesitation she lipped her request.	(1) 他吻了她的嘴唇。 (2) 她咬着嘴唇克制着自己不要哭。 (3) 她犹豫了一会儿,然後轻声提出请求。
liquid adj.液体的；液态的；清澈的；清脆的；已转化成现款的（财） n.液体	(1) The doctor recommended that the patient be fed liquid food. (2) Air whether in the gaseous or liquid state is a fluid. (3) The earth is believed to have a liquid core. (4) Kate is a pretty girl with large liquid eyes. (5) The liquid note of an oriole sound pleasing to the ear. (6) How much liquid capital do you have to invest? (7) Plasma is clear yellow liquid. (8) The liquid was 5 litres in volume.	(1) 医生建议病人应吃流质食物。 (2) 空气，无论是气态的还是液态的，都是一种流体。 (3) 人们相信地球有一个液态核。 (4) 凯特是一个有一双水汪汪大眼睛的漂亮姑娘。 (5) 黄莺清脆的鸣叫声听起来很悦耳。 (6) 您有多少流动资金可以用于投资? (7) 血浆是种透明淡黄的液体。 (8) 该液体的体积为5升。
literature n.文学；文献；<口>印刷品	(1) She is fond of polite literature. (2) He destroyed feudal ideas in literature. (3) The principal literature comes from zoology.	(1) 她喜爱风雅文学。 (2) 他摧毁了文学中的封建思想。 (3) 主要文献都来自动物学。
literary adj.文学的	(1) He is endowed with literary talent. (2) Dickens' A Tale of Two Cities is a literary classic. (3) I don't like to read his literary criticism. (4) Her poetry is full of obscure literary allusions. (5) Literary works are art works of language.	(1) 他有文学天分。 (2) 狄更斯的《双城记》是文学名著。 (3) 我不喜欢读他的文学批评。 (4) 他的诗里用了很多晦涩的文学典故。 (5) 文学作品是一种语言文学的艺术。
litre n.公升 =liter(美).	(1) The capacity of this bottle is one litre. (2) A litre of gas has less mass than a litre of water.	(1) 这个瓶子的容量是1公升。 (2) 一公升的气体质量少于一公升的水。
living adj.活着的；生动的 n.生活；生计 动词live的现在分词.	(1) I'll tell you a secret that I have never told a living soul. (2) He was the greatest living novelist in England. (3) The wilderness is a living museum of natural history. (4) The judge advised him to amend his way of living. (5) We should improve what is called the quality of living. (6) What do you do for a living?	(1) 我要告诉你一个我从未告诉过任何人的秘密。 (2) 他是英国活着的最伟大的小说家。 (3) 这片荒野是一座活生生的自然历史博物馆。 (4) 法官劝告他改变生活方式。 (5) 我们应该改进所谓的生活品质。 (6) 你以什么谋生？
load n.负荷；重担；装载量 v.装载；给(枪)装子弹；[计算机] 装入	(1) A plane can carry only so much load after all. (2) The load is too heavy and the supports buckle . (3) She will not shove the heavy load onto others. (4) The baker contracted for a load of flour. (5) The maximum load of the lorry is one ton. (6) We must use mechanical hoisting to load the goods. (7) Be careful, that gun's loaded. (8) To locate and load a quantity of data from storage.	(1) 一架飞机终归只能承载那么多的负荷。 (2) 负荷过重，支柱坍下来。 (3) 她不愿意把重担推给别人。 (4) 面包师订了买一车面粉的合同。 (5) 这卡车的最大载重量是一吨。 (6) 我们必须用起重机来装载货物。 (7) 小心，那枪是上了膛的。 (8) 从存储器中寻找并装入一批数据。
loaf n.（一条）面包；块 vi.游手好闲；虚掷光阴	(1) That small loaf won't go far among this large family! (2) He bought a loaf of bread. (3) He used to loaf about and ultimately took to drink. (4) Those who loaf all day and do nothing are social parasites. (5) Nobody should loaf away his precious time.	(1) 那一小条面包全家人吃不了多久的。 (2) 他买了一大块奶酪。 (3) 他过去终日游手好闲，最终沉溺于酗酒。 (4) 饱食终日，无所事事的人是社会上的寄生虫。 (5) 人人都不该虚度宝贵的光阴。
local adj.地方性的；当地的；局部的 n.当地人	(1) I suggest that he put an advertisement in the local paper. (2) He provided local delicacies for his guests' meal. (3) The local war escalated into a major conflict. (4) Is the pain local? (5) I asked one of the locals which way to go.	(1) 我建议他在当地的报纸上登条广告。 (2) 他用当地的美味佳肴来招待客人。 (3) 局部的战争逐步升级成大规模的冲突。 (4) 是局部疼痛吗? (5) 我问了一位本地人，该走哪条路。
locust n.蝗虫；洋槐；刺槐	(1) The locust swarm has destroyed all the crops and vegetables.	(1) 蝗虫群毁坏了所有的庄稼和蔬菜。
loose adj.松的；宽松的；不确切的；不牢固的；放纵的 n.解放；放任；放纵 v.弄松；释放；放枪 adv.松散地	(1) The screw worked itself loose and the door fell off the cupboard. (2) She wore loose garments in the summer. (3) Loose labour regulations are one reason. (4) It is used these days in a very loose sense by a great many people. (5) She was branded a loose woman. (6) This will ship to our customer via their consolidator as loose freight. (7) Shake yourself loose from the accreted layers of presuppositions and assumptions that your profession has built up around the topic. (8) I still think a lot about transportation -- you never loose a dream, it just incubates as a hobby. (9) But if we leave, we loose it and I can't make an entire life disappear to start a new one. (10) Things were not just lax, but loose, as though everyone but him had grown to accept the situation. (11) Please help me loose the nail, It is rusty and won't come out of the wall. (12) A chemical change has to take place before the energy can be let loose. (13) Men were loosing off at shadows.	(1) 螺丝松了，门从橱柜上掉下来了。 (2) 她在夏天穿宽松的衣服。 (3) 宽松的劳动规则是原因之一。 (4) 现在,许多人用起它来是很不确切的。 (5) 她被标为放纵的女人。 (6) 这将会经由他们的整合者对我们的客户运送如解放船货。 (7) 把自己从本专业对此所建立的厚厚预设和假定中解放出来。 (8) 我直到现在还想着很多有关交通的问题，你不要放任梦想，而要把它当作一种习惯去培育。 (9) 可是如果我们走了，我们放纵它，我不能结束自己完整的生活去开始一段新的生活。 (10) 这里的事物已不能说是松懈，应该拿放纵来形容，好像除了他以外，每个人都渐渐接受了这个处境。 (11) 请帮我把这个钉子弄松，它生锈了，拔不出来。 (12) 能量释放，必须有化学变化。 (13) 士兵向黑影射击。
lorry n.卡车	(1) Bind down the ropes around the load on the lorry. (2) A heavy lorry floundered about in deep snow.	(1) 把绕在卡车上货物外面的绳子扎紧。 (2) 一辆重型卡车在厚厚的积雪中艰难地行进。
loss n.遗失；丧失；损失；失败；失落；死亡	(1) The loss of her purse caused her much inconvenience. (2) This wounded soldier was unconscious from his loss of blood. (3) His costly mistake resulted in severe loss. (4) The loss of the football game stirred up much anger. (5) She is inconsolable for the loss of her husband.	(1) 丢失钱包给她带来了诸多不便。 (2) 这名伤员由于失血过多而昏迷不醒。 (3) 他的严重的错误导致了重大的损失。 (4) 球赛的失败引起了极大的愤慨。 (5) 她因丈夫的离世而痛不欲生。

(4) The children have made an awful mess in the lounge. (5) I don't want to lounge about town. I have other things to do. (6) Teenage boys were lounging against the wall. (4) Both brothers are mad about tennis. (5) When Bob gets mad, you can't hold him down. (6) I was so mad at getting this kind of bum rap. (10) It was thought that witches had magic power. (11) He played some clever magic tricks. (12) That music is really magic.	(1) 仙子用魔法将两兄弟变成了天鹅。 (2) 有些人仍然相信魔法。 (3) 真正的魔法是一种非常微妙的事。 (4) 这纸魔术般地变成了绿色。 (5) 魔术师用他的魔术技艺使观众们激动。 (6) 他将在晚会上表演魔术。 (7) 这小孩认为这个玩具车是由魔力驱动的。 (8) 他们相信这全是靠魔力实现的。 (9) 巫师向王子施了具有魔力的咒语,把他变成了一只青蛙。 (10) 女巫被认为拥有魔力。 (11) 他表演了一些巧妙的魔术。 (12) 那音乐真是妙不可言。
maid n.【C】女仆；侍女 n.【古】未婚女子	(1) Her maid helped her to dress up for the party. (2) I'll send the maid round to carry it to your house. (3) The maid lowered her chin and simpered. (4) The Democrats became the majority in the election.	(1) 多数人喜欢电视胜过广播。 (2) 种族主义是大多数人都憎恨的。 (3) 民主党在这次选举中变成了多数党。 (4) 民主党在这次选举中变成了多数党。

(6) The male is physically stronger than the female. (7) The male of the species has a white tail. marathon n.马拉松；耐力比赛	(1) It takes stamina to run a marathon. (2) He can hardly run a mile, much less the marathon. (3) Towards the end of the marathon several runners showed signs of distress. (4) My job interview was a real marathon.	(1) 跑马拉松要有耐力。 (2) 他连一哩都跑不了，更不用说马拉松了。 (3) 马拉松赛接近终点时，有些参赛者显出极难受的样子。 (4) 我那次求职面试简直是马拉松式的长谈。

(4) The peace march attracted a large turnout. (5) This term will begin on March 1st. (6) The troops marched on. (7) The teacher marched the children out to the playground.	(1) 在长途行军中没有一个人掉队。 (2) 部队当时正向上海进军。 (3) 科学正在进步中。 (4) 和平游行吸引了大量的参加者。 (5) 这个学期三月一日开始。 (6) 部队继续前进。 (7) 教师带领孩子们排队去操场。
marriage n.结婚；婚姻；紧密结合	(1) The news of their marriage knocked me for a loop. (2) It was a pleasant surprise to learn of her marriage. (3) Marriage is an institution in most societies. (4) Marriage is for life. (5) He played a passive role in the marriage. (6) A lichen is a compound organism, a symbiotic marriage of fungus and algae. married adj.已婚的；婚姻的；密切结合的 n.已婚者	(1) Married officers get extra allowances. (2) Friends regarded Karen and Jeff as a shining example of a happily married couple. (3) I have never been married and am still a virgin waiting until marriage. (4) Of course, some of them had been married mostly before becoming rickshaw pullers or arriving in Chengdu, but the men seldom got married when they were rickshaw pullers.	(1) 已婚的军官有额外津贴。 (2) 朋友认为卡伦和杰夫是婚姻的光辉典范。 (3) 我并未结过婚，依然保持着纯洁之身期盼婚姻的到来。 (4) 不过，已婚者大多是在沦为拉车之前或者是来成都之前成的家，而拉车期间结婚的非常之稀少。
mask n.伪装；面罩；面具；[计算机]掩码 v.掩饰；戴面具；遮盖	(1) They did so under the mask of charity. (2) He longed to throw off the mask of respectability. (3) Her sociable manner is really a mask for a very shy nature. (4) The bank robber wears a stocking mask. (5) The mask fitted tightly over his face. (6) She whipped the mask off her face. (7) Her smile masked true feelings. (8) He tried to mask his disappointment with a smile. (9) He is masked. (10) The thief masked his face with a stocking.	(1) 他们是打着慈善的幌子这么做的。 (2) 他渴望丢掉那副道貌岸然的伪装。 (3) 她那好交际的作风，实际上是她腼腆天性的伪装。 (4) 那个抢劫银行的匪徒戴着长筒袜面罩。 (5) 他用面具把脸蒙得严严的。 (6) 她刷地一下子把脸上的面具摘掉了。 (7) 她的微笑掩饰了她的感情。 (8) 他试图以微笑来掩饰他的失望。 (9) 他戴了假面具。 (10) 那贼套上长筒袜遮住脸。
mass n.大量；块；众多 adj.大规模的；群众的 v.集中 Mass. n.弥撒曲；弥撒	(1) After harvest we will have a mass of rice. (2) There were masses of dark clouds in the sky. (3) The priest sings Mass. (4) The priest celebrates Mass in church. (5) Modern education is a mass enterprise. (6) The mass rally was a total fiasco. (7) The only correct way is to follow the mass line. (8) Crowds massed along the road where the king would pass.	(1) 秋收后，我们将获得大量稻谷。 (2) 天上有朵朵乌云。 (3) 牧师吟唱弥撒曲。 (4) 神父在教堂内举行弥撒。 (5) 现代教育是一项大规模的企业。 (6) 那次群众集会彻底失败。 (7) 唯一正确的办法是走群众路线。 (8) 群众聚集在国王要经过的街道旁。
master n.主人；硕士；专家 vt.控制；精通 adj.主要的；主人的；精通的	(1) The dog remained faithful to his master. (2) I can be a master of myself in learning. (3) He is a Master of Science. (4) No man is born a master of art. (5) She learned to master her anger. (6) It's not easy to master a foreign language. (7) There is always a master for each of these services and there may be one or more replicas. (8) Ramchandra Dutta, one of the chief householder disciples of the Master, lived in Calcutta. (9) The servant tried to gauge his master's mood. (10) His father was a master carpenter.	(1) 这条狗始终忠于它的主人。 (2) 我可以做自我学习上的主人。 (3) 他是理科硕士。 (4) 没有人生来就是艺术大师。 (5) 她学会了控制自己不发火。 (6) 掌握一门外语并不容易。 (7) 对于这些服务的每一种总是有一个主要的而且可能有一件以上的复制品。 (8) 师父的其中一位主要的居士门徒拉姆钱德拉杜塔也住在加尔各答。 (9) 那个仆人想揣测他主人的心思。 (10) 他父亲是个手艺高的木匠。
mat n.垫子；席子 v.编织；集结；铺席于 ... 上	(1) There are some clods of soil on the mat. (2) He lifted the mat and slid the key under (it). (3) I wiped my shoes on the mat before I came in. (4) Scrape your shoes on the door mat before you come in. (5) He cleaned the mud off his shoes on the shaggy mat in front of the door. (6) Be careful you don't trip (up) on the mat. (7) My foot caught in the mat and I fell heavily. (8) The swimmer's wet hair was matted together. (9) The fur collar mats when it gets wet. (10) The room is matted.	(1) 垫子上有些土块。 (2) 他掀起垫子把钥匙悄悄放在下面。 (3) 我在进门前把鞋在垫子上擦了擦。 (4) 进屋前先在门口擦鞋垫上擦一擦鞋子。 (5) 他在门前的粗糙的垫子上把鞋上的泥蹭掉。 (6) 小心别在地席上绊倒了。 (7) 我被席子绊了一下, 重重地摔了一跤。 (8) 那游泳者的湿头发乱糟糟结成一团。 (9) 皮领子湿了时毛就结在一起。 (10) 这房间地上铺著草垫。

(3) She's collecting materials for her latest novel. (4) He was grubbing about in the public library for materials. (5) This is good material for a play. (6) This material is impervious to gases and liquids. (7) He made a material contribution to the work. (8) Is this point material to your argument? (9) Great men see that spiritual is stronger than any material force. (10) The citizens is looking forward to getting blessed with more material welfare.	(1) 这种绸布料子不会褪色。 (2) 由于缺乏原料，这个车间已停工了。 (3) 她在为其最新的小说收集素材。 (4) 他正在公共图书馆里寻找资料。 (5) 这是写剧本的好题材。 (6) 气体和液体都透不过这种物质。 (7) 他对工作做出了重要的贡献。 (8) 这一点对你的论点很重要吗? (9) 伟人认为精神力量比肉体力量更强大。 (10) 市民们都盼望着获得更多实质性的福利。
mathematics n.数学	(1) Mathematics is her favorite subject. (2) He has a great faculty for mathematics.	(1) 数学是她喜欢的科目。 (2) 他具有很强的学数学的才能。
mature adj.成熟的；(保单）到期的；考虑周到的 v.成熟；长成	(1) This is the most mature of his plays. (2) She swept her hair back, so she looks more mature than before. (3) Your fixed account is mature and can be withdrawn any time. (4) Young as she is, she cares for others and has a mature mind. (5) I will let you have an answer after mature consideration. (6) Girls mature earlier than boys. (7) He was not able to mature his plans. (8) The wine is left to mature in oak barrels.	(1) 这是他最成熟的一部剧作。 (2) 她把头发往后梳，所以显得比以前成熟。 (3) 您的定期存款已经到期了，随时可以提取。 (4) 她虽然年轻,但却很为他人着想,考虑周到。 (5) 我考虑成熟后，再给你回答。 (6) 女孩比男孩成熟得早些。 (7) 他未能将他的计划酝酿成熟。 (8) 葡萄酒在橡木桶中陈酿。
maximum n.最大量；最大限度；最高点 adj.最高的；最大极限的	(1) This hall holds a maximum of seventy people. (2) The child turned the volume up to the maximum. (3) It is the maximum the insurance company will pay. (4) Our goal is to achieve the maximum of efficiency. (5) The maximum price we can pay is 50 pence per yard. (6) The maximum temperature in July may be 36 Celsius degree. (7) The maximum load for this lorry is one ton. (8) The dress is carefully styled for maximum comfort. (9) The demonstration was carefully orchestrated to attract maximum publicity.	(1) 这厅最多容纳七十人。 (2) 小孩把音量转到了最大。 (3) 这是保险公司所能付给的最大金额。 (4) 我们的目标是取得最高的效率。 (5) 我们所能出的最高价格是每码50便士。 (6) 七月份最高温度可能达到36摄氏度。 (7) 这辆卡车最大载重量是一吨。 (8) 这服装精心设计，力求达到最大限度的舒适。 (9) 该示威经过精心策划以尽量吸引公众注意。
means n.方法；手段；收入；财产 v.意思是，意味（动词mean的第三人称单数）	(1) Are there any means of getting there? (2) We express our thought by means of words. (3) He explored ways and means of solving the question. (4) If other means fail we shall resort to force. (5) Radio and television are important means of communication. (6) The price has gone beyond our means. (7) Her tastes and her means don't jump together.	(1) 有什么方法可以到那里吗？ (2) 我们用词句来表达思想。 (3) 他寻找解决问题的方法。 (4) 如果其他手段均告失败，我们将诉之武力。 (5) 无线电和电视是重要的通信手段。 (6) 价格已超出了我们的收入。 (7) 她的爱好和她的收入很不相称。
meanwhile adv.其间；同时	(1) Father was cutting the grass, and meanwhile mother was planting roses. (2) Meanwhile, my debts were mounting up. (3) Meanwhile they set aside part of their funds for the motorized boats.	(1) 父亲在剪草,母亲在种玫瑰。 (2) 同时，我的债务还在不断增加。 (3) 与此同时,他们拨出一部分资金购买机动帆船。

(7) She measured her power with that of a dangerous adversary. (8) He measured his words with caution.	(1) 政府已采取措施控制通货膨胀。 (2) 标准的千克是测量质量的量度 (3) 我想要这套西装照他自己的尺寸做。 (4) 从某种程度上来说你是对的。 (5) 这个措施要是不行,我们还可采取别的办法。 (6) 他们测量了天花板的高度。 (7) 她拿自己的力量和危险的敌手进行较量 (8) 他仔细斟酌着字句。

(5) The President bestowed a medal on the hero. (6) They'll strike a medal in memory of the great victory. (7) Winning the medal was a feather in his cap. (8) Several international celebrities were present at the statesman's memorial service. (4) If a teacher wrote something on the board that had to be memorized verbatim for an upcoming exam, I'd memorize it then and there.Then I wouldn't have to go back and study it later.	(1) 这男孩能轻松地记住这些数据。 (2) 演员们不得不记住台词。 (3) 当然必须学习很多东西，必须记下很多汉字。 (4) 如果老师在黑板上面写下一些考试的时候必考的内容的话，我会当堂记下，这样的话我就不用花费课余的时间去重新记忆了。
mental adj.思想的；心理的；精神的；脑力的 n.精神病患者	(1) It's clear that mental activity does not stop when we're asleep. (2) We should pay more attention to our mental health. (3) I think such mental disorders are hereditary. (4) Social life is developed by physical labor and mental labor. (5) The hospital cares for some fifty mental patients.	(1) 很显然,我们熟睡的时候,思想活动仍然不会停下来。 (2) 我们应该更注重心理健康。 (3) 我认为这种精神失调是遗传的。 (4) 社会生活由于体力劳动和脑力劳动的结合才得以发展。 (5) 这家医院照料五十名左右精神病患者。
mentally adv.精神上；智力上；心理上	(1) We must equip the children mentally and physically to meet the trial they will face. (2) Finally, people can feel refreshed both physically and mentally after a period of idling. (3) A mentally deficient person is one who is weak-minded. (4) I am moved to show how aging feels to me physically and mentally. (5) The adjustment of these mentally sleeps peacefully benignantly.	(1) 我们必须准备在精神上和身体上使这些孩子们有条件迎接他们将面临的各种考验。 (2) 最后，人们能感觉到在一段时间的闲散之后，身体和精神上都重新振作。 (3) 一个智力上不足的人是个低能的人。 (4) 我被采取行动来表示老化如何对我身体上地而且心理上感觉。 (5) 这些心理上的调节都是有益安眠的。
merchant n.商人；店主；专家 adj.商业的；商船的 n.（班轮提单）货方；签约方	(1) The merchant had received a shipment of tea. (2) The merchant decided to use camels to carry his goods across the desert. (3) The merchant's cash sales each day were $300. (4) Art experts, who have already dated the painting to this time, say the Heidelberg discovery is a breakthrough and the earliest mention linking the merchant's wife to the portrait. (5) His brother is in the merchant marine.	(1) 这个商人收到了一船茶叶。 (2) 商人决定用骆驼载运货物穿过沙漠。 (3) 那店主一天有300美元的现金售货收入。 (4) 美术专家们还称，关于此画，海德尔堡的发现是一个突破，并且是最早提出把商人的妻子和人物肖像结合起来这一说法的。 (5) 他的兄弟是名商船船员。
merciful adj.仁慈的；宽大的	(1) Be merciful to those who show mercy. (2) The merciful king saved the young officers from death. (3) She was merciful to the prisoners. (4) The brave are merciful; cowards do not dare to forgive their enemies.	(1) 对仁慈的人讲仁慈。 (2) 仁慈的国王把年青的军官从死神手中救了出来。 (3) 她对犯人很仁慈。 (4) 勇敢者仁慈宽大，胆小鬼不敢饶恕敌人。
mercy n.仁慈；怜悯；恩惠；宽恕	(1) Mercy to the enemies means cruelty to the people. (2) They showed their enemies no mercy. (3) They never appealed to us for mercy. (4) The commander showed mercy to the prisoners of war. (5) The prisoner implored the king for mercy. (6) The prisoner appealed to the judge for mercy. (7) The king showed no mercy and killed all the prisoners.	(1) 对敌人的仁慈就意味着对人民的残忍。 (2) 他们不给敌人半点仁慈。 (3) 他们从不向我们乞求怜悯。 (4) 司令官对战俘十分怜悯。 (5) 囚犯恳求国王开恩。 (6) 囚犯恳求法官开恩。 (7) 这个国王没有宽容之心，杀死了所有的犯人。
merely adv.仅仅；只不过	(1) They are not merely content to fill the stomach. (2) I accepted this job merely for the high salary. (3) She is merely a child. (4) I merely suggest you should do it again.	(1) 他们不仅仅满足于填饱肚子。 (2) 我仅仅是因为高薪才接受了这份工作。 (3) 她只不过是个孩子。 (4) 我只是建议你重新做这件事。
mess n.混乱；混杂；脏乱；一份食品；粪便；（军队的）食堂 v.弄糟；弄乱；妨碍	(1) The local economy is now in a mess. (2) The heavy rain made a great mess of the garden. (3) The room was in a terrible mess. (4) He caught a large mess of fish. (5) Who will clean up the cat's mess in the bedroom? (6) The party will be held in the officers' mess. (7) I am ask to organize the trip, but I mess it up. (8) You'd better not mess in the affairs of others.	(1) 当地的经济现在很混乱。 (2) 这场大雨把花园搞得一团糟。 (3) 房间里脏乱不堪。 (4) 他捕到足够饱餐一顿的鱼。 (5) 谁去清除卧室里的猫屎? (6) 聚会将在军官食堂举行。 (7) 大家要我组织这次旅游, 可是我把事情搞糟了。 (8) 你最好不要干涉他人的事情。
messy adj.散乱的；污秽的；麻烦的	(1) I can't find anything on this messy desk. (2) She doesn't know how to tidy up the messy room. (3) It is shaping up to be a dirty, messy campaign. (4) The divorce was painful and messy. (5) I'd like to know who wished off this messy job on me.	(1) 在这张堆放得乱七八糟的桌子上我什么也找不到。 (2) 她不知道该怎样整理这个凌乱的房间。 (3) 这绝对会成为一场卑鄙而肮脏的竞选。 (4) 那次离婚令人痛苦而又纠葛不清。 (5) 我想知道是谁把麻烦的活推给我做的。
method n.方法；条理 n.类函数；类成员函数（计算机）	(1) I have a simple and easy method. (2) New methods of teaching foreign languages are adopted in this institute. (3) His book is totally without method. (4) We must get some method into our office filing.	(1) 我有个简易的方法。 (2) 该学院采用新的外语教学法。 (3) 他写的那本书毫无条理。 (4) 我们必须把公文归档工作弄出些条理来。
Mexican n.墨西哥人；墨西哥语 adj.墨西哥的	(1) I read that the new director is a Mexican. (2) It was a great boost to Mexican morale and pride. (3) My mother can cook delicious Mexican food. (4) Mexican liquor made from fermented juices of an Agave plant.	(1) 我获悉新董事是墨西哥人。 (2) 这对墨西哥人的士气和自尊来说是个巨大的鼓舞。 (3) 我的母亲烧得一手墨西哥的美味佳肴。 (4) 墨西哥的一种用已发酵的龙舌兰植物的汁液制成的酒。
Mexico n.墨西哥	(1) I learned Spanish during my residence in Mexico. (2) California and Mexico are contiguous.	(1) 我住在墨西哥时学会了西班牙语。 (2) 加利福尼亚和墨西哥相邻。
microscope n.显微镜	(1) He focuses the lens of a microscope.	(1) 他调整显微镜的透镜以定焦点。
microwave n.微波；微波炉 vt.用微波炉加热	(1) The samples were digested using a microwave oven. (2) A land line can be wire or fiber optics or microwave. (3) We cooked the fish in the microwave oven. (4) It also has a nice dish washer and microwave oven. (5) Last winter it unveiled a bra that can be heated in a microwave so as to help save on indoor heating costs.	(1) 用微波消解样品。 (2) 陆上线路可以是金属或光纤电缆或者微波线路。 (3) 我们在微波炉中煮鱼。 (4) 一个洗碗机和一个微波炉。 (5) 去年冬天，黛安芬公司为了响应日本政府的节能，就推出了一款可以用微波炉加热的文胸，从而减少室内供暖的成本。
midday n.正午；中午	(1) He's grilling out there in the midday sun. (2) We have finished work at midday. (3) We usually have a simple meal at midday. (4) It was good going to reach London by midday.	(1) 他在正午的阳光下受炙烤。 (2) 我们已于正午完成任务。 (3) 我们的中午饭一般都比较简单。 (4) 那次行进速度很快，到中午已抵达伦敦。
Middle East n.中东(一般泛指欧；亚；非三大洲连接的地区) =Mideast.	(1) California law says that they must be taught from September to the middle of June. (2) Cartier's loyal high-end customers, particularly those living in China and the Middle East, have softened somewhat a consumer pullback elsewhere.	(1) 加里福尼亚州的法律规定儿童演员上课时间从九月到第二年的六月中旬。 (2) 卡地亚的忠实高端客户，尤其是在中国和中东区域，冲淡了其他区域的客户下滑。
might aux.可能；也许；may的过去式 n.威力；力量	(1) That might be in your favor. (2) You might do me a favor? (3) If someone had been with him, he might not have been drowned. (4) The boy might have known the truth, but I am not quite sure. (5) We fear the military might of the enemy. (6) To be frank, this mission is beyond my might. (7) He fought back with all his might.	(1) 那可能对你有利。 (2) 你或许能帮我—个忙吧? (3) 如果有人在他旁边，或许他就不会溺死。 (4) 这男孩当时也许知道真相，但我不很确定。 (5) 我们惧怕敌人强大的军事力量。 (6) 说实话，这一使命非我能力所及。 (7) 他倾全力反击。
mild adj.温和的；柔和的；宽大的；清淡的	(1) He has a mild nature. (2) He gave a mild answer, in spite of his anger. (3) The coastal area has very mild winter, but by contrast the central plains become extremely cold. (4) The patient has a mild fever. (5) The punishment inflicted on them was too mild. (6) This cheese is very mild.	(1) 他的性格温和。 (2) 尽管他十分恼火,他还是态度温和地回答了。 (3) 靠近海岸的地区有很温和的冬天,相比而方,靠近中央的平原就变得非常寒冷。 (4) 那个病人有些轻微的发烧。 (5) 他们受的惩罚太轻。 (6) 这种奶酪味道清淡。
mile n.英里；海里；一英里赛跑	(1) My son hoofs a mile to school each day. (2) It's not less than a mile to the station. (3) He had come up from deep down in the water as the dark cloud of blood had settled and dispersed in the mile deep sea. (4) He wants to better his record for running the mile.	(1) 我的儿子每天步行一英里去上学。 (2) 到火车站至少有一英里路。 (3) 鱼深暗色的血在一哩深的海里，像云朵般地扩散开来，鲨鱼闻到血腥味便由深水中游过来。 (4) 他要提高一英里赛跑的纪录。
millionaire n.百万富翁	(1) He spends as if he were a millionaire. (2) Now a millionaire, he typifies the self-made man. (3) He is not poor, on the contrary, he is a millionaire. (4) The library's latest acquisitions were donated by a millionaire. (5) They are all vultures round the bedside of the dying millionaire. (6) The millionaire has handed over 50 percent of his stock to his first son. (7) The lazy girl is dreaming of marrying a millionaire and therefore won't do any work.	(1) 他用起钱来像个百万富翁似的。 (2) 他成了百万富翁，可以说是白手起家的典型。 (3) 他不穷，相反，他是个百万富翁。 (4) 图书馆最近增添的书籍是一位百万富翁捐献的。 (5) 他们都是围拢在将要去世的百万富翁床边的贪心人。 (6) 这个百万富翁已把他一半的股票移交给他的长子。 (7) 这个懒惰的女孩正梦想着嫁给一个有钱人，从此不再工作。
mineral n.矿物(石）；矿物质	(1) Coal is a mineral. (2) We are digging for mineral deposits. (3) They have sold up ten crates of mineral water in the afternoon. (4) Some people need to take vitamin and mineral supplements.	(1) 煤是一种矿物。 (2) 我们正在掘地探矿。 (3) 他们这个下午卖掉了十箱矿泉水。 (4) 有些人需要补充维生素和矿物质补充剂。
minimum adj.最少的；最低程度的 n.最低限度；最小量	(1) That is the minimum number necessary to complete the circuit. (2) The minimum wage is 4.25 dollars an hour. (3) Repairing your car will cost a minimum of 100 dollars. (4) The class needs a minimum of 6 pupils to continue. (5) Consolidate everything to the bare minimum. (6) And when I did, I tried to keep it to a minimum.	(1) 这是完善循环的最低限度人数。 (2) 最低工价为每小时四点二五美元。 (3) 修理你的汽车最低限度要100美元。 (4) 这个班最低限度要六个学生才可以继续办下去。 (5) 把一切巩固到最低限度的最小量。 (6) 吃的时候，我也要保持在最小量。
miniskirt n.迷你短裙	(1) Miniskirts are starting to come back. (2) It's an era of the miniskirt in the seventies.	(1) 超短裙又开始流行了。 (2) 七十年代是超短裙时代。
minister n.外交使节；部长；大臣；牧师 v.照顾；给予帮助	(1) The president gave his minister carte blanche in foreign affairs. (2) He was elected Minister of Education. (3) The minister can only act in this matter with the sanction of Parliament. (4) The Chancellor of the Exchequer is the minister in charge of finance in Britain. (5) The minister preached a sermon on humility. (6) I have to minister to my mother all the time. (7) She felt it was her vocation to minister to the sick.	(1) 总统把处理外交事务的全权授予他的公使。 (2) 他被选为教育部长。 (3) 部长只有得到国会批准才能就此事采取行动。 (4) 英国财政大臣是负责财政的大臣。 (5) 牧师就谦恭的问题布道。 (6) 我不得不一直照料我的母亲。 (7) 她觉得照料病人是她的天职。
ministry n.(政府的)部；内阁；(全体)牧师	(1) She's on attachment to the Ministry of Defense. (2) The army, navy and airforce are all controlled by the Ministry of Defense. (3) The Ministry released him on compassionate grounds. (4) The ministry is about to haul up the white flag. (5) Our son wants to enter the ministry. (6) He is training for the ministry. (7) He felt no vocation for the ministry.	(1) 她现在隶属于国防部。 (2) 陆海空军皆由国防部控制。 (3) 内阁因同情而将他释放。 (4) 该内阁正准备认输。 (5) 我们的儿子想做牧师。 (6) 他正在接受培训，准备做牧师。 (7) 他不以为做牧师是自己的天职。
minority n.少数；少数民族；未成年	(1) Only a minority of British households do not have a car. (2) A small minority voted against the motion. (3) The question of which state the minority group should belong to was decided by (a) plebiscite. (4) There are 56 minorities in our country. (5) The nationality of the minority groups in that country is still at issue.	(1) 英国只有少数家庭没有汽车。 (2) 投票反对该提议的人占少数。 (3) 该少数民族应归属哪一州的问题已由公民投票表决。 (4) 我国有56个少数民族。 (5) 在那个国家的少数民族的国籍问题上仍有争论。
mirror n.镜子；反映 vt.反映；反射	(1) Steam has fogged the bathroom mirror. (2) A glance in the mirror reassured him that his tie wasn't crooked. (3) She stared at herself in the mirror. (4) The clear water mirrored the blue sky. (5) These novels mirror life in today's Japan from various angles. (6) Our inventions mirror our secret wishes. ----Lawrence Durrell	(1) 水蒸气把浴室里的镜子遮住了。 (2) 他照了一下镜子，领带确实没有戴歪。 (3) 她凝视着镜中的自己。 (4) 清澈的水中映出蔚蓝的天空。 (5) 这些小说从不同角度反映了当代日本的生活。 (6) 我们的发明反射出我们的秘密愿望。----劳伦斯。达雷尔

missile n.导弹；投射物	(1) The missile deflected from its trajectory. (2) The smallest deflection of the missile could bring disaster. (3) The missile had blown the battleship asunder. (4) A missile was projected into space. (5) The huge ship was sunk by a homing missile. (6) A defect in the fuel lines prevented the missile from blasting off. (7) Demonstrators attacked the police, using sticks and assorted missiles. (8) A hand-grenade is a missile weapon.	(1) 导弹已偏离轨道。 (2) 导弹有极微小的偏斜也可能酿出大祸。 (3) 炮弹把战舰炸碎了。 (4) 导弹被发射升空。 (5) 这只巨大的军舰被一枚自动寻的导弹击中。 (6) 燃料管路上的一个缺陷妨碍了导弹的发射。 (7) 示威者用棍棒和各种投掷物攻击警察。 (8) 手榴弹是一种投掷武器。
mist n.雾；迷蒙；朦胧不清 vt.使…模糊；蒙上雾 vi.使模糊；下雾	(1) A mist of perfume hung in the air. (2) Everything was covered in mist. (3) She could hardly recognize her son through the mist of tears that filled her eyes. (4) I turn from my work and my eyes fill with the mist. (5) Our breath is misting up the car windows. (6) Humidity would mist his glasses and slick his bald head with sweat. (7) When I drink tea, my glasses mist over.	(1) 空气中飘溢著香水的雾气。 (2) 一切都笼罩在雾霭中。 (3) 她泪眼蒙蒙，几乎不能认出自己的儿子。 (4) 我劳作回来眼神朦胧不清。 (5) 我们呼出的气渐渐给汽车的窗户上蒙上一层水蒸气。 (6) 湿气模糊了眼镜，汗水却令头顶更加光亮。 (7) 我喝茶时眼镜蒙上了一层水汽。
mistaken adj.犯错的；错误的 动词mistake的过去分词.	(1) I suppose you're mistaken there. (2) It appears to me that you are all mistaken. (3) He is bedeviled by his mistaken ideas. (4) If you thought she intended to be rude, you were mistaken.	(1) 我认为在这点上您错了。 (2) 我觉得你们全搞错了。 (3) 他被错误思想弄糊涂了。 (4) 如果你认为她是故意粗鲁无礼，那你就弄错了。
misunderstand v.误解；误会；不了解	(1) They pretend to misunderstand my complaint. (2) His remarks show that he misunderstood my position on the question. (3) He wrote her a letter for fear she misunderstand him.	(1) 他们假装误解了我的投诉。 (2) 他的话说明他误解了我在这一问题上的立场。 (3) 他给她写了封信，免得她误会。
mix v.混合；掺入；合成；联系；融合；介入 n.混合(物)；融合	(1) You can't mix oil with water. (2) If you mix blue with yellow, you'll get green. (3) For better flavor, you can mix an egg into the batter. (4) Her son's return made her mix joy with sorrow. (5) He finds it hard to mix at parties. (6) Pink and blue mix well together. (7) Alcohol and drugs is a deadly mix. (8) Add the water and give it a good mix.	(1) 你不能把油和水混合。 (2) 蓝色和黄色混合在一起就成了绿色。 (3) 要想口味更好,你可以在面糊中加进一个鸡蛋。 (4) 她儿子的归来令她喜悲交集。 (5) 他感到很难在聚会上与人攀谈。 (6) 粉色和蓝色在一起很协调。 (7) 酒精和毒品混在一块儿,足以令人毙命。 (8) 加点水,让它很好地融合。
mixture n.混合；混合物	(1) You need a spoon to beat the mixture smooth. (2) Air is a mixture, not a compound of gases. (3) The bottom layer is a mixture of sand and clay. (4) She trickles oil into the mixture.	(1) 你需要用一把调羹来搅均混合液。 (2) 空气是气体的混合物，不是化合物。 (3) 最下面的一层是沙和泥的混合物。 (4) 她把油一点点地注入混合物中。
mm abbr.毫米(=millimeter)	(1) The rainfall there averages 300 mm a year.	(1) 那儿的年降雨量平均每年为三百毫米。
mobile adj.移动的；易变的；活动的 n.<美>汽车；可动雕塑；悬挂饰物；活动物体	(1) Additionally, consumers continue to embrace mobile personal devices. (2) He had a mobile, expressive, animated face. (3) He has a broken leg and isn't very mobile. (4) A specially equipped car makes a handicapped person more mobile.	(1) 此外,消费者接受移动个人设备的热情依然不减。 (2) 他有一张多变的，富于表情的，生动活泼的脸。 (3) 他的腿摔伤了,活动不便。 (4) 有特殊装置的汽车使得残障者比以前更易于活动。
modern adj.现代的；时髦的 n.现代人；时尚人士	(1) Modern agriculture is spoiling our beautiful countryside. (2) He can't adjust himself to the whirl of modern life in this big city. (3) Her novel depicts life in modern London. (4) She wears a modern dress. (5) Girls often shop for modern clothes. (6) This kind of furniture is modern in style. (7) Education is essential to modern men. (8) Many people live long healthy lives in modern times.	(1) 现代农业正在破坏我们美丽的农村。 (2) 他无法适应这个大都市的现代生活的忙碌。 (3) 她的小说描写的是伦敦现代的生活。 (4) 她穿着一件时髦的礼服。 (5) 女孩子们经常去商店买时髦衣服。 (6) 这种家具款式时髦。 (7) 教育对于现代人十分重要。 (8) 很多现代人都长寿。
modest adj.谦虚的；适度的；端庄的；有节制的	(1) We should be modest and prudent. (2) She is very modest about her success. (3) I bought the house at a modest price. (4) Young girls must be modest in speech, dress and behavior. (5) She continued to lead a quiet and modest life.	(1) 我们应该谦虚谨慎。 (2) 她对自己的成就很谦虚。 (3) 我以适中的价格买下了这所房子。 (4) 年轻姑娘必须言词谨慎，衣着得体，行为端庄。 (5) 她仍然过着安静、有节制的生活。
Mom n.妈妈 abbr.月中(=middle of month) abbr.会议纪要(=Minutes of Meeting)	(1) I talk to my mom on the phone every Saturday. (2) My mom used to make the best peanut brittle.	(1) 我每个周六给母亲打电话。 (2) 我妈妈过去经常做最好吃的花生糖。
monument n.纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽作品	(1) The monument was fronted with stone. (2) Nelson's Column is a famous monument in London. (3) The monument is in honor of a scientist. (4) Time and weather had long ago effaced the inscription on the monument. (5) A monument was built to commemorate the victory. (6) They dedicated a monument in memory of those who died in the great earthquake. (7) It's the most enigmatic prehistoric monument on earth.	(1) 纪念碑的正面是石料做的。 (2) 纳尔逊纪念碑是伦敦著名的纪念碑。 (3) 那座纪念碑是为纪念一位科学家而建的。 (4) 岁月和风雨早已磨掉纪念碑上的铭文。 (5) 为了纪念胜利，建造了一座纪念碑。 (6) 他们为悼念死于大地震的人们建造纪念碑。 (7) 它是地球上最神秘的史前遗迹。
moon cake n.月饼	(1) My mother likes moon cake with meat. (2) I eat moon cakes and pomelos on Moon Festival.	(1) 妈妈喜欢吃带有肉馅的月饼。 (2) 我在中秋节时会吃月饼和柚子。
mop n.拖把；拖把状物 vt.用拖把拖；擦拭 vi.用拖把拖	(1) Here is a dish mop. (2) I used a mop to sop up the spilled water. (3) She had a mop of black hair. (4) I have to mop the kitchen floor at least once a day. (5) She mops her tears with a towel. (6) First she dusted, then she mopped.	(1) 这儿是洗碗刷。 (2) 我用拖把把泼出的水擦干。 (3) 她一头蓬乱的黑发。 (4) 我每天至少要把厨房地板擦洗一次。 (5) 她用毛巾擦眼泪。 (6) 她首先擦掉灰尘, 然后用拖把擦。
moral adj.道德的；精神上的 n.寓意；道德；品行；伦理	(1) She regards his moral faults with charity. (2) We differ about moral standards. (3) His behavior transgressed the moral rules of the social conduct. (4) The moral of this story is ‘Better late than never'. (5) People can draw a moral from tales. (6) You may draw your own moral from it. (7) As a Puritan, he is strict in moral and religion. (8) Taking drygs is also a moral and ethical problem. (9) She threw aside all her moral teachings and inhibitions.	(1) 她宽恕他的品行不端。 (2) 我们对道德标准看法不一致。 (3) 他的行为违背了社会行为的道德准则。 (4) 这个故事的寓意是｀迟做总比不做好＇. (5) 人们可以从寓言里吸取经验教训。 (6) 你可以从中得出自己的教训。 (7) 作为清教徒，他的道德和宗教观念都很严格。 (8) 用药问题也涉及到伦理道德问题。 (9) 她把她所讲的伦理道德全抛到了一边。
Moslem n.回教徒；穆罕默德信徒 adj.回教徒的；回教的 =Muslim（英）.	(1) Yesterday when we went to the post office, we ran across a Moslem. (2) Richard the Lionhearted, leader of the Third Crusade, intends to take the fight to Moslem leader Saladin.	(1) 作天我们去邮局的时候，遇到一个回教徒。 (2) 狮王李察率领十字军第三次东征，意图歼灭回教徒酋长沙拉丁。
Mosquito n.蚊子	(1) The mosquito is the disgusting thing. (2) Mosquitoes like to suck the blood of people and animals. (3) The mosquito is a transmitter of disease.	(1) 蚊子是讨厌的东西。 (2) 蚊子喜好吸人和动物的血。 (3) 蚊子能传播疾病。

motivation n.动机；动力；刺激；积极性	(1) bend on sth (2) The most intrinsic motivation for learning is the child's spontaneous interests. (3) They lack the motivation to study.	(2) 学习的最为内在的刺激是儿童自发的兴趣。 (3) 他们缺乏学习的积极性。
motor n.马达；发动机；机动车 adj.机动的；汽车的；运动神经的	(1) At six o'clock the motor started up. (2) If the battery is dead, the motor won't turn over. (3) We switched off the motor and started to drift (along). (4) I stopped the car but left the motor ticking over. (5) Tell him to shut off the motor. (6) That young man is a motor mechanic. (7) All this year's new models are displayed at the motor show. (8) Last year was really bad for the motor industry in Europe. (9) The athlete has good motor coordination.	(1) 6点钟时马达开动起来。 (2) 电池要是用完了，马达就转不起来了。 (3) 我们关闭发动机开始滑行。 (4) 我停住汽车，让发动机空转。 (5) 告诉他把发动机关掉。 (6) 那个年轻人是一个汽车修理工。 (7) 汽车展览会上展出了今年所有的新型号。 (8) 去年，欧洲的机动车市场很不景气。 (9) 那个运动员运动神经的协调很好。

(4) Who would want to ride a motorcycle here?	(1) 他的父母反对他买摩托车的计划。 (2) 我兄弟那辆破摩托车已经解体了。 (3) 骑摩托车的人戴了一顶头盔。 (4) 谁会愿意在这种鬼地方骑摩托车？

mouthful n.一口；又长又拗口的词	(1) I can't manage another mouthful. (2) He wants to eat it up at a mouthful. (3) He took a mouthful of sweet country air. (4) That Russian name is really a mouthful.	(1) 我一口也吃不下了。 (2) 他要一口把它吃掉。 (3) 他吸一口清香的乡村空气。 (4) 那个俄文名字真拗口。

(4) Ms japan: because it passes from mouth to mouth. (5) The news was transmitted from mouth to mouth. (6) The rumor passed from mouth to mouth.	(1) 这消息广为流传。 (2) 一传十，十传百，这消息很快就传开了。 (3) 他的故事被广泛流传。 (4) 日本小姐:因为它从一张嘴里传到另一张嘴里。 (5) 这一消息被广泛传播。 (6) 谣言不胫而走。

(6) A slow theme introduces the first movement. (7) The first movement of the symphony is beautiful. mud n.泥；泥浆；诽谤 vt.弄脏；抹泥	(1) My car's stuck in the mud, and it won't budge. (2) He removed the mud from his shoes. (3) As the bus passed, it spattered mud on my clothes. (4) The heavy wheels churned the earth into mud. (5) The boy churned the earth into mud. (6) She often threw mud at her colleagues. (7) Don't fling mud at him just because you don't like him. (8) His clothes were daubed with mud. (9) Rolling over in the mud, she would make herself all muddy and dirty. nature n.自然界；性质；自然；自然状态；本性；类型	(1) In fact, nature is much better at recycling than we humans are. (2) To a great extent, that is the nature of my own work. (7) Both types of organisms are ubiquitous in nature. (8) The nature of the high a drug provides depends on the type of drug. (5) She tried to needle me into losing my temper. (6) He was always needling me.	(1) 针刺进了她的手指。 (2) 她被针扎了一下。 (3) 这条路上铺满了金黄色的松针，看上去美极了。 (4) 我妈妈在给我缝外套。 (5) 她想方设法惹我发脾气。 (6) 他一直在嘲弄我。
negotiate vi.谈判；协商；交涉 vt.谈判达成；成功越过；议价出售	(1) We've decided to negotiate with the employers about our wage claim. (2) We are happy to negotiate with you in that way. (6) The climber had to negotiate a steep rock face.	(1) 我们决定就工资问题与雇主谈判。 (2) 我们很高兴用这种方式来和贵方协商交易。 (3) 工会领导回去和政府进行交涉。 (4) 由于我们的合同快到期了，我们必须谈判新的合约。 (5) 你是怎么谈成那笔有利可图的交易的? (6) 那攀登者得攀越一陡峭岩石。
nephew n.外甥；侄子	(1) My little nephew is very naughty. (2) He decided to take his nephew abroad. (3) To my surprise, I found my nephew dressed in a girl's skirt. (4) His nephew is an uncouth young man.	(1) 我的外甥特别调皮。 (2) 他决定把他的外甥带出国。 (3) 令我惊奇的是，我侄子穿着女孩的裙子。 (4) 他的侄子是一个粗野的年轻人。
nest n.巢；窝 vt.为 ... 筑巢；嵌入 vi.筑巢；寻找鸟巢	(1) The blackbird's nest contained four eggs. (2) The male hunts for food while his mate guards the nest. (3) The bird is building a nest of straw and twigs. (4) The swallow has made a nest under our eaves. (5) The nest held three vigorous young birds. (6) The boy was nesting for the little birds. (7) You can nest up to 64 levels of functions. (8) She nested the glass tumblers in a crate. (9) You can nest one kind of control structure within another kind. (10) The swallows nested under the eaves. (11) There the birds nest and bring up their young.	(1) 黑鹂巢里有四个蛋。 (2) 雌性动物守巢时，雄性动物猎食。 (3) 这只鸟在用稻草和小树枝筑巢。 (4) 燕子在我们的屋檐下垒了一个窝。 (5) 这窝里有三只活泼的小鸟。 (6) 这个男孩正在为这些小鸟筑巢。 (7) 最多可以嵌套64个级别的函数。 (8) 她把玻璃酒杯一个套一个放在箱子里。 (9) 可以在一种控制结构中嵌套另一种控制结构。 (10) 燕子在屋檐下筑巢。 (11) 这些鸟在那里筑巢并哺育幼鸟。
net n.网；网状物 adj.净余的；纯粹的	(1) This area has not been covered by the communication net. (2) My mother bought a lot of net curtains. (3) The net weight of this jar of coffee is 180 grams.	(1) 这个地区还不在通讯网的覆盖之内。 (2) 我妈妈买了很多网眼帘布。 (3) 这瓶咖啡净重180克。
network n.网点；网络；网状系统；广播公司	(1) The fabrics are merchandised through a network of dealers. (2) The Internet is a worldwide computer network. (3) She gave me a diagram of railway network. (4) The broadcast was carried on national network .	(1) 通过经销网点销售纺织品。 (2) 因特网是一个全球计算机网络系统。 (3) 她给了我一张铁路网图解。 (4) 这个节目通过全国广播网进行广播。
New Zealand n.新西兰	(1) Auckland is the largest city in New Zealand. (2) New Zealand is a marvelous country, isn't it?	(1) 奥克兰是新西兰最大的城市。 (2) 新西兰是一个非常奇妙的国家，是吗？
New Zealander n.新西兰人	(1) The Kiwi is New Zealand's national symbol and New Zealanders refer to themselves as Kiwis. (2) Living in a country with plenty of space and a good climate, New Zealanders love all kinds of sport and outdoor activities.	(1) 几维鸟是新西兰的名族象征，新西兰人也常常把自己称为几维人。 (2) 新西兰幅员辽阔，气候宜人，新西兰人喜爱各种各样的运动和户外活动。
niece n.侄女；外甥女；教士的私生女	(1) Her niece is wearing a bright yellowish skirt. (2) My niece was left in my trust for the weekend. (3) Nancy is staying with her niece for the moment.	(1) 她的侄女穿著一条鲜明的淡黄色裙子。 (2) 我受托周末照顾我的外甥女。 (3) 南希暂时同她外甥女住在一起。
night n.夜晚 adj.夜晚的	(1) Night began to fall. (2) We can see the stars at night. (3) With the setting of the sun, night comes silently. (4) Not many people want to be night owls. (5) Do you think you'll go to night school tomorrow night?	(1) 夜幕降临。 (2) 夜晚我们可以看见星群。 (3) 随着太阳的落下，夜晚悄悄地来到。 (4) 不是很多人想当夜猫子。 (5) 你明天晚上打算去夜校吗?
night club 夜总会	(1) The phony glamour of night club soon become stale and boring. (2) I wouldn't want to annoy the bouncer on the door of the night club; he's a nasty piece of work. (3) I don't want you hanging about with that low life down at the night club. (4) He made a career of taking off famous people for night club audiences.	(1) 夜总会那种虚假的荣华不久便失去了新意而使人生厌。 (2) 我不想与夜总会那看门的人交往，他是个令人讨厌的家伙。 (3) 我不希望你在夜总会里沦落成为一个名声极坏的人。 (4) 他在夜总会以给观众表演模仿名人动作或语言为职业。
nineteen 十九	(1) They were chatting away nineteen to the dozen. (2) Nobody is as sophisticated as a boy of nineteen who is just recovering from a baby- grand passion. (3) He was born in the nineties of the nineteen century. (4) There are nineteen students in my class.	(1) 他们聊个没完。 (2) 谁也不会象十九岁的男孩子那么别扭，他是刚刚要从“大幼儿病”恢复过来的嘛。 (3) 他生于十九世纪九十年代。 (4) 我班里有十九个学生。
ninety num.九十	(1) He was born in the nineties of the nineteen century. (2) He must be going on for ninety.	(1) 他生于十九世纪九十年代。 (2) 他准有九十岁了。
