noble adj.高贵的；宏伟的；高尚的 n.贵族	(1) These few words fully revealed her noble quality. (2) Jim is descended from a noble family. (3) The noble peaks tower into the clouds. (4) His noble example inspired the rest of us to greater efforts. (5) He framed his life according to a noble pattern. (6) It was said that he was from a noble family. (7) He is no longer within the pale of noble society.	(1) 这寥寥数语充分显示了她的高贵品质。 (2) 吉姆出身于一个贵族家庭。 (3) 壮丽的山峰高耸入云。 (4) 他那高尚的榜样激发我们大家更加努力。 (5) 他以高尚的模式构筑自己生活的框架。 (6) 据说他出身于贵族家庭。 (7) 他不再是贵族社会的一员了。
nod v.点头；打盹；（使）摆动 n.点头；同意	(1) She nodded when she passed me in the street. (2) He nodded in agreement with me. (3) The student began to nod off during math class. (4) Trees nod in the wind. (5) She greeted us with a nod of the head. (6) I hope he'll give the nod to the plan.	(1) 她在街上走过我身旁时向我点了点头。 (2) 他点头表示同意我的意见。 (3) 那学生上数学课的时候开始打盹。 (4) 树在风中摇曳。 (5) 她向我们点点头打招呼。 (6) 我希望他会同意这个计划。
noisily adv.喧闹地	(1) A troop of children rushed in and chased each other noisily.	(1) 一群小孩冲进来，喧闹地彼此追逐。

normal adj.正常的；正规的；精神健全的 n.常态；标准	(1) Everything is absolutely normal. (2) She refused to conform to the normal social conventions. (3) It was several days before the floodwater sank and life returned to normal. (4) Her temperature is above normal.	(1) 一切完全正常。 (2) 她拒绝遵从正常的社会习俗。 (3) 过了几天洪水才退,生活恢复了正常。 (4) 她的体温高于正常标准。
northwards adv.向北	(1) The gulf extends northwards. (2) The coast sweeps (away) northwards in a wide curve. (3) The escapee ran quickly northwards and cut back to the original place.	(1) 海湾向北方延伸。 (2) 海岸呈一大弧形向北伸展。 (3) 逃犯迅速向北跑去，然后又突然回到原地。
note n.笔记；便条；纸币；音符；票据；注解；音调 vt.注意；记录；注解	(1) Students should take notes during the lectures. (2) Seeing nobody at home, he decided to leave a note. (3) I'd like to break this 50 dollars note. (4) You should pay off the note before our next cooperation. (5) Pay attention to the notes on each page;those notes might be the focus of our exam. (6) There was a note of warning in what he said. (7) I failed to note that he had left. (8) Let me note down your address and telephone number. (9) The meaning of this sentence is noted on the lower right part of the page.	(1) 学生们上课应该做笔记。 (2) 看到没人在家,他决定留下一个便条。 (3) 我想把这张50美元的纸币换开。 (4) 在我们下次合作之前,你应该把票据付清。 (5) 注意课文每页的注释,它们可能是我们考试的重点。 (6) 他的话带有一种警告的口气。 (7) 我没有注意到他已经走了。 (8) 让我记下你的地址和电话号码。 (9) 这句话的意思在书页的右下方有注解。
notebook n.笔记本；笔记本电脑	(1) I record all my thoughts in a notebook. (2) She filled her notebook with sketches. (3) The ultimate big prize will be notebook one! (4) Use this pc, and notebook together.	(1) 我在笔记本上记下我所有的想法。 (2) 她在笔记本上画满素描。 (3) 终极大奖将是笔记本电脑一台！ (4) 这台笔记本电脑和台式电脑你花搭着用吧！
novelist n.小说家	(1) I dreamed of becoming a novelist. (2) He was an unknown novelist then. (3) I put her in the top rank of modern novelist.	(1) 我梦想成为一个小说家。 (2) 当时他是位不出名的小说家。 (3) 我把她看做是当代第一流的小说家。
nowadays adv.现今；现在	(1) Nowadays we rely increasingly on computers for help/to help us. (2) Nowadays people travel in cars rather than carriages. (3) Portable telephones are very popular nowadays. (4) Nowadays, children often prefer watching TV to reading. (5) Nowadays, the poor student has become a rich man. (6) Lasers can be used to perform operations nowadays. (7) Phonograph is no longer used nowadays. (8) It is rare to find such a genius nowadays. (9) Nowadays many people die of cancer.	(1) 现今人们越来越依赖计算机协助工作。 (2) 现今人们旅行都坐汽车，而不使用马车。 (3) 现今，移动电话非常普及。 (4) 如今，儿童常爱看电视而不爱看书。 (5) 如今，那个穷学生成了富人。 (6) 现在激光可以用来做手术。 (7) 留声机现在已不再使用了。 (8) 这样的天才现在很少见。 (9) 现在有很多人死于癌症。
nowhere adv.任何地方都不 n.不知道的地方；无处	(1) Nowhere else will you find such a good book. (2) The young girl would go nowhere without her chaperon. (3) That kind of talk will get you nowhere. (4) He's had nowhere to live since his eviction.	(1) 你在其他任何地方都找不到这么好的书。 (2) 这个年轻女孩去任何地方都有监护人跟着。 (3) 说那种话对你没好处。 (4) 他自从被驱逐出住所以来，就一直无处栖身。
nuclear adj.原子核的；原子能的；核心的	(1) Nuclear binding energies are strikingly high. (2) The college students are active to crusade against the nuclear weapons. (3) They decided to establish a nuclear power station. (4) A nuclear family consists of parents and their children only.	(1) 原子核的结合能是极大的。 (2) 大学生们积极投入开展反对核武器的运 动。 (3) 他们决定修建一所核电站。 (4) 核心家庭一般只有父母和孩子两代。
numb adj.麻木的；失去知觉的 vt.使麻木；使失去知觉	(1) My fingers were so numb that I could hardly write. (2) I've just been to the dentist and my face is still numb. (3) The anaesthetic made his whole face go numb. (4) His leg was numbed by the intense pain. (5) She was completely numbed by the shock of her father's death.	(1) 我的手指都麻木了几乎不能写字。 (2) 我刚刚去看了牙医，脸上现在还没知觉呢。 (3) 麻醉药使他的整张脸失去了知觉。 (4) 他的腿因剧痛而麻木。 (5) 她父亲去世造成的打击使她目瞪神呆.
nursery n.托儿所；保育室；苗圃	(1) Many children under five go to nursery school. (2) She's all for more nursery schools being built. (3) She sent her little son to a nursery when she was working. (4) We bought a small tree at the nursery.	(1) 5岁以下的许多儿童都上幼儿园。 (2) 她坚持主张多建托儿所。 (3) 她工作的时候就把小儿子送到托儿所。 (4) 我们在苗圃买了一棵小树。
nursing n.护理 动词nurse的现在分词.	(1) Nursing is a very worthwhile career. (2) The sick boy came round with careful nursing.	(1) 护理工作是很值得干的职业。 (2) 那个生病的男孩经过精心护理已经康复了。
nutrition n.营养	(1) Variety is not a guarantee of good nutrition. (2) This food provides all the nutrition your dog needs. (3) A balanced diet provides nutrition for your body.	(1) 品种多并不能确保营养好。 (2) 本食品含有狗所必须的一切营养。 (3) 均衡的食物使你的身体获得营养。
nylon n.【U】尼龙 （复数）nylons：女长袜.	(1) This coat is made of nylon. (2) She strung the beads with a fine nylon. (3) Cotton is more comfortable to wear than nylon.	(1) 这件衣服是尼龙的。 (2) 她用细尼龙线把珠子串了起来。 (3) 棉布比尼龙穿着舒服。
obey v.服从；遵守；顺从；听从	(1) Soldiers are expected to obey their orders without question. (2) We should obey the law. (3) The abbot told him to obey the rules. (4) We must obey the decencies and attend the funeral. (5) We agreed to serve your father and to follow his orders and obey his edicts. (6) Dogs can be trained to obey orders.	(1) 军人应当绝对服从命令。 (2) 我们应当遵守法律。 (3) 修道院院长告诉他要遵守规定。 (4) 我们要遵照礼仪参加葬礼。 (5) 我们很愿意服事你的父亲,遵行他的话,顺从他的命令。 (6) 狗可以训练得听从命令。
observe v.观察；遵守；注意到；庆祝	(1) We have to observe carefully what's going on there. (2) All citizens should observe traffic rules. (3) We should observe the proprieties. (4) If they have to leave home, they must wear a face mask and observe good personal hygiene.	(1) 我们必须仔细观察那里的动静。 (2) 每位公民都应该遵守交通规则。 (3) 我们应该遵守礼节。 (4) 若外出,要佩戴口罩,注意个人卫生。
obtain vt.获得；得到 vi.流行；通用；存在	(1) He failed to obtain a scholarship. (2) At last, their company obtained the mining concession. (3) Those who were penitent obtained absolution. (4) They obtained a loan from the government. (5) Please advise us immediately after you have obtained the necessary import license. (6) Your dress still obtains now. (7) The custom still obtains in districts. (8) The word has obtained general currency. (9) These laws no longer obtain. (10) These conditions no longer obtain.	(1) 他没有获得奖学金。 (2) 他们的公司最终获得了采矿权。 (3) 悔过者获得了赦免。 (4) 他们从政府那里得到一笔贷款。 (5) 你公司得到所需进口许可证后，请立即通知我们。 (6) 你的这款套裙现在还很流行。 (7) 这种风俗在某些地区仍然流行。 (8) 该词已经通用了。 (9) 这些法律不再通用了。 (10) 这些条件已不复存在了。
obvious adj.明显的；显然的	(1) It is obvious that she is very clever. (2) The embassy is an obvious target for terrorist attacks. (3) The merits of the scheme are quite obvious. (4) All great truths are obvious truths. But no all obvious truths are great truths.	(1) 很明显，她挺聪明。 (2) 大使馆是恐怖分子攻击的明显目标。 (3) 该计画的可取之处是相当明显的。 (4) 所有伟大的真理都是显而易见的事实,但并非所有显而易见的事实都是伟大的真理。
occupation n.职业；占有；消遣；居住	(1) I haven't entered your name and occupation yet. (2) Please state your name, age and occupation. (3) He is a merchant in occupation. (4) He returned from Paris and found his office was under someone else's occupation. (5) Riding is her favorite occupation. (6) The house was adapted for occupation.	(1) 我尚未记下你的名字和职业。 (2) 请说明姓名、年龄和职业。 (3) 他的职业是经商。 (4) 他从巴黎回来，发现他的办公室被别人占了。 (5) 骑马是她最喜欢的消遣。 (6) 这所房子已被改造得可以居住了。
occur vi.发生；存在；出现；想到	(1) That plane crash occurred only minutes after take-off. (2) Misprints occur on every page. (3) A connection error might occur. (4) Didn't it occur to you that he was lying?	(1) 空难在起飞几分钟后就发生了。 (2) 每页都有印刷错误。 (3) 可能会出现连接错误。 (4) 你当时没想到他在撒谎吗？
Oceania n.大洋洲	(1) Oceania is the smallest continent. (2) Oceania is a separate landmass,but it is separated from Asia by very shallow water.	(1) 大洋洲是最小的洲。 (2) 大洋洲是一块单独的陆地，但它与亚洲之间只隔着很浅的水域。
off adv.表示状态的关闭或离开 prep.离开；在 ... 之外 adj.空闲的；离开的；关闭的 v.离开；脱下	(1) The singer was led off the stage by the maestro. (2) Off campus, they faced hostility. (3) The plane took off and ascended steadily until it was out of sight. (4) He forgot to turn off the gas torch when he left. (5) Please switch the lights off as you leave. (6) Make sure the central heating is off. (7) Boring! We should just off him and be done with it! (8) He pulled off his overcoat and began to work. (9) The girl peeled her sweater off over her head.	(1) 歌唱家由那位著名的指挥领着离开了舞台。 (2) 在校园之外，他们遭人敌意。 (3) 飞机起飞之后平稳地逐渐升空直到消失在视野之外。 (4) 他离开的时候忘记关掉气焊焊炬了。 (5) 你离开的时候请把灯关了。 (6) 集中供暖设备一定要关掉。 (7) 无聊!我们应该干掉他,这样一切就搞掂了。 (8) 他脱下大衣，开始工作。 (9) 小姑娘从头上把毛衣脱下来。
offence n.犯罪；过错；攻击，冒犯；令人讨厌的事物	(1) He was not aware that he had committed an offence. (2) In the eyes of law, it is an offence. (3) They were arrested for drug offences. (4) Such an offence will lead to a summary fine. (5) A fine for this offence is automatic. (6) The best defence is offence. (7) Whether a gun is a weapon of offence or a weapon of defense depends on which end of it you are at. (8) The new shopping centre is an offence to the eye.	(1) 他没有意识到自己犯罪了。 (2) 在法律上,这是犯罪。 (3) 他们因贩卖毒品罪而被逮捕。 (4) 这类过错要当场予以罚款。 (5) 对于这种过失,罚款是必然的。 (6) 先下手为强/以攻为守。 (7) 枪是攻击武器还是防御武器，要看你的目的而定。 (8) 新购物中心很不顺眼。
officer n.官员；高级职员；警官；军官；办事员	(1) That officer must be removed. (2) He doubts if the officer is anybody. (3) The immigration officer stamped my passport. (4) His father was a senior officer at the bank. (5) He wore all the trappings of high officer. (6) At the sight of the police officer they run off. (7) The bullet hit the police officer in the shoulder. (8) Such an act of cowardice by an officer shames his whole regiment. (9) He's not an officer, but a common soldier.	(1) 那位官员必须免职。 (2) 他怀疑这官员是个要人。 (3) 移民官员在我的护照上盖了戳。 (4) 他父亲是那家银行的高级职员。 (5) 他佩戴着高级官职的各种服饰。 (6) 一看见那些警官，他们便逃跑了。 (7) 枪射中了警官的肩膀 (8) 一个军官作出如此胆怯的行为使整个团都蒙受羞辱。 (9) 他不是军官而是普通士兵。
official adj.正式的；官方的；公务上的 n.官员	(1) The group have split off from the official union. (2) I happen to have the official statistics with me. (3) They expressed their dissent from official policy. (4) He is a pompous official. (5) The mayor is a considerable official. (6) An official of the local government called to see him.	(1) 这一部分人已从正式的联盟中分裂出来了。 (2) 我碰巧身边有官方的统计数字。 (3) 他们对官方的政策表示出异议。 (4) 他是个自命不凡的官员。 (5) 市长是一位重要的官员。 (6) 当地政府一位官员来看他。
offshore adj.近海的；离岸的；海外的 adv.离岸地；近海地	(1) Meizhou Island is an ofsfhore island. (2) The water quality of the offshore marine areas tended to improve. (3) The bluefin are fattened offshore in sea cages before being shot and butchered for the sushi and steak markets in Japan, America, and Europe. (4) Large sums are kept in opaque offshore centres. (5) The plane hit the ocean several miles offshore.	(1) 湄洲岛地处海陆边际。 (2) 近岸海域海水水质呈改善趋势。 (3) 在屠宰并卖到日本、美国和欧洲的寿司或者烤鱼片市场之前，这些金枪鱼被关在离岸的笼子中养肥。 (4) 大量的财富都交由不透明的海外理财中心处理。 (5) 飞机在距离海岸数英里处坠入大海。
oh int.啊呀；哦	(1) Oh, Xiao Fang, I didn't hear you come in. (2) Oh, she really is getting above herself!	(1) 哦，小方，你进来我都没听见。 (2) 哦，她确实变得越来越自高自大了。

(4) We outlined our main objections to the proposal. (5) He outlined the triangle in red.	(1) 他写下演讲的提纲。 (2) 她笔力雄健地画出了轮廓。 (3) 在谈话时,她概述了我将要干的工作。 (4) 我们扼要地说明了反对该建议的意见。 (5) 他用红笔画出三角形。

(4) Have you got the one which has an output of 150 horsepower? (5) These computers have an audio output. (6) There is hum or noise in the speaker output. (7) The printer will output colour chart. (8) Computers can now output data much more quickly. (9) The program will output it into a file.	(1) 产量已增加到三倍。 (2) 这个国家的工业生产排名最後。 (3) 该工厂的平均产量是每天20辆汽车。 (4) 你们有没有输出功率是一百五十（150）马力的? (5) 这些电脑有音频输出。 (6) 扬声器输出声带嗡嗡声或杂音。 (7) 打印机将会输出彩色图表。 (8) 现在计算机能更快地输出数据。 (9) 这个程序将把它输出到一个文件里。

(4) My boss is an outspoken critic of my ideas.	(1) 他是一个直言批评政府的人。 (2) 他那番直言不讳的言语使他成了反对派的主要抨击对象。 (3) 弗朗克叔叔是个坦率的人。 (4) 我的上司总是对我的想法进行坦率的评论。
outstanding adj.优秀的；突出的；未支付的；未完成的	(1) He was an outstanding student. (2) Given the chance, John might have become an outstanding painter. (3) Two things are outstanding in the creation of the English system of canals. (4) A good deal of work is still outstanding.	(1) 他是个优秀的学生。 (2) 如果有机会,约翰也许已成为一位杰出的画家了。 (3) 在创建英国运河体系的过程中,有两件事是非常突出的。 (4) 还有很多工作尚未完成。
outward adj.向外的；表面的；外部的 adv.向外；在外；表面	(1) A detonation projects an instantaneous pulse of pressure outward in all directions. (2) Frost consists of tiny crystals of ice which grow outward from a solid surface. (3) And there have been morbid miseries fostered by gloomy creeds, which have led men into profound inner discords that made all outward prosperity of no avail. (4) The walls of the dilapidated shed lean outward. (5) Steam in a cylinder expands to push a piston outward. (6) Mark showed no outward signs of distress. (7) Had he been able to come back with me no-w, he would have found Peiping in outward appearance littleo changed. (8) Frost consists of tiny crystals of ice which grow outward from a solid surface.	(1) 爆炸的瞬间会朝各个方向发出向外的压力波。 (2) 霜是由冰的微晶组成，它生长在固体表面的外部。 (3) 悲观的信念孳生了病态的痛苦，致使人类的内部极不和谐，从而使外部的繁荣毫无成果。 (4) 那座破棚屋的墙向外倾。 (5) 气缸中的蒸汽膨胀并推动活塞向外运动。 (6) 马克在外表上没有现出沮丧的神色来。 (7) 假如这次他能够同我一起重回北平的话，他会看到这个城市在外表上没有多大变化。 (8) 霜是由冰的微晶组成，它生长在固体表面的外部。
oval adj.卵形的；椭圆形的 n.椭圆；椭圆形跑道	(1) There are many oval stones at the bottom of the stream. (2) The mirror is oval. (3) The path of the earth around the sun is oval. (4) He hair framed her face in a gentle oval.	(1) 在小河底上有许多卵形的石头。 (2) 镜子是椭圆的。 (3) 地球围绕太阳公转的轨道是椭圆形的。 (4) 她的头发把她的脸蛋勾勒成椭圆形。
overcoat n.外套；大衣	(1) He turned his overcoat collar up. (2) Although I am wearing an overcoat, I am still cold. (3) That overcoat should see me through the winter. (4) She didn't put on an overcoat though it was very cold outside. (5) He walked out into the snow, heavily muffled up in a thick scarf and warm overcoat.	(1) 他把外套的衣领翻了起来。 (2) 虽然我穿了件外套，但还是觉得冷。 (3) 有那件大衣我应该能过冬了。 (4) 外头虽冷，她却没披件外套。 (5) 他雪天出门，裹着厚厚的围巾，穿着暖和的大衣。

(3) We can and must overcome our shortcomings. (4) He was overcome by the gas fumes. (5) I was overcome by a sense of failure. (6) We shall overcome!	(1) 我意识到自己没有办法战胜它。 (2) 世界上任何困难他们都可以克服。 (3) 我们能够而且必须克服我们的缺点。 (4) 汽油味使他受不了。 (5) 我被失败感所压倒。 (6) 我们一定胜利！
overhead n.经常开支；普通用费 adj.高架的；在头上的 adv.在头顶上；在空中；在高处 [计算机] 总开销.	(1) Their office is in central Beijing, so their overhead is very high. (2) The overhead costs are ridiculously expensive. (3) This button turns on your overhead light. (4) The hawk is hovering overhead. (5) An eagle circled high overhead. (6) An aeroplane droned overhead. (7) The lantern hanging overhead swung in the wind.	(1) 他们的办事处设在北京市中心，所以他们的日常开支很大。 (2) 日常开支太高了。 (3) 这个按钮用来开亮您头顶上方的灯。 (4) 鹰在头顶上盘旋。 (5) 一只鹰在高空盘旋。 (6) 一架飞机在头上嗡嗡飞过。 (7) 吊在高处的灯在风中摇动。
overlook v.俯瞰；远眺；没注意到；忽视 n.忽视；远眺	(1) My room overlooked the garden. (2) My room overlooks the sea. (3) He overlooked a spelling error on the first page. (4) They overlooked the enormous risks involved. (5) We are too apt to overlook our own faults. (6) It was a slight overlook on my part. (7) My house has a nice overlook in the hills behind it.	(1) 我的房间俯瞰花园。 (2) 从我的房间可眺望大海。 (3) 他没有看出第一页中有个拼写错误。 (4) 他们忽略了暗含的巨大危险。 (5) 我们很容易忽视自己的过错。 (6) 这是我的小疏忽。 (7) 我的房子从屋后的山顶上俯瞰起来很漂亮。
overweight adj.超重的；过胖的 n.超重 vt.使超重；过于重视	(1) Too many people in the States are overweight. (2) Overweight women who undergo axillary lymph node dissection are more likely to develop lymphedema. (3) The baggage is two kilos overweight. (4) Too many people in the States are overweight.	(1) 超重的美国人太多了。 (2) 超重的妇女在进行腋窝淋巴结清扫后更容易产生淋巴水肿。 (3) 那件行李超重两公斤。 (4) 超重的美国人太多了。
owe vt.欠（债；钱；人情等）；应当给予；感激；把...归功于	(1) I gotta get back there, I owe it to them. (2) Incidentally, I think you still owe me some money. (3) I owe you one. (4) You owe yourself a holiday. (5) I owe a lot to my wife and children. (6) He owes his success more to luck than to ability.	(1) 我要回到那,我欠他们的。 (2) 顺便说一句, 我想你还欠我一些钱。 (3) 我欠你一个人情。 (4) 你应该给自己安排个假期。 (5) 我很感激我的妻子和孩子。 (6) 他认为他的成功是靠运气而不是因为自己有能力。

ox n.牛；公牛	(1) An ox pulls a wagon into the village. (2) The frequent, unreasonable whips angered the ox. (3) Farm owner feeds the ox with the wheat. (4) The ox eats the grass on the lawn. (5) It is easy to tell an ox from a cow. (6) An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox.	(1) 有只牛拉着一台四轮车进入村庄。 (2) 这种经常而无理的鞭打激怒了牛。 (3) 农场主用麦子喂牛。 (4) 牛在草坪上吃草。 (5) 公牛和母牛很容易区分。 (6) 行动的蚂蚁比睡觉的公牛干活更多。
oxygen n.氧；氧气	(1) Water contains hydrogen and oxygen. (2) Hydrogen and oxygen are gases. (3) Plants can absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen. (4) Mars is too dry and poor in oxygen.	(1) 水含有氢和氧。 (2) 氢和氧是气体。 (3) 植物可以吸收二氧化碳释放氧气。 (4) 火星上面过于干燥，并且缺乏氧气。
pace n.速度；步伐；(一)步 v.踱步；(用步)测；(马)溜蹄走 prep.用在人名前(礼貌的表达不同意见)	(1) She works so fast that I can't keep pace with her. (2) When John found he was going to be late, he stepped up his pace. (3) They pace in sleek chivalric certainty. (4) The trot is a pace of the horse. (5) The lion paced the floor of his cage restlessly. (6) He gets up,and begin to pace up and down the room. (7) I pace the path and I know how long it is.	(1) 她工作得很快，我跟不上她的速度。 (2) 约翰发现要迟到了, 就加大步伐。 (3) 自信的步态骑士般孔武而自如。 (4) 快步是马行的一种步态。 (5) 狮子烦躁地在兽笼里走来走去。 (6) 他起身并开始在房间里踱来踱去。 (7) 我用步子量过这条路，我知道它有多长。

(6) The spacecraft splashed down in the Pacific. (7) They must think you are a madman if you tell them you want to cross the Pacific on a raft. (4) For most applications, the default packet size is best.	(1) 政府对每包香烟额外提价十便士。 (2) 邮递员使劲把邮件塞进信箱里。 (3) 明天有邮船开到加莱去。 (4) 对于大多数应用程序而言,最好使用默认数据包大小。

(7) She lay at the side of the pool and paddled in the water with her fingers. pale adj.苍白的；灰白的；暗淡的；无力的 vi.变苍白；变黯淡；相形见绌 n.栅栏	(1) She was pale with fear. (2) His pale face has shown his bad health. (5) His hair was pale and lightless. (6) When he returned, he looked pale and weary. (7) She paled with shock at the news. (8) She paled at the sight of the blood. (9) The clouds paled and pulled apart. (10) The devastating floods of two years ago pale in comparison to last week's storms. (11) Her problems paled into insignificance when compared with this family's tragedy. (4) The idea might panic the investors. (5) I panic at the thought of my weakness and fear it being exposed. (6) The financial crisis caused panic selling of securities. paragraph n.段落；节 vt.将 ... 分段；写短评报道 vi.写短评	(1) The editor struck out the whole paragraph. (2) You'll find the last paragraph extremely apropos. (3) Look at the second paragraph on page fifteen. (4) This point has been dealt with in the preceding paragraph. (5) This paragraph relates to the October Revolution. (6) Don't omit this paragraph when you write your report. (7) The student is ask to paragraph an essay in class. (8) The teacher taught the students how to paragraph an essay. (9) The editor asked him to paragraph. parallel adj.平行的；相同的；类似的；并联的 n.对比；平行线(面)；双杠；相似物 vt.相比；相应；与 ... 平行	(1) In the parallel world, there might be an answer for everything. (2) Parallel processing is the most important peculiarity in this design. (3) The railway lines run parallel to the road. (4) My experience in this matter is parallel to yours. (5) My experience in selling is parallel to yours. (6) Japan's macroeconomic puzzle has a microeconomic parallel. (7) Elements may be connected in parallel, series, or any combination thereof. (8) It is inappropriate to draw such a parallel. (9) The trees stand in parallel with the road. (10) The gymnast swung on the parallel bars. (11) The accuracy of the parallel increased. (12) No one can parallel him in Math. (13) Actually no one can parallel him in poetry. (14) Her experiences parallel mine in many instances. (15) They parallel with one another.	(1) 在平行世界里,似乎有一切的答案。 (2) 其中,并行化的设计理念是该设计的最大特点。 (3) 铁路线和那条道路平行。 (4) 在这件事情上，我的经验和你的类似。 (5) 在销售方面,我的经验和你相仿。 (6) 日本的宏观经济难题是与其微观经济并联的。 (7) 这些硅碳棒可以是并联的，串连的，或者是串并混联的。 (8) 这种比拟是不恰当的。 (9) 这些树与公路平行。 (10) 体操运动员在双杠上摆动身子。 (11) 这种比拟变得愈来愈确切了。 (12) 在数学方面无人能与他匹敌。 (13) 实际上，在诗歌方面无人能同他相提并论。 (14) 她的经历多与我的相似。 (15) 他们相互平行。
parcel n.包裹；部分；一块(土地) vt.分配；打包	(1) He snipped the string and untied the parcel. (2) He tied the parcel with twine. (3) Her stinginess is part and parcel of her nature. (4) Once you've explored a bit, perhaps you'll find a perfect parcel of land to build your house or business. (5) On the other hand, the opportunity cost of using land in a particular project cannot exceed the cost of buying an equivalent parcel to replace it. (6) He used to parcel out jobs to representatives. (7) He parceled up the books.	(1) 他剪断绳子，解开包裹。 (2) 他用细绳来捆扎包裹。 (3) 她生性吝啬。 (4) 一旦你开始探险，你可能会找到一块理想的土地去建造你的房子或者发展你的商业。 (5) 另外一方面，在一个特定项目中使用土地的机会成本不能超过购买一块等效的土地来替代它的成本。 (6) 他曾将工作分配各个代表。 (7) 他把书打成了包。
Paris n.巴黎；重楼（百合科植物）；帕里斯（姓氏）	(1) Paris is the capital of France. (2) I have been away from Paris for two weeks. (3) First prize in the raffle is a holiday for two in Paris. (4) Have you ever been to Paris? (5) He sent me some postal cards from Paris. (6) She wrote a book on the Paris Commune. (3) Everyone in the class is expected to participate in the discussion. (4) I participate your suffering and joy. (5) She found him the only person who could participate thoroughly her feeling. particular adj.特定的；专指的；特殊的；特别的；挑剔的 n.详情；细节	(1) They depend on a particular historical situation. (2) I have nothing particular to do this evening. (3) Clouds must be given a particular attention. (4) She's very particular about what she wears. (5) He gave full particulars of the stolen property.	(1) 它们取决于特定的历史境况。 (2) 今晚我没有什么特殊的事要做。 (3) 必须对云给予特别的注意。 (4) 她对衣著很讲究。 (5) 他详细列出全部被盗的财物。
partly adv.在一定程度上；部分地；不完全地	(1) You have introduced a partly random component. (2) The transformation is partly due to demographics. (3) Their energy is partly dissipated. (4) This partly accounts for the efficiency of the company.	(1) 你介绍了一个在一定程度上属于偶然的成分。 (2) 这一变化一定程度上是源于人口的变化。 (3) 它们的能量被部分地消耗掉。 (4) 这部分地说明了公司效率高的原因。
partner n.伙伴；搭档；伴侣；合伙人 v.同 ... 合作；做 ... 的搭档	(1) He has a competent partner who always organizes everything well for him. (2) Will you be my partner in the next dance? (3) I am so lucky to have a partner like you to enjoy the beauty of life together. (4) Her partner tried to trick her out of her share. (5) They have to partner with the government, even if they are dismissive of its bureaucracy. (6) Gerry offered to partner me at tennis.	(1) 他有个很能干的伙伴,总是替他把一切弄得井井有条。 (2) 下一支曲子时可否请你跟我一起跳舞? (3) 我真幸运,能拥有你这样的伴侣陪我一起享受生命中的美好。 (4) 她的合伙人企图骗走她的股份。 (5) 他们同政府合作,即使他们看不惯政府的官僚主义。 (6) 格里提出和我一起搭档打网球。
passage n.通过；通道；走廊；(文章等的)段落；(时间的)消逝	(1) The bridge is not strong enough to allow the passage of vehicles. (2) The police kept a clear passage for the traffic. (3) We discovered a secret passage behind the wall. (4) This is our room, and yours is down the passage. (5) This passage may be given several interpretations. (6) He's had a rough passage since his son's death, with one illness after another.	(1) 这座桥不够牢固，车辆不能通行。 (2) 警方使来往车辆畅通无阻。 (3) 我们在墙后发现了一个秘密通道。 (4) 这是我们的房间，你们的在走廊的那一头。 (5) 这段文字可以有不同的解释。 (6) 自打他儿子死后他的日子过得很艰苦，病了一场又一场。
passer-by n.过路人；经过者	(1) The purse was picked up by a passer. (2) Somebody passing by asked me the way to the post office.	(1) 钱包被一个过路人捡到了。 (2) 一个过路人问我去邮局怎么走。
passive adj.被动的；消极的 n.被动性	(1) He played a passive role in the marriage. (2) You are passive when you allow things to happen, but do nothing. (3) Good is the passive that obeys reason. (4) Passive tear suctioning force can be demonstrated by a Venturi tube model.	(1) 他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。 (2) 当你让这些事发生,而不做任何事来阻止它,你是消极的。 (3) 善是服从理智的被动性。 (4) 被动性泪液吸引之力量，可藉由文氏管模型来解释。
passport n.护照；手段	(1) Show me your passport, please. (2) My passport has been transacted. (3) He views boxing as his passport out of poverty. (4) He thought that money was a passport to high society.	(1) 请出示护照。 (2) 我的护照已经办完了。 (3) 他把拳击看作自己摆脱贫困的手段。 (4) 他以为金钱是通往上流社会的手段。
patent n.专利；特许 vt.给予专利权 adj.专利的；显著的	(1) The patent runs out in three years time. (2) He got a patent for this invention. (3) The government patented the device to its inventor. (4) This is a packet of a patent cement mix. (5) This is a fact patent to the world. (6) It was patent to everyone that he disliked the idea.	(1) 这项专利期限为3年。 (2) 他获得了这项发明的专利权。 (3) 政府给予发明者专利权。 (4) 这是一包专利水泥混合料。 (5) 这是全世界都明白的事实。 (6) 每个人都看得出来他不喜欢这个主意。
patience n.耐心；忍耐；毅力	(1) Her endless patience made her the best nurse in the hospital. (2) His patience was worn out by all these troubles. (3) She owes her success to hard work and patience. (4) His rudeness was beyond my patience. (5) Learning to walk again after his accident required great patience.	(1) 无限的耐心使她成为这个医院最好的护士。 (2) 这么多麻烦使他都没有耐心了。 (3) 她的成功是努力工作和耐心的结果。 (4) 他的粗暴使我无法忍受。 (5) 他出事后重新学习走路要有极大的毅力。
pattern n.模式；图案；典范；式样 v.以图案装饰；仿造；模仿	(1) The two buildings are modeled after the same pattern. (2) Training and education follow different patterns in different regions. (3) This cloth has a pattern of blue and white squares. (4) Threads of different colors and textures were woven into an intricate pattern. (5) She is a pattern of virtue. (6) This company set a pattern of what a good company should be. (7) Please cut out my overcoat according to this pattern. (8) I like the carpets patterned with peonies. (9) He patterned himself upon a man he admired. (10) This is a new approach patterned on Japanese ideas.	(1) 这两座建筑是按照同一模式建造的。 (2) 培训和教育在不同的地区遵循不同的模式。 (3) 这种布有蓝白格子的图案。 (4) 各种花色和质地的线织成了一幅复杂的图案。 (5) 她是美德的典范。 (6) 这家公司是好公司的典范。 (7) 我这件大衣请你照这个式样裁剪。 (8) 我喜欢印有牡丹花图案的地毯。 (9) 他模仿一位他钦佩的人。 (10) 这是模仿日本概念而设计的新方法。
physical education 体育； 体育课	(1) A school course in physical education. (2) Study on the Aesthetic Education in Colleges P. E. (3) In most schools physical education is compulsory. (4) We haven't had any physical trainingclasses this week.	(1) 体操课学校体育教育中的一门课程 (2) 高校体育教学中的美学教育探析。 (3) 在大部分学校里体育课是必修课。 (4) 这星期我们还没上过体育课。
personal computer n.个人计算机	(1) Be careful how you start the personal computer. (2) Microcomputer is a very small computer,such as a laptop or personal computer.	(1) 要注意怎样起动个人计算机。 (2) 微机计算机是一种非常小的计算机，如膝上机或个人计算机。
peace n.和平；安静	(1) The situation poses a grave threat to world peace. (2) The dove is the emblem of peace. (3) She's never at peace with herself. (4) You'll be able to read in peace here.	(1) 这局势对世界和平构成了严重的威胁。 (2) 鸽子是和平的象徵。 (3) 她总是静不下来。 (4) 你可以在这里安静地看书。
peaceful adj.和平的；安宁的	(1) Hopes of a peaceful settlement are now fading. (2) China is a peaceful country. (3) The world today is far from peaceful. (4) Law and order are necessary for a peaceful society. (5) My husband loves adventurous life while I enjoy a more peaceful domestic life.	(1) 和平解决的希望正在消失。 (2) 中国是一个爱好和平的国家。 (3) 今天的世界还很不安宁。 (4) 法律和秩序对于社会安宁是必需的。 (5) 我丈夫喜欢充满冒险的生活，而我则喜欢宁静的家居生活。
peach n.桃子；桃树；桃红色	(1) The peach is a sweet and juicy fruit. (2) The beauty of the peach blossom is beyond description. (3) There is a peach standing by the lake. (4) Peach is the most popular color this season.	(1) 桃子是甜又多汁的水果。 (2) 桃花的美丽难以形容。 (3) 湖边有棵桃树。 (4) 桃红色是这一季最受欢迎的颜色。
peasant n.农民	(1) That night we put up in a peasant's home. (2) It is the lament of an impoverished peasant.	(1) 那天晚上我们住在一个农民的家里。 (2) 它是一个已贫穷化的农民的哀词。
pedestrian adj.徒步的；缺乏想像的 n.行人	(1) We enjoy all pedestrian activities. (2) They ought to stop at the pedestrian crossing. (3) He was rather a pedestrian student. (4) We present this approach in a pedestrian version. (5) The driver was slanging a pedestrian who had got in his way. (6) Being a good pedestrian is just as important as being a good driver.	(1) 我们喜欢所有的步行活动。 (2) 他们该停在人行横道上。 (3) 他原是个相当平常的学生。 (4) 我们用平铺直叙的方式介绍这个方法。 (5) 那司机破口大骂挡他的路的行人。 (6) 做一个好的行人就像做一个好的司机一样重要。
pen-friend n.笔友	(1) They have pen pals in the United Kingdom. (2) I want a pen pal to correspond with.	(1) 他们有英国的笔友。 (2) 我想要一个通信的笔友。
penny n.便士；【美】分	(1) I only have a few pennies with me. (2) He said that he wouldn't lend me a penny. (3) He felt in his pocket for a penny. (4) He keeps track of every penny he spend. (5) We should make every penny count.	(1) 我身上只有几个便士。 (2) 他说过他一便士都不愿借给我。 (3) 他在口袋里摸索着找一个便士。 (4) 他记录他花掉的每一分钱。 (5) 我们每一分钱都要花在刀刃上。
pension n.养老金；退休金；抚恤金；年金；（欧洲等地的）私人小旅店 v.发退休金	(1) He's got nothing beyond his state pension. (2) He went to the post office to draw his pension. (3) concede one's attention (4) He had stayed at the pension for a fortnight. (5) He was pensioned off and replaced with a younger man.	(1) 除了国家发的养老金，他一无所有。 (2) 他到邮局去取退休金了。 (4) 他已在那个小旅馆待了两个星期。 (5) 他被迫退休，由一年轻人接替其职务。
per prep.每；每一；经过；按照	(1) These apples cost five yuan per kilogram. (2) We were bowling along (the motorway) at seventy miles per hour. (3) The vessel tax of anchorage is 5,000 dollars per year. (4) Tickets to the concert are $50 per head! (5) The goods were shipped per steamer. (6) Cars will be supplied as per the terms agreed on.	(1) 这些苹果每公斤五元。 (2) 我们以每小时七十英里的速度(在高速公路上)飞驰。 (3) 这艘船的停泊税一年是五千美元。 (4) 这场音乐会的门票价格是每人五十美元。 (5) 货物由船舶运送。 (6) 汽车将按所有条款达成一致后供应。
percent n.百分比 adv.百分之 ... adj.百分之 ... 的	(1) The number of queues repaired out of the percent detected. (2) Twenty percent of the products are exported. (3) The company's market share is 48 percent in the marketplace. (4) The gross national product had increased 5 percent last year. (5) The millionaire has handed over 50 percent of his stock to his first son. (6) The covering of forestry in our town is 60 percent. (7) I am a hundred percent in agreement with you. (8) We give 10 percent discount for cash.	(1) 修复的队列数目超过检测到的百分比。 (2) 百分之二十的产品外销。 (3) 这家公司的市场占有率是百分之四十八。 (4) 去年的国民生产总值提高了百分之五。 (5) 这个百万富翁已把他一半的股票移交给他的长子。 (6) 我们镇的森林覆盖率是百分之六十。 (7) 我百分之百同意你的看法。 (8) 现金付款，我们九折优惠。
percentage n.百分率；比例；部分；好处	(1) The percentage at grade E and above for day school candidates in the HKCEE was 67.5 compared with 65.6 in 1998. (2) What percentage of the earth is covered by oceans? (3) Whisky contains a large percentage of alcohol. (4) The percentage of unskilled workers is small. (5) Each of them got a percentage of the profits. (6) We have only a small percentage of foreign books. (7) There is no percentage in worrying about it.	(1) 中学会考日校考生报考的科目成绩达E级或以上的有67. (2) 地球上百分之多少被海水覆盖着？ (3) 威士忌所含酒精的百分比很高。 (4) 非熟练工的比例很小。 (5) 他们每个人都得到一部分利润。 (6) 我们只有一少部分外文书。 (7) 为此担忧无济於事。
perfect adj.完美的；完全的；完满的；十足的；理想的 vt.使完美；使完全	(1) Laurel was a perfect girl in every way. (2) No one expects you to be perfect, but we do expect you to do your best always. (3) I insist on perfect sobriety and silence. (4) The more obedient daughters are, the more often there is no perfect life, especially the marital problems. (5) Therefore, relatively more perfect steroid withdrawl regimens have been studied by many researchers at home and abroad. (6) She's a perfect angel! (7) If you could make a wish, what would be your perfect job? (8) She went to France to perfect her French. (9) He endeavored to perfect his ability.	(1) 从各方面讲，罗拉都是一个完美的女孩。 (2) 没人指望你完美无缺，但是我们盼望你永远尽最大的努力。 (3) 我坚决要求完全的肃静。 (4) 越是听话的女儿，往往越没有完满的人生，尤其是婚姻问题。 (5) 因而国内外众多学者一直在研究相对完满的撤离激素方案。 (6) 她是真正的好人! (7) 在你的理想中,最好的工作是什么? (8) 她为了学好法语去过法国。 (9) 他努力增进实力。
perform v.执行；履行；表演；运转；举行	(1) Every manager must perform some duties of a ceremonial nature. (2) Student teams perform a comprehensive analysis and valuation of a business, as outlined in the syllabus. (3) They always perform their duties faithfully. (4) We will resolutely perform our internationalist duty no matter what happens. (5) He is going to perform magic at the party. (6) John is a bullfighter. Death hangs over his head every time he performs. (7) The machine performs well. (8) Members of certain tribes perform special ceremonies when they reach manhood.	(1) 每个管理者必须执行一些礼仪性的任务。 (2) 如同课程大纲所提及，每一组学生都要对一个企业执行广泛的分析与评价。 (3) 他们总是忠实地履行自己的职责。 (4) 不管发生什么情况，我们都要坚决履行我们的国际主义义务。 (5) 他将在晚会上表演魔术。 (6) 约翰是斗牛士，每次出场表演都要面临死亡的威胁。 (7) 那部机器运转良好。 (8) 某些部落的男人在达到成年时要举行特殊的庆祝仪式。
performer n.表演者；执行者	(1) The performer juggled with knives and swords. (2) The performer removes a notepad and pen. (3) Performer strolls out grumbling and shows his lunchbox empty.	(1) 表演者耍弄刀剑。 (2) 执行者去除笔记薄和笔。 (3) 执行者漫步抱怨并且显示他的饭盒空。
perfume n.香水；香气 vt.洒香水于；使香气弥漫	(1) The room reeked of cheap perfume. (2) The smell of her perfume lingered in the empty house. (3) A mist of perfume hung in the air. (4) Can you smell the perfume of the roses? (5) She perfumed herself with Eau de Cologne. (6) The lemon trees are blossoming and the flowers perfume the valleys and hills.	(1) 房间里弥漫著劣质香水的呛鼻气味。 (2) 空屋里仍然飘溢著她的香水味。 (3) 空气中飘溢著香水的雾气。 (4) 你能闻到玫瑰花的香味吗？ (5) 她身上洒著古龙水。 (6) 柠檬树上的花盛开了，花香弥漫了整个山谷。
period n.一段时间；周期；时期；课时；学时；句号；月经	(1) He feels completely restored to health after a period of intensive care. (2) The exercise period was similar to the previous study. (3) Childhood is a period of rapid growth. (4) He teaches 10 periods a week. (5) This course needs 30 periods in all, and case analysis will use 4 periods. (6) Use a period at the end of the sentence.	(1) 通过一段时间的精心照顾，他感到身体完全康复了。 (2) 运动周期类似前面的研究。 (3) 幼年是生长迅速的时期。 (4) 他每周授课10课时。 (5) 本课程的总学时是30学时，其中4学时是让学生做案例分析。 (6) 在一个句子的末尾用句号。
permanent adj.永久的；持久的 n.<口> 烫发	(1) The incident left permanent traces on his mind. (2) I am looking for a permanent position. (3) These factors usually have a longer and more permanent impact on share prices.	(1) 那件事在他头脑里留下了永久的印象。 (2) 我在找一个永久性的职业。 (3) 这项因素通常会对股价产生更加长远和持久的影响。
permission n.许可；允许；同意	(1) They entered the area without permission. (2) You were wrong to take the car without permission. (3) You must ask permission if you want to leave early. (4) Do I have your permission to change the date? (5) She refused to give her permission.	(1) 他们未经许可擅入该地。 (2) 你未得许可就把汽车开走是不应该的。 (3) 如果你想早走的话，必须得到允许。 (4) 您允许我改变一下日期吗？ (5) 他拒不同意。
permit n.许可证；执照 v.允许；许可	(1) You can't work here without a work permit. (2) He said that if he had a permit he could get a job. (3) I'll come after the meeting if time permits. (4) You are not permitted to smoke here. (5) The rules of the club do not permit smoking.	(1) 你没有许可证就不能在这里工作。 (2) 他说如果他有执照就能找到工作。 (3) 如果时间许可的话，我开完会就来。 (4) 此处不许吸烟。 (5) 这个俱乐部的规章不允许吸烟。
personally adv.就个人而言；亲自地；个别地；作为个人；有私交地	(1) Personally, I like blue best. (2) She saw to the comforts of her guests personally. (3) I really need to talk to him personally. (4) He was personally criticized by inspectors for his incompetence. (5) I have nothing against Sandy personally, but her family's a bit strange. (6) I dislike him personally, but I admire his art. (7) Don't take my remarks about your plan personally.	(1) 我个人最喜欢蓝色。 (2) 她亲自照顾客人。 (3) 我真的需要亲自跟他说。 (4) 他因能力差而受到检查员的个别批评。 (5) 我对桑迪本人并不反感，只是她的家庭有点怪。 (6) 我不喜欢他的为人,但我钦佩他的艺术。 (7) 不要把我对你那计划的评论看作是针对你个人。
persuade vt.说服；劝说	(1) How can I persuade you of my sincerity? (2) We are persuaded of the justice of her case. (3) I am not fully persuaded by the evidence. (4) You try and persuade her (to come out with us). (5) He is easily persuaded.	(1) 我如何能够让你相信我的诚意？ (2) 我们确信对她案件的审理是公正的。 (3) 这证据不足以使我充分信服。 (4) 你去试试劝她(跟我们一起出去)吧。 (5) 他这人好说话。
pest n.害虫；讨厌的人	(1) Stores of grain are frequently attacked by pests. (2) It won't be long before we can be rid of the pest altogether. (3) That child is being a real pest. (4) My little brother is a pest when he spoils my games.	(1) 储存的谷物经常受到害虫的破坏。 (2) 不要太久，我们就能把这种害虫消除干净。 (3) 那个孩子真讨厌。 (4) 我的小弟弟破坏我的各种游戏真讨厌。
petrol n.<英>汽油	(1) The petrol is running out. (2) My car is rather heavy on petrol. (3) They have increased the price of petrol again. (4) My new car really runs away with the petrol. (5) They had to ration petrol during the war. (6) The police faced a mob throwing bricks and petrol bombs.	(1) 汽油快要耗尽了。 (2) 我的汽车很费油。 (3) 他们又提高了汽油的价格。 (4) 我的新汽车耗油太多了。 (5) 战时他们不得不限量供给汽油。 (6) 警察面对一群投掷砖块和汽油弹的暴徒。
phenomenon n.现象；奇人；奇事	(1) Their so-called prosperity is only a temporary phenomenon. (2) International terrorism is not just a recent phenomenon. (3) Magnetism is a natural phenomenon. (4) A child who could read at the age of one would indeed be a phenomenon. (5) Beethoven was a phenomenon among musicians. (6) There are special reasons for this unusual phenomenon.	(1) 但他们所谓的繁荣只是一个暂时的现象。 (2) 国际恐怖主义并不是近年才有的现象。 (3) 磁力是一种自然现象。 (4) 一个一岁的孩子能阅读，会被认为是个神童。 (5) 贝多芬是音乐家中的奇才。 (6) 这种奇事的发生，有其独特的原因。
phone-booth n.电话间	(1) He went into the phone booth and dialed the number. (2) I'll give him a call from the phone booth on the corner. (3) I'm lost. Can you direct me to the nearest phone booth? (4) There is a phone booth in the corner. (5) He went into the phone booth and dial the number. (6) Is there a pay phone booth around here ?	(1) 他走进电话亭拨了号码。 (2) 我到街角的电话亭给他打个电话。 (3) 我迷路了。你能告诉我最近的一个电话亭在哪吗？ (4) 在转角处有个电话亭。 (5) 他走进电话亭拨了号码。 (6) 这附近有没有公用电话?
photograph n.相片 vi.拍照，摄影；被照相 vt.给 ... 照相	(1) I planned to enlarge this photograph. (2) This photograph flatters you. (3) I always photograph badly. (4) Some people just don't photograph well. (5) Stand still while I photograph you.	(1) 我计划放大这张照片。 (2) 这照片比你本人漂亮。 (3) 我照相总是照不好。 (4) 有些人就是不上相。 (5) 我给你照像，别动。
photographer n.摄影师	(1) The photographer retouched her picture.	(1) 摄影师对她的照片作了修整。
phrase n.短语；习语；措辞；[音]乐句 vt.措词；将(乐曲)分成乐句	(1) The new phrase is now on the tongue of men. (2) The teacher dictated the phrase to the class. (3) He hashed a phrase in order to colour the sentence. (4) The speaker certainly knew how to turn a phrase. (5) Four whipping bars, ff as well as marcatissimo, put a more or less vicious and peremptory end to the phrase. (6) Notice syncopation in the second phrase where the accent falls after the first beat. (7) She will phrase a fugue of Bach's in these days.	(1) 这个新短语现在正十分流行。 (2) 老师让全班同学听写这个短语。 (3) 他反复推敲一个习语以使该句增色。 (4) 该讲话者当然懂得如何措辞。 (5) 四个鞭打般的小节，以带强调的最强音给乐句一个或多或少野蛮而断然的结束。 (6) 注意第二乐句中的切分音，重音在第一拍之后出现。 (7) 这几天她将把巴赫的赋格曲分成旋律分句。
physical adj.物质的；身体的；体力的；物理的；肉体上的，身体上的 <美>体格检查	(1) It's a physical impossibility to be in two places at one time. (2) Physical disability causes mental anguish. (3) Staying up late makes him at his worst in terms of physical situation. (4) For them, getting rid of heavy physical labour is a big thing	(1) 同时在两地是自然规律上不可能的事。 (2) 生理伤残会引起心理苦闷。 (3) 熬夜使得他的体力状况处于低潮。 (4) 对他们来说, 摆脱重体力劳动是一件大事。

(4) He has made a study on depth effect of pile foundation. (5) See that pile of lumbering by the barn? (6) The little boy is piling up his building blocks. (7) The cart is piled high with fruit and vegetables. (8) Try to solve it immediately and never pile up problems for yourself. (9) Cars often pile up here in the rush hours. (10) It's probably not as bad as she says she does tend to pile it on. (11) The situation is frightful, but it's just piling on the agony to keep discussing it. (6) 小男孩正在搭积木。 (7) 马车上堆满了水果和蔬菜。 (8) 尽量快点解决，不要为自己积攒问题。 (9) 在交通拥挤时刻汽车往往在这里挤成一团。 (10) 大概不像她说的那么糟－－她确实有意夸大事实。 (11) 情况很可怕，可是还一个劲儿地议论让人觉得更可怕。

(6) She was nervous about returning to the pill because of worries about a possible cancer risk. (4) Her arm pillowed the sleeping child. (5) She lay down on the bed and put her head on the pillow tiredly. (6) Birdlike, he retired at dusk, lying on the bare floor with a wooden block under his head like a pillow. (3) This latest incident may be the lever needed to change government policy. (4) This is a constant policy to conduct our steps. (5) It's the company's policy to sacrifice short-term profits for the sake of long-term growth. (6) The annual premium on my policy is 3000 yuan. polish n.光泽；上光剂；优雅；精良 v.擦亮；磨光；推敲；完善 Polish. adj.波兰的；波兰人的；波兰语的 n.波兰语	(1) A hot plate will spoil the polish on this table. (2) This car polish is an effective shield against rust. (3) With this polish you can give a good high gloss to the wood. (4) Now we have a presentable great speaker whose polish reminds me of Will Smith. (5) We want the game we're working on right now to be as high in quality, polish and playability as anything we've done in the past. (6) These well trained and elite troops are well equipped with plate armour and lances, making them a fearsome addition to any Polish army. (7) This chapter introduces the vocalic inventory of Polish. (8) I polished my buttons with a handkerchief. (9) The aluminum film retains its high polish much longer than does silver, and it can be repolished, whereas silver can not. (10) It's an honest book but it hasn't been polished. (11) When I awoke, a Polish man came to my room, held my hand and looked at me with friendly eyes. (12) Well, I think she's either Russian or Polish. (13) This chapter introduces the vocalic inventory of Polish.	(1) 热盘子会毁坏桌面的光泽。 (2) 这种汽车上光蜡很有防锈作用。 (3) 使用这种上光蜡可使木器表面极为光亮平滑。 (4) 现在我们能言善辩的总统，他的优雅一直让我想起了威尔史密斯。 (5) 我们希望能够使这款正在开发的游戏像我们曾做过的任何东西一般高质量，精良和具高度可玩性。 (6) 这些骑士装备精良板甲和骑枪，是训练有素的精锐骑兵，为波兰军队之杀手镧。 (7) 这一章讲了波兰语的元音表。 (8) 我用手帕把钮扣擦亮。 (9) 铝膜保持高度的光洁的时间比银粉长多了，而且铝膜可以再次磨光，而银粉层却不行。 (10) 这本书写得真诚坦率，但还未经润色。 (11) 当我醒来时,一名波兰人走过来,他握着我的手,亲切地望着我。 (12) 嗯，我看她不是俄罗斯人就是波兰人。 (13) 这一章讲了波兰语的元音表。
polite adj.有礼貌的；客气的；有教养的；文雅的	(1) It is not polite of you to cut the speaker short. (2) This boy is polite to everyone. (3) You may be busy, but you should be polite at least. (4) Don't answer back; it's not polite. (5) She is fond of polite literature.	(1) 你打断发言者的话,真不礼貌。 (2) 这个男孩对所有人都很礼貌。 (3) 你可能很忙,但无论如何你应客气点。 (4) 不要顶嘴, 这样显得你没教养。 (5) 她喜爱风雅文学。
political adj.政治的；政治上的；政党的；人事的；争权夺利的	(1) He has some pretty strange political ideas. (2) She entered the political arena after her husband's death. (3) The British political system has evolved over several centuries. (4) The program of a political party is a banner. (5) One suspects he was dismissed for political reasons. (6) Everything in our company is so political that you never know who you can trust.	(1) 他有一些很奇怪的政治信念。 (2) 她丈夫死后，她进入了政界。 (3) 英国的政治制度是经过几个世纪逐步发展而成的。 (4) 一个政党的纲领就是一面旗帜。 (5) 有人怀疑他是由于人事上的原因而被解职的。 (6) 我们公司的所有事情都是争权夺利的,以至于你都知道你能相信谁。
politician n.政治家；政客	(1) A politician should be a servant of the people. (2) That famous politician was murdered last year. (3) A politician needs the common touch. (4) The politician gave an equivocal answer. (5) The politician cops out on the issue of free trade. (6) Mr. Brown is a highly visible politician.	(1) 政治家应是人民的公仆。 (2) 那位著名的政治家去年被谋杀了。 (3) 政治家需要有平易近人的美德。 (4) 那政客的答复模棱两可。 (5) 那政客对自由贸易的问题只是一味逃避。 (6) 布朗先生是一位经常公开露面的政客。
politics n.政治；政治学；政治活动；政治策略；政见	(1) This letter does not pertain to politics. (2) He is not interested in politics. (3) In politics Britain has preferred evolution to revolution. (4) He has serious aspirations to a career in politics. (5) Politics has always interested me. (6) She plays an active part in local politics. (7) We've been having friendly argument on politics. (8) What are your politics?	(1) 这封信的内容与政治无关。 (2) 他不喜欢政治。 (3) 在政治上，英国喜欢渐进而不喜欢革命。 (4) 他有从政的雄心壮志。 (5) 我一直对政治学有兴趣。 (6) 她积极参与地方政治活动。 (7) 我们一直就政治问题进行友好的讨论。 (8) 你的政见是什么？
pollution n.污染；污染物	(1) They devised proposals to deal with air pollution. (2) Waste water from the factory is the main cause of the pollution of local rivers. (3) Many young people could not resist the spiritual pollution. (4) The main pollution sources include: slag, sewage water, smoke, and tail gas.	(1) 他们构想出处理空气污染的方案。 (2) 来自那家工厂的污水是当地河流污染的主要原因。 (3) 很多年轻人不能抵制精神污染。 (4) 主要污染物有矿渣，污水，烟气、尾气等。
pond n.池塘	(1) There are some reeds in the pond. (2) The deer lowered its head to drink from the pond. (3) The farm has a pond from which the cattle can drink. (4) The cattle had trodden a path to the pond. (5) Lotus flowers are in full bloom in the pond in summer. (6) She threw a stone into the pond and watched the ripples spread.	(1) 池塘里有些芦苇。 (2) 鹿低下头去喝池塘里的水。 (3) 农场有一个供牛饮水的池塘。 (4) 牛群踩出了一条通往池塘的小径。 (5) 夏季的水塘中，芙蓉盛开。 (6) 她把一块石头扔进池塘里,看着水的波纹扩散开。

port n.港口	(1) Rick often watched the boats returning to port in the late afternoon. (2) The priest blessed the ship before it left port.	(1) 瑞克常常看到小船在傍晚回到港口。 (2) 牧师在船离港之前为其祝福。

(4) The new portable computers are going like hot cakes.	(1) 这种轻便装置容易拆卸。 (2) 现今，移动电话非常普及。 (3) 她拿旱冰鞋换了比利的手提收音机。 (4) 新的便携式计算机卖得很快。
porter n.搬运工；（列车）服务员；杂务工 n.门卫 n.<旧>黑啤酒 Porter n.波特(人名)	(1) Did you remember to tip the porter? (2) The porter will carry your luggage to your room. (3) The porter was weighed down by all the luggage. (4) The porter ushered us into the wainitg room. (5) He once worked as porter in a commercial bank. (6) The hotel porter will call a taxi for you. (7) I had forgotten all about Mr. Porter. (1) 你记得给搬运工小费了吗？ (2) 搬运工会把你的行李搬到你的房间去的。 (3) 搬运工扛着这些行李压得直不起腰来。 (4) 服务员把我们引进了候车室。 (5) 他曾在一家商业银行当杂务工。 (6) 旅馆的门卫可以给你叫计程车。 (7) 我已经把波特先生忘得一干二净了。 (8) 波特如实地揭示了细胞结构的复杂性。

(4) He maintained his position. (5) He refused to back away from his position. (6) The company is in a difficult position now. (7) She positioned herself near the warm fire. (8) The integrated child seat is positioned behind the driver's seat. (9) They position the task by means of radar. (10) Market research can help a company to position its product. (3) She saw the possibilities of the scheme from the beginning. (4) We can't exclude the possibility that it will rain. (5) She thought of several possibilities. (6) The idea has tremendous possibilities.	(1) 我看这计划很可能成功。 (2) 我们必须承认，我们有可能搞错了。 (3) 她从一开始就预见到这计划可能成功。 (4) 我们不能排除天会下雨的可能性。 (5) 她考虑了几种可能的情况。 (6) 这个想法极具潜在价值。

(4) Have you seen their poster? (5) The poster had been ripped to pieces. (6) Her bedroom is covered with posters. (7) There are many posters in the big beautiful city.	(1) 海报上的字体非常醒目。 (2) 他贴了一张宣传马戏团的海报。 (3) 我涂了大量胶水，可那张海报就是贴不住。 (4) 你看到他们的广告牌了吗？ (5) 那张广告画已被撕得粉碎。 (6) 她的卧室里满是画片。 (7) 在这座美丽的大城市有很多急行的旅人。
postpone vt.延期；推迟	(1) The weather being bad, we had to postpone our trip. (2) She did not postpone her departure. (3) Can we postpone the meeting till tomorrow? (4) The commander decided to postpone the big push until the spring. (5) We agree to postpone the shipping date, considering (that) there is no steamer recently. (6) Our financial situation is still precarious if we postpone the release of the new product.	(1) 因为天气不好,我们不得不延期出行。 (2) 她不再延迟她的行期。 (3) 我们可以把会议延到明天吗? (4) 指挥官决定把大规模的进攻推迟到春天进行。 (5) 由于(考虑到)最近无船，我们同意推迟装期。 (6) 如果我们推迟发布新产品的话，我们的财政状况仍然岌岌可危。
pot n.罐；壶；一大笔(钱)；奖杯（尤指银杯）；<俚>大麻 v.把 ... 装罐；射猎；(台球)入袋	(1) Will you help me to wash up all these pots and pans? (2) She stayed up all night writing the paper with a pot of coffee at her elbow. (3) He has earned a pot of money.	(1) 帮我洗洗这些锅碗瓢盆好吗？ (2) 她熬了一整夜写论文,身边放着一壶咖啡。 (3) 他赚了一大笔钱。
potential adj.潜在的；可能的 n.潜力；潜能 n.电位；电势	(1) These potential effects must be studied carefully. (2) Aha! Now that 's something that has potential . (3) She has acting potential, but she needs training. (4) He hasn't realized his full potential yet. (5) We can only measure the difference between the potentials of two half cells when they are linked to form an electrochemical cell.	(1) 这些潜在的影响必须仔细地加以研究。 (2) 啊！ 现在这好像是很有可能的。 (3) 她有表演潜力，但需要训练。 (4) 他还没有意识到他的全部潜能。 (5) 当两个半电池连接形成一个化学电池时,我们仅能测定两个半电池之间电位的差值。

(5) I'm just going to powder my nose. (6) Actors powder with their left hands for luck.	(1) 硼砂是一种白色粉末。 (2) 你鼻子上的粉擦得太多了。 (3) 我上过战场。 (4) 你在犹他州滑过雪吗? (5) 我想去补补妆。 (6) 演员们为了讨吉利而用左手搽粉。
power n.力量；力；能力；权力；【数】幂；电力 v.使有力量；给 ... 提供动力 adj.电力的；力量的；权力的	(1) A man should rely upon his own power. (2) Such things aren't within the compass of my power. (3) I intend to release my karma to give power away. (4) The powers of the police need to be clearly defined. (5) So you need to power up your lymph system. (6) To power your camera you will need some rechargeable batteries. (7) She's gone to some power lunch to discuss the deal.	(1) 人类应该依靠自身的力量。 (2) 这些事不在我力可能及的范围之内。 (3) 我意愿释放我送给别人力量的业力。 (4) 必须对警方的权限作出明确的规定。 (5) 因此你需要增强淋巴系统的功能。 (6) 要为你的相机供电，你需要一些可充电电池。 (7) 她赴巨头午餐会商讨此事。
powerful adj.强有力的；强大的；有权的；强健的	(1) This defeat was a powerful blow to the enemy. (2) The elephant grinds its food with its powerful molars. (3) Russia used to be a very powerful country. (4) The chancellor is the most powerful man in the Austrian government.	(1) 这次失败是对敌人的有力的打击。 (2) 象用其强有力的臼齿嚼碎食物。 (3) 俄国曾是一个非常强大的国家。 (4) 首相是奥地利政府最有实权的人。
practical adj.明智的；实际的；实用的；事实上的 n.实践考试	(1) A practical person does not spend his money and time foolishly. (2) It's an interesting idea, but there are many practical difficulties. (3) Most importantly, we should develop our own practical ability. (4) Your invention is not practical. (5) His practical at the hospital went well enough.	(1) 一个有头脑的人是不胡乱花钱和虚度光阴的。 (2) 这是一个很有意思的想法,然而却存在着许多实际困难。 (3) 最重要的是,我们应该提高自身的实践能力。 (4) 你的发明不实用。 (5) 他在医院的实习进行得相当好。
prairie n.大草原	(1) The prairie is topped occasionally by low hills. (2) A cowboy fell off his horse and broke his leg on the prairie.	(1) 偶尔可见大草原上隆起几座低矮的小山。 (2) 一个牛仔在大草原上从马背上摔了下来，摔断了腿。

(4) Offer up praise and adoration to sb. (5) Mankind and womankind both like praise. (6) His heroism was beyond all praise.	(1) 老师赞扬了她的勇气。 (2) 客人们称赞这顿饭做得好. (3) 他因获得该奖而受到同事们的称赞。 (4) 颂扬并崇拜某人。 (5) 男人与女人都喜欢被赞美。 (6) 他的英勇行为使人赞美不尽。
pray v.祈祷；请求；恳求；祈求	(1) She prays to god to keep her son from harm. (2) They went to the mosque to pray. (3) I earnestly pray for your pardon. (4) I pray that you will have pity on my distress. (5) We pray you for mercy/to show mercy. (6) They prayed that their enemies might be defeated. (7) I'll pray to God for your safety. prayer n.祈祷；祷告；祷文；祈祷者	(1) She had a wakeful night spent in prayer. (2) The congregation in the church knelt in prayer. (3) I say my prayers every night before going to bed. (4) Her prayer answered and her son came home safely. (5) The Brethren hold a prayer meeting every Thursday. (6) She offered up a prayer to God for her husband's safe return. (7) And the whole building rocked with prayer and song. (8) The supreme prayer of my heart is not to be learned, rich, famous, powerful, or "good," but simply to be radiant.	(1) 她整夜祈祷。 (2) 教堂的会众跪下来祈祷。 (3) 每天晚上上床前，我都要祈祷。 (4) 她的祈祷应验了，儿子平安地回到了家。 (5) 教友每周四举行一次祷告会。 (6) 她向上帝祷告保佑她丈夫平安回来。 (7) 整个教堂在祈祷者的歌声中震荡着。 (8) 在我心里最虔诚的祈祷者不是博学的，富有的，有影响力的，或者好的，但是是容光焕发的。
precious adj.宝贵的；珍贵的；矫揉造作的 adv.极其 n.<口>宝贝，心爱的人	(1) You should make good use of every precious minute to study. (2) That old book is my most precious possession. (3) He is a rather precious young man. (4) Precious few people can afford prices like that.	(1) 你应很好利用宝贵的每一分钟去学习。 (2) 那本旧书是我最珍贵的财产。 (3) 他是一个惺惺作态的年轻男子。 (4) 没有什麽人出得起那个价钱。
precise adj.精确的；恰好的；准确的；严格的	(1) With the new technique, measurement was claimed to be much more precise. (2) At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step, the bus started. (3) I am not clear about the precise bearing of the word in this passage. (4) Precise employees are highly appreciated in our company.	(1) 有了这种技术,人们断言测量的结果会精确得多。 (2) 恰恰就在我登上公共汽车踏板的时候，车子开动了。 (3) 我说不准这个字在这段文章里的确切意义是什么。 (4) 我们公司十分欣赏工作态度严谨的员工。
predict v.预言；预报；预知；预测	(1) It is virtually impossible to predict the future accurately. (2) The economists predicted an increase in the rate of inflation. (3) The earthquake had been predicted several months before. (4) It is impossible to predict what will happen. (5) I can predict something with great accuracy.	(1) 精确预言未来的事实际上是办不到的。 (2) 经济学家预言通货膨胀率将会增长。 (3) 这次地震早在几个月以前就发布了预报。 (4) 预知未来的事是不可能的。 (5) 我能很准确地预测某事。
preference n.偏爱；优先；喜爱物；优惠	(1) She has a preference for blue. (2) It's entirely a matter of preference. (3) A polar bear has a preference for cold weather. (4) Her preference in foods is omelets. (5) What is your preference, tea or coffee? (6) We've granted that country special trade preferences.	(1) 她特别喜欢蓝色。 (2) 这完全是个见仁见智的问题。 (3) 北极熊喜欢寒冷的天气。 (4) 她喜爱的食物是煎蛋卷。 (5) 咖啡和茶,你最喜欢哪一样？ (6) 我们给了那个国家特殊的贸易优惠。
pregnant adj.怀孕的；充满的；意味深长的	(1) How long has she been pregnant? (2) She got pregnant and was turned out of the house by her parents. (3) Women who do not ovulate regularly have difficulty in becoming pregnant. (4) He is a man pregnant with ideas. (5) His only reaction was a pregnant silence. (6) His words were followed by a pregnant pause.	(1) 她怀孕多久了？ (2) 她怀孕了，父母把她赶出了家门。 (3) 妇女排卵期不正常就不易受孕。 (4) 他是一个思想丰富的人。 (5) 他唯一的反应是一阵意味深长的沉默 (6) 他说完话，接着是一段意味深长的停顿。
prejudice n.偏见；伤害 vt.伤害；使 ... 存偏见；使偏袒	(1) She has a prejudice against modern music. (2) A judge must be free from prejudice. (3) The offer was accepted without prejudice to the current pay negotiations. (4) A new law has been brought in to discourage racial prejudice. (5) We can't do the prejudice of your rights. (6) Her charm prejudiced the judges in her favour. (7) His pleasant voice and manner prejudiced the jury in his favor. (8) Her charm prejudiced the judges in her favour.	(1) 她对现代音乐怀有偏见。 (2) 法官必须不抱成见。 (3) 该提议获得接纳，但对目前正在进行的工资谈判并无影响。 (4) 一项反对种族歧视的新法律已被提出。 (5) 我们不能做有损你权益的事。 (6) 她姿色迷人，因而评委都偏向她。 (7) 他那令人愉快的声音和举止使陪审团对他产生了偏心。 (8) 她姿色迷人，因而评委都偏向她。

(4) His work on the cause of the diseases is of premier importance to the whole world. (5) The company has achieved a premier position in the electronics field. (3) Prepare to alight,for we are almost there. (4) Peel the pineapples and I will prepare the pineapple pie.	(1) 早年对军用火箭进行的实验为发展航天技术奠定了基础。 (2) 他正准备明天集会的演说。 (3) 我们马上就要到了 (4) 你把菠萝皮削了,我来准备菠萝派。

(4) His prescription for economic recovery was not well received.	(1) 医生正在开处方。 (2) 医生开处方给病人配药。 (3) 开药方是医生的职责。 (4) 他为经济复苏提出的对策反应不佳。

(4) He gave a presentation on drug abuse.	(1) 艾米做的介绍是关于她的猫的。 (2) 我们想送她一件礼物以庆贺她的纪念日。 (3) 我必须在会议中作重要报告。 (4) 他开办了一场关于毒品滥用的讲座。

(4) The native bankers grew weaker under pressure from the bureaucrats. (5) Now you are trying to pressure me. (6) Don't be pressured into making any rash decisions. (4) Surely he doesn't pretend to any understanding of music!	(1) 她假装很喜欢他们，借以获得他们的帮助。 (2) 那个年轻演员扮演哈姆雷特。 (3) 她闭上眼睛,装作睡着了。 (4) 谅他不会自以为懂得什麽音乐吧！

(7) The new car was the pride of the whole family. (8) He prides himself on remaining calm in an emergency. (8) Collins was nosed out by his opponent in the primary. (9) Nowadays, technology has become the primary factor in the economy development and many people begin to question Marx's theory on labor value. (10) These are created by combining the primary colors. (11) "(actors, singers, etc.) perform for outside salary income without approval by the unit they belong to" (12) In one way, primary and secondary coils are wound around the space. (13) An electric transformer changes the alternating voltage applied to it in proportion to the numbers of turns in its primary and secondary windings.	(1) 社会主义的首要任务是发展社会生产力。 (2) 另一个主要原因是私家车过多而公交车不够。 (3) 欧洲市场对初级产品的需求在增长。 (4) 小学教育受地方政府的保护。 (5) 这是人类认识发展的根源。 (6) 处于初期阶段的疾病发生时没有明显的外在症状。 (7) 我们应将发展放在执政兴国中的第一位。 (8) 柯林斯在初选中就被他的对手击败了。 (9) 摘要当今世界，科技已成为推动经济的第一要素，不少人开始对马克思的劳动价值论提出质疑。 (10) 这些颜色通过混合原色形成。 (11) 走穴 (12) 有一种方法是把初级线圈和次级线圈绕在这个地方。 (13) 变压器其交变电压的改变与初级线圈及其次级线圈的匝数成正比。
primary school 小学	(1) Sure. We are friends since primary school. (2) The little boy left primary school at eleven.	(1) 当然，我们从小学就是朋友了。 (2) 这个小男孩十一岁时小学毕业。

(3) We adhere to the principle that everyone should be treated fairly. (4) It is easier to fight for one's principle than to live up to them. (5) He refused to attend the meeting on principle. (2) The most probable discipline for its use is chemical engineering, but it can also be used in materials science, fuels science, and chemistry programs. (7) The visitors processed into the house. (8) The bishops, priests and deacons processed into the cathedral. (3) The eastern frontier of France was the product of centuries of historical accidents. (4) They are the products of post-war affluence. (5) The product of 21 and 16 is 336. (3) If we cannot sell more goods, we'll have to cut back on the production. (4) This book on education is his latest production. (5) Chapter five is the conclusion .In this part , research production is summarized. (6) The company entered into motion picture production in1897. (4) The legal profession has always resisted change. (5) That's why our profession of faith is hollow if we are not caring for our own family. (3) It is well known that fake and inferior commodities do harm to the profit of consumers. (4) We profit from the work of the specialist. (5) He learned to profit by his mistakes. (6) Knowing what you know and profit from it. (7) All his wealth did not profit him. (3) The news programme overran the allotted time. (4) The purpose of the programme is primarily educational. (5) The school building programme postulates an increase in educational investment. (6) The programme will continue in the coming school year. (7) You haven't been paying attention to the programme. (8) Human beings are genetically programmed to learn certain kinds of language. (9) You can programme it to do different tasks at specific times. (10) The video is programmed to switch on at ten o'clock.	(1) 政府已开始实施经济改革方案。 (2) 我们现在用的是一套新的质保程序。 (3) 新闻节目超出了规定的时间。 (4) 演出该节目的主要目的是为了进行教育。 (5) 修建校舍的规划是在增加教育经费的前提下拟定的。 (6) 该课程会在新学年续办。 (7) 你刚才一直没有注意这个程序。 (8) 人类生来有学习某几种语言的遗传因素。 (9) 你可以使它在特定时间按计划完成各项不同的任务。 (10) 电视机设定在10点钟自动打开。
prohibit vt.禁止；妨碍	(1) Smoking is prohibited here. (2) We should prohibit the sale of pornographic literature. (3) Some areas prohibit dogs or require them to be on a leash at all times. (4) Rainy weather and fog prohibited flying. (5) I fear that a prior engagement will prohibit me from joining you in dinner.	(1) 这里禁止吸烟。 (2) 我们应该禁止出售淫秽文学。 (3) 一些区域禁止狗或者要求一直拴住它们。 (4) 雨天和大雾妨碍了飞行。 (5) 有约在先，我恐怕不能与你共进晚餐。
project n.计划；工程；项目；课题；专题研究；住房工程 v.计划；预计；设计；放映；投射；表达；突出；投掷	(1) Our project was scrubbed. (2) They doubted of the feasibility of the project. (3) The project is proceeding as planned. (4) We are discussing the project to establish a new national park (5) We launched a new project. (6) This research project is of great worth. (7) I'm doing a project on Chinese history. (8) The final term will be devoted to project work. (9) The government projected a tax decrease. (10) Our projected visit had to be cancelled. (11) The unemployment rate has been projected to fall. (12) The engineers projected a new machine. (13) The film was projected onto the screen. (14) Images are projected onto the retina of the eye. (15) The campaign has tried to project a view of the party that is acceptable to the most people. (16) His ears project noticeably. (17) Candidates try to project a strong leadership image. (18) An actor must learn to project (his voice).	(1) 我们的计划被取消了。 (2) 他们怀疑这个计划的可行性。 (3) 工程正在按计划进行。 (4) 我们正在讨论建立一个新的国家公园的工程。 (5) 我们开始从事一个新项目。 (6) 这一研究项目很有价值。 (7) 我正在做一个有关中国历史的研究课题。 (8) 最后一学期的时间将全部用于专题研究。 (9) 政府计划降低税收。 (10) 我们计划中的访问不得不取消。 (11) 据预测失业率将下降。 (12) 工程师们设计一台新机器。 (13) 电影放映在银幕上。 (14) 影像被投射到眼睛的视网膜上。 (15) 竞选游说团试图表达一个让大多数人易于接受的党派观点。 (16) 他的耳朵明显突出。 (17) 候选人都尽力突出表现一种强有力的领导的形象。 (18) 演员必须学习（使声音）扩及远处的发声法.
promise n.诺言；预示；约定；(有)希望 v.允诺；发誓；答应；有希望	(1) Once he made a promise, he would stick to it. (2) I have committed myself and must keep my promise. (3) I don't trust his promise to come for a visit. (4) For her family, life seemed to have no promise. (5) I promise never to reveal his secret. (6) I promise never to lie to you from now on. (7) I promise to return your bicycle on good condition. (8) Dropping ears of rice promise another good harvest.	(1) 他一旦许下诺言,就坚守这个诺言。 (2) 我已经作出了承诺,必须信守我的诺言。 (3) 我不相信他会如约前来访问。 (4) 对她家而言,生活没有任何希望。 (5) 我答应决不泄漏他的秘密。 (6) 我发誓从今以后再也不向你说谎话。 (7) 我答应一定完好无损地还你的自行车。 (8) 沈甸甸的稻穗预示著又一次丰收。
promote vt.促进；提升；升迁；发起；促销，推销	(1) They discussed how to promote cooperation between the two countries. (2) He has been promoted to general manager. (3) He failed to get promoted for lack of resolution. (4) He promoted a campaign to remind the public of protecting the wildlife.	(1) 他们讨论如何促进两国间的合作。 (2) 他已被提升为总经理。 (3) 他因缺乏果断力而未能得到升迁。 (4) 他发起了一项旨在提醒人们保护野生动物的活动。
pronounce vt.发音；宣告；宣判；断言 vi.发音；发表意见	(1) I don't know how to pronounce this word. (2) People pronounce the word differently in this part of the country. (3) The doctors pronounced that he was no longer in danger. (4) The court pronounced her innocent of all charges. (5) The general pronounced that the fortress was impregnable. (6) He has every right to pronounce on this matter.	(1) 我不知道这个单词怎么发音。 (2) 在国内这一地区，这个单词的发音不同。 (3) 医生宣称他已脱离危险。 (4) 法庭宣判所有的对她指控撤销。 (5) 将军断言那座要塞是攻不下的。 (6) 他完全有权利对这件事发表意见。
pronunciation n.发音；读音	(1) His pronunciation is simply terrible. (2) Your faults of pronunciation can be remedied. (3) He learns pronunciation by imitating the teacher. (4) He forgot the pronunciation of this word. (5) You should look up the right pronunciation of this word in the dictionary.	(1) 他的发音太糟了。 (2) 你的发音毛病是可以纠正的。 (3) 他是向老师模仿来学习发音的。 (4) 他把这个字的读音忘了。 (5) 你应该查字典找出这个单词的正确读音。
proper adj.合适的；正当的；真正的	(1) He could not come up with a proper answer. (2) It's not proper for you to catch him up very short. (3) The company does not take proper fire precaution. (4) She hadn't had a proper holiday for years.	(1) 他想不出一个合适的回答。 (2) 你突然打断他的话是不恰当的。 (3) 公司未采取正当的防火措施。 (4) 多年来她都没有过真正的假期。
properly adv.适当地；正确地；完全地	(1) He has disposed of the rubbish properly. (2) The heater in my car doesn't work properly. (3) The allegations were never properly investigated.	(1) 他已经适当地处理了垃圾。 (2) 我汽车里的暖气设备出了点毛病。 (3) 指控永远不会被彻底调查。
protection n.保护；防卫	(1) He's devoted his whole life to the protection of the rare animals. (2) She put on dark glasses as a protection against the strong light. (3) She subscribes to an animal protection society. (4) They lobbied on the environmental protection issue. (5) The settlers banded together for protection.	(1) 他终生献身于珍稀动物的保护。 (2) 她戴上墨镜以防强光的照射。 (3) 她捐款给一个动物保护协会。 (4) 他们就环境保护问题在议员中进行了游说。 (5) 移民联合起来保护自己。
prove v.证明；检验；结果是；发酵	(1) There wasn't enough evidence to prove him guilty. (2) He has proved his courage in the battle. (3) Leave the dough to prove for half an hour. (4) She may prove to be the most suitable person for the job. (5) The old methods proved best after all. (6) Leave the dough to prove for half an hour.	(1) 没有充分的证据证明他有罪。 (2) 他已在这场战斗中证明了自己的勇气。 (3) 让面团发酵半小时。 (4) 她结果可能是最适合干这工作的人。 (5) 采用老方法结果反而是某事物最好。 (6) 让面团发酵半小时。
psychology n.心理；心理学	(1) I can't understand that man's psychology. (2) She had no personal life and no private psychology. (3) Many people failed in the psychology test. (4) This is fluky psychology, also be pure belong to accidental. (5) Displeased that he assumes surface, in fact the pleased ground of psychology. (6) The national psychology greatly bars the cooperation of the two countries. (7) I am always interested in psychology. (8) She had an undergraduate degree in psychology. (9) My major is linguistic psychology. (10) She is the dean of the psychology department.	(1) 我无法理解那个人的心理。 (2) 她没有个人的生活和隐秘的心理活动。 (3) 很多人在心理测试环节被淘汰。 (4) 这是侥幸心理，亦是纯属偶然。 (5) 他表面装出不乐意,其实心理美滋滋地。 (6) 民族的心理因素大大阻碍了这两个民族的合作。 (7) 我一直对心理学感兴趣。 (8) 她有心理学的学士学位。 (9) 我的专业是语言心理学。 (10) 她是心理学系的系主任。
pub n.酒吧；酒馆	(1) I ran into an old friend in a pub. (2) We make our ritual visit to the pub. (3) I passed the pub on my way to the library. (4) There is a dreadful shindy in the pub last night.	(1) 我在酒吧碰到了一位老朋友。 (2) 我们照例去了酒吧。 (3) 我在去图书馆的路上经过了那个酒馆。 (4) 昨天晚上酒馆里有人大打出手。
publicly adv.公开地；公然地；以公众名义	(1) Extra shares of common will be sold publicly. (2) The list will be announced publicly. (3) Artists, writers, composers, and others publicly condemned the structure as monstrosity.	(1) 额外的普通股份将公开出售。 (2) 名单将会公开宣读。 (3) 艺术家、作家、作曲家等人公然把该建筑指责为巨型怪物。
publish v.出版；发行；公开发表	(1) Her book was published last year. (2) Oxford University Press will publish a new magazine. (3) Prime minister will publish the broadcasting speech this evening. (4) Only in 1687 did he at last publish his new theory.	(1) 她的书去年出版了。 (2) 牛津大学出版社将发行新杂志。 (3) 首相将于今晚发表广播演说。 (4) 终于在一六八七年他发表了他的新理论。
pulse n.脉搏；脉冲；[植]豆类 v.搏动；跳动	(1) His pulse is not very regular. (2) The excitement quickened my pulse. (3) I could feel a fluttering pulse. (4) The machine emits sound pulses. (5) I could feel blood pulsing through my veins. (6) He is now used to the life pulsing through a great city (7) His heart began to pulse faster.	(1) 他的脉搏不很规则。 (2) 激动使我的心跳加快。 (3) 我感到脉搏跳动。 (4) 这台机器可发出声脉冲信号。 (5) 我感到浑身血液在沸腾。 (6) 他现在习惯了大都市里紧张繁忙的生活。 (7) 他的心开始加快地跳动起来。
pump n.泵；抽水机；打气筒；抽水；打气 v.打气；唧筒般运动；灌输；抽取；增加；<口>盘问	(1) The heart has acted as a strong pump. (2) At the farm there was an old-fashioned pump for drawing water from a well. (3) Can you lend me your bicycle pump? (4) After several pumps, the water began to flow. (5) She blow up the flat tyre with a bicycle pump. (6) Pump the tire up hard before going out on the road. (7) His heart was pumping fast. (8) It's hard work to pump facts into unwilling students. (9) It is autumn and they are pumping water out of the swimming pool. (10) They have cut prices in an attempt to pump up sales.	(1) 心脏充当了一部强有力的泵。 (2) 那个农场有一台老式的用来从井里抽水的抽水机。 (3) 能把你的打气筒借给我吗？ (4) 用泵抽了几下之后,水流出来了。 (5) 她用自行车打气筒给瘪了的轮胎打气。 (6) 在出去上路之前, 要把轮胎打足气。 (7) 他的心脏跳动得很快。 (8) 向不自觉的学生灌输知识并非易事。 (9) 入秋了, 他们正在抽游泳池的水。 (10) 为了增加销售量他们减价销售。
punctual adj.准时的；严守时刻的；正点的	(1) My cat makes a punctual appearance at mealtimes. (2) Please be punctual in futurity. (3) He likes his guests to be punctual. (4) Not being punctual is his greatest shortcoming. (5) The Chinese are always punctual. (6) He's very punctual always arrives on the dot.	(1) 我的猫一到用餐时间就会准时出现。 (2) 今后请准时。 (3) 他喜欢客人守时。 (4) 不守时间是他的最大缺点。 (5) 中国人历来是十分守时的。 (6) 他很守时--总是按时到。
punctuate v.加标点于；强调；不时打断	(1) The transcription of his speech must be punctuated. (2) The children have not yet learned to punctuate correctly. (3) He made gestures to punctuate his speech. (4) The announcement was punctuated by cheers from the crowd. (5) He punctuated his remarks with thumps on the table.	(1) 他的讲话文本得加上标点符号。 (2) 这些小学生尚未学会正确使用标点符号。 (3) 他打手势来强调他的讲话。 (4) 在宣布过程中，群众的欢呼声此起彼伏。 (5) 他讲话时不时地捶着桌子。
punctuation n.标点；强调	(1) Beginners should learn the punctuation well. (2) Our teacher is very fussy about punctuation. (3) Our teacher has a bee in his bonnet about punctuation. (4) Now, let's begin to learn punctuation.	(1) 初学者应该把标点学好。 (2) 我们的老师对标点符号非常重视。 (3) 我们的老师没完没了地琢磨著标点符号。 (4) 那么，我们开始学习标点。
punish vt.惩罚；粗暴对待 vi.处罚	(1) The teacher blazoned she would punish the bad student. (2) Their teacher punished them for their rudeness. (3) Dangerous driving should be severely punished. (4) The teacher warned them that she would punish anyone who stepped out of line. (5) She was always reluctant to punish her opponent. (6) I have a mind to punish you for stealing a cookie. (7) We wonder whom the teacher is going to punish.	(1) 老师宣布她将惩罚那个坏学生。 (2) 老师因为他们态度粗鲁而责罚他们。 (3) 危险驾驶应受严惩。 (4) 老师警告他们说谁要不守规矩就罚谁。 (5) 她总是不情愿地粗暴对待她的对手。 (6) 我有意要处罚你偷饼干。 (7) 我们极想知道老师要处罚谁。
punishment n.惩罚	(1) He has received a just punishment. (2) Punishment had very little effect on him.	(1) 他已受到应得的惩罚。 (2) 惩罚对他没有什么效果。
purchase vt.购买 n.购买；购买的物品	(1) She purchased a number of shares in the company. (2) Tickets must be purchased two weeks in advance. (3) The receipt is your proof of purchase. (4) The house is the most expensive purchase I have ever made.	(1) 她在公司里买了一些股票。 (2) 票必须提前两周买。 (3) 这张发票是你购物的凭据. (4) 房子是我买过的最贵的东西。
pure adj.纯的；纯洁的；纯粹的	(1) Water can be made pure by distilling it. (2) They are all made of one-hundred percent pure silk. (3) Life is a sweet thing for one who has a pure conscience. (4) It's pure nonsense. (5) They met each other by pure accident.	(1) 水可以通过蒸馏而提纯。 (2) 它们都是用100%的纯丝绸做成的。 (3) 对于善良纯洁的人来说,生活是一件美好的事情。 (4) 那是一派胡言。 (5) 他们相见纯属偶然。
purpose n.目的；决心；意图；议题 v.打算；决意	(1) What is the purpose of your visit? (2) He was a man of purpose. (3) What is the purpose of this meeting? (4) He purposed to visit South America. (5) We purpose making another trial / to make another trial. (6) I purpose that next year I will go to Hong Kong .	(1) 你来访的目的是什么？ (2) 他是一个意志坚强的人 (3) 这次会议的议题是什么？ (4) 他计划去南美。 (5) 我们打算再试一下。 (6) 我意欲明年去香港。
puzzle n.难题；谜；迷惑；拼图游戏 vt.使为难；使困惑 vi.苦思；迷惑	(1) Will you help me to solve this puzzle? (2) He sat frowning over a crossword puzzle. (3) Her decision was a puzzle to him. (4) She could not get the puzzle out of her mind. (5) He is in a puzzle about the matter. (6) The question puzzled me. (7) I've never been able to puzzle her out. (8) I have in mind some doubts which really puzzle me. (9) I saw him puzzle over a math problem. (10) She listened with a puzzled expression on her face.	(1) 你能帮助我解决这个难题吗? (2) 他坐着皱着眉头在思考纵横字谜。 (3) 她的决定对他来说是个谜。 (4) 她无法解开心中的疑虑。 (5) 他对这件事大惑不解。 (6) 这个问题把我难住了。 (7) 我一直对她捉摸不透。 (8) 我心中有一个疑团, 百思不得其解。 (9) 我看见他正在苦心思索一道数学题。 (10) 她脸上带著困惑的表情在倾听。
puzzled adj.困惑的；迷惑的 动词puzzle的过去式和过去分词.	(1) She listened with a puzzled expression on her face. (2) Due to their puzzling nightmares the villagers have felt puzzled recently. (3) He looked at my puzzled expression. (4) The puzzled look on his face made us puzzling.	(1) 她脸上带著困惑的表情在倾听。 (2) 因为困惑的梦魇，村民们最近都感觉疑惑。 (3) 他看我迷惑的表情。 (4) 他脸上迷惑的样子令我们感到迷惑。
pyramid n.金字塔；棱锥体；[证券]金字塔式交易法 v.急速增加；以金字塔的模型构建	(1) Egypt is famous for its grand pyramid. (2) Lagrange is the lofty pyramid of mathematical sciences. (3) A pyramid provides a useful conceptual model for organizing scientific knowledge.	(1) 埃及以巨大的金字塔闻名。 (2) 拉格朗日是数学科学中高耸的金字塔。 (3) 金字塔给科学知识的组织提供了一个有用的概念性模型。
quake v.震动；颤抖 n.震动；地震	(1) The ground quaked under his feet. (2) I stood there quaking with fear. (3) The sound of quake is very terrible. (4) There were four major quakes in this century. (5) The earth quake shut many factories down.	(1) 大地在他的脚下震动。 (2) 我站在那里，害怕得直发抖。 (3) 震动的声音很吓人。 (4) 本世纪有四次大的地震。 (5) 地震使好多工厂停业。
qualification n.资格；限制；资历	(1) What sort of qualifications do you need for the job? (2) He's got all the right qualifications but he is temperamentally unsuitable. (3) The plan was approved without qualification. (4) I welcome the amendment to the bill without qualification. (5) What is your highest education qualification?	(1) 做这项工作需要什么资格？ (2) 他具备一切合格的条件,惟独性情不适合。 (3) 这项计划获得无条件批准。 (4) 我不带任何条件地接受这项法令的修正案。 (5) 你的最高学历是什么?
quality n.品质；才能；特质 adj.高品质的；<英俚>棒极了	(1) He examined the quality of the furniture carefully. (2) Her most essential quality is kindness. (3) What are the qualities that mark a great leader ? (4) Even the best quality rubber will perish with age. (5) "What was the film like?""Quality!"	(1) 他仔细检查家俱的品质。 (2) 她最主要的品质是善良。 (3) 伟大领袖的特质是什么? (4) 就是最佳质量的橡胶也会因老化而腐烂。 (5) “这部电影怎么样？”“棒极了！”
quantity n.量；数量；大量	(1) This company is more concerned with quality than with quantity. (2) He ate a small quantity of rice. (3) It was a bad year for films, in terms of both quantity and quality. (4) In our work quality counts for as much as quantity. (5) The factory turns out a large quantity of paper products.	(1) 这家公司对质量比对产量更重视。 (2) 他吃了少量的米饭。 (3) 今年的电影无论从数量上还是质量上都说不上好。 (4) 在我们的工作中，质量跟数量同等重要。 (5) 这家工厂生产大量的纸制品。
queen n.王后；女王	(1) The queen consort has come together with the king. (2) They were bowing as the king and queen walking in. (3) The Pope was present at the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. (4) They saluted the Queen by firing ten guns. (5) The Queen was flanked by a retinue of bodyguards and policemen. (6) The queen ruled her kingdom wisely. (7) The queen was gracious enough to invite us.	(1) 王后也随同国王前来。 (2) 当国王和王后进来时他们屈膝致敬。 (3) 教皇参加了伊丽莎白二世的加冕礼。 (4) 他们鸣礼炮十响向女王致敬。 (5) 女王左右有保镖和警察护卫着。 (6) 女王英明地统治着她的王国。 (7) 女王亲切地邀请了我们。
questionnaire n.调查表；问卷	(1) We gave them some questionnaires for collecting data. (2) Please fill up the blanks in the questionnaire. (3) Please complete and return the enclosed questionnaire. (4) Is a questionnaire answered by 500 people truly representative of national opinion?	(1) 为了收集数据我们发给他们一些调查表。 (2) 请把调查表填写一下。 (3) 所附问卷请填妥交回。 (4) 一份调查问卷有500人作答,是否能真正代表全国人民的意见?
quilt n.被状物；被子 v.缝被；缝制；用垫料填塞	(1) He bought a heavy quilt for the winter. (2) He wake to find that his quilt have slip off the bed. (3) If you air your quilt on such a wet day, it'll soak up the moisture.	(1) 他买了一床厚被子过冬。 (2) 他醒来发现被子从床上滑下来了。 (3) 如果在这么潮湿的天晒被子，被子就会把湿气都吸去。
quit v.停止；离开；退出；辞职	(1) You must quit smoking. Most important of all, you should start taking exercise. (2) They have to quit China in a few days. (3) The guard did not quit his post all night long. (4) Some students quit school due to poverty. (5) He quit in disgrace over the bribe.	(1) 你必须戒烟，更重要的是，你该开始运动。 (2) 他们必须在几天之内离开中国。 (3) 那个哨兵整夜都没有离开他的哨位。 (4) 一些学生因贫困而辍学。 (5) 他因受贿而不光彩地辞职了。
quiz n.恶作剧；测验；问答比赛 v.盘问；对 ... 进行测验	(1) I hate the quiz someone made. (2) We will have a quiz tomorrow morning. (3) He asked us to prepare for a quiz. (4) Match your skill against the experts in this quiz. (5) Have you entered your name for the quiz yet? (6) The Cambridge team were too much for the Oxford team in the quiz. (7) Four men are being quizzed by police about the murder. (8) The students were quizzed on history. (9) You will be quizzed on chapter 6 tomorrow.	(1) 我讨厌别人搞恶作剧。 (2) 我们明天早晨进行一个小测验。 (3) 他要我们准备好测验。 (4) 在这一测验中你与专家较量一下技巧吧。 (5) 你申请参加这次问答比赛了吗? (6) 在智力竞赛中，剑桥队远胜牛津队。 (7) 警察就这起谋杀案正在盘问四个男子。 (8) 对学生进行了历史测验。 (9) 明天将考你们第6章。
racial adj.种族的；人种的	(1) We should not have racial discrimination. (2) This hatred was generated by racial prejudice. (3) Genuine racial equality still seems light-years away. (4) A new law has been brought in to discourage racial prejudice. (5) The racial discrimination issue is a political hot potato. (6) Moreover, the final achievement "would signify the racial decline of its founders", presumably as a result of racial mixing.	(1) 我们不该有种族歧视。 (2) 这种仇恨是由种族偏见引起的。 (3) 真正的种族平等似乎仍遥遥无期。 (4) 一项反对种族歧视的新法律已被提出。 (5) 种族歧视问题是政治上的棘手问题。 (6) 而最终的成功必会导致该创始者种族的倒退，结果很可能使人种的杂合。
radiation n.辐射；放射线	(1) Radiation reached unheard-of levels. (2) The most terrifying aspect of nuclear bombing is radiation. (3) In the accident, the workers received a heavy dose of radiation. (4) The news of the radiation leak caused widespread public alarm. (5) The body cannot tolerate such large amounts of radiation. (6) The mutations in plants caused by radiation have been found in experiments.	(1) 辐射作用已达到前所未有的程度。 (2) 核弹轰炸最可怕的一面是辐射。 (3) 在这次事故中，工人受到大剂量的辐射。 (4) 辐射泄露的消息引起了公众的普遍恐慌。 (5) 身体经不住那么大剂量的放射线。 (6) 放射线引起植物变异已在实验中被证实。
radioactive adj.放射性的	(1) Radioactive ray is material thing. (2) Radium and uranium are radioactive elements. (3) Radioactive waste must be stored on land.	(1) 放射线是实际的物质。 (2) 镭和铀是放射性元素。 (3) 有放射性的废物都必须存放在陆地上。
radium n.[化]镭（元素符号Ra）	(1) Radium and uranium are radioactive elements. (2) Madame Curie discovered the element radium.	(1) 镭和铀是放射性元素。 (2) 居里夫人发现了镭元素。
rag n.破布；碎布；破衣服；（低劣的）报纸	(1) She twisted a rag round my hand. (2) He plugged the hole in the pipe with an old rag. (3) He wrapped a clean rag around his ankle. (4) It's just an old rag I had in the closet. (5) Why do you read that worthless rag? (6) I like it much better than the local rag.	(1) 她用一块破布包住我的手。 (2) 他用一块旧破布把管子上的那个洞塞住了。 (3) 他把一小块乾净的布缠住脚腕。 (4) 这只不过是我挂在壁橱里的旧衣服罢了。 (5) 你为什么看这种没有价值的报纸? (6) 它比地方报纸好多了。

(4) We saw a beautiful rainbow across the sky. (5) He is chasing the rainbow of overnight success.	(1) 你看到彩虹了吗？ (2) 大雨之后常有彩虹。 (3) 在未来岁月里，让我们在记忆的长虹里永远珍藏对他的怀念。 (4) 我们看到了一条五彩缤纷的虹横贯天空。 (5) 他追寻一夜成功的梦。

(5) Changes in climate affected the amount of rainfall. (6) Excessive rainfall had made the harvest impossible.	(1) 一场雨使马路上的尘埃落定。 (2) 今天清晨又下了一场雨。 (3) 这个地区雨量稀少。 (4) 年降雨量平均为36英寸。 (5) 气候变化影响了降雨量。 (6) 雨量过多，丰收已经不可能了。

(2) The first thing that we did when we conquered the town was to haul down the enemy's flag and raise our own. (3) The guesture might come from Rome, when people raise the right hand to show their extolling and respect for the empire. (4) Many western countries raise and butcher a large number of beef cattle. (5) I had asked everyone to raise questions in advance of the meeting. (6) I wonder how he actually plucked up his nerve to raise that ridiculous question. (7) Your speech and action will raise Cain. (8) These two-way TV systems raise serious questions about privacy.	(1) 薪水的提高比率和物价的上升一致。 (2) 我们占领这座城市以后以后所做的第一件事就是降下城里敌人的旗帜，升起我们自己的旗帜。 (3) 这一手势有可能来自罗马,那时人们将右臂举起以表示对帝王的称颂或敬意。 (4) 许多西方国家饲养并屠宰大量的肉牛。 (5) 我要求大家在会议前提出问题。 (6) 我奇怪他怎会有胆量提出那个可笑的问题。 (7) 你的言行会引起骚乱。 (8) 这些双向电视系统将引起保密方面的严重问题。
random adj.任意的；随机的；随意的 n.随意；任意 adv.随机地	(1) Men are exposed to more acts of random physical violence. (2) Most people know that the outcome of a coin toss is random. (3) The computer will generate apparently random numbers. (4) This random approach is not as dubious as one might expect. (5) Soiled dishes were piled at random. (6) The librarian took a book at random from the shelf. (7) These fluctuations are random in nature. (8) This paper proposes a method of interference suppression for a random planar array. (9) Complex organs made up of separate but necessary subsystems cannot be the result of random chance.	(1) 男人受到更多的任意的身体强烈活动。 (2) 大部分人都知道掷硬币的结果是随机的。 (3) 电脑似乎将随机产生号码。 (4) 这种随意的途径并不象人们所预期的那样无把握。 (5) 脏碟子胡乱地堆放着。 (6) 图书管理员从书架上随便拿了一本书。 (7) 这种波动的性质是任意随机的。 (8) 本文提出一种任意平面阵列抑制干扰的方法。 (9) 复杂的器官是由独立的，必要的子系统组成，而且不能随机地形成。
range n.范围；射程；山脉；排；一系列；闲逛；炉灶；【数】值域，极差 v.排列；使…站在某一方；延伸；漫游；射程达到(某距离)	(1) The houses are sold out within this price range. (2) It has come within the range of practical politics. (3) He used a whistle to decoy the birds within range. (4) She is still within range of my gun. (5) A range of hills rose on our left. (6) Name one large mountain range in the United States. (7) There is a fine range here in this book. (8) Here we have a range of products, our toys. (9) She takes her dog for a range every afternoon. (10) Gas is escaping from the range. (11) The shabby houses used to range along the road. (12) The spectators ranged themselves along the route of the procession. (13) On this issue, she has ranged herself with the Opposition. (14) The children's ages range from 8 to 15. (15) Our conversation ranged over many topics. (16) We ranged the woods looking for a place to set up our tents. (17) This rifle ranges over a mile.	(1) 在这个价位范围之内的房子已售完。 (2) 这就属于可实施性政治的范围了。 (3) 他用口哨把鸟群诱至射程内。 (4) 她仍在我枪炮的射程之内。 (5) 山脉在我们左方出现。 (6) 说出美国其中一个大山脉。 (7) 这本小册子里记有一系列上等货。 (8) 我们这儿有一系列的产品，我们的玩具。 (9) 她每天下午牵着狗闲逛。 (10) 瓦斯从瓦斯炉灶漏出。 (11) 过去这路边破败的房子排成行。 (12) 观众沿游行队伍的路线列队停立。 (13) 在这个问题上，她站在反对派一边。 (14) 这些孩子们的年龄在8岁到15岁之间。 (15) 我们的谈话涉及很多话题。 (16) 我们在树林里东走西跑，找个地方搭帐篷。 (17) 这种步枪射程达一英里。

(5) The student is showing rapid progress in his studies. (6) The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent. (7) The first rapid we went through was the easiest. (6) Her performance did not rate very high in the competition. (7) The novel was rated a brilliant performance. (8) His house was rated at one million. (9) He was rated as a midshipman. (10) That joke didn't rate a laugh.	(1) 房价比通货膨胀上涨的比率高。 (2) 出生率是出生数与人口数的比率。 (3) 物价以极快的速度不断上涨。 (4) 你们报纸的广告价格是多少? (6) She was always ready to catch people on the raw and hold them up to ridicule.	(1) 我们从马来西亚进口生胶。 (2) 你要把蔬菜煮熟还是生吃？ (3) 这个工厂经常原料不足。 (4) 她把她所遇见的人们作为她创作小说的素材。 (5) 这天真冷!我觉得很不舒服。 (6) 她专爱揭短处, 挑人长相。

(3) X ray is increasingly used in industry as well. (4) Besides, a global ray-tube tracing method is presented, which is to trace the global wave tubes instead of the many small ray tubes for simulating wave propagations in urban areas. (7) Ray take a gulp of coffee and rushed out of the room. (8) As time went on,his intelligence rayed out more brightly. (9) Besides, a global ray-tube tracing method is presented, which is to trace the global wave tubes instead of the many small ray tubes for simulating wave propagations in urban areas. razor n.剃刀	(1) He shaved his face with a razor. (2) He was honing his razor although it's very sharp. (3) This electric razor is our latest promotion.	(1) 他用剃刀刮脸。 (2) 尽管他的剃刀十分锋利了，可他还是不停地磨它。 (3) 这种电剃刀是我们的最新产品。
react v.反应；反攻	(1) Iron reacts with water and air to produce rust. (2) She reacted to the insult by turning her back on him. (3) How did they react to your suggestion? (4) An acid can react with a base to form a salt. (5) The British would never react militarily to the invasion of the islands. (6) The Glade Riders and Warhawk Riders are swift and skilful beastmasters, striking with speed before the foe can react.	(1) 铁与水和空气起化学反应而生锈。 (2) 她受辱之后就不再理睬他了。 (3) 他们对你的建议有什么反应？ (4) 酸可以和碱起反应而生成盐。 (5) 英国根本不会在他们侵占福岛后在军事上进行反攻。 (6) 森林骑兵和战鹰骑士都能灵巧地驾驭他们的坐骑，从而能迅速地攻击敌人，致使其不能反攻。

(4) I took some light reading for the train journey. (5) The readings on my thermometer last month were well above the average. (6) He agreed with the plurality opinion's reading of the statute. (4) This is the just the bitter reality of wars in Iraq. (5) Mr Green is a professor in name but not in reality. (6) It seems as if he knew everything, but in reality, he is as stupid as can be.
