(3) Many a parent pins the hopes on the children to realise their unfilled ambitions. (4) You broke the promise and made me realise. (5) The furniture realized 900 at the sale. (6) How much did you realize on those paintings?	(1) 他并没有意识到已经有多晚了。 (2) 看起来好象你没意识到那点。 (3) 很多父母试图在他们的儿女身上实现他们的梦想。 (4) 你带走了承诺让我明白。 (5) 拍卖这家具获900英镑。 (6) 那些画你卖了多少钱?
reason n.原因；理由；理智；理性 v.理论；论证；推理；劝说	(1) That is the reason why I don't like it. (2) He is able to explain the reason because he was present at that time. (3) We have reason to believe that he was murdered. (4) His assessment of the situation is based on sheer emotion, not reason. (5) Who can reason with you when you are so stubborn? (6) Copernicus reasoned that the earth revolved around the sun. (7) He reasoned that if we started at dawn, we would be there by noon. (8) Let us try to reason him into joining us.	(1) 那就是我不喜欢它的原因。 (2) 他当时在场,所以他能解释原因。 (3) 我们有理由相信他是被谋杀的。 (4) 他对形势的评估完全是感情用事,而不是建立在理性基础上的。 (5) 你这么执拗的时候,谁能和你理论? (6) 哥白尼论证了地球绕着太阳转。 (7) 他推断，我们要是黎明出发，中午就能到。 (8) 让我们来说服他和我们一起吧。
reasonable adj.合理的；通情达理的；公平适度的	(1) The management took all reasonable safety precautions. (2) All you need is reasonable doubt. (3) You are fortunate to have such a reasonable father. (4) My mother was always reasonable. (5) At first sight their demands seemed reasonable.	(1) 管理部门采取了一切合理的安全措施。 (2) 你所需要的是合理怀疑。 (3) 你有这样一位通情达理的父亲，真是幸运。 (4) 我母亲一向通情达理。 (5) 乍看之下,他们的要求似乎公平合理。
rebuild v.重建；重新组装；恢复	(1) It's necessary to rebuild our alma mater. (2) Plans have been put forward to pull down and rebuild the area. (3) He paid his living expenses through graduate school by rebuilding engines. (4) Jones used to be a thief, but now he's seen the error of his ways and is trying to rebuild his life.	(1) 有必要重建我们的母校。 (2) 已提出计划，要把这个地区的房屋推掉重建。 (3) 他在攻读研究生期间靠重新组装发动机维持日常开销。 (4) 琼斯过去是小偷，但是现已知过能改重新做人。
receipt n.收据；收条；收到 v.出收据	(1) May I have a receipt? (2) Please send me a receipt for the money. (3) We only take goods back if customers can produce the receipt. (4) Please give the receipt to the bearer. (5) On receipt of your instructions he will send the goods. (6) His main work is to receipt for each lot of goods.	(1) 我可以要一张收据吗？ (2) 请寄给我一张收到此款的收据。 (3) 顾客如能出示收据，我们才能予以退货。 (4) 收条请交来人带回。 (5) 一经收到你的指令他就发货。 (6) 他的主要工作是给每一批货物开收据。
receiver n.听筒；接收器；收款员；接受者；破产管理官	(1) Please put the receiver back after calling. (2) He jammed the receiver down on the cradle. (3) The television receiver is an electronic device. (4) The giver benefits more than the receiver. (5) Their business has failed and is in the hands of the receiver.	(1) 打完电话后，请把听筒放回原位。 (2) 他把听筒猛力往支架上放下。 (3) 电视接收器是一种电子装置。 (4) 付出者比接受者收获得更多。 (5) 他们的公司垮了，现在由破产管理人管理。
recent adj.近来的；新近的	(1) Recent discoveries will bear his prediction out. (2) The government's control over the newspapers has loosened in recent years. (3) The teapot looked old but was a recent fake. (4) The minister has put a different gloss on recent developments.	(1) 近来的种种发现将会证实他的预言。 (2) 近年来政府对报纸的控制已经变松了。 (3) "这把茶壶貌似古董,却是一件新近制作的赝品。" (4) 部长就局势的最新发展作了另一番解释。
reception n.接待；反应；接待处；欢迎；接收；招待会	(1) The bridal suite was prepared for the reception of the honeymooners. (2) The play got a favourable reception from the critics. (3) Wait for me at reception. (4) The bridal suite was prepared for the reception of the honeymooners. (5) Reception (eg of TV programmes) is poor here.	(1) 新婚套间已准备好以接待度蜜月的人。 (2) 该剧获评论界好评。 (3) 在接待处等我吧。 (4) 新婚套间已准备好以接待度蜜月的人。 (5) 这里的接收情况欠佳（如电视节目的）.
receptionist n.接待员；接线生；	(1) The receptionist scowled at me. (2) I will leave a message with the receptionist.	(1) 接待员怒视着我。 (2) 我会给前台小姐留个口信。
recipe n.秘诀；食谱；药方	(1) What's your recipe for success? (2) He knows the recipe for this dish. (3) This recipe will be enough for four servings. (4) In fact, could I ask you for the recipe? (5) I will keep the recipe in my head.	(1) 你取得成功有什么窍门？ (2) 他知道这道菜的烹饪方法。 (3) 本食谱为四人食用分量。 (4) 事实上,我能向你要这道菜的食谱吗? (5) 我将把这个处方留在记忆里。
recite vt.背诵；朗诵；叙述；列举 vi.背诵；回答问题	(1) Can you recite the Ten Commandants? (2) I like to recite his poetical works. (3) She can recite the whole poem from memory. (4) He loved to recite his grievances. (5) My family likes to recite quotations from movies. (6) I don't like reciting in public. (7) She got cold feet when asked to recite in class.	(1) 你能背诵十诫吗？ (2) 我喜欢背诵他的诗。 (3) 她能背诵全诗。 (4) 他爱喋喋不休地叙述自己的苦难。 (5) 我的家人很喜欢列举电影里的语录。 (6) 我不喜欢当众朗诵。 (7) 当她被叫起来在班上背诵时害怕了。
recognise v.<英>承认；识别，认出；认可 =recognize	(1) We recognise the imperative need for this development. (2) Once that is done, it would be easier to recognise an independent Kosovo. (3) As an engineer, he can recognise a kludge when he sees one. (4) Kill them all, God will recognise his own. (5) So far, Western governments have yet to recognise Mr Kibaki fully.	(1) 我们承认这是必要的为了这个发展。 (2) 只要这样，就更容易承认一个独立的科索沃。 (3) 作为一名工程师，他一眼就能识别出那些尚不成熟的技术。 (4) 杀光他们，你们将得到上帝的认可。 (5) 到目前为止，西方各国政府还没有完全认可齐贝吉总统。
recommend vt.推荐；建议；劝告；使受欢迎；使可取	(1) Can you recommend me some new books on this subject? (2) I should recommend it as a useful reference book. (3) I recommend you to buy this dictionary and that tape. (4) I recommend that you inquire about the job. (5) How do you recommend them to do before going abroad? (6) Behaviour of that sort will not recommend you. (7) His proposal has much to recommend it.	(1) 你能推荐一些有关这个学科的新书给我吗? (2) 我愿意推荐它作为一本有用的参考书。 (3) 我建议你买这本字典和那盒磁带。 (4) 我建议你打听一下这项工作。 (5) 你对即将出国的人们有何劝告?。 (6) 那样的行为不会使别人对你有好感。 (7) 他的建议有不少可取之处。
record n.唱片；纪录；记载；经历；前科 v.记录；显示；(将声音等)录下	(1) He did very well, but failed to break the record. (2) She holds the world record for long distance swimming. (3) You should keep a record of your expenses. (4) Last summer was the wettest on record. (5) Her past record counts against her. (6) She seemed perversely proud of her criminal record. (7) I recorded the score in a notebook. (8) We record our thoughts and experiences in diaries. (9) The thermometer recorded 40C. (10) The broadcast was recorded, not live.	(1) 他做得很出色,但未破纪录。 (2) 她保持着长距离游泳的世界纪录。 (3) 你应该记下你的各项开支。 (4) 去年夏天是有记录以来降雨量最大的。 (5) 她过去的经历对她不利。 (6) 她似乎不通人事，拿自己的前科当荣耀。 (7) 我在笔记本上记下了分数。 (8) 我们把自己的思想和经验记录在日记中。 (9) 温度计上显示出40C. (10) 这次广播是事先录音的，不是现场直播。
record holder n.纪录保持者	(1) Jason Lezak was the final American in the pool, and he was about a full body length behind former 100-meter freestyle world record holder Alain Bernard at the final turn.	(1) 他在最后一个转身时落后百米自由泳前世界纪录保持者伯纳德大约一个身长。
recorder n.记录员；记录器（录音机等） n.（英国某些市镇的）首席法官；市法院法官 n.竖笛	(1) He works as a recorder in the city court. (2) The recorder chalked it up as soon as the athlete beat a new record. (3) Use Recorder to record keystrokes or mouse actions to play back later. (4) According to the record, the cord was the oldest recorder the people could afford. (5) Like most musical children, Tom first played the recorder.	(1) 他在市法院当记录员。 (2) 运动员一打破记录，记录员就立即公布。 (3) 用记录器记录击键或鼠标行为，以备后来播放。 (4) 据记载，绳子是人们用得起的最古老的记录器。 (5) 象大多数喜欢音乐的孩子一样，汤姆第一次使用八孔竖笛。
recover v.恢复；复原；重获	(1) He's now fully recovered from his stroke. (2) He is very ill and unlikely to recover. (3) I nearly fell but managed to recover myself. (4) I sat down to recover from my agitation. (5) The police recovered the stolen jewellery. (6) Hung Lo went to battle to recover that horse.	(1) 他现已从中风病完全康复了。 (2) 他病得非常厉害，不大可能恢复健康了。 (3) 我差一点倒下,但最后还是站稳了脚根。 (4) 我坐下以使自己平静下来。 (5) 警察找回了被盗的珠宝。 (6) 贺龙又去打仗夺回来那匹马。
recreation n.消遣；娱乐	(1) In other words, we had better take sufficient recreation to relax after work. (2) Art is both creation and recreation. (3) Some films combine education with recreation . (4) Our city needs more facilities for recreation.	(1) 换句话说，我们最好工作后，消遣消遣来轻松一下。 (2) 艺术是创作，同时也是消遣。 (3) 有些影片把教育同娱乐融合在一起。 (4) 我们城市需要更多的娱乐设施。

redirect adj.再直接的 v.重新传入；重新寄送	(1) Standard output is just as easy to redirect.	(1) 标准的输出正如是当做容易的重新传入。
reduce v.减少；缩小；使落魄；简化；还原	(1) The new government's prime task is to reduce the level of inflation. (2) We need to reduce our dependence on oil as a source of energy. (3) They were reduced to begging. (4) You need to reduce the equation to its simplest form. (5) Electrons from water involved in noncyclic photophosphorylation are used to reduce the added substance. (6) In the case of very small strains, these derived bounds reduce known results for linear cases.	(1) 新政府的主要任务是减低通货膨胀的水平。 (2) 在能源方面,我们需减少对石油的依赖。 (3) 他们沦落到得要饭。 (4) 你需要将这个方程式化为最简单形式。 (5) 非循环光合磷酸化中由水提供的电子被用来还原产物。 (6) 在微小变形下，所导出的界限还原成已知的线性情况下的相应结果。
refer vt.把 ... 提交；把 ... 归因；归类 vi.参考；谈及；咨询	(1) We referred the proposal to the board of directors. (2) You should refer this matter to the head office for a decision. (3) He referred all his troubles to bad luck. (4) Botanists refer this flower to the rose family. (5) You can refer to a dictionary if necessary. (6) Don't refer to this matter again please. (7) She referred to the subject several times during her speech. (8) Refer to the Manager if confusion arises.	(1) 我们把这一建议提交董事会处理。 (2) 你应当把这事提交总部去决定。 (3) 他将他的一切麻烦都归因于运气不好。 (4) 植物学家将这花归入蔷薇科。 (5) 如果有必要，你可以参考字典。 (6) 请不要再提这件事了。 (7) 在她的演讲中多次提到这个学科。 (8) 如有不清楚的地方,就咨询经理。
referee n.裁判员；仲裁人；鉴定人；证明人 v.裁判；仲裁	(1) The referee whistled and the game began. (2) Does the referee have the power to send him off the field? (3) He was booked by the referee for foul play. (4) The head teacher often acts as (a) referee for his pupils. (5) Who's going to referee the basketball match? (6) The world's supposedly independent nuclear referee, in short, is stumped for the present. (7) For some research purposes and possibly for referee work, analyzed primary standards may be obtained from the U.S. Bureau of Standards.	(1) 裁判哨子一响，比赛开始了。 (2) 裁判员有权勒令他退场吗? (3) 他因为动作犯规而被裁判记下姓名。 (4) 这位校长常为求职学生做证明人。 (5) 谁将担任这场篮球赛的裁判? (6) 总之，目前，设想中的全球独立核仲裁者还只能蹒跚而行。 (7) 对于某些研究工作和仲裁工作，可以从美国标准局获得经过分析的一级标准物。
reference n.参考；参照；出处；推荐人；推荐函 v.注明出处；附参考资料	(1) This book is for reference only. (2) Full reference citations are available on the readings page. (3) Can we contact your references? (4) He has a good reference from his former employer. (5) Paraphrasing is not direct quotation, but you still need to reference it. (6) Each chapter is referenced in minute detail. (7) Each chapter is referenced, citing literature up to 1999.	(1) 这本书仅供参考。 (2) 全部参考资料的出处可以在阅读资料那页找到。 (3) 我可以与你的推荐人联系吗? (4) 他有以前老板提供的一份很好的推荐书。 (5) 意译不是直接引用 (6) 每一章后面都附有极为详尽的参考资料。 (7) 每一章都附有参考资料，引用文献截止到1999年。
reflect v.反映；反射；反省；归咎；显示	(1) Her sad looks reflected the thought passing through her mind. (2) The results reflect the greatest credit upon all concerned. (3) The sunlight was reflected in the water. (4) I often reflect on the beauty and complexity of life. (5) Why not reflect on it when you are happy, in good health, confident, and full of well-being?	(1) 她忧戚的面容反映出她内心的思想。 (2) 这些成绩带给所有有关人员最大的荣誉。 (3) 日光由水面反射出来。 (4) 我们经常思考人生的美丽与复杂。 (5) 当你快乐、健康,充满自信,满怀幸福喜悦时,为何不反省死亡?

(6) We are going to reform this law. (7) We must reform the outdated rules and regulations. (8) You have had every chance to reform. (9) She thought she could reform him. (10) He spent years trying to reform the world. (11) It is high time that the legal profession reformed itself.	(1) 我们的改革取得了势不可挡的进展。 (2) 教育体制要作许多改革。 (3) 改革开放的政策给我们中国人民带来了富裕和多彩的生活。 (4) 他打算在监狱制度方面实行一些改良。 (5) 新的领导人将改革不当的制度。 (6) 我们即将改革这个法律。 (7) 我们必须改革那些过时的规章制度。 (8) 你是一直有改过自新的机会的。 (9) 她觉得她可以使他洗心革面。 (10) 他花了多年时间,力图改造世界。 (11) 法律界的自我改造此其时也。
refresh v.（使）恢复精神；提神；提醒	(1) A cool drink refreshed me after my long walk. (2) He has drunk one cup of coffee to refresh oneself. (3) I refreshed myself with a cup of coffee. (4) Let me refresh your memory with some fact. (5) I looked at the map to refresh my memory of the road.	(1) 走了很长的一段路之后，一杯冷饮使我恢复了精神。 (2) 他喝了一杯咖啡提神。 (3) 我喝了一杯咖啡给自己提提神。 (4) 我来提几件事帮你恢复记忆吧。 (5) 我看着地图，想使自己回忆起那条道路。
refreshments n.茶点；饮料；点心 名词refreshment的复数形式.	(1) Refreshments will be served after the meeting. (2) We have to make a small charge for refreshments. (3) We bought refreshments at the football match. (4) There were cold drinks and refreshments. (5) Refreshments can be obtained at the station.	(1) 会后有茶点供应。 (2) 我们得收取少量茶点费。 (3) 我们在足球比赛时买了食物和饮料。 (4) 有冷饮和点心。 (5) 在车站买得到点心。
refusal n.拒绝；回绝	(1) I translate his silence as a refusal. (2) She couched her refusal in very polite terms. (3) Your words amount to a refusal.	(1) 我把他的沉默解释为拒绝。 (2) 她用十分委婉的措辞表示拒绝。 (3) 你的话等于回绝了。
regards n.问候；致意	(1) Please give my sincere regards to all the members of your family. (2) Should you see him, please give him my regards.	(1) 请向你全家转达我真挚的问候。 (2) 如果你见到他，请代我向他致意。
regardless adj.不顾的；不注意的 adv.不顾	(1) He crushed the bloom with regardless tread. (2) I protested, but she carried on regardless. (3) They decorated the house regardless of cost. (4) All our proposals were rejected, regardless of their merits.	(1) 他毫不在意一脚践踏了鲜花。 (2) 我极力反对，但她置之不理仍一意孤行。 (3) 他们不惜工本装修这栋房子。 (4) 我们所有的建议都遭到拒绝，不管这些建议的价值如何。
register v.登记；记录；注册；挂号 n.登记簿；记录；暂存器 n.[语]语域；[音]音域通风调节设备	(1) You must register if you intend to vote. (2) He registered the trial proceedings. (3) You must register as a member first. (4) I want this letter registered. (5) Would you sign the register? (6) No register of his death was found. (7) We need to buy registers. (8) Official documents are written in formal register.	(1) 如果你要投票选举,你就必须登记。 (2) 法庭速记员记录下了审判进程。 (3) 你必须先注册成为会员。 (4) 我想挂号邮寄这封信。 (5) 请你在登记簿上签名好吗? (6) 没有查到他的死亡记录。 (7) 我们需要购买暂存器。 (8) 官方文件是以正式语体写成的。
regret v.后悔；惋惜；为 ... 感到遗憾 n.遗憾；抱歉；后悔	(1) I now regret having made a promise that I would join in the scheme. (2) We deeply regret that this big fire has taken away two young men's lives. (3) We regret that we have to place the entire shipment at your disposal. (4) Much to my regret, I can't accept your invitation. (5) There is no room for regret when matters have reached this stage.	(1) 我现在后悔答应参加该计划的事。 (2) 这次大火夺走了两个年轻人的生命,我们为此感到深深的惋惜。 (3) 很遗憾，我们只得将全部货品退回贵方自行处理。 (4) 很抱歉,我不能接受你的邀请。 (5) 事已至此,后悔也没有用了。
regular adj.有规律的；定期的；经常的；正规的；整齐的；规则的	(1) He made a regular visit to his parents. (2) We will remain in regular contact with them. (3) Please act according to the regular procedure. (4) He is a handsome young man with regular features. (5) The building has a regular square shape.	(1) 他定期看望父母亲。 (2) 我们将和他们保持经常的联系。 (3) 请按照正规的程序行事。 (4) 他是个五官端正的英俊青年。 (5) 这栋大楼的外观是规则的正方形。
regulation n.管理；规章；规则 adj.规定的	(1) We need the regulation of share prices. (2) From now on any violation of the regulation must be cruelly punished. (3) It's wrong of you to get around the regulation. (4) This regulation refers only to children. (5) She was fined for driving above the regulation speed. (6) Please use envelopes of the regulation size.	(1) 我们需要对股票价格的管制。 (2) 今后任何违反秩序的行为会受到严厉惩罚。 (3) 你存心规避规章制度是不对的。 (4) 这些规定仅适用于儿童。 (5) 她因超速开车而被罚款。 (6) 请用尺寸大小符合规定的信封。
reject vt.拒绝；排斥；驳回；丢弃 n.不合格产品；被拒之人	(1) He rejected their offer of a job. (2) After the transplant his body rejected the new heart. (3) The supermarket rejected all spotted apples. (4) The factory sells some of its better rejects cheaply, but it throws most of the rejects away. (5) He was a reject from the varsity team.	(1) 他拒绝了他们给他的工作。 (2) 他的身体对新移植的心脏产生了排斥作用。 (3) 超级市场丢弃了所有的烂苹果。 (4) 这家公司廉价出售略好一些的次品，但将大多数次品丢弃。 (5) 他被大学代表队拒绝了。
relate v.叙述；使有联系；有关联；涉及；符合；发生共鸣	(1) To what events did your remarks relate? (2) It is difficult to relate cause and effect in this case. (3) These two events were related to each other. (4) In what way does it relate to your current career? (5) Some adults can't relate to children.	(1) 你的话指的是什么事? (2) 这个案件中的动机与结果很难联系起来。 (3) 这两个事件相互有联系。 (4) 这跟您目前的职业有何关联呢?。 (5) 有些成年人不理解儿童的想法。
relation n.关系；联系；亲戚；陈述；参考	(1) Relation between the two countries has reached a crisis point. (2) We try to maintain good relation with our customer. (3) We wish to establish relation with you. (4) I don't see any relation between the two problems. (5) The relation between unemployment and inflation has also weakened. (6) He is a near relation of mine. (7) You may invite all your relations to the dinner party. (8) A distant relation of hers came to see her yesterday. (9) His relation of his adventure fascinated us. (10) Her own relation gives us a remarkably objective account of her final attempt. (11) Several referenced suggestions in relation to the sustainable development of Chinese professional football were preposed.	(1) 两国关系已达到出现危机的地步。 (2) 我们努力与客户保持良好的关系。 (3) 我们希望与你们建立贸易关系。 (4) 我看不出这两个问题间的联系。 (5) 失业和通胀之间的联系也被削弱了。 (6) 他是我的一个近亲。 (7) 你可以请你所有的亲戚来参加晚宴。 (8) 昨天她的一个远方亲戚来看她。 (9) 他讲述的关于自己的冒险经历使我们听入了迷。 (10) 他的叙述地为我们客观地描绘了她的最后一次尝试。 (11) 从而对中国职业足球的持续发展提出参考意见。
relationship n.关系；联系；亲属关系	(1) Part of my job is to maintain good relationship with our suppliers. (2) We have a working relationship. (3) I'm not going to give my son the job just because of our relationship. (4) Is there any relationship between them?	(1) 我的部分工作是同我们的供应商保持良好的关系。 (2) 我们是工作上的关系。 (3) 我不打算把这个职位给我的儿子,正因为我们有这层亲属关系。 (4) 它们之间有联系吗?
relax v.休息；放松；使 ... 放松；放宽	(1) I felt my shoulders relax a little. (2) His muscles relaxed. (3) A good massage will relax your tired muscles. (4) The music will help to relax you. (5) We could relax the procedure slightly in your case.	(1) 我觉得我的肩膀放松了好多。 (2) 他的肌肉松弛了。 (3) 舒服的按摩会让你疲惫的肌肉放松。 (4) 音乐会使你感到轻松。 (5) 我们可以根据你的情况通融一些。
relevant adj.相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的	(1) A paper relevant to this research was published by him. (2) Have you heard of the relevant report? (3) My next conclusion is more relevant. (4) Portraits of people will draw readers'attention, especially if the images are relevant and tell a story. (5) These values are relevant in a relative sense.	(1) 与本研究相关的一篇论文是他发表的。 (2) 你听说过相关的报道吗? (3) 我的另一个结论更切题。 (4) 人物肖像可以吸引读者的注意,当图像切题并在讲述一个故事时更是如此。 (5) 这些值只是在相对比较上才有中肯的意义。
reliable adj.可靠的；可信的	(1) I don't think he is a reliable man. (2) She may be slow but at least she's reliable. (3) A reliable car is worth its weight in gold. (4) A man who is dead to the justice is not reliable. (5) There is no doubt that he is a reliable person.	(1) 我认为他不是一个可靠的人。 (2) 她迟钝是迟钝，但无论如何她很可靠。 (3) 靠得住的汽车就是无价之宝。 (4) 一个没有正义感的人是不可信的。 (5) 毫无疑问,他是一个可信赖的人。
relief n.减轻；解除；轻松；浮雕；救济(品)；安慰；替代 adj.提供救济的；文本的	(1) The pills gave her some relief. (2) A doctor's life is consecrated to the relief of suffering. (3) His jokes provided some comic relief in what was really a dull speech. (4) The young man carved a figure in low relief. (5) Relief was quickly sent to the sufferers from the great fire. (6) It was a great relief to find that my family was all safe. (7) The relief driver has got here.	(1) 药片减轻她一些痛苦。 (2) 医师的一生奉献于解除世人的疾苦。 (3) 他说的笑话给极沉闷的讲话增加几分轻松气氛。 (4) 这个年轻人刻了一座浅浮雕人像。 (5) 救济品很快被送到遭受火灾的灾民手中。 (6) 看到我的家人安然无恙，我感到极大的欣慰。 (7) 接班的司机已经到了。
religion n.宗教；宗教信仰	(1) He is a disciple of religion. (2) Jesus was the founder of the Christian religion. (3) Politics and religion are daily topics of conversation. (4) There are many religions in the world. (5) He was a Catholic but didn't practice his religion.	(1) 他是宗教信徒。 (2) 耶稣是基督教的创始人。 (3) 政治和宗教是人们平常交谈的主要话题。 (4) 世界上有许多种宗教信仰。 (5) 他那时是天主教徒,但并不实践信仰。
religious adj.宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；信奉宗教的	(1) The religious affairs have been reestablished. (2) He was troubled by religious doubt. (3) Secular music refers to music which is not religious. (4) She is very religious and goes to church three times a week. (5) He was religious in his attendance at class.	(1) 宗教事务已经恢复。 (2) 他因对宗教的疑惧而十分烦恼。 (3) 世俗音乐是指非宗教的音乐。 (4) 她非常虔诚，每周去教堂三次。 (5) 他上课仔细听讲,毫不分心。
rely vi.依靠；信任	(1) They have to rely on the river for their water. (2) A man should rely upon his own power. (3) You can't rely on his assistance. (4) We are relying on your decision. (5) I rely on getting my money back in due time.	(1) 他们用水只好依靠这条河。 (2) 人类应该依靠自身的力量。 (3) 你不能指望他能帮助你。 (4) 我们相信你的判断。 (5) 我相信到期时可以收回我的钱。
remain v.剩余；逗留；留下；依然；保持 n.剩余物；遗迹；残骸	(1) We must learn to conserve what remains. (2) I didn't remain long in the city. (3) The present international situation remains tense and turbulent. (4) Most of the unearthed relics remain intact. (5) After maintenance the main remains and remainders are left on the domain. (6) They have found prehistoric remains. (7) The remains of the wooden hull are fragile and need special handling.	(1) 我们必须学会保存那些剩余的资源。 (2) 我没在那个城市逗留很长时间。 (3) 当前的国际局势依然紧张动荡。 (4) 大多数出土文物仍保持完好无损。 (5) 维修之后，主要遗骸和剩余物留在了领地上。 (6) 他们发现了史前遗迹。 (7) 木船体的残骸是很不牢固的，搬动时需要特别小心。
remark n.评论；备注；注意 v.评论；注意到	(1) They made rude remarks about her appearance. (2) The teacher asked the students to make a remark on this page. (3) Ellen later regretted her remarks about his private affairs. (4) The editor remarked that article was well written. (5) She did remark the likeness between father and son.	(1) 他们对她的外表横加粗暴的评论。 (2) 老师要求学生在这页备注。 (3) 后来,艾伦后悔的发现没有好好注意他的私事。 (4) 编者评论说那篇文章写得很好。 (5) 她确实注意到父子之间的相似之处了。
remind vt.使想起；提醒	(1) This story reminds me of my childhood. (2) I feel it is absolutely necessary for me to remind him of the meeting today.	(1) 这个故事让我想起了我的童年。 (2) 我觉得绝对有必要提醒他今天要开会。
remote adj.遥远的；偏僻的；远程的；(感情等)距离很大 n.远程操作	(1) The most remote two points in this world are two estranged hearts. (2) This is a village remote from the madding crowd. (3) Mail comes to this remote village only once a week. (4) The bomb was exploded by remote control. (5) The connection between these ideas is very remote. (6) Actuation is often desired for process automation, precision timing, and remote operation not possible with manual valves alone.	(1) 人世间相距最远的两点,是两颗隔膜的心。 (2) 这是一个远离喧嚣尘世的村庄。 (3) 邮车每周只到这个偏僻的村庄一次。 (4) 这颗炸弹是遥控引爆的。 (5) 这两种看法之间的距离很大。 (6) 执行机构经常用于实现紧靠手动阀门无法实现的工艺过程的自动化，准确定时，以及远程操作。
remove v.消除；脱掉；免除；搬迁	(1) He removed the mud from his shoes. (2) How can we remove the husk of the grains? (3) She asked me to remove my shnes. (4) That officer must be removed. (5) Our office has removed to Shanghai from Beijing.	(1) 他去掉鞋上的泥。 (2) 我们怎样去掉谷物的外皮？ (3) 她让我把鞋脱掉。 (4) 那位官员必须免职。 (5) 我们的办公室已从北京迁到上海。
rent n.租金 v.租用；出租 动词rend的过去式和过去分词.	(1) The rent is due at the end of each quarter. (2) They let the house to me at a rent of 100 dollars a month. (3) I rent a room from her. (4) I'd like to rent a car for just one day. (5) She decided to rent out a room to get extra income.	(1) 缴纳租金以每季度末为期限。 (2) 他们把房子租给我，每月租金一百美元。 (3) 我向她租了一个房间。 (4) 我想租一部车，一天即可。 (5) 她为获得额外收入决定租出一个房间。
repairs n.修理工作 名词repair的复数形式.	(1) Now ordinary repairs can be handled in our plant. (2) We need someone to help do the repairs.	(1) 现在一般的修理工作都可在我们厂进行了。 (2) 我们需要一个人来帮助做修理工作。
repeat n.重复；反复 v.重复；复述 adj.重复的；反复的	(1) Malcolm is forced to repeat crimes on himself. (2) Repeat this process repetitively, each time going farther and farther from the dog. (3) The teacher asked him to repeat what he had said. (4) It is embarrassing to repeat what he said. (5) I repeat that this must not happen again. (6) The girl repeated the poem after I had read it twice. (7) Can you repeat what I've just said word for word? (8) In this task, test takers repeat sentences verbatim. (9) You might as well read the argument as to have me repeat it to you. (10) You can also specify the repeat interval for the probe.	(1) 马尔康不得不反复声言自己有罪。 (2) 反复这一过程，逐渐地加大你与狗之间的距离。 (3) 老师要他重复他所讲的话。 (4) 若要重复他说过的话,会很尴尬的。 (5) 我重复地说一遍，这种事不容再发生。 (6) 我读了两遍这首诗，这个小女孩就会背诵了。 (7) 你能一字不差地复述我刚才说过的话吗? (8) 在这个部分,考生将逐词逐句地复述句子。 (9) 你也可以自己先阅读该论题或由我来复述。 (10) 你还可以指定探测器的重复间隔。
replace vt.取代；替换；放回原处；偿还	(1) Nothing can replace a mother's love. (2) We've replaced the old adding machine with a computer. (3) The coach decided to replace player No. 8 with No. 3. (4) He replaced the book in the shelf.	(1) 什么都无法取代母爱。 (2) 我们用电脑取代了老式的加法计算器。 (3) 教练决定让3号替换8号。 (4) 他把书放回到书架上。
reporter n.记者	(1) The reporter had a red-hot story.	(1) 那个记者掌握著最新消息。
represent vt.表现；表示；描绘；代表；象征；说明；阐明 vi.提出异议	(1) Monsters in dreams often represent fears. (2) Both represent the triumph of passion over reason. (3) Dotted arrows represent flow of information. (4) You must represent your complaints to Head Office. (5) The carvings represent a hunting scene. (6) The red lines on the map represent railways. (7) They represent each society stratum. (8) Noodles should be uncut, as they represent long life. (9) These beautiful green stones represent love and success. (10) Let me represent my ideas to you in another way. (11) I will represent to him the risks he is running.	(1) 怪物在梦里经常表现为恐惧。 (2) 两者都表现出理智之外的激情。 (3) 虚矢线表示信息流程。 (4) 你必须向总部表示出你的抱怨。 (5) 这些雕刻作品描绘了一幅狩猎的场面。 (6) 这张地图上的红线代表铁路。 (7) 他们代表各个社会阶层。 (8) 面条必须是整条不切断的，象征长命百岁。 (9) 这些美丽的绿宝石象征爱和成功。 (10) 让我用另一种方式向你说明我的想法。 (11) 我将向他说明他所冒的危险。
representative n.代表；众议员；典型 adj.代表的；典型的；代表制的	(1) That representative brought forth an amendment to the press law. (2) A senator takes precedence over a Representative. (3) The tiger is a representative of the cat family. (4) Are your opinions representative of the other students? (5) The study was carried out in one small town,so we can't be sure that the results are truly representative. (6) Representative government as defined by Abraham Lincoln is government of the people,by the people,for the people.	(1) 那位代表提出了一项对新闻法的修正案。 (2) 参议员的地位高于众议员。 (3) 老虎是猫科动物的典型。 (4) 你的意见是否代表其他学生的意见？ (5) 这项研究在一个小镇里进行,因此我们也不确定研究结果是否真的具有典型性。 (6) 由亚伯拉罕·林肯定义的代表制政府是民享、民有和为人民的政府。
republic n.共和国；共和政体	(1) He was one of the architects of the republic. (2) Back to our Republic of Singapore. (3) In what ways is a republic more desirable than a principality? (4) In a republic, that paradise of debility, the politician is a petty tyrant who obeys the laws.	(1) 他是这个共和国的缔造者之一。 (2) 回到我们新加坡共和国。 (3) 共和政体为何比君主政体更令人向往？ (4) 在一个共和政体，那是衰弱者的天堂，政治家是一个服从法律的小暴君。
reputation n.好名声；声誉，名声，名气	(1) This store has an excellent reputation for fair dealing. (2) He has not too good a reputation in the matter of honesty. (3) He trades on his father's reputation. (4) He spotted his reputation by lying repeatedly. (5) He earned a high reputation for his learning.	(1) 这家商店因公平交易而获好名声。 (2) 就诚实而言, 他的名声不太好。 (3) 他用他父亲的名誉牟利。 (4) 他因反复说谎而败坏了自己的名声。 (5) 他在学识方面享有很高的声誉。
request n.请求；要求 vt.请求；要求	(1) I will oblige any sincere request. (2) His answer to my request was a negative. (3) Your request will be dealt with in due course. (4) I bought it at your request. (5) We request you to deduct our commission from the invoice. (6) They request that a delegation be sent to their country. (7) They requested financial support. (8) I requested him to come before ten.	(1) 我会答应任何诚意的请求。 (2) 我的请求遭到了他的拒绝。 (3) 你的要求将在适当时机予以处理。 (4) 我应你的要求买下来。 (5) 我们请求你方从发票中扣除我们的佣金。 (6) 他们请求派一个代表团去他们国家。 (7) 他们要求资助。 (8) 我要求他十点以前来。
require v.要求；需要；命令；规定	(1) The director required that we should work all night. (2) We must not propagate one method and require all localities to adopt it. (3) Please call if you require assistance. (4) This game requires a minimum of three players. (5) The headmaster required her to keep silent. (6) Napoleon required every soldier to obey his orders. (7) Students are required to attend classes. (8) As required by the traceablitiy, the duplicate copy of purchase documents shall be kept.	(1) 主任要求我们通宵工作。 (2) 我们在宣传上不要只讲一种办法，要求各地都照着去做。 (3) 如果需要帮忙，请打电话。 (4) 这个游戏至少需要三个人才可以玩。 (5) 校长命令她不要做声。 (6) 拿破仑要求每个士兵 都服从他的命令. (7) 学生必须按规定上课 (8) 根据可追溯性的专用要求的范围规定,应保存有关采购文件的副本。
requirement n.必要条件；要求	(1) Candidates who fail to meet these requirements will not be admitted to the University. (2) Our immediate requirement is extra staff. (3) The refugees' main requirements are food and shelter.	(1) 不符合这些要求的考生不能上这所大学。 (2) 我们亟需增加工作人员。 (3) 难民的主要必需品是食物和住所。
rescue vt.营救；援救 n.营救；救援	(1) He dived from the bridge to rescue the drowning child. (2) Had Jim not dived in to rescue him, the boy would have drowned. (3) The government has rescued the firm from bankruptcy by giving them a grant. (4) The rescue attempt was impeded by bad weather. (5) Rescue workers rushed to the site of the plane crash.	(1) 他从桥上跳入水中去抢救那溺水儿童。 (2) 如果不是吉姆跳下水去救，那小孩早就淹死了。 (3) 政府拨款给这家公司使其免于破产。 (4) 营救工作受到恶劣天气的妨碍。 (5) 抢救人员冲向飞机坠毁的现场。
research n.研究；调查 v.研究；调查	(1) We all support his scientific research. (2) Research indicates that men find it easier to give up smoking than women. (3) My research is just bouncing along at present. (4) They have been researching the effects of the drug on mice. (5) He needs to research about the coffee market.	(1) 我们都支持他的科学研究。 (2) 研究表明，男人比女人更容易戒烟。 (3) 目前我的调查进展得很顺利。 (4) 他们一直在研究老鼠对这种药物的反应。 (5) 他需要对咖啡市场进行调查。
resemble v.与…相似；像	(1) The brothers resemble each other in taste. (2) She resembles her sister in appearance but not in character. (3) You resemble your mother very closely.	(1) 那对兄弟兴趣相似。 (2) 她和她姐姐外貌相似，但性格不同。 (3) 你非常像你的母亲。
reservation n.预定；保留意见	(1) I'd like to make a reservation. (2) I'll arrive late, but please keep my reservation. (3) Do you require a deposit to confirm a reservation? (4) They accepted the proposal without reservation. (5) Some members of the committee expressed reservations about the proposal.	(1) 我想订票。 (2) 我会晚一点到达，请保留所预订的房间。 (3) 确定预定的旅馆房间要不要付定金？ (4) 他们无保留地接受了这个建议。 (5) 委员会一些成员对这项提议持保留态度。
reserve vt.保留；预订；延期 n.候补；预备品；贮存 n.含蓄；克制	(1) We reserve the right to lodge a claim for loss. (2) I have reserved a table at the restaurant. (3) The court will reserve judgement. (4) He has played very well on the reserve side but this chance in the first team should put him on his mettle. (5) The army should be equipped with sufficient war reserves. (6) The old man keeps a large reserve of firewood for cold weather. (7) The ultimate reserve was a source of his fascination and his power.	(1) 我们保留要求赔偿损失的权利。 (2) 我已在饭店预订了一桌菜。 (3) 法庭将延期判决。 (4) 他在候补队中表现非常出色,但这次作为正式队员参赛将对他的能力进行考验。 (5) 军队应该得到充足的军需储备品。 (6) 这位老人贮存了大量的柴薪以备天冷时用。 (7) 最大限度的克制是他获得魅力和力量的一个源泉。
resign v.辞职；放弃；顺从；听任	(1) Have you heard of her intention to resign? (2) He decided to resign his claim to the copyright. (3) He has resigned himself to the fact that he will lose the job.	(1) 你听到她打算辞职的传闻了吗？ (2) 他决定放弃对版权的要求。 (3) 他已经接受他将要失去这份工作的现实。
resist v.抵制；抵抗；反抗；忍住 n.防蚀涂层	(1) Many young people could not resist the spiritual pollution. (2) They are determined to resist invasion. (3) The nobility usually resist social changes. (4) They were powerless to resist. (5) I can never resist an ice cream.	(1) 很多年轻人不能抵制精神污染。 (2) 他们决定抵抗入侵。 (3) 贵族通常反对社会变革。 (4) 他们无力反抗。 (5) 我一见到冰淇淋就忍不住想吃。
respect vt.尊敬；尊重；遵守；关于；涉及 n.尊敬；敬重；关系；方面 n.（复）respects: 敬意；问候	(1) All students should respect their teachers. (2) I respected their moral standards. (3) I respect him as a writer and as a man. (4) We must respect the laws of a country we are in. (5) Respecting your salary, we shall come to a decision. (6) The terms of the agreement respect the boundary line between the two countries. (7) The students have great respect for their history teacher. (8) They treated me with respect. (9) Their relationship was based on mutual respect. (10) Respect and friendship provide a solid foundation for marriage. (11) It's going to raise a lot of problems with respect to atmosphere pollution. (12) My argument is different from yours in one crucial respect. (13) We called to pay our respects. (14) Please give my respects to your parents.	(1) 凡是学生就应当尊敬老师。 (2) 我尊重他们的道德标准。 (3) 我尊重他这位作家，也尊重他这个人。 (4) 我们必须遵守所在国家的法律。 (5) 关于你的薪水,我们稍后会做出决定。 (6) 协议的条款涉及两国间的边界线。 (7) 学生们非常尊敬他们的历史老师。 (8) 他们对我很敬重。 (9) 他们的关系是以相互的尊重为基础的。 (10) 尊重和伴侣关系是婚姻的牢固基础。 (11) 这将会引起许多有关环境污染方面的问题。 (12) 我的论点在一个至关重要的方面跟你的不一样。 (13) 我们去拜望了，以表示敬意 (14) 请向你父母表达我的问候。
respond v.回答；响应；反应；反应灵敏；反响 n.[建]壁联；[宗]应唱圣歌	(1) I invited her to dinner but she did not respond. (2) He tried to be amusing, but I didn't respond. (3) The car responds well to the controls. (4) They respond warmly to the accent on apartment buildings. (5) The professor lectured with a beaming countenance, but the students didn't respond much, only agreeing with what he said.	(1) 我请她吃晚饭，但她未作回答。 (2) 他试图逗乐,可我一点都没反应。 (3) 这辆汽车操纵灵敏. (4) 他们对加强住宅楼的建设反响热烈。 (5) 教授讲得眉飞色舞，学生们却没有太大的反响，只是随声应和。
responsibility n.责任；职责；责任心	(1) It's my responsibility to lock the doors. (2) You can't retreat from the responsibility in this affair. (3) The prescription of drugs is a doctor's responsibility. (4) He is free from any sense of responsibility. (5) Our teacher has a high degree of responsibility.	(1) 我负责锁门。 (2) 你不能回避在这一事件中的责任。 (3) 开药方是医生的职责。 (4) 他丝毫没有责任感。 (5) 我们老师有高度的责任感。
restrict vt.限制；约束	(1) In a move to restrict imports, the government raised custom duties. (2) Recent laws have tended to restrict the freedom of the press. (3) I restrict myself to smoking two cigarettes a day. (4) Fog restricted visibility. (5) You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine. (6) Their policy was to restrict our growth. (7) Will realty restrict Chinese economy?	(1) 政府在限制进口的措施中提高了关税。 (2) 新法例有限制新闻自由的趋势。 (3) 我限定自己每天只抽两支烟。 (4) 雾天能见度很低。 (5) 携带的免税酒不得超过八升。 (6) 他们的政策是限制我们的发展。 (7) 房地产会制约中国经济吗?
restriction n.限制；约束	(1) The swimming club is open to families in the neighborhood without restriction. (2) The sale of firearms is subject to many legal restrictions. (3) There are currency restrictions on the sums allowed for foreign travel. (4) Enforced isolation or restriction of free movement imposed to prevent the spread of contagious disease. (5) As far as I am concerned, corruption is avoidable with the restriction of law.	(1) 这个游泳俱乐部对邻近地区的家庭开放，不受限制。 (2) 出售枪支受到许多法律限制。 (3) 到国外旅行允许携带的款额有所限制。 (4) 隔离为了防止传染疾病的传播，而强制施行的隔离或对自由活动的限制 (5) 在我看来,腐败是可以通过法律的约束避免的。
retell v.复述；再讲	(1) The teacher asked the students to retell the story they just read. (2) After you have read these stories, retell them in your own words.	(1) 老师要求学生们复述他们刚读的故事。 (2) 把这些故事看完之后，用你自己的话再讲一遍。
retire v.退休；撤退；离去；就寝；主动退出比赛；收回（货币）；赎回（票据） n.退休，退职	(1) My father retired at the age of 60. (2) The old worker decided to retire to the country. (3) Our forces retired to prepared positions. (4) After lunch he retired to his study. (5) I decided to retire early with a book. (6) She fell badly, spraining her ankle, and had to retire. (7) Companies may retire their bonds payable before maturity.	(1) 我父亲六十岁时退休了。 (2) 那们老工人决定退休后搬到乡下去。 (3) 我们的部队撤退到既设阵地上。 (4) 他午饭后就到书房去了。 (5) 我决定带本书早点就寝。 (6) 她摔得很重，扭伤了脚踝，只好退出比赛。 (7) 企业可以在债券到期之前赎回他们的应付债券。
reuse vt.重新使用 n.再使用	(1) The same water was reused after chemical treatment. (2) The bottles are designed to be reused up to 20 times. (3) Rice straw is recycled for reuse to avoid creating pollution by burning it.	(1) 原来的水经过化学处理之后再度使用。 (2) 这些瓶子可以重复使用达20次。 (3) 避免燃烧稻草造成污染，稻草也要回收再利用。
reviewer n.评论者；书评作者；报刊评论员	(1) The movie was enthusiastically received by the reviewers.	(1) 这部电影受到了评论家热烈的认可。
revision n.修订本；校订；修正；复习	(1) A revision of that dictionary has been published. (2) The catalogue is under revision. (3) She matured her novel by constant revision. (4) The law is in need of revision. (5) Our budget needs drastic revision. (6) Friday afternoons are left free for revision. (7) You need enough revision for the test.	(1) 那本词典的修订本已经出版。 (2) 目录正在修订之中。 (3) 她不断修改自己的小说以使其趋于完善。 (4) 这法律需要修改。 (5) 我们的预算需作重大修改。 (6) 留出星期五下午的时间做复习。 (7) 为了考试你需要充分的复习。
revolution n.革命；变革；重大改变；旋转	(1) The industrial revolution had taken place in England first. (2) Those people go around preaching revolution. (3) The invention of aircraft caused a revolution in our ways of travelling. (4) Credit cards have brought about a revolution in people's spending habits. (5) The earth makes one revolution round the sun each year. (6) The earth completes one revolution each day.	(1) 工业革命首先在英国发生。 (2) 那些人到处宣扬革命。 (3) 飞机的发明引起了旅行方式的巨大改变。 (4) 信用卡的使用给人们的消费习惯带来巨大改变. (5) 地球每年绕太阳旋转一周。 (6) 地球每天完成一次自转。
reward n.报答；赏金；报酬 vt.奖赏；给 ... 报酬	(1) An act of kindness deserves a reward. (2) By rights, half the reward should be mine. (3) You have received a just reward. (4) They rewarded the winners with gifts of fruits and flowers.	(1) 做好事,当然要有报答。 (2) 按理说，有一半奖赏应该是我的。 (3) 你已得到了应有的报酬。 (4) 他们奖给优胜者一些水果和鲜花。
rewind v.倒带；转回；重绕 n.倒带装置；重绕	(1) Don't forget to rewind that videotape before you return it. (2) I stopped the tape and pressed rewind button.	(1) 在你归还那卷录影带前，别忘了倒带。 (2) 我停止了磁带播放，按下了倒回键。
rewrite n.重写；改写 vt.改写；重写 vi.修改	(1) It would be just as well to rewrite your essay. (2) You have to rewrite the article. (3) You have to rewrite the article. (4) It would be just as well to rewrite your essay. (5) Next Dr. Brock was asked if it was important to rewrite. (6) Here you have to modify the line of the rewrite module to deactivate it.	(1) 你还是把文章重写一遍。 (2) 你不得不重新改写这篇文章。 (3) 你不得不重新改写这篇文章。 (4) 你还是把文章重写一遍。 (5) 接着布罗克医生被问及修改是否重要。 (6) 在此你必须修改重写模块的语句并将其禁用。
rhyme n.韵；押韵；韵文 v.押韵；用韵诗表达	(1) Do you understand the rhyme of this poem? (2) Poetry often follows special patterns of rhyme. (3) Shakespeare sometimes wrote in rhyme. (4) You can't rhyme “sleep”with “feet”. (5) The last two lines of this poem don't rhyme properly. (6) Love is a blank poetry, rhyme it with your heart.	(1) 你理解这首诗的韵吗? (2) 诗歌常常遵循专门的节奏和押韵格式。 (3) 莎士比亚有时用韵文写作。 (4) 你不能用“sleep”和“feet”押韵。 (5) 这首诗的最后两行没有押好韵。 (6) 爱情就像一页空白的诗篇,用你的心去谱写她的旋律吧。
rid vt.摆脱；除去	(1) We will be glad to get rid of him. (2) You must rid yourself of this melancholy mood. (3) We must try every way to rid ourselves of these debts. (4) It is necessary to get rid of bureaucratic practices. (5) We have an extractor fan in the kitchen to get rid of the smell of cooking.	(1) 摆脱他，我们将很高兴。 (2) 你一定要摆脱这种忧愁情绪。 (3) 我们要想尽一切办法来摆脱这些债务。 (4) 必须清除官僚习气。 (5) 我们的厨房里有台排气扇，用来消除油烟。
ridiculous adj.荒谬的；可笑的	(1) His social pretensions make him appear ridiculous. (2) His aristocratic manners seemed ridiculous in this poor area. (3) I'll show you how to settle such ridiculous stuff. (4) That's ridiculous. (5) That fat woman looked ridiculous in her tight golden dress.	(1) 他冒充上流社会人士而出尽洋相。 (2) 在这个贫穷的地区，他的贵族气派显得很可笑。 (3) 你瞧我怎样来对付这种无稽之谈。 (4) 那太荒唐了。 (5) 那位胖妇人穿着金色的紧身礼服，显得滑稽可笑。
right-handed adj.用右手的；向右旋地 adv.用右手地	(1) Take the first street on the right. (2) Fewer people write with their left hand than with their right.	(1) 走右手的第一条街。 (2) 用左手写字的人比用右手的少。
right-wing adj.右翼的	(1) Robson passes to Lineker on the right wing. (2) Before him, populism belonged as much to the left as the right.	(1) 罗伯逊把球传给右翼的莱茵克尔。 (2) 在他之前，无论是左翼还是右翼的平民化程度都是一样的。
ring-road n.环城公路	(1) The ring road connecting the main cities, the symbol of reconstruction, became perilous.	(1) 联系各主要城市的环城公路是重建的象征，也变得岌岌可危。
rigid adj.坚硬的；严格的；固执的；僵硬的；刻板的	(1) The tent has a rigid support. (2) He's very rigid in his ideas. (3) She was rigid with fear. (4) It's an exercise which adds a touch of the comic opera to his rigid training routines.	(1) 帐篷有一个坚硬的支柱。 (2) 他的想法非常固执。 (3) 她害怕得全身僵住了。 (4) 这一练习给他那刻板的训练程序平添了一份滑稽的色彩。
ripe adj.成熟的；熟的	(1) The branches were weighed down with ripe apples. (2) Most tomatoes are red when ripe, but some kinds are yellow. (3) The ripe apples picked easily. (4) The time was ripe for a challenge to the power of the government. (5) These apples are not ripe; they are sour. (6) I picked a ripe apple from the tree. (7) It was mid-summer when the crops were ripe.	(1) 苹果成熟了把树枝都压弯了。 (2) 大多数西红柿成熟时是红色的，但有些品种是黄色的。 (3) 成熟的苹果易于采摘 (4) 时机已经成熟，可以向政府权力提出挑战了。 (5) 这些苹果不熟，是酸的。 (6) 我从树上摘下一只熟的苹果。 (7) 庄稼熟的时候已是仲夏。
ripen v.(使)成熟	(1) The sun ripens the corn. (2) Time had ripened his life and mellowed its fruits. (3) We are waiting for the first crops to ripen.	(1) 阳光使农作物成熟。 (2) 时间使他的生命成熟，结出硕果。 (3) 我们正等待着第一次农作物的成熟。
rise vi.上升；升起；增加；起床；反抗；复活 n.上升；增加；斜坡；小山	(1) The higher we rise, the smaller we appear to those who do not know how to fly. (2) The sun rises in the east and sets in the west. (3) In proportion as the sales increase the profit will rise. (4) The next morning I was the first to rise. (5) The king's cruelty excited the people to rise against him. (6) Christians believe that Jesus rose from the dead on Easter Sunday. (7) I am reading a book about the rise and fall of the Roman Empire. (8) Experts say the figures for divorce are on the rise. (9) Tax revenue reached 1,637.1 billion yuan, a rise of 240 billion yuan in comparable terms. (10) The length of the steps depends on the rise of the slope. (11) On mountain slopes that receive plentiful rainfall, huge Douglas firs rise in towering columns.	(1) 我们上升得越高,我们在那些不懂飞翔的人眼里就显得越遥远。 (2) 太阳从东方升起，在西方落下。 (3) 随着销售量增长,利润也成比例地增加。 (4) 第二天早上,我是第一个起床的。 (5) 那个国王的残酷激起了人民起来反对他。 (6) 基督徒相信耶稣在那个星期日(後定为复活节)里复活了。 (7) 我正在看一本关于罗马帝国兴衰的书。 (8) 专家称,离婚数量在增加。 (9) 税收大幅度增长，全国财政收入达到16371亿元，按可比口径增加2400亿元。 (10) 台阶的长度远取决于斜坡的倾斜度。 (11) 在有充足降水的斜坡，巨大的道格拉斯枞树高耸入云。
risk n.危险；风险；投资报酬的风险 vt.冒 ... 的危险；承受...的风险	(1) He saved my life at the risk of his own. (2) Loans to farmers are now considered to be a bad risk. (3) If you don't warm up before taking exercise, you risk injuring yourself. (4) The investor is not willing to risk the money in any investment.	(1) 他冒着自己的生命危险救了我的命。 (2) 贷款给农民现在被认为要承受糟糕的投资报酬风险。 (3) 假如运动前不做准备活动,你就有受伤的危险。 (4) 投资者不愿承受将这笔钱用于投资的风险。
roast n.烤肉；烘烤 v.烤；烘焙；晒；<俚>痛斥 adj.烘烤的；烤过的	(1) Let's have a nice roast for Sunday dinner. (2) His mouth watered at the sight of roast. (3) They had a hot dog roast last Sunday. (4) The beef is roasting nicely on the spit. (5) As the roast darkens, caffeine and acidity decrease proportionately. (6) The ability to replicate a roast time and time again can be accomplished with sound profile management practices. (7) They sat in the sun roasting themselves. (8) His favorite dish is roast duck. (9) We had fish for the first course, followed by roast fowl and fresh vegetables.	(1) 我们星期天晚上好好吃一顿烤肉吧。 (2) 他看见烤肉就垂涎三尺。 (3) 他们上星期天举行了一次烤热狗野餐会。 (4) 这块牛肉在烤肉叉上烤得很好。 (5) 烘焙度越深，咖啡因含量越少，酸度也越小。 (6) 屡次重复烘焙的能力能够完成管理概况的实践。 (7) 他们坐着晒太阳。 (8) 他最喜欢吃的菜是烤鸭。 (9) 我们吃的第一道菜是鱼，接著上的菜是烤禽肉和新鲜蔬菜。
role n.作用；角色	(1) The Panama Canal has played a very important role in transportation. (2) The key role of the teacher in the learning process should not be neglected. (3) The role of the railway declines in the transport system. (4) He played a passive role in the marriage. (5) His dual role as a composer and a conductor made him very busy.	(1) 巴拿马运河在运输上起到了非常重要的作用。 (2) 教师在学习中的关键作用是不该忽视的。 (3) 在运输系统中,铁路的重要性逐渐下降。 (4) 他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。 (5) 他作曲家和指挥家的双重身份使他非常繁忙。
roll n.卷；滚动；名单；压路机；颤音；圆形物，面包卷 v.摇摆；滚；绕；转动；展开	(1) Love comes quick and passes away quick too. Only the pork roll will go on. (2) The desk calculator use a roll of paper. (3) A ball can roll smoothly on a plane. (4) Merlin tried different ways to make himself roll. (5) The platoon mustered for roll call. (6) The ship was rolling heavily to and fro. (7) The dog rolled on the floor. (8) You should roll the wool into a ball before you start knitting. (9) Jeanie would roll the pearl necklace around her fingers. (10) The ailerons are moved in opposite senses to make the plane roll. (11) When in the SAF-t in parts of coloured ink, swivel hinge-drum, view the SAF-t and the hinge-clip roll coloring. (12) Roll out the map so that we can all see it. (13) Create data-driven subscriptions that roll out reports to a large recipient list.	(1) 爱情来得快去得也快,只有猪肉卷才是永恒的。 (2) 这台台式计算机使用卷纸。 (3) 球可以在水平面上流畅地滚动。 (4) 莫林试了很多不同的方式，想让自己滚动起来。 (5) 全排集合点名。 (6) 那船晃来晃去很不平稳。 (7) 狗在地板上打滚。 (8) 你应当在织毛活儿以前先把毛线绕成线球。 (9) 珍琳妮会把项链绕在手指上的。 (10) 副翼向相反的方向转动就会使得飞机翻滚。 (11) 调整时，在折刀的刀刃部位涂上油墨，转动折页滚筒，查看折刀和折页夹辊的着色情况。 (12) 将地图展开，好让我们都看见。 (13) 创建可以将报表展开为大型收件人列表的数据驱动订阅。
roller n.滚筒；滚轴；滚转机；巨浪	(1) There is rust spot on some of the roller. (2) Be careful to keep the roller and plate clean. (3) May I borrow your roller skates? (4) A road roller is used in making and repairing roads. (5) Huge rollers broke on the beach.	(1) 有些滚筒上有锈斑。 (2) 注意使辊轴和版材保持干净。 (3) 我可以借你的旱冰鞋吗？ (4) 压路机是用来修筑道路的。 (5) 巨浪冲击着海滩。
roller skating 滑旱冰	(1) I was knocked down by someone on roller skates.	(1) 我被一个滑旱冰的人撞倒了。
roof n.屋顶；顶 vt.覆盖；给 ... 覆以屋顶	(1) The wind was whispering in the roof. (2) Has your roof a sharp slant? (3) Snow sifted through the crack in the roof into the room. (4) The stone made a dent in the roof of my car. (5) We're going to roof in the yard to make a garage. (6) The shed was roofed over with tin.	(1) 屋顶上风声飒飒。 (2) 你的屋顶是否有一个陡峭的斜面？ (3) 雪从屋顶上的裂缝飘进屋里。 (4) 我的汽车顶让石头砸了个坑。 (5) 我们打算将院子加盖屋顶建成一个车库。 (6) 那间小屋以马口铁为屋顶。
rooster n.公鸡；雄禽；狂妄自负的人	(1) The rooster clawed a hole in the earth. (2) The rooster disappeared under the car. (3) Don't talk with him; he is a rooster.	(1) 那只公鸡在地上扒出个洞来。 (2) 公鸡消失在车子底下。 (3) 别理他，他太狂妄自负了。
root n.根；根源；根本 v.生根；扎根；根除	(1) Ann caught her foot on a tree root and stumbled. (2) The dog is snuffling around the root of a tree. (3) Unhappiness is the root cause of his illness. (4) Money is thought to be the root cause of all evils. (5) I finally got to the root of the problem. (6) Roses will not root in such acid soil. (7) After a few months I felt I had really taken root here. (8) The pegged-down branches of the plant will take root. (9) It is vain to attempt to root out heresy by force.	(1) 安的一只脚被树根绊了一下跌倒了。 (2) 那条狗在树根处嗅来嗅去。 (3) 不开心是他生病的根源。 (4) 金钱被认为是万恶之源。 (5) 我们最终抓住了问题的实质 (6) 玫瑰在这种酸性土壤中不会生根。 (7) 几个月之后，我感到确实在这里扎根了。 (8) 固定的植物的枝条将会扎根。 (9) 试图用暴力消除异端邪说是徒劳的。
rope n.绳索；一串；绞刑 v.捆绑；说服（口）	(1) The rope was not strong enough, so we used wire. (2) They tied their prisoner up with a piece of rope. (3) I bought a beautiful rope of pearls. (4) He roped his horse on a nearby tree. (5) We must try and rope in as many helpers as possible. (6) He tried to rope Ted in on that swindle.	(1) 这根绳子不够结实，所以我们用金属线。 (2) 他们用绳索把犯人捆起来。 (3) 我买了一串很好看的珠子。 (4) 他把马拴到附近的一棵树上。 (5) 我们必须想法说服尽可能多的人来帮忙。 (6) 他想拉特德入伙参加那个骗局。

(4) There was a tombstone made of rose granite, adorned by an American flag and a bouquet of plastic flowers. (5) The life of a rose is counted by hours. (6) It's a story of Flintlock and Blood Rose. rot n.腐烂；腐蚀；败坏；胡话 v.腐烂；使 ... 枯朽；消瘦	(1) Foot rot is an avoidable affiction. (2) Rot in the tree trunk caused the tree to fall. (3) The roof timbers were affected by rot and insect attack. (4) We should stop it the minute the rot sets in. (5) The rot set inwhen we lost that important customer in Japan. (6) They're bound to win.' Rot! They haven't a chance!' (7) He's talking rot when he says that the company is almost bankrupt. (8) This cheap wine will rot your stomach. (9) The meat will rot if it isn't kept cool. (10) Too much television rots your brain. (11) They didn't buy the house because it had dry rot. (12) The prisoner is left to rot in the jail.	(1) 烂蹄病是可以避免的。 (2) 树干的腐烂导致树倒了。 (3) 屋顶的木料已经腐朽并遭虫害。 (4) 腐败一产生，我们就应立即制止住。 (5) 我们失去了日本的那家重要客户後,情况越来越糟了。 (6) ｀他们一定赢. (7) 他说这家公司快要破产了，简直是胡说八道。 (8) 这种劣质葡萄喝了会伤胃。 (9) 肉如果不冷藏就会腐败。 (10) 多看电视会使你的头脑退化。 (11) 他们没有买那座房子，因为房子的木料已经干朽了。 (12) 这个囚徒被投入监狱任凭他渐渐消瘦下去。

(3) She suggested it in a very roundabout way. (4) I entered the village by the little roundabout lane. (5) Turn left at the next roundabout. (6) The car stalled at the roundabout. (7) There was a slight noise behind her and she turned just in time to seize a small boy by the slack of his roundabout and arrest his flight.	(1) 我们绕远道驾车回家。 (2) 出租车没有走直路，而是绕道行驶。 (3) 她很婉转地提出了这个建议。 (4) 我由一条迂回曲折的小径进了村。 (5) 在下一个环形交叉路口向左转。 (6) 那辆汽车在环形交叉处抛锚了。 (7) 这时在她身后传来一声轻微的响声，她转身一把抓住了一个小男孩的短外套的衣角，他想跑都跑不掉了。

(4) You just need to break out of that boring routine. (5) The film is a love story, with routine portraits of a conductor and a violinist. (6) It was a rather routine performance. (4) Like those who work for government or nonprofit organizations, they are salaried rather than paid a fee. (4) Looking at a beautiful painting always gives one satisfaction. (5) The store owner received satisfaction for the damage. (6) Unless you push your claims you'll get no satisfaction. (7) It was a great satisfaction to have revisited our native village. (8) I will dispose the matter to your satisfaction. (9) It's been proved to my satisfaction that you're telling the truth. (10) Can you demonstrate to our satisfaction that your story is true?	(1) 包你满意。 (2) 他的脸上露出满意的神情。 (3) 获胜者满意地笑了。 (4) 观赏一幅美丽的图画使人心满意足。 (5) 店主收到了对损坏的赔偿。 (6) 如果你不努力争取,你就得赔偿。 (7) 重访家乡是非常愉快的事。 (8) 这件事我一定会处理妥当，包你满意。 (9) 我确信你说的是实话。 (10) 你能不能证实一下，让我们确信你说的是事实?
satisfy v.使满意；满足；使信服；清偿	(1) Some people are very hard to satisfy. (2) We always satisfy our customers with good service. (3) We must satisfy the people's needs. (4) Output cannot satisfy the demands of the market. (5) Her explanation did not satisfy the teacher. (6) He tried to satisfy the police of his innocence. (7) He has satisfied a claim for damages.	(1) 有些人是很难使其满意的。 (2) 我们总是以良好的服务来满足顾客。 (3) 我们要满足人民的需要。 (4) 产量无法满足市场需求。 (5) 她的解释没有让老师信服。 (6) 他设法使警察相信他是无辜的。 (7) 他已经答应赔偿损害的请求。
sauce n.酱汁；调味汁；<口>无礼 vt.给 ... 调味；使 ... 增加趣味；对 ... 无礼	(1) Waiter, may I have steak sauce, please？ (2) The cook poured the sauce over the food. (3) The secret of this dish is in the sauce. (4) He sauced criticism with flattery (5) Should I sauce this in soy sauce? (6) He sauced a talk with humour. (7) Good boys do not sauce their parents. (8) How dare you sauce your mother?	(1) 服务生,请给我一些牛排酱汁。 (2) 厨师将调味汁倒在食物上。 (3) 这道菜好吃的秘诀在于调味汁。 (4) 他用谄媚来冲淡批评。 (5) 我要不要给它加点儿酱油? (6) 他幽默的谈吐给报告增添了趣味。 (7) 好孩子不会对父母无礼的。 (8) 你怎么对你母亲这么无礼呢?
saucer n.茶托；碟子	(1) He is drinking with a cup and saucer. (2) First, Linc pushed over a chair and jolted a knickknack table off its accustomed site hard enough so that a cup and saucer fell to the rug. (3) The cat has upset its saucer of milk. (4) I think I prefer the round plate and saucer,though.	(1) 他正在用带茶托的茶杯喝茶。 (2) 第一，林克推翻了一个椅子，把一个放小摆设的小桌子用力的推离了原来的位置，使上面的一个杯子和茶托掉到了地毯上。 (3) 那只猫打翻了它的牛奶碟子。 (4) 虽然如此，我想我还是偏好圆形盘子和小碟子。
sausage n.香肠；腊肠	(1) She loves sausage and mash. (2) Many people don't like blood sausage. (3) The sausage began to spit in the pan. (4) I'll take a pound of that sausage.	(1) 她喜欢香肠和土豆泥。 (2) 很多人不喜欢黑香肠。 (3) 锅里香肠开始滋滋作响。 (4) 我买一磅那种腊肠。
savage adj.野性的；凶猛的；粗鲁的；荒野的；原始的 n.野蛮人；粗人；凶恶的人 vt.激烈抨击；猛烈攻击	(1) Most of the time elephants are tame but they can be very savage. (2) He was wild and savage, and no man could mount him, or do anything at all with him. (3) He smarted from the savage attacks on his film. (4) She was irritated by his savage behavior. (5) He likes savage mountain scenery. (6) The inhabitants were still in the savage state. (7) These civilizations flourished while Europeans were still savages living in caves. (8) There are no savage and civilised peoples; there are only different cultures. (9) Smith's play was savaged by the critics.	(1) 大多数时候大象很温顺,但他们也会大发野性。 (2) 它既野又凶，谁都驾驭不了它，谁也对它没办法。 (3) 他因自己的影片受到猛烈攻击而感到痛心。 (4) 他的不文明行为激怒了她。 (5) 他喜欢荒山的景色。 (6) 这些居民仍处于野蛮状态。 (7) 当欧洲人还是居住在洞穴中的野蛮人时，这些地方的文化早已十分繁荣昌盛。 (8) 人无野蛮与文明之分,只是文化不同。 (9) 史密斯的剧本遭到评论家的猛烈抨击。
saying n.谚语；俗话；格言 动词say的现在分词.	(1) As the saying goes the early bird catches the worm. (2) An old trader's saying warns to be wary of smiling Squibs. (3) As the saying goes, a drowning man clutches at a straw. (4) Each woodcarving has a saying next to it. (5) This saying, therefore, teaches us to be industrious.	(1) 谚语说，早起的鸟有食吃。 (2) 老生意人有句俗话，提醒你要当心满面堆笑的斯奎布人。 (3) 正如俗话所说，溺水的人见到一根稻草也要抓。 (4) 这些木雕旁一律配着一句格言。 (5) 因此，这句格言教导我们要勤奋用功。
scan vt.扫描；浏览；审视；细看 vi.合韵律；划分音步 n.扫描；浏览；细看	(1) Could you teach me how to scan an image? (2) I scanned the newspaper when I was waiting for the bus. (3) She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking. (4) I scanned my pocket for change. (5) The doctors gave him an ultrasonic brain scan. (6) I'm too busy to read the whole newspaper, I just scan the headline. (7) Employers receive many resumes and must scan each of them quickly.	(1) 你可以教我如何扫描一个影像吗? (2) 等公共汽车的时候，我匆匆浏览了一下报纸。 (3) 她审视他的脸,试图探寻他在思考什么。 (4) 我仔细查看囗袋找零钱。 (5) 医生给他做了脑部超声波扫描检查。 (6) 我太忙了，没法看整份报纸，只是浏览了一下大标题。 (7) 雇主会收到许多简历，因此必须快速浏览它们。
scar n.疤痕；伤痕；断崖 v.结疤；痊愈	(1) The scar flawed her beauty. (2) The cut in her hand has healed completely, without leaving a scar. (3) In that heart, where there had been a wound, there was a scar. (4) The wound gradually scarred over. (5) The cut on his finger will eventually scar over. (6) Her scar tissue would heal and she would have daily treatment with eye drops and cream.	(1) 这伤疤损害了她的美貌。 (2) 她手上的刀伤完全愈合了,没有留下一点伤痕。 (3) 在他的心上，从前有过一条伤口，后来只剩下一条伤痕。 (4) 伤口渐渐愈合。 (5) 他指头上的伤口最后会结疤痊愈。 (6) 她的伤口组织会慢慢痊愈，每天还要滴眼药水和眼药膏。
scare v.受惊吓；恐吓；吓走 n.惊吓；惊恐	(1) You scare them to death with your mouth. (2) We'll scare her out of telling the police. (3) His threats scared them out of carrying out the plan. (4) The dog scared the thief away. (5) You did give me a scare. (6) There was a bomb scare during the procession.	(1) 你一开口就能把人吓死。 (2) 我们要把她吓得不敢报警。 (3) 他的威胁迫使他们不敢实行该计划。 (4) 狗把小偷吓走了。 (5) 你真吓了我一跳。 (6) 在列队行进时因怀疑有炸弹而引起恐慌。

(5) My tutor is an accomplished scholar. (6) The greatest scholar cannot solve this difficult problem. (7) He went abroad to study as a scholar. (8) She was a British Council scholar. secure adj.安全的；牢靠的；稳妥的 vt.使安全；获得；固定	(1) If you are not sure it is secure, do not debug it. (2) His place in history is now secure. (3) A climber needs secure footholds. (4) We must create a secure and reliable international environment of lasting peace and stability. (5) The document shall be kept in a secure place. (6) Some measures are needed to secure the farmland against shift sand. (7) There is no magic wand to secure a just peace. (8) We must prepare our claim and send it to the insurance company to secure payment. (9) Remove the five screws that secure the battery tray to the vehicle. (10) The gate won't stay open, so we'll have to secure it to the post.	(1) 如果您不能确定它是安全的,请不要调试它。 (2) 他在历史上的地位现在已经稳固了。 (3) 攀登的人脚踩的地方要很牢固。 (4) 我们要创造安全可靠、长期稳定的国际和平环境。 (5) 文件应保管在安全的地方。 (6) 需要采取措施使农田免遭流沙的侵袭。 (7) 要获得正义的和平并非易事。 (8) 我们得准备好索赔要求，并把它寄给保险公司以便获得赔偿。 (9) 拆下固定电池架到车身的五个螺丝。 (10) 大门不能一直开着,所以我们不得不将它固定在柱子上。
security n.安全；保证；证券；债券；抵押；防护措施	(1) I'll undertake for your security. (2) Our own actions are our security. (3) He traded in securities and became rich. (4) The value of a derivative is based on another security. (5) He has given his house as security for the loan. (6) A life insurance policy may serve as security for a loan. (7) We need greater security in car parks.	(1) 我将保证你的安全。 (2) 我们的行为是自己的保证。 (3) 他做证券交易发了财。 (4) 金融衍生工具的价值以另一种债券为基准。 (5) 他以抵押自己的房屋作为贷款的担保。 (6) 人寿保险可作贷款的抵押。 (7) 我们需要加强停车场的安全措施.
seed n.种子 vi.播种；(植物)结实 vt.播种	(1) The farmers were scattering seed on the fields. (2) Part of every crop is saved for seed. (3) Most plants propagate by seed. (4) Do you know about the evolution of a seed into a plant? (5) Peasants plough up and seed in the spring ! (6) These plants will not seed in a cold climate. (7) The fields have been seeded with corn.	(1) 农夫把种子撒在田里。 (2) 每一种庄稼都留一部分作种子。 (3) 大多数植物靠种子繁殖。 (4) 你知道从种子发展成为植物的过程吗？ (5) 农民在春天犁地播种。 (6) 这些植物在寒冷气候里不会结子。 (7) 田里播种了玉米。
melon seed 甜瓜子	(1) And a vegetable and melon seed and seedling cultivation base. (2) Is eating melon seed still very it is good to eat earthnut why? (3) Alwin: Ah my little sugar-candy. Oh, my little melon seed. (4) Give me a beer and some melon seeds, please. (5) A second important consequence of the collision was major strike slip faulting, facilitating the tectonic "escape" of China like a squeezed melon seed. (6) We played checkers and ate melon seeds and peanuts all night.	(1) 蔬瓜种子种苗基地。 (2) 吃瓜子好还是吃花生好为什么？ (3) 阿尔文:呀，我的小糖果。噢，我的小瓜子哦。 (4) 请给我一瓶啤酒和一些瓜子。 (5) 碰撞的第二个重要结果是主要的平移断层，它促进了中国构造的逃离，就象一颗被挤出的西瓜籽。 (6) 我们整个晚上都在下西洋棋，吃瓜子和花生。
seek vt.寻求；追求；试图 vi.寻找	(1) Tortured by fear, he decided to seek the aid of a psychiatrist. (2) Many single people are seeking that special someone. (3) Some nations will seek the change of their energy supply sources to reduce emissions, or for other reasons. (4) You seek all day and you find it, and then you realize that it is worthless.	(1) 他终日恐惧不安,决定寻求心理医生的帮助。 (2) 许多单身人士都在追求他们的唯一。 (3) 为了减少碳排量,或是出于其他原因,一些国家试图改变他们的能源供应来源。 (4) 你终日寻寻觅觅,找到了,之后却发现那根本不值得寻找。
see-saw n.跷跷板 adj.反复变化的；摇摆不定的 vi.玩跷跷板	(1) Near the seesaw I saw a saw saw the wood into four. (2) How may saws could a see-saw saw if a see-saw could saw saws?	(1) 在跷跷板附近，我看见一个锯子把那木头锯成四段。 (2) 如果跷跷板能看见锯子的话，它能看见几个？
seize v.抓住；夺取；利用；没收	(1) Seize the chance, otherwise you'll regret it. (2) Before he could run away, she seized him by the collar. (3) He would seize upon any excuse to justify himself. (4) They seize the drugs and arrest the people on the boats.	(1) 抓住这个机会，否则你会后悔的。 (2) 在他逃跑之前,她抓住了他的衣领。 (3) 他会利用任何借口为自己辩解。 (4) 他们没收毒品,逮捕船上的人。
seldom adv.很少；难得	(1) The apple tree is seldom fruitful. (2) I have seldom seen such brutality. (3) We go out very seldom. (4) She seldom, if ever, goes to the cinema.	(1) 这棵苹果树很少结果。 (2) 我很少见到这种暴行。 (3) 我们绝少外出。 (4) 她难得看电影。
select v.选择；挑选 adj.精选的；优等的 n.被挑选出来的人或物	(1) Please select a channel to begin with from left. (2) She lets her son select his own Christmas present. (3) They select him to their leader. (4) She selected a diamond ring from the collection. (5) You may select those books you like best. (6) A select group were invited to the wedding reception. (7) Select film excerpts will be played on the film festival. (8) This is a very select area; you have to be rich to live here.	(1) 请从左边选择一个频道。 (2) 她让儿子自己选择圣诞礼物。 (3) 他们选择他为他们的领导人。 (4) 她从收藏品中挑选了一枚钻石戒指。 (5) 你可以从那些书中挑选你最喜欢的书。 (6) 一群经过挑选的人士被邀请参加婚宴。 (7) 精选电影摘录将在电影节播放。 (8) 这是高级住宅区，你必须有钱才能住在这里。
self n.自己；本性；自我 pron.我自己；你自己；他或她自己 adj.始终如一的；同一类型的；性质不变的 v.近亲繁殖；自花授粉	(1) He is now out of all conceit with his former self. (2) I do not like to go to the movies by my self. (3) Suddenly it all falls out of relation to her basic henny self, and she realizes she has lost her life. (4) Knowledge of self increases as one gets older. (5) There are many doorways to your Divine Self. (6) I was looking for some resemblance between my ancestor and my self. (7) Before doing anything, ask your Higher Self, God, and us angels to guide you. (8) If you would have a faithful servant, and one that you like, serve your self.	(1) 他现在全盘否定了他原来的自己。 (2) 我不喜欢自己一个人看电影。 (3) 瞬间这一切与她如母鸡一样的本性毫无关系，她意识到她已失去了自己的生活。 (4) 随着年岁的增长，人们的自我认识也不断加深。 (5) 通往你的神性自我有许多门道。 (6) 我在寻找我的祖先和我自己之间的某些相似之处。 (7) 在你做任何事之前，祈请你自己的高我，上主，和天使来引领你。 (8) 如果你想得到一个忠诚的仆人，这个人就是你自己。
selfish adj.自私的；利己的	(1) A selfish person always thinks about himself. (2) I am becoming more and more irritated by his selfish behaviour. (3) I call his behaviour mean and selfish. (4) Nobody but you could be so selfish. (5) I have been a selfish being all my life, in practice, though not in principle.	(1) 一个自私的人总是想着自己。 (2) 我对他那种自私的行为愈加恼火起来。 (3) 我认为他的行为卑鄙、 自私。 (4) 除了你之外，谁也不会这样自私。 (5) 我生平是个利己的人，虽然只在实践而非原则上如此。

semicircle n.半圆；半圆形；半圆物	(1) An angle in a semicircle is a right angle. (2) We sat in a semicircle round the fire. (3) We sat in a semicircle facing the teacher.	(1) 半圆所对的圆周角是直角。 (2) 我们坐在炉火前，围成一个半圆形。 (3) 我们面对着老师坐成半圆形。
senior adj.地位较高的；高级的；年长的；资深的 n.上司；年长者；长辈；大四学生	(1) He is senior to me, though he is younger. (2) She was unfit for such a senior position. (3) Lying north of the church is a girls' senior high school. (4) A senior member of the committee is authorized to act for the chairman during his absence. (5) The three vice-ministers are my seniors. (6) He is my senior by two years. (7) This is a senior of the profession. (8) The seniors defeated the juniors by 3-1.	(1) 他地位比我高，虽然他比我年轻。 (2) 她不能胜任这样的高级职位。 (3) 位于这座教堂以北的是一所女子高中。 (4) 主席不在时,授权委员会中的一位资深委员代理他的职务。 (5) 三位副部长都是我的上司。 (6) 他比我大两岁。 (7) 这是一位同行中的老前辈。 (8) 四年级学生以三比一战胜了三年级学生。
sense n.感官；感觉；意识；鉴赏力；意义；理智；道理；见识 v.感觉；意识到；理解；检测	(1) I lost my sense of taste. (2) I'm afraid I haven't got a very good sense of directions, so I easily get lost. (3) He felt an overwhelming sense of loss. (4) Your brother has a good sense of humor. (5) Scholars tend to lack a sense of proportion. (6) The sense of the word is not clear. (7) The sense of the novel is the inevitability og human tragedy. (8) Forget it. He had lost his senses. (9) Don't act so foolishly, John. Come to your senses. (10) There is no sense in waiting three hours. (11) There is a lot of sense in what she has said. (12) The horse sensed danger and stopped. (13) Lisa sensed that he did not believe her. (14) Can you sense the essence of this poem? (15) The apparatus can sense the presence of toxic gases.	(1) 我丧失了味觉。 (2) 恐怕我的方位感很差，因此我容易迷路。 (3) 他感到非常失落。 (4) 你兄弟很有幽默感。 (5) 学者往往缺乏冷静地辨别轻重缓急的能力。 (6) 这个词的意义不明确。 (7) 这部小说的含义是人类悲剧的不可避免性。 (8) 别放在心上。他是失去理智了。 (9) 别丑态百出啦，约翰，放理智点。 (10) 等三个小时是不合理的。 (11) 她说的话很有见地。 (12) 马感觉到了危险，于是停了下来。 (13) 莉萨意识到他不相信她。 (14) 你能理解这首诗的精华吗？ (15) 这个仪器能够检测出有毒气体的存在。
sensitive adj.灵敏的；敏感的；感光的；易受伤害的；善解人意的 n.敏感的人	(1) She's got very sensitive hearing, skin, etc. (2) Don't be so sensitive and I was not criticizing you. (3) What food and fruit are sensitive? (4) The film is coated with light sensitive chemicals, which are change by the different shades and colors of light. (5) Wear rubber gloves if you have very sensitive skin.	(1) 她的听觉、 触觉等很灵敏。 (2) 别那么敏感,我不是在批评你。 (3) 哪些食物和水果是感光的？ (4) 胶卷上涂了一层感光的化学物质，这些物质因光的不同色度与颜色而改变。 (5) 如果你的皮肤容易受伤的话,就带上橡胶手套。
sentence n.句子；判决 vt.宣判；判决	(1) It is a fact that I have written this sentence. (2) The judge will pass sentence tomorrow after looking at the report. (3) He has been sentenced to pay a fine of 1000 pounds.	(1) 我写了这个句子是事实。 (2) 法官看完报告后明天会做出判决。 (3) 他被判罚款1000英镑。
separate adj.分开的；不同的；单独的；各自的 v.分开；隔开；区分；分居；脱离 n.分开；抽印本	(1) Can these two definitions be conflated, or must they be kept separate? (2) I advocate separate classes for students to learn Chinese in different ways. (3) We don't have a separate dining room—the living area is all one. (4) The house is divided into two living units or residences, usually having separate entrances. (5) We'd better separate the good ones from the bad ones. (6) This examination is intended to separate the sheep from the goats. (7) Children suffer from divided loyalties when their parents separate. (8) We should never separate from the masses. (9) Nothing can separate them from each other now. (10) It's hard for me to separate the two fighting boys.	(1) 这两个定义可以合成一个呢，还是必须分开? (2) 我建议我们分班授课，让不同的学生以不同的方式学习华文。 (3) 我们没有单独的饭厅——活动空间都在一处。 (4) 房屋分为两个居住部分,一般具有各自的出口。 (5) 我们最好把好的和坏的分开。 (6) 这次考试就是想区分一下水平高低。 (7) 父母分居时孩子们会因不知对谁忠诚为好而感到痛苦。 (8) 我们绝不应该脱离群众。 (9) 现在什么也不能把他们彼此分开了。 (10) 我很难把这两个打架的孩子分开。
separately adv.分别地；个别地；独立地；分开地	(1) He said he would see each of us separately. (2) We saw the play separately and compared notes afterwards. (3) Please be sure that you wrap each item separately. (4) None of us can afford it separately, so let's pool our money. (5) Living separately from parents after marriage is all the mode today.	(1) 他说他将分别约见我们每一个人。 (2) 我们各自看了那出戏,后来交换了意见。 (3) 请确保个别地包装每件物品。 (4) 我们中无人能独立应付，所以让我们把钱凑起来。 (5) 婚后与父母分开住是现在非常流行的做法。
separation n.分离；分居；缺口；分隔线；[化]离析；【航】间隔	(1) Separation from her children was a terrible wrench. (2) He reminded me of the separation of church and state. (3) Friends managed to reconcile him with his wife after years of separation.	(1) 同她的孩子们分别是一项很大的痛苦。 (2) 他提醒我政教是分离的。 (3) 经过多年分居后朋友们设法使他与妻子重修旧好。
servant n.仆人	(1) Satan is still a servant of God. (2) The servant enjoyed his master's confidence. (3) He is a humble and submissive servant. (4) A politician should be a servant of the people.	(1) 撒旦仍是上帝的奴仆。 (2) 这仆人深得主人的信赖。 (3) 他是个恭顺的仆人。 (4) 政治家应是人民的公仆。
service n.服务；发球；服役；公务部门；礼拜仪式；(车辆、机器等定期的)维修 v.保养；维护；提供服务；支付(借款)利息	(1) The volunteers for community service are doing a good job. (2) We all complain about the poor service in the hotel coffee lounge. (3) You must run fast enough to return his service. (4) I'd like to know something about badminton game,first,can you tell me about the service? (5) His poor health disbarred him from further service in the army. (6) His military service was deferred. (7) His father had been in the diplomatic service. (8) I have a service passport to America. (9) Mass is a kind of Church service. (10) He suggested that my car should be serviced. (11) We have the machines serviced regularly. (12) And once in orbit,there's no inexpensive and simple way to service them. (13) The power station is serviced by road transport. (14) I had to service a lot of debts last year.	(1) 社区服务的义工做得很出色。 (2) 我们都抱怨饭店咖啡休息室的劣质服务。 (3) 你必须要跑得很快才可能接起他的发球。 (4) 我想了解一下羽毛球比赛，能否先给我说说发球? (5) 因身体欠佳，他不能继续在军队服役。 (6) 他被允许缓期服役。 (7) 他的父亲曾在外交部门供职。 (8) 我有美国的公务护照。 (9) 弥撒是教会的一种礼拜仪式。 (10) 他建议我把汽车送去保养。 (11) 我们请人定期维修机器。 (12) 一旦进入轨道，也没有一套简便和低耗的方式来对它们进行维护。 (13) 这座发电站的燃料是通过公路运送的。 (14) 去年我不得不为债务支付大量的利息。
session n.会议；会期；开庭期；学期；一段时间	(1) If the negotiations between the rich northerly nations and poor southerly nations make headway, it is intended that a ministerial session in December should be arranged. (2) Several bills were enacted at the end of this session of Parliament. (3) Is Parliament in session during the summer? (4) Be seated! This court is now in session. (5) The Congress ended its first session on January4. (6) She attended the summer session of college.	(1) 要是北方富国和南方穷国之间的谈判获得进展的话,就打算在十二月份安排召开部长级的会议。 (2) 这届国会结束时，好几个议案制定成为法律。 (3) 议会在夏季是开会期吗? (4) 请坐下！本庭现在开庭。 (5) 代表大会第一次会议在1月4日结束。 (6) 她上大学的暑期班。
settle v.解决；定居；安顿；平静；结算 n.背长椅，座位；定居，安顿	(1) If you pay for both of us now, we can settle up later. (2) An official mission was sent to settle the dispute. (3) The two companies settled out of court. (4) They moved the local people and settle them in another place. (5) He's of an age when he ought to settle down. (6) The thunderstorm may settle the weather.	(1) 你要是现在先付清咱们两人的帐，事后咱们俩再细算。 (2) 一个官方使团被派去解决争端。 (3) 两家公司在法院外了结了争端。 (4) 他们把当地人迁移到别处定居。 (5) 他已经到了应该安顿下来的年龄了。 (6) 这场雷暴过后天气可能反而好些。
settlement n.解决；结算；协议；安置；殖民；定居	(1) There is no prospect of a settlement of the dispute. (2) Negotiators are looking for a peaceful settlement to the dispute. (3) After much discussion the negotiators hammered out a compromise settlement. (4) I enclose a cheque in settlement of your account. (5) The pressure is now on the unions to reach a settlement. (6) They hope to be able to patch together a temporary settlement. (7) The long French sojourn in Canada before English settlement has left its marks.	(1) 这场纠纷根本不可能获得解决。 (2) 谈判双方正寻求和平解决争端的办法。 (3) 双方经多次谈判达成一项折衷的解决办法。 (4) 兹附支票一张以结清贵处帐目。 (5) 目前正对各工会施加压力，要他们达成协议。 (6) 他们希望能草草搭成一个临时安置区。 (7) 在英国殖民者之前，法国人在加拿大的长期居留也留下了痕迹。
settler n.【C】移居者；定居者	(1) The settlers were soon acclimated. (2) One of his forefathers was an early settler in America. (3) The government allotted a stretch of land to each settler.	(1) 移居者很快就适应了。 (2) 他的祖先之一是美洲的早期移民。 (3) 政府分配给每个居民一块地。
seventeen num.十七	(1) We covered seventeen miles on foot. (2) My grandmother got married at the age of seventeen.	(1) 我们步行了十七英里。 (2) 我的祖母十七岁就结婚了。
seventh num.第七；七分之一	(1) He was laid out in the seventh round. (2) It has just entered the seventh edition. (3) He's pulled up from the seventh to the second place. (4) A seventh of the profit will be sent to charity.	(1) 他在第七回合中被打倒了。 (2) 它刚出版了第七版。 (3) 他已从第七名跃升到第二名。 (4) 七分之一的利润将捐赠慈善事业。
seventy 七十	(1) We were bowling along (the motorway) at seventy miles per hour. (2) This hall holds a maximum of seventy people. (3) You should forgive him for his forgetfulness; after all, he is over seventy. (4) I pay him seventy dollars a week. (5) The temperature today is seventy degrees Fahrenheit. (6) His grandfather is nearly seventy.	(1) 我们以每小时七十英里的速度(在高速公路上)飞驰。 (2) 这厅最多容纳七十人。 (3) 你应该原谅他的健忘症，毕竟他已经七十多岁了。 (4) 我一星期付给他70美元。 (5) 今天气温是华氏七十度。 (6) 他爷爷快七十岁了。
severe adj.严厉的；严重的；剧烈的；严格的；严峻的	(1) The premier came under severe criticism. (2) He's suffering from severe mental disorder. (3) A severe storm turned the small village down to ground. (4) The new product has stood a severe proof . (5) They can withstand severe tests.	(1) 这位总理遭到严厉的抨击。 (2) 他患有严重的精神病。 (3) 一场剧烈的风暴把小村夷为平地。 (4) 新产品经受了严格的考验。 (5) 他们能经得起严峻的考验。
sew v.缝合；缝纫	(1) The skirt is finished I'm now going to sew a pocket on. (2) I'll just sew up that tear, and the coat will be as good as new. (3) Sew that part all along. (4) She preferred to sew rather than to knit. (5) The quickest way to sew is with a sewing machine.	(1) 裙子做好了--我现在再缝上个口袋。 (2) 我把大衣的破处缝好，就会完好如新了。 (3) 把那部分从头到尾缝合起来。 (4) 她喜欢缝纫而不喜欢编织。 (5) 最快的缝纫办法是用缝纫机。
sex n.性别；性欲；性 vt.区别 ... 性别；引起 ... 性欲	(1) Everybody can come to this school,without respect to class, race, or sex. (2) She disguised her true sex under a man's garment. (3) Hunger and sex are elemental drives of human beings. (4) The movie is full of sex and violence. (5) It's difficult to sex newborn chicks.	(1) 不论阶级、种族、性别,人人都可以进这所学校上课。 (2) 她身穿男装来掩饰自己的真实性别。 (3) 食欲和性欲是人类的原始冲动。 (4) 这部电影充满了性和暴力。 (5) 新生小鸡雏的性别是很难判断的。
shabby adj.破旧的；寒酸的；低劣的，无耻的；卑劣的	(1) He owns nothing beyond the shabby house. (2) His shabby appearance creates a bad impression. (3) She is none the less beautiful for her shabby clothing. (4) His reasoning is weak, even shabby. (5) He even plays a shabby trick on his father.	(1) 除了那个破旧的房子,他一无所有。 (2) 他那寒酸的样子给人留下不好的印象。 (3) 即使她衣衫褴褛，却仍然美丽。 (4) 他的论证软弱无力，甚至可以说很拙劣。 (5) 他甚至同他的父亲玩弄卑鄙的手段。
shade n.阴影；遮蔽；遮光物；(色彩的)浓淡 vt.遮蔽；使阴暗；使渐变；略减（价格） vi.渐变	(1) This artist uses shade to good effect. (2) There are no trees or bushes to give shade. (3) Something,such as a window shade or a Venetian blind,that hinders vision or shuts out light. (4) The portrait shows fine effects of light and shade. (5) He tried to shade his house with thick trees. (6) He tried to shade in one side of his drawing. (7) Is it possible to shade the prices a little? (8) The colors of the light shaded from blue into purple.	(1) 这位画家有效地利用阴影。 (2) 没有树木或灌木丛可以遮荫。 (3) 遮光物如窗帘或软百叶窗等能遮挡视线或挡住阳光的物体。 (4) 这幅肖像画的浓淡色调表现得很好。 (5) 他想让这些大树把房子遮住。 (6) 他想把他那幅画的一边涂成阴影。 (7) 有没有可能降一点价格? (8) 光线的颜色由蓝逐渐变紫。
shadow n.影子；阴影；阴暗；荫；暗处 vt.投阴影于；跟踪；预示 vi.渐变；变阴暗 adj.影子内阁的；阴影的	(1) The tree cast its shadow on the wall. (2) His shadow followed him along the road. (3) The scandal cast a shadow on his career. (4) Sometimes she sits alone in the shadow. (5) He walked along in the shadows hoping no one would recognize him. (6) Figmentary fears can shadow our whole existence. (4) He saw some amazing sights at the zoo. (5) The ghastly sight gave him the shudders. (6) The hunter sighted carefully before firing his gun. (7) After three days at sea, we sighted land. (8) We like to sight stars with the telescope at night.	(1) 我正在接受激光治疗来提高我的视力。 (2) 船长命令我们凡是看见的陌生人都要将其枪毙。 (3) 火车仍在视线内。 (4) 他在动物园里看到一些珍禽异兽。 (5) 那恐怖的景象使他感到恐惧。 (6) 猎人射击前仔细瞄准。 (7) 我们在海上航行三天後见到了陆地。 (8) 我们喜欢在夜晚用望远镜观测星星。
sightseeing n.【U】观光；游览	(1) I spent most of my time in sightseeing. (2) We spent the remainder of the day sightseeing. (3) They embarked on an orgy of sightseeing. (4) Good morning, Mr.Smith. Sightseeing is our agenda today.	(1) 我大部分时间都用在观光游览上了。 (2) 这天剩下的时间我们到各处观光。 (3) 他们开始尽情地观光游览。 (4) 早上好，史密斯先生。我们今天的日程安排是游览。
signal n.信号；标志 v.(发信号)通知、表示 adj.显著的	(1) A red lamp is often a danger signal. (2) I corrected my watch by the time signal. (3) I've called several times, but I keep getting a busy signal. (4) We live too far from the city to get a strong television signal. (5) Her speech yesterday is a signal that her view has changed. (6) The police signalled the traffic to move forward slowly. (7) People speak of Mark Twain as a signal humourous writer. (8) This is a signal success.	(1) 红灯常常是危险的信号。 (2) 我按报时信号校正我的表。 (3) 我打了好几次了,可是一直是忙音。 (4) 我们住的地方离城里太远, 不能收到清晰的电视图像。 (5) 她昨天的讲话标志著她的观点已经转变。 (6) 警察向来往车辆打信号，示意缓慢前行。 (7) 人们称马克·吐温为杰出的幽默作家。 (8) 这是显著的成功。
signature n.签署；书帖；有特征的符号；【计】签名	(1) He traced his signature laboriously. (2) Her signature was an illegible scrawl.	(1) 他吃力地签上自己的名字。 (2) 她的签字潦草难辩。
significance n.重要性；意义	(1) Few people realized the significance of the discovery. (2) Our boss urged on us the significance of punctuality. (3) He puzzled out the significance of the statement. (4) Could you explain to me the significance of this part of the contract?	(1) 很少有人意识到这一发现的重要性. (2) 老板向我们强调守时的重要性。 (3) 他解释了这一论断的意义。 (4) 你能给我解释一下合同这一部分的含义吗？
silence n.沉默；寂静 vt.使安静；使沉默	(1) We interpreted his silence as a refusal. (2) His forceful arguments reduced his opponents to silence. (3) There was nothing but silence in the room. (4) A terrible silence descended upon the whole hall. (5) The teacher tried to silence the pupils. (6) The speaker tried to silence the angry crowd . (7) The enemy's guns were silenced by repeated bombings.	(1) 我们认为他的沉默是拒绝的表示。 (2) 他那有力的论点驳得对手哑口无言。 (3) 这间屋内声息全无，一片寂静。 (4) 一阵可怕的寂静突然笼罩着整个厅堂。 (5) 老师设法让学生们安静下来。 (6) 讲话者试图使愤怒的人群安静下来。 (7) 敌人的炮火因遭到轮番轰炸而沉寂了。
silent adj.安静的；不吵闹的；沉默的；无言的	(1) Would you be good enough to keep silent? (2) The old house was quite silent. (3) We sailed into a beautiful and silent bay. (4) She was a silent girl, cool and remote. (5) I represent the silent majority. (6) If you are arrested you have the right to remain silent. (7) She was blind to the silent worship in his eyes.	(1) 请你保持安静好吗？ (2) 这所旧房子非常寂静。 (3) 我们驶进一个美丽而安静的海湾。 (4) 她是一个沉默寡言的女孩，对人冷漠而孤傲。 (5) 我代表沉默的大多数。 (6) 如果你被捕，你有权保持沉默。 (7) 她没有发觉他眼里流露出的无声的敬慕之情。
silly adj.愚蠢的；琐屑的；可笑的；犯晕的 n.（通常指小孩子）淘气鬼；傻孩子	(1) The silly ending robs the plot of any credibility. (2) Don't get upset over silly things that people say. (3) I look pretty silly in this dress. (4) I took a swing at him and knocked him silly. (5) Listen, silly, we have to leave now. (6) He is not a silly boy,not by a jugful. (7) No, silly, those aren't your shoes!	(1) 这愚蠢的结尾使得整个情节变得一点都不可信。 (2) 不要在意人们的闲言碎语。 (3) 我穿这条裙看上去很可笑。 (4) 我挥拳打了他一下, 把他打得晕头转向。 (5) 听着,小淘气鬼,我们现在得走了。 (6) 他不是一个傻孩子。 (7) 不对，傻孩子，那不是你的鞋！
silver n.银币；银器；银；银灰色 adj.银的；银色的 vt.镀银于；使 ... 成银色	(1) He had some silver in his pocket. (2) Acid had pitted the surface of the silver. (3) His black hair was threaded with silver. (4) This board was cast in bronze not in silver. (5) This becomes silver gray, while I remember your handset was black. (6) You can recognize the genuine tape because of its silver grey color. (7) He found the chest to contain silver coins. (8) She wore a silver chain around her neck. (9) Every cloud has a silver lining. (10) There is not a silver hair on her head. (11) He silvered a mirror. (12) The years have silvered her hair.	(1) 他口袋里有些银币。 (2) 酸把银器的表面腐蚀了。 (3) 他的黑发中夹杂着银发。 (4) 这个牌匾是铜铸的,不是银制的。 (5) 怎么变银灰色了，我记得你的手机是黑色的。 (6) 你可以认出这种真正的带子，它是银灰色的。 (7) 他发现那囗箱子装着银币。 (8) 她脖子上戴着一条银项链。 (9) 黑暗中总有一丝光明。 (10) 她头上没有一根银发。 (11) 他给镜子镀上了一层银。 (12) 岁月已使她的青丝似雪。
similar adj.类似的	(1) The two buildings are similar on the whole. (2) I sympathize with you; I've had a similar unhappy experience myself. (3) He talked about it in a similar way. (4) Gold is similar in color to brass. (5) We have similar opinions.	(1) 从整体来看，这两幢楼是相似的。 (2) 我很同情你，我自己也有过类似的不幸遭遇。 (3) 他对此事有相似的说法。 (4) 金和铜颜色相仿。 (5) 我们的看法相同。
simple adj.简单的；朴素的；单纯的；笨的	(1) In each cave they constructed five simple beds. (2) As he had forgot his keys, he got into the house by the simple expedient of climbing through the window. (3) I like my clothes to be simple but elegant. (4) "A-bomb, H-bomb and nuclear-powered submarine" (5) I'm not so simple as to think it will be easy. (6) She doesn't understand you. She's a bit simple.	(1) 他们在每间窑洞里做了5个简单的床。 (2) 他由于忘了带钥匙，便以简单的应急办法从窗户爬进屋里。 (3) 我喜欢朴素但漂亮雅致的衣服。 (4) 两弹一艇 (5) 我决不致于笨得以为那是容易的事。 (6) 她不明白你的意思。她有点笨。
simple-minded adj.愚蠢的；头脑简单的	(1) While intelligent people can often simplify the complex, a fool is more likely to complicate the simple. (2) Simple Simon met a pie man going to the fair. (3) Eleanor's younger brother Freder was a simple youth.	(1) 聪明人常常能把复杂的事变得简单，而愚蠢的人却常常把简单的事复杂化。 (2) 头脑简单的西蒙遇到了一个卖馅饼的人正往集市去。 (3) 埃莉诺的弟弟弗雷德尔是一个头脑简单的年轻人。
simplify vt.简化；使简单	(1) That will simplify my task. (2) She simplified the instructions so that the children could understand them. (3) Can you simplify your language a little?	(1) 那可简化了我的工作。 (2) 她简化了指令以便于儿童理解。 (3) 你能不能把你的语言改得简单一点?
simply adv.简单地；仅仅；简直	(1) Most of these problems won't simply dissolve. (2) Put simply, we accept their offer or go bankrupt. (3) You may open the tin simply by pulling the puller. (4) Is success simply a matter of working hard? (5) I bought the house simply because it was large. (6) The holidays simply sped by. (7) That meal was simply divine!	(1) 大多数这些问题不会简单地解决。 (2) 简单地说吧，我们要么接受他们的条件，要么破产。 (3) 你只要拉这个拉出器，就可以很容易地把罐头打开。 (4) 是否只要勤奋就能成功？ (5) 我购买了这房子，只是因为它面积大。 (6) 假期简直是一晃而过。 (7) 那顿饭简直好极了。
sincerely adv.真诚地；真心地	(1) She praised him sincerely for his victory. (2) I sincerely hope you'll come with us. (3) Do you sincerely want to succeed?	(1) 她真诚地表扬了他的胜利。 (2) 我真诚希望你和我们一起去。 (3) 你真的想要成功吗?

(2) My sister in law has two husbands, my mother in law also has two husbands," Indira says. (3) And she said， Behold， thy sister in law is gone back unto her people， and unto her gods： return thou after thy sister in law. (4) The sister in law went to work straight, and the income is steady, two persons can also spend this period of time together. (5) And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law. (6) And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.	(1) 刚出生那几天很像妈妈,但是最近去看他,他竟然慢慢有我们周家的家族特徵了耶!!! (2) 我弟妹有两个老公，我婆婆也有两个老公。” (3) 路得说，不要催我回去不跟随你，你往哪里去，我也往那里去。你在哪里住宿，我也在那里住宿。你的国就是我的国，你的神就是我的神。 (4) 弟妹倒是一直上班的,而且收入稳定,二人还能共同度过这段日子。 (5) 拿俄米说,看哪,你嫂子已经回她本国,和她所拜的神那里去了,你也跟着你嫂子回去吧。 (6) 16路得说，不要催我回去不跟随你，你往哪里去，我也往那里去。你在哪里住宿，我也在那里住宿。你的国就是我的国，你的神就是我的神。
situation n.形势；局面；位置；职位；处境；状况	(1) The overall situation is worsening. (2) The economic situation is now different. (3) You dealt with an awkward situation very tactfully. (4) The house is in a good situation at the top of the hill. (5) He was promoted to a high situation for his outstanding performance in the project. (6) He was in a dangerous situation. (7) He laughed off an embarrassing situation. (8) He gave a neat summary of the financial situation.	(1) 整体形势在日益恶化。 (2) 现在经济形势不同了。 (3) 你很巧妙地处理了一个困难的局面。 (4) 这座房子在山上的一个好位置上。 (5) 因为在项目中的突出表现,他被提升到高职位。 (6) 他处境危险。 (7) 他以笑来解除这种尴尬的处境。 (8) 他对财务状况做了简要的概括。

sixty n.六十 adj.六十的；六十个的	(1) The country maintains some sixty missions abroad. (2) Now my husband is sixty, I know.	(1) 该国在海外设有约六十个使馆。 (2) 现在我的丈夫六十岁，我知道。
sixteen num.十六	(1) There are sixteen ounces in one pound. (2) He was scarcely sixteen when he joined the army.	(1) 一磅有十六盎司。 (2) 他参军时刚刚十六岁。
