(4) Tom is one of the seers in the sixteenth century. (5) He was the sixteenth president of the United States. (6) You don't pay attention to rests, especially the eighth rest and sixteenth rest.	(1) 他的名字在名单上排第十六名。 (2) 十月十六日为国际粮食日。 (3) 我的新家在第十六层。 (4) 汤姆是十六世纪的先知。 (5) 他是美国的第16届总统。 (6) 你对休止符重视不够，尤其是八分休止符和十六分休止符。
skateboard n.溜冰板(一种装有滑轮的椭圆形滑板) v.滑滑板	(1) With a skateboard, you can skate on the street. (2) Skateboards are the latest craze. (3) You will know when you try to skateboard once, I promise that you won't regard.	(1) 有了溜冰板,你可以在大街上滑冰了。 (2) 滑板运动是目前最时兴的玩意儿。 (3) 踏上滑板你便知道，我保证你不会后悔。
skill n.技能；技艺；技巧；熟练	(1) The crisis put his courage and skill to the test. (2) She dealt with the problem with consummate skill. (3) Resources management is an important business skill. (4) As a lightweight his skill is of the highest order. (5) Match your skill against the experts in this quiz. (6) His cleverness and skill compel our admiration. (7) The surgeon cut away the tumour with expert skill. (8) His hard work atones for his lack of skill.	(1) 这次危难是对他的勇气和技能的考验。 (2) 她以巧妙的手腕处理了这个问题。 (3) 资源管理是一项重要的经营技能。 (4) 作为轻量级拳击手，他的技术是第一流的。 (5) 在这一测验中你与专家较量一下技巧吧。 (6) 他的聪明和技巧使我们赞叹不已。 (7) 外科大夫用熟练的技术把肿瘤切去。 (8) 他的艰苦努力弥补了技术的不熟练。
skilled adj.有技能的；熟练的	(1) Unskilled workers usually earn less money than skilled workers. (2) The third wave includes Muslim refugees from Iraq, workers from the Indian subcontinent, students from South Korea, skilled Chinese and others. (3) The intricate machine requires a skilled operator. (4) Fluent spoken English and skilled writen English.	(1) 无技能的工人通常比有技能的工人挣钱少。 (2) 第三波文化整合也包括了从伊拉克逃出来的回教难民，从印度来的工人，从南韩来的学生，有技能的华人移民等等。 (3) 这种复杂精细的机器须由技能熟练的人操作。 (4) 熟练的英语口语及读写能力。
skillful adj.熟练的；灵巧的	(1) His skillful manipulation vivified this puppet. (2) He is a skillful English-speaking professor. (3) Her skillful fingers spun the wool out to a fine thread. (4) With a skillful movement he rounded the small fishing-boat.	(1) 他熟练的操作让木偶栩栩如生。 (2) 他是位英语讲得很熟练的教授。 (3) 她那灵巧的手指把羊毛纺织成了细线。 (4) 他以灵巧的动作使小渔船调过头来。
skillfully adv.巧妙地；技术好地	(1) The candidate skillfully worked the huge crowd. (2) He skillfully dealt with an embarrassing situation.	(1) 候选人巧妙地对大众施加影响。 (2) 他很巧妙地应付了一个尴尬局面。
skin n.皮肤；外皮；皮囊 n.惊讶；生气 vt.剥皮；削皮；贴皮；蹭破皮；<俚>击败	(1) He had brown skin. (2) When he fell he just broke the skin. (3) She peeled off the skin of a banana for the child. (4) I nearly jumped out of my skin when a hand grabbed me in the dark. (5) Don't let him get under your skin. (6) It's no skin off my nose if I lose this job, I can always get another one. (7) David is skinning onions in the kitchen. (8) Firstly, you should pare the skin. (9) He skinned his knee when he fell.	(1) 他的皮肤是棕色的 (2) 当他跌倒时，他只擦破皮肤。 (3) 她替孩子剥掉香蕉皮。 (4) 黑暗中有一只手把我抓住，可真把我吓了一大跳。 (5) 别让他惹你生气。 (6) 我失掉这份工作也没有关系，我随时都能再找到工作。 (7) 大卫在厨房里剥洋葱皮。 (8) 首先，你得削皮。 (9) 他摔跤时把膝盖擦破了。
skip v.跳过；略过；遗漏 n.跳跃；跳读；省略	(1) Lambs skipped in the field. (2) Let' s skip over this page and come to page 55. (3) He gave a skip of joy as he heard the news. (4) He read the lengthy report without a skip.	(1) 小羊在田野里跳跃。 (2) 咱们越过这一页，看第五十五页。 (3) 得知这个消息，他高兴地跳了起来。 (4) 他从头至尾读了那份冗长的报告。
skipping n.跳读 动词skip的现在分词形式.	(1) He is skipping out of town to get away from the cops. (2) I read the whole book without skipping (a page). (3) Children are fond of skipping.	(1) 他匆匆出城，以免落在警察手里。 (2) 我一页不漏地读完了全书。 (3) 孩子们喜欢跳绳。
skyscraper n.摩天大楼	(1) A new skyscraper has been put up downtown. (2) The skyscraper towers into the sky.	(1) 市中心又建起了一座摩天大厦。 (2) 该摩天大楼高耸入云。
slave n.奴隶；像奴隶般受制的人；【机】从动装置 v.做苦工；做奴隶；拼命干	(1) This slave dreamed of becoming a freeman. (2) The boy was caught and sold to be a galley slave. (3) He is a slave to drink. (4) We are born to slave it for our lord.	(1) 这个奴隶梦想着成为一个自由人。 (2) 这个男孩被抓住，并被卖到战舰上做奴隶。 (3) 他是个酒鬼。 (4) 我们是生来为君王效犬马之劳的。
slavery n.奴役；奴隶制；奴隶身份	(1) They were delivered from slavery. (2) Lincoln was an unbending foe of slavery. (3) All humanitarians are against slavery. (4) However, the Israelite people, accustomed to slavery and uncertain of freedom, soon rebelled against God. (5) After Harriet Tubman escaped from slavery, she returned to slave-holding states many times to help other slaves escape.	(1) 他们从奴役中被解放出来。 (2) 林肯是奴隶制的死敌。 (3) 所有人道主义者都反对奴隶制。 (4) 然而，以色列人，习惯了奴隶身份和不确定的自由，很快又再反抗神了。 (5) 自奴隶身份脱逃后，海丽特塔布曼多次往返于赞成奴隶制度的各州内，帮助其他的奴隶逃亡。
sleepy adj.欲睡的；困倦的	(1) The softness of the breeze made him feel sleepy. (2) I'm too sleepy to watch the end of the show. (3) I often feel sleepy after supper and then I get my second wind later in the evening. (4) In his sleepy state, the sound of a car driving up to the house scarcely impinged on his consciousness.	(1) 柔和的微风使他昏昏欲睡。 (2) 我太困倦了，不能把戏看完。 (3) 我吃完晚饭常感到困，一到晚上就又精神了。 (4) 他困得那副样子，连汽车朝那房子开去时发出的声音都没能使他清醒。
sleeve n.套管；袖子	(1) If it is necessary to have the joints under water, they must be bedded into a box or sleeve which absolutely prevents water from penetrating in. (2) A stranger plucked at my sleeve as I was leaving. (3) He rolled up his sleeves and got to work in the garden.	(1) 如果有必要在水下接头，就必须把它们安置于绝对不渗水的密封盒子或套管中。 (2) 我刚要离去，一个陌生人拽我的袖子。 (3) 他卷起了袖子，在花园里干起活来。
slice n.薄片；部分；曲球 v.切成薄片；割；切开	(1) Please give me a slice of bread. (2) This is just a slice of life. (3) He also gets a slice of the profit. (4) A slice is a curving shot from left to right with severe sidespin. (5) Slice the mushrooms thinly and fry in butter. (6) He sliced his finger by accident when cutting vegetables. (7) The destroyer sliced through the water.	(1) 请给我一片面包。 (2) 这只是人生的一个片段罢了。 (3) 他也得到一份利润。 (4) 右曲球是一种带有相当于顺时钟旋转导致剧烈向右弯曲的击球。 (5) 把蘑菇切成薄片,用黄油抄。 (6) 他切菜时不小心割破了手指。 (7) 驱逐舰划开了水面

solid adj.固体的；实心的；结实的；可靠的 n.固体；立体图形 adv.一致地	(1) Ice is water in solid state. (2) In fact, it was originally a solid rock. (3) You should present solid evidence to prove your point. (4) Water becomes solid when it freezes. (5) A cube is a solid.	(1) 冰是水的固体状态。 (2) 其实,这本来是实心的岩石。 (3) 你应该提供有说服力的证据来证明你的观点。 (4) 水结冰时便变成固体。 (5) 立方体是个立体图形。
sorrow n.悲伤；悲痛；懊悔；伤心事 vi.悲伤；惋惜；悔恨	(1) He wrung his hands in sorrow. (2) He hanged himself in sorrow after his wife died. (3) At last she keened her sorrow to me. (4) He expressed his sorrow for what he had done. (5) The remembrance of past sorrow is joyful. (6) She was certain that some romantic sorrow had blighted his life and made him hard and bitter , and she felt that what he needed was the love of a good woman. (7) We sorrow over the death of his son. (8) The busy bee has no time for sorrow.	(1) 他悲伤地绞紧双手。 (2) 妻子死后，他因悲伤而自缢。 (3) 终于她向我哭诉了悲痛之情。 (4) 他对自己所做的事情表示懊悔。 (5) 昔日伤心事，思之有乐趣。 (6) 她深信一定有某种罗曼蒂克的伤心事把他的生活给毁了，才使他变得这样强硬而苛刻，而他目前最需要的是一个好女人的爱。 (7) 我们都为他儿子死感到悲伤。 (8) 忙碌的蜜蜂没有时间悔恨。
sort n.种类；某一种人 v.整理；分类；处理；安排妥当	(1) What sort of book do you want? (2) This sort of wet weather plays hell with my chest. (3) He is a good sort (of a fellow). (4) My brother would never cheat on his wife; he's not that sort. (5) We must sort out the good apples from the bad ones. (6) Sort these eggs by size. (7) The workers sort the mail from the mailbox. (8) It's our problem. We'll get it sorted. (9) Let's leave the two of them to sort themselves out.	(1) 你要哪一类的书？ (2) 这种潮湿天气对我的肺有害。 (3) 他是个好样儿的。 (4) 我哥哥永远不会背着妻子在外面拈花惹草；他不是那种人。 (5) 我们必须把好的苹果与坏的分开。 (6) 将这些蛋按大小分好。 (7) 工作人员从邮箱中分拣邮件。 (8) 这是我们的问题。我们来处理。 (9) 咱们让他们俩自己把相互间的误解好好澄清一下吧。
soul n.灵魂；心灵；精神	(1) Creativity is the soul of a nation. (2) No words can express the secret agony of my soul. (3) The eye is the window of the soul. (4) Knowledge is the food of the soul. (5) The music will replenish my weary soul.	(1) 创新是一个民族进步的灵魂。 (2) 没有任何语言能够表达我心灵中的隐痛。 (3) 眼睛是心灵的窗户。 (4) 知识是精神食粮。 (5) 音乐使我疲惫的精神充满活力。
sour adj.酸的；酸腐的；刻薄的 v.变酸	(1) Most green fruit is sour. (2) The dish's gone sour. (3) He's always got a sour look on his face, and he has never said anything friendly. (4) The hot weather has soured the milk. (5) Relations between the two countries have soured.	(1) 大多数未熟的水果都是酸的。 (2) 这菜已经变质了。 (3) 他总是板着脸,从来不说一句好听的话。 (4) 炎热的天气使牛奶变酸了。 (5) 这两个国家之间的关系变得恶化了。
southeast n.东南；东南地区 adj.东南的；向东南的；来自东南的 adv.往东南；来自东南；在东南	(1) Taiwan is in the southeast of China. (2) The wind is in the southeast. (3) Kowloon is a city of southeast China. (4) The inneer terrain tilted from the northwest to southeast.	(1) 台湾在中国的东南部。 (2) 东南部有风。 (3) 九龙是中国东南一城市。 (4) 境内地势由西北向东南倾斜。
southern adj.南部的；南方的	(1) He lives in southern China. (2) Only in the southern part of Taiwan have I seen such scenery as this. (3) The secession of some southern states from the USA in the 1860s led to the civil war. (4) Rice is the chief crop in most southern provinces. (5) Do you prefer northern food or southern food?	(1) 他住在中国南部。 (2) 唯有在南台湾我才见过像这样的风景。 (3) 由于南部某些州于十九世纪六十年代脱离美国而导致了南北战争。 (4) 稻子是大多数南方省份的主要作物。 (5) 你喜欢北方的食物还是南方的食物?

(3) Tainan is situated in the southwest part of Taiwan not far from Kaohsiung. (4) This river flowed southwest to the Atlantic Ocean.	(1) 威尔士在大不列颠岛的西南部。 (2) 中国西南地区会出现明显降水。 (3) 台南位于台湾的西南方，在离高雄不远处。 (4) 这条河流向西南，汇入大西洋。

(4) It's hard to work this soil with such an old spade. (5) My partner surprised me by leading with a spade. (6) Orders came that we should spade the trench in an hour. (7) I spade compost into the flower beds.	(1) 她拿了把铲子和大家一起大干起来。 (2) 我父亲用一把特别的铲子挖草皮。 (3) 他正在用铁锹挖马铃薯。 (4) 用这样一把旧铁锹挖地真费劲。 (5) 我的搭档先出黑桃，使我感到吃惊。 (6) 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。 (7) 我用铁锹把堆肥撒到花坛中。
spaghetti n.意大利式细面条；[电]绝缘套管	(1) Spaghetti is one of my favorite foods. (2) If you're very hungry a double helping of spaghetti should fit the bill! (3) He's a dab hand at cooking spaghetti.	(1) 意大利式细面条是我喜欢的食品之一。 (2) 要是很饿的话，吃两份意大利细面条就行了！ (3) 他是煮意大利面条的高手。

(5) They were standing in the river spearing fish. (6) If I could no longer hold on to the handrail, those horns would spear me. (3) Let us take a look at three specific areas of concern. (4) There is no specific remedy for the malady. (5) He never talked in specifics about his work. (6) The specifics of this data are specified via a schema in the process definition. speech n.演说；演讲；言语；语言能力	(1) The mayor made a speech at the opening. (2) The speaker will soon wind up his speech. (3) I had to give a speech to the press club. (4) He closed his speech with a funny joke. (5) We express our thoughts by speech. (6) He had lost the power of speech. (7) Only human beings are capable of speech. (4) The composition is not well written, and moreover, there are many spelling mistakes in it.	(1) 不要在拼法上出错。 (2) 英文的拼法没什么规律。 (3) 他的拼写大有改进。 (4) 这篇作文写得不好，而且还有许多拼写错误。

(4) In spring, they spin their cocoons. (5) My head began to spin after three glasses of wine. (6) Before the invention of spin technology, zoic fur were mainly material. (7) The pitcher gave a spin to the ball. (8) I've been in a real spin all morning. (9) Let's go for a spin in my new car.	(1) 我妹妹能像舞者一样踮着脚尖旋转。 (2) 摩托车正全速疾驰。 (3) 母亲过去一直是自己纺纱的。 (4) 到了春天，它们才吐丝结茧。 (5) 三杯酒落肚，我的头开始发晕了。 (6) 在纺织技术尚未发明之前，动物的毛皮是人们服装的主要材料。 (7) 投手使球旋转。 (8) 我整个上午都晕头转向的。 (9) 坐我的新汽车兜一圈吧。

(12) The wooden floor had split in the heat. (13) When he bent over, he split his pant. (14) Frost caused the split in the rock. (15) The split in the sidewalk is getting larger. (16) Argument over policy led to a split in the party. (17) Each partner got a split of the profits. (18) They believe the killer has a split personality. (4) The gangsters sprayed the car with machinegun bullets. (5) I've lost my throat spray. (6) This spray will exterminate the termites. (7) It's better to buy a non-aerosol spray. (8) We parked the car by the sea and it got covered with spray. (9) A cloud of fine spray came up from the waterfall. (3) She spread her wings and flew lightly down. (4) I spread my arms as far apart as I could. (5) Who spread these rumours? (6) We spread a rug on the grass for the picnic. (7) He spread the map flat out on the floor. (8) Its branches spread far and wide. (9) But Langston Hughes spread his creative wings even further. (10) I spread butter on my toast. (11) She spread the bread with butter. (12) The survey revealed a wide spread of opinion. (13) What can we do to prevent the spread of the disease? (14) Tv has become a more powerful vehicle for the spread of news. (15) The wings of the bird have a 12-inch spread. (16) The spread of the prairies was indeed a startling sight. (17) Our host had a fine spread waiting for us.	(1) 事故一发生,收音机就把这条消息传播出去了。 (2) 谣言在人群当中广泛地传播开来。 (3) 她展开双翅轻轻飞下。 (4) 我尽可能地将双臂伸展开。 (5) 谁散布的这些谣言? (6) 我们在草地上铺镇开毯子,准备野餐。 (7) 他把地图平铺在地上。 (8) 它的枝条向四面八方伸展开来。 (9) 但蓝斯顿休斯将其创作羽翼更向外伸展。 (10) 我将黄油涂在吐司上。 (11) 她把黄油涂在面包上。 (12) 调查结果表明各种意见差别很大. (13) 我们能做些什么来防止这种疾病的传播呢? (14) 电视已成为影响力更大的传播消息的媒介。 (15) 这鸟的翼展有十二英寸。 (16) 草原的浩瀚确是奇观。 (17) 我们的主人准备了盛宴在等我们。
spy n.间谍；侦探；侦察 v.侦探；监视；看到；找出	(1) The spy was expelled from the realm. (2) This evidence reinforces my view that he is a spy. (3) The scout was sent to spy out the land. (4) She hired a detective to spy on her husband. (5) They read the histories and talk about the weapons and spy tools. (6) The scout was sent to spy out the land. (7) It's wrong to spy into people's affairs. (8) He is paid by the police to spy on other students. (9) He sent out a party to spy the enemy. (10) How much did you pay the man to spy on me? (11) The Cassini orbiter may be able to spy some of the hidden puppeteers. (12) I do spy some marks of love in her.	(1) 这名间谍被驱逐出境。 (2) 这个证据证实了我认为他是间谍的这一看法。 (3) 侦探被派出去秘密侦察高地去了。 (4) 她雇了一个侦探来监视她丈夫。 (5) 他们阅读历史记录，谈论武器和侦察工具。 (6) 侦探被派出去秘密侦察高地去了。 (7) 刺探他人的私事是错误的。 (8) 警察收买他去监视其他学生。 (9) 他派出一个小分队暗中监视敌人的行动。 (10) 你付那人多少钱来监视我? (11) 卡西尼太空船也许能够找出这些幕后的操纵者。 (12) 我真的从她脸上看出几分爱我的意思来了。
squeeze v.挤压；塞进；压榨；设法腾出 n.挤压；少量；拥挤；严控；财政困难	(1) Kara squeezed the bottle, and the water rushed out. (2) It took some ingenuity to squeeze all the furniture into the little room. (3) Supermarkets are accused of squeezing both customers and suppliers. (4) I can squeeze a meeting in early tomorrow morning. (5) He gave my hand a gentle squeeze. (6) The host put a squeeze of lemon in my drink. (7) We managed to get all the luggage into the car but it was a tight squeeze. (8) She's just lost her job, so they're really feeling the squeeze.	(1) 卡拉挤压着那个瓶子,水一下子喷了出来。 (2) 把全部家具都塞进那个小房间是很费了一番心思的。 (3) 超市因压榨顾客和供货商而遭到指控。 (4) 我可以在明天清早挤出时间开个会。 (5) 他握着我的手,轻轻捏了捏。 (6) 主人往我的饮料中挤了少量柠檬汁。 (7) 我们总算把行李都塞进汽车里了，不过挤得要命。 (8) 她刚失了业，这下他们真正感到艰难了。
squid n.鱿鱼	(1) Try to get your fishmonger to skin and gut the squid for you. (2) They also eat animal cephalopods, including squid and octopus.	(1) 让鱼贩子帮你收拾一下鱿鱼，去皮和内脏。 (2) 它们还吃头足纲动物，包括鱿鱼和章鱼。
squirrel n.松鼠；松鼠皮毛 vt.储存	(1) The squirrel is a lovely small animal. (2) The squirrel hoards up nuts for the winter. (3) Nervous householders continue to squirrel more money away in the banks.	(1) 松鼠是一种可爱的小动物。 (2) 松鼠储藏坚果以防冬天。 (3) 不安的居民持续不断地把更多钱存入银行里。
stable adj.稳定的；安定的；可靠的 n.马棚；马厩；一批人 v.使（马）入厩；入马棚	(1) Markets are flourishing and prices are stable. (2) In order that our country could flourish and achieve its own goals, a stable environment within the country is definitely not dispensable. (3) The Sunnis hold a majority in four provinces and any government will have to respect them if they wish to administer a stable state. (4) He is a bit neurotic, but his wife is a very stable person. (5) The horse in the stable has broken out. (6) Who opened the stable door? (7) He has a whole stable of informers working for him. (8) Where do you stable your pony?	(1) 市场繁荣, 物价稳定。 (2) 国家要发展，要实现自己的目标，这是必不可少的条件，就是要国内有安定的环境。 (3) 逊尼派在四个省份里都是多数群体，而任何政府只要想管理一个安定的国家，就不得不对他们予以尊重。 (4) 他有点神经质，但他的妻子是一个非常稳重的人。 (5) 马厩里的那匹马跑了。 (6) 谁打开了马房的门？ (7) 他有一群告密者为他效劳。 (8) 你那匹矮种马养在哪儿?（《牛津高阶英汉双解词典》）
stadium n.体育场；运动场；[生]期	(1) The crowds drifted away from the stadium. (2) Keep on past the church; the stadium is about half a mile further on. (3) We will go to the stadium to watch a football match. (4) The takings at the football stadium has fallen off. (5) Supporters crowded through the gates into the stadium.	(1) 人群慢慢从体育场散去。 (2) 一直向前走过了教堂，约莫半英里就是体育场。 (3) 我们将去体育场观看足球比赛。 (4) 足球运动场的收入减少了。 (5) 来捧场的人挤过大门，涌入运动场。
staff n.员工；全体人员；全体职员；拐杖；杆；棒；五线谱 vt.配备员工	(1) I find the hotel staff particularly courteous.	(1) 我发现饭店员工特别谦恭有礼。
stage n.舞台；戏剧；阶段；步骤；行程 v.上演；举行；组织；筹划；使出现	(1) She stood alone on the enormous stage. (2) He quitted the stage of politics. (3) Novels are often adapted for the stage. (4) The disease is still in its primary stage. (5) Negotiations were at a crucial stage. (6) The pay increase will be introduced in stages. (7) She did the first stage of the trip by train. (8) They decided to stage a general strike. (9) They were going to stage a large-scale money collecting. (10) After five years in retirement, he staged a comeback to international tennis.	(1) 她孤零零地站在巨大的舞台上。 (2) 他退出了政治舞台。 (3) 小说常常改编为戏剧。 (4) 这疾病仍然在初发阶段。 (5) 谈判正处于一个关键的阶段。 (6) 工资的提高将分步进行。 (7) 她行程的第一段是乘火车的。 (8) 他们决定举行总罢工。 (9) 他们筹划举办一个大型募捐活动。 (10) 退役五年之后，他又复出国际网坛。
stain n.污点；瑕疵；着色剂；染料 v.弄脏；玷污；着色	(1) The stain on his shirt is difficult to clean off. (2) It will remain an indelible stain on his memory. (3) Such a man is a stain to humanity. (4) There isn't a stain on her reputation. (5) Wood stain is one of the most important painting material in coating of American style furniture. (6) How much stain should I buy for the table? (7) These carpets won't stain easily. (8) He stained the family honor.	(1) 他衬衣上的污点很难去除掉。 (2) 这将成为他记忆中一个不可磨灭的污点。 (3) 这种人是人类的耻辱。 (4) 她的名誉没有半点瑕疵。 (5) 木材着色剂是美式涂装中极其重要的涂装材料。 (6) 给这张桌子上色，我得买多少颜料？ (7) 这些地毯不易弄脏。 (8) 他玷污了家族的荣誉。
stainless adj.无污点的；无瑕疵的；不锈的	(1) He wears a stainless white shirt today. (2) Half heaven was pure and stainless. (3) This cup is made of stainless steel. (4) I think the most long lasting is stainless steel. (5) We installed a stainless steel towel rail on the wall. (6) If I had a bicycle made of stainless steel, it will never get rust.	(1) 他今天穿着一件洁白无污的衬衫。 (2) 半个天空，纯洁无瑕。 (3) 这只杯子是不锈钢做的。 (4) 我认为最耐用的是不锈钢的。 (5) 我们在墙上装了一个不锈钢的挂毛巾的横杆。 (6) 要是我有一辆不锈钢制造的自行车，它就再也不会生锈了。
stainless steel 不锈钢	(1) If I had a bicycle made of stainless steel, it will never get rust. (2) We installed a stainless steel towel rail on the wall. (3) This cup is made of stainless steel.	(1) 要是我有一辆不锈钢制造的自行车，它就再也不会生锈了。 (2) 我们在墙上装了一个不锈钢的挂毛巾的横杆。 (3) 这只杯子是不锈钢做的。
stair n.楼梯	(1) The child was sitting on the bottom stair. (2) Clutch stair armrest, move carefully step by step.	(1) 那孩子正坐在楼梯最下面的一级上。 (2) 抓紧楼梯扶手，一步步谨慎地移动。
standard n.标准；规格；水准；军旗 adj.标准的；普通的；规范的；权威的	(1) There is no absolute standard for beauty. (2) The government has an official standard for the purity of silver. (3) Washing machines have standard measurements to fit under kitchen units. (4) Such prices hit off with the standard of our life. (5) The ignominy of losing your standard, your eagle standard, became equally great. (6) Wagon bearing Milan's standard to inspire the army, pushed by elite troops armed with spears and light armour. (7) According to my height, what is my standard weight? (8) Searching handluggage at airports is now standard procedure. (9) Maintain a secure DB server using standard and advanced techniques. (10) In my mind, the hgihest standard to measure the ethics and morality is justice. (11) This is one of the standard books on the subject.	(1) 美是没有绝对的标准的。 (2) 政府对于银的纯度定有官方的规格。 (3) 洗衣机的长宽高都有一定的规格，这样才能和厨房家具成为一体。 (4) 这样的物价与我们的生活水准相符。 (5) 丢失军旗和鹰旗，所带来的耻辱，也变的同样重大起来。 (6) 军旗战车的米兰战旗能极大激励部队士气，由装备长矛和轻甲的精锐部队负责护卫。 (7) 根据我的身高,我的标准体重是多少? (8) 在机场检查手提行李现在已成例行程序。 (9) 用规范的和先进的技术来安全地维护数据库服务器。 (10) 在我的思想中，衡量道德规范的最高标准就是公平。 (11) 这是有关这个问题的权威著作之一。
stare v.盯着看；凝视 n.凝视	(1) She stared him into silence. (2) They all stared with astonishment. (3) It's impolite to stare at people. (4) You can enjoy its beauty each time you stare at its wonderment. (5) I see his eyes curiously stare on me. (6) Peter looked at them with glazy stare. (7) She gave him a long cool stare.	(1) 她把他盯得不吭声了。 (2) 他们全都惊讶地瞪着眼。 (3) 盯着看人是不礼貌的。 (4) 每当你凝视它，你都能重温旧梦。 (5) 我看见他的眼睛好奇地盯着我。 (6) 彼得用呆滞的目光凝视他们。 (7) 她冷冷地久久凝视他。
starvation n.饿死；饥饿	(1) The old woman died of starvation. (2) These people are living on the verge of starvation. (3) He suffered from starvation and disease.	(1) 老妇人被活活饿死。 (2) 这些人正在饥饿线上挣扎。 (3) 他因饥饿和疾病而受苦。
starve vi.挨饿；受饿；极度匮乏 vt.使挨饿；使饿死	(1) They were suffered to starve on the pavement. (2) They would starve if food was difficult to find. (3) They would rather starve than give way. (4) The explorers starved to death in the desert. (5) The plant was starved of light and died. (6) It is silly to starve yourself to be skinny. (7) They tried to starve him into submission. (8) The enemy is trying to starve us out.	(1) 他们流流街头，忍饥挨饿。 (2) 如果很难找到食物，他们就会挨饿。 (3) 他们宁愿饿死也不妥协。 (4) 探险者们在沙漠中饿死了。 (5) 这株植物因为极度缺乏光照而死了。 (6) 显得有骨感而挨饿是愚蠢的. (7) 他们试图用饥饿来使他屈服。 (8) 敌人想把我们饿出来。
state n.情形；状态；国家；州；政府 adj.国家的；州的；国事礼仪的 v.陈述；声明；说明；规定	(1) She wept to see him in such a state. (2) The house has fallen into a state of neglect. (3) The head of state was deposed by the army. (4) Alaska is a state of ample size. (5) He was wary of telling state secrets. (6) She teaches in a state university. (7) The Queen is on a state visit to Moscow. (8) They do not state that she is ( or is not ) a good teacher. (9) State your name and address.	(1) 她一见他那种情形簌簌泪下。 (2) 这所房屋已处于荒废的状态。 (3) 国家元首被军队废黜了。 (4) 阿拉斯加是个大州。 (5) 他小心翼翼以免泄漏国家机密。 (6) 她在一所州立大学任教。 (7) 女王正对莫斯科进行国事访问。 (8) 他们没有声明她是(或不是)一个好教师。 (9) 请说出你的姓名和地址。
statement n.陈述；声明；【计】语句	(1) Her views were fully elaborated in a written statement.	(1) 她的观点在一篇书面声明中得到了充分的阐述。
statesman n.政治家	(1) The statesman is respected by people. (2) He will go down in history as a great statesman.	(1) 这位政治家为人们所敬重。 (2) 他将作为伟大的政治家而载入史册。
statistics n.统计学；统计；统计数字	(1) He is a professor of statistics. (2) There is a compulsory course in statistics. (3) Get me a printout of the statistics. (4) He is taking statistics. (5) I happen to have the official statistics with me. (6) Statistics should be treated with caution.	(1) 他教授统计学。 (2) 有一门统计学的必修课。 (3) 给我一份打印出的统计资料。 (4) 他正在进行统计。 (5) 我碰巧身边有官方的统计数字。 (6) 对待统计数字要小心。
statue n.雕像；塑像	(1) The statue is twice life-size. (2) The statue was carved out of marble. (3) The statue of Jefferson was big as life. (4) The statue is a lasting reminder of Churchill's greatness.	(1) 该雕像大小为实体的两倍。 (2) 这座雕像是用大理石雕刻的。 (3) 杰斐逊的塑像和真人一样大小。 (4) 这尊塑像使人永远缅怀邱吉尔的伟大功绩。
status n.地位；情形；状况，状态；身份	(1) Women's social status has changed much over the years. (2) I'll keep you posted on the status. (3) We ask the bank to report on his financial status. (4) There are many fine shadings of status through the social hierarchy.	(1) 这些年来妇女的社会地位有了很大改变。 (2) 我会随时告诉你进展的情形。 (3) 我们请银行报告他的财政状况。 (4) 在各个社会等级之间有许多细微的身分区别。
steady adj.稳定的；稳固的；坚定的 v.使稳固；使稳定；(变得)稳固；使坚定 adv.稳定地，稳固地 n. 关系固定的情侣；固定支架	(1) The old man is not steady on his legs. (2) The agreement ensured a steady supply of oil. (3) Don't tell your secret to him before you get a steady relationship. (4) I know she is steady in her purpose. (5) She held onto a strap to steady herself. (6) The hunter steadied his rifle and fired.	(1) 这位老人站不稳。 (2) 该协定保证了石油的稳定供给。 (3) 在未跟他的感情稳定下来之前,不要把自己的秘密说给他听。 (4) 我知道她意志坚定。 (5) 她抓住拉手吊带以便站稳。 (6) 猎人端稳了猎枪，然后开了火。
steak n.牛排	(1) I want my steak well-done. (2) I would like some steak and bread. (3) The steak was so tough that I couldn't eat it.	(1) 我要全熟的牛排。 (2) 我要牛排和面包。 (3) 牛排太老了,我咬不动它。
steam n.蒸汽；水汽；蒸汽动力；轮船 v.蒸；冒热气；行驶；<口>发怒	(1) The engines are driven by steam. (2) There was a puff of steam from the engine before it stopped. (3) Steam has fogged the bathroom mirror. (4) The equipment was originally powered by steam. (5) He used to travel by steam. (6) The car windows steamed up. (7) He steamed the stamp off the envelope. (8) The cup of coffee was steaming. (9) The ship steamed into the harbor.	(1) 这些发动机是由蒸汽驱动的。 (2) 机车喷出一股蒸气后就停了下来。 (3) 水蒸气把浴室里的镜子遮住了。 (4) 这个机器最初使用蒸汽动力。 (5) 他过去常乘轮船旅行。 (6) 汽车窗户上有一层水汽。 (7) 他用蒸汽把信封上的邮票揭下来。 (8) 那杯咖啡在冒热气。 (9) 船驶入了港湾。
steel n.钢铁；钢制品；钢铁般的性质 vt.使坚强；使 ... 硬如钢；使下定决心 adj.钢的；坚强的	(1) The doctor inserted a steel plate into his damaged leg. (2) The output value of iron and steel makes up one quarter of the country's national income. (3) He is a man of steel who has experienced a lot of wars. (4) You should steel yourself against failure . (5) He steeled himself to tell her about her father's death. (6) The profits of the steel industry have fallen due to the measures of trade protectionism taken by that country. (7) He gave me a steel grip while I tried to console him.	(1) 医生在他受伤的腿中植入了一块钢板。 (2) 钢铁制品创造的产值占据了国民收入的四分之一。 (3) 他是一个经历过许多战争、有着钢铁般意志的男人。 (4) 面对失败,你应该坚强起来。 (5) 他硬起心肠把她父亲的死讯告诉了她。 (6) 由于那国采取的贸易保护主义措施,钢铁业的利润有所下降。 (7) 当我试着去安慰他时,他坚强地握住我的手。
step-mother n.后母；继母	(1) Xin-er's step mother asked in an impatient tone. (2) A stepmother's love can be as deep and pure as any mother's.	(1) 新儿的继母有些不耐烦的说。 (2) 继母的爱也可以像生母一样深厚纯洁。
steward n.乘务员；管家；干事；管理员 v.做乘务员；管理	(1) His neighbor is a chief steward. (2) We thanked the steward for his good service. (3) Sometimes he sent his house steward in his place. (4) The stewards will inspect the course to see if racing is possible. (5) He is the steward of that great estate. (6) He was selected to steward a team.	(1) 他的邻居是一个乘务员领班。 (2) 我们感谢了乘务员所提供的优质服务。 (3) 有时他派管家替他去。 (4) 那些干事将检视赛马场看是否适宜比赛。 (5) 他是那笔大财产的管理人。 (6) 他被指派经管球队。
stewardess n.女乘务员；女管家	(1) An airline passenger is talking to the stewardess in-flight about a briefcase he has left behind.	(1) 一位旅客正和女乘务员谈话，讲他遗失了公事包，忘了带上飞机。
stomach n.胃；胃口；腹部 vt.忍受；吃得下	(1) He had had too much to eat and his stomach started to kick up. (2) Anxiety may disorder the stomach. (3) The stomach revolts at such food. (4) The film about eye operations turned my stomach. (5) A blow to the stomach made him curl up. (6) I can't stomach your constant nagging. (7) He now could stomach liquids only.	(1) 他吃得太多了,胃不舒服。 (2) 忧虑可能会引起胃部不适。 (3) 这样的食物倒胃囗。 (4) 这部眼科手术的影片看得我恶心极了。 (5) 他腹部受到一击而直不起腰来。 (6) 我再也忍受不了你不停的唠叨了。 (7) 他现在还只能吃流质食品。
stomachache n.胃痛；肚子痛	(1) The medicine did his stomachache a power of good. (2) The child squirmed with stomachache on bed. (3) One can get stomachache from eating hot food rinsed with cold beer.	(1) 这种药对他的胃痛疗效显著。 (2) 这孩子肚子疼得在床上滚来滚去。 (3) 吃了热食物，又喝冷啤酒，肚子会疼的。
stone n.【U】石料 n.【C】石头；宝石；(水果的)硬核 n.英石(重量单位；合14磅) vt.向 ... 扔石头；去掉(水果的)核	(1) The brick house was faced with stone. (2) The inscription on the stone had worn away. (3) The beetle scurried away when I lifted the stone. (4) A diamond ring with five stones is quite expensive. (5) There is a stone in the middle of a peach. (6) The criminal was stoned to death. (7) She washed and stoned the cherries.	(1) 这座砖房石料贴面。 (2) 刻在石头上的文字已磨损了。 (3) 我把石头搬起来时，那只甲虫跑了。 (4) 镶有五颗宝石的钻戒十分昂贵。 (5) 桃子的中心有一个核。 (6) 罪犯被人们用石头砸死。 (7) 她把樱桃洗净并去核。
stopwatch n.记秒表；跑表	(1) Drop the barometer and time its fall with a stopwatch. (2) Please prepare a stopwatch to record every runner's time.	(1) 扔下气压表，用秒表测出它降落的时间。 (2) 请准备好跑表记录每个跑步者的时间。
storage n.保管；贮藏；仓库；保管费；[计]存储器	(1) The best place for storage of money is a bank. (2) You should place the goods in storage. (3) His furniture is in storage while he finds a new house. (4) The management accept full responsibility for loss of goods in storage. (5) How much will you have to pay the warehouse for storage? (6) You have to pay storage for your furniture. (7) The data in the storage has been encoded. (8) You'd better locate and load a quantity of data from storage.	(1) 银行是存钱最好的地方。 (2) 你应该把货物贮藏起来 (3) 他在找新房子时把家具存放在仓库里。 (4) 管理部门接受仓库中货物损失的全部责任。 (5) 你得付多少仓库保管费? (6) 你必须缴纳家具保管费。 (7) 这个存储器的数据已经被编码了。 (8) 你最好从存储器中寻找并装入一批数据。
stout adj.强壮的；肥胖的；牢固的；坚定的 n.烈啤酒	(1) Hope is a slender reed for a stout man to lean on. (2) He became stout as he grew older. (3) The balloon was tied down to a stout stake. (4) The manager put up stout resistance to the proposal. (5) This stout has a slight chocolate flavor.	(1) 希望是壮汉依靠的一根纤细的芦苇。 (2) 随着年龄的增长，他发胖了。 (3) 气球被拴在一个结实的木桩上。 (4) 经理对提议采取坚决的抵制态度。 (5) 这种烈性啤酒有点巧克力的味道。
stove n.炉子；窑；【主英】温室	(1) I have to buy a more economical stove. (2) Please warm up this milk over the stove. (3) The erected stove is specially made for firing limestone.	(1) 我得买一个更节省燃料的火炉。 (2) 请把这杯牛奶放在炉子上热一热。 (3) 这座立窑是专门用来烧制石灰石的。
straightforward adj.易懂的；笔直的；坦率的	(1) I wonder if the literature can be put in straightforward Chinese. (2) This book presents an up-to-date, straightforward course for students. (3) They took a straightforward route to the lake. (4) The straightforward and wide road has degenerated into a little path. (5) I am quite a straightforward man. (6) His straightforward, modest manner took into camp everybody he knew.	(1) 我不知道那些说明书能不能译成简明易懂的中文。 (2) 这本书为学生提供了一本最新式的、简明易懂的教程。 (3) 他们走了一条笔直通向湖的路。 (4) 那条宽广笔直的公路已退化成一条蹩脚的小路。 (5) 我是一个非常直率的人。 (6) 他爽直而谦虚的态度使所有认识他的人都上了当。

(4) The door is rather strait. (5) My old aunts are very strait laced.	(1) 我们将在夜间通过那个海峡。 (2) 我们穿过了麦哲伦海峡。 (3) 我听说你处于经济困难之中。 (4) 这门相当窄。 (5) 我的老姨妈都很古板。
stranger n.陌生人；外地人；新手	(1) A sergeant asked the stranger to show his pass. (2) A stranger plucked at my sleeve as I was leaving. (3) His habitual place at the table was occupied by a stranger. (4) It's hard for a stranger to make friends in this town. (5) He is no stranger in mirosurgery.	(1) 警官要求这个陌生人出示通行证。 (2) 我刚要离去，一个陌生人拽我的袖子。 (3) 他惯常坐在桌旁的位置被一个陌生人占据了。 (4) 外地人在这个城里很难交朋友。 (5) 在显微外科方面,他绝非门外汉。
straw n.稻草；吸管；麦杆；不值钱的东西 adj.用稻草做的；麦杆色的；无价值的；像稻草人的；非正式民意测验所发现的	(1) The bird is building a nest of straw and twigs. (2) A drowning man will catch at a straw. (3) She was drinking juice through a straw. (4) The bumblebee sizzed right under his straw hat. (5) Mary bought a lovely straw basket at the market. (6) The force of his fall was broken by the straw mats. (7) My young sister bought a straw bag. (8) The enemy was cheated by the straw thins. (9) A straw poll among members of staff shows the government is in the lead.	(1) 这只鸟在用稻草和小树枝筑巢。 (2) [谚]人快淹死时，稻草也要抓。 (3) 她正在用吸管喝果汁。 (4) 大黄蜂就在他的草帽底下丝丝作声。 (5) 玛丽在市场上买了只可爱的草篮。 (6) 草垫的缓冲作用减弱了他下跌的力量。 (7) 我妹妹买了一个麦秆色的包包。 (8) 敌人被稻草人似的东西骗住了。 (9) 在职员中的快速民意测验表明政府处于领先地位。

(4) They grew strawberries in their garden. (5) I'd like some strawberry if you have any.	(1) 这草莓酱还是太稀，凝结不起来。 (2) 草莓冻都吃光了。 (3) 我们有不同的派，例如苹果、樱桃和草莓派。 (4) 他们在园中种了草莓。 (5) 如果有的话，我想要点草莓。
stream n.(小)河；水流；(人；车；气)流；组 v.流动；流出；飘动；将(学生)按能力分组	(1) On either bank of the stream stand rows of willow trees. (2) Sand and leaves trapped the water in the stream. (3) Visitors to the exhibition came in an endless stream. (4) They streamed out of the cinema. (5) Her hair streamed(out) in the wind.	(1) 小河两岸柳树成行。 (2) 沙子和树叶堵住了小河的水流。 (3) 参观展览会的人络绎不绝。 (4) 他们涌出电影院。 (5) 她的头发迎风飘动着.
strength n.力气；强度；力量；长处	(1) I have hardly enough strength left to move my feet. (2) In this game, you need more science than strength. (3) By doing so, you can test the strength of steel. (4) She prayed for strength in her troubles. (5) Tolerance is one of her many strengths.	(1) 我连移动双脚的力气都几乎没有了。 (2) 在这项比赛中，技巧比力气更重要。 (3) 这样做,你可以试验一下钢的强度。 (4) 她祈求(上帝)在困难时给她力量。 (5) 宽容是她的一个优点.

(4) The current strengthened as we moved down the river. (5) The wind strengthened during the night.	(1) 已请他来加强后卫力量。 (2) 我们将加强湿地保护。 (3) 大家尽力加强团结。 (4) 我们顺流而下时，水流更急了。 (5) 风在夜间刮得更猛了。

(3) Which syllable does the stress of this word fall on? (4) Here I will stress the importance of mathematics to the whole of science.	(1) 压力对你的健康会是非常有害的。 (2) 现在，强调以身作则这个问题很必要。 (3) 这个单词的重音是在哪个音节上? (4) 这里我要强调数学对整个科学的重要性。

strike n.罢工；打击；殴打 v.打；撞；罢工；划燃	(1) The dockers are coming out on strike for higher wages. (2) The coalminers have been out on strike for several weeks now. (3) The strike has delivered a heavy blow to the management. (4) His spirits sagged after that strike. (5) Next, the local press carried an order by the city's garrison commander forbidding soldiers to strike students. (6) He offered to strike the boy with his cane. (7) He struck the man a blow at the chin. (8) Be careful not to strike your head against the mantel. (9) His words incited them to strike. (10) I am sure the bus drivers will strike. (11) The girl struck a match to light a cigarette.	(1) 码头工人将举行罢工要求增加工资。 (2) 煤矿工人已罢工了几个星期。 (3) 这场罢工给资方以一个沉重打击。 (4) 受到打击后他有点萎靡不振了。 (5) 接着报纸上又刊出了城防司令部严禁军人殴打学生的布告。 (6) 他威胁要用手杖打那个男孩。 (7) 他一拳打在男子的下巴。 (8) 小心不要使你的头撞到壁炉架。 (9) 他的话煽动他们罢工。 (10) 我相信公共汽车司机会罢工的。 (11) 那女孩划火柴点燃一根烟。
string n.线；弦；一串；字串 vt.串起；收紧；悬挂；系；扎；抽去筋；使紧张；使兴奋 vi.连成一串	(1) Puppets are worked by strings. (2) The E string of the violin needs screwing up. (3) We have had a string of complaints about the program. (8) I bent down to tie the string to the dog's collar. (9) One end of that string was not fast to my heart. (10) I need a piece of string to tie this parcel up. (11) Winston undid the bit of string that held his overalls together. (12) He is highly strung for the game.	(1) 木偶是用线来操纵的。 (2) 这只小提琴的E弦需要调紧些。 (3) 我们已经收到了对该节目的一连串投诉。 (4) 如果登录失败,则返回空字符串。 (5) 她用细尼龙线把珠子串了起来。 (6) 你别太紧张啦! (7) 水池周围的树上悬挂著灯笼。 (8) 我弯下身去将绳子系在狗的颈圈上。 (9) 线的一头不是系在我的心上。 (10) 我需要一根细绳把这包裹扎起来。 (11) 温斯顿把扎住工作服的一根绳子解开。 (12) 他对比赛非常紧张。

stupid adj.愚蠢的；笨拙的；无聊的；乏味的 n.傻瓜	(1) What a stupid idiot! (2) I think he was born stupid. (3) The woman is proverbially stupid. (4) It was stupid of you to get involved. (5) He was inarticulate and stupid in thought. (6) This stupid car won't start. (7) What a stupid prick you are! (8) His stupid remarks really got us. (9) Please don't bother me with your stupid questions. (10) I didn't like his stupid party. (11) Hey, stupid! What do you think you're doing!	(1) 真是个愚蠢的白痴！ (2) 我认为他生来就愚笨。 (3) 这个女人是出名的愚蠢。 (4) 你卷进去了，真是愚蠢。 (5) 他不善于表达自己的思想，显得有点笨拙。 (6) 这辆老爷车就是发动不了。 (7) 你真是个大傻瓜！ (8) 他那无聊的议论使我们恼火。 (9) 请别拿那些无聊的问题来烦我。 (10) 我不喜欢他那乏味的聚会。 (11) 喂,傻瓜！你以为你在做什么啊！
style n.文体；风格；式样；时尚；类型	(1) The letter is written in formal style. (2) I wouldn't tell lies to you; that's not my style. (3) The style of this skirt is just in season. (4) Her clothes are always in style. (5) We have vases in various styles.	(1) 这封信是用正式文体写的。 (2) 我不会跟你撒谎，那不是我的风格。 (3) 这条裙子的款式正当时令。 (4) 她的衣服总是很时髦。 (5) 我们有各种各样的花瓶
subjective adj.主观的	(1) His arguments were never subjective. (2) He took a subjective view of the problem. (3) Grading of oral tests is quite subjective.	(1) 他的论点从来不是主观的。 (2) 他用主观的方法看问题。 (3) 口语考试的打分是相当主观的。
