topic n.题目；话题；标题	(1) Lack of space forbids further treatment of the topic here. (2) This essay is so short that it can only scratch the surface of the topic. (3) The essay isn't even remotely relevant to the topic. (4) The topic seemed to have a fascination for her. (5) They discussed the weather and other topics. (6) Let's take leave of the topic and turn to another. (7) Can we shunt the talks onto a new topic?	(1) 因篇幅所限，此处不便对本题作进一步阐述。 (2) 这篇文章很短，只能对这一问题作肤浅的探讨。 (3) 这篇文章毫不切题。 (4) 这个题目似乎对她很有吸引力。 (5) 他们讨论了气候和其他的话题。 (6) 这个问题就说到这里吧，现在来谈谈另一个话题。 (7) 我们谈话换个新话题好吧？
tortoise n.龟	(1) He bought two small tortoises for me. (2) Do you remember the story about race between the hare and the tortoise? (3) The tortoise crept along at an agonizingly slow speed.	(1) 他给我买了两只小乌龟。 (2) 你们还记得那个关于龟兔赛跑的故事么？ (3) 乌龟以极其缓慢的速度爬行着。
total adj.总的；全体的；完全的 n.总数；合计 v.共计；总计	(1) The total cost will be 126 dollars. (2) You can choose four out of the total number. (3) A dingle monthly total is posted to Accounts Receivable and Fees Earned in the general ledger. (4) The news comes as a total surprise. (5) The garden was in a state of total neglect. (6) As a pop star, he is a total failure. (7) Their expenses reached a total of 1,000 pounds. (8) That will cost you 7.50 in total. (9) In total over 100 people attended the conference. (10) Your debts total one thousand pounds. (11) The angles of a triangle total 180.	(1) 总的费用要126美元。 (2) 你可以从全部数目中选出四个。 (3) 全体的小峡谷月刊被寄到帐户应收帐款和费用在一般的分类帐中赚。 (4) 我得说这个消息来得太突然了。 (5) 那花园完全无人整理。 (6) 作为一位流行歌星,他是一位彻底的失败者。 (7) 他们的花费总计一千英镑。 (8) 你总共要花7. (9) 共计有百余人参加了这个会议。 (10) 你的债务共计为一千镑。 (11) 三角形的三角之和等于180°。
totally adv.完全	(1) The rampart was destroyed totally. (2) The details of the costume were totally authentic. (3) He immersed himself totally in his work. (4) I am totally bewildered by the clues to this crossword puzzle.	(1) 壁垒被彻底摧毁了。 (2) 这件古装的每个小地方都完全真实。 (3) 他埋头于工作。 (4) 这个纵横字谜的提示完全把我弄糊涂了。
touch vt.触摸；感动；吃；喝；触及 vi.接触；联系 n.触觉；接触；修饰；少许；痕迹	(1) Don't touch the paint until it's dry. (2) His sad story touched our hearts. (3) I'm not going to touch a thing tonight. (4) Sorry, I never touch alcoholic drink. (5) The peak seems to touch the sky. (6) He feared to touch on distressing memories. (7) The two wires were touching. (8) I had no difficulty in getting in touch with him. (9) We have been out of touch for years. (10) The blind have a keen sense of touch. (11) They keep close touch with me. (12) Bob had to touch up the exterior paintwork where it was necessary. (13) The wood-work is done, but there are a few places he has to touch up. (14) There was a touch of sarcasm in his tone. (15) Real jade is always cool to the touch and will resist any scratch with metal.	(1) 油漆未干,切勿触摸。 (2) 他的悲惨的故事深深打动了我们的心。 (3) 今天晚上,我什么也不打算吃了。 (4) 对不起，我从来不喝烈性酒。 (5) 山峰似乎已触及天空。 (6) 他害怕触及到令人伤心的往事。 (7) 那两条金属线搭在一起了。（《牛津高阶英汉双解词典》） (8) 我和他取得联系没有什么困难。 (9) 我们多年没联系了。 (10) 盲人有敏锐的触觉。 (11) 他们和我保持密切联系。 (12) 鲍勃要给所有外表需要修饰的地方上油漆。 (13) 这件木制品已经做好，但还有几处需要修饰修饰。 (14) 他的音调里有一点讽刺的痕迹。 (15) 真玉摸上去总有凉润之感，而且不怕金属刮擦，刮后也不留痕迹。
tough adj.强硬的；棘手的，难办的；艰苦的；严厉的；牢固的，强壮的；坚强的，坚韧的 adv.以强硬的态度；强硬地，顽强地 n.暴徒; 恶棍	(1) The government is taking a tough line on drug abuse. (2) I am well aware that this is a tough job. (3) Conditions are rather tough here. (4) The law is tough on offenders. (5) A gang of toughs attacked the police.	(1) 政府对滥用麻醉药品采取强硬方针。 (2) 我深知这是一件棘手的工作。 (3) 这里条件比较艰苦。 (4) 该法律对违法者处罚很严厉。 (5) 一群暴徒袭击了警察。
tour n.旅游；观光；巡回 v.周游；旅行；巡回	(1) They're going on a world tour. (2) We are going on a tour of the city this afternoon. (3) He went on a speaking tour of the United States. (4) She plans to tour about the world. (5) We are touring Italy for our holidays this year. (6) The play will tour the provinces in the fall.	(1) 他们正在环球旅行。 (2) 我们今天下午要到城里去观光。 (3) 他去美国作巡回演讲。 (4) 她打算周游世界。 (5) 今年我们假期要去意大利旅行。 (6) 这出戏将在秋天到各地巡回演出。
tourism n.旅游业；观光	(1) Tourism was then still in its infant stage. (2) We should work on improving our tourism industry. (3) The island has been ruined by tourism. (4) Tourism is a major source of income for the people of Thailand.	(1) 旅游业当时还处在初创阶段。 (2) 我们应该努力改进我们的旅游业。 (3) 该岛毁在旅游业上了。 (4) 观光是泰国人很重要的收入来源。
tourist n.旅游者；二等舱 adj.观光的；乘坐二等舱的	(1) The tourist complained that the room was too dirty. (2) The tourist is a Hungarian. (3) London is full of tourists in the summer. (4) A rd class is a tourist class. (5) We bought a tourist handbook before going travelling. (6) The tourist trade has become a real industry. (7) Tourist class passengers are prohibited from using the first-class lounge.	(1) 游客抱怨说房间太脏了。 (2) 这名游客是匈牙利人。 (3) 夏季伦敦有很多游客。 (4) 三等舱就是一般游客用的舱座。 (5) 出去旅游前,我们先买了一本旅游指南。 (6) 旅游业已经成为真正的产业。 (7) 经济舱乘客禁用头等舱休息室。
tournament n.锦标赛；比赛；比武	(1) Winning the tournament gratified the golf champion. (2) His victory in the tournament earned him $50000. (3) I won the tennis tournament. (4) She went out in the first round of the tournament/went out of the tournament in the first round. (5) She would no doubt have been anxious for something small in the way of a tournament.	(1) 那位高尔夫球世界冠军为赢得锦标赛而感到高兴。 (2) 他在这次锦标赛中获胜，挣得了5万元。 (3) 我赢了那场网球比赛。 (4) 她在比赛的第一轮比赛中遭淘汰。 (5) 她无疑急于想要举行一场小规模的马上比武。
toward prep.向；朝；对于；接近；关于；将近 adj.有希望的；有利的；逼近的	(1) He ran for dear life toward his house. (2) The bus follows the road toward Beijing. (3) I have shown enough forbearance toward him. (4) The Policeman continues to shuffle toward her. (5) Tom has an optimistic attitude toward the future. (6) But toward the end of the term you may suddenly find that time is running out.	(1) 他拼命地向他的房子跑去。 (2) 那公共汽车是顺着朝北京去的道路行驶。 (3) 我已经对他很有耐心了。 (4) 警察还是慢慢地移步接近她。 (5) 关于未来,汤姆持有一个乐观的态度。 (6) 但到将近期末时,你可能突然发现已经没有什么时间了。
towel n.毛巾；手巾 v.用毛巾擦	(1) I dry my hands and face with the towel. (2) She mops her tears with a towel. (3) Sop up the water with a paper towel. (4) He toweled himself dry.	(1) 我用毛巾擦干了双手和面部。 (2) 她用毛巾擦眼泪。 (3) 用纸巾把水吸乾。 (4) 他用毛巾擦干身体。
tower n.塔；高楼 vi.高耸；胜过	(1) There is a sonorous bell in the tower. (2) The tower was blown to atoms by the force of the explosion. (3) The bell tower is the emblem of this city. (4) Above the victorian houses and shops tower the monster office blocks of the redeveloped center. (5) Shakespeare towers above all other Elizabethan dramatists.	(1) 塔里有一口洪亮的钟。 (2) 爆炸的力量把塔炸得粉碎。 (3) 这座钟楼是这个城市的象征。 (4) 高耸于维多利亚时代房屋店铺之上的是新开发的市中心高大的办公楼群。 (5) 莎士比亚远超过伊丽莎白时代所有的剧作家。
trade n.贸易；交易；行业；同行；顾客；营业额；交易量 v.做生意；从事贸易；购物；营业；(在证券交易所)交易；交换	(1) China does a lot of trade with many countries. (2) There has been some shrinkage in our export trade. (3) He started his daughter up in the trade. (4) They offer discounts to the trade(= to people who are working in the same business). (5) That department store has a lot of trade. (6) I refuse to trade with that company again. (7) He trades in silk. (8) I used to trade at that store. (9) The firm has now ceased trading. (10) Shares were trading at under half their usual value. (11) My deskmate wanted to trade his pen for my book.	(1) 中国和许多国家进行多方面贸易。 (2) 我们的出口贸易量已有些减少。 (3) 他让女儿从事这一行业。 (4) 他们对同行业的人给予折扣。 (5) 那家百货公司顾客很多。 (6) 我拒绝再度和那家公司做生意。 (7) 他经营丝绸贸易。 (8) 过去我常在那家商店买东西。 (9) 这家商行现已停业。 (10) 那些股份以低于通常价值的一半买卖。 (11) 我的同桌想用他的钢笔换我这本书。
tradition n.传统；惯例	(1) We shall carry forward the revolutionary tradition. (2) In many countries young people still keep up the tradition that women will get married in a long white dress. (3) They still follow the tradition of their fathers. (4) The older generation are respectful of tradition. (5) They decided to break with tradition. (6) It was very sad to see the tradition die. (7) This decision represents a complete break with tradition.	(1) 我们应该发扬革命传统。 (2) 许多国家里，年轻人仍保持着妇女结婚时穿白色长礼服的传统。 (3) 他们仍然继承著他们祖先的传统。 (4) 年老的一辈尊重传统。 (5) 他们决定打破惯例。 (6) 看到这个惯例取消，感到非常悲伤。 (7) 这一决定完全打破了以往的惯例。
traffic lights 交通灯,红绿灯	(1) Go down the road till you reach the traffic lights. (2) The traffic lights have changed (from red to green). (3) The two sets of traffic lights were out of phase (ie did not show the same change at the same time) and several accidents occurred. (4) The car came to a full stop at the traffic lights. (5) The driver pulled up at the traffic lights. (6) The two sets of traffic lights were out of phase.	(1) 沿路前行直至有交通灯处。 (2) 交通灯由红灯变绿灯了。 (3) 那两组交通灯不同步因而发生了几起事故。 (4) 汽车在交通信号灯处停住了。 (5) 司机在红绿灯前把车停住。 (6) 那两组交通灯不同步。
trainer n.训练者；训练设备；（软底）运动鞋	(1) The cat suddenly turned on its trainer. (2) As we were rushing through my lace cam undone on my trainer so I stopped to tie it up.	(1) 这只猫突然转而进攻它的训练者。 (2) 当我们正在冲闯过在我的训练者上被恢复原状的我饰带凸轮，我停止将它绑好。
tram n.缆车；煤车；有轨电车 v.乘缆车；用煤车运；乘有轨电车	(1) A tram was just arriving at the hill foot. (2) If you go to Melbourne, you can travel by tram. (3) The tram is being switched on to another track.	(1) 一辆缆车刚到达山脚下。 (2) 如果你要去墨尔本，你可以做有轨电车。 (3) 电车正被移至另外一条轨道上。
transform vt.改变；转换 vi.改变；变形；变态	(1) She is responsible for the character part of the hero's devoted mother. (2) The magician transformed the frog into a princess. (3) His plans were transformed overnight into reality. (4) We should try to transform heat into power. (5) I believe she would transform me into a talker.	(1) 她负责这个主人公的忠诚的母亲的角色部分。 (2) 魔术师把青蛙变成了公主。 (3) 他的计划迅速变为现实。 (4) 我们应该设法将热转化为能量。 (5) 我相信，她会把我这个沉默寡言的人变成个碎嘴子。
translate v.翻译；解释；转移；调动	(1) I need to translate it into English. (2) Be you plan to translate the novel? (3) I translate his silence as a protest. (4) It is hard to translate the animal's behaviour . (5) We should translate the schemes into actions. (6) He was translated to the Ministry of Defence.	(1) 我必须把它译成英语。 (2) 你计划翻译这部小说吗？ (3) 我把他的沉默解释为抗议。 (4) 那种动物的行为很难解释。 (5) 我们应该把计划变成行动。 (6) 他被调到国防部工作。
translation n.翻译；译文；RNA的转录；平移	(1) I am making a verbal translation. (2) The effect of the novel loses in translation. (3) I think her translation of the article is much better than his. (4) Invariance under translation in time leads to conservation of energy.	(1) 我正在逐字的翻译。 (2) 这部小说经过翻译失色不少。 (3) 我认为她对这篇文章的翻译要比他强的多。 (4) 在时间平移下的不变性导致能量守恒。
transparent adj.透明的；明显的；清晰的	(1) Plain glass is transparent. (2) The insect's wings are almost transparent. (3) It was transparent that her pride was hurt. (4) Your words are a transparent lie. (5) I like her transparent style of writing. (6) The meaning of this passage seems quite transparent.	(1) 普通的白玻璃是透明的。 (2) 这昆虫的翅膀几乎是透明的。 (3) 很显然，她的自尊心受到了伤害。 (4) 你所说的明显是谎言。 (5) 我喜欢她明晰的文体。 (6) 这一段的意思看来是相当清楚的。
translator n.翻译者	(1) The copyright in the work shall be enjoyed by the adaptor and translator. (2) To truly translate, the translator has to modify the writers original meaning and word order to design a new sentence.	(1) 本作品的著作权应由改编者及翻译者共享有。 (2) 对真正的翻译来说，翻译者必须修饰作者的原意，改变词序，设计一个新句子。
transport n.运输；心醉 v.运输；传播；流放；激动	(1) The goods have been cased up for transport. (2) London Transport run extra trains during the rush-hour. (3) Please find alternative means of transport. (4) The transport of goods by air is very expensive. (5) A helicopter was used to transport the wounded. (6) Wheat is transported from the farms to the mills. (7) Flies transport different kinds of diseases. (8) I was reluctant to let language transport me.	(1) 货物已装箱待运。 (2) 伦敦运输公司在交通高峰时 间增开加班列车。 (3) 请另外找一个运输方法。 (4) 空运货物费用十分昂贵。 (5) 一架直升飞机被用来运送伤员。 (6) 把小麦从农场运到面粉厂。 (7) 苍蝇传播各种不同的疾病。 (8) 我不情愿被语言弄得失魂落魄。
traveler n.旅行者(移式起重机；导丝钩；临时记帐单)	(1) A cavern was found by a traveler under the mountain. (2) The Russian traveler was equipped with masses of electronic devices. (3) The traveler took out a bottle of water from the pack on his back. (4) The traveler wrapped himself with a blanket. (5) She was too timid to talk with other travelers.	(1) 一名游客在山下发现了一个大洞穴。 (2) 这些俄罗斯旅行者携带了大量的电子设备。 (3) 那位旅行者从他的背包中拿出了一瓶水。 (4) 旅行者用毯子把自己裹上。 (5) 她很害羞，不敢和其他旅行者交谈。
treasure n.财富；宝物 vt.珍藏；珍视	(1) A nation's treasure is in its scholars. (2) This museum has many art treasures. (3) They went to the cave in quest of hidden treasure. (4) I shall always treasure the memory of our meetings. (5) To treasure what you have is actually the beginning to own everything.	(1) 学者是国家的财富。 (2) 这家博物馆收藏了许多艺术珍品。 (3) 他们到山洞去寻找宝藏。 (4) 我将永远记住我们相聚的情景。 (5) 珍惜,是拥有一切的开始。
treatment n.治疗；对待；处理	(1) I tried every treatment the doctor suggested. (2) The treatment arrested the growth of the disease. (3) This is a new product for the treatment of industrial waste.	(1) 我试遍了医生建议的每一种疗法。 (2) 治疗抑制了病情的发展。 (3) 这是一种处理工业废物的新产品。
tremble n.战悚；颤抖 v.发抖；忧虑；震颤	(1) His remarks struck a tremble into her heart. (2) The dog was all of a tremble with cold. (3) He was trembling with rage. (4) After the severest reprimand, he did not tremble . (5) I tremble to think what's going to happen. (6) The whole house trembled when the train went by.	(1) 他的话令她感到不寒而栗。 (2) 这条狗冻得全身发抖。 (3) 他气得发抖。 (4) 即使受到最严厉的申斥，他也不发抖。 (5) 我一想到即将发生的事就担心。 (6) 火车经过时，整座房子都在震颤。
trend n.趋势；倾向；方位 vi.倾向；转向	(1) The trend of prices is still upward. (2) The youth like to follow the latest trends in fashion. (3) This quartet represents a major new trend in modern music. (4) The event changed the trend of public opinion. (5) The mountains have a western trend. (6) The prices of houses are trending upwards. (7) The trend towards product customization has forced many apparel manufacturers to shift from mass production to more flexible, high-volume production. (8) Actually, the trend of Anti-Humanistic thought is also a kind of humanism which is deeply influenced by the shift of western philosophy.	(1) 物价仍有上涨趋势。 (2) 年轻人喜好追求最新的流行款式。 (3) 这首四重奏的曲子反映了现代音乐中一种主要的新趋向。 (4) 这件事改变了舆论的趋向。 (5) 群山向西延伸。 (6) 房价趋于上涨。 (7) 产品的定制化趋势迫使许多服装制造厂家不得不由批量生产转向更灵活的高产量生产。 (8) 反人道主义思潮受到西方哲学转向的深刻影响，反人道主义思潮实际上也是一种人道主义。
trial n.审讯；试验；试用；尝试；预赛或选拔赛；讨厌的事；惹麻烦的人 v.测试	(1) He went through hell during the trial. (2) The flier is flying a new-type jet plane on trial. (3) She agreed to employ me for a trial period. (4) Trial and error is the source of our knowledge. (5) They succeeded in the experiment on the fifteenth trial. (6) His blindness is a great trial to him. (7) The child was a trial to his parents.	(1) 审讯期间他吃尽了苦头。 (2) 飞行员正在驾驶一架新式喷气机作试验飞行。 (3) 她同意试用我一段时间。 (4) 尝试和失败同是学识之源。 (5) 他们在第十五次尝试时获得了成功。 (6) 眼睛瞎对他来说是非常麻烦的事。 (7) 那孩子真让他父母烦得够呛。
triangle n.三角(形)	(1) He outlined the triangle in red. (2) The angles of a triangle total 180. (3) The place is a cobbled triangle.	(1) 他用红笔画出三角形。 (2) 三角形的三角之和等于180°。 (3) 这个地方是一块铺石子的三角地。
trick n.诡计；花招；把戏；诀窍 vt.欺骗；戏弄 adj.有诡计的；有阴谋的	(1) Her tears were just a trick to deceive others. (2) You can't fool me with that old trick! (3) If you watch carefully,you'll see how the trick is done. (4) The trick is to hold your breath while you aim. (5) Her partner tried to trick her out of her share. (6) There are rumors about that you are trying to trick me. (7) This man is quite trick and undependable.	(1) 她的眼泪只是欺骗别人的诡计。 (2) 你玩弄那种老花招骗不了我! (3) 如果你仔细观看,你就会发现那个把戏是怎么耍的。 (4) 窍门就在于瞄准时须屏住呼吸。 (5) 她的合伙人企图骗走她的股份。 (6) 有传言说你在耍我。 (7) 这个人滑头滑脑，很不可靠。
trolley-bus n.无轨电车	(1) Do this trolley- bus run past the park? (2) The enrolled jolly stroller polled on the trolley.	(1) 这无轨电车经过公园吗？ (2) 被招收的快乐的散步者在无轨电车上投票。
troop n.群；组；军队；大量 vi.群集；结队；成群前行	(1) There is a troop of monkeys in the woods. (2) The enemy made a thrust against our troop. (3) The troop made good their retreat from the occupied city. (4) He came out with a troop of followers. (5) We trooped into the meeting. (6) The audience began to troop away. (7) They would troop shouting with joy and laughter into our restaurant.	(1) 林子中有一群猴子。 (2) 敌人向我军发动了袭击。 (3) 部队从沦陷的城市安全撤出。 (4) 他带着一大群随从走出来。 (5) 我们一起走进会场。 (6) 听众开始成群结队地离去。 (7) 他们会高兴地叫着、笑着拥进我们的饭馆。
troublesome adj.令人烦恼的；讨厌的；困难的；棘手的	(1) You must learn to rid yourself of such troublesome thoughts. (2) She has left, for instance, some troublesome bits of scaffolding, like the vermiform appendix, behind. (3) This species is a troublesome weed. (4) He hoped in this way to get rid of the troublesome prisoner. (5) A troublesome situation has grown up. (6) Noise has always been the most troublesome problem in seismic prospecting.	(1) 你必须学会使自己摆脱如此令人烦恼的想法。 (2) 比如，它遗留下了令人烦恼的残留物，如隐藏的阑尾。 (3) 本种是一根令人讨厌的杂草。 (4) 他指望这样除掉这个讨厌的囚犯。 (5) 出现了使人感到棘手的局面。 (6) 噪声始终是地震勘探中最棘手的问题。
truly adv.真实地；真诚地；正确地	(1) The performance truly exalted the audience. (2) She didn't let anyone know what she truly felt. (3) The birth of a baby is truly a blessed event. (4) He knew he had behaved badly and he seemed truly sorry. (5) Mary is truly a homespun girl from the country.	(1) 演出确使观众情绪高昂。 (2) 她不让别人知道她的真实感情。 (3) 生个孩子真是喜事。 (4) 他知道自己表现不好，所以确实显得懊悔。 (5) 玛丽实实在在是一位来自乡村的朴实的女孩。
trunk n.树干；(汽车后部)行李箱；大箱子；象鼻；躯干 (复)trunks: 男用运动裤.	(1) The branch has separated from the trunk of the tree. (2) I eulogize the tall and straight trunk of the white poplar. (3) The trunk is chock-full. There is no more room. (4) He crammed all his clothes into the trunk. (5) A trunk distinguishes the elephant. (6) The athlete has a powerful trunk.	(1) 这个树枝已从树干上脱落了。 (2) 我赞美白杨树那挺拔的树干。 (3) 车尾行李箱里塞满了东西。一点空隙都没有了。 (4) 他把他所有的衣服硬塞进皮箱。 (5) 长鼻是象的特征。 (6) 那个运动员身躯强壮有力。
trust n.信任；信托 vi.信任 vt.相信；委托	(1) A good marriage is based on trust. (2) In his will he created trusts for his children. (3) You must trust in your own judgement. (4) Can you trust his account of what happened? (5) Can I trust you to post this letter?	(1) 美满的婚姻是建立在互相信任的基础上的。 (2) 他在遗嘱里为子女安排好了信托财产。 (3) 你得相信自己的判断力. (4) 你能相信他对发生的事情所做的报告吗？ (5) 我托你把这封信寄走行吗?
tube n.管子；管状物；<英>地铁；电视；管状器官 v.提供或装上管子	(1) This tube is flexible but tough. (2) She bought a tube of toothpaste. (3) I go to work on the tube. (4) What's on the tube? (5) The appendix is a worm-like tube between two and four inches long protruding from the start of the large intestine.	(1) 这管子柔软但很坚固。 (2) 她买了一管牙膏。 (3) 我经常乘地铁去上班。 (4) 电视上正演什么? (5) 阑尾是一突出于大肠起始端，2-4英寸长的蠕虫样的管状器官。
tune n.曲调；调子；和谐；协调；数量 vt.为 ... 调音；调整 vi.调音；调整频率	(1) He played a tune on the violin. (2) She was humming a tune to herself. (3) The violin is not quite in tune with the piano. (4) His ideas are in tune with the times. (5) He was fined for speeding to the tune of 200. (6) The orchestra tuned their instruments. (7) The machine has just been tuned. (8) Please tune up your instruments before class. (9) We always tune in at ten o'clock to hear the news.	(1) 他用小提琴演奏了一首曲子。 (2) 她自个儿哼著小调。 (3) 这小提琴跟钢琴的调子不太和谐。 (4) 他的思想适合时代的潮流。 (5) 他因超速行车被罚款达 200 英镑。 (6) 乐队在给乐器调音。 (7) 机器刚刚调整过。 (8) 请在上课前调好乐器的音调。 (9) 我们总是在10点钟收听新闻。
tutor n.家庭教师；导师 v.指导；当家庭教师；当导师	(1) His parents employed a tutor to teach him Greek. (2) Most parents have no time to tutor their children. (3) For extra money, she tutors on weekends. (4) I was asked to tutor three students and I gladly accepted.	(1) 他父母雇佣了一位家庭教师来教他希腊语。 (2) 大部分家长没有时间辅导孩子。 (3) 为了多挣些钱，她在周末当家庭教师。 (4) 我被邀请当3个学生的导师,对此我欣然应允。
twenty num.二十	(1) We invited twenty people, but only a handful of them came. (2) He lived in California until he was twenty. (3) He was a famous artist in the twenties.	(1) 我们邀请了20 个人，但只来了寥寥数人。 (2) 他在加里弗尼亚一直住到20岁。 (3) 他在二十年代是一个著名的艺术家。
twenty-one num.二十一	(1) Oh, I wish to goodness I were twenty one. (2) Next monday is my birthday of twenty first.	(1) 嗨，我要是二十一岁就好了。 (2) 下星期一是我二十一岁的生日。
twist v.缠绕；捻；搓；拧；扭曲 n.拧；捻；扭曲；盘旋；弯曲处	(1) She twisted the long scarf round her head. (2) Selecting the suitable twist factor in order to meet the needs of flax knitting yarn, it is the key to increase high_grade and productivity of flax knitting products. (3) We twisted the bed sheets into a rope and escaped by climbing down it. (4) The cap should twist off easily. (5) The papers twisted everything I said. (6) She gave the lid another twist and it came off. (7) Selecting the suitable twist factor in order to meet the needs of flax knitting yarn, it is the key to increase high_grade and productivity of flax knitting products. (8) His answer showed a mental twist. (9) The mountain road began to twist up,steeper and steeper. (10) The accident happened at the twist in the road.	(1) 她把那条长围巾围在头上。 (2) 选择合理的捻系数以满足针织用纱的要求是提高亚麻针织产品档次和生产效率的关键。 (3) 我们把床单搓成绳子，援绳下坠逃跑了。 (4) 这个帽儿应该容易拧开。 (5) 报纸把我的话全都歪曲了。 (6) 她又拧了一下，盖儿开了。 (7) 选择合理的捻系数以满足针织用纱的要求是提高亚麻针织产品档次和生产效率的关键。 (8) 他的回答显示了心智失常。 (9) 山路开始向上曲折盘旋，越来越陡。 (10) 这场事故发生在道路的拐弯处。
typewriter n.打字机	(1) The computer is more expensive than the typewriter. (2) The typewriter is at your service.	(1) 这部电脑比这部打字机更贵。 (2) 这台打字机随便你使用。
typical adj.特有的；典型的；有代表性的	(1) Since I'm here, I'd like to try a typical dish of this country. (2) This is a typical bourgeois neighborhood. (3) They reacted to the appalling weather with typical British stoicism. (4) We had some typical Bavarian food.	(1) 既然来了，我想吃这个国家特有的食物。 (2) 这是一个典型的中产阶级地区。 (3) 他们忍受着恶劣天气的煎熬,表现了英国人典型的坚韧不拔的精神。 (4) 我们点了一些最具巴伐利亚代表性的食物。
typhoon n.台风	(1) The typhoon is gathering strength. (2) The typhoon hit the coastal area. (3) The navy rescued forty people in the typhoon. (4) The typhoon pulled up many trees by the roots. (5) They have received notice of a typhoon approaching.	(1) 台风的风力正逐渐增强。 (2) 台风侵袭沿海地区。 (3) 海军在台风天时救了四十个人。 (4) 台风把许多树连根拔了起来。 (5) 他们已收到台风即将来临的预报。
typist n.打字员	(1) She worked as a typist in a law firm. (2) Our typist is away on holiday this week.	(1) 她在一家律师事务所当打字员。 (2) 我们这儿的打字员这星期因休假没上班。
tyre n.轮胎 =tire（美）. Tyre：提尔(古代腓尼基的有名港口； 现属黎巴嫩).	(1) A bald tyre is no longer safe to use. (2) A tyre expands when you pump air into it.	(1) 磨光了的轮胎用起来不安全。 (2) 轮胎一打气就鼓起来。
ugly adj.丑陋的；难看的；令人困窘的；令人不愉快的	(1) Toads have an ugly appearance but they are useful. (2) You can't persuade me to buy this ugly vase! (3) His face was covered in ugly red blotches. (4) What an ugly mug! (5) This is an ugly situation. (6) I heard an ugly rumour that they are going to shut all the pubs on Sundays.	(1) 蟾蜍外表丑陋，但很有用。 (2) 你不能劝服我买这个丑陋的花瓶！ (3) 他脸上有许多难看的红色大斑点。 (4) 多难看的脸！ (5) 这是个令人困窘的情况。 (6) 我听到一个令人不愉快的传闻，说是星期天所有的酒店都将关门。
UN abbr.(=United Nations) 联合国 pron.<口>人，事物，家伙，东西	(1) abbr.(=United Nations) 联合国 (2) pron.<口>人，事物，家伙，东西	(1) abbr.(=United Nations) 联合国 (2) pron.<口>人，事物，家伙，东西
unable adj.不能的；不会的	(1) He is an able person, nothing is unable to him. (2) Despite our great advances in microbiology, we are still unable to differentiate these organisms that cause the different infections.	(1) 他是一个能人，对他没有不能的事。 (2) 不管我们的在微生物学的大进展，我们仍然是不能的区分引起不同的感染的这些有机体。
unbearable adj.无法忍受的	(1) The uncertainty is unbearable! (2) The politician found the piteous cries of the starving children unbearable.	(1) 事情定不下来真让人难以忍受！ (2) 这个政治家发现饥饿的孩子们可怜的哭声让人不忍心听下去。
unbelievable adj.难以置信的	(1) They work with an unbelievable speed. (2) His ecstasy to the pop music is unbelievable.	(1) 他们以令人难以置信的速度工作。 (2) 他对流行音乐的入迷是令人难以置信的。
uncertain adj.不确定的；不稳定的；易变的	(1) Life on earth is short and uncertain. (2) I'm uncertain whether to go or not. (3) It seems uncertain why he lost the election. (4) I told him what I thought of him in no uncertain terms! (5) This is a very uncertain time for the global economy. (6) The uncertain weather delayed our departure.	(1) 地面上的生命是短暂而不确定的。 (2) 我不能肯定去还是不去。 (3) 他落选的原因似乎并不清楚。 (4) 我毫不含糊地把我对他的看法告诉了他。 (5) 当前全球经济正面临一个极不稳定的时期。 (6) 天气变换莫测，延误了我们启程。
uncomfortable adj.不舒服的；不自在的	(1) But women alway wear uncomfortable shoes. (2) I'm uncomfortable being introduced to a new person. (3) And looking uncomfortable made me look terrible!	(1) 可是女人们总是穿不舒服的鞋子。 (2) 你会觉得给别人介绍你才去的时候有不自在的感觉吗？ (3) 不舒服自在的穿着，使我看起来糟透了。
unconditional adj.无条件的；无限制的；绝对的	(1) Discharge may be conditional or unconditional. (2) On the plaintiff's application for summary judgment the master give the defendant unconditional leave to defend. (3) This war's objective is less than the unconditional defeat of the enemy. (4) It has unconditional sovereignty over the state.	(1) 解除责任可以是有条件或无条件的。 (2) 原告一提出即判决申请后，法院书记官无条件允许被告进行辩护。 (3) 这场战争的目的决不是无限制地打败敌人。 (4) 它对国家有绝对的权威。
unconscious adj.失去知觉的；无意的	(1) He lay unconscious in a pool of blood. (2) This wounded soldier was unconscious from his loss of blood. (3) He is unconscious of having made a serious error. (4) I was unconscious of her presence.	(1) 他失去知觉，躺在血泊之中。 (2) 这名伤员由于失血过多而昏迷不醒。 (3) 他未察觉到已犯了严重的错误。 (4) 我不知道她在场。
underline v.在…下面划线；强调	(1) Please underline the important items. (2) In writing you should underline titles of books. (3) These different roles underline the importance of these cells.	(1) 请在重要事项的下面划线。 (2) 写作时你该在书名下画线。 (3) 这些不同的作用强调了这些细胞的重要性。
understanding n.理解；非正式协议；谅解；同情心 adj.有同情心的	(1) Love is the byname of understanding and care. (2) Such matters transcend human understanding. (3) A knowledge of economics is fundamental to any understanding of this problem. (4) We have reached an understanding with them. (5) There is an understanding between us that we will not sell to each other's customers. (6) We could count on benevolent understanding. (7) She showed great love and understanding.	(1) 爱是理解和体贴的别名。 (2) 这些事情是人类所无法理解的。 (3) 经济知识对于理解这个问题是至关重要的。 (4) 我们和他们达成了协议。 (5) 我们有个协议，不向对方的顾客出售货物。 (6) 我们可以指望得到善意的谅解。 (7) 她表现出极大的爱和同情。
undertake v.承担；从事；保证；答应	(1) We could undertake the work for the time being. (2) We shall undertake the construction of this bridge. (3) Whatever I may undertake in the coming years, I don't need your help. (4) I can not undertake that you will make a profit. (5) He undertook to finish the job by Friday.	(1) 我们可暂时承担这项工作。 (2) 我们将负责这座桥的修建工程。 (3) 未来无论我从事什么,我都不需要你的帮助。 (4) 我不能保证你会获利。 (5) 他答应星期五之前完成这项工作。
underwear n.内衣	(1) She changes her undarweer every day. (2) My mother has bought the thermal underwear for me.	(1) 她每天换内衣内裤。 (2) 我妈妈已经给我买了保暖内衣。
undivided adj.专一的；没分开的	(1) You have my full and undivided attention. (2) An undivided nation is the efforts of everyone in this country.	(1) 你是我一心一意注意的人。 (2) 统一的名族需要这个国家每一个人的努力。
undo v.解开；松开；取消	(1) Would you please undo this knot for me? (2) He tried to undo the knot by picking at it with his fingers. (3) To return a database to its state as of the last committed change, i.e., to undo recent uncommitted changes. (4) A compensating transaction means that a new transaction will undo the effects of previous transactions.	(1) 你能不能帮我把这个结解开？ (2) 他用手指不停地扯，想把绳结解开。 (3) 使一个数据库返回到它上次已确认的改变之后的状态，即取消最近的尚未确认的变动。 (4) 补偿事务的意思是一个新事物会用于取消前一个事务的所有效果。
unemployment n.失业；失业人数	(1) Mass unemployment may lead to social upheaval. (2) The specter of unemployment haunted the land. (3) The decrease in unemployment was 30 percent. (4) One deals with unemployment claims.	(1) 大批失业会导致社会动乱。 (2) 失业的恐怖笼罩全国。 (3) 失业人数减少了百分之三十。 (4) 一个涉及到失业人数情况。
unfair adj.不公平的；(商业上)不正当的	(1) The detention of the whole class was unfair. (2) It's unfair to devalue anyone's work unjustly.	(1) 滞留全班学生是不公平的。 (2) 不公正地贬低任何人的工作都是不公平的。
unfit adj.不合适的；不健康的 vt.使不合格	(1) The water is unfit for drinking. (2) This house is unfit for human habitation. (3) She was unfit for such a senior position. (4) The army rejected him as medically unfit. (5) You're very unfit; you ought to take up running.	(1) 这水不宜饮用。 (2) 这所房子不适合人居住。 (3) 她不能胜任这样的高级职位。 (4) 由于体检不合格，部队未接收他。 (5) 你身体很弱，应该练练跑步。
unfold v.展开；开放；显露	(1) The war seemed to unfold in the blink of an eye. (2) That's how life tends to unfold before us. (3) She seemed to unfold like a strong white lily under this genial breath of admiration and homage. (4) A walk through town will unfold many interesting buildings.	(1) 这场战争在眨眼间就展开了。 (2) 生活就是这样在我们前面展开。 (3) 她似乎在这赞赏和尊敬的真诚氛围之中象一朵白色的水仙那样猛烈地开放了。 (4) 一条穿越城镇的行道将显露很多有趣的建筑物。
unfortunate adj.不幸的；令人遗憾的 n.不幸的人	(1) The unfortunate man shot himself afterwards. (2) His indifference to future needs is unfortunate. (3) The poor unfortunate had starved to death.	(1) 那个不幸的男人后来开枪自杀了。 (2) 他对未来的需要漠不关心真令人遗憾。 (3) 这个可怜的倒霉蛋是饿死的。
unfortunately adv.不幸地；遗憾地	(1) Unfortunately, I missed the last train. (2) Unfortunately, I hurt my knee when I fell down on the ice. (3) Unfortunately I am not aware of that. (4) Unfortunately, the restaurant he recommended fell far short of our expectations.	(1) 我不幸错过了末班火车。 (2) 真不幸，我在冰上摔倒时摔伤了膝盖。 (3) 遗憾的是，我不知道此事。 (4) 遗憾的是,他推荐的餐厅与我们心目中的相去甚远。
unhappy adj.不快乐的；不高兴的；不幸福的；不满的	(1) I overheard them saying they were unhappy. (2) My heart bled for the poor unhappy children. (3) I was unhappy because of the discomforts of travel. (4) He was unhappy because of his separation from his mother. (5) She looked unhappy after she read the letter. (6) He told me about his unhappy childhood. (7) He repined against his unhappy lot. (8) We are unhappy about the way the doctor treated us.	(1) 我偶然听到他们说，他们很不快乐。 (2) 我心里为这些不快乐的孩子们感到悲痛。 (3) 我因为旅行的不适而感到不快。 (4) 他因与母亲分离而感到不快。 (5) 她看过信后显得挺不高兴。 (6) 他对我讲了他不幸福的童年。 (7) 他自叹命运多舛。 (8) 我们对医生这样对待我们感到不满。
unhealthy adj.不健康的；有害健康的；病态的或不正常的	(1) The sick boy had an unhealthy flush and must have contracted pneumonia. (2) French fries are unhealthy food. (3) We must get rid of the unhealthy living habits. (4) Their slavish devotion to the leader is unhealthy. (5) He had an unhealthy interest in disease and death.	(1) 病孩子脸上有一种不健康的红晕，一定是感染上肺炎了。 (2) 薯条不是健康的食物。 (3) 我们必须改掉不健康的生活方式。 (4) 他们对领导的盲目崇拜是不健康的。 (5) 他对疾病与死亡有病态的兴趣。
uniform n.制服 adj.一致的；统一的	(1) He looks very manly in his uniform. (2) The students are wearing school uniforms. (3) The rows of houses were uniform in appearance. (4) Their internal temperatures are essentially uniform with the environment. (5) Lack of uniform standards is a problem. (6) Now many bus routes in this city charge two yuan as a uniform fare.	(1) 他穿着制服十分精神。 (2) 学生们穿着校服。 (3) 这一排排的房屋外表都是一样的。 (4) 它们的体温与周围环境基本上是一致的。 (5) 尚缺乏统一标准规定。 (6) 现在,这座城市的许多公交路线无论距离远近都统一收取两元车费。
unimportant adj.不重要的	(1) Relatively speaking, this matter is unimportant. (2) Don't quibble about unimportant things with me.	(1) 相对来说，这事并不重要。 (2) 别为了琐碎的小事和我狡辩。
union n.结合；工会；联盟；和睦；连接轴；【数】并，并集 adj.联邦政府的；工会的	(1) They had a sound basis of union. (2) He was elected the leader of the union. (3) He has changed his stance on monetary union. (4) All the nationalities live together in perfect union. (5) Nine States seceded from the Union government and established their own confederate government. (6) Some of the union members did not want to picket. (7) A democrat usually gets the union's endorsement.	(1) 他们的结合有着坚实的基础。 (2) 他被选为工会的领导人。 (3) 他已经改变了对货币联盟的态度。 (4) 各族人民非常和睦地生活在一起。 (5) 九个州脱离联邦政府,成立了自己的邦联政府。 (6) 工会的一些会员不想担任罢工纠察员。 (7) 民主主义者通常都得到工会的支持。
unique adj.独特的；独一无二的；稀罕的	(1) He occupies a unique place in English literature. (2) The elephant's trunk is a unique form of appendage. (3) The custom is unique to the region. (4) Her style of writing is rather unique.	(1) 他在英国文学中占有独特的地位。 (2) 象的鼻子是一种独特的附肢。 (3) 这种风俗是这一地区特有的。 (4) 她的写作风格很不寻常。
unit n.单元；单位；部件；组件	(1) This textbook has twenty units. (2) There's a rumour floating around of a new job in the unit. (3) The family is the smallest social unit. (4) Cubit is an ancient unit of length. (5) What's the unit cost? (6) Remove the letter printing unit. (7) The IPP, my second example, is a sophisticated turbine that acts as the auxiliary power unit on engine starts.	(1) 这本课本有二十单元。 (2) 这个部门盛传有个新工作要聘人。 (3) 家庭是社会最小的单位。 (4) 腕尺是古代的一种长度单位。 (5) 单位成本是多少钱? (6) 移开贺卡组件。 (7) 综合动力组件，也就是我所举的第二个例子，是一台在发动机启动过程中扮演辅助动力角色的技术成熟的涡轮发动机。
unite v.联合；合并；统一；团结	(1) They unite to form a new company. (2) The more of the masses we unite with, the better. (3) Two major telecommunication providers will unite into one. (4) The oceans do not divide the world so much as unite it. (5) We must unite as many people as possible.	(1) 他们联合组成一个新公司。 (2) 我们联合起来的群众越多，就越有利。 (3) 两大主要的电信提供商会合并成一家。 (4) 与其说是海洋分割这个世界,不如说是统一这个世界。 (5) 我们要团结尽可能多的人。
universal adj.普遍的；全世界的；宇宙的；全体的；通用的 n.通用原理，普遍原则	(1) These phenomena is very universal. (2) Overpopulation is a universal problem. (3) Music has been called the universal language. (4) The doer is a universal structure. (5) A universal theory cannot be induced from a finite number of facts. (6) Americans strongly favour the introduction of universal health care. (7) Therefore any attempt at a universal tool set also proves futile. (8) There are no economic universals.	(1) 这些现象己经非常普遍了。 (2) 人口过多是全球性的问题。 (3) 人们称音乐为世界的语言。 (4) 行事者是一个宇宙的结构。 (5) 一项宇宙的学说不能从有限数目的事实归纳而得。 (6) 美国人强烈赞同推行覆盖全体国民的医保制度。 (7) 因此,任何建立一个通用工具集的尝试被认为是徒劳的。 (8) 英语是一种世界通用的语言。
unknown adj.未知的；不出名的	(1) I braced myself for the unknown. (2) Its greater part is unknown to me. (3) He was an unknown novelist then. (4) No one could match the skill of the unknown carver.	(1) 我准备好了去接受未知的命运。 (2) 它的大部分对我是未知的。 (3) 当时他是位不出名的小说家。 (4) 没有哪个人的技艺能比得上那位不出名的雕刻家。
unless conj.除非；如果不 prep.除 ... 外	(1) I won't go to the party unless I'm invited. (2) I sleep with the window open unless its really cold. (3) Iron corrodes unless it is greased or kept clean. (4) Nothing could stop me from waiting for you to come back unless death.	(1) 除非我被邀请，否则我不会去参加晚会的。 (2) 我总是开著窗户睡觉，除非天气非常冷才关上窗户。 (3) 如果不涂油或保持清洁铁便会腐蚀。 (4) 除了死亡再没有别的事物能够阻止我等待你回来。
unmarried adj.未婚的；独身的 n.未婚者	(1) His unmarried sisters were left quite unprovided for in the will. (2) More and more unmarried people prefer to live with their families. (3) He remained unmarried all his life. (4) Though he is forty,he is still unmarried.	(1) 他在遗嘱中没有给他的未婚姐妹留下财产。 (2) 越来越多未婚的人喜欢和家人一起生活。 (3) 他终生未娶。 (4) 尽管他已经40岁了,但还是独身。
unpleasant adj.使人不愉快的；讨厌的；不合意的；不友好的，粗鲁的	(1) It happened with unpleasant consequences. (2) He was about to mingle in an unpleasant affair. (3) That girl is a very unpleasant cup of tea. (4) They always pick on him to do the unpleasant jobs.	(1) 这件事产生了令人不愉快的后果。 (2) 他会陷入一桩不愉快的事情。 (3) 那女孩是个非常讨厌的人。 (4) 他们总找他去做那些令人讨厌的差事。
unrest n.不安；动乱；动荡的局面	(1) There's (a feeling of) unrest in the air. (2) The unrest erupted into revolution. (3) People are predicting civil unrest in the area. (4) Politic unrest will cause economic instability.	(1) 四处充满了不安(的感觉)。 (2) 动乱爆发为革命。 (3) 人们预言该地区将发生动乱。 (4) 政治动荡会导致经济不稳定。
unsafe adj.不安全的；危险的；靠不住的	(1) The auto- maker recalls a lot of cars that are unsafe. (2) She lives in an unsafe city. (3) It's unsafe for her to go alone.	(1) 汽车制造商召回许多不安全的车辆。 (2) 她住在一个不安全的城市中。 (3) 她单独去是很危险的。
unsuccessful adj.不成功的；失败的	(1) My early attempts at learning to drive were unsuccessful. (2) He was discouraged by the unsuccessful attempt. (3) The unsuccessful candidate demanded a re-count. (4) After a series of unsuccessful attempts, he has finally passed the driving test.	(1) 我曾经几次打算学开车，却都没有学成。 (2) 这次不成功的尝试使他气馁。 (3) 那个落选的候选人要求重新计算选票。 (4) 经过连续几次的失败，他最后终于通过了驾驶考试。
untrue adj.不真实的；不正确的；不忠实的；不符合(标准、原则等)的	(1) He exclaimed that it was untrue. (2) Your allegations are completely untrue, and I demand an immediate apology. (3) It appears that what I said was untrue, but I did not knowingly lie to you. (4) But now he never felt guilty about being untrue to them. (5) He was untrue to type when he said that.	(1) 他大声说那不是事实。 (2) 你的说法完全不真实，我要求立即道歉。 (3) 看来我说错了，但是我并非故意向你撒谎。 (4) 但是目前他对她们不忠，他却一点儿不感到内疚。 (5) 他那样说不合他的本性。
unwilling adj.不愿意的	(1) I am unwilling to set a precedent. (2) Nothing is easy to the unwilling. (3) He is unwilling to accept advice. (4) He is unwilling to acknowledge defeat. (5) If you are unwilling, don't hesitate to say no.	(1) 我不想开先例。 (2) 人不情愿事事难。 (3) 他不愿意接受忠告。 (4) 他不愿认输。 (5) 如果你不愿意,请直说吧。
upon prep.在 ... 上；紧接着；逼近	(1) All our hopes rested upon this venture. (2) Upon his release, Davis went immediately to his mother. (3) Christmas is almost upon us again.	(1) 我们所有的希望都寄托在这次冒险上了。 (2) 戴维斯一被释放就立即回到了母亲身边。 (3) 圣诞节又快到了。
upper adj.较高的；上面的；上部的 n.鞋帮；上铺 n.兴奋剂；令人兴奋的经历	(1) The upper valley is also noted for its valuable woodland and birds. (2) He locked his diary in the upper drawer. (3) The upper side of a leaf is known as the adaxial surface. (4) It also features a laser etched graphic over the upper. (5) Octagons in the olympic colors are spread all over the upper in the form of prints. (6) Do you prefer an upper or a lower berth?	(1) 在较高的山谷也有不少珍贵树林和雀鸟。 (2) 他把日记锁在上层抽屉里。 (3) 叶子的上部被称为近轴表面。 (4) 它也以在鞋帮的激光被铭刻的图表为特色。 (5) 以印刷品的形式，在奥林匹克颜色的八角形物在鞋帮被传播。 (6) 你想要上铺还是下铺?
upset adj.心烦的；苦恼的；不安的；不适的 v.推翻；翻倒；颠覆；打乱；使心烦 n.混乱；推翻	(1) I'm always upset when I don't get any mail. (2) There is no reason to get so upset. (3) Try not to get too upset about it. (8) The foreign team upset the local team. (9) In fact, it's inorganic chemistry and it has upset the aquatics world. (10) The whole plan was upset owing to his absence. (11) The news completely upset them. (12) Last-minute changes caused a great deal of upset. (13) The generals plotted to upset the government. (14) Conflict in North Korea or the toppling of Kim Jong Il's government there could upset both of those goals, Chinese analysts say.	(1) 我接不到任何邮件时总是心烦意乱。 (2) 完全没有理由如此心烦意乱。 (3) 尽量不要过于为此烦恼。 (4) 我的肠胃正不舒服着呢。 (5) 将军们策划推翻政府。 (6) 他打翻了一瓶墨水。 (7) 一阵疾风吹翻了小船。 (8) 这个外来队竟把地方队给颠覆了。 (9) 实际上，这种新型泳衣就是无机化学的产物，它已经颠覆了整个水上运动界。 (10) 由于他没来,整个计划都给打乱了。 (11) 这消息使他们极为心烦。 (12) 出现的临时变动造成一片混乱。 (13) 将军们策划推翻政府。 (14) 中国分析家说，如果在朝鲜发生冲突或是推翻金正日政权，那么会使这两个目标的实现受挫。
upward adj.向上的；上升的 adv.向上；上升	(1) We must keep a healthy and upward mood. (2) An upward force must be exerted on it so as to lift an object. (3) The deruralization of the world is on a fast upward curve. (4) His glaring eyes are looking straight upward. (5) The Far East has a general upward trend. (6) The smoke from the camp fire curled upward.	(1) 要保持健康向上的心态。 (2) 要提起重物必须向它施加一个向上的力。 (3) 世界的脱离乡村是个快速上升的曲线。 (4) 他怒视的双眼直向上看。 (5) 远东全面向上增加。 (6) 烟自营火缭绕上升。

(7) An urge to improve society led me into politics. (8) When the urge to create a cellar happens it's usually at the beginning of your wine appreciation career.	(1) 他用鞭子策马前行。 (2) 很多医生鼓励有氧运动。 (3) 我们将敦促他们遵守巴黎协议。 (4) 他们向我们强调合作的必要性。 (5) 我力劝你戒烟。 (6) 当春天再次来临,我就有了到户外活动的冲动。 (7) 推动社会进步的强烈愿望使我投身于政治。 (8) 当你有强烈愿望要建一个酒窖时，通常是你的葡萄酒鉴赏生涯的开始。

(4) Expand User Configuration to set restrictions on a per-user basis.	(1) 字处理软件允许用户在键盘上输入数据。 (2) 是，我是现代教育资源库的用户。 (3) 使用者同计算机对话。 (4) 展开用户配置来设置在个别使用者为基础的限制。

(4) They will vacation in Hawaii during Christmas.	(1) 上星期我正在度假，没收到你们的传真。 (2) 我太忙抽不出休假的时间。 (3) 立即腾出这所房子是当务之急. (4) 他们圣诞节期间将到夏威夷度假。
vacant adj.空虚的；空的；木然的	(1) Absence of occupation is not rest, a mind quite vacant is a mind distress. (2) The sky remains infinitely vacant for earth there to build its heaven with dreams. (3) He was appointed to the vacant post. (4) There are some vacant offices on the third floor. (5) The lavatory is vacant. (6) He does not know what to do with his vacant time. (7) She has a vacant look on her face.	(1) 无所事事不是休息，十分空虚的心灵是痛苦的心灵。 (2) 天空总是无限空虚地用梦在大地构筑天堂。 (3) 他被委派填补那空缺。 (4) 四楼有几间空著的办公室。 (5) 厕所现在无人使用。 (6) 他不知道空闲时间该干点什么。 (7) 她的脸上是一片茫然的神色。
vague <a class="pos_a">adj. 不明确的；模糊的；茫然的；犹豫不决的	(1) At the back of his mind was the vague idea that he had met her before. (2) She is so vague that I can never understand what she is trying to say. (3) His vague ideas crystallized into a definite plan. (4) I'm quite vague about what happened. (5) His vague reply disconcerted us completely.	(1) 他隐隐约约地觉得以前曾经见过她。 (2) 她说话含含糊糊，我怎么也听不明白她想说些什么。 (3) 他那些模糊的想法变成了一个明确的计划。 (4) 我对发生的事很不了解。 (5) 他那含糊的回答弄得我们很为难。
vain adj.自负的；徒劳的；无效的；虚荣的	(1) She is vain and foolish, and yet people like her. (2) She is vain of her voice. (3) They endeavoured to make her happy but in vain. (4) All his father's exhortations were in vain. (5) We tried in vain to make him change his mind. (6) The world had made him extravagant and vain. (7) She is so vain that she can't pass a mirror without looking into it. (3) Whether or not you believe the lawsuit is fair or valid, it is vital that you act on the summons. (4) The values may be valid,but are not allowed contextually. (5) Illness is a valid excuse for being absent from work.	(1) 请输入有效的显示名。 (2) 银行发的支票保付卡不是有效的身份证明文件。 (3) 无论这起诉讼是否是公平的或者是有根据的，认真对待传票对当事人来说是至关重要的。 (4) 提供的值可能是合法的，但是在当前的上下文环境中不被允许。 (5) 生病是不去上班的正当理由。

vest n.背心；内衣；汗衫；马甲 vt.授予；使穿衣 vi.穿衣服；(权力、财产等)归于	(1) One button on the vest is loose. (2) Jimmy is wearing a vest under a coat. (3) Then I became aware of his hand drifting lower and suddenly I was wide awake as he stroked my neck and started sliding his hand down my vest top. (4) She was dressed only in a vest and underpants. (5) He takes off his coat to reveal a bright red vest. (6) Parliament is vested with the power of making laws. (7) This is the power vested in a priest.	(1) 背心上的一粒鈕扣松了。 (2) 吉米在外套里面穿着一件背心。 (3) 接着我意识到他的手向下滑去，当他抚摸着我的脖子并开始将手滑向我的内衣时，我猛地清醒起来。 (4) 她只穿了一件汗衫和一条短裤。 (5) 他脱下上衣，露出一件鲜红的马甲。 (6) 国会有立法权. (7) 这是赋予牧师的权力。
via prep.经由；通过	(1) We went from London to Washington via New York. (2) This flight is roetud to Chicago via New York. (3) He flew to Europe via the North Pole. (4) I can send him a note via the internal mail system.	(1) 我们从伦敦经纽约到华盛顿。 (2) 这班机是经纽约飞往芝加哥的。 (3) 他经由北极飞到欧洲。 (4) 我可以通过内部通信系统给他发个通知。
vice n.缺点；恶习；邪恶；罪行；生理缺陷 adj.副的；代理的 prep.代替 pref.代理的；副的 n.老虎钳	(1) He who thinks too much of his virtues reminds others of his vice. (2) Virtue and vice are two different things: the former leads to peace, the latter to misery. (3) There is a lot of vices in big cities. (4) The vice is bolted to the work-bench. (5) The convulsive pressure of her slight hand held her companion as firmly as an iron vice could have held her. (6) He reported on the whole event to the vice premier. (7) John was appointed postmaster vice Richard retired. (8) She is vice-chair of the education committee. (9) He is the vice-president in charge of sales.	(1) 念念不忘自己长处的人,会使别人想起他的缺点。 (2) 美德与邪恶是不同的：前者带来和平,后者导致痛苦。 (3) 大城市存在许多道德败坏的行为。 (4) 老虎钳是用螺栓拧在工作台上的。 (5) 她瘦小的手，以其痉挛的压力，坚定地钩住了她的同伴，就象老虎钳夹紧她一般。 (6) 他把整个事件向副总理作了汇报。 (7) 约翰被任命为邮政局长,取代退休的理查德。 (8) 她是教育委员会的代理主席。 (9) 他是负责销售的副总经理。
victory n.胜利；成功	(1) The soldiers exulted at their victory. (2) I have every reason to be confident of our victory. (3) People in the city held a great party to celebrate their victory. (4) They were intoxicated with victory. (5) No victory comes out without price.	(1) 战士们为取得胜利而欢跃。 (2) 我有充分的理由坚信胜利是属于我们的。 (3) 本市的市民举行了盛大的晚会庆祝他们的胜利。 (4) 他们因成功而狂喜。 (5) 成功就是要付出代价的。
videophone n.可视电话	(1) Your wristwatch videophone suddenly rings. (2) In the future, shopping can be done by videophone.	(1) 突然，你手表上的可视电话响了。 (2) 在将来，购买东西能在可视电话中进行。
view n.视野；见解；风景；方法；检查 v.考虑；看；把 ... 视为	(1) The valley was hidden from view in the mist. (2) His view of life is different from yours. (3) I enjoy the view of the bay in the starlight. (4) He took a subjective view of the problem. (5) The police took a view of the scene. (6) People came from all over the world to view her work. (7) We view every customer as a partner.	(1) 溪谷隐没在雾霭之中，看不见了。 (2) 他的人生观与你的不同。 (3) 我喜欢星光下的海湾风景。 (4) 他用主观的方法看问题。 (5) 警方检查了现场。 (6) 人们从世界各地涌来欣赏她的作品。 (7) 我们将每一位客户视为合作伙伴。
viewer n.观看者；电视观众；观察器	(1) A larger crystal ball will also give a larger area in which the viewer can observe whatever they need to see. (2) The television viewer takes no initiative. (3) Of course, being a selective viewer isn't bad. (4) The viewer cannot complete this procedure. (5) DARPA is developing several viewer options for the computers, including a set of eyeglasses with embedded display in the frame being built by the Micro Optical Corporation.	(1) 大的水晶球会提供观看者想看到的地方的大面积范围。 (2) 电视观众没有施展主动性。 (3) 当然，被选中做了电视观众也并不意味着是件坏事。 (4) 观察器不能完成该过程。 (5) 国防高级研究计划局正在研制与这些计算机配套的几种观察器，包括正由微光学公司制造的在镜框中嵌入显示器的眼镜。
villager n.村民	(1) The enemy raped the country and killed many villagers. (2) This clergyman is respected by all the villagers. (3) The villagers knew about the scandal.	(1) 敌人掠夺了这个地区，并且杀害了许多村民。 (2) 这位教士受到所有村民的尊敬。 (3) 村子里的居民知道这件丑事。
vinegar n.醋	(1) Vinegar has an acid taste. (2) He sprinkled vinegar on his fish and chips. (3) His retort was delivered with a strong note of vinegar.	(1) 醋有酸味。 (2) 他把醋洒在鱼和薯条上。 (3) 他的反驳带着强烈不满的口气。
violate v.侵犯；违反；扰乱；亵渎；强奸	(1) Don't violate other people's copyright. (2) I'm committed not to violate the rules. (3) The country violated the international agreement. (4) The sound of guns violated the peace of the countryside. (5) The soldiers violated the church by using it as a stable.	(1) 不要侵犯他人版权。 (2) 我有义务不违反规定。 (3) 这个国家违反了国际协议。 (4) 炮声扰乱了乡村的宁静。 (5) 士兵们把教堂当马厩用而亵渎了它。
violence n.猛烈；暴力；暴行；强暴	(1) The wind blew with great violence. (2) The violence of his words alarmed her. (3) She slammed the door with violence. (4) I detest violence with my whole being. (5) The young man was charged with robbery with violence. (6) Quakers strongly oppose violence and war. (7) His violence was abhorrent to everybody. (8) I condemn this senseless violence. (9) The act of violence made people boil with anger.	(1) 风异常猛烈地吹着。 (2) 他言语上的猛烈使她产生了警觉。 (3) 她砰的一声用力关上了门。 (4) 我毕生谴责暴力行为。 (5) 这个年轻人被控暴力抢劫。 (6) 教友派信徒们强烈反对暴力和战争。 (7) 大家都痛恨他的暴行。 (8) 我谴责这种无谓的暴行. (9) 这种强暴的行为令人发指。
violent adj.猛烈的；强烈的；暴力的；极端的	(1) The soldiers launched into a violent attack. (2) She was in violent temper. (3) They showed violent opposition to the oppressor. (4) Violent criminals like that are dangers to society. (5) He is suffering from violent pains.	(1) 士兵们展开猛烈的攻击。 (2) 她暴跳如雷。 (3) 他们对压迫者表现出强烈的不满。 (4) 那种暴力罪犯对社会是一种危害。 (5) 他承受着极度的痛苦。
violin n.小提琴	(1) He plays the violin for the fun of it. (2) The audience lapped up the violin solo. (3) The violin is not quite in tune with the piano.	(1) 她拉小提琴只是为了好玩。 (2) 观众对小提琴独奏反应热烈。 (3) 这小提琴跟钢琴的调子不太和谐。
violinist n.小提琴手	(1) The drummer doubles in brass as a violinist.	(1) 这鼓手还是一个小提琴手。
virtue n.美德；德行；优点；贞操	(1) Fidelity to engagement is a virtue. (2) My neighbor is a man of highest virtue. (3) He said his plan had the virtue of being the easiest to implement. (4) Meekness is a virtue he appreciates in his wife. (5) She's definitely not a woman of easy virtue.	(1) 信守诺言是一种美德。 (2) 我的邻居是一个具有高尚品德的人。 (3) 他说他的计划的优点是最简单易行。 (4) 温顺是他所欣赏的妻子的优点之一。 (5) 她决不是一个放荡的女人。
virus n.病毒；病原体	(1) Scientists have isolated the virus causing the epidemic. (2) We should be watchful of computer viruses. (3) HBV is a virus that causes inflammation of the liver. (4) Could you do me a favor? My computer suffered from computer virus. (5) Iraq also got samples of other deadly pathogens, including the West Nile virus. (6) The excrement and the excrement polluted water carry a lot of pathogens of them, including the diseaseful virus and worm eggs, which threaten seriously the health of the habitants.	(1) 科学家们已分离出引起这种流行病的病毒。 (2) 我们应该警惕计算机病毒。 (3) HBV是一种会引起肝脏发炎的病毒。 (4) 能帮帮我吗?我电脑中病毒了。 (5) 伊拉克还由此得到了其他能致命的病原体包括西尼罗河病毒。 (6) 粪便中和被粪便污染的饮用水中，含有多种肠道传染病和寄生虫病的病原体，包括致病的病毒和虫卵，严重威胁农民的身体健康。
visa n.签证 vt.办理签证	(1) We've had to cut a few corners to get your visa ready in time. (2) He is applying to the Consul for a visa. (3) He experienced great difficulty in getting a visa to leave the country. (4) He has applied for an entry visa. (5) I was eventually granted an exit visa. (6) I have my passport visaed.	(1) 我们得简化手续才能将你的签证及时办妥。 (2) 他正向领事申请签证。 (3) 他申请出国签证经历了很大的困难。 (4) 他已申请入境签证。 (5) 我终于获得了出境签证。 (6) 我已取得了护照签证。
visual adj.视觉的；视力的；看的见的；形象的 n.画面；图象	(1) Her designs have a strong visual appeal. (2) He has a good visual memory. (3) His failed to pass his visual test.	(1) 她的设计在视觉上很有感染力。 (2) 他有良好的视觉记忆力。 (3) 他没有通过他的视力测试。
vital adj.至关重要的；有活力的；生死攸关的	(1) The government saw the introduction of new technology as vital. (2) She's a very vital sort of person. (3) Confronted with such a vital problem of life and death, he looked as cool as a cucumber.	(1) 政府认为引进新技术至关重要。 (2) 她是个精力旺盛的人。 (3) 面对着这样重大的生死问题,他的神态却异常冷静。
vivid adj.生动的；鲜艳的；栩栩如生的	(1) This place conjures up vivid memories. (2) My daughter is a child with vivid imagination. (3) This girl gave a vivid description of the event. (4) Only the vivid red hair ever stood out. (5) The actresses were wearing vivid historical costumes. (6) The new varieties have very vivid designs and beautiful colors. (7) Television presents a vivid world in front of us. (8) Dickens'novels are full of vivid characterization. (9) The sculpture is really very vivid.	(1) 这个地方使人回忆起许多生动的往事。 (2) 我女儿是一个想象力活跃的孩子。 (3) 那女孩对这件事作了一番生动的描述。 (4) 只有鲜艳的红头发非常令人注目。 (5) 女演员们穿着鲜艳的古装。 (6) 那新产品图案新颖，色泽鲜艳。 (7) 电视在我们面前展示出一个栩栩如生的世界。 (8) 狄更斯的小说中充满了栩栩如生的人物形象。 (9) 真是被雕刻得栩栩如生啊。
vocabulary n.词汇；词汇量	(1) You can look up this word in the vocabulary. (2) He has an extensive vocabulary. (3) That if your vocabulary is limited your chances of success are limited. (4) She has a large English vocabulary at command.	(1) 你可以在词汇表里查这个词。 (2) 他词汇很丰富。 (3) 如果你的词汇量不大，你成功的机会也就不多。 (4) 她能灵活运用掌握的大量英语辞汇。
volcano n.火山	(1) Vesuvius is an active volcano. (2) The eruption of volcano makes many people lose their lives. (3) That volcano cast forth lots of lava and ashes. (4) The erupting volcano was an awe-inspiring sight.	(1) 维苏威山是一座活火山。 (2) 火山的爆发使许多人丧失了生命。 (3) 那火山喷了出大量熔岩和灰烬。 (4) 火山爆发是使人畏惧的景象。

(3) We rely entirely on voluntary contribution. (4) She's very taken up with voluntary work at the moment. (5) Although I'm retired, voluntary work keeps me in the swim (of things). (6) The organization is run on a voluntary basis.	(1) 他自愿为警方作供。 (2) 在我们的城市，许多社会服务仍然是有志愿团体提供的。 (3) 我们全靠自愿捐赠。 (4) 她目前大部分时间和精力都用在志愿工作上了。 (5) 我虽已退休，但仍做些义务工作，以便了解当前的情势。 (6) 这个组织是由志愿人员管理的.

(4) Many people volunteer to work on the farms. (5) They volunteer for good causes.	(1) 他以志愿兵从军。 (2) 在业余时间 (3) 他自动向警方供出情况。 (4) 许多人自动到农场劳动。 (5) 她们自愿做好事。
vote n.选举权；投票；选举；投票结果 v.表决；选举；投票	(1) Give women the vote! (2) I suggested putting the matter to a vote, but the chairman demurred to it. (3) A large vote was polled. (4) He used his casting vote to block the motion. (5) This vote spells defeat for the government. (6) Was the vote for or against the resolution? (7) We are going to vote on the plan . (8) He became a citizen, thereby gaining the right to vote. (9) I may vote for her at the next election. (10) Only citizens are eligible to vote. (11) Parliament voted the bill through without a debate. (12) He refused to declare which way he would vote.	(1) 给妇女选举权！ (2) 我建议对此事投票表决，但主席表示反对。 (3) 投票踊跃。 (4) 他用他的投票反对动议的通过。 (5) 这次选举意味着政府的失败。 (6) 表决结果是赞成还是反对此决议? (7) 我们打算就这一提案进行表决。 (8) 他成为公民，并因此获得了选举权。 (9) 下届选举我可能选她。 (10) 只有公民有选举资格。 (11) 国会未经辩论就投票通过了这项法案。 (12) 他拒绝声明他将投票给哪一边。
voyage n.航行；旅程 v.航行；旅行	(1) This is the virgin voyage of the ship. (2) The ship hit heavy fog on its voyage. (3) She went on a long sea voyage. (4) Once the voyage comes to an end. (5) Happiness is a voyage, not a destination. (6) My dream is to voyage around the world in a hot air balloon. (7) They planned to voyage across the Pacific Ocean.	(1) 这是这艘船的处女航。 (2) 船在航行时碰上了大雾。 (3) 她乘船在海上长途旅行。 (4) 旅程结束之际。 (5) 快乐是旅程，不是目的地。 (6) 我的梦想是乘着热气球周游世界。 (7) 他们计划做穿越太平洋的旅行。
wage n.工资；报酬 v.开展；从事；进行(战争、运动)	(1) A postman's wages are 180 per week. (2) In our family both my husband and I are wage earners. (3) In order to circumvent the straitjacket of national wage rates, employers in many cities offer non-pecuniary rewards to their workers. (4) I am saying that in most cases, if you were to look at a pure dollar-per-hour "wage," you would find that many bloggers work rather inexpensively. (5) The government is waging a campaign against sex discrimination in industry. (6) The government has pledged itself to wage a war against poverty and disease. (7) No country wants to wage a nuclear war.	(1) 邮递员的工资为每周180英镑。 (2) 在我们家里，丈夫和我都挣工资。 (3) 为了避免全国工资率的约束，许多城市的雇主不以金钱的形式付给工人报酬。 (4) 而是说大部分情况下，如果你在看一份一小时只有一美元报酬的工作，那么你会发现很多博客在廉价工作。 (5) 政府正在展开反对工业界性别歧视的运动。 (6) 政府发誓要进行一场消灭贫穷和疾病的斗争。 (7) 哪个国家也不想打核战争。
waist n.腰部；腰	(1) Her hair nearly reached down to her waist. (2) She wears a ribbon belt round her waist. (3) If the skirt is too big, we can take in the waist. (4) He put his arm around her waist. (5) The uncut grass came up to her waist.	(1) 她的头发几乎垂到了腰部。 (2) 她在腰部束了一条缎带。 (3) 要是裙子太大了，我们可以把腰部收紧一些。 (4) 他搂住了她的腰。 (5) 未割的草齐了她的腰。

(4) The boy was wandering around. (5) The travelers are wandering the forests and fields. (6) She went for a little wander round the park. (7) I went to the park and had a wander around. (8) I wander in the passageway, the school is empty. (9) You wander upon the remains of an weathered shrine. (10) I went to the park and had a wander around.	(1) 他喜欢在乡间漫步。 (2) 这条河蜿蜒曲折地流经一些风景秀丽的乡村。 (3) 我喜欢晚饭后在公园里闲逛。 (4) 男孩在那周围徘徊。 (5) 旅行者漫步穿过森林与田野。 (6) 她到公园去遛达遛达。 (7) 我去公园转了一圈。 (8) 我在学校的走廊里徘徊。 (9) 你在这个风化的神殿的废墟上徘徊。 (10) 我去公园转了一圈。
ward n.病房；行政区；监护；守卫；受监护人 vt.守护；躲开	(1) The hospital has a medical ward and a surgical ward. (2) The patient lay quietly on his bed in the medical ward. (3) There are two nurses in the ward. (4) They phoned to every ward and suburb. (5) Which ward does he represent on the council? (6) The child was made a ward of court. (7) The soldiers kept watch and ward over the castle. (8) She invested the money on behalf of her ward. (9) The soldiers warded over the city. (10) He managed to ward off the blow. (11) You should learn how to ward off blows.	(1) 这医院有内科病房和外科病房。 (2) 病人安静地躺在内科病房的床上。 (3) 病房里有两个护士。 (4) 他们给各城区和郊区打电话。 (5) 在理事会中他代表哪个区? (6) 那个孩子由法院监护。 (7) 士兵们守卫这个城堡。 (8) 她代表受她监护的人投资。 (9) 士兵们守护着这座城市。 (10) 他设法避过了那一击。 (11) 你应该学会如何避开打击。
warehouse n.仓库 vt.存入仓库	(1) They stored their goods in a warehouse. (2) They operate three factories and a huge warehouse. (3) If necessary, please warehouse the goods.	(1) 他们把货物储存在一个仓库里。 (2) 他们经营三家工厂和一个大仓库。 (3) 如有必要，请将该货存入仓库。
warm-hearted adj.热诚的；热心的	(1) Aunt Sue is a very warm person. (2) Warm professionals were not easy to come by. (3) Columbus found a warm supporter in the Queen.	(1) 苏阿姨是个极为热诚的人。 (2) 热心的内行是不容易碰上的。 (3) 哥伦布发现王后是位热心的支持者。
warmth n.温暖；热烈；热情；热心	(1) The sun gives (us) warmth and light. (2) She sheds warmth and happiness around her. (3) He was pleased by the warmth of his welcome. (4) He was touched by the warmth of their welcome. (5) The hall effuses warmth and hospitality. (6) What sets him apart is his warmth and sincerity.	(1) 太阳供给我们光和热。 (2) 她给周围的人带来温暖兴幸福。 (3) 他因受到热烈欢迎而高兴。 (4) 他受到他们热情欢迎，十分感动。 (5) 大厅里洋溢着热情友好的气氛。 (6) 所不同的是他有一颗赤热的心。
warning n.警告；警报；预兆 adj.警告的；告诫的	(1) I flashed a warning glance at them. (2) A gale warning has just been put out. (3) We battened down at the first hurricane warning. (4) There was no advance warning before the earthquake hit. (5) But without any warning, Mount Vesuvius roared to life. (6) When I give out a warning you'd best take heed.	(1) 我向他们投去警告性的一瞥。 (2) 刚才发出了大风警报。 (3) 飓风警报一发出我们就封舱了。 (4) 地震之前没有任何预兆。 (5) 然而，在没有任何预兆的情况下，维苏威火山咆哮着苏醒了。 (6) 我发出警告的时候你最好听仔细了。
washing-machine n.洗衣机	(1) The salesperson demonstrated a new washing machine. (2) Washers are for washing clothes.	(1) 推销员示范操作新的洗衣机。 (2) 洗衣机是洗衣服用的。
watermelon n.西瓜	(1) This kind of watermelon is remarkable for its size. (2) The hostess iced the watermelon.	(1) 这种西瓜个头儿大。 (2) 女主人把西瓜冰镇上了。
wax n.蜡；蜂蜡 vt.(用蜡)涂 vi.变圆	(1) Blobs of wax covered the candlestick. (2) He is modeling a unicorn in wax . (3) They bought wax and honey up by the great. (4) Why did she have to wax the floors herself? (5) The moon is waxing.	(1) 烛台上全是一团团的蜡。 (2) 他在用蜡制作独角兽。 (3) 他们大量购进蜜蜡和蜂蜜。 (4) 她干什么非要自己动手给地板打腊? (5) 月亮越来越圆。
wayside n.路旁 adj.路旁的	(1) By the wayside stood a huge tree. (2) They put up a board on the wayside.	(1) 路旁矗立著一棵大树。 (2) 他们路旁竖起了一个牌子。
web n.网；网络；网状物；腹板 vi.结网 vt.结网于；使陷入罗网	(1) A spider weaves a web to catch prey. (2) The tiger was enmeshed in the web laid by hunter. (3) Do you think art and design are melding on the web? (4) He breathlessly watched the spider attempt to spin its web for the third time. (5) Do you think that the spider can web anything?	(1) 蜘蛛为捕猎昆虫而织网。 (2) 老虎缠在猎人布下的网里。 (3) 你认为在网络上艺术和设计是相结合的吗？ (4) 他凝神屏息地观看那蜘蛛试图第三次结网。 (5) 你觉得这蜘蛛能用网捕住什么吗?
website n.网站	(1) You can visit its website on the Internet. (2) Can you recommend a good website? (3) This page includes lots of links to other websites you may find interesting.	(1) 你可以访问它的网站。 (2) 你能给我推荐一个好的网站吗? (3) 这个网页包括很多链接,可以链接到其它有趣的网站。
weakness n.软弱；弱点；嗜好	(1) Don't take his patience as a sign of weakness. (2) She thoroughly despised him for his weakness. (3) Forehand return is my greatest weakness. (4) There is an inherent weakness in the design. (5) The book's weakness is the author's inability to sustain an argument. (6) Women have a weakness for shopping. (7) His weakness for cigarettes is detrimental to his health.	(1) 别把他的耐心看作软弱的表示。 (2) 她因为他的软弱而十分鄙视他。 (3) 正手回球是我最大的弱点。 (4) 这设计本身存在弱点。 (5) 该书的缺点在于作者未能把论证展开。 (6) 女士都有爱逛街的嗜好。 (7) 他抽烟的嗜好对他的身体有害。
wealth n.【U】财富；财产；丰富；大量	(1) Health is better than wealth. (2) He's always flaunting his wealth. (3) She is responsible for the character part of the hero's devoted mother. (4) He has gambled away all his wealth. (5) She is not to be compared with you in wealth. (6) There's a wealth of books in the library. (7) Jim has a whole wealth of teaching experience. (8) Wealth allows them to be indulged in abundance. (9) She married a man of untold wealth.	(1) 【谚】健康胜于财富。 (2) 他总是摆阔。 (3) 她负责这个主人公的忠诚的母亲的角色部分。 (4) 他赌博输掉了全部财产。 (5) 她的财产不能与你相比。 (6) 这个图书馆藏书丰富。 (7) 吉姆具有丰富的教学经验。 (8) 而现在，物质的丰富使人们可以享受大量的这些东西。 (9) 她嫁了一个拥有大量财富的人。
wealthy adj.富有的 n.富人	(1) She's an attractive woman, and wealthy to boot. (2) A wealthy sponsor came to our rescue with a generous donation. (3) He was the son of a wealthy planter. (4) She married her daughter to a wealthy man. (5) Obama says those cuts favor the wealthy.	(1) 她是个很有魅力的女人，而且很富有。 (2) 有个富有的赞助人慷慨捐赠来解救我们。 (3) 他是一个富有的种植园主的儿子。 (4) 她把她女儿嫁给了一个富人。 (5) 说这些政策只会对富人有利。
weatherman n.气象工作者；天气预报员	(1) The weatherman suggested that people not use Highway 7. (2) The weatherman predicted a freeze for tonight.	(1) 气象员建议人们不要使用7号公路。 (2) 天气预报员预报今晚有冰冻。
wedding n.婚礼；结合	(1) We decided to delay our wedding until next year. (2) She reproached her husband for having forgotten their wedding anniversary. (3) The coalition government was obviously a shotgun wedding.	(1) 我们决定把婚礼推迟到明年。 (2) 她责怪丈夫忘了他们的结婚周年纪念日。 (3) 这个联合政府显然是勉强的结合。
weed n.杂草；野草 n.衣服；丧服 vi.除草；清除；淘汰	(1) The garden is choked with weeds. (2) She knelt down to pull a weed from the flower bed. (3) There are so many weeds in his field! (4) He pulled off his coat and started to weed with us. (5) Tomorrow I have to weed the garden. (6) We must weed out the traitors in our midst! (7) We have to weed out unqualified applicants.	(1) 花园杂草丛生。 (2) 她跪下来拔除花圃上的杂草。 (3) 他的田里有那么多野草！ (4) 他脱去上装，开始和我们一起除草。 (5) 我明天得给花园除草。 (6) 我们必须清除我们中间的叛徒! (7) 我们必须淘汰不合格的申请人。
weekly adj.每周的；一周一次的；周刊的 n.周刊；周报 adv.每周；一周一次	(1) We should work out what our weekly costs are. (2) The child has a weekly allowance of five dollars. (3) I'll have to discontinue these weekly visits. (4) Shall we assign Thursdays for our weekly meetings? (5) The newsman jazzed up the story to sell himself to the editor of the weekly. (6) There is an interesting article in this weekly. (7) The weekly makes a feature of drug abuse. (8) This weekly is printed every Friday. (9) We played chess two or three times weekly. (10) John goes there fortnightly instead of weekly.	(1) 我们应该算出我们每周的花费。 (2) 这孩子每星期有五元零用钱。 (3) 我每周一次的访问得停止了。 (4) 我们把每周例会定在星期四好吗? (5) 这位记者把报道写得绘声绘色，以求博得那家周刊的青睐。 (6) 这期的周刊上有一篇有趣的文章。 (7) 该周刊做了药物滥用的专题报导。 (8) 这份周报每星期五印刷。 (9) 我们每周下两三次棋。 (10) 约翰并非每周去那儿，只是隔周去一次。
weep v.流泪；哭泣；悲叹；渗出 n.哭泣；<俚>眼泪	(1) She wept bitter tears over her lost youth. (2) It is better to laugh than (to) weep. (3) I weep for the loss of your husband. (4) Evil men should weep for their evil deeds. (5) The father wept the death of his child. (6) His wound is weeping. (7) good weep would probably make you feel better.	(1) 她为自己逝去的青春痛苦地流泪。 (2) 笑比哭好。 (3) 我为你失去丈夫而哭泣。 (4) 作恶的人应为他们的恶行感到悲哀。 (5) 父亲为孩子的死而悲叹。 (6) 他的伤口在出血。 (7) 你痛痛快快哭上阵也许就好受些了。
weigh v.衡量；称(重量)；重达 ...	(1) He weighed the ideas in his mind. (2) It's been weighing on my mind for days whether to tell her or not. (3) The branches of the trees were weighed down by snow. (4) He weighed in at several pounds below the limit. (5) Some of the stones weigh twenty-six tons! (6) A full-grown elephant can weigh over 6,000 kilograms.	(1) 他在脑中权衡着这些想法。 (2) 我这几天心烦意乱，不知道应该不应告诉她。 (3) 树枝被雪压弯了。 (4) 他赛前量体重比规定限度少几磅。 (5) 有些石头重达二十六吨！ (6) 一头成年大象能重达六千多公斤。
weight n.重量；体重；重任；重要 vt.使 ... 负重；使倾斜	(1) The pillars have to support the weight of the roof. (2) He gained some weight recently. (3) He has put on weight since I last saw him. (4) The full weight of decision-making falls on her. (5) The President swings his weight to get laws passed. (6) His opinion doesn't carry much weight. (7) The loss of the money has been a weight on my mind. (8) The true giants weight nearly a ton (9) We'll weight up the consequences of the action.	(1) 这些柱子须承受屋顶的重量。 (2) 近来，他的体重增加了。 (3) 自从我上次见到他以来，他又长胖了。 (4) 决策的重任全落在她的肩上了。 (5) 总统运用权力使法律获得通过。 (6) 他的意见没多少影响。 (7) 丢钱的事总是压在我心里。 (8) 这个真正的巨人的重量约达一吨 (9) 我们将评价这一行动的后果。
welfare n.福利；福利事业；幸福	(1) The welfare of the individual is bound up with the welfare of the community. (2) These are matters that bear on the welfare of the community. (3) The government decided to promote public welfare. (4) My principal concern is my family's welfare.	(1) 个人的福利与社会的福利有着密切的关系。 (2) 这些都是与社会福利有关的问题。 (3) 政府决定发展公共福利。 (4) 我至为关心的是我一家的幸福。
well-known adj.出名的；众所周知的	(1) He is little known as an artist. (2) Our silks are known for good quality. (3) His championship of women's rights is well known. (4) Auroras are known to have many shapes and colors.	(1) 他是个不出名的艺术家。 (2) 我们的丝绸是以质量出名的。 (3) 他提倡女权是众所周知的。 (4) 众所周知的是极光有许多形状和颜色。
westerner n.西方人；（美国的）西部人	(1) See from his face, he looks like an Asian more than a westerner.	(1) 从面孔上看并不太像西方人，倒是更像我们亚洲人。
westwards adv.向西	(1) The ship drifted westwards in the strong wind.	(1) 船在强风中向西漂移。
whale n.鲸 vi.捕鲸 v.打击	(1) We may live to see the extinction of the whale. (2) The whale thrashed the water with its tail. (3) The blue whale is the world's largest living animal. (4) He used to whale me when he was sober and could get his hands on me.	(1) 人类或许能亲眼见到鲸的灭绝。 (2) 那条鲸鱼不住地用尾巴击水。 (3) 蓝鲸是当今最大的动物。 (4) 他从前没喝醉的时候，只要能抓住我，总要打我一通。
whatever pron.无论什么；任何事物 adj.不管怎样的；所有的；丝毫的	(1) We shall remain friends whatever may betide. (2) Whatever nonsense the papers print, some people always believe it. (3) Whatever requests you make will be granted. (4) She applied whatever strength she had left to the task. (5) No campers whatever may use the lake before noon.	(1) 无论发生什么事，我们将永远是朋友。 (2) 不管报纸胡说什么,总有一些人信以为真。 (3) 你提的任何请求都会得到许可 (4) 她将所有剩下的精力都用到这项任务上。 (5) 不管什么宿营者,都不许在中午前使用这个湖。
whichever adj.无论哪个；无论哪些 pron.无论哪个	(1) Whichever nation explodes an atomic bomb will engage the whole world in war. (2) Whichever nation explodes an atomic bomb will engage the whole world in war.	(1) 无论哪个国家使用原子弹都会使全世界卷入战争。 (2) 无论哪个国家使用原子弹都会使全世界卷入战争。
whisper n.低语；窃窃私语；飒飒的声音 vi.低声说；窃窃私语；飒飒地响 vt.耳语；私语	(1) She said it in a whisper, so I didn't hear. (2) I heard the whisper of wind in the pines. (3) The children were whispering in the corner. (4) You'll have to whisper or he'll hear you. (5) She whisper to me so no one else will hear. (6) It is bad manners to whisper in company. (7) Don't you know it's rude to whisper? (8) The wind was whispering in the roof. (9) Fatso leaned over to whisper in her ear. (10) They love to whisper intimately. (11) When the teacher turned around , they began to whisper.	(1) 她是悄声说的，所以我没有听见。 (2) 我听见风吹过松林间飒飒作响。 (3) 孩子们正在角落里低声耳语。 (4) 你们得低声说,否则他会听到。 (5) 她低声跟我说话以免别人听见。 (6) 在众人面前窃窃私语是不礼貌的行为。 (7) 难道你不知道窃窃私语是不礼貌的吗? (8) 屋顶上风声飒飒。 (9) 胖子欠身对她耳语几句。 (10) 他们爱亲密地耳语。 (11) 老师一转过身去，他们就开始窃窃私语。
whistle n.口哨；汽笛；警笛 v.吹口哨；鸣汽笛；呼啸；吹口哨召唤	(1) The whistle goes at the end of the match. (2) He gave a loud whistle of gladness. (3) The whistle went and the man knocked off for lunch. (4) The horse shied at the shrill whistle. (5) The little boy rounded his lips to whistle. (6) The referee whistled and the game began. (7) He whistled to his friend to keep hidden. (8) We used to hear the train whistle at night. (9) A bullet whistled past his head. (10) The wind whistled through a crack in the door.	(1) 比赛结束时哨声响了。 (2) 他吹了一声响亮的口号表示高兴。 (3) 汽笛响了，工人们停工午餐。 (4) 那匹马听到刺耳的汽笛声，惊得往后倒退。 (5) 那个小男孩把双唇收圆好吹口哨。 (6) 裁判哨子一响，比赛开始了。 (7) 他吹口哨通知朋友继续隐蔽。 (8) 过去我们常会在晚上听到火车的汽笛声。 (9) 一颗子弹从他头顶上呼啸而过。 (10) 风从门的裂缝中呼呼地刮了进来。
widespread adj.分布(或散布)广的；普遍的	(1) The high cost prohibits the widespread use of the drug. (2) Widespread flooding is affecting large areas of Devon. (3) The Government acted quickly to relieve the widespread distress caused by the earthquake. (4) The new laws gained widespread acceptance. (5) English is more widespread and more used in international intercourse than German. (6) The news of the radiation leak caused widespread public alarm.	(1) 该药因价格昂贵而影响其被广泛应用。 (2) 洪水泛滥，淹没了德文郡的广大地区。 (3) 地震造成大范围的灾难,政府迅速采取行动赈济灾民。 (4) 新法例广获赞同。 (5) 英语在国际交往中比德语使用得更为广泛。 (6) 辐射泄露的消息引起了公众的普遍恐慌。
wild adj.野生的；野蛮的；未开发的；狂热的 adv.胡乱地；失去控制地 n.荒野；荒地	(1) In nature, all animals are wild and free. (2) North America has the world's best climate for wild grapes. (3) I was living like a wild child. (4) Nothing is sacred to these wild youths. (5) He is wild to see the film star. (6) You can't make wild accusations like that! (7) Danger in the wild comes from the carnivores. (8) There's a wild stretch of land behind the house. (9) The village people are planting trees to turn the wild into a beautiful garden.	(1) 在自然界，一切动物都是野生的，自由自在的。 (2) 北美的气候是世界上最适合野生葡萄生长的。 (3) 我的行为像个野蛮的孩子。 (4) 这些狂野的年轻人什么都不尊重。 (5) 他一心想见一面那位影星。 (6) 你不能这样胡乱地指责别人。 (7) 荒野地带的危险来自食肉动物。 (8) 房子后面有一大片荒地。 (9) 村民们植树要把荒地变成美丽的花园。
wildlife n.野生动植物 adj.野生动植物的	(1) This area was once a wildlife reserve. (2) Hunters are barred from wildlife sanctuaries.	(1) 该地区曾是一个野生动物保护区。 (2) 野生动物保护区内禁止狩猎。
willing adj.愿意的；心甘情愿的	(1) Are you willing to help? (2) I don't know whether he is willing to come. (3) The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak. (4) I'd like to buy your house if you are willing to sell it. (5) I wouldn't be willing. (6) He is always a willing helper. (7) She's the willing horse in the office and so gets given most of the work to do.	(1) 你愿意帮忙吗？ (2) 我不知道他是否愿意来。 (3) 心有余而力不足。 (4) 如果你愿意卖的话，我想买你的房子。 (5) 我不会愿意的。 (6) 他是一个乐于帮忙的人。 (7) 她是办公室里埋头苦干的人，大部分的工作都交给她去做。
willingly adv.乐意地；心甘情愿地	(1) He listened to reason and willingly accepted his comrades'opinions and criticisms. (2) If you won't do it willingly,I'll make you do it.	(1) 他听从劝告，乐意地接受了同志们的意见和批评。 (2) 如果你不心甘情愿地干，我就强迫你干。
willingness n.乐意；愿意	(1) I expressed my willingness to support the cause. (2) They tried to assure him of their willingness to work. (3) They manifested much willingness to go.	(1) 我表示乐意支持该项运动。 (2) 他们尽力使他相信他们乐意工作。 (3) 他们表示很愿意去。
windbreaker n.防风上衣的一种；商标名；防风林	(1) I want to buy a windbreaker so that I will look more handsome.	(1) 我想买一件风衣，以便使我看起来更帅。
wing n.翅膀；翼 v.飞过；空运；临时发挥	(1) The hen tucked her head under her wing. (2) A seagull fluttered down with an injured wing. (3) Wild gooses wing regularly,haste and idle. (4) I lost my lecture notes, so I had to wing it.	(1) 那母鸡把头缩在翅膀下。 (2) 一只海鸥拍打着翅膀飞落下来。 (3) 大雁整齐地飞过 (4) 我把讲稿弄丢了，所以只得即兴说几句了。
wipe v.擦；揩；抹；拭去；消除；用力打 n.擦拭；抹布	(1) She wiped her tears away. (2) I wiped my shoes on the mat before I came in. (3) When you have washed the car , wipe it down well . (4) He tried to wipe out the memory of his former girlfriend. (5) How could I trace your hair to wipe your tears?My hands reached out, catching nothing but a raindrop, on a leaf that had withered. (6) Only in this way can we wipe out the enemy troops. (7) He wiped me with his fist. (8) Please give the table mats a quick wipe. (9) Please wipe the table with a dry cloth. (10) Life is like a mop, using today to mop up yesterday and wipe out tomorrow.	(1) 她擦掉了眼泪。 (2) 我在进门前把鞋在垫子上擦了擦。 (3) 你把汽车冲洗过后，要好好用布揩拭一下。 (4) 他试图抹去对前任女友的回忆。 (5) 多想摩娑你的发，温柔地拭去你的眼泪，我伸出手，却只碰到枯叶上的一滴落雨！ (6) 只有用这样的方法我们才能消灭敌军。 (7) 他用拳头打我。 (8) 请把桌上的盘碗垫擦一下。 (9) 请用乾抹布擦桌子。 (10) 生命就像抹布用今天擦去昨天擦亮明天。
wire n.金属丝；电线；电报 vt.发电报；装电线；(通过电线)接通；用金属丝把...连一起；电汇	(1) The fabric was displayed on a wired stand. (2) The rope was not strong enough, so we used wire. (3) The hot wire is caused by overload. (4) I sent a wire to my mother this morning. (5) Yon can wire the details to my brother in New York. (6) The kids are taught how to wire a plug. (7) As soon as the equipment is wired up, you can use it. (8) The two pieces of wood were wired together. (9) I'd like to wire some money to my son in Seattle.	(1) 那种织物陈列在金属制的架子上。 (2) 这根绳子不够结实，所以我们用金属线。 (3) 电线发热是由于过载造成的。 (4) 今天上午我给母亲打了电话。 (5) 你可以将细节电告我在纽约的兄弟。 (6) 孩子被教导如何在把电线装进塞子。 (7) 这个设备一接通电源你就能用了。 (8) 这两块木头已用金属丝捆在一起了。 (9) 我想给我在西雅图的儿子电汇一些钱。
wisdom n.智慧；明智；才智；聪明；至理名言	(1) She had acquired much wisdom during her long life. (2) He attributes his wisdom to his teachers. (3) We grow in wisdom as we grow older. (4) A flow of words is no proof of wisdom. (5) Confucius's many words are wisdom.	(1) 她经年累月造就了很高的智慧。 (2) 他认为他的智慧来自于老师。 (3) 我们随着年龄增长而更加明智。 (4) 口若悬河，不能证明真有才智。 (5) 孔子的很多话都是至理名言。
wise adj.聪明的；有智慧的；明智的；有见识的	(1) Learned men are not necessarily wise. (2) To a wise person, time is like a diamond. (3) A wise general can gain the upper hand in any battle. (4) She is wise in money matters. (5) You are wise to remain silent. (6) It would be wise not to give undue importance to his criticism. (7) Lord Melbourne replied with a very wise letter. (8) He is the wise man who is the honest man.	(1) 博学者未必都是聪明的。 (2) 时间对一个有智慧的人而言，就如钻石般珍贵。 (3) 一位有智慧的将军在任何战争中都能占上风。 (4) 她善于理财。 (5) 你保持沉默，这很明智。 (6) 不过份看重他的批评是明智的。 (7) 梅尔本爵爷回了一封极有见识的信。 (8) 正直的人就是有见识的人。
withdraw vt.撤回；取回；撤退；提款 vi.撤退；退缩；走开	(1) In view of members reservation and request for further information, the Administration agreed to withdraw the item. (2) He wanted to withdraw his name from the guest list. (3) I'd like to withdraw some money from my account. (4) The troops have been withdrawn from the danger area. (5) He withdrew his horse from the race. (6) Tell the men to withdraw from their new position. (7) He may withdraw into his own private world. (8) He talked to us for an hour and then withdrew.	(1) 鉴于委员有所保留,并要求取得进一步资料,政府当局同意撤回该项目。 (2) 他想从客人名单中撤出自己的名字。 (3) 我想从户头里提出一些钱。 (4) 部队已经撤出危险地带。 (5) 他让他的马退出了比赛。 (6) 告诉那些人从新的阵地上撤出。 (7) 他可以蜷缩在个人的小天地里。 (8) 他跟我们谈了一小时的话就走了。
within prep.在(某段时间、距离或范围)内；在…里面 adv.在…里面 n.内部	(1) I'll be coming within an hour. (2) This is a task well within your ability. (3) Several cars are available within this price range. (4) Within these old walls there was once a town. (5) The noise seems to be coming from within the building. (6) He decorated his house within and without. (7) Seen from within, the cave looks larger.	(1) 一小时之内我就会到。 (2) 这完全是你力所能及的工作。 (3) 在这个价格范围内，有好几种汽车可供选购。 (4) 在这些旧城墙里面曾经有一座城市。 (5) 吵闹声像是从楼房里传出来的。 (6) 他装修房屋的里面和外面。 (7) 从内部看这山洞显得比较大些。
witness n.目击者；证人 vt.目击；经历；见证；出席；观察 vi.证明；为(宗教信仰)做见证	(1) The witness was telling about the whole accident. (2) The lawyer examined the witness. (3) A material witness failed to appear in court. (4) Did anyone witness the traffic accident? (5) Please the witness to the room on the right. (6) It was an extraordinary experience to witness the first sunrise of the new millennium. (7) Programs look for people with special experience, to witness history, pondering life, against life experience and spiritual secrets of the creation of a novel transcript. (8) Only one witness of the accident has come forward. (9) The witness at the trial had been carefully primed by defence lawyers. (10) You are now the witness or the watcher of the pain-body. (11) The empty cupboard was a witness of his poverty. (12) He is a living witness to my innocence.	(1) 目击者正在讲述整个事故的过程。 (2) 律师讯问了证人。 (3) 一名重要的证人没有出庭。 (4) 有谁目击了这场交通事故？ (5) 请把目击证人带到左边的房间。 (6) 亲眼目睹千禧年的第一缕曙光是一种与众不同的经历。 (7) 节目寻访拥有特殊经历的人物，一起见证历史，思索人生，直指生命的体验与心灵秘密，创造一种新颖的谈话记录。 (8) 只有一人站出来为这次事件作见证。 (9) 被告律师对出席审讯的证人事先作了仔细的指导。 (10) 现在你是痛苦体的目击人或观察者。 (11) 空的食橱就是他贫穷的证明。 (12) 他是证明我清白的活证人。
wolf n.狼；特立独行的人 v.狼吞虎咽	(1) The pups played with the mother wolf. (2) He saw a hungry wolf on the prowl with his telescope. (3) Peter is a good footballer, but he is a lone wolf. (4) I have to wolf down my breakfast, I'm rushed for time. (5) With tears in his eyes, he would watch them wolf it down and mutter to himself, "Poor motherless children!	(1) 小狼们跟母狼玩耍。 (2) 他通过望远镜看到了一头四处觅食的饿狼。 (3) 彼得是个好足球队员，但他是个不与人合作的人。 (4) 我得快点吃完早餐,时间不够了。 (5) 看他俩狼吞虎咽的吃那些东西,他眼中含着泪,自言自语的说：“没娘的孩子!”
wooden adj.木制的；生硬笨拙的	(1) There is a wooden porch over the sidewalk. (2) He has two big round new Chinese wooden tables.	(1) 人行道上有一个木制的门廊。 (2) 他有两张新的中国式的木制的大圆桌。
woo v.寻求支持；求爱；求婚	(1) Politicians try to woo the voters before an election. (2) His efforts to woo her to his side proved fruitless. (3) He wooed and won her. (4) I will never try to woo someone with fine car or gift. (5) He wooed four girls before finally marrying one.	(1) 在选举前政治家们都力争选民的支持。 (2) 他试图说服她站到自己一边的努力徒劳无功。 (3) 他向她求爱成功而结婚。 (4) 我绝不会用香车和礼物来求婚。 (5) 他在结婚之前曾向四个姑娘求过婚。
woollen n.毛织品 adj.羊毛制的	(1) The woollen cloth prickles (my skin). (2) China's woollen textile industry is forging ahead to meet the needs of the country. (3) A man was lying in the box on top of a pile of woollen goods.	(1) 穿毛料衣服(使我的皮肤)有被扎的感觉。 (2) 中国的毛纺工业正迅速发展以适应国家的需要。 (3) 一个男人躺在箱子里的一堆毛织品上。
workday n.工作日；工作时间	(1) An ordinary workday is eight hours. (2) Still, there have been times when her workday was upended by a sick child.	(1) 一个工作日通常是八个小时。 (2) 尽管如此，有时她的工作日还是会因为孩子生病而被弄得一团乱。
workforce n.劳动力；工人总数；职工总数	(1) Only about half of the original workforce remains. (2) Demographic change is another reason why the workforce is greying.	(1) 只剩下大约原来一半的劳动力。 (2) 人口变化是劳动力老龄化的又一原因。
workmate n.同事；工友	(1) We have considered him to be the best workmate. (2) Her workmate is ill and she has to do double work.	(1) 我们一直认为他是我们最好的同事。 (2) 她的同事病了,她必须做双倍的工作。
works n.工厂；修建；机器部件；全套物品	(1) The steel works has been supplying us with raw material in large quantities. (2) They are repairing the defense works. (3) They expanded the shipyards and started engineering works. (4) We went to the chip shop and had the works: fish, chips, gherkins, mushy peas.	(1) 在过去的两年中，那家钢铁厂一直提供给我们原材料。 (2) 他们正在修防御工程。 (3) 他们扩建造船厂，开始了工程施工。 (4) 我们去薯条店吃了套餐：炸鱼、炸薯条、小黄瓜、豆泥。
world-famous adj.世界闻名的	(1) Charles Chaplin is a world famous comedy actor. (2) Her woven goods were universally famous.	(1) 查理卓别林是世界闻名的喜剧演员。 (2) 它的纺织品是世界闻名的。
worldwide adj.全世界的 adv.在全世界	(1) The story has attracted worldwide attention. (2) Gasoline now has an almost worldwide use. (3) Our hotel have a worldwide reputation for good service. (4) Our society expanded into a worldwide organization. (5) The company has worldwide distribution channels. (6) More than 100 million votes were cast worldwide.	(1) 这件事已经引起了全世界的关注。 (2) 汽油在全世界范围内被广泛使用。 (3) 我们出色的饭店服务享誉世界。 (4) 我们的协会扩大成一个世界性组织。 (5) 这家公司拥有遍布全世界的销售网络。 (6) 全世界投票总数超过1亿。
worn adj.用旧的；穿坏的；精疲力竭的；憔悴的 动词wear的过去分词形式	(1) The worn brakes require replacement. (2) His worn jacket revealed his elbows. (3) They were shivering in thin, worn sweaters.	(1) 磨损的刹车需要替换。 (2) 他的破上衣露出了肘部。 (3) 他们穿着很薄的破毛衣，冻得发抖。
worthless adj.无价值的；无用的；可鄙的	(1) The worthless books in a library should be weeded out. (2) Those financiers made spoil of widows'money by selling them worthless shares. (3) The old man was cursed with a worthless son. (4) He foolishly spent his winnings on worthless and unnecessary things, and soon he had nothing left.	(1) 应该清除图书馆里无价值的图书。 (2) 那些金融家把无价值的股票卖给寡妇们以掠夺她们的钱财。 (3) 老人因无用的儿子而感到痛苦。 (4) 他傻乎乎地用赢来的钱买了很多没有价值和无用的东西，他因此变得一无所有。
worthwhile adj.值得(做)的	(1) Thank you for making my visit so worthwhile. I shall treasure your friendship and kind hospitality you have given me. (2) That's worthwhile.	(1) 感谢你们使我的访问如此有价值。我将珍惜我们之间的友谊及你们给予我的盛情款待。 (2) 那是值得的。
worthy adj.有价值的；可尊敬的；值得的；配得上的 n.知名人士；杰出人物	(1) This is a worthy English-Chinese dictionary. (2) This book is worthy of reading. (3) No man thinks more highly than I do of the patriotism, as well as abilities, of the very worthy gentlemen who have just addressed the house. (4) Mr. Foker himself is a worthy man, though not of high extraction or indeed much education. (5) The event is worthy of being remembered. (6) His behavior is worthy of praise. (7) The book is well worthy of his reputation. (8) I want you to sell these two and find more worthy replacements.	(1) 这是一本有价值的英汉词典。 (2) 这本书值得一读。 (3) 没有人比我对刚刚向议会全体代表发言的可尊敬的先生们的爱国精神和才干更钦佩了。 (4) 福克先生本人也是值得尊敬的,尽管他出身不太高贵,受的教育确实也有限。 (5) 那事件是值得记忆的。 (6) 他的行为值得称道。 (7) 这本书完全配得上他的声望。 (8) 我需要你卖这些二和发现更多杰出人物替换。
would aux.将；可能；大概；总会；愿意；will的过去式	(1) The president proclaimed that a new currency would be issued. (2) He would have lost his position if you hadn't backed him up. (3) It would take about 30 minutes. (4) Every time he saw me, he would say hello to me. (5) Would you help me with the report?	(1) 总统宣布将发行新货币。 (2) 假如你当初没有支持他,他可能已经失去职位了。 (3) 大概要开30分钟。 (4) 每当他看见我,总向我问好。 (5) 你愿意帮我写报告吗？
wound n.创伤；伤害；伤口 v.伤；伤害；缠绕（动词wind的过去式和过去分词）	(1) I hope her emotional wound will heal with the passing of time. (2) She got deep psychological wounds. (3) The soldier received a serious wound on the chest. (4) That was a wound to the child's pride. (5) The wound is healing fast. (6) The wound was bound up by bandage. (7) Two soldiers died and three others were wounded in the attack. (8) He was deeply wounded by their disloyalty. (9) You should pay attention not to wound his pride.	(1) 我希望她感情上的创伤能随时间的流逝而治愈。 (2) 她受到很深的心理创伤。 (3) 这名士兵胸部受了重伤。 (4) 那是对孩子自尊心的伤害。 (5) 伤口愈合得很快。 (6) 伤口用绷带包扎着。 (7) 在这次袭击中,有两名士兵牺牲,三名受伤。 (8) 因为他们不忠,他十分伤心。 (9) 注意不要伤害他的自尊心。
wounded adj.受伤的 n.伤员	(1) The wounded bird fluttered to the ground. (2) The wounded man was in agony. (3) The wounded were bedded in the farmhouse. (4) Many of the wounded died on their way to hospital.	(1) 那受伤的鸟拍著翅膀落到地上。 (2) 那受伤的人痛苦已极。 (3) 把伤员安置在农家住宿。 (4) 许多伤员死在去医院的途中了。
wrestle v.摔跤；斗争；努力解决；斟酌 n.摔跤比赛；格斗	(1) He wrestled his opponent to the floor/ground. (2) He taught his little brother how to wrestle. (3) We have to wrestle with difficulties. (4) We must wrestle with the problem. (5) The minister wrestled over the wording of the communique. (6) They are going to wrestle a match next month.	(1) 他把对手摔倒在地上。 (2) 他教他小弟弟如何摔跤。 (3) 我们必须同困难作斗争。 (4) 我们必须尽全力解决该问题。 (5) 部长斟酌公报的措辞。 (6) 他们下月要进行一场摔跤比赛。
wrinkle n.皱纹；方法 vt.使起皱纹；皱着 vi.起皱	(1) She's beginning to get wrinkles round her eyes. (2) My findings add a new wrinkle to each scenario. (3) Too much sunbathing will wrinkle your skin. (4) He wrinkled up his forehead in perplexity. (5) The apples are beginning to wrinkle. (6) Spread the varnish thin if you don't want it to wrinkle.	(1) 她的眼角开始有皱纹了。 (2) 我的发现为两种说法都提供了一点想法。 (3) 皮肤晒得过分就能起皱纹。 (4) 他困惑地皱起了眉头。 (5) 这些苹果开始起皱纹了。 (6) 如果你不想让它起皱就把油漆涂薄。
wrist n.手腕；腕部	(1) He fell downstairs and broke his wrist. (2) She wears a ring round her wrist. (3) I want a pair of wrist protectors.	(1) 他从楼梯跌下，摔伤了手腕。 (2) 她的手腕上戴着一只镯子。 (3) 我要一副护腕。
writing n.写作；著述；笔迹；作品	(1) Writing is his life. (2) She is endowed with great writing ability. (3) She doesn't earn much from her writing. (4) Throughout his lifetime Lai Zhide strove to become a sage and was devoted to writing in seclusion with the wish of attaining spiritual immortality. (5) I can't read the doctor's writing. (6) It's really difficult to read your writing. (7) Have you read his writings? (8) His writing contains some real goodies. (9) The word play in his writing is very witty.	(1) 写作是他的生命。 (2) 她具有杰出的写作天赋。 (3) 她写作得到的收入不多。 (4) 在人生态度上，来氏有圣贤之志，毕生隐居著述，而有不朽的愿望。 (5) 我看不明白那位医生的笔迹。 (6) 你的笔迹真是难以辨认。 (7) 你读过他的作品吗？ (8) 他的作品中含有真正引人入胜的东西。 (9) 他作品中的双关语诙谐风趣。
X-ray n.X射线；光机；X光照片 vt.用X射线检查	xxxx	(1) n.X射线；光机；X光照片 (2) vt.用X射线检查
yawn v.打呵欠；张开 n.呵欠；<口>乏味的人（事）	(1) His long boring story made me yawn. (2) He closed the book, yawned, and went to bed. (3) The deep crevasse yawned at their feet. (4) I gave a loud yawn, but he just kept on talking. (5) He stretched himself with a yawn.	(1) 他的冗长的故事听得我直打呵欠。 (2) 他合起书, 打了个呵欠, 然后上床睡觉了。 (3) 他们脚下的冰川有一道深深的裂缝。 (4) 我大声打了个呵欠，可他还是不停地讲下去。 (5) 他打了个呵欠伸了伸懒腰。
yell v.大叫 n.大喊	(1) Don't yell at me! (2) You don't have to yell; I can hear you. (3) She yelled out at her mischievous child. (4) We yelled our good-byes as the bus left. (5) She let out a yell and ran home.	(1) 别对我大喊大叫！ (2) 你用不著喊，我听得见。 (3) 她对她淘气的孩子大喊大叫。 (4) 汽车离开时我们大喊再见。 (5) 她尖叫了一声跑回了家。
yoghurt n.酸奶；酸乳	(1) I like drinking creamy yoghurt in summer. (2) Drink yoghurt to have curative effect to the cold? (3) This yoghurt contains no artificial flavouring or colouring.	(1) 我喜欢在夏天喝些酸奶。 (2) 喝酸奶对感冒有疗效吗？ (3) 这种酸乳酪不含人造香料或著色剂。
youth n.青年时期；青春；青年	(1) In his youth, he had shown great promise. (2) He mused over memories of his youth. (3) Youth glided past without our awareness. (4) I can't bear young people casting away their youth. (5) The youth of the country are being ignored by politicians. (6) His brother is a member of a youth fellowship.	(1) 他在青少年时代就显得很有出息。 (2) 他重温青年时期的往事。 (3) 青春在我们不知不觉中逝去。 (4) 我无法忍受年轻人虚掷青春。 (5) 这个国家的青年没有受到政治家的重视。 (6) 他哥哥是青年联谊会的会员。
yummy adj.美味的；好吃的；愉快的；吸引人的，悦人的	(1) This cake is really yummy. (2) Chocolate cake for tea? How yummy! (3) I could eat a whole pot of that hot, yummy carrot.	(1) 蛋糕非常美味。 (2) 有巧克力蛋糕当茶点? 多好吃啊！ (3) 我可以吃一锅那样的又热又好吃的胡萝卜。
zebra n.斑马；斑马线	(1) Seemingly everyone likes the zebra. (2) The neck of the zebra was nipped by a lion. (3) There was only one big road to cross, but it had a zebra crossing.	(1) 似乎每个人都喜欢斑马。 (2) 狮子咬断了那头斑马的脖子。 (3) 只有一条大路要过，但它有斑马线。
zebra crossing 斑马线，人行道	(1) There was only one big road to cross, but it had a zebra crossing.	(1) 只有一条大路要过，但它有斑马线。
zip n.拉链 n.活力；飞射声 v.拉拉链 v.飕飕飞过；注入活力	(1) She caught her hair in the zip of the dress. (2) The zip sticked because it was caught by a thread. (3) We need to put some zip into this presentation. (4) Please help me to zip my dress on. (5) Rifle fire zipped over them. (6) These new trains really zip along.	(1) 她的头发被裙子的拉链钩住了。 (2) 拉链被线卡住了, 拉不动。 (3) 我们需要为这次演出注人一些活力。 (4) 请帮我把衣服的拉链拉上。 (5) 步枪子弹在他们头顶上飕飕飞驰。 (6) 这些新列车行驶得可真快。
